The Dwight D. Eisenhower National System of अंतरराज्यीय and रक्षा Highways ( commonly known as the Interstate Highway System, Interstate Freeway प्रणाली, Interstate System, or simply the Interstate ) is a network of freeways that फ़ॉर्म a part of the National Highway System of the United States.
The system is named for President ड्वाइट D. Eisenhower, who championed its formation.
Construction was authorized by the संघीय Aid Highway Act of 1956, and the original portion was completed 35 years later.
The network has चूंकि been extended, and, it had a total लंबाई of, making it the world 's second longest after China 's., about one-quarter of all vehicle miles driven in the country use the Interstate system.
The cost of construction has महरूम estimated at $ 425 billion ( in 2006 dollars ), making it the `` largest public works program since the Pyramids ``.
The system has contributed in shaping the United States into a world आर्थिक superpower and a highly industrialized nation.
.eu is the देश code top-level domain ( ccTLD ) for the European Union ( eu ).
Launched on 7 December 2005, the domain is उपलब्धियाँ for organisations in and residents of EU member states.
The TLD is administered by EURid, a consortium originally consisting of the national ccTLD registry operators of Belgium, Sweden, and Italy, joined later by the national रजिस्ट्री operator of the Czech Republic.
Trademark स्वामी were able to submit registrations through a sunrise काल, in an effort to prevent cybersquatting.
पूरा registration started on 7 April 2006.
Meister means master in German ( as in master craftsman, or as an honorific title such as Meister Eckhart ).
The word is akin to maestro.
in खेल, Meister is used for the current national, European or world champion ( Deutscher Meister, *Europameister, Weltmeister ).
Many modern day German police शक्तियां उपयोग the title Meister.
During the Second World War, Meister was the highest enlisted rank of the Ordnungspolizei.
Meister has been उधार into English slang, where it is used in compound nouns.
A person referred to as “Meister” is one who रै extensive theoretical knowledge and practical skills in उसके profession, कारोबार, or some other kind of work or activity.
For example, a “puzzle-meister” would be someone highly skilled at solving पहेलियाँ.
These neologisms sometimes have a व्यंग्यात्मक intent ( for उदाहरण, “stubble-meister” for someone with a short, neat beard or “crier-meister” लिये someone who often cries ).
mighty Morphin Power Rangers is an American live-action children 's television series about teenagers with super-powers, based on the 16th installment of the Japanese Super Sentai franchise, kyōryū Sentai Zyuranger.
Both the दिखाएँ and its related merchandise saw unbridled overnight success, becoming a staple of 1990s pop culture in mere months.
Under the original name, `` Mighty morphin शक्ति Rangers '' the series ran from 1993 to 1995 and spawned the feature film mighty Morphin Power Rangers : The Movie.
The second and third seasons of the show drew on footage and elements from the Super Sentai series Gosei Sentai Dairanger and Ninja Sentai Kakuranger respectively, though the Zyuranger costumes were still used for the five main Rangers and several regular villains.
Only the mecha and the Kiba Ranger costume ( worn by the White Ranger ) यहूद retained from Dairanger for the second ऋतु, while only the mecha from Kakuranger were featured in the third season.
However the Kakuranger costumes were later used for the title characters of the mini-series, Mighty Morphin Alien Rangers.
The series was produced by MMPR प्रोडक्शन्स, distributed by Saban Entertainment, and aired on Fox Kids.
The show 's merchandise थी produced and distributed by Bandai Entertainment.
In 1996, the series was rebranded as the Power Rangers franchise ; renaming the series every year after, and using costumes, props, और footage from subsequent Super Sentai series, as well as changing the cast and storyline.
While an overarching storyline would continue until शक्ति Rangers Lost Galaxy, subsequent series after MMPR are not sequels or spin-offs in the traditional sense.
In 2010, a re-version of Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, with a new logo, comic book-referenced ग्राफिक्स, and extra alternative special effects, was broadcast on ABC Kids, and Bandai produced brand new toys to coincide with the series.
Edgar Allan Poe ( born Edgar पो ; January 19, 1809 – October 7, 1849 ) was an American author, poet, editor and literary critic, considered part of the American Romantic Movement.
बेहतरीन known लिये his tales of रहस्य and the macabre, Poe was one of the earliest American practitioners of the short story and is generally considered the inventor of the detective fiction genre.
He is further credited with contributing to the emerging genre of science fiction.
He was the first well-known American writer to try to earn a living through writing अलोन, resulting in a financially difficult life and करियर.
He was born as Edgar Poe in Boston, मैसाचुसेट्स ; he was orphaned यंग when his माँ died shortly after his father abandoned the परिवार.
पो was taken in by जॉन and Frances Allan, of Richmond, Virginia, but they never formally adopted उसे.
He attended the University of Virginia for one semester but left due to lack of money.
After enlisting in the Army and later failing as an officer 's cadet at West Point, Poe parted ways with the Allans.
His प्रकाशन career began humbly, with an anonymous collection of poems, Tamerlane और Other Poems ( 1827 ), credited तभी to `` a Bostonian ''.
Poe switched his फ़ोकस to गद्य and spent the next several years working for literary journals and periodicals, becoming known for his own style of literary criticism.
His work forced him to move among several cities, including Baltimore, Philadelphia, और New York City.
In Baltimore in 1835, he शादीशुदा Virginia clemm, his 13-year-old cousin.
In January 1845 Poe published उसके कविता, `` The Raven ``, to instant success.
His बीवी died of tuberculosis दो years after its publication.
He began planning to produce his own journal, the Penn ( later renamed The Stylus ), though he died before it could be produced.
On October 7, 1849, at age 40, Poe died in Baltimore ; the cause of his death is unknown और has been variously attributed to alcohol, brain congestion, cholera, दवाएँ, heart disease, rabies, suicide, tuberculosis, and other एजेंटों.
Poe and his works influenced literature in the United States and around the world, as खूब as in specialized fields, such as cosmology and cryptography.
पो and his work appear throughout लोकप्रिय culture in literature, music, films, and टेलीविज़न.
A number of his homes are dedicated museums today.
The Mystery Writers of America present an सालाना award known as the एडगर पुरस्कार for distinguished work in the mystery genre.
Lions are obligate carnivores ; they require up to seven kilograms ( 15 lbs ) of meat per दिन.
A major component of their diet is the flesh of large mammals, like this African buffalo.
A carnivore ( ) meaning 'meat eater ' ( Latin, caro meaning 'meat ' or 'flesh ' and vorare meaning 'to devour ' ) is an organism that derives its energy and nutrient requirements from a diet consisting mainly or exclusively of animal tissue, whether through predation or scavenging.
Animals that depend solely on एनिमल flesh लिये their nutrient requirements are considered carnivores while those कि also consume non-animal food are considered carnivores.
Omnivores also consume both animal and non-animal food, and apart इससे the more general definition, there is no clearly defined ratio of plant to animal material that would distinguish a facultative carnivore इससे an omnivore.
A carnivore that sits at the top of the foodchain is an apex predator.
Plants that capture and digest insects are पुकारा carnivorous plants.
Similarly, fungi that capture microscopic animals are often called carnivorous fungi.
The FIFA World Cup, often simply the World कप, is an international association फ़ुटबॉल competition contested by the senior men 's national टीमों of the members of fédération Internationale de Football Association ( FIFA ), the sport 's global governing body.
the championship has been awarded every four years since the inaugural tournament in 1930, except in 1942 and 1946 when it was not held because of the Second World युद्ध.
The current champions हैं Spain, who won the 2010 tournament.
the current format of the tournament involves 32 teams competing for the title at venues भीतर the host nation ( s ) over a period of about a month ; this phase is often called the World Cup Finals.
A qualification phase, which currently takes place over the preceding three years, is used to determine which teams qualify for the tournament together साथ the host nation ( s ).
The 19 World Cup tournaments have been won by eight different national teams.
Brazil have won five times, and they are the only team to have played in every tournament.
The other World Cup विजेता are Italy, with four titles ; Germany, with three titles ; Argentina and inaugural winners Uruguay, with two titles प्रत्येक ; and England, France, and Spain, with one title प्रत्येक.
The World Cup is the world 's most widely viewed sporting इवेंट ; an estimated 715.1 million people watched the final match of the 2006 FIFA World Cup held in Germany.
The next three World Cups will be hosted by Brazil in 2014, Russia in 2018, and Qatar in 2022.
Heroes is an American science fiction television drama series created by Tim Kring that appeared on NBC for four seasons from September 25, 2006 through February 8, 2010.
the series tells the stories of ordinary people who discover superhuman abilities, और how these abilities take effect in the characters ' lives.
The series emulates the aesthetic style and storytelling of American comic books, using multi-episode story arcs that build upon a larger, more encompassing arc.
The series was produced by tailwind Productions in association with Universal Media Studios.
It was filmed primarily in Los Angeles, California.
Four complete seasons aired, ending on February 8, 2010.
The critically acclaimed first season had a run of 23 episodes and garnered an average of 14.3 million viewers in the United States, receiving the highest rating for an NBC drama premiere in five years.
The second season of Heroes attracted an average of 13.1 million viewers in the U.S., and marked NBC 's sole series among the top 20 ranked programs in total viewership for the 2007–2008 season.
Heroes has earned a number of awards and nominations, including प्राइमटाइम Emmy Awards, Golden Globes, People 's Choice Awards और British Academy Television Awards.
An ऑनलाइन extension of the series, Heroes 360 Experience, बाद rebranded as Heroes Evolutions, was created to explore the Heroes universe and provides insight into the show 's mythology.
Other official Heroes media include magazines, action figures, tie-in and interactive websites, a mobile game, a novel, clothing and other merchandise.
In the fall of 2008, एनबीसी Digital Entertainment released a series of online content लिये the summer, including more original web content, wireless iTV interactivity, graphic novels उपलब्धियाँ for mobile viewing and webisodes.
NBC announced Heroes cancellation on May 14, 2010.
Afterward, the network considered making a टेलीविज़न खास event to conclude the series ; however, on सितंबर 9, 2010, NBC announced the decision to stop any further विकास of the Heroes franchise.
Tim Kring then suggested that the व्यापक premise of Heroes storylines allowed for the franchise to return for fans, but he did not specify when or in what media format.
On अप्रैल 17, 2013, tv Line reported that MSN was in talks to revive the श्रेणी with a नई cast.
John Pierpont `` J. P. ''
Morgan ( April 17, 1837 – March 31, 1913 ) was an American financier, banker, philanthropist and art कलेक्टर जो dominated कॉरपोरेट finance and industrial consolidation during his time.
In 1892 मॉर्गन arranged the merger of Edison General Electric and Thomson-Houston Electric Company to form General Electric.
After financing the creation of the Federal Steel Company, he merged in 1901 with the Carnegie Steel Company and several other steel and आयरन businesses, including Consolidated Steel and Wire कम्पनी owned by William Edenborn, to form the United राज्य Steel निगम.
Morgan died in Rome, Italy, in his sleep in 1913 at the age of 75, leaving his fortune and business to his बेटे, John Pierpont `` Jack '' Morgan, Jr., and bequeathing his mansion and large book collections to The Morgan Library & Museum in New York.
At the height of Morgan 's career during the early 1900s, he and his partners था financial investments in many large corporations and were accused by critics of controlling the स्वदेश 's high finance.
He directed the banking coalition that stopped the Panic of 1907.
He थी the leading financier of the Progressive Era, और his dedication to efficiency and modernization helped transform American business.
This is a list of episodes of the television श्रेणी.
The episodes were directed by Shigeru Ueda and produced by the Yggdrasil Executive Committee which included Xebec and Genco.
The plot of the episodes is set in Tokyo and revolves around Rin Asōgi, an immortal private investigator, as she explores the secrets of modern and near-future world and the supernatural events that surround the fictional society of immortals like herself.
There are विशाल time gaps in the internal chronology between the पहला five episodes, ranging from one to thirty years.
The six episodes यहूद broadcast monthly on AT-X चैनल in Japan, between फ़रवरी 3 and July 6, 2008.
Each episode is 45 minutes long.
Two टुकड़े of theme music are used for the episodes : the खोलने theme `` Alsatia '' and the ending theme `` Cause Disarray ''.
Both were composed and performed by the Japanese मेटल band Galneryus.
The series was produced to commemorate the tenth anniversary of the AT-X network it originally aired on.
Aerial photo of FLETC, where us digital forensics standards यहूद developed in the 1980s and '90s
Digital forensics ( sometimes known as digital forensic science ) is a branch of forensic science encompassing the recovery and investigation of material found in digital devices, often in relation to computer crime.
The पद डिजिटल forensics was originally used as a synonym for computer forensics but has expanded to कवर investigation of all devices capable of storing digital आंकड़ा.
With roots in the personal computing revolution of the late 1970s and early '80s, the discipline evolved in a haphazard manner during the 1990s, and it was not until the early 21st century that national policies emerged.
Digital forensics investigations have a variety of अनुप्रयोग.
The most common is to support or refute a hypothesis before criminal or civil ( as part of the इलेक्ट्रॉनिक discovery process ) courts.
Forensics may also feature in the private सेक्टर ; such as during internal corporate investigations or intrusion investigation ( a specialist probe into the nature and extent of an unauthorized network intrusion ).
The technical aspect of an investigation is विभाजित into several sub-branches, relating to the type of digital devices involved ; computer forensics, network forensics, forensic data analysis and mobile device forensics.
The typical forensic process encompasses the seizure, forensic imaging ( acquisition ) and analysis of digital media and the production of a report into collected evidence.
As well as identifying direct प्रमाण of a crime, digital forensics can be used to attribute evidence to specific suspects, confirm alibis or statements, determine intent, identify sources ( for example, in copyright cases ), or authenticate documents.
Investigations are much broader in scope than other areas of forensic analysis ( where the usual aim is to provide answers to a series of simpler questions ) often involving complex time-lines or hypotheses.
A comparison of the chromaticities enclosed by some color spaces.
A रंग model is an abstract mathematical model describing the रास्ता colors can be represented as tuples of numbers, typically as three or four values or color components ( e.g. RGB and CMYK हैं color मॉडल ).
However, a color model with no associated mapping function to an निरपेक्ष color space is a more or less arbitrary color प्रणाली with no connection to any globally understood system of रंग interpretation.
Adding a certain mapping function between the color मॉडल and a certain reference color space results in a definite `` footprint '' within the reference color space.
This `` footprint '' is known as a gamut, and, in combination with the color मॉडल, defines a new color space.
लिये example, Adobe RGB and sRGB हैं two different absolute color spaces, दोनो based on the RGB model.
In the सबसे generic sense of the परिभाषा above, color spaces can be defined without the use of a color model.
These spaces, such as Pantone, are in effect a given set of names or numbers which are defined by the existence of a corresponding set of physical color swatches.
This article focuses on the mathematical model concept.
मजदूर Day is an American federal holiday observed on the first Monday in September, that celebrates the economic and social contributions of workers.
Life insurance is a contract between an insured ( insurance policy holder ) and an insurer, where the insurer promises to pay a designated beneficiary a sum of money ( the `` benefits '' ) upon the death of the insured person.
Depending on the contract, other events such as टर्मिनल बीमारी or critical illness may also trigger payment.
The policy holder typically pays a premium, either regularly or as a lump sum.
अन्य expenses ( ऐसे as funeral expenses ) are also sometimes included in the benefits.
Life policies are legal contracts and the terms of the contract describe the limitations of the insured events.
विशिष्ट exclusions are प्रायः लिखा into the contract to limit the liability of the insurer ; common उदाहरण are claims relating to suicide, fraud, war, riot and civil commotion.
Life-based contracts tend to fall into two प्रमुख categories:
Protection policies – designed to provide a benefit in the event of specified इवेंट, typically a lump sum payment.
A common form of this design is term insurance.
Investment policies – where the main objective is to facilitate the growth of capital by regular or single premiums.
Common forms ( in the US ) are whole life, universal life and variable जीवन policies.

Mitzi Gaynor Donahue ( born May 2, 1962 in Yorba Linda, Orange County, California ) is an American actress, also credited and अधिक popularly known as Mitzi Kapture.
Kapture began her career in films, most of which were नहीं huge commercial successes.
She went on to make a few television guest appearances ( MacGyver, 1st & टेन, and as a प्रतियोगी on The $ 100,000 Pyramid ) before she gained international एक्सपोज़र with her first major television role as Sergeant Rita Lee Lance in the television series रेशा Stalkings.
Kapture 's role as Rita, the other half of the two `` Sams '' for almost 5 years, cemented her popularity.
Paired साथ Rob Estes who played Sergeant Chris Lorenzo, Kapture gained global recognition साथ with her costar since the show थी broadcast in अनेक countries.
सार्जेंट तलवार आखिरकार became Lieutenant Lance by the time Kapture left the series in 1995 to have her first child Madison.
During her time with the series, Kapture briefly sat in the director 's chair, for two episodes.
She थी interviewed for the Silk Stalkings Season 1 DVD which was distributed by Anchor Bay Entertainment and released in सितंबर 2004.
After a short अंतराल from the screen following her exit from Silk Stalkings, kapture returned in 1997 to the small screen and USA Network.
She played lead roles in two USA Pictures Originals telemovies, Perfect Crime ( based on a true story, also called Hide and Seek : The Joanne Jensen Story ), जिससे also starred Jasmine Guy and His Bodyguard.
She बाद starred in a few other independent film projects and theatre productions and had several टेलीविज़न guest दिखावे.
kapture also had a recurring भूमिका on बेवाच as एलेक्सिस ryker.
She played Anita Hodges on The Young and the Restless from 2002 through 2004, where she was credited as mitzi Kapture Donahue, and starred in the made-for-TV movie Night of Terror which premiered March 26, 2006 on Lifetime Network.
Her नवीनतम is a supporting role in God 's Ears, released in 2007.
Kapture is the official celebrity spokesperson लिये the Xeroderma Pigmentosum Society.
The Xbox 360 is the second video खेल console developed by and produced for Microsoft and the successor to the Xbox.
The Xbox 360 competes with Sony 's प्लेस्टेशन 3 and Nintendo 's Wii as part of the seventh generation of video game consoles.
As of September 30, 2012, 70 million Xbox 360 consoles have been sold worldwide.
the Xbox 360 was officially unveiled on MTV on May 12, 2005, with detailed launch and game information divulged later that month at the Electronic Entertainment Expo ( E3 ).
The console sold out completely upon release in all regions मगर in Japan.
Several major features of the Xbox 360 are its integrated एक्सबॉक्स Live सेवा that allows players to compete online ; download arcade games, game demos, trailers, TV shows, music और movies ; and its Windows Media Center multimedia capabilities.
The Xbox सजीव also offers access to various ( often region-specific ) third-party media streaming applications.
At their E3 प्रस्तुतीकरण on June 14, 2010, Microsoft announced a redesigned Xbox 360 that would जलयान on the same day.
The redesigned console is slimmer than the previous Xbox 360 model and सुविधाएँ integrated 802.11 b/g/n Wi-Fi, TOSLINK S/PDIF optical audio output, five USB 2.0 ports ( compared to the three from older versions ) and a special AUX port.
Older models of the Xbox 360 have since been discontinued.
the first new कंसोल to be released features a 250 GB hard ड्राइव, while a later, less expensive SKU features 4 GB internal storage.
Backpack may also refer to a 2001 novel by Emily Barr
A modern backpack
Swiss army backpack ca. 1960
Integrated bearer फ़्रेम.
a backpack ( also called rucksack, knapsack, packsack, pack ) is, in its simplest form, a cloth sack carried on one 's back and secured with two straps that go over the shoulders, but there can be exceptions.
Lightweight types of backpacks are sometimes worn on only one shoulder strap.
Backpacks हैं often preferred to handbags for carrying heavy loads or carrying any sort of equipment, because of the limited capacity to carry heavy weights for long periods of time in the hands.
Large backpacks, used to carry loads over 10 kg ( 22 lbs ), प्रायः offload the largest भाग ( up to about 90 % ) of their weight onto padded hip belts, leaving the shoulder straps mainly for stabilising the load.
This improves the potential to carry heavy loads, as the कूल्हों are stronger than the shoulders, and also increases agility and balance, since the load rides nearer the wearer 's own center of mass.
In ancient times, the backpack was used as a means to carry the hunter 's larger खेल and other types of prey and as a way of easier transport for other materials.
In the cases of larger hunts, the hunters would dismember their prey and distribute the pieces of the एनिमल around, each one packing the meat into many wrappings and then into bags which they placed on to their backs.
The bag itself was बना up of different animal hide and skin ( depending on what sorts of animals were in the area ) and sewn together by the intestines of said animals, which were woven together tightly to make a sturdy thread-like material.
Mexico ( ; ; ), officially the United Mexican States ( ), is a federal संवैधानिक republic in North America.
It is bordered on the उत्तर by the United States ; on the south and west by the Pacific Ocean ; on the southeast by Guatemala, Belize, and the Caribbean Sea ; and on the east by the Gulf of मैक्सिको.
Covering almost two million square kilometres ( over 760,000 sq mi ), Mexico is the fifth largest country in the Americas by total area and the 13th largest independent nation in the world.
With an estimated जनसांख्यिकी of over 113 million, it is the world 's eleventh सबसे populous country and the most populous Spanish-speaking country.
Mexico is a federation comprising thirty-one states and a Federal ज़िला, the capital city.
In pre-Columbian मैक्सिको many cultures matured into advanced civilizations ऐसे as the Olmec, the Toltec, the Teotihuacan, the zapotec, the Maya and the Aztec before first contact साथ Europeans.
In 1521, Spain conquered and colonized the territory from इसके base in México-Tenochtitlan, which was administered as the Viceroyalty of New Spain.
इस territory would eventually become Mexico following recognition of the colony 's independence in 1821.
The post-independence period was characterized by economic instability, the Mexican-American War and territorial cession to the United States, a civil war, two empires and a domestic dictatorship.
The latter led to the Mexican Revolution in 1910, which culminated with the promulgation of the 1917 Constitution and the emergence of the country 's current political system.
चुनावों held in July 2000 marked the first time that an opposition party जीती the presidency from the Institutional Revolutionary Party.
Since 2006 the country has been in the midst of a drug war which has caused 60,000 deaths.
Mexico रै one of the world 's largest economies, और is considered both a regional power and middle शक्ति.
In addition, Mexico was the first Latin American member of the Organisation for Economic co-operation and Development OECD ( since 1994 ), and considered an upper-middle income country by the World Bank.
Mexico is considered a newly industrialized country and an emerging power.
It has the fourteenth largest nominal GDP and the eleventh largest जीडीपी by purchasing power parity.
The अर्थव्यवस्था is strongly linked to those of its North American Free Trade Agreement ( NAFTA ) partners, विशेषकर the United States of America.
Mexico ranks sixth in the world and first in the americas by number of UNESCO World Heritage साइट with 31, and in 2007 was the दसवाँ most visited country in the world with 21.4 million international arrivals per year.
Babe रुथ holds the MLB career slugging percentage record (.690 ).
In बेसबॉल statistics, slugging percentage ( abbreviated SLG ) is a popular measure of the power of a hitter.
It is calculated as कुल bases divided by at bats :
where AB is the number of at-bats for a given player, and 1b, 2B, 3B, and HR are the number of singles, doubles, triples, and home runs, respectively.
Walks are specifically excluded from this calculation.
For उदाहरण, in 1920, बेब Ruth played his first season लिये the New York Yankees.
In 458 at bats, Ruth had 172 hits, comprising 73 singles, 36 doubles, 9 triples, and 54 home runs, which brings the total base count to ( 73 × 1 ) + ( 36 × 2 ) + ( 9 × 3 ) + ( 54 × 4 ) = 388.
His कुल number of bases ( 388 ) divided by his कुल at-bats ( 458 ) is.847, his slugging percentage for the season.
The next year he slugged.846, and ये रिकॉर्ड went unbroken until 2001, when Barry bonds achieved 411 bases in 476 at-bats, bringing his slugging percentage to.863, unmatched since.
is a role-playing video game developed and published by Square ( now Square Enix ) for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1995.
Chrono ट्रिगर 's विकास team शामिल three designers that Square dubbed the `` Dream Team '' : Hironobu Sakaguchi, the निर्माता of Square 's Final Fantasy series ; Yuji Horii, a freelance designer and creator of Enix 's popular Dragon Quest series ; और Akira Toriyama, a freelance manga artist famed for his work with Dragon Quest and Dragon Ball.
Kazuhiko Aoki produced the game, Masato Kato wrote most of the प्लाट, while composer Yasunori Mitsuda scored most of the game before falling ill and deferring remaining tracks to Final Fantasy composer Nobuo Uematsu.
The game 's story follows a group of adventurers who travel through time to prevent a global catastrophe.
Square re-released a ported version by tose in Japan लिये Sony 's प्लेस्टेशन in 1999, later repackaged with a फाइनल Fantasy IV port as Final Fantasy Chronicles in 2001 for the North American market.
A slightly enhanced Chrono Trigger was released for the Nintendo DS on November 25, 2008, in North America and Japan, and went on sale in Australia on February 3, 2009 and in Europe on फ़रवरी 6, 2009.
The game was never released in PAL territories before the Nintendo DS version.
Chrono Trigger was a नाजुक and commercial success upon रिलीज and is considered today to be one of the greatest वीडियो games of सब time.
Nintendo Power magazine described पहलुओं of Chrono Trigger as revolutionary, including इसके multiple endings, plot-related sidequests focusing on character development, unique बैटल system, और detailed graphics.
Chrono Trigger was the third best-selling game of 1995, and the game 's SNES and PlayStation iterations have shipped 2.65 million copies as of March 2003.
The version for the Nintendo DS sold 790,000 copies as of March 2009.
Chrono Trigger थी भी ported to मोबाईल phones, Virtual Console, the PlayStation Network ( only in the यूएसए ), iOS devices, and एंड्रॉइड devices.
Goat cheese
Goat cheese, or chèvre ( from the French word for goat ), is cheese made out of the milk of goats.
Hyperthermia is elevated body temperature due to failed thermoregulation that occurs when a body produces or absorbs more heat than it dissipates.
Extreme temperature elevation then becomes a medical emergency requiring तात्कालिक treatment to prevent disability or death.
The most common causes शामिल heat स्ट्रोक and adverse reactions to drugs.
The पूर्व is an acute temperature elevation caused by exposure to excessive heat, or combination of heat and humidity, that overwhelms the heat-regulating mechanisms.
the latter is a अपेक्षाकृत rare पक्ष effect of many drugs, particularly those that affect the central nervous system.
Malignant hyperthermia is a rare complication of some types of सामान्य anesthesia.
Hyperthermia can also be deliberately induced using drugs or चिकित्सा devices and may be used in the treatment of some kinds of cancer and other conditions, most commonly in conjunction with radiotherapy.
Hyperthermia differs from fever in that the body 's temperature set point remains unchanged.
The opposite is hypothermia, which occurs when the तापमान drops below that required to maintain normal metabolism.
Belize, is a country located on the northeastern coast of Central America.
It is the only देश in the area where अंग्रेज़ी is the official language, although kriol and Spanish are more commonly spoken.
Belize is bordered on the north by Mexico, to the south and west by Guatemala and to the east by the Caribbean समुद्र.
Its mainland is about long and wide.
With of land and a population of only 312,698 inhabitants ( 2010 census ), Belize possesses the lowest population घनत्व in Central America.
The country 's population growth rate of 3.15 % ( 2012 est. ) is the second highest in the region and one of the highest in the western hemisphere.
Belize 's abundance of terrestrial and marine प्रजाति, और its diversity of ecosystems give it a key place within the globally significant Mesoamerican Biological Corridor.
Belize has a diverse society, comprising many cultures and languages.
It is the only nation in the region with a British colonial heritage, but as a part of the पश्चिमी Caribbean Zone, it also shares a common heritage with the fellow Anglophone Caribbean countries.
In general, Belize is considered to be a Central American and Caribbean nation with strong ties to both the caribbean और Latin America.
Belize is a member of the Caribbean Community ( CARICOM ), the Community of Latin American और Caribbean States ( CELAC ), and Central अमरीकी संयोजन System ( SICA ).
Belize is known for इसके September Celebrations, and is the जन्मस्थान of chewing gum and punta Rock.
The `` Betsy Ross '' flag
A `` Betsy Ross '' flag flying बाहर San Francisco City Hall
The बेट्सी Ross flag is an early design of the flag of the United States, popularly attributed to Betsy रॉस, using the common motifs of alternating red-and-white striped field with five-pointed stars in a blue canton.
the flag was designed दौरान the American Revolution and features 13 stars to represent the original 13 colonies.
The distinctive feature of the Ross flag is the arrangement of the stars in a circle.
Although the Betsy Ross story is accepted by सबसे अमेरिकी, some flag historians and revisionists do not accept the Betsy Ross design as the first American flag.
According to the traditional account, the original flag was made in जून 1776, when a small committee—including George Washington, Robert Morris and relative जार्ज Ross —visited Betsy और discussed the need for a new American flag.
Betsy accepted the जॉब to manufacture the flag, altering the committee 's design by replacing the six-pointed stars with five-pointed stars.
While the Betsy Ross legend is questionable, the flag design is known to have been in use by 1777 ; Alfred B. Street described it at the surrender of General Burgoyne and समझा the circle of stars to represent समता among the American states.
It is one of the oldest versions of U.S. flags ज्ञात to exist ; जबकि it is not the oldest surviving flag centuries in cloth form, its likeness appears on older physical relics, namely, the contemporary battlefield paintings by John Trumbull and Charles Willson Peale.
वे depict the circular star arrangement being flown from ship masts and many other places, and thus provide the first ज्ञात ऐतिहासिक documentation of the ध्वज 's appearance.
The मुहर of the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs uses the Betsy रॉस flag to represent सेवा to all दिग्गजों from the American Revolution to the present day.
The Betsy Ross design of 13-star us flags रै been featured in many popular artworks ( sometimes inaccurately, as in Washington Crossing the Delaware ) and films, such as the 1960 version of Pollyanna.
The flag continues to be one of the most popular symbols of the American Revolution.
A purr is a sound made by all species of felids and is a part of cat communication.
it varies between cats ( लिये example by loudness and tone ), and from species to species, but can be characterized as a tonal buzzing.
The term `` purring '' has been used liberally in literature, and it has महरूम claimed that viverrids ( civet, mongoose, genet ), bears, badgers, hyaenas ( et cetera ) purr.
Other animals that have been said to purr are rabbits, squirrels, guinea pigs, tapirs, ring-tailed lemurs, हाथियों, raccoons and gorillas while eating.
However, using a strict definition of purring that continuous sound production must alternate between pulmonic egressive and ingressive airstream ( and usually go on for minutes ), Peters ( 2002 ), in an exhaustive review of the scientific literature, reached the conclusion that until then only ‘purring cats’ ( Felidae ) and two species of genets, Genetta tigrina, and most संभावित also Genetta genetta, had been documented to purr.
The platypus ( Ornithorhynchus anatinus ) is a semiaquatic mammal endemic to eastern Australia, including Tasmania.
Together with the चार प्रजाति of echidna, it is one of the five extant species of monotremes, the only mammals that lay अंडे instead of giving birth.
It is the sole living representative of its family ( Ornithorhynchidae ) and genus ( Ornithorhynchus ), though a number of related species have been found in the fossil record.
The unusual appearance of this egg-laying, duck -billed, beaver -tailed, otter -footed mammal baffled European naturalists when they first encountered it, with some considering it an elaborate fraud.
It is एक of the few venomous स्तनधारियों, the male platypus having a spur on the hind foot that delivers a venom capable of causing severe pain to humans.
The unique features of the platypus make it an important subject in the study of evolutionary biology and a recognisable and iconic symbol of Australia ; it has appeared as a mascot at national events और is featured on the reverse of its 20-cent coin.
The platypus is the animal emblem of the state of New South Wales.
Until the early 20th century, it was hunted for its fur, but it is now protected throughout its range.
Although captive breeding programmes have had तभी limited success and the platypus is vulnerable to the प्रभाव of pollution, it is not under any immediate threat.
St. Elizabeth is a village in Miller County, Missouri, United States.
The population थी 336 at the 2010 census.
Wilton is a census-designated place ( CDP ) in Sacramento County, कैलिफ़ोर्निया, United States.
It is part of the Sacramento – Arden-Arcade – Roseville Metropolitan Statistical Area.
The population was 5,363 at the 2010 census, up from 4,551 at the 2000 census.
In human-computer interaction, काटें and paste and नक़ल और paste are related commands that offer a user-interface interaction technique for transferring text, data, files or objects from a source to a destination.
Most ubiquitously, उपयोक्ता require the ability to cut and paste sections of plain text.
The cut command removes the selected data from its original position, while the नक़ल command creates a duplicate ; in both cases the selected data is placed in a clipboard.
The data in the clipboard is later inserted in the position where the paste command is issued.
the command names are an interface metaphor based on the physical procedure used in manuscript editing to create a page layout.
This interaction technique has close associations with related techniques in graphical user interfaces that use pointing devices such as a computer mouse ( by drag and drop, for उदाहरण ).
Economic order quantity is the order मात्रा that minimizes total inventory holding लागत and ordering costs.
It is one of the oldest classical production scheduling models.
the फ्रेमवर्क प्रयुक्त to determine this order quantity is also known as Barabas EOQ Model or Barabas Formula.
The model was developed by Ford W. Harris in 1913, but R. H. Wilson, a consultant who applied it extensively, is given क्रेडिट for his in-depth analysis.
Stephen `` Stevie '' Ray Vaughan ( October 3, 1954 – August 27, 1990 ) was an American guitarist, singer-songwriter, और record producer.
प्रायः referred to by उसके initials SRV, Vaughan is best known as a founding member and leader of Double Trouble.
Together with drummer Chris Layton and bassist टॉमी Shannon, वे ignited the blues पुनरुद्धार of the 1980s.
साथ a करियर spanning seven years, Vaughan and Double Trouble consistently sold out कॉन्सर्ट जबकि their albums अक्सर went gold.
He was born and raised in Dallas, Texas, and for a short period of time lived in Graham, Texas.
As the younger brother of Jimmie Vaughan, Vaughan started playing the guitar at age seven and formed अनेक bands that occasionally performed in local nightclubs.
At age 17, he dropped out of high school and moved to Austin to further pursue उसके musical करियर, joining groups such as Krackerjack, the Nightcrawlers, and the Cobras.
In 1977, he formed ट्रिपल Threat Revue, a बैंड कि eventually evolved into Double Trouble and regularly performed around Austin.
In 1982, Vaughan and Double Trouble performed at the Montreux Jazz Festival in Switzerland, catching the attention of musicians David Bowie and Jackson Browne.
Bowie asked vaughan to play on his upcoming studio album Let 's Dance, while Browne offered the band free use of his personal studio in Los Angeles to record an album.
In March 1983, Vaughan and Double Trouble were signed to एपिक Records by दिग्गज record producer John Hammond Sr. and released their debut album, Texas Flood in June of that साल.
After successful touring, the group released the albums, Could n't स्टैंड the Weather ( 1984 ) and Soul to Soul ( 1985 ), the latter of which featured new keyboardist Reese Wynans.
Although his करियर had progressed successfully, Vaughan checked into a rehabilitation hospital in Atlanta, Georgia to दे up a cocaine and alcohol habit और returned to touring with the band.
In June 1989, In Step was released और earned them a Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Blues Performance.
on August 27, 1990, Vaughan was killed in a helicopter crash following a performance in East Troy, Wisconsin.
Vaughan 's uniquely eclectic yet intense style was derived from a किस्में of musical genres.
He was बहकावे by blues musicians including Albert King, Freddie किंग, Otis Rush, and Muddy Waters, and rock guitarists such as जिमि Hendrix and Lonnie Mack.
His guitar playing reflected the classic blues और pentatonic तराजू.
He has received wide critical recognition for his गिटार playing, ranking at # 6 on Rolling Stones list of `` 100 Greatest Guitarists '' in 2011.
He was posthumously inducted into the Blues Hall of Fame in 2000 and a memorial statue was erected in Austin 's Auditorium Shores park.
Stevie Ray Vaughan is widely considered to be एक of the greatest musicians to come from the state of Texas.
The Las Vegas Strip World of Coca-Cola museum in 2003
Coca-Cola is a carbonated soft drink sold in स्टोर्स, restaurants, and vending machines in every country except Cuba और North Korea.
It is produced by The Coca-Cola Company of Atlanta, Georgia, and is often referred to simply as Coke ( a registered trademark of The Coca-Cola Company in the संयुक्त States चूंकि March 27, 1944 ).
originally intended as a patent आयुर्विज्ञान when it was invented in the late 19th century by John Pemberton, Coca-Cola was bought out by businessman Asa Griggs Candler, जिनकी marketing tactics led Coke to इसके दबदबा of the world soft-drink market throughout the 20th century.
The company produces concentrate, which is then sold to licensed Coca-Cola bottlers throughout the world.
The bottlers, who hold territorially exclusive contracts with the company, produce finished product in cans and bottles from the concentrate in combination with filtered जल and sweeteners.
The bottlers तब sell, distribute and merchandise Coca-Cola to retail stores और vending machines.
Such bottlers include Coca-Cola Enterprises, which is the largest single Coca-Cola bottler in उत्तर America and western Europe.
The Coca-Cola Company also बिकता concentrate for soda fountains to major restaurants and food service distributors.
The Coca-Cola Company has, on occasion, introduced अन्य कोला पेय under the Coke brand name.
The most common of these is Diet Coke, साथ others including Caffeine-Free Coca-Cola, Diet कोक Caffeine-Free, Coca-Cola Cherry, Coca-Cola Zero, Coca-Cola वैनिला, and special versions with lemon, lime or coffee.
Based on interbrand 's best global brand 2011, Coca-Cola was the world 's most मूल्यवान ब्रांड.
Barry Louis Larkin ( born April 28, 1964 ) is a retired Major League Baseball player.
Larkin played shortstop for the Cincinnati Reds from 1986 to 2004 and was one of the pivotal players on the 1990 लाल ' World Series championship team.
Larkin was elected to the National Baseball Hall of कीर्ति in January 2012 and थी inducted on July 22.
Larkin is considered one of the top players of his era, winning nine Silver Slugger awards and three Gold Glove awards.
He was selected to the प्रमुख League All-Star Game बारह times, and was elected the 1995 National League Most Valuable Player.
Brasília ( ) is the federal capital of Brazil and the seat of government of the Federal District.
Administratively, the city is located in the Federal District which is in the central-west Region.
Physically, it is located in the Brazilian Highlands.
it has a population of about 2,562,963 ( 3,716,996 in the metropolitan area ) as of the 2008 IBGE estimate, making it the fourth largest city in ब्राज़ील.
However, as a metropolitan area, it ranks lower at sixth in population.
Brasília is the largest city in the world that did not exist at the beginning of the 20th सदी.
Brasília has the fifth largest GDP among Latin अमरीकी cities और the third in Brazil.
At around R $ 62,000 Brazilian reais ( equal to approximately $ 30,900 US dollars or €23,000 euros ), the city 's per capita income is the highest among ब्राज़ील 's largest cities.
As the national capital, Brasília is the seat of all three branches of the federal government of Brazil.
The city भी hosts the headquarters of अनेक Brazilian companies.
Planning policies such as the स्थान of residential buildings around expansive urban areas, as well as building the city around विशाल avenues और dividing it into sectors, have sparked a debate and reflection on life in big शहरों in the 20th century.
The city 's design divides it into numbered ब्लॉक as well as sectors for specified activities, such as the Hotel Sector, the बैंकिंग Sector or the Embassy Sector.
Brasília hosts 124 foreign embassies.
The city was planned and developed in 1956 with Lúcio Costa as the principal urban planner, Oscar Niemeyer as the principal architect and Roberto Burle Marx as the landscape designer.
Brasilia is in the Unesco 's World Hertitage List due to its architecture.
On April 22, 1960, it formally became Brazil 's national capital.
Viewed from above, the main portion of the city resembles an airplane or a butterfly.
The नगर is commonly referred to as Capital Federal, or simply BSB.
Residents of Brasília are known as brasilienses or candangos ( the latter referring to those not born in the city but who migrated there after it was established ).
In local usage, the word `` Brasília '' usually refers only to the First Administrative Region ( RA i ) within the Federal District ( Distrito Federal ), where the most important government buildings are located.
Brasília has a unique status in Brazil, as it is an प्रशासनिक division rather than a legal municipality like nearly all cities in Brazil.
Nationally, the term is almost always used synonymously with the Federal District, which constitutes an indivisible federative ईकाई, analogous to a state.
Several `` satellite cities '' exist which are also part of the Federal ज़िला.
Brasília International विमानक्षेत्र is the main airport in Brasília, connecting the capital to all major Brazilian cities and many international destinations.
It is the third most important airport in Brazil, in terms of यात्री and aircraft movements.
Personifications of Germany, France, Russia, austria-hungary, and the United Kingdom attempting to keep the lid on the simmering cauldron of imperialist and nationalist tensions in the Balkans to prevent a general European war.
They were successful in 1912 and 1913 but किया not succeed in in 1914.
The causes of World War I, which began in central Europe in late July 1914 and finished in 1918, included अनेक factors, such as the conflicts and hostility of the four दशकों leading up to the war.
Militarism, alliances, imperialism, and राष्ट्रवाद played major roles in the conflict as well.
The immediate origins of the युद्ध, however, lay in the decisions लिया by statesmen and generals during the Crisis of 1914, casus belli for which was the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand ( the Archduke of Austria Hungary ) and his wife Sophie by Gavrilo Princip, an irredentist Serb.
The संकट came after a long and difficult series of diplomatic clashes between the ग्रेट Powers ( Italy, France, Germany, the British Empire, the Austria-Hungarian Empire and Russia ) over European and औपनिवेशिक issues in the दशक before 1914 that had बाएँ tensions high.
In turn these diplomatic clashes can be traced to changes in the balance of power in Europe चूंकि 1867.
The more immediate cause लिये the war was tensions over territory in the Balkans.
Austria-Hungary competed with Serbia and Russia for territory and influence in the region and वे pulled the rest of the Great Powers into the विरोध through their various alliances and treaties.
Although the chain of events unleashed by the assassination triggered the war, the war 's origins go deeper, involving national politics, संस्कृतियों, economics, and a complex web of alliances and counterbalances that had developed between the various European powers since 1870.
Some of the most महत्वपूर्ण long term or संरचनात्मक कल्याणकारी are : the विकास of राष्ट्रवाद across Europe, अनसुलझे territorial disputes, an intricate system of alliances, the perceived breakdown of the balance of power in Europe, convoluted and fragmented governance, the बाहें races of the previous decades, previous military planning, imperial and औपनिवेशिक rivalry for माल, power and prestige, and economic and military rivalry in industry and trade – e.g., the Pig War between Austria and Serbia.
Other causes that came into play during the diplomatic crisis that preceded the war included misperceptions of intent ( e.g., the German विश्वास that the United Kingdom would remain neutral ) and delays और misunderstandings in diplomatic communications.
The various categories of explanation for World War I correspond to different historians ' overall methods.
Most historians and popular टीकाकारों include कल्याणकारी from more than एक category of explanation to provide a rounded account of the causes of the war.
The deepest distinction among these accounts is between stories that see it as the inevitable and predictable निष्कर्ष of certain कारकों, and those that describe it as an arbitrary and unfortunate mistake.
In attributing causes for the war, historians and लड had to deal with an unprecedented flood of memoirs and official documents, released as each country involved tried to avoid blame for starting the war.
Early रिलीज of information by governments, विशेषकर those released for use by the `` Commission on the Responsibility of the Authors of the War '' were shown to be incomplete and biased.
In addition some documents, especially diplomatic cables between Russia and France, were found to have been doctored.
Even in later decades however, when much more information had been released, historians from the same culture have been shown to come to differing conclusions on the causes of the war.
Johnson 's new चार्ट of national emblems, published c. 1868.
The विशाल flags shown in the corners हैं the 37-star flag of the United States ( flown 1867-1877 ), the Royal Standard of the United Kingdom, the Russian Imperial Standard, and the French tricolore with इनसेट Imperial Eagle.
Various other flags flown by ships हैं shown.
The Flag of Cuba is labelled `` Cuban ( so called ) ``.
The Chinese dragon on the Flag of China was drawn mistakenly as a western dragon.
A national flag is a ध्वज that symbolizes a country.
The flag is flown by the government, but usually can also be flown by नागरिकों of the देश.
Both public and private buildings such as schools and courthouses may fly the national flag.
In some countries, the national flags are only flown from non-military buildings on certain flag days.
There are three distinct types of national flag for use on land, and three for use at sea, though अनेक countries use identical designs for several ( and sometimes all ) of these types of flag.
The American Civil War ( ACW ), also ज्ञात as the War between the States or simply the Civil War ( see naming ), was a civil war fought from 1861 to 1865 between the United States ( the `` Union '' or the `` North '' ) and several Southern स्लेव states that declared their secession and formed the Confederate States of America ( the `` Confederacy '' or the `` दक्षिण '' ).
The war had its उत्पत्ति in the issue of slavery, especially the extension of slavery into the western territories.
Foreign powers did not intervene.
After four years of खूनी combat that left over 600,000 soldiers dead and destroyed much of the South 's infrastructure, the Confederacy collapsed, slavery थी abolished, and the difficult Reconstruction process of restoring national unity and guaranteeing rights to the freed slaves began.
In the 1860 presidential election, Republicans, led by Abraham Lincoln, opposed expanding गुलामी into United States ' territories.
Lincoln won, but before his inauguration on March 4, 1861, seven cotton-based slave states formed the Confederacy.
Outgoing Democratic President James Buchanan and the incoming Republicans rejected secession as illegal.
Lincoln 's inaugural address declared his administration would not initiate civil war.
Eight remaining slave states continued to अस्वीकृत calls for secession.
Confederate forces seized numerous federal forts within territory claimed by the Confederacy.
a Peace Conference failed to find a compromise, and both sides prepared for war.
The Confederates assumed कि European countries were so dependent on `` King Cotton `` that they would intervene ; none did and none recognized the new Confederate States of America.
Hostilities began on April 12, 1861, when Confederate forces fired upon Fort Sumter, a key फोर्ट आयोजित by Union troops in South Carolina.
Lincoln called लिये each state to provide troops to retake the fort ; consequently, four more slave states joined the Confederacy, bringing their कुल to eleven.
The Union soon controlled the border states and established a naval नाकेबंदी that crippled the southern economy.
The Eastern Theater थी inconclusive in 1861–62.
The autumn 1862 confederate campaign into Maryland ( a Union state ) ended साथ confederate retreat at the Battle of Antietam, dissuading British intervention.
Lincoln issued the Emancipation उदघोषणा, which made ending slavery a war goal.
To the west, by summer 1862 the Union destroyed the Confederate नदी navy, then much of their पश्चिमी सेना, and the Union at Vicksburg split the Confederacy in दो at the Mississippi River.
In 1863, रॉबर्ट E. Lee 's confederate incursion north ended at the Battle of Gettysburg.
Western successes led to Ulysses S. Grant command of all Union armies in 1864.
In the Western Theater, William T. Sherman drove east to कैप्चर Atlanta and marched to the sea, destroying Confederate अवसंरचना along the way.
the Union marshaled the resources and manpower to आक्रमण the Confederacy from all दिशानिर्देश, and could afford to fight battles of attrition through the Overland Campaign towards Richmond, the Confederate capital.
The defending Confederate army failed, leading to Lee 's surrender to Grant at appomattox Court House on April 9, 1865.
The American Civil युद्ध was one of the earliest true industrial wars.
Railroads, the telegraph, steamships, and mass-produced weapons were employed extensively.
The mobilization of civilian factories, mines, shipyards, banks, transportation and food supplies all foreshadowed World War I.
It remains the deadliest war in American history, resulting in the deaths of an estimated 750,000 soldiers and an undetermined number of civilian casualties.
Historian John Huddleston estimates the death toll at टेन percent of all Northern males 20–45 years old, and 30 percent of all Southern white males aged 18–40.
Norrie disease is a genetic disorder that primarily affects the eye and almost always leads to blindness.
In addition to the congenital ocular symptoms, some patients suffer इससे a progressive hearing loss starting mostly in their 2nd decade of life, while another portion may be mentally challenged.
Patients with Norrie disease may develop cataracts, leukocoria ( a condition where the pupils appear white जब light is shone on them ), along with other developmental issues in the eye, ऐसे as shrinking of the globe and the wasting away of the iris.
Around 30–50 % of them will also have developmental delay/ mental retardation, psychotic-like features, incoordination of movements or behavioral abnormalities.
Most मरीजों are born with normal hearing ; however, the onset of hearing घाटा is very common in early adolescence.
About 15 % of the patients are estimated to develop all the features of the disease.
The disease affects almost only male infants at birth or जल्द after birth, because the disease is inherited x-linked recessive.
Only in very rare cases, females have been diagnosed with Norrie बीमारी as well.
The exact incidence number is unknown ; only a few hundred cases have been reported so far.
It is a very rare disorder कि is not associated with any specific ethnic or racial groups.
a contract is an agreement having a lawful object entered into voluntarily by two or अधिक parties, each of whom intends to create one or more legal obligations between them.
The elements of a contract are `` offer '' and `` acceptance '' by `` competent persons '' having legal capacity who exchange `` consideration '' to बनाएँ `` mutuality of obligation. ''
Proof of some or all of these elements may be done in writing, though contracts may be made entirely orally or by conduct.
The उपाय लिये breach of contract can be `` damages '' in the form of compensation of money or specific प्रदर्शन enforced through an injunction.
Both of these remedies पुरस्कार the party at loss the `` benefit of the bargain '' or expectation damages, which are वृहद than mere reliance क्षतिपूर्ति, as in promissory estoppel.
The parties may be natural persons or juristic persons.
A contract is a legally enforceable promise or undertaking that something will or will not occur.
The word promise can be used as a legal synonym for contract, although care is जरूरी as a promise may not have the full standing of a contract, as जब it is an agreement without consideration.
Contract law varies greatly from एक क्षेत्राधिकार to another, including differences in common law compared to civil law, the प्रभाव of received law, particularly from England in common law देशों, and of law codified in regional legislation.
Regarding Australian Contract Law for example, there are 40 relevant acts जिससे impact on the interpretation of contract at the Commonwealth ( Federal / national ) level, and an additional 26 acts at the level of the state of NSW.
In addition there are 6 international instruments or conventions which are applicable for international dealings, such as the संयुक्त Nations Convention on अनुबंध for the अंतरराष्ट्रीय Sale of Goods.
ASP.NET is a server-side Web application framework designed for Web development to produce dynamic वेब पृष्ठों.
It was developed by Microsoft to allow programmers to build dynamic web sites, web applications and web services.
It was first released in January 2002 with version 1.0 of the.NET Framework, और is the successor to Microsoft 's Active सर्वर Pages ( ASP ) technology.
ASP.NET is built on the Common Language Runtime ( CLR ), allowing programmers to write ASP.NET code using कोई supported.NET language.
The ASP.NET SOAP extension framework allows ASP.NET components to process SOAP messages.
Lysergic acid diethylamide, abbreviated LSD or LSD-25, also ज्ञात as lysergide ( INN ) and colloquially as acid, is a semisynthetic साइकेडेलिक drug of the ergoline family, well ज्ञात for इसके psychological effects which can include altered thinking processes, closed and open eye visuals, synesthesia, an altered sense of time और spiritual experiences, as well as for its key भूमिका in 1960s counterculture.
It is used mainly as an entheogen, recreational drug, and as an agent in psychedelic therapy.
LSD is non-addictive, is नहीं known to cause brain damage, and has extremely low toxicity relative to dose.
However, adverse psychiatric reactions ऐसे as anxiety, paranoia, and delusions are possible.
LSD was first synthesized by Albert Hofmann in 1938 from ergotamine, a chemical derived by Arthur stoll from ergot, a grain fungus that typically grows on rye.
The छोटी form `` LSD '' comes from its early code name LSD-25, which is an abbreviation for the German `` Lysergsäure-diethylamid '' followed by a sequential number.
LSD is sensitive to oxygen, ultraviolet light, and chlorine, especially in solution, though इसके potency may last लिये years if it is stored away from light and moisture at low temperature.
In pure form it is a colorless, odorless, tasteless solid.
LSD is typically delivered orally, usually on a substrate such as absorbent blotter paper, a sugar cube, or gelatin.
In its liquid form, it can also be administered by intramuscular or intravenous injection.
एलएसडी is very potent, with 20–30 μg ( micrograms ) being the threshold dose.
नई experiments with LSD started in 2009 for the first time in 40 years.
Introduced by Sandoz Laboratories, साथ trade-name Delysid, as a drug with various psychiatric uses in 1947, LSD जल्दी became a therapeutic agent that appeared to show ग्रेट promise.
In the 1950s, officials at the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency ( सीआईए ) thought the drug might be applicable to mind control and chemical warfare ; the एजेंसी 's mkultra research कार्यक्रम propagated the drug among young servicemen and students.
The subsequent recreational use of the drug by youth culture in the Western world during the 1960s led to a political firestorm that resulted in its prohibition.
Currently, a number of organizations—including the Beckley Foundation, MAPS, Heffter Research Institute and the Albert Hofmann Foundation—exist to fund, encourage and coordinate research into the medicinal and आध्यात्मिक uses of LSD and related psychedelics.
The United States नेवी 's Sea, Air, Land Teams, commonly known as the Navy SEALs, are the U.S. Navy 's प्रिंसिपल special परिचालन force and a part of the Naval Special Warfare Command and United States Special Operations Command.
`` SEAL '' is always capitalized in reference to members of the Naval Special warfare community.
The acronym is derived from their capacity to operate at sea, in the air, and on land.
SEALs are पुरूष सदस्यों of the United States Navy.
an exchange program with the Coast Guard, which graduated three coast Guardsmen as SEALs, was suspended in 2011.
The CIA 's अत्यधिक secretive Special Activities Division ( SAD ) and अधिक specifically its elite Special Operations Group ( SOG ) recruits operators from the मुहर Teams.
संयुक्त Navy SEALs and सीआईए operations go back to the famed macv-sog during the Vietnam War.
This cooperation still exists today and is देखी in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, and in the finding and killing of Osama bin Laden in Pakistan.
संसार population estimates from 1800 to 2100, based on UN 2010 projections ( red, orange, green ) और US Census Bureau historical estimates ( black ).
वास्तविक recorded population figures are in blue.
According to the highest estimate, the world population may rise to 16 अरब by 2100 ; according to the न्यूनतम estimate, it may decline to 6 billion.
The संसार population is the total number of living humans on Earth.
As of today, it is estimated to number billion by the United States जनसांख्यिकी Bureau ( USCB ).
The USCB estimates that the world population exceeded 7 billion on March 12, 2012.
According to a separate estimate by the United Nations Population Fund, it reached this milestone on October 31, 2011.
The world population has experienced continuous growth since the end of the Great Famine and the Black Death in 1350, when it stood at around 370 million.
the highest rates of विकास – global जनसांख्यिकी increases above 1.8 % per year – were seen briefly during the 1950s, and for a longer काल दौरान the 1960s and 1970s.
The growth rate peaked at 2.2 % in 1963, and had declined to 1.1 % by 2011.
Total annual births were highest in the late 1980s at about 138 million, and are now अपेक्षित to remain essentially निरंतर at their 2011 level of 134 million, while deaths number 56 million per year, and हैं expected to increase to 80 लाख per साल by 2040.
Current projections show a continued increase in population in the near future ( but a steady मनाही in the population growth rate ), with the global जनसांख्यिकी expected to reach between 7.5 and 10.5 billion by 2050.
Various longer-term estimates predict further growth, stagnation, or even overall decline in the global population by 2150.
Some analysts have questioned the sustainability of further world जनसांख्यिकी growth, citing the growing pressures on the environment, global food supplies, and energy resources.
Memphis is a city in the southwestern कोने of the U.S. state of Tennessee, and the county seat of Shelby County.
the city is located on the 4th Chickasaw Bluff, south of the confluence of the भेड़िया और Mississippi rivers.
Memphis था a population of 672,277 in 2011 making it the largest नगर in the state of Tennessee, the largest city on the Mississippi River, the third largest in the southeastern United राज्य, and the 20th largest in the United States.
The greater Memphis metropolitan area, including adjacent काउंटी in Mississippi and Arkansas, had a 2010 population of 1,316,100.
इस makes Memphis the second largest metropolitan area in Tennessee, surpassed only by metropolitan Nashville, which has overtaken Memphis in recent years.
Memphis is the youngest of Tennessee 's major cities.
A resident of Memphis is referred to as a Memphian, and the Memphis region is known, particularly to media outlets, as `` Memphis & The mid-south ``.
the cattenom Nuclear Power Plant in France.
France produces around three quarters of its electricity by nuclear power.
The Grafenrheinfeld Nuclear Power Plant in Germany.
Chancellor Angela Merkel 's गठबन्धन announced on May 30, 2011, that germany’s 17 nuclear शक्ति स्टेशन होगा be shut down by 2022, in a policy reversal following Japan 's Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster.
फिलहाल, 68 reactors are under construction in 15 countries.
Nuclear power stations operate in thirty countries.
In 2010, before the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster, it was reported that an average of about 10 nuclear reactors were expected to become operational per year, although according to the World Nuclear Association, of the 17 civilian reactors planned to become operational between 2007 and 2009, only five actually came on stream.
As of जून 2011, Germany and Switzerland are phasing-out nuclear power.
As of June 2011, countries such as Australia, Austria, Denmark, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malta, New Zealand, Norway and Portugal remain opposed to nuclear power.
Skeletal muscles homo sapiens
This is a table of muscles of the human anatomy.
There are approximately 642 skeletal muscles within the typical human, and almost every muscle constitutes one part of a pair of identical bilateral muscles, found on both पहलू, resulting in approximately 320 pairs of muscles, as presented in इस article.
Nevertheless, the exact number is difficult to define because different sources समूह muscles differently, e.g. regarding what is defined as different parts of a single muscle or as several muscles.
Examples range from 640 to 850.
The muscles of the human body can be categorized into a number of groups which include muscles relating to the head and neck, muscles of the torso or trunk, muscles of the upper limbs, and मांसपेशियां of the lower limbs.
The action refers to the कार्रवाई of each मांसपेशी from the standard anatomical स्थिति.
In other positions, other actions may be performed.

The Seminole Wars, also known as the Florida Wars, were three conflicts in Florida between the Seminole — the collective name given to the amalgamation of various groups of native Americans and ब्लैक people who settled in Florida in the early 18th century — और the United राज्य Army.
The First Seminole War was from 1814 to 1819 ( although sources differ ), the Second Seminole War from 1835 to 1842, and the Third seminole War from 1855 to 1858.
The पहला conflict साथ the Seminoles arose out of tensions relating to General एंड्रयू Jackson 's attack and विनाश of Negro Fort in Florida in 1816.
Jackson also attacked the Spanish at Pensacola.
Ultimately, the Spanish Crown ceded the colony to United States rule.

It is home to The University of Maine.

Luxor Las Vegas is a hotel और casino on the Las Vegas Strip in Paradise, Nevada.
The 30-story hotel, owned and operated by MGM Resorts International, has a casino with over 2,000 slot machines और 87 table games.
In the 2008 to 2009 renovation, it has a new, highly आधुनिकीकरण, and contemporary design and contains a total of 4,400 rooms, including 442 suites, lining the interior walls of a pyramid style tower and भीतर twin 22-story ziggurat towers that were built as later additions.
The hotel is named after the city of लक्सर ( ancient Thebes ) in Egypt.
Luxor is the second largest होटल in Las Vegas ( the largest होने the MGM Grand ) और the आठवीं largest in the world.
As of 2010, the Luxor has a 4 Key rating from the Green Key Eco-Rating Program, which evaluates `` sustainable '' होटल operations.
A pilot experiment, also called a pilot study, is a small स्केल preliminary study conducted in order to evaluate feasibility, time, लागत, प्रतिकूल events, and effect size ( statistical variability ) in an attempt to predict an appropriate sample size and improve upon the study design prior to performance of a full-scale research project.
Pilot studies, therefore, may not be उचित लिये case studies.

The acre is a unit of area used in the imperial and U.S. customary systems.
An एकड़ is about 40 % of a हेक्टेयर – slightly smaller than an American football field.
the acre is no longer commonly used, although a few notable exceptions include the संयुक्त States, Australia, Burma and the संयुक्त Kingdom ( as of 2010, the acre is no longer officially प्रयुक्त in the United Kingdom, though is still प्रयुक्त in रियल estate descriptions ).
It is still used, to some extent, in Canada.
The international symbol of the acre is ac, and is defined as 1/640 of a square mile.
The most commonly used acre today is the international acre.
In the United States both the international acre and the slightly different US survey acre are in use.
The most common use of the acre is to माप tracts of land.
One international acre is defined as 4046.8564224 square मीटर.
During the Middle Ages, an acre was the amount of जमीन that could be plowed in one day with a yoke of oxen.

Language processing refers to the way human beings use words to communicate ideas and feelings, and how such communications are processed and understood.
Thus it is कैसा the brain creates and understands language.
Most recent theories consider that this process is carried out entirely by and अंदर the brain.
This is considered एक of the सबसे characteristic abilities of the human species - perhaps the most characteristic.
However very little is known about it and there is विशाल scope for research on it.
Most of the knowledge acquired to date on the विषय has आइये from patients who have suffered some type of significant head injury, whether external ( wounds, बुलेट ) or आतंरिक ( strokes, tumors, degenerative diseases ).
अध्ययन have shown कि most of the language processing functions are carried out in the cerebral cortex.
the essential function of the cortical language areas is symbolic representation.
Even though भाषा exists in different forms, all of उन्हें are based on symbolic representation.
The Bugatti Veyron EB 16.4 is a mid-engined grand touring car, designed and developed by the Volkswagen Group and manufactured in Molsheim, France by Bugatti Automobiles S.A.S.
The Super Sport version of the Veyron is the fastest street-legal उत्पादन car in the world, with a top speed of.
The original version रै a top speed of.

DVD is an optical disc storage format, invented and developed by Philips, Sony, Toshiba, and Panasonic in 1995.
dvds offer higher storage capacity than compact discs while having the same dimensions.
Pre-recorded DVDs are mass-produced using molding मशीने that physically stamp data onto the DVD.
Such discs are known as DVD- ROM, because data can only be read and not written nor erased.
Blank recordable DVD discs ( DVD-R and DVD+R ) can be recorded once using a DVD recorder and then function as a DVD-ROM. Rewritable DVDs ( DVD-RW, DVD+RW, and DVD-RAM ) can be recorded and erased multiple times.
DVDs are प्रयुक्त in DVD-Video consumer digital video format और in DVD-Audio उपभोक्ता digital audio format, as खूब as for authoring AVCHD discs.
DVDs containing other types of information may be referred to as DVD data discs.

The series premiered on April 11, 2010, और रै since been renewed for a second season.

पीटर Gene Hernandez ( born October 8, 1985 ), known by his stage name Bruno Mars, is an American singer-songwriter and record producer.
Raised in Honolulu, Hawaii, by a family of musicians, Mars began making music at a young age and performed in various musical venues in his hometown throughout his childhood.
He graduated from high school and तब moved to Los Angeles, कैलिफ़ोर्निया, to pursue a musical career.
Mars produced songs for other artists, joining production team The Smeezingtons.
मंगल had an unsuccessful stint with Motown Records, but then signed with Atlantic in 2009.
He became recognized as a solo artist बाद lending his vocals and co-writing the hooks for the गीतों `` nothin ' on You `` by B.o.B, and `` अरबपति `` by Travie McCoy.
He also co-wrote the hits `` Right Round `` by Flo Rida featuring Ke $ ha, and `` Wavin ' Flag `` by K'naan.
In October 2010, he released his debut एल्बम, Doo-Wops & Hooligans.
Anchored by the worldwide number-one singles `` Just the Way You Are `` and `` ग्रेनेड ``, the album peaked at number three on the Billboard 200.
Mars was nominated लिये seven Grammys at the 53rd Grammy Awards, winning Best Male पॉप Vocal Performance for `` Just the Way You Are ''.
His second studio album, Unorthodox Jukebox, थी released on December 11, 2012.
Mars ' music is noted for displaying a wide variety of styles and influences, and contains elements of many musical जाति.
He has worked with an assortment of artists from विभिन्न genres.
As a child, he was highly influenced by artists such as Little Richard, Elvis Presley and Michael Jackson and would often impersonate these कलाकारों from a young age.
Mars also incorporates रेगी - and Motown -inspired sounds into his work.
Worldwide, Mars became the best-selling digital artist in 2011.
He had three singles in the top ten, including first प्लेस with `` Just the Way You Are '', which बेची 12.5 million copies.
Mars won Best International Male सोलो Artist at the 2012 BRIT Awards.
ब्रूनो Mars has sold 6 million एल्बम and 40 million singles worldwide as a सिंगर.
Althought as a song-writer, producer and singer his total single download sales surpass 100 million worldwide.

Greek mythology is the देह of myths and teachings that belong to the ancient Greeks, concerning their gods और heroes, the nature of the world, and the origins and significance of their own cult and ritual practices.
It was a भाग of the religion in ancient Greece and is part of religion in modern Greece and around the world, ज्ञात as Hellenismos.
आधुनिक scholars refer to और study the myths in an attempt to throw light on the religious और political institutions of Ancient Greece और its civilization, and to gain understanding of the nature of myth-making itself.
Greek mythology is explicitly embodied in a large collection of narratives, और implicitly in Greek representational arts, such as vase-paintings and votive gifts.
यूनानी myth attempts to explain the origins of the world, and details the lives and adventures of a wide variety of gods, goddesses, heroes, heroines, and mythological creatures.
ये accounts initially were disseminated in an oral-poetic tradition ; today the Greek myths are ज्ञात primarily from Greek literature.
The oldest known Greek literary sources, Homer 's epic poems Iliad and Odyssey, focus on events surrounding the Trojan युद्ध.
Two poems by होमर 's near contemporary Hesiod, the Theogony and the Works and Days, contain accounts of the genesis of the world, the succession of divine rulers, the succession of human ages, the origin of human woes, and the origin of sacrificial practices.
Myths are also preserved in the homeric Hymns, in fragments of epic poems of the Epic Cycle, in lyric poems, in the works of the tragedians of the fifth century bc, in writings of scholars and कवियों of the Hellenistic Age, and in texts from the समय of the Roman Empire by writers such as Plutarch and Pausanias.
Archaeological findings provide a principal सोर्स of detail about Greek mythology, with gods and heroes featured prominently in the decoration of many artifacts.
ज्यामितीय designs on pottery of the eighth century BC depict दृश्यों इससे the Trojan cycle as well as the adventures of Heracles.
In the succeeding Archaic, Classical, and Hellenistic periods, Homeric and various अन्य mythological scenes appear, supplementing the existing literary evidence.
Greek mythology has had an extensive influence on the culture, arts, and literature of Western civilization and remains part of Western heritage and language.
Poets and artists from प्राचीन times to the present have derived inspiration from Greek mythology and have discovered contemporary significance and relevance in the विषयवस्तु.
