They are currently led by head coach Chris Petersen and play their home games at Bronco Stadium.
The franc ( sign : Fr. or SFr. ; German : Franken, French and Romansh : franc, Italian : franco ; code : CHF ) is the currency and legal tender of Switzerland and Liechtenstein ; it is also legal tender in the इतालवी exclave Campione d'Italia.
Although not formally legal tender in the German exclave Büsingen ( the sole legal currency is the euro ), it is in wide daily use there.
The Swiss National Bank issues banknotes and the federal mint Swissmint issues सिक्के.
The Swiss franc is the only version of the franc स्टिल issued in Europe.
The smaller denomination, a hundredth of a franc, is a rappen ( Rp. ) in German, centime ( c. ) in French, centesimo ( ct. ) in Italian, and rap ( rp. ) in Romansh.
the ISO code of the currency used by banks and financial institutions is CHF, although `` Fr. '' is used by most businesses and advertisers ; some use SFr. ; the Latinate `` CH '' stands for Confoederatio Helvetica.
Given the different languages used in Switzerland, Latin is used for language-neutral inscriptions on the coins.
Sir Charles Spencer `` Charlie '' Chaplin, ( 16 April 188925 December 1977 ) was a British comic actor and filmmaker who rose to fame in the silent era.
चैपलिन became a worldwide icon through his screen persona `` the Tramp `` और is considered one of the most important figures of the film industry.
His career spanned more than 75 years, इससे a child in the Victorian era to close to his death at the age of 88, and encompassed both adulation and controversy.
Raised in London, Chaplin 's बाल्यकाल was defined by गरीबी and hardship.
He was sent to a workhouse twice before the age of nine ; his father was absent, and his mother was committed to a mental asylum.
Chaplin began performing from a young age, touring music हॉल and बाद working as a stage actor and comedian.
at 19 he was signed to the prestigious Fred Karno company, which took him to अमेरिका.
Chaplin was scouted by the film industry, and made his first appearances in 1914 with Keystone Studios.
He soon developed the Tramp persona and formed a large fan base.
Chaplin directed his films from an early stage, and continued to hone his craft as he moved to the Essanay, Mutual, और First National corporations.
by 1918, he थी एक of the most famous men in the world.
In 1919, Chaplin co-founded the distribution company United Artists, giving him complete control over his films.
His first feature-length picture was The बच्चा ( 1921 ), followed by A Woman of Paris ( 1923 ), The Gold फटाफट ( 1925 ), और The Circus ( 1928 ).
He refused to move to sound films in the 1930s, instead producing City Lights ( 1931 ) and Modern Times ( 1936 ) without dialogue.
Chaplin became increasingly political and उसके next film, The Great Dictator ( 1940 ), satirised Adolf Hitler.
The 1940s was a decade marked with controversy for Chaplin, और his लोकप्रियता declined rapidly.
He was अभियुक्त of communist sympathies, while his involvement in a paternity suit and marriages to much younger women were considered scandalous.
An FBI investigation was opened on Chaplin, और he was आखिरकार forced to leave the United States and settle in Switzerland.
he abandoned the ट्रैम्प लिये his later films, which include Monsieur Verdoux ( 1947 ), Limelight ( 1952 ), A King in नई York ( 1957 ), and A Countess From Hong Kong ( 1967 ).
Chaplin wrote, directed, produced, edited, scored, and स्ट्रक्चर in most of his films.
He was a perfectionist, and his financial independence meant he often spent years on the विकास and production of a picture.
His films are characterised by slapstick combined with pathos, and often feature the Tramp struggling against adversity.
Many contain social और political themes, as well as autobiographical elements.
In 1972, as part of a renewed appreciation for his work, Chaplin received an Honorary Academy Award लिये `` the incalculable effect he has had in making motion pictures the art form of this century ''.
He continues to be held in high लिहाज़, with the Gold Rush, City Lights, Modern Times, and The Great Dictator often ranked among the greatest films of सब time.
Planned Parenthood Federation of America ( ppfa ), commonly shortened to Planned Parenthood, is the U.S. affiliate of the अंतरराष्ट्रीय Planned Parenthood Federation ( IPPF ) and one of its larger members.
PPFA is a non-profit organization providing reproductive health and maternal and child health services.
the Planned Parenthood Action Fund, Inc. ( PPAF ) is a सम्बन्धित संगठन which lobbies for pro-choice legislation, comprehensive sex education, and access to affordable स्वास्थ्य care in the United States.
Planned Parenthood is the largest U.S. provider of reproductive health services, including cancer screening, HIV screening and counseling, contraception, and abortion.
Contraception accounts लिये 35 % of PPFA 's total services and abortions account for 3 % ; ppfa conducts roughly 300,000 abortions each year, among 3 million people served.
The organization has its roots in ब्रुकलीन, New York, where मार्गरेट Sanger opened the country 's first birth-control clinic.
सैंगर founded the American Birth Control League in 1921, which in 1942 became part of the Planned Parenthood Federation of America.
Since then, Planned Parenthood has grown to have over 820 clinic locations in the U.S., साथ a total budget of US $ 1 billion.
PPFA provides an array of services to over three million people in the United States, और supports services for over one million clients outside the United States.
Mens rea is Latin for `` guilty mind ''.
in criminal law, it is viewed as one of the necessary elements of some crimes.
The standard common law परीक्षण of criminal liability is usually expressed in the Latin phrase, actus non facit reum nisi mens sit rea, which means `` the act is not culpable unless the mind is guilty ''.
Thus, in jurisdictions with due process, there जरूर be an actus reus, or `` अपराधी act, '' accompanied by some level of mens rea to constitute the crime with which the defendant is charged ( see the technical requirement of concurrence ).
as a general rule, criminal liability does not attach to a person who acted with the absence of mental fault.
The exception is strict liability crimes.
In सिविल law, it is usually नहीं necessary to prove a subjective mental तत्व to establish देयता for breach of contract or अपकृत्य, for example.
however, if a tort is intentionally वचनबद्ध or a contract is intentionally breached, such intent may increase the scope of liability as well as the माप of damages payable to the plaintiff.
Therefore, mens rea refers to the mental element of the offence that accompanies the actus reus.
In some jurisdictions, the terms mens rea and actus reus have been replaced by alternative terminology.
In Australia, for example, the elements of the federal offences are now designated as `` दोष elements '' or `` mental elements '' ( mens rea ) and `` physical तत्व '' or `` external elements '' ( actus reus ).
This terminology was adopted to replace the obscurity of the Latin terms with simple and accurate phrasing.
Ulysses S. Grant ( born Hiram Ulysses Grant ; April 27, 1822 – July 23, 1885 ) was the 18th President of the United States ( 1869–1877 ) following his highly successful role as a war general in the second हाफ of the Civil War.
Under Grant, the Union Army defeated the Confederate military ; having effectively ended the war and secession with the surrender of Robert E. ली 's army at Appomattox.
As president he led the Radical Republicans in their effort to eliminate all vestiges of Confederate nationalism and slavery.
Upset over uncontrolled violence in the South and having desired to protect African American citizenship, President Grant effectively destroyed the Ku Klux Klan in 1871.
Grant was the first President to establish Civil सेवा reform having created a two-year federally funded Civil Service Commission in 1871.
in terms of foreign policy, Grant revealed an `` unexpected capacity for deliberation and consultation '' that promoted the national interest.
His reputation was marred by his repeated defense of corrupt appointees, and by America 's first industrial age economic depression ( called the `` Panic of 1873 `` ) कि dominated his second term.
Although his Republican Party split in 1872 with reformers denouncing him, Grant was easily reelected.
By 1875 the conservative white Southern opposition regained control of every state in the दक्षिण and as he left the श्वेत House in March 1877 his policies were होने undone.
A career soldier, he graduated from the United States Military Academy at West Point and served in the Mexican–American War.
When the Civil War began in 1861, Grant trained संघ volunteer regiments in Illinois.
In 1862, as a general he fought a series of battles and was promoted to major general after forcing the surrender of a large Confederate army and gaining control of Kentucky and most of Tennessee.
He then led Union forces to victory after initial setbacks in the Battle of Shiloh, earning a reputation as an aggressive commander.
In July 1863, after a long, complex campaign, Grant defeated five uncoordinated Confederate armies ( capturing one of them ) and seized Vicksburg.
This famous victory दिया the Union full control of the मिसिसिपी नदी, split off the western Confederacy, and opened the रास्ता for more Union triumphs.
After another win at the Battle of चट्टानूगा in लेट 1863, अध्यक्ष Abraham Lincoln made him lieutenant सामान्य and कमांडर of all of the Union Armies.
As commanding general of the army, Grant confronted Robert E. Lee in a श्रेणी of very bloody battles in 1864 known as the Overland अभियान that ended with the bottling up of Lee at Petersburg, outside the Confederate capital of Richmond.
During the siege, Grant coordinated a series of devastating campaigns launched by William Tecumseh Sherman, Philip Sheridan, and George Thomas.
आखिरकार breaking through Lee 's trenches, the संघ Army captured Richmond in April 1865.
Lee surrendered his depleted forces to ग्रान्ट at appomattox as the confederacy collapsed.
Although pro-Confederate historians attacked Grant as a निष्ठुर butcher who won by brute force, most historians have hailed his military genius.
Grant 's two लगातार terms as President stabilized the nation after the American Civil War and during the turbulent Reconstruction period that followed.
As president, he enforced Reconstruction by enforcing सिविल rights कानून and fighting Ku Klux Klan violence.
ग्रान्ट won passage of the Fifteenth Amendment ; giving constitutional protection for African-American voting rights.
He used the army to build the Republican Party in the South, based on black voters, Northern newcomers ( `` Carpetbaggers `` ) and native white supporters ( `` Scalawags. '' )
As a result, African Americans were represented in the u.S. Congress लिये the first time in अमरीकी इतिहास in 1870.
Reformers praised Grant 's Indian सलाम policy by having broken the deadlock on Indian appropriations in Congress, the creation of the Board of Indian Commissioners to make reform recommendations, and उसके enlistment of Quaker protestants who controlled mid पश्चिमी Indian agencies, that effectively curbed Congressional patronage.
Grant remained determined in keeping Indians from being exterminated from white settler encroachment or by the U.S. military.
Grant 's reputation as president by 1875 was at an all-time high for his previous veto of the Inflation Bill, the passage of the Resumption of Specie Act, and Secretary bristow 's successful raids that shut down the Whiskey Ring.
Grant 's foreign policy, led by सचिव of State Hamilton मछली, implemented International Arbitration, settled the अलबामा Claims with Britain and avoided war with Spain over the Virginius Affair.
A jukebox is a partially automated music-playing यंत्र, usually a coin-operated machine, that will play a patron 's selection from self-contained media.
The क्लासिक ज्यूकबॉक्स रै buttons with letters and numbers on them that, when entered in combination, are used to play a विशिष्ट selection.
A drug test is a technical analysis of a biological specimen – for example urine, hair, blood, sweat, or मौखिक fluid / saliva – to determine the presence or absence of specified parent drugs or their metabolites.
Major उपयोग of drug testing are to detect the presence of performance enhancing steroids in sport or for drugs prohibited by laws, such as cannabis, cocaine and heroin.
A `` 10-panel मूत्र screen '' consists of the following:
Amphetamines ( including Methamphetamine )
Barbiturates
Benzodiazepines
Cannabinoids ( thc )
Cocaine
Methadone
Methaqualone
Opiates ( Codeine, Morphine, हेरोइन, Oxycodone, Hydrocodone, etc. )
Phencyclidine ( PCP )
Propoxyphene
शनि V rocket, used for the American manned lunar लैंडिंग missions
Space exploration is the discovery and exploration of outer space by means of space technology.
शारीरिक exploration of space is conducted both by human spaceflights and by robotic spacecraft.
While the observation of objects in space, known as astronomy, predates reliable recorded history, it was the development of विशाल and relatively efficient rockets during the early 20th सदी that allowed physical space exploration to become a reality.
Common rationales for exploring space include advancing scientific research, uniting अलग nations, ensuring the future survival of humanity and developing military और strategic advantages against other countries.
Various criticisms of space exploration are sometimes made.
Space exploration has often been प्रयुक्त as a proxy competition for geopolitical rivalries such as the ठंडा War.
The early era of space exploration was driven by a `` Space Race `` between the Soviet Union and the United States, the launch of the first man-made object to कक्षा the Earth, the USSR 's Sputnik 1, on 4 October 1957, and the first चंद्रमा landing by the अमरीकी Apollo 11 craft on 20 July 1969 हैं often लिया as the boundaries for this initial period.
The Soviet space program achieved many of the first milestones, including the first living being in orbit in 1957, the first human spaceflight ( Yuri Gagarin सवार Vostok 1 ) in 1961, the first spacewalk ( by Aleksei leonov ) on 18 March 1965, the first automatic landing on another celestial body in 1966, and the launch of the first space station ( Salyut 1 ) in 1971.
After the first 20 years of exploration, focus shifted from one-off flights to renewable hardware, such as the Space Shuttle program, and from competition to cooperation as with the International Space Station ( ISS ).
With the substantial completion of the ISS following STS-133 in March 2011, plans for space exploration by the USA remain in flux.
Constellation, a बुश Administration program for a return to the चंद्रमा by 2020 was judged inadequately funded and unrealistic by an विशेषज्ञ review panel reporting in 2009.
The ओबामा Administration proposed a revision of Constellation in 2010 to focus on the development of the capability for crewed missions beyond low earth orbit ( LEO ), envisioning extending the operation of the ISS beyond 2020, transferring the development of launch vehicles for human crews from NASA to the private sector, and developing technology to enable missions to beyond leo, such as Earth/Moon L1, the Moon, Earth/Sun L2, near-earth asteroids, and Phobos or Mars कक्षा.
As of March 2011, the US सीनेट and House of Representatives are still working towards a सुलह NASA funding bill, which होगा probably terminate Constellation and fund development of a heavy lift launch vehicle ( hllv ).
In the 2000s, the लोगों 's गणतंत्र of China initiated a कामयाब manned spaceflight program, while the यूरोपीय Union, Japan, and India have also planned future manned space missions.
China, Russia, जापानी, and India have advocated मानवयुक्त मिशन to the Moon during the 21st सदी, while the यूरोपीय Union has advocated manned missions to both the Moon and Mars during the 21st century.
From the 1990s onwards, private interests began promoting space tourism and then private space exploration of the Moon ( see Google Lunar X Prize ).
John Calvin Coolidge, Jr. ( July 4, 1872January 5, 1933 ) was the 30th President of the United States ( 1923–1929 ).
A रिपब्लिकन lawyer इससे Vermont, Coolidge worked his रास्ता up the ladder of Massachusetts state politics, eventually बनने governor of that state.
His conduct during the Boston Police Strike of 1919 thrust him into the नेशनल spotlight and gave him a reputation as a man of decisive action.
Soon after, he was elected as the 29th Vice President in 1920 and succeeded to the Presidency upon the sudden death of Warren G. Harding in 1923.
Elected in his own right in 1924, he gained a reputation as a small-government रूढ़िवादी, and also as a man who said very little.
Coolidge लौटी पब्लिक confidence in the श्वेत House after the scandals of his predecessor 's administration, और left office with considerable popularity.
as a Coolidge biographer put it, `` He embodied the spirit and hopes of the middle क्लास, could interpret their longings and express their opinions.
कि he did represent the genius of the average is the most convincing proof of his strength. ''
Some later criticized Coolidge as भाग of a general criticism of laissez-faire government.
His reputation underwent a renaissance during the Ronald Reagan Administration, but the ultimate assessment of his presidency is स्टिल divided between those who approve of his कटौती of the size of government programs and those who believe the federal government should be more involved in regulating and controlling the economy.
Espresso is a concentrated beverage brewed by forcing a small amount of nearly boiling water under दबाव through finely मैदान coffee beans.
Espresso often has a thicker consistency than coffee brewed by other methods, a higher concentration of निलंबित and dissolved solids, and crema ( meaning cream, but being a reference to the foam with a creamy texture that forms as a result of the pressure ).
as a result of the pressurized brewing process the flavors और chemicals in a ठेठ cup of espresso हैं very concentrated.
Espresso is the base for other drinks, ऐसे as a latte, cappuccino, macchiato, mocha, or americano.
Espresso has more caffeine per unit volume than most beverages, but the usual serving size is smaller—a typical 60 mL ( 2 US द्रव ounce ) of espresso has 80 to 150 mg of caffeine, छोटी less than the 95 to 200 mg of a standard 240 mL ( 8 US fluid ounces ) cup of drip-brewed coffee.
Brian Keith Kelly ( born October 25, 1961 ) is an American football coach and former player.
He is currently the head football coach for the Notre Dame Fighting Irish, a position he has held since December 2009.
केली was previously head coach at ग्रैंड Valley State विश्वविद्यालयों ( 1991–2003 ), Central Michigan विश्वविद्यालयों ( 2004–2006 ), and University of Cincinnati ( 2006–2009 ).
A contract is an agreement having a lawful object entered into voluntarily by two or more parties, each of whom intends to create one or more legal obligations between उन्हें.
The elements of a contract are `` प्रस्ताव '' and `` acceptance '' by `` competent persons '' having legal capacity who exchange `` consideration '' to create `` mutuality of obligation. ''
Proof of कुछ or all of these elements may be done in writing, though contracts may be made entirely orally or by conduct.
The remedy for breach of contract can be `` damages '' in the form of compensation of money or specific प्रदर्शन enforced through an injunction.
Both of these remedies award the party at loss the `` benefit of the bargain '' or expectation damages, which हैं greater than mere reliance damages, as in promissory estoppel.
The parties may be natural persons or juristic persons.
A अनुबंध is a legally enforceable promise or undertaking that something will or will not occur.
The word promise can be used as a legal synonym लिये contract, हालांकि care is required as a promise may not have the full standing of a contract, as when it is an agreement without consideration.
Contract law varies greatly from एक jurisdiction to another, including differences in common law compared to civil law, the impact of received law, particularly from England in common law countries, and of law codified in regional विधान.
Regarding Australian Contract Law for example, there are 40 relevant acts which impact on the interpretation of contract at the Commonwealth ( Federal / national ) level, and an additional 26 acts at the level of the राज्य of NSW.
In addition there are 6 international यंत्र or conventions which are applicable for अंतरराष्ट्रीय dealings, such as the United Nations सम्मेलन on Contracts for the अंतरराष्ट्रीय Sale of Goods.
Sidney Patrick Crosby, ONS ( born August 7, 1987 ) is a Canadian professional ice हॉकी player who is captain of the Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League ( NHL ).
Crosby was drafted first overall by the Penguins out of the Quebec Major Junior Hockey लीग ( qmjhl ).
During his two-year major junior career with the Rimouski Océanic, he earned back-to-back chl खिलाड़ी of the Year awards and led his club to the 2005 Memorial Cup फाइनल.
nicknamed `` The अगला One ``, he was one of the most highly regarded draft picks in हॉकी history, leading अनेक to refer to the 2005 Draft Lottery as the `` Sidney Crosby Sweepstakes ''.
in his पहला NHL season, Crosby finished sixth in league scoring with 102 points ( 39 goals, 63 assists ) and was a runner-up लिये the Calder Memorial Trophy ( won by Alexander Ovechkin ).
By his second season, he led the NHL with 120 points ( 36 लक्ष्य, 84 assists ) to capture the Art Ross Trophy, becoming the youngest player and the only teenager to win a scoring शीर्षक in any प्रमुख North American sports league.
That same season, Crosby also won the Hart Memorial Trophy as the Professional Hockey Writers Association 's choice for most valuable player and the Lester B. पियर्सन Award as the NHL Players Association 's choice for most outstanding खिलाड़ी, becoming the seventh player in NHL history to earn all three awards in one year.
crosby started the 2007–08 season with the team 's captaincy and subsequently led them to the 2008 Stanley Cup Finals, where they were defeated by the Detroit Red Wings in six games.
The Penguins returned to the Finals against डेट्रॉयट the following year and won in seven games ; Crosby became the youngest captain in एनएचएल history to win the Stanley Cup.
In the 2009–10 season, Crosby scored a career-high 51 goals, tying him with Steven Stamkos for the Rocket Richard Trophy as the league-leader ; with 58 assists, he totaled 109 points, second in the NHL.
During the off-season, Crosby received the Mark Messier Leadership Award.
In 2010–11, Crosby sustained a concussion as a result of hits to the head in back-to-back games.
The injury left उसे sidelined for ten and a half महीने.
However, after playing eight games in the 2011–12 season, Crosby 's concussion-like symptoms returned in December 2011, और he did not return until mid-March 2012.
Internationally, Crosby has represented कनाडा in numerous tournaments for the country 's junior and men 's teams.
After competing in the 2003 U-18 जूनियर World Cup, he represented कनाडा in back-to-back IIHF World u20 Championships, winning चांदी in 2004 and gold in 2005.
At the 2006 IIHF World Championship, he led the tournament in स्कोरिंग, while also earning Top Forward and All-Star टोली honours.
Four years later, Crosby was named to Team Canada for the 2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver.
playing the United States in the gold medal game, he scored the game-winning goal in overtime.
A United States cent, also known as a penny.
`` My two cents '' ( 2¢ ) and its longer version `` put my two cents in '' is an संयुक्त States ( US ) idiomatic expression, taken from the original English idiom expression : to put in `` my two pennies worth '' or `` my tuppence worth. ''
It is used to preface the tentative stating of one’s opinion.
By deprecating the opinion to follow – suggesting its value is only two cents, a very small amount – the user of the phrase hopes to lessen the impact of a possibly statement, showing politeness और humility.
However, it is also sometimes used with irony when expressing a strongly felt opinion.
The phrase is also used out of habit to preface uncontentious opinions.
For example:
The Chinese सिविल War was a civil war in China fought between forces loyal to the government of the Republic of China led by the Kuomintang ( KMT ) and forces of the कम्युनिस्ट Party of China ( CPC ).
The war began in April 1927, amidst the उत्तरी Expedition, and essentially ended when major क्रियाशील लड़ाइयों ceased in 1950.
The विरोध eventually resulted in two de facto states, the गणतंत्र of China ( ROC ) in Taiwan and the People 's Republic of China ( PRC ) in mainland China, both claiming to be the legitimate government of China.
The war represented an वैचारिक split ( Left vs. Right ) between the Communist CPC, and the KMT 's brand of Nationalism.
The civil war continued intermittently जबतक late 1937, when the two parties formed a दूसरी United Front to counter a Japanese आक्रमण.
China 's full-scale civil war resumed in 1946, a year after the end of hostilities with Japan.
After four more सालो, 1950 saw the cessation of major military hostilities—with the newly founded People 's Republic of China controlling mainland China ( including Hainan ), and the गणतंत्र of China 's jurisdiction being restricted to Taiwan, Penghu, Quemoy, Matsu and several outlying islands.
The Kuomintang defeat is attributed to several कारकों : Corruption - Chiang wrote in his डायरी on June 1948 that the KMT had failed, not because of external enemies but because of दुर्गन्ध from within.
Strong आरंभिक support from the U.S. diminished, and then, stopped.
( Partly because of KMT corruption and anti-democratic regime, and partly because of the uncertain U.S. foreign policy towards Communism between 1945 and 1950 ) ; Communist land reform policy promised poor peasants farmland from their landlords.
This ensured PLA popular support.
After the आत्मसमर्पण of Japan at the end of World War II, Soviet forces turned over उनके captured Japanese weapons to the CPC and allowed the CPC to take control of territory in Manchuria.
To this दिन, no armistice or peace treaty has कभी been signed, and it is debated as to the whether the Civil War has legally ended.
Cross-Strait relations have been hindered by military खतरे and political and economic pressure, particularly over Taiwan 's political status, with both governments officially adhering to a `` One-China policy. ''
The PRC still actively claims Taiwan as part of its territory and continues to threaten the ROC with a military invasion if the ROC officially declares independence by changing its name to and gaining international recognition as the Republic of Taiwan.
The आरओसी mutually claims mainland China, and they both continue the fight over diplomatic recognition.
Today, the war as such occurs on the राजनैतिक and economic fronts in the form of cross-Strait relations ; however, the two separate de facto states have close economic ties.
The One Hundred Twelfth United States Congress was the meeting of the legislative branch of the United States federal सरकारी, from January 3, 2011 until January 3, 2013.
It convened in Washington, D.C. on January 3, 2011, and ended on जनवरी 3, 2013, 17 days before the end of the presidential term to which Barack Obama was elected in 2008.
Senators elected to regular terms in 2006 completed those terms in this Congress.
This Congress included the last House of Representatives elected from congressional districts that were apportioned based on the 2000 census.
in the 2010 midterm elections, the Republican Party won the बहुमत in the House of Representatives.
While the Democrats kept उनके Senate majority, it was घटाया from the previous Congress.
This was the first Congress in which the हाउस and Senate were controlled by different parties since the 107th Congress ( 2001–2003 ), और the first Congress to begin कि way since the 99th Congress ( 1985–1987 ).
In this Congress, the House of Representatives had the largest number of Republican members, 242, since the 80th Congress ( 1947–1949 ).
It was also the first Congress since 1947 in which no सदस्य of the Kennedy family served, as well as the most politically polarized कॉंग्रेस since Reconstruction, with record low approval ratings.
Wealth in the United States is commonly measured in terms of net worth, which is the sum of all assets, including home इक्विटी, minus all liabilities.
The total net worth of US households और nonprofit organizations 1945–2009, unadjusted for inflation or population change.
For उदाहरण, a household in possession of an $ 800,000 house, $ 5,000 in mutual funds, $ 30,000 in cars, $ 20,000 worth of stock in their own company, and a $ 45,000 IRA would have assets totaling $ 900,000.
Assuming that this household would have a $ 250,000 mortgage, $ 40,000 in car loans, and $ 10,000 in credit card debt, its debts would total $ 300,000.
Subtracting the debts इससे the worth of this household 's एसेट ( 900,000 - $ 300,000 = $ 600,000 ), this household would have a net लायक of $ 600,000.
Net worth can vary with fluctuations in value of the underlying assets.
The माल —more specifically, the मध्य net worth—of households in the United States is varied with relation to race, education, geographic स्थान and gender.
As one would expect, households with greater income feature the highest net worths, though high आय can not be taken as an always accurate indicator of net worth.
Overall the number of wealthier households is on the rise, with baby boomers hitting the highs of their करियर.
In addition, माल is unevenly distributed, with the wealthiest 25 % of US households owning 87 % of the wealth in the संयुक्त States, which थी $ 54.2 खरब in 2009.
Including human capital such as skills, the United Nations estimated the total wealth of the संयुक्त States in 2008 to be $ 118 trillion.
This article deals with Selective Dorsal rhizotomy ( SDR ) rather than the rhizotomy procedures for pain relief ; for those procedures, which have begun to take the name `` rhizotomy '' in certain instances, see facet rhizotomy and similar.
A rhizotomy ( ) is a term chiefly referring to a neurosurgical procedure that selectively destroys समस्यापूर्ण nerve roots in the spinal cord, most often to relieve the symptoms of neuromuscular शर्तें such as spastic diplegia and other forms of spastic cerebral palsy.
The selective dorsal rhizotomy ( sdr ) लिये spastic cerebral palsy has been the main use of rhizotomy for neurosurgeons specialising in spastic CP since the 1980s ; in this surgery, the spasticity-causing nerves हैं isolated and then targeted and destroyed.
The sensory nerve roots, जहाँ spasticity is located, are पहला separated from the motor ones, and the nerve fibres to be cut are then identified via electromyographic stimulation.
The ones producing spasticity are then selectively lesioned साथ tiny electrical pulses.
In spasticity, rhizotomy precisely targets and destroys the damaged nerves that don’t प्राप्त gamma amino butyric acid, which is the core problem for people with spastic दिमागी palsy.
These over-firing, non-GABA-absorbing nerves generate unusual विद्युत activity during the emg testing phase in SDR and are thus considered to be the source of the patient 's hypertonia ; they are eliminated with the electrical pulses once identified, while the remaining nerves and nerve routes carrying the correct messages remain fully intact and untouched.
This means that the spasticity is permanently dissolved, and that this is done without affecting nervous system sensitivity or function in other areas, because the only nerves destroyed are the over-firing ones जिम्मेदार for the muscle tightness.
The terms rhizotomy and neurotomy हैं भी increasingly becoming interchangeable in the treatment of chronic back pain from degenerative disc disease.
This is a procedure called a facet rhizotomy and is not a surgical procedure but is instead done on an outpatient basis using a simple probe to apply radiofrequency waves to the impinged pain-causing तंत्रिका root lying between the facet joint and the vertebral body.
Such radio आवृत्ति nerve lesioning results in five to eight or more months of pain relief before the nerve regenerates and another round of the procedure needs to be performed.
A facet rhizotomy is बस one of अनेक different forms of radiofrequency ablation, और its use of the `` rhizotomy '' name should not be confused with the SDR procedure.

The term migrant worker has different official meanings and connotations in different parts of the world.
The संयुक्त Nations ' definition is broad, सहित any people working outside of their home देश.
The term can also be used to describe किसी who migrates within a country, संभवतः their own, in order to pursue work such as seasonal work.

The teardrop tattoo or tear tattoo is a symbolic tattoo that is placed underneath the eye.
It has no fixed meaning but almost all meanings ( see below ) have some connection to prison.
U.S. Route 75 is a north–south u.S. Highway.
The highway 's northern terminus is in kittson County, Minnesota, at the Canadian border, where it once continued as Manitoba Highway 75 on the other side of the now-closed border crossing.
Its southern terminus is at Interstate 30 and अंतरराज्यीय 45 in डलास, Texas, where it is known as North Central Expressway.
U.S. 75 was a border-to-border route, from Canada to the Gulf of Mexico at Galveston, Texas.
However, the संपूर्ण खण्ड south of Dallas, टेक्सास has been decommissioned in favor of अंतरराज्यीय 45, a cutoff section of town-to-town surface road having become State Highway 75.
Lower Ninth Ward is a neighborhood of the city of नई Orleans.
As the name implies, it is part of the Ninth Ward of New Orleans.
The Lower नवीं Ward is often thought of as the entire area within New Orleans downriver of the Industrial कनाल ; however, the City Planning Commission divides this area into the Lower Ninth Ward ( 2 ) and Holy Cross ( 3 ) neighborhoods.
The पद `` Lower '' refers to its location farther towards the mouth of the Mississippi River, `` down '' or `` नीचे '' the बाकी of the city in local geographic terminology.
But the 9th Ward, like all Wards in New Orleans, is a voting district.
The 9th Ward was added as a voting district in 1852.
The `` lower '' 9th Ward is composed of Ward 9 Districts 1, 2, 4, and 7 which make up the Holy Cross Area and Ward 9 Districts 3, 5, 6, and 8.
Higher voting district numbers in the 9th Ward ( 8-27 ) are on the upriver side of the Industrial Canal.
The area came to national attention for its devastation in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina in 2005.

Red and orange tinted Moon, as seen from Earth during a lunar eclipse, where the Earth comes between the Moon and Sun
The Moon is the only natural satellite of the Earth, and the fifth largest satellite in the सौर प्रणाली.
It is the largest natural satellite of a planet in the Solar प्रणाली relative to the size of its primary, having 27 % the diameter and 60 % the density of Earth, resulting in its mass.
The Moon is the दूसरी densest satellite after Io, a satellite of Jupiter.
The Moon is in synchronous rotation with धरती, always showing the same face with its near पक्ष marked by dark volcanic maria that fill between the bright ancient crustal highlands and the prominent impact craters.
It is the brightest object in the sky after the Sun, हालांकि its surface is actually very dark, with a reflectance similar to that of coal.
Its prominence in the sky and its नियमित cycle of phases have, since ancient times, made the Moon an important cultural influence on language, calendars, art and mythology.
The चंद्रमा 's gravitational influence produces the समंदर tides और the मिनट lengthening of the day.
The Moon 's current orbital distance, परिचय thirty times the diameter of the Earth, causes it to appear almost the same size in the आसमान as the Sun, allowing it to cover the Sun nearly precisely in total solar eclipses.
This matching of apparent visual size is a coincidence.
The Moon 's linear अलहदा from the Earth is currently increasing at a rate of 3.82±0.07cm per year, but this rate is not constant.
The Moon is thought to have formed nearly 4.5 billion years ago, not long after the Earth.
Although there have been several hypotheses लिये its origin in the past, the current सबसे widely accepted explanation is that the Moon formed from the मलबा left over after a giant प्रभाव between Earth and a Mars -sized body.
The Moon is the तभी celestial body other than Earth on which इंसानो have set foot.
the Soviet Union 's Luna programme was the first to reach the Moon with unmanned spacecraft in 1959 ; the United States ' NASA Apollo program achieved the only manned missions to date, beginning with the पहला manned lunar orbiting मिशन by Apollo 8 in 1968, and six manned चंद्र landings between 1969 and 1972, with the first होने Apollo 11.
These missions returned over 380 kg of lunar rocks, which have been प्रयुक्त to develop a geological understanding of the चंद्रमा 's origins, the formation of its internal structure, and its subsequent history.
After the Apollo 17 mission in 1972, the Moon has been visited only by unmanned spacecraft, notably by the final सोवियत Lunokhod rover.
Since 2004, Japan, China, India, the संयुक्त States, and the European Space Agency have each भेजा lunar orbiters.
These spacecraft have contributed to confirming the discovery of lunar water ice in permanently shadowed craters at the poles and bound into the lunar regolith.
Future manned मिशन to the चंद्रमा have been planned, including government as well as privately funded efforts.
The Moon remains, under the Outer Space Treaty, free to all राष्ट्र to explore for शांतिपूर्ण purposes.
Ronald Wilson reagan ( ; February 6, 1911 – जून 5, 2004 ) was the 40th President of the United States ( 1981–1989 ).
prior to कि, he was the 33rd Governor of California ( 1967–1975 ), and a radio, film and television actor.
Born in Tampico, Illinois, and raised in Dixon, Reagan was educated at Eureka College, earning a Bachelor of Arts degree in economics and sociology.
After graduating, Reagan moved पहला to Iowa to work as a रेडियो broadcaster और then, in 1937, to Los एंजिल्स where he began a career as an actor, first in films and later television.
Some of उसके most notable films include Knute Rockne, All American ( 1940 ), Kings Row ( 1942 ), and Bedtime for Bonzo ( 1951 ).
Reagan served as अध्यक्ष of the Screen Actors Guild and later as a प्रवक्ता for General Electric ( GE ) ; उसके start in राजनीती occurred during उसके work लिये GE.
Originally a member of the Democratic Party, his positions began shifting rightward in the 1950s, और he switched to the Republican Party in 1962.
After delivering a rousing speech in support of Barry Goldwater 's अध्यक्षीय candidacy in 1964, he was persuaded to seek the California governorship, winning two years later and again in 1970.
He was defeated in his चलाएं for the रिपब्लिकन presidential nomination in 1968 and in 1976, but won both the nomination and general election in 1980, defeating incumbent Jimmy Carter.
As president, Reagan implemented sweeping new political and economic initiatives.
His supply-side economic policies, dubbed `` Reaganomics ``, advocated reducing tax rates to spur economic growth, controlling the money supply to reduce महंगाई, deregulation of the economy, and reducing government बिता.
In his पहला term he survived an assassination attempt, took a hard लकीर against मजदूर unions, announced a new War on Drugs, and ordered an invasion of Grenada.
He was re-elected in a landslide in 1984, proclaiming that it was `` morning in America ``.
His दूसरी term was primarily marked by foreign matters, such as the ending of the Cold War, the 1986 bombing of Libya, and the revelation of the Iran-Contra affair.
Publicly describing the Soviet Union as an `` evil empire ``, he supported anti-communist movements worldwide and spent his first term forgoing the strategy of détente by ordering a massive military buildup in an arms race with the ussr.
Reagan negotiated with Soviet General Secretary Mikhail गोर्बाचेव, culminating in the INF Treaty and the घटी of both countries ' नाभिकीय arsenals.
Reagan left office in 1989.
In 1994, the पूर्व president disclosed that he had been diagnosed साथ Alzheimer 's disease earlier in the year ; he died ten years later at the age of 93.
A conservative icon, he ranks highly in public राय polls of U.S. Presidents and is credited for generating an ideological renaissance on the American political right.
Complete set of scrolls, constituting the entire Tanakh.
The Tanakh (, or ; also Tenakh, Tenak, Tanach ) is a name used in Judaism for the canon of the Hebrew Bible.
The Tanakh is also known as the Masoretic Text or the miqra.
The name is an acronym formed from the initial Hebrew letters of the Masoretic टेक्स्ट 's three traditional subdivisions : The Torah ( `` Teaching '', also known as the Five Books of Moses ), Nevi'im ( `` Prophets '' ) and Ketuvim ( `` Writings '' ) —hence tanakh.
The name `` Miqra '' ( מקרא ), meaning `` that which is read '', is an alternative Hebrew पद for the Tanakh.
The books of the Tanakh यहूद relayed with an accompanying oral tradition passed on by each generation, called the Oral Torah.
The Kawasaki Ninja zx-6r is a Kawasaki 600 cc class sport motorcycle.
It was introduced in 1995, and रै been constantly updated throughout the years in response to new products from होंडा, Suzuki, and Yamaha.
The ZX series is what was known as the Ninja line of कावासाकी motorcycles in the 1980s और still carries the name आज.
Assassination attempts and plots on राष्ट्रपतियों of the संयुक्त States have been numerous : more than 20 attempts to मार sitting और former presidents, as well as the Presidents-elect, are known.
Four sitting presidents have been मारे : Abraham Lincoln ( the 16th President ), James A. Garfield ( the 20th President ), William McKinley ( the 25th President ) and John F. Kennedy ( the 35th President ).
Two presidents were injured in attempted assassinations : former President Theodore Roosevelt ( the 26th President ), and President Ronald Reagan ( the 40th President ).
Although the historian J.W. क्लार्क has suggested that most American assassinations were politically motivated actions, carried out by rational मेन, not all such attacks have been undertaken for political reasons.
Some attackers had questionable mental stability, और a few were judged legally insane.
Since the Vice President of the United States has for more than a century been elected from the same political party as the President, the assassination of the President is unlikely to result in major policy changes.
This may explain why political groups typically do not make such attacks.
Where the Red Fern Grows is a novel लिखा by Wilson Rawls in 1961 about a boy who buys and trains two Redbone Coonhound hunting dogs.
Oklahoma ( ) ( Pawnee : Uukuhuúwa, Cayuga : Gahnawiyoˀgeh ) is a state located in वेस्ट South Central United States.
Oklahoma is the 20th most extensive and the 28th most populous of the 50 United States.
The state 's name is निकला from the Choctaw words okla and humma, अर्थ `` red people '', and it is ज्ञात informally by its nickname, The Sooner State.
Formed by the combination of Oklahoma Territory and Indian Territory on November 16, 1907, Oklahoma was the 46th state to enter the union.
Its residents are known as Oklahomans or, informally `` okies '', and इसके capital and largest city is Oklahoma City.
A major producer of natural gas, oil, and agriculture, Oklahoma relies on an economic base of aviation, energy, telecommunications, and biotechnology.
It has one of the fastest growing economies in the nation, ranking among the top states in per capita income growth and gross domestic product growth.
Oklahoma City and Tulsa serve as Oklahoma 's primary आर्थिक anchors, with nearly two thirds of Oklahomans living within their metropolitan सांख्यिकीय areas.
With small mountain ranges, prairie, mesas, and eastern forests, most of Oklahoma lies in the Great Plains and the U.S. आंतरिक Highlands —a region especially prone to severe weather.
In addition to having a prevalence of English, German, Scottish, Irish and Native American ancestry, more than 25 Native American languages are spoken in Oklahoma, second तभी to California.
Oklahoma is located on a confluence of three major American cultural regions and historically परोसा as a route for चौपायों ड्राइव, a destination for southern settlers, and a government-sanctioned territory for Native Americans.
Redwall, by Brian Jacques, is a श्रेणी of children 's fantasy novels.
It is the title of the first book of the series, published in 1986, as well as the नाम of the Abbey featured in the book and the name of an animated TV series based on three of the novels ( Redwall, Mattimeo, and Martin the योद्धा ), जिससे first aired in 1999.
The books are primarily aimed at older children, but have fans of all ages.
There have been twenty-two novels and दो picture books published.
The twenty-second, और final, novel, The Rogue Crew, was posthumously released on May 3, 2011.
Natural Gas is usually measured by volume in the United States and is stated in cubic feet.
A cubic foot of gas is the amount of गैस needed to fill a volume of one cubic foot under set conditions of pressure and temperature.To measure larger amounts of natural gas, a `` therm '' is used to denote 100 cubic feet, and `` mcf '' is used to denote 1,000 cubic feet.
to provide greater सटीकता in comparing fuels, energy content is measured in terms of `` British Thermal Units ( BTU 's ). ''
a BTU is the amount of heat जरूरी to उठाएँ one pound of water ( approximately a pint ), one degree Fahrenheit at or close to इसके point of maximum density.
एक British therm ( symbol thm ) is a non- SI unit of heat energy equal to 100,000 British thermal units ( btu ).
It is approximately the energy equivalent of burning 100 घन feet ( often referred to as 1 CCF ) of प्राकृतिक gas.
Since ( Natural Gas ) meters measure volume and not energy content, a therm factor is used by ( प्राकृतिक ) gas companies to convert the volume of gas used to इसके heat equivalent, और thus calculate the actual energy use.
The therm factor is usually in the units therms/CCF.
It will vary with the mix of hydrocarbons in the natural gas.
Natural gas with a higher than average concentration of इथेन, propane or butane will have a higher therm factor.
Impurities, such as कार्बन dioxide or nitrogen, lower the therm factor.
The volume of the gas is गणना as if measured at standard temperature and pressure ( STP ).
the heat content of natural gas is solely dependent on the composition of the gas, and is independent of temperature and दबाव.
One therm is equal to about 105.5 megajoules, 25,200 kilocalories or 29.3 kilowatt-hours.
एक therm can भी be provided by about of natural gas.
the therm sometimes has been confused with the thermie ( see below ).
The names of both units come from the Greek word for heat.
A thermie ( th ) is a metric unit of heat energy, part of the meter-tonne-second system sometimes used by European engineers.
the thermie is equal to the राशि of energy required to raise the temperature of 1 tonne of water by 1 °C.
The thermie is equivalent to 1,000 kilocalories, 4.1868 megajoules or 3968.3 BTU.
The American Civil War ( ACW ), also known as the War between the States or simply the Civil War ( see नामकरण ), was a civil war fought from 1861 to 1865 between the United States ( the `` Union '' or the `` North '' ) and several Southern slave राज्य that declared their secession and formed the Confederate States of America ( the `` Confederacy '' or the `` South '' ).
The war had its origin in the issue of slavery, especially the एक्सटेंशन of slavery into the पश्चिमी territories.
Foreign powers did not intervene.
After four सालो of bloody combat that left over 600,000 soldiers dead and destroyed much of the South 's infrastructure, the Confederacy collapsed, slavery was abolished, and the difficult Reconstruction process of restoring national unity और guaranteeing rights to the freed slaves began.
In the 1860 presidential चुनाव, Republicans, led by Abraham Lincoln, opposed expanding slavery into United राज्य ' territories.
lincoln won, but before his inauguration on March 4, 1861, seven cotton-based slave states formed the Confederacy.
Outgoing Democratic President James Buchanan and the incoming Republicans rejected secession as illegal.
Lincoln 's inaugural address declared his administration would not initiate civil war.
Eight remaining slave states continued to अस्वीकृत calls for secession.
Confederate forces seized numerous federal forts within territory claimed by the Confederacy.
A Peace सम्मेलन failed to find a compromise, और both sides prepared for युद्ध.
The Confederates assumed that European countries were so dependent on `` King Cotton `` that they would intervene ; none did and none recognized the new Confederate States of America.
Hostilities began on April 12, 1861, when Confederate forces fired upon Fort sumter, a key fort held by Union troops in South कैरोलिना.
Lincoln called for each state to provide troops to retake the fort ; consequently, four more slave states joined the Confederacy, bringing their total to eleven.
The Union soon controlled the border states and established a naval blockade that crippled the southern economy.
The Eastern Theater was inconclusive in 1861–62.
The autumn 1862 Confederate campaign into Maryland ( a Union state ) ended with Confederate retreat at the Battle of Antietam, dissuading British intervention.
Lincoln issued the emancipation Proclamation, which made ending slavery a war goal.
To the west, by गर्मियाँ 1862 the Union destroyed the Confederate river navy, then much of their western armies, and the Union at Vicksburg split the Confederacy in दो at the Mississippi नदी.
In 1863, रॉबर्ट E. Lee 's confederate incursion north ended at the Battle of Gettysburg.
Western successes led to ulysses S. Grant command of all Union armies in 1864.
In the Western Theater, William T. शरमन drove east to capture Atlanta and marched to the sea, destroying confederate infrastructure along the way.
The Union marshaled the resources and manpower to attack the Confederacy from all directions, and could afford to fight battles of attrition through the Overland Campaign towards Richmond, the Confederate capital.
The defending confederate army failed, leading to Lee 's surrender to Grant at Appomattox Court House on अप्रैल 9, 1865.
The American Civil War was one of the earliest true industrial युद्धों.
Railroads, the telegraph, steamships, and mass-produced weapons यहूद employed extensively.
The mobilization of civilian factories, खानों, shipyards, banks, transportation and food supplies सब foreshadowed World War I.
It remains the deadliest war in American history, resulting in the deaths of an estimated 750,000 soldiers and an undetermined number of civilian casualties.
Historian John Huddleston estimates the death toll at ten percent of all Northern males 20–45 years old, and 30 percent of all Southern white males aged 18–40.
विलियम Bruce Jenner ( born October 28, 1949 ) is a former U.S. track और field खिलाड़ी, motivational speaker, socialite, television personality and businessman.
He won the gold medal for decathlon in the Montreal 1976 Summer Olympics.
Following his Olympic win and the related recognition, he शादीशुदा Kris Kardashian, and his professional career evolved into being a television celebrity.
By 1981, he had starred in अनेक made-for-TV movies and was Erik Estrada 's replacement on the top रेटेड TV series CHiPs.
He रै six children : Burt, Casey, Brandon, Brody, Kendall and Kylie.
Since his 1991 marriage to Kris जेनर, he is the stepfather to Kourtney, Kim, Khloe and Rob Kardashian.
Since 2007, he has appeared with his blended family on Keeping Up with the kardashians.
escherichia coli ( ; commonly abbreviated E. coli ) is a Gram-negative, rod-shaped bacterium that is commonly found in the lower intestine of warm-blooded organisms ( endotherms ).
Most E. coli strains are harmless, लकिन some serotypes can cause serious food poisoning in humans, and are occasionally responsible for product recalls due to food contamination.
The harmless strains are part of the normal flora of the gut, और can benefit their hosts by producing vitamin K2, and by preventing the establishment of pathogenic bacteria within the intestine.
E. coli and related जीवाणु constitute about 0.1 % of gut flora, and fecal–oral transmission is the major रूट through which pathogenic strains of the bacterium cause disease.
Cells are able to survive outside the body for a limited amount of time, जिससे makes them ideal indicator organisms to test environmental samples लिये fecal contamination.
There is, however, a growing body of research that has examined environmentally persistent E. coli which can survive for extended periods outside of the host.
The bacterium can also be grown easily and inexpensively in a laboratory setting, and has been intensively investigated for over 60 years.
E. coli is the most widely studied prokaryotic model organism, and an important species in the fields of biotechnology and microbiology, where it has परोसा as the host organism for the majority of work with recombinant DNA.
Area कोड 217 is the North American telephone area कोड for much of western and central Illinois.
The 217 area शामिल Illinois ' capital, Springfield, plus Champaign, Urbana, Decatur, danville, Quincy, और Rantoul.
217 was एक of the original area codes, which were created in 1947.
The only significant change in 217 's boundaries was in 1957, when its northern portion was combined with part of क्षेत्रफल code 815 to form area code 309.
Image of the largest Antarctic ozone hole ever recorded ( September 2006 ), over the Southern pole
Layers of the माहौल ( not to scale )
Ozone depletion describes two distinct but related phenomena observed since the late 1970s : a steady decline of about 4 % प्रति decade in the total volume of ozone in Earth 's stratosphere ( the ozone layer ), and a much larger springtime decrease in stratospheric ozone over Earth 's polar regions.
The latter phenomenon is referred to as the ozone hole.
In addition to these well-known stratospheric phenomena, there are also springtime ध्रुवीय tropospheric ozone depletion events.
The details of polar ozone hole गठन differ from that of mid-latitude thinning, लकिन the most important process in both is catalytic destruction of ozone by atomic halogens.
The main source of these halogen atoms in the stratosphere is photodissociation of man-made halocarbon refrigerants ( CFCs, freons, halons ).
These compounds हैं transported into the stratosphere बाद being emitted at the surface.
Both types of ozone depletion were observed to increase as emissions of halo-carbons increased.
CFCs and other contributory substances are referred to as ozone-depleting substances ( ODS ).
Since the ozone layer prevents most नुकसानदेह UVB wavelengths ( 280–315 nm ) of पराबैंगनी light ( UV light ) from गुजर through the Earth 's atmosphere, observed and projected decreases in ozone have generated worldwide concern leading to adoption of the Montreal Protocol that bans the उत्पादन of CFCs, halons, and other ozone-depleting chemicals such as carbon tetrachloride and trichloroethane.
It is suspected that a variety of biological consequences such as increases in skin cancer, cataracts, damage to plants, and reduction of plankton populations in the ocean 's photic zone may result from the increased UV exposure due to ozone depletion.
The Preamble to the United States Constitution is a brief introductory statement of the Constitution 's fundamental purposes and guiding principles.
It states in general terms, और न्यायालयों have referred to it as reliable evidence of, the Founding Fathers ' इरादों regarding the Constitution 's meaning and कया they hoped the Constitution would achieve as it pertains to all of the people of the United States.
As the phrase, `` we the लोगों '' suggests that the नई government originates इससे the लोगों of the United States and it sets into motion a question as it pertains to that vast जनसांख्यिकी concerning the individual rights and equality among all people ; this can be seen most broadly in the divide between republicanism and social democracy.
