The shot put ( pronounced ) is a track and field event involving `` throwing '' / '' putting '' ( throwing in a pushing गति ) a heavy spherical object —the shot—as far as possible.
The shot put competition लिये men has been a part of the modern Olympics since उनके पुनरुद्धार in 1896, women 's competition began in 1948.
Map of the United Nations ( UN ) member states, with their territories ( including dependent territories ) recognized by the UN in blue
There are United राष्ट्र ( UN ) member states, and each of them is a member of the United Nations General Assembly.
The criteria for admission of new members are set out in the United Nations Charter, Chapter II, Article 4:
A recommendation for admission from the Security Council requires affirmative votes from at least nine of the council 's fifteen members, with none of the five permanent members voting against.
The Security Council 's recommendation must then be subsequently approved in the General Assembly by a two-thirds majority vote.
In principle, तभी sovereign states can become UN members, and currently all UN members are sovereign राज्य ( although a few members were not sovereign when they joined the UN ).
Because a state can only be admitted to the un by the approval of the Security Council and the General Assembly, a number of states that may be considered sovereign states according to the Montevideo Convention criteria हैं not members because the UN does not consider them to possess sovereignty, mainly due to the lack of international recognition or opposition इससे certain members.
In addition to the member states, the UN also invites non-member states ( currently two : the Holy See and फिलिस्तीन ), intergovernmental organizations, and other international organizations और entities whose statehood or sovereignty are नहीं precisely defined, to become observers at the General सभा, allowing them to participate and speak, but not vote, in General Assembly meetings.
The Eiffel Tower (, ) is an iron lattice tower located on the Champ de Mars in Paris, named after the इंजीनियर Gustave Eiffel, whose company designed and built the tower.
Erected in 1889 as the प्रवेश arch to the 1889 World 's Fair, it has become both a global cultural प्रतीक of France and one of the सबसे recognizable structures in the world.
The tower is the tallest structure in Paris and the most-visited paid monument in the world ; 7.1 million people ascended it in 2011.
The third level observatory 's upper platform is at the highest accessible to public in the European Union and the उच्चतम in यूरोपीय as long as the platform of the Ostankino Tower, at, remains closed as a result of the fire of August 2000.
The tower received इसके 250 millionth visitor in 2010.
The tower stands tall, about the same height as an 81-storey building.
During its construction, the Eiffel Tower surpassed the Washington Monument to assume the title of the tallest man-made structure in the world, a title it held for 41 years, until the Chrysler Building in New York City was built in 1930.
क्युकी of the addition, in 1957, of the एंटीना atop the Eiffel Tower, it is अभी taller than the क्रिसलर भवन.
Not including broadcast antennas, it is the second-tallest ढांचा in France, after the Millau Viaduct.
the मीनार रै तीन levels for विज़िटर.
Tickets can be खरीदा to ascend, by stairs or lift ( elevator ), to the first और second levels.
The walk from ground level to the first level is over 300 steps, as is the चलना from the first to the second level.
The third and highest level is accessible only by lift—stairs do exist but are usually closed to the public.
The first and second levels have रेस्तरां.
The tower रै become the most prominent प्रतीक of both Paris and फ़्रांस, often in the establishing shot of films set in the city.
Kenneth Wayne `` Ken '' Jennings III ( born May 23, 1974 ) is an American game दिखाएँ contestant and author.
Jennings is noted for holding the रिकार्ड for the longest winning streak on the U.S. syndicated खेल show Jeopardy !
and as being the all-time leading money winner on American game shows.
In 2004, Jennings won 74 Jeopardy !
games before he was defeated by challenger Nancy Zerg on his 75th appearance.
उसके total earnings on Jeopardy !
are $ 3,172,700, consisting of $ 2,520,700 over his 74 विन्स, a $ 2,000 second-place prize in his 75th appearance, a $ 500,000 second-place prize in the Jeopardy !
परम Tournament of champions, as well as half of a $ 300,000 prize in the IBM Challenge.
During his first run of jeopardy !
appearances, जेनिंग्स earned the record for the highest American game show winnings.
His total was surpassed by ब्रैड Rutter, who defeated Jennings in the finals of the Jeopardy !
Ultimate Tournament of Champions ( first aired on May 25, 2005 ), adding $ 2,000,000 to Rutter 's existing jeopardy !
winnings.
Jennings regained the record after appearing on several अन्य game shows, culminating in an appearance on Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader ?
( first aired on October 10, 2008 ), though Rutter retains the Jeopardy !
record.
After his success on Jeopardy !, Jennings wrote about his experience and explored American trivia history and culture in his book Brainiac : adventures in the Curious, Competitive, Compulsive World of Trivia Buffs, published in 2006.
The Canadian Football League or CFL ( ' [ LCF ] in French ) is a professional sports league located in Canada.
The CFL is the highest level of competition in Canadian football, a form of gridiron फ़ुटबॉल closely related to American football.
Its eight current teams, जिससे are located in eight पृथक cities, are विभाजित into two divisions of four teams each — the East Division and the West Division.
The league 's 19-week regular season runs from late June to early November ; each team plays 18 games with one bye week.
Following the regular season, the तीन teams with the best records in their division ( except if the fourth place team in एक division has a better record than the third place team in the other प्रभाग, when the team with the better record makes the playoffs and `` crosses over '' to the other division 's playoff ) compete in the league 's three-week डिवीजनल playoffs, which culminate in the late-November Grey कप championship, the country 's largest annual sports and television event.
the cfl was officially founded on January 19, 1958, making it the second oldest gridiron football league in North America स्टिल in operation, although all its teams long predate the modern formation of the league.
it is the highest level of play in Canadian फ़ुटबॉल, the most popular फ़ुटबॉल league in Canada, and the second-most popular major sports league in Canada, after the National Hockey League.
Although ice hockey is Canada 's most popular sport, the CFL has increased the popularity of Canadian football in Quebec और Western कनाडा.
Canadian football is also played at amateur levels ( i.e. youth, high school, CJFL, QJFL, CIS and senior leagues such as the अलबर्टा Football League ).
The 2010s will be a significant decade लिये the CFL in terms of growth, as teams have renovated, विस्तारित स्टेडियम, or plan to build entirely new stadiums.
The Montreal Alouettes accomplished this first, adding 5,000 seats to Percival Molson Memorial Stadium in समय for the 2010 CFL season.
The Edmonton Eskimos and Calgary Stampeders also renovated their respective स्टेडियम and facilities for the 2010 season.
In 2011, the BC शेर played अंतर्गत a new, retractable roof in BC Place after spending one and a half seasons at साम्राज्य Field.
Then the Winnipeg ब्लू Bombers will play in an entirely new stadium at the University of Manitoba, अनुसूचित to open in time for the 2013 season.
The Hamilton Tiger-Cats, Saskatchewan roughriders and the new Ottawa franchise हैं also looking at new or extensively-renovated stadiums in the following years.
वहीँ are also उम्मीदें of expanding the league to Atlantic Canada ( ideally basing a टोली in either the more populated Halifax, or the more centralized Moncton ), as 2010 and 2011 had regular season games hosted in Moncton.
According to sports historian डगलस Brei, the Canadian Football League holds the distinction of होने the only professional sports league in North America, major or minor league, in which each मौजूदा franchise has won at least one league title while in their current location.
Each antibody binds to a विशिष्ट antigen ; an interaction similar to a lock and key.
An antibody ( Ab ), also known as an immunoglobulin ( Ig ), is a large Y-shaped protein produced by b-cells that is used by the immune system to identify and neutralize foreign objects such as bacteria and viruses.
The antibody recognizes a unique part of the foreign target, called an antigen.
Each tip of the `` Y '' of an antibody contains a paratope ( a structure analogous to a lock ) that is specific for one particular epitope ( similarly analogous to a key ) on an antigen, allowing these two structures to bind together with precision.
Using this binding mechanism, an antibody can tag a microbe or an infected कोशिका for आक्रमण by other parts of the immune system, or can neutralize its target directly ( for example, by blocking a भाग of a microbe that is essential for its invasion and अस्तित्व ).
The production of antibodies is the main function of the humoral immune system.
Antibodies are secreted by a प्रकार of white blood cell called a प्लाज्मा cell.
Antibodies can occur in two physical forms, a soluble form that is secreted from the cell, and a membrane -bound form that is attached to the surface of a b कोशिका and is referred to as the B कोशिका receptor ( BCR ).
The BCR is only found on the surface of B cells and facilitates the activation of these cells and उनके subsequent differentiation into either antibody factories called plasma cells, or memory B cells that will survive in the body and remember that same antigen so the B cells can respond faster upon future exposure.
In most cases, interaction of the B कोशिका with a T helper cell is necessary to produce full activation of the B cell and, therefore, antibody generation following antigen binding.
Soluble antibodies are released into the blood and tissue fluids, as well as many secretions to continue to survey लिये invading microorganisms.
Antibodies are glycoproteins belonging to the immunoglobulin superfamily ; the terms antibody and immunoglobulin हैं often used interchangeably.
Antibodies are typically made of basic structural units—each with two large heavy chains and two small light chains.
There are several different प्रकार of एंटीबॉडी heavy chains, and several different kinds of antibodies, which are grouped into different isotypes based on which heavy chain they possess.
Five different antibody isotypes are known in mammals, which perform different roles, and help सीधा the appropriate immune response लिये each different type of foreign object they encounter.
Though the general structure of all antibodies is बहुत समान, a small region at the tip of the protein is extremely variable, allowing millions of antibodies with slightly different tip structures, or antigen binding sites, to exist.
This region is known as the hypervariable region.
Each of these variants can bind to a different antigen.
This enormous diversity of antibodies allows the immune system to recognize an equally wide variety of antigens.
The large and diverse population of antibodies is generated by random combinations of a set of जीन segments that encode different antigen binding sites ( or paratopes ), followed by random mutations in इस area of the एंटीबॉडी gene, which create further diversity.
Antibody जीनों also re-organize in a process पुकारा class switching that changes the base of the heavy chain to another, creating a different isotype of the antibody that retains the antigen specific परिवर्तनीय region.
This allows a single antibody to be used by several different parts of the immune system.
The symbol used by the Zodiac Killer to sign his correspondence
The Zodiac Killer was a सीरियल killer who operated in Northern California in the लेट 1960s and जल्दी 1970s.
The killer 's identity remains unknown.
The Zodiac murdered victims in Benicia, Vallejo, Lake Berryessa, and सैन Francisco between December 1968 and October 1969.
Four men and three महिलाओं between the आयु of 16 and 29 were targeted.
The killer originated the name `` Zodiac '' in a series of taunting letters भेजा to the लोकल खाड़ी Area press.
These letters included four cryptograms ( or ciphers ).
Of the four cryptograms sent, only one has been definitively solved.
Suspects have been named by law enforcement and amateur जांचकर्ताओं, but no conclusive evidence has surfaced.
In April 2004, the San Francisco Police Department चिह्नित the case `` inactive '', yet re-opened the case at some point prior to March 2007.
The case also remains open in the city of Vallejo, as well as in Napa County and Solano County.
The California विभाग of Justice has maintained an open case संचिका on the zodiac murders since 1969.
Jennings is a small city in and the parish seat of Jefferson Davis Parish, louisiana, United States, near Lake Charles.
The population was 10,383 at the 2010 census, a small मनाही इससे the 2000 tabulation.
The city is 68 percent white.
Jennings is the प्रिंसिपल city of the Jennings Micropolitan सांख्यिकीय Area, which includes all of Jefferson Davis Parish.
It is also part of the larger Lake Charles-Jennings Combined Statistical Area.
Nanotechnology ( sometimes shortened to `` nanotech '' ) is the manipulation of matter on an atomic and molecular scale.
the earliest, widespread description of nanotechnology referred to the particular technological goal of precisely manipulating atoms और molecules for fabrication of macroscale products, also now referred to as molecular nanotechnology.
A more generalized वर्णन of nanotechnology was subsequently established by the National Nanotechnology Initiative, which defines nanotechnology as the हेरफेर of matter with at least one आयाम sized from 1 to 100 nanometers.
इस definition reflects the fact that quantum mechanical प्रभाव are important at this quantum-realm scale, and so the definition shifted from a particular technological goal to a शोध category inclusive of all types of शोध and technologies that सौदे with the special properties of matter that occur below the given size threshold.
It is therefore common to see the plural रूप `` nanotechnologies '' as well as `` nanoscale technologies '' to refer to the broad range of research और applications whose आम trait is size.
Because of the variety of potential अनुप्रयोग ( including industrial and military ), governments have invested billions of dollars in nanotechnology शोध.
Through its National Nanotechnology Initiative, the USA has invested 3.7 billion dollars.
The European Union has invested 1.2 billion and Japan 750 million dollars.
Nanotechnology as defined by size is naturally very broad, including fields of विज्ञान as diverse as surface science, organic chemistry, molecular biology, semiconductor physics, microfabrication, etc.
The associated research and applications are equally diverse, ranging from एक्सटेंशन of conventional device physics to completely new approaches based upon molecular self-assembly, from developing new materials साथ dimensions on the nanoscale to direct control of matter on the atomic scale.
Scientists currently debate the future implications of nanotechnology.
Nanotechnology may be able to create many new materials और devices with a vast range of applications, such as in आयुर्विज्ञान, electronics, biomaterials and energy production.
On the other हाथ, nanotechnology उठाता many of the same issues as any नई technology, including concerns about the toxicity and environmental impact of nanomaterials, and their potential effects on global economics, as well as speculation about various doomsday scenarios.
These concerns have led to a debate among advocacy groups and governments on whether special regulation of nanotechnology is warranted.
Map of the Eastern Bloc
The term Eastern Bloc or कम्युनिस्ट Bloc refers to the former communist states of Central and Eastern यूरोपीय, generally the Soviet संघ and the countries of the Warsaw Pact.
the terms Communist Bloc and Soviet Bloc were also used to denote groupings of states aligned with the Soviet Union, although these terms might include states outside Central and Eastern Europe.
The New Jersey gubernatorial election of 2009 took place on November 3, 2009.
Democratic Governor Jon Corzine was running for a second term and was being challenged by Republican क्रिस Christie, Independent Christopher daggett and नौ others, in addition to several write-in candidates.
Christie won the election, with about 48.5 percent of the vote, to 44.9 percent लिये Corzine and 5.8 percent for daggett.
Christie won the largest margin for a first term रिपब्लिकन since 1969.
क्रिस्टी assumed office on January 19, 2010.
This was the first election to fill the newly created office of Lieutenant Governor.
The candidates for governor and lieutenant governor were joined together as a single choice, so that voters did not have the अवसर to split the ticket.
Kim Guadagno, Christie 's running mate, became New Jersey 's first lieutenant governor following her inauguration.
Health care in the United States is provided by many distinct organizations.
Health care facilities are largely owned and operated by private sector businesses.
Health बीमे for public sector कर्मचारी is primarily provided by the government.
60-65 % of healthcare प्रावधान and spending comes from programs such as Medicare, Medicaid, TRICARE, the Children 's Health Insurance Program, and the Veterans Health Administration.
सबसे of the population under 65 is insured by their or a family member 's employer, some buy health insurance on their own, and the remainder are uninsured.
Of 17 high-income countries studied by the National Institutes of Health in 2013, the United States was at or near the bottom in infant mortality, heart and lung disease, sexually transmitted infections, adolescent pregnancies, injuries, homicides, और दरों of disability.
Together, such issues place the u.S. at the bottom of the list for life प्रत्याशा.
On average, a U.S. male can be expected to live almost four fewer years than those in the top-ranked country.
According to the World Health Organization ( WHO ), the United States spent more on health care per capita ( $ 7,146 ), and more on health care as percentage of its GDP ( 15.2 % ), than any other nation in 2008.
The Commonwealth निधि ranked the United States last in the quality of health परवाह among similar countries, and टीप U.S. care costs the most.
the U.S. Census Bureau reported कि 49.9 million residents, 16.3 % of the population, यहूद uninsured in 2010 ( up from 49.0 million residents, 16.1 % of the population, in 2009 ).
A 2004 Institute of Medicine ( IOM ) report said : `` The United States is among the few industrialized nations in the world that does not guarantee access to health care लिये its population. ''
A 2004 OECD report said : `` With the exception of Mexico, Turkey, and the United States, all OECD countries had achieved universal or near-universal ( at least 98.4 % insured ) coverage of their populations by 1990. ''
A 2010 report observed that lack of health बीमे causes roughly 48,000 unnecessary deaths every year in the United States.
In 2007, 62.1 % of filers for bankruptcies claimed high medical expenses.
A 2013 study found that about 25 % of all senior citizens declare bankruptcy due to medical expenses, and 43 % are forced to mortgage or sell their प्राथमिक residence.
On March 23, 2010, the Patient Protection और Affordable Care Act ( PPACA ) became law, providing लिये major परिवर्तन in health insurance.
in physiology, body water is the water content of the human body.
A significant fraction of the human देह is water.
Arthur Guyton 's textbook of Medical physiology states that `` the total amount of water in a man of average weight ( 70 kilograms ) is approximately 40 litres, averaging 57 percent of his total body weight.
In a newborn infant, this may be as high as 75 percent of the देह weight, but it progressively decreases from birth to बूढ़ा age, most of the decrease occurring during the first 10 years of life.
Also, obesity decreases the percentage of water in the body, sometimes to as कम as 45 percent ''.
These figures are statistical averages, so are illustrative, and like all biostatistics, will vary with things like type of population, age and number of people sampled, and methodology.
So there is not, and can not be, a figure that is exactly the same for all people, for this or any other physiological measure.
For example, Jackson 's ( 1985 ) Anatomy & Physiology for Nurses gives a figure of 60 % for the proportion of body-weight attributable to water, which approximates Guyton 's 57 %.
In diseased states where body water is प्रभावित, the compartment or compartments that have changed can give clues to the nature of the problem.
Body water is regulated by hormones, including anti-diuretic hormone ( ADH ), aldosterone and atrial natriuretic peptide.
Per Netter 's Atlas of Human Physiology, body water is broken down into the following compartments:
intracellular fluid ( 2/3 of देह water ).
Per Guyton, in a body containing 40 litres of fluid, परिचय 25 litres is intracellular, which amounts to 62.5 % ( 5/8 ), close enough to the 2/3 rule of thumb.
Jackson 's texts states 70 % of body fluid is intracellular.
Extracellular fluid ( 1/3 of body water ).
Per Guyton 's illustration, for a 40 litre body, about 15 litres is extracellular, which amounts to 37.5 % Again, this is close to the 1/3 rule of thumb cited here.
Plasma ( 1/5 of extracellular fluid ).
Per Guyton 's illustration, of the 15 litres of extracellular fluid, plasma volume averages 3 litres.
This amounts to 20 %, the same as per Netter 's Atlas.
अंतरालीय fluid ( 4/5 of extracellular fluid )
Transcellular fluid ( a.k.a. `` तीसरा space, '' normally ignored in calculations )
contained inside organs, such as the gastrointestinal, cerebrospinal, peritoneal, and ocular fluids.
Self-esteem is a term used in psychology to reflect a person 's overall emotional मूल्यांकन of his or her own worth.
It is a judgement of oneself as well as an attitude toward the self.
Self-esteem encompasses beliefs ( लिये example, `` I am competent, '' `` I am worthy '' ) and emotions such as triumph, despair, pride और शर्म.
Smith and Mackie define it by saying `` The self-concept is what we think about the स्वः ; self-esteem, is the positive or negative evaluations of the self, as in how we feel परिचय it. ''
Self-esteem is भी known as the evaluative dimension of the self that includes feelings of worthiness, prides and discouragement.
One 's self-esteem is also closely associated with self-consciousness.
Self-esteem is a disposition that a person has which represents their judgements of their own worthiness.
In the mid-1960s, Morris Rosenberg and social-learning theorists defined self-esteem as a personal worth or worthiness.
nathaniel Branden in 1969 defined self-esteem as `` the experience of being competent to cope with the basic challenges of life and being worthy of happiness. ''
according to Branden, self-esteem is the sum of self-confidence ( a feeling of personal क्षमता ) and self-respect ( a feeling of personal worth ).
It exists as a consequence of the implicit निर्णय that every person has of their क्षमता to face life 's challenges, to समझे and solve problems, and their right to achieve happiness, and be दिए आदर.
As a social मनोवैज्ञानिक construct, self-esteem is attractive because researchers have conceptualized it as an influential predictor of relevant outcomes, such as academic achievement ( Marsh 1990 ) or exercise behavior ( hagger et al. 1998 ).
In addition, self-esteem has भी been treated as an important outcome due to its close relation साथ psychological well-being ( Marsh 1989 ).
Self-esteem can apply specifically to a particular dimension ( for example, `` I believe I am a good लेखक and I feel happy about that '' ) or a global extent ( for example, `` I believe I am a bad person, and महसूस bad about myself in general '' ).
Psychologists प्रायः regard self-esteem as an enduring personality characteristic ( `` trait '' self-esteem ), though सामान्य, short-term variations ( `` state '' self-esteem ) also exist.
Synonyms or near-synonyms of self-esteem include : self-worth, self-regard, self-respect, and self-integrity.
A Masonic Lodge, often termed a Private Lodge or Constituent Lodge, is the basic organisational unit of Freemasonry.
Every new Lodge must be warranted or चार्टर्ड by a Grand Lodge, but is subject to its दिशा only in enforcing the published Constitution of the jurisdiction.
By exception the three surviving lodges that formed the संसार 's पहला known Grand Lodge in London ( today called the United Grand Lodge of England ) have the unique privilege to operate as time immemorial i.e. without such warrant ; only one other lodge operates without a warrant - this is the Grand Stewards ' Lodge in London, although it is not भी entitled to the `` time immemorial '' शीर्षक.
A Freemason is generally entitled to visit any Lodge, in any jurisdiction ( i.e. under any Grand Lodge ) in amity with his own.
In some jurisdictions this privilege is restricted to Master Masons ( that is, Freemasons who have attained the Order 's third degree ).
He is first usually required to check, and certify, the regularity of the relationship of the Lodge - and be able to satisfy that Lodge of उसके regularity of membership.
Freemasons gather together as a Lodge to work the three basic Degrees of Entered Apprentice, Fellowcraft and Master मेसन.
Pilkington Group Limited is a multinational glass manufacturing company headquartered in St Helens, United Kingdom and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Japan-based NSG Group.
Prior to its acquisition by NSG in 2006 it was an independent company listed on the London Stock Exchange and for a time was a constituent of the FTSE 100 Index.
a quotation is the repetition of one expression as part of another one, particularly when the quoted expression is well-known or explicitly attributed by citation to its original source, and it is indicated by ( punctuated with ) quotation marks.
A quotation can also refer to the दोहराया use of units of any other form of expression, especially parts of artistic works : elements of a painting, scenes from a movie or sections from a musical composition.
Year 1877 ( MDCCCLXXVII ) was a common year starting on Monday ( link होगा display the full calendar ) of the Gregorian calendar and a common year starting on Saturday of the 12-day slower Julian पंचांग.
Black pepper ( Piper nigrum ) is a flowering vine in the family Piperaceae, cultivated for its fruit, which is usually सूखी and used as a spice and seasoning.
The फल, known as a peppercorn when dried, is approximately in व्यास, dark red when fully mature, and, like all drupes, contains a single seed.
Peppercorns, and the ground pepper derived from them, may be described simply as pepper, or more precisely as ब्लैक pepper ( cooked and dried unripe fruit ), green pepper ( dried unripe fruit ) and white pepper ( dried ripe seeds ).
Black pepper is native to south India, and is extensively cultivated there and elsewhere in tropical regions.
Currently Vietnam is the world 's largest producer and निर्यातक of pepper, producing 34 % of the world 's Piper nigrum crop as of 2008.
Dried ground pepper has been used since antiquity for दोनो its flavour and as a medicine.
Black pepper is the world 's सबसे traded spice.
It is one of the most common spices added to European cuisine and its descendants.
The spiciness of black pepper is due to the chemical piperine, not to be confused with the capsaicin that gives fleshy peppers theirs.
It is in the modern world, often paired with salt.
Fire hydrant in Charlottesville, Virginia, USA
A fire hydrant ( also known colloquially as a fire plug in the United States or as a johnny pump in New York City ), is an active fire protection measure, and a source of water provided in most urban, suburban and rural areas with municipal जल सेवा to enable firefighters to tap into the municipal water supply to assist in extinguishing a fire.
Buildings near a hydrant may qualify for an insurance discount since अग्निशमन should be समर्थ to more rapidly extinguish a fire on the insured property.
The concept of fire plugs dates to at least the 17th century.
इस was a time when firefighters responding to a call would dig down to the wooden water mains and hastily bore a hole to secure water to fight fires.
The water would भरण the hole creating a temporary well, and be transported from the well to the fire by bucket brigades or, later, by hand-pumped आग engines.
The holes यहूद then plugged साथ stoppers, normally redwood, which over time came to be known as fire plugs.
The location of the plug would प्रायः be recorded or marked so that it could be reused in future fires.
This is the source of the colloquial term आग plug still used for fire hydrants today.
After the Great आग of London in 1666, the नगर installed water mains with holes drilled at intervals, equipped with risers, allowing an access point to the wooden fire plugs from street level.
The invention of a post- or pillar-type fire hydrant is generally credited to Frederick Graff sr., Chief Engineer of the Philadelphia Water Works around the year 1801.
It had a combination hose/faucet आउटलेट and was of `` wet बैरल '' design साथ the valve in the top.
It is said that graff held the first patent for a fire hydrant, but this can not be verified क्युकी the patent office in Washington D.C. caught on fire in 1836 destroying अनेक पेटेंट रिकॉर्ड from that period in the process.
the President of the Republic of South Africa is the head of state and head of सरकारी under South Africa 's Constitution.
इससे 1961 to 1994, the head of state was called the State President.
The President is elected by members of the National Assembly, the lower house of Parliament, and is usually the नेता of the largest party, जिससे has been the African National Congress since the first non-racial elections were आयोजित on 27 अप्रैल 1994.
The role was originally founded to be distinct from the now defunct role of prime minister, but the two roles were merged in the 1983 constitution which specified a four-year पद of office.
The 1993 and later constitutions limits the president 's time in office to two five-year terms.
The first President to be elected under the new संविधान was Nelson Mandela, and the incumbent president is याक़ूब zuma.
Under the interim Constitution ( valid from 1994 to 1996 ), there was a Government of National Unity, in जिससे an MP from the largest opposition party was entitled to a position as Deputy President.
Along with Thabo Mbeki, the last State President, F.W. De Klerk also served as Deputy President, in his capacity as the leader of the National Party which was the second-largest party in the new पार्लियामेंट.
But De Klerk later resigned and went into opposition with his party.
A voluntary coalition government continues to exist under the new constitution ( adopted in 1996 ), although there have been no appointments of opposition politicians to the post of deputy president.
Special education or special needs education is the education of students with special needs in a रास्ता that addresses the students ' व्यक्तिगत differences and needs.
Ideally, this process involves the individually planned and systematically monitored arrangement of teaching प्रक्रियाओं, adapted equipment and materials, accessible settings, and other interventions designed to help learners with special needs achieve a higher level of personal self-sufficiency and success in school और community than would be available if the छात्र यहूद only given access to a ठेठ classroom education.
आम special needs include challenges with learning, संचार challenges, emotional and behavioral disorders, शारीरिक disabilities, and developmental disorders.
Students with these kinds of special needs are likely to benefit from additional educational services such as different approaches to teaching, उपयोग of technology, a specifically adapted teaching क्षेत्रफल, or संसाधन room.
Intellectual giftedness is a अंतर in learning and can also benefit from specialized teaching techniques or different educational programs, but the term `` special education '' is generally used to specifically indicate instruction of students whose special needs reduce their ability to learn independently or in an ordinary classroom, and gifted education is handled separately.
In most विकसित countries, educators are modifying शिक्षण methods and environments so that the अधिकतम क्रमांक of students are served in general education environments.
खास education in developed countries is often regarded less as a `` place '' and अधिक as `` a range of services, available in every school. ''
Integration can reduce social stigmas and improve academic achievement for many students.
The opposite of special education is general education.
General education is the standard curriculum presented with standard teaching विधि and without additional supports.
George Soros ( or ; ; ; born August 12, 1930, as Schwartz György ) is a Hungarian-American business magnate, निवेशकों, and philanthropist.
He is the chairman of Soros Fund Management.
Soros supports progressive-liberal causes.
He is known as `` The Man Who Broke the बैंको of England `` because of his in investment profits during the 1992 Black Wednesday uk currency crisis.
Between 1979 and 2011, Soros gave दूर over $ 8 billion to human rights, public health, and education causes.
He played a significant role in the peaceful transition from communism to capitalism in Hungary ( 1984–89 ) and provided one of Europe 's largest higher education endowments to Central European University in Budapest.
Soros is also the अध्यक्ष of the Open Society संस्थान.
An actor portraying Alexander ग्राहम Bell speaking into an early model telephone.
The invention of the telephone is the culmination of work done by अनेक individuals, the history of which involves a संग्रहण of claims and counterclaims.
The development of the modern electrical telephone involved an array of lawsuits founded upon the patent claims of several individuals and numerous companies.
This article covers the early years from 1844 to 1898, from conception of the idea of an इलेक्ट्रिक voice-transmission device, to failed attempts to use `` make-and-break '' current, to successful experiments with electromagnetic telephones by Alexander ग्राहम Bell and थामस Watson, और finally to commercially successful telephones in the late 19th century.
A निपुण of Fine Arts ( MFA, M.F.A. ) is a graduate degree typically requiring 2–3 years of postgraduate study beyond the bachelor 's degree ( BFA ), although the term of study will vary by country or by university.
The MFA is a creative degree usually awarded as a टर्मिनल degree in visual arts, creative writing, filmmaking, dance, or theatre and other performing arts.
Coursework is primarily of an applied or performing nature with the program often culminating in a प्रमुख work or performance.
Master of Fine Arts programs have generally required a bachelor 's degree prior to admission, but many do not require कि the undergraduate major be the वही as the MFA field of study.
The most important admissions requirement has often been a sample portfolio or a performance audition.
The Master of Fine कला differs from the Master of Arts in कि the MFA, while an अकादमिक program, centers around practice in the particular field, whereas programs leading to the MA usually center on the scholarly, academic, or critical study of the field.
Additionally, in the United States, an MFA is recognized as a terminal degree लिये practitioners of Visual Art, Design, Dance, Theatre, Film/Video, नई Media, and Creative Writing - meaning that it is माना to be the highest degree in its field, and is प्रयुक्त as a minimum qualification to be able to apply to become a full-time Professor teaching at the University level in these disciplines.
There are exceptions to this standard in the Arts, notably in the मामला of म्यूज़िक performance, जहाँ the MFA is not seen as a terminal degree in the context of the more standardized dma degree.
It is also critical to note that in the interest of extending the connection between creative production and continued अकादमिक research, some universities have established practice-based Ph.D programs in fields ऐसे as creative writing, visual arts, नई media, design and theater.
While this has had an effect in Creative Writing, and to a lesser extent in design and new मीडिया, the influx of graduates from practice-based PhD programs has not appreciably changed the मानक for the MFA as the terminal degree in most Arts disciplines yet.
This is an ongoing contentious topic, and is the frequent subject of अकादमिक panels, especially at the annual कॉलेज Art Association conference.
The CAA 2008 guidelines regarding the MFA strongly re-affirms that the PhD is not required as a terminal degree in the visual arts.
The atomic bombings of the cities of Hiroshima and Nagasaki in Japan were conducted by the United States during the final stages of World War II in 1945.
The two events are the only use of नाभिकीय weapons in war to date.
Following a firebombing campaign that नष्ट many जापानी cities, the allies prepared for a costly invasion of Japan.
The war in Europe ended जब Nazi Germany हस्ताक्षरित its instrument of surrender on 8 May, but the Pacific War continued.
Together with the संयुक्त Kingdom और the Republic of China, the United States called for a surrender of Japan in the Potsdam Declaration on 26 July 1945, threatening Japan with `` prompt and utter destruction ''.
The Japanese government ignored इस ultimatum, and the United States deployed two नाभिकीय weapons developed by the Manhattan Project.
American airmen dropped Little लड़के on the city of Hiroshima on 6 August 1945, followed by Fat Man over Nagasaki on 9 August.
Within the पहला two to four months of the bombings, the acute effects मारे 90,000–166,000 people in Hiroshima और 60,000–80,000 in Nagasaki, with roughly half of the deaths in each नगर occurring on the first day.
The Hiroshima prefecture health विभाग estimated that, of the people जो died on the day of the explosion, 60 % died from फ्लैश or flame burns, 30 % from falling debris and 10 % from other causes.
During the following months, large numbers died from the effect of burns, radiation sickness, और other injuries, compounded by illness.
In a US estimate of the कुल immediate and short term cause of death, 15–20 % died from radiation sickness, 20–30 % from burns, and 50–60 % from other injuries, compounded by illness.
In both cities, most of the dead were civilians, although Hiroshima had a sizeable garrison.
On 15 August, six days after the bombing of नागासाकी, Japan announced its surrender to the Allies, signing the Instrument of Surrender on 2 September, officially ending World War II.
the bombings led, in part, to post-war Japan 's adopting Three Non-Nuclear Principles, forbidding the nation from nuclear armament.
The role of the bombings in Japan 's आत्मसमर्पण और उनके ethical justification are still debated.
Mohandas Karamchand Gandhi ( ; 2 October 1869 – 30 January 1948 ), commonly known as Mahatma Gandhi, was the preeminent leader of Indian nationalism in British-ruled इण्डिया.
Employing non-violent civil disobedience, Gandhi led India to independence and inspired movements for non-violence, civil rights and freedom across the world.
the son of a senior government official, Gandhi was born and raised in a Hindu Bania community in coastal Gujarat, and trained in विधि in लंदन.
गांधी became प्रसिद्ध by fighting for the civil rights of Muslim and हिन्दू Indians in South Africa, using new techniques of non-violent civil disobedience that he विकसित.
Returning to India in 1915, he set about organising peasants to protest excessive land-taxes.
A lifelong opponent of `` communalism `` ( i.e. basing politics on religion ) he reached out widely to all धार्मिक groups.
He became a leader of Muslims protesting the declining status of the Caliphate.
Assuming leadership of the Indian National Congress in 1921, Gandhi led nationwide campaigns for easing poverty, expanding women 's rights, building religious and ethnic amity, ending untouchability, increasing आर्थिक self-reliance, and above all for achieving Swaraj —the independence of इण्डिया from British domination.
Gandhi led Indians in protesting the national salt tax with the Dandi Salt कूच in 1930, and later in demanding the British to तत्काल Quit India in 1942, during World War II.
He was imprisoned for that and for numerous अन्य political offenses over the years.
गांधी sought to practice non-violence and truth in all situations, and advocated that others do the same.
He saw the villages as the core of the true India and promoted self-sufficiency ; he did not support the industrialization programs of his disciple Jawaharlal Nehru.
he lived modestly in a self-sufficient residential community and wore the traditional Indian dhoti और shawl, woven साथ yarn he had hand spun on a charkha.
His मुख्य political enemy in Britain was Winston Churchill, who ridiculed him as a `` half-naked fakir. ''
He was a dedicated vegetarian, and undertook long fasts as means of both self-purification and political mobilization.
In his last year, unhappy at the partition of India, Gandhi worked to stop the carnage between Muslims, Hindus and Sikhs that raged in the border area between इण्डिया and Pakistan.
He was assassinated on 30 January 1948 by Nathuram Godse who thought Gandhi was too sympathetic to India 's Muslims.
30 January is observed as Martyrs ' Day in India.
The honorific Mahatma ( `` Great Soul '' ) थी applied to him by 1914.
In India he was also called Bapu ( `` Father '' ).
he is known in India as the Father of the Nation ; his जन्मदिवस, 2 October, is commemorated there as Gandhi jayanti, a नेशनल holiday, and world-wide as the अंतरराष्ट्रीय Day of Non-Violence.
Gandhi 's philosophy was not theoretical लकिन one of pragmatism, that is, practicing his principles in the moment.
Asked to give a message to the people, he would respond, `` My जीवन is my message. ''
Joan Crawford ( March 23, ca. 1904 – May 10, 1977 ), born lucille Fay lesueur, was an American actress in film, television and theatre.
Starting as a dancer in traveling theatrical companies before debuting on Broadway, Crawford was हस्ताक्षरित to a motion picture अनुबंध by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer in 1925.
Initially frustrated by the size और विशेषता of her parts, क्रॉफर्ड began a campaign of self-publicity and became nationally ज्ञात as a flapper by the end of the 1920s.
In the 1930s, Crawford 's fame rivaled, and later outlasted, MGM colleagues norma Shearer and Greta Garbo.
Crawford प्रायः played hardworking young women who find रोमांस and financial success.
These `` rags-to-riches '' stories were well received by Depression -era ऑडियंस and were popular with women.
Crawford became one of Hollywood 's most prominent फिल्म stars and one of the highest paid women in the United States, but her films began losing money and by the end of the 1930s she थी labeled `` box office poison ''.
After an absence of nearly दो सालो from the screen, Crawford staged a comeback by starring in Mildred पियर्स ( 1945 ), for which she won the Academy Award for Best Actress.
In 1955, she became involved with the Pepsi-Cola कम्पनी through her marriage to company Chairman Alfred Steele.
After his death in 1959, क्रॉफर्ड was elected to fill his vacancy on the board of directors लकिन was forcibly retired in 1973.
She continued एक्टिंग in film and television regularly through the 1960s, when her performances became fewer ; after the रिलीज of the British horror film trog in 1970, Crawford retired from the स्क्रीन.
Following a public appearance in 1974, after which unflattering photographs were published, Crawford withdrew from public life and became increasingly reclusive until her मौत in 1977.
Crawford married four times.
Her first three marriages ended in divorce ; the पिछला ended with the मौत of husband Alfred Steele.
She adopted five children, one of whom was reclaimed by his birth mother.
Crawford 's relationships with her two older children, क्रिस्टीना and Christopher, were acrimonious.
Crawford disinherited the two और, after Crawford 's death, Christina wrote a `` tell-all '' memoir, Mommie Dearest, in which she alleged a lifelong pattern of physical and emotional abuse perpetrated by क्रॉफर्ड.
She was voted the दसवाँ greatest मादा star in the history of अमरीकी cinema by the American Film संस्थान.

Tonneau cover ( or ) describes a hard or soft cover used to protect unoccupied passenger सीटे in a convertible or roadster, or the cargo bed in a pickup truck.
Hard tonneau covers open by a hinging or folding mechanism while soft covers open by rolling up.
The tonneau cover is used to conceal cargo.
When the cover is pulled out, it keeps items out of the sun and provides extra security by keeping personal items out of sight, as well as shielding the driver from view.
Twitter is an online social networking service and microblogging service that enables its users to send and read text-based messages of up to 140 वर्ण, known as `` tweets ''.
ट्विटर was created in March 2006 by Jack Dorsey and by July, the सोशल networking site was launched.
The service rapidly gained worldwide popularity, with over 500 million registered users as of 2012, generating over 340 million tweets daily and handling over 1.6 billion search प्रश्नों per दिन.
Since its launch, Twitter has become one of the ten most visited websites on the Internet, and has been described as `` the SMS of the Internet. ''
Unregistered users can read tweets, while registered users can post tweets through the website interface, SMS, or a range of apps for mobile devices.
Twitter inc. is based in San Francisco, with additional servers and कार्यालयों in नई York City, Boston, and San Antonio.
The Hangover is a 2009 American comedy film, co-produced and directed by Todd phillips and written by Jon Lucas and स्कॉट Moore.
It is the first film of The hangover मताधिकार.The film stars ब्राडली Cooper, ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Heather Graham, Justin Bartha, and Jeffrey Tambor.
The Hangover tells the स्टोरी of Phil Wenneck, Stu Price and Alan Garner, जो travel to Las Vegas for a bachelor पार्टी to celebrate their friend Doug Billings ' impending marriage.
However, Phil, Stu and Alan have no memory of the previous night 's events and must find Doug before the wedding can take place.
Lucas and Moore wrote the script after executive producer Chris Bender 's friend disappeared and had a large bill after being sent to a strip club.
बाद Lucas and मूर sold it to the studio for $ 2 million, Philips and Jeremy Garelick rewrote the script to include a tiger as well as a subplot involving a baby and a police cruiser, and also including boxer Mike Tyson.
Filming took place in Nevada for 15 दिनों, and during filming, the three main actors ( Cooper, Helms और Galifianakis ) formed a friendship.
The Hangover was released on June 5, 2009, becoming a critical and commercial success.
It became the tenth-highest-grossing film of 2009, with a worldwide gross of over US $ 467 million.
आलोचकों praised the फिल्मी 's comedic approach but criticized it for its vulgarity.
The film won the Golden Globe Award for Best Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy, and received multiple अन्य accolades.
It is the tenth-highest-grossing film of 2009 in the world, as well as the second highest-grossing R-rated comedy ever in the संयुक्त States, surpassing a record previously held by Beverly Hills Cop for almost 25 years and later being surpassed by Ted in 2012.
आउट of all R-rated films, it is the third highest-grossing ever in the U.S., पीछे only The Passion of the मसीह and The Matrix Reloaded.
A sequel, The Hangover Part II, was released in 2011, and a तीसरा and final film, The Hangover Part III, is set for release in 2013.
Events involving meiosis, showing chromosomal crossover
Meiosis ( ) is a special type of cell division necessary for sexual reproduction in eukaryotes.
The cells produced by meiosis हैं गैमीट or spores.
In many organisms, including all पशु and land plants ( but not some other groups such as fungi ), gametes are called sperm and egg cells.
Whilst the process of meiosis bears a number of similarities with the 'life-cycle ' cell division process of mitosis, it differs in two important respects:
the chromosomes in meiosis undergo a recombination which shuffles the genes producing a different जेनेटिक combination in each gamete, compared with the co-existence of each of the two separate pairs of each chromosome ( one received इससे each parent ) in each cell which results from mitosis.
the निष्कर्ष of meiosis is potentially four ( genetically unique ) haploid cells, compared with the two ( genetically identical ) diploid cells उत्पादित from mitosis.
meiosis begins with one द्विगुणित cell containing two copies of each chromosome —one from the organism 's mother and one from its father.
The cell divides twice, potentially producing up to चार अगुणित cells containing one copy of each chromosome.
( `` potentially '' because in some cases, such as the formation of oocytes in mammals, only one of the संभावित four haploid cells survives. )
In animals the haploid कोशिका resulting इससे meiosis is a male or female gamete.
Each of the resulting गुणसूत्रों in the gamete cells is a unique mixture of maternal and paternal DNA, resulting in offspring that are genetically distinct from either parent.
This gives rise to genetic diversity in sexually reproducing populations.
This genetic diversity can provide the variation of शारीरिक and behavioural attributes ( phenotypes ) upon which प्राकृतिक selection can अधिनियम, but, as described नीचे in Section 6, Origin and function of meiosis, the genetic diversity may be largely a by-product of the homologous recombination that is primarily employed for its DNA repair function during meiosis.
It is also noteworthy that during meiosis, specific genes हैं more highly transcribed, and these are called the meiome, the term used in functional genomics for the meiotic transcriptome.
Meiosis is a key feature for all sexually reproducing eukaryotes in which homologous chromosome pairing, synapse and recombination occur.
In addition to strong meiotic stage-specific expression of mRNA ( the meiome ), however, there are also pervasive translational नियंत्रण ( e.g. selective usage of preformed mRNA ), regulating the ultimate meiotic stage-specific protein expression of genes during meiosis.
Thus, both the meiome and translational नियंत्रण determine the broad restructuring of meiotic cells needed to carry out meiosis.
Prior to the meiosis process the cell 's chromosomes are duplicated by a round of DNA replication, creating from the maternal and paternal versions of each chromosome ( homologs ) two exact copies, sister chromatids, संलग्न at the centromere region.
In the beginning of meiosis the maternal and paternal homologs pair to प्रत्येक other.
Then they typically exchange parts by homologous recombination leading to crossovers of DNA between the maternal and paternal versions of the chromosome.
Spindle fibers bind to the centromeres of each pair of homologs and arrange the pairs at the spindle equator.
Then the fibers pull the recombined homologs to विपरीत poles of the कोशिका.
As the chromosomes move away इससे the बीच the cell divides into two daughter cells, each containing a haploid number of chromosomes रचित of two chromatids.
बाद the recombined maternal and paternal homologs have separated into the two daughter cells, a second round of कोशिका division occurs.
There meiosis ends as the two sister chromatids making up each homolog are separated and move into one of the four resulting gamete cells.
Upon fertilization, for example when a sperm enters an egg cell, two gamete cells produced by meiosis fuse.
The gamete from the mother and the gamete from the father each contribute one हाफ of the set of chromosomes that make up the new offspring 's genome.
Meiosis uses many of the same mechanisms as mitosis, a type of कोशिका division used by eukaryotes like plants and animals to split one cell into two एकसमान daughter cells.
In सब plants and in many protists meiosis results in the formation of spores : haploid cells that can divide vegetatively without undergoing fertilization.
Boxing ( pugilism, prize fighting, the sweet science or in Greek pygmachia ) is a martial art and combat sport in जिससे दो लोगों engage in a contest of strength, speed, reflexes, endurance and will by throwing punches with gloved hands.
Amateur boxing is an Olympic and Commonwealth sport and is a आम fixture in most of the major international games - it also has its own World Championships.
मुक्केबाज़ी is supervised by a referee over a series of one- to three-minute intervals called rounds.
The परिणाम is decided when an opponent is deemed incapable to continue by a referee, is disqualified लिये breaking a rule, resigns by throwing in a towel, or is सुनाया the winner or loser based on the judges ' scorecards at the end of the contest.
The birth hour of boxing as a sport may be its acceptance by the ancient Greeks as an Olympic game as early as 688 BC.
Boxing evolved from 16th- and 18th-century prizefights, largely in Great Britain, to the forerunner of modern boxing in the mid-19th century, again initially in ग्रेट Britain and later in the United States.
In 2004, ESPN ranked मुक्केबाज़ी as the most difficult sport in the world.
Agreement or concord happens when a word changes form depending on the other words to which it relates.
It is an instance of inflection, and usually involves making the value of some grammatical category ( such as लिंग or person ) `` agree '' between different words or parts of the sentence.
For example, in Standard English, one may say I am or he is, but not `` I is '' or `` he am ''.
This is because the grammar of the language requires that the verb and its विषय agree in person.
The pronouns i और he are first and third person respectively, as are the verb forms am and is.
The verb रूप जरूर be selected so that it रै the same person as the subject.
The अनुबंध based on overt grammatical categories as above is formal agreement, in contrast to notional agreement, which is based on meaning.
लिये instance, the phrase The United States is treated as singular लिये purposes of agreement, भी though it is formally plural.
This is a list of places below mean sea level that are on जमीन.
स्थान in tunnels, mines, basements, dug holes ( also with open sky ), under water, under ice, or existing temporarily as a परिणाम of ebbing of sea tide etc. are not included.
All figures are in meters below समुद्र level:
Debbie Macomber ( born अक्तूबर 22, 1948 in Yakima, Washington ) is a best-selling अमरीकी author of over 150 रोमांस novels and contemporary women 's fiction.
Over 140 million नक़ल of उसके books are in print throughout the world, and चार have become made-for-TV-movies.
Macomber was the inaugural विजेता of the fan-voted Quill Award for romance in 2005 and has been awarded both a Romance Writers of America RITA and a lifetime achievement award by the Romance Writers of America.
Catonsville is a census-designated प्लेस ( CDP ) in Baltimore County, Maryland, United States.
The population was 41,567 at the 2010 census.
The community lies to the west of Baltimore along the city 's border.
Catonsville is the home of the University of Maryland, Baltimore County ( UMBC ), a public research university with over 12,000 students.
a lawyer, according to Black 's Law Dictionary, is `` a person learned in the law ; as an attorney, counsel or solicitor ; a person who is practicing law. ''
विधि is the system of rules of conduct established by the sovereign government of a समाज to correct wrongs, maintain the stability of political and social authority, and deliver justice.
Working as a वकील involves the practical अनुप्रयोग of abstract legal theories and knowledge to solve specific individualized problems, or to advance the रूचि of those who retain ( i.e., hire ) lawyers to perform legal services.
the role of the lawyer varies significantly across legal jurisdictions, and so it can be treated here in तभी the most general terms.
Vector विपणन is the domestic sales arm of Cutco Corporation, an Olean, New York based cutlery manufacturer.
The Family and Medical Leave Act of 1993 ( FMLA ) is a United States federal law requiring covered employers to provide employees job-protected and unpaid leave for qualified medical and family reasons.
Qualified medical and family कारण include : personal or family illness, family military leave, pregnancy, adoption, or the foster परवाह placement of a child.
The FMLA is administered by the Wage और Hour Division of the United States Department of Labor.
The विधेयक was a major part of President Bill Clinton 's agenda in his first term.
President Clinton signed the bill into law on February 5, 1993 ( ; 29 U.S.C. sec. 2601 ; 29 CFR 825 ) and it took effect on August 5, 1993, six months later.
The FMLA was intended `` to balance the demands of the workplace with the needs of families. ''
The Act allows eligible employees to take up to 12 work weeks of unpaid leave during any 12-month period to attend to the serious health condition of the employee, parent, spouse or child, or for pregnancy or care of a newborn child, or for adoption or foster परवाह of a child.
In अनुक्रम to be eligible for fmla leave, an कर्मचारी must have been at the business at तनिक 12 months, and worked at least 1,250 hours over the past 12 months, and work at a location where the company employs 50 or more employees within 75 miles.
The FMLA covers both public- and private-sector employees, but certain categories of employees are excluded, including elected officials and their निजी staff members.
The Vietnam War ( ) was a Cold War -era military conflict कि occurred in Vietnam, Laos, and Cambodia from 1 November 1955 to the fall of Saigon on 30 April 1975.
This war followed the First Indochina War और was लड़ा between North Vietnam, supported by इसके communist allies, and the government of South Vietnam, supported by the United राज्य and other anti-communist countries.
The Viet Cong ( also known as the National Liberation सामने, or NLF ), a हलके armed South वियतनामी communist आम front directed by the North, largely fought a guerrilla war विरूद्ध anti-communist forces in the region.
The Vietnam People 's Army ( North Vietnamese Army ) engaged in a more conventional war, at times committing large units into battle.
U.S. and South वियतनामी forces relied on air superiority and overwhelming firepower to conduct search and destroy operations, involving ground forces, artillery, and airstrikes.
The U.S. government viewed involvement in the युद्ध as a way to prevent a communist takeover of South Vietnam as part of their wider strategy of containment.
The North Vietnamese government and Viet Cong were fighting to reunify Vietnam under communist rule.
They viewed the conflict as a colonial war, लड़ा initially विरूद्ध France, backed by the U.S., and later विरूद्ध South Vietnam, which it regarded as a U.S. puppet state.
American military advisors arrived in what was then French Indochina beginning in 1950.
U.S. involvement escalated in the जल्दी 1960s, with troop स्तर tripling in 1961 and tripling again in 1962.
U.S. combat units were तैनात beginning in 1965.
Operations spanned international borders, with Laos and कंबोडिया heavily bombed.
American involvement in the war peaked in 1968, at the time of the Tet Offensive.
After this, U.S. ground forces were gradually withdrawn as part of a policy known as Vietnamization.
Despite the Paris Peace Accords, signed by all पार्टियों in January 1973, fighting continued.
U.S. military involvement ended on 15 August 1973 as a result of the Case–Church amendment passed by the U.S. Congress.
The capture of Saigon by the वियतनाम People 's Army in April 1975 marked the end of the war, and North and South Vietnam were reunified the following year.
The war exacted a विशाल human cost in terms of fatalities ( see Vietnam War casualties ).
Estimates of the क्रमांक of Vietnamese soldiers and civilians killed vary from 800,000 to 3.1 million.
Some 200,000–300,000 Cambodians, 20,000–200,000 Laotians, and 58,220 U.S. service members also died in the विरोध.
Cleveland Volcano in the Aleutian Islands of Alaska photographed from the अंतरराष्ट्रीय Space Station, May 2006.
Ash plumes reached a height of 19 km during the climactic eruption at Mount Pinatubo, Philippines in 1991.
A volcano is an opening, or rupture, in a planet 's surface or crust, which allows hot magma, volcanic ash and gases to escape from the magma chamber below the surface.
Volcanoes are generally found where tectonic प्लेटों are diverging or converging.
A mid-oceanic ridge, for example the Mid-Atlantic Ridge, has examples of ज्वालामुखी caused by divergent tectonic plates pulling अलावा ; the Pacific Ring of Fire has examples of volcanoes caused by convergent tectonic plates coming साथ.
By contrast, volcanoes are usually not created where two tectonic plates slide past एक another.
Volcanoes can also form where वहीँ is stretching and thinning of the Earth 's crust in the interiors of प्लेटों, e.g., in the East African Rift, the Wells Gray-Clearwater volcanic field and the Rio Grande Rift in उत्तर अमेरिका.
इस प्रकार of volcanism falls under the umbrella of `` Plate hypothesis '' volcanism.
Volcanism away from plate boundaries has also been explained as mantle plumes.
These so-called `` hotspots ``, for example Hawaii, are postulated to arise from upwelling diapirs with magma from the core–mantle boundary, 3,000 km गहन in the Earth.
Erupting volcanoes can pose many hazards, not only in the immediate vicinity of the eruption.
Volcanic ash can be a threat to aircraft, in particular those with जेट engines where राख particles can be melted by the high operating तापमान.
Large eruptions can affect temperature as ash and droplets of sulfuric acid obscure the sun and cool the Earth 's lower atmosphere or troposphere ; however, they also absorb heat radiated up from the Earth, thereby warming the stratosphere.
Historically, so-called volcanic winters have caused catastrophic famines.
A deep pothole on New York City 's Second Avenue
A pothole ( sometimes पुकारा a kettle and known in भाग of the Western United States as a chuckhole ) is a प्रकार of disruption in the सतह of a roadway where a portion of the road सामग्री has broken away, leaving a hole.
Renal cell carcinoma ( RCC, also known as hypernephroma ) is a kidney cancer that originates in the lining of the proximal convoluted tubule, the very small tubes in the kidney that transport GF ( glomerular filtrate ) from the glomerulus to the descending limb of the nephron.
RCC is the most common type of गुर्दा cancer in adults, responsible for लगभग 80 % of मामले.
it is also known to be the most lethal of all the genitourinary tumors.
Initial treatment is most commonly a radical or partial nephrectomy and remains the mainstay of curative treatment.
Where the tumor is confined to the renal parenchyma, the 5-year survival rate is 60-70 %, but this is lowered considerably जहाँ metastases have spread.
It is relatively resistant to radiation therapy and chemotherapy, although some cases respond to immunotherapy.
targeted cancer therapies such as sunitinib, temsirolimus, bevacizumab, interferon-alpha, and sorafenib have improved the outlook for RCC.
estée Lauder Companies, Inc. is a manufacturer and marketer of prestige skincare, makeup, fragrance and hair care products.
The company has its headquarters in Midtown Manhattan, New York City.
The peritoneum ( ) is the serous membrane that forms the lining of the abdominal cavity or the coelom —it covers most of the intra-abdominal ( or coelomic ) organs—in amniotes and कुछ invertebrates ( annelids, for instance ).
It is composed of a layer of mesothelium supported by a thin layer of संयोजी tissue.
The peritoneum both supports the abdominal organs and serves as a conduit for their blood and lymph vessels and nerves.
The abdominal cavity ( the space bounded by the vertebrae, abdominal muscles, diaphragm and pelvic floor ) should not be confused with the intraperitoneal space ( located within the abdominal गुहा, but wrapped in peritoneum ).
The structures within the intraperitoneal स्पेस हैं called `` intraperitoneal '' ( e.g. the stomach ), the structures in the abdominal cavity that हैं located पीछे the intraperitoneal space are called `` retroperitoneal `` ( e.g. the kidneys ), और those structures below the intraperitoneal space are called `` subperitoneal '' or `` infraperitoneal '' ( e.g. the bladder ).

PCI attached IO Accelerator ssd
PCI-E, DRAM, and NAND based SSD.
It uses an external power supply to make the DRAM non-volatile.
A solid-state drive ( SSD ) ( also known as a solid-state disk or electronic disk, though it contains no actual `` disk '' of any kind ) is a data storage device using integrated circuit assemblies as मेमोरी to store data persistently.
SSD technology उपयोग electronic interfaces compatible with traditional block input/output ( I/O ) hard disk drives.
SSDs have no moving mechanical components, which distinguish them from traditional electromechanical magnetic disks such as hard disk drives ( HDDs ) or floppy disks, which contain spinning disks and movable read/write heads.
Compared with electromechanical disks, SSDs are typically less susceptible to physical शॉक, much quieter, have lower अभिगम time, and less latency.
However, while the price of ssds has continued to decline in 2012, SSDs हैं still about 7 to 8 times more expensive per unit of storage than HDDs.
अनेक SSDs use I/O अंतरफलक developed for hard disk drives, thus permitting simple replacement in common applications.
, most SSDs use NAND-based flash memory, which retains data बगैर power.
लिये applications requiring fast access, but not necessarily data persistence after power घाटा, SSDs may be constructed from random-access memory ( RAM ).
Such devices may employ separate power sources, such as batteries, to maintain data after power loss.
Hybrid drives or solid state hybrid drives ( SSHD ) combine the features of SSDs and hdds in the same unit, containing a large hard disk drive and an SSD संचय to improve performance of frequently accessed data.
These devices may offer near-SSD प्रदर्शन for many अनुप्रयोग.
Salmon roe ( left ) and sturgeon caviar ( right ) served with mother of pearl caviar spoons to avoid tainting the taste of the caviar.
