Humans are born साथ over 270 bones, some of which fuse together into a longitudinal axis, the axial skeleton, to which the appendicular skeleton is attached.
Saint पैट्रिक ( ; ; Modern ; ; c. 387 – 17 March c. 460 or c. 492 ) was a Romano-British Christian missionary and बिशप in Ireland.
Known as the `` Apostle of Ireland '', he is the primary संरक्षक saint of the island साथ साथ संतो Brigid and Columba.
दो authentic letters from him survive, from which come the only generally accepted details of his life.
When he थी about 16, he was captured from उसके home and taken as a slave to Ireland, where he lived for six years before escaping और returning to his परिवार.
After becoming a cleric, he returned to northern and western Ireland as an ordained bishop, but little is known about the places where he worked.
By the seventh century, he had already come to be revered as the patron saint of Ireland.
Most उपलब्धियाँ details of his life are from subsequent hagiographies, and these are now not accepted without detailed criticism.
The Annals of Ulster state that he arrived in Ireland in 432, ministered in Ulster around 443, and died in 457 or 461.
The text, however, distinguishes between `` Old Patrick '' ( thought to mean Palladius ) and `` Patrick, archapostle of the Scots, '' who died in 492.
The actual dates of Patrick 's जीवन can नहीं be fixed with certainty but, on a widespread interpretation, he was क्रियाशील as a missionary in Ireland during the second हाफ of the 5th century.
He is generally credited with being the first bishop of Armagh, Primate of All Ireland.
Saint Patrick 's Day is observed on March 17, the date of his death.
It is celebrated both inside and outside Ireland, as both a religious and, especially outside Ireland, secular holiday.
In the dioceses of Ireland, it is both a solemnity and a holy day of obligation ; बाहर Ireland, it can be a celebration of Ireland itself.
Line segments in the golden ratio
A golden rectangle with longer side a and shorter side b, when placed adjacent to a square with पहलू of length a, will produce a similar golden rectangle साथ longer side a + b and shorter side a.
This illustrates the relationship.
In mathematics और the arts, two quantities are in the सुनहरी ratio if the ratio of the sum of the quantities to the larger quantity is equal to the ratio of the larger quantity to the smaller one.
The figure on the right illustrates the geometric relationship.
Expressed algebraically:
where the Greek letter phi ( ) represents the golden अनुपात.
Its मान is:
The golden ratio is also called the golden खण्ड ( Latin : sectio aurea ) or golden mean.
Other names include extreme and mean अनुपात, medial section, divine proportion, divine section ( Latin : sectio divina ), सुनहरी proportion, golden काटें, and golden number.
Many 20th century artists and architects have proportioned their works to approximate the golden ratio—especially in the form of the golden rectangle, in which the ratio of the longer side to the shorter is the golden ratio—believing this proportion to be aesthetically pleasing ( see Applications and observations below ).
Mathematicians since Euclid have पढ़ाई the properties of the golden ratio, including its appearance in the dimensions of a regular pentagon and in a golden rectangle, which can be cut into a square and a smaller rectangle with the same aspect ratio.
The golden ratio has also been used to analyze the proportions of natural objects as well as man-made systems such as financial markets, in some cases based on dubious fits to आंकड़ा.
North Myrtle Beach is a तटीय resort city in Horry County, दक्षिण Carolina, United States.
it was created in 1968 from चार existing municipalities north of Myrtle Beach, और serves as one of the primary tourist towns along the Grand Strand.
The population was 13,752 at the 2010 census.
World War I ( WWI ) was a वैश्विक war centred in Europe that began on 28 July 1914 and lasted until 11 November 1918.
It was predominantly called the World War or the ग्रेट War इससे its occurrence until the start of World War II in 1939, and the First World War or World War I thereafter.
it involved सब the world 's ग्रेट powers, which were assembled in two opposing alliances : the allies ( based on the Triple entente of the संयुक्त Kingdom, France and Russia ) and the Central Powers ( originally the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy ; लकिन, as Austria–Hungary had taken the offensive against the अनुबंध, Italy did not डालें into the युद्ध ).
These alliances were both reorganised and expanded as more nations entered the war : Italy, Japan and the United States joined the Allies, और the उस्मानी साम्राज्य and Bulgaria the Central Powers.
Ultimately, more than 70 million military personnel, including 60 million europeans, were mobilised in एक of the largest wars in history.
More than 9 million combatants were killed, largely because of technological advancements that led to enormous increases in the lethality of weapons without corresponding improvements in protection or mobility.
It was the fifth- deadliest conflict in world history, subsequently paving the way for various political changes, such as revolutions in अनेक of the nations involved.
One of the long-term causes of the war was the पुनरुत्थान of imperialism in the foreign नीतियों of the great powers of Europe.
More तत्काल, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria, the वारिस to the throne of Austria-Hungary, on 28 June 1914 by Yugoslav nationalist Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo triggered a diplomatic crisis when Austria-Hungary subsequently delivered an ultimatum to the Kingdom of Serbia.
Several alliances formed over the previous decades were invoked.
Within weeks, the major powers were at war and, via their colonies, the conflict soon spread around the world.
On 28 July, the Austro-Hungarians fired the first shots of the war as preparation for the invasion of Serbia.
While the Russians mobilised, the Germans invaded neutral बेल्जियम and Luxembourg on the way to France, providing a casus belli for Britain 's declaration of war विरूद्ध Germany.
After the German march on Paris was brought to a halt—the so-called चमत्कार of the Marne —the Western Front settled into a static बैटल of attrition with a trench line that changed little until 1917.
On the Eastern Front, the रूसी army was successful against the Austro-Hungarians, but was stopped in इसके invasion of East Prussia by the Germans.
In November the Ottoman Empire joined the war, खोलने up fronts in the Caucasus, Mesopotamia and the Sinai.
Italy and Bulgaria went to war in 1915 and Romania in 1916.
In Russia, the tsar 's government collapsed in March 1917 and a subsequent revolution in November brought the Russians to terms with the Central Powers.
After a 1918 जर्मनी offensive along the western front, the Allies drove वापस the Germans in a श्रेणी of successful offensives और American forces began entering the trenches.
Germany, which had its own ट्रबल with revolutionaries, agreed to an armistice on 11 November 1918.
The war ended in victory for the Allies.
Events on the home fronts were as tumultuous as on the battle fronts, as the भागीदार tried to mobilize their manpower and आर्थिक resources to fight a total war.
By the end of the war, four major imperial powers—the German, Russian, Austro-Hungarian and Ottoman empires—ceased to exist.
The successor states of the former two lost a ग्रेट amount of territory, while the latter two were dismantled entirely.
The map of central Europe was redrawn into several smaller states.
The League of Nations was formed in the hope of preventing another such conflict.
The European nationalism spawned by the war and the breakup of empires, the repercussions of Germany 's defeat and problems साथ the सन्धि of Versailles are agreed to be factors contributing to World War II.
Camden is a city in Camden County, New Jersey, United States.
It is the county seat, located across the Delaware River from Philadelphia.
As of the 2010 United States Census the city had a total population of 77,344, representing a decline of 2,560 ( 3.2 % ) from the 79,904 residents enumerated during the 2000 Census, which had in turn declined by 7,588 ( 8.7 % ) इससे the 87,492 counted in the 1990 Census.
Camden ranked as the 12th-most populous municipality in the state in 2010 after having been ranked 10th in 2000.
Camden was originally incorporated as a city on February 13, 1828, from portions of the now-defunct Newton Township, while the area was still part of Gloucester काउंटी.
On March 13, 1844, Camden became part of the newly formed Camden County.
Although once a thriving center for manufacturing and industry, Camden is perhaps best known for its struggles with urban dysfunction.
Three Camden mayors have been jailed for corruption, the most recent being मिल्टन मिलान in 2000.
Since 2005 the school system and police department have been operated by the state of नई Jersey ; the takeover expired in 2012.
In 2008, Camden had the highest crime rate in the U.S. with 2,333 violent crimes per 100,000 people while the national average was 455 per 100,000.
Camden public schools spent $ 23,770 per student ( $ 19,118 on a budgetary per-pupil basis ) in the 2009–10 स्कूल year and two-thirds of the students graduate.
Two out of every five residents are below the national poverty line.
Amitriptyline ( tryptomer, Elavil, Tryptizol, laroxyl, Saroten, sarotex, Lentizol, Endep ) is a tricyclic antidepressant ( tca ).
It is the most widely used TCA and has at least equal efficacy against depression as the newer class of SSRIs according to a study from early 2001.
As खूब as reducing depressive symptoms, these types of tricyclics also ease migraines, tension headaches, anxiety attacks and some schizophrenic symptoms.
It is also known to reduce aggression और violent behavior.
A computer is a सामान्य purpose यंत्र that can be programmed to carry out a finite set of arithmetic or logical operations.
Since a sequence of operations can be readily changed, the computer can solve more than one kind of problem.
Conventionally, a computer consists of at least one processing element, typically a central processing unit ( CPU ) and some form of memory.
The processing element carries out arithmetic and logic operations, and a sequencing and control unit कि can change the order of operations आधारित on stored information.
परिधीय devices allow information to be retrieved from an external सोर्स, and the result of operations saved and retrieved.
The first electronic digital computers were developed between 1940 and 1945 in the United Kingdom and संयुक्त States.
Originally they were the आकार of a large room, consuming as much power as several सौ modern personal computers ( PCs ).
In this era mechanical analog computers were used for military applications.
Modern computers based on integrated circuits are millions to billions of times more capable than the early machines, and occupy a भिन्न of the space.
सरल कंप्यूटर are छोटी enough to अनुरूप into mobile devices, and mobile computers can be powered by small बैटरी.
Personal कंप्यूटर in their various forms हैं icons of the Information Age and are what most people think of as “computers.”
However, the embedded computers found in many devices from MP3 players to fighter aircraft and from toys to औद्योगिक robots are the most numerous.
`` Barefoot and pregnant '' is a phrase most commonly associated with the controversial idea that women should not work outside the home और चाहिए have many children during their reproductive years.
It has several other meanings as well.
It is a figure of speech.
The phrase `` barefoot and pregnant '' was probably first used sometime before 1950.
An article from 1949 states, `` By early 1949, TWA was—in the words of its new president, Ralph S. Damon—both 'barefoot and pregnant. ' ''
Its usage may date as early as the 1910s.
An article published in 1958 राज्य the phrase was first used by a `` Dr. Hertzler '' 40 years earlier.
`` Some चालीस years ago, Dr. Hertzler advanced a hypothesis which young women of today seem झुकी on proving correct. '
The only way to keep a स्त्री happy, ' he said, 'is to keep her barefoot and pregnant. ' ''
Oakhurst is a census-designated place और unincorporated community within Ocean Township, in Monmouth काउंटी, New Jersey, United States.
As of the 2010 संयुक्त States Census, the CDP 's population was 3,995.
University of Phoenix Stadium, opened August 1, 2006, is a multipurpose football stadium located in Glendale, एरिज़ोना.
It is the home of the Arizona Cardinals of the National Football League ( NFL ) and the annual Fiesta Bowl.
The stadium is located अगला door to the Jobing.com Arena and it features the first fully retractable natural grass playing surface built in the United States on top of an AirField Systems drainage system.
An opening on one पक्ष of the stadium allows the playing field to move to the exterior of the building, allowing the entire natural turf playing surface to be exposed to daylight.
The stadium has hosted Super Bowl XLII, and the 2011 BCS National चैंपियनशिप Game, a game that it hosts every four years, which set the venue 's entertainment attendance record of 78,603 on January 11, 2011.
It will again मेजबान Super Bowl XLIX in 2015.
The University of Phoenix acquired the naming rights in September 2006, shortly after the stadium had opened under the name Cardinals Stadium.
The `` University of Phoenix `` name is applied as a कॉरपोरेट sponsor, and not as the घर stadium of the University ( which has no intercollegiate एथलेटिक्स program ).
the stadium has also hosted the WWE event WrestleMania XXVI with 72,219 fans in attendance.
the event थी held in the stadium on March 28th 2010.
Joshua Lawrence Chamberlain ( September 8, 1828 – February 24, 1914 ), born as Lawrence Joshua Chamberlain, was an अमरीकी college professor from the State of Maine, who volunteered during the American Civil War to जुड़ें the Union Army.
Although having no earlier education in military strategies, he became a highly respected और decorated Union officer, reaching the rank of brigadier general ( and brevet major general ).
For his gallantry at Gettysburg, he was awarded the पदक of Honor.
He was given the honor of commanding the संघ troops at the surrender ceremony लिये the infantry of Robert E. Lee 's Army at appomattox, Virginia.
After the war, he entered politics as a Republican और served four one-year terms of office as the 32nd Governor of Maine.
He served on the faculty, and as president, of his alma mater, Bowdoin College.
An inning, or innings, is a fixed-length segment of a game in any of a variety of sports – सबसे notably cricket and baseball during which one team attempts to score while the other team attempts to prevent the first from scoring.
In cricket, the term innings is both singular and plural and is always spelled and pronounced with the terminal `` s ''.
in baseball and softball, the singular form is inning and only the plural takes an `` s ''.
In अनेक other sports, the length of the game is dictated by a clock and teams swap offensive and defensive roles dynamically by taking possession of a ball or similar item.
In baseball and cricket, however, one team, said to be `` batting '', attempts to score `` runs '' —see run ( baseball ) and run ( cricket ) —while the other team, कहा to be `` fielding '', attempts to prevent the scoring of runs and get members of the batting team out.
The teams switch places after the fielding team has succeeded in getting a fixed number of players आउट, making a clock unnecessary.
In cricket, the term innings is also used to refer to the play of one particular player ( Smith had a poor innings, scoring तभी 12 ).
By extension, this term can be used in British English for almost any कार्यकलाप which takes a period of time ( the Liberal government था a good पारी, लकिन finally lost office in 1972, or You 've had a fair innings, now it 's my turn, meaning `` you have spoken for long enough, now let me speak '' ).
It is also used in reference to someone who has died at a reasonably old age or lived a rich and rewarding life ( Ah, well.
John was 89.
At least he था a good innings ).
The baseball-derived parallel to this in American English is the term at bat.
According to the Oxford English Dictionary, the term innings रै been used in reference to क्रिकेट since at तनिक 1735.
As क्रिकेट was a mature, highly organized sport in the 1600s in England, the term 's origin could well precede this first recorded usage.
The word inning meaning 'a gathering in ' is first recorded in 1522, and could be related.
Adenosine deaminase deficiency, also called एडीए deficiency or ADA-SCID, is an autosomal recessive metabolic disorder that causes immunodeficiency.
It occurs in fewer than one in 100,000 live births worldwide.
It accounts for about 15 % of all मामले of severe combined immunodeficiency ( SCID ).
It is very rare, you have a 3 % chance of getting this जीन.
ADA deficiency may be present in शैशव, childhood, adolescense, or adulthood.
आयु of onset and severity is related to some 29 known genotypes associated with the disorder.
An example of urban poverty in this slum in Jakarta, Indonesia
Poverty is the state of one who lacks a certain amount of material possessions or money.
Absolute poverty or destitution refers to the deprivation of basic human needs, which commonly includes खाना, water, sanitation, clothing, shelter, health care and education.
सापेक्ष poverty is defined contextually as economic inequality in the location or समाज in which people live.
For much of history, poverty was considered largely unavoidable as traditional modes of production were insufficient to give an entire population a comfortable standard of living.
After the industrial revolution, mass production in factories made माल increasingly more inexpensive and accessible.
Of अधिक महत्व is the modernization of agriculture, such as fertilizers, in order to provide enough yield to feed the population.
The supply of basic needs can be restricted by constraints on सरकारी services such as भ्रष्टाचार, tax avoidance, debt and ऋण conditionalities and by the brain drain of स्वास्थ्य care and educational professionals.
Strategies of increasing income to make basic needs more affordable typically include welfare, economic freedoms, and providing financial services.
Poverty reduction is a major goal and issue for many international organizations such as the United Nations and the World Bank.
The World Bank estimated 1.29 billion people were living in absolute poverty in 2008.
of these, about 400 million people in absolute poverty lived in India and 173 million people in China.
In यूएसए 1 in 5 children lives in poverty.
in terms of percentage of regional populations, sub-Saharan Africa at 47 % था the highest incidence rate of absolute poverty in 2008.
between 1990 and 2010, about 663 million people moved above the absolute poverty level.
Still, extreme poverty is a global challenge ; it is observed in all parts of the world, including the developed economies.
Mushroom poisoning ( also known as mycetism ) refers to harmful effects from ingestion of toxic substances present in a mushroom.
These symptoms can vary from slight gastrointestinal discomfort to death.
The toxins present are secondary metabolites produced in specific biochemical pathways in the fungal कोशिकाएं.
Mushroom poisoning is usually the result of ingestion of जंगली mushrooms after misidentification of a toxic mushroom as an edible species.
The most आम reason for this misidentification is close resemblance in terms of colour and general morphology of the toxic मशरूम species with edible प्रजाति.
Even very experienced wild mushroom gatherers are upon rare occasion poisoned by eating toxic species, despite being well aware of the risks, through carelessness.
To prevent mushroom poisoning, mushroom gatherers need to be very familiar with the mushrooms they intend to collect as well as with any similar-looking toxic species.
In addition, edibility of mushrooms may depend on methods of preparation for cooking.
Collectors also need to be well aware that edibility or toxicity of some species varies with भौगोलिक location.
Human height is the distance from the bottom of the feet to the top of the head in a human देह, standing erect.
When populations share genetic background and environmental factors, average height is frequently characteristic within the group.
Exceptional height variation ( around 20 % deviation from average ) within such a population is sometimes due to gigantism or dwarfism, which are medical conditions caused by specific genes or endocrine abnormalities.
In regions of extreme poverty or prolonged warfare, environmental factors like chronic malnutrition during childhood or adolescence may account for delayed growth and/or ( in severe cases ) marked reductions in adult stature even without the presence of any of these medical conditions.
Apollo 11 थी the spaceflight that landed the पहला इंसानो, Americans Neil Armstrong और Buzz Aldrin, on the Moon on July 20, 1969, at 20:18 UTC.
Armstrong became the first to step onto the चंद्र surface 6 घंटों later on July 21 at 02:56 UTC.
Armstrong spent about two और a half hours outside the spacecraft, Aldrin slightly less ; and साथ they collected of lunar सामग्री for return to Earth.
A third member of the mission, Michael कॉलिन्स, piloted the command spacecraft alone in lunar orbit until Armstrong and Aldrin returned to it just under a day later for the trip back to Earth.
Launched by a Saturn V rocket from Kennedy Space Center in Merritt द्वीप, Florida on जुलाई 16, Apollo 11 was the पांचवां manned mission of NASA 's Apollo program.
The Apollo spacecraft had three parts : a Command Module with a cabin for the three astronauts which was the only part which landed back on Earth ; a Service Module which supported the Command Module with propulsion, electrical power, oxygen और water ; and a Lunar Module for landing on the Moon.
After being sent to the Moon by the Saturn V 's upper stage, the astronauts separated the spacecraft from it and travelled for three days until they entered into चंद्र orbit.
Armstrong and Aldrin then moved into the Lunar Module और landed in the Sea of tranquility.
They stayed a total of about 21 and a half hours on the चंद्र सतह.
After lifting off in the upper भाग of the Lunar Module and rejoining Collins in the Command Module, they returned to Earth and landed in the Pacific Ocean on जुलाई 24.
Broadcast on live TV to a world-wide audience, आर्मस्ट्रांग stepped onto the चंद्र surface and described the event as `` one small step for [ a ] man, one giant leap for mankind. ''
Apollo 11 effectively ended the Space Race and fulfilled a national लक्ष्य proposed in 1961 by the late U.S. President John F. कैनेडी in a speech before the United States Congress, `` before this decade is out, of landing a man on the Moon and returning him safely to the Earth. ''
The FIFA World Cup, often simply the World Cup, is an international association football competition contested by the senior men 's national teams of the members of Fédération Internationale de Football Association ( FIFA ), the sport 's global governing body.
The championship has महरूम awarded every four years since the inaugural tournament in 1930, except in 1942 and 1946 when it was not held because of the Second World War.
The current champions are स्पेन, who won the 2010 tournament.
The current format of the tournament involves 32 teams competing for the title at venues within the host nation ( s ) over a period of about a month ; this phase is often called the World कप Finals.
A qualification phase, which currently takes प्लेस over the preceding three years, is used to determine which teams qualify for the tournament together with the host nation ( s ).
The 19 World Cup tournaments have महरूम won by eight different नेशनल teams.
ब्राज़ील have won five times, and they are the only team to have played in every tournament.
The other World Cup winners are Italy, with four titles ; Germany, with three titles ; Argentina and inaugural winners Uruguay, with two titles each ; और इंग्लैण्ड, France, and Spain, with one title each.
The World Cup is the world 's most widely viewed sporting इवेंट ; an estimated 715.1 million people watched the final match of the 2006 FIFA World Cup held in Germany.
The next three World Cups will be hosted by Brazil in 2014, Russia in 2018, and Qatar in 2022.
Genocide is a term coined in 1944 by Raphael Lemkin to describe the deliberate and systematic destruction, in whole or in part, of an ethnic, racial, धार्मिक, or national group.
It is defined in Article 2 of the Convention on the Prevention और Punishment of the Crime of Genocide ( CPPCG ) of 1948 as `` any of the following acts committed साथ intent to destroy, in whole or in part, a national, ethnical, racial or religious समूह, as ऐसे : killing members of the group ; causing serious bodily or दिमागी harm to members of the group ; deliberately inflicting on the groups conditions of life, calculated to bring about its physical destruction in whole or in part ; imposing measures intended to prevent births within the group ; [ and ] forcibly transferring children of the group to another group. ''
Skulls of victims of the Rwandan Genocide
The preamble to the cppcg not only राज्य कि `` genocide is a crime अंतर्गत international विधि, contrary to the spirit और aims of the United राष्ट्र and condemned by the civilized world '', but also that `` at all periods of history genocide has inflicted great losses on humanity ''.
Determining what historical events constitute a genocide and which are merely criminal or inhuman behavior is not a clear-cut matter.
In nearly every case where accusations of genocide have circulated, partisans of विभिन्न sides have fiercely disputed the interpretation and details of the event, often to the point of promoting wildly different versions of the facts.
An accusation of genocide is certainly नहीं taken lightly and will almost always be controversial.
The following list of genocides and alleged genocides should be understood in this context and can not be regarded as the final word on these subjects.
A timing belt is a non-slipping mechanical drive belt and the term may refer to either:
Toothed belt, a flexible बेल्ट with teeth moulded onto its inner surface
Timing belt ( camshaft ), a toothed belt used to drive the camshaft ( s ) within an internal combustion इंजन
The culture of the United States is primarily a Western culture, but is also बहकावे by Native American, African, Asian, Polynesian, and Latin American cultures.
American culture started its formation over 10,000 years ago with the माइग्रेशन of Paleo-Indians from Asia into the region that is today the continental United States.
It has its own unique social and cultural characteristics such as dialect, music, arts, social habits, cuisine, and folklore.
The United States of America is an ethnically and racially diverse country as a result of large-scale immigration from many different countries throughout its history.
Its chief early European प्रभाव came from English, Scottish, Welsh and Irish settlers of colonial America during अंग्रेजों rule.
British culture, due to colonial ties with Britain that spread the English language, legal system and other cultural inheritances, had a formative influence.
Other important influences came from other भाग of western Europe, especially Germany, France, and Italy.
Original elements also play a strong role, ऐसे as the invention of Jeffersonian democracy.
Thomas Jefferson 's Notes on the State of Virginia was perhaps the first influential domestic cultural critique by an American and a reactionary piece to the prevailing European consensus that America 's domestic originality was degenerate.
Prevalent ideas and ideals that evolved domestically, such as national छुट्टियाँ, uniquely American sports, military tradition, and innovations in the arts and entertainment give a strong भाव of national pride among the population as a whole.
American culture includes both conservative and उदार elements, scientific and religious competitiveness, political structures, risk taking and free expression, materialist and moral elements.
Despite certain consistent ideological principles ( e.g. individualism, egalitarianism, and faith in freedom and democracy ), American culture has a variety of expressions due to इसके geographical scale and जनसांख्यिकी diversity.
The लचीलापन of U.S. culture and its highly symbolic nature lead some researchers to categorize American culture as a mythic identity ; others see it as American exceptionalism.
it also includes तत्व that evolved इससे Indigenous Americans, and other ethnic cultures—most prominently the culture of African Americans, cultures from Latin America, and Asian American cultures.
Many American cultural elements, especially from popular culture, have spread across the globe through आधुनिक mass media.
The United States रै often been thought of as a melting घट, but शुरूआत in the late 1990s and early 2000s, it trends towards cultural diversity, pluralism and the image of a salad bowl instead.
Due to the extent of American संस्कृति, there are many integrated but unique social subcultures within the United States.
The cultural affiliations an individual in the United States may have commonly depend on social class, political orientation and a multitude of demographic characteristics such as religious background, occupation और ethnic group membership.
Samoan ( Gagana fa'a Sāmoa or Gagana Sāmoa — IPA : ) is the language of the Samoan Islands, comprising the independent country of Samoa and the United राज्य territory of अमरीकी Samoa.
It is an official language—alongside अंग्रेज़ी —in both jurisdictions.
Samoan, a Polynesian language, is the first language for most of the Samoa Islands ' population of about 246,000.
With many samoan लोगों living in other countries, the total number of speakers worldwide is estimated at 370,000.
The language is notable for the phonological differences between formal and अनौपचारिक speech as well as a ceremonial form used in Samoan oratory.
A glucose tolerance test is a medical test in which glucose is given and blood samples taken afterward to determine कैसा जल्दी it is cleared from the blood.
The test is usually used to test for diabetes, insulin resistance, and sometimes reactive hypoglycemia and acromegaly, or rarer disorders of carbohydrate चयापचय.
In the most commonly performed version of the test, an oral glucose tolerance परीक्षण ( OGTT ), a standard dose of glucose is ingested by mouth and blood levels are checked two hours later.
Many variations of the GTT have महरूम devised over the years for various purposes, with different standard doses of ग्लूकोज, different रूट of administration, different intervals and durations of sampling, and various substances measured in addition to blood glucose.
`` What About Me '' is a song written by Garry Frost and Frances Swan, first recorded by Australian rock band Moving Pictures from their album दिनों of Innocence.
It was the बैंड 's पहला number-one single in ऑस्ट्रेलिया spending six लगातार सप्ताह on the top ; there, it was the second-highest selling single of 1982.
The success of the song led them to America where it became a hit, reaching # 29 on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart.
The song stayed in the U.S. charts for such a long time that it managed to make billboards top 100 Pop Singles of 1983, at # 88, a rare feat for a single with such a low peak position.
The song made an unusual comeback in 1989, peaking at # 46.
on the बाएँ a chicken egg, the egg most commonly eaten by humans, and on the right two quail अंडे
Eggs are laid by females of many different species, including birds, reptiles, amphibians, और मछली, and have been खाया by mankind for thousands of years.
Bird and reptile eggs consist of a protective eggshell, albumen ( egg white ), and vitellus ( egg yolk ), contained within various thin membranes.
Popular choices for egg consumption are chicken, duck, quail, roe, and caviar, but the egg most often consumed by humans is the chicken egg, by a wide margin.
Egg yolks and पूरे अंडे store significant amounts of protein और choline, and are widely used in cookery.
Due to their protein content, the United States Department of कृषि ( USDA ) categorizes अंडे as Meats within the Food Guide Pyramid.
Despite the nutritional मान of eggs, there are some potential health issues arising from egg quality, भंडार, and individual allergies.
Chickens and other egg-laying creatures are widely kept throughout the world, and mass production of chicken eggs is a वैश्विक industry.
in 2009, an estimated 62.1 million metric tons of eggs were produced worldwide from a total laying flock of approximately 6.4 अरब hens.
There are मुद्दे of regional variation in demand and expectation, as well as current debates concerning methods of mass production, साथ the European Union 's ban on battery खेती of chickens.
Major League Soccer ( MLS ) is a professional soccer league representing the sport 's उच्चतम level in the United States and Canada.
Sanctioned by the United States Soccer Federation ( u.S. Soccer ), the league is composed of 19 teams — 16 in the U.S. and 3 in Canada.
Seasons presently चलाएं from कूच to December, साथ each team playing 34 games in the regular season.
Ten teams compete in the postseason MLS कप playoffs culminating in the championship game, the MLS Cup.
Major League Soccer थी founded in 1993 as part of the United States ' bid to मेजबान the 1994 फीफा World Cup.
The first season took प्लेस in 1996 beginning with ten teams.
बजाय of operating as an association of independently स्वामित्व teams, MLS is a single entity where each team is owned and controlled by the league 's investors.
The league 's closed membership makes it one of the world 's few soccer लीग not using promotion and relegation.
The legality of cannabis varies from देश to country.
Possession of cannabis is illegal in most countries and has been since the beginning of widespread cannabis निषेध in the late 1930s.
However, many देशों have decriminalized the possession of small quantities of cannabis, particularly in North America, South America and Europe.
Furthermore, possession is legal or effectively legal in the Netherlands, North Korea and would be in the U.S. states of Colorado and Washington if it were not for federal law, which governs persons in all states.
The medicinal use of cannabis is विधिक in a number of countries, including Canada, the Czech Republic and इसराईल.
While federal law in the United States bans all sale and possession of cannabis, enforcement varies widely at the state level और some states have established medicinal marijuana programs in that खण्डन federal law ; two states ( Colorado and वॉशिंगटन ) have repealed their laws prohibiting the recreational use of cannabis और replaced उन्हें with a regulatory regime, also contrary to federal statute.
Some countries have laws that are not as vigorously prosecuted as others but, अलावा from the countries that प्रस्ताव access to medical marijuana, most countries have various penalties ranging from lenient to very severe.
Some infractions are taken more seriously in some countries than others in regard to the cultivation, use, possession or transfer of cannabis for recreational use.
A few jurisdictions have lessened penalties for possession of small quantities of cannabis, making it punishable by confiscation and a fine, rather than imprisonment.
Some क्षेत्राधिकारs/ drug न्यायालयों use mandatory treatment programs for young or frequent users, with freedom from narcotic drugs as the goal and a few jurisdictions permit cannabis use for medicinal purposes.
वहीँ are also changes in a more restrictive दिशा as in कनाडा.
Drug tests to detect cannabis are increasingly common in many countries and have resulted in jail sentences and people losing उनके jobs.
However, simple possession can carry long jail वाक्य in कुछ countries, विशेषकर in parts of East Asia and Southeast Asia जहाँ the sale of cannabis may सीसे to a sentence of life in prison or even execution.
In cardiovascular physiology, ejection भिन्न ( EF ) represents the volumetric fraction of blood pumped आउट of the ventricle ( heart ) with प्रत्येक heart ताल or cardiac साईकिल.
it can be applied to either the right ventricle which ejects via the pulmonary valve into the pulmonary circulation or the left ventricle जिससे ejects via the aortic valve into the systemic circulation.
Imaging of the physiology of the mammalian heart is the art that allows meaningful गणितीय expression defining EF.
Noninvasive cardiac imaging has become a worldwide utility enabling study of cardiac performance reproducibly and inexpensively.
Simplified, Ejection fraction is a mathematical product allowed by cardiac imaging.
As a mathematical term, Ejection Fraction is an extension of the work of Adolph Fick in cardiac output.
Dedicated प्रौद्योगिकी ऐसे as Echocardiography, Computed टोमोग्राफी, Magnetic Resonance इमेजिंग and MUGA scanning have definitively allowed clinically प्रासंगिक mathematics regarding Ischemia, Congenital Heart Disease and Heart Failure.
State Route 14 ( SR 14 ) is a north–south state highway in the u.S. state of California, largely in the Mojave Desert.
The southern portion of the highway is signed as the Antelope घाटी Freeway.
The route connects Interstate 5, or Golden राज्य Freeway, near Santa Clarita and साथ U.S. रूट 395 near Inyokern.
legislatively, the रूट extends south of I-5 to State Route 1 in the Pacific Palisades क्षेत्रफल of Los Angeles, however the portion south of the junction with I-5 has नहीं been constructed.
The southern part of the constructed route is a busy commuter freeway सेवारत and connecting the समुदायों of Santa Clarita, Palmdale and Lancaster with the rest of the Greater Los एंजिल्स area.
The northern portion, from Vincent ( south of palmdale ) to Route 395, is legislatively named the Aerospace राजमार्ग, as the highway serves Edwards Air Force Base, once one of the प्राथमिक landing strips for NASA 's Space Shuttle.
This section is rural, following the line between the hot Mojave desert and the forming Sierra Nevada mountain range.
Most of Route 14 is loosely paralleled by a main line of the Southern Pacific Railroad, used for the Antelope Valley लकीर of the Metrolink commuter rail system as well as a connection between Los Angeles and the California Central Valley via Tehachapi Pass.
Linked with US 395, इस road connects Los Angeles with such places as Mammoth Mountain, Mono Lake, Yosemite National Park and Reno, Nevada.
Route 14 was part of U.S. Route 6 prior to truncation in 1964, when U.S. 6 was a coast-to-coast route इससे Long Beach to Provincetown, Massachusetts.
The non-freeway segment of SR 14 from Silver Queen Road north of Rosamond to Mojave is known as Sierra Highway, as is the बूढ़ा routing between अंतरराज्यीय 5 and Silver Queen Road where SR 14 has been moved to a newer freeway alignment.
Portions of Route 14 remain signed with names संबद्ध with US 6, including Midland Trail, Theodore Roosevelt Highway and Grand Army of the Republic Highway.
This रूट is part of the कैलिफ़ोर्निया Freeway और Expressway System.
Blindness is the कंडीशन of lacking visual perception due to physiological or neurological factors.
Various scales have been developed to describe the extent of vision loss and define blindness.
Total blindness is the complete lack of form and visual light perception and is clinically recorded as NLP, an abbreviation for `` no light perception. ''
Blindness is frequently used to describe severe visual impairment with vision.
Those described as having only light perception have no more sight than the ability to tell light from dark and the general direction of a light source.
To determine which people may need special assistance because of their visual disabilities, विभिन्न governmental jurisdictions have formulated more जटिल परिभाषाएं referred to as legal blindness.
In North America and most of Europe, legal blindness is defined as visual acuity ( vision ) of 20/200 ( 6/60 ) or कम in the better eye with best correction possible.
This means that a legally अँधा individual would have to stand from an object to देखिए it—with corrective lenses —with the same degree of clarity as a normally sighted व्यक्ति could from.
In many areas, people with average acuity जो nonetheless have a visual field of कम than 20 degrees ( the norm being 180 degrees ) are also classified as being legally blind.
Approximately ten percent of those deemed legally blind, by any measure, have no vision.
The rest have some दृष्टि, from light perception alone to relatively good acuity.
कम vision is sometimes used to describe visual acuities from 20/70 to 20/200.
By the 10th Revision of the WHO अंतरराष्ट्रीय Statistical वर्गीकरण of Diseases, Injuries and Causes of Death, कम vision is defined as विज़ुअल acuity of less than 20/60 ( 6/18 ), but equal to or बेहतर than 20/200 ( 6/60 ), or corresponding visual फ़ील्ड loss to less than 20 degrees, in the better eye with best possible correction.
Blindness is defined as visual acuity of less than 20/400 ( 6/120 ), or सम्बन्धित visual फ़ील्ड loss to less than 10 degrees, in the बेहतर eye with best possible correction.
Blind people with undamaged eyes may still पंजीकरण light non-visually for the purpose of circadian entrainment to the 24-hour light/dark cycle.
Light signals for this purpose travel through the retinohypothalamic tract and are not affected by optic nerve damage beyond where the retinohypothalamic tract exits.
Earl Simmons ( born December 18, 1970 ), बेहतर known by his stage names DMX and Dark Man X, is an American rapper and actor.
in 1999, DMX released his best-selling album... And Then There Was X, which प्रदर्शित the hit single `` Party Up ( up in Here ) ``.
He has acted in films such as Belly, Romeo Must Die, Exit Wounds, Cradle 2 The संगीन, and Last Hour.

In 2003, DMX published a book of his memoirs entitled, E.A.R.L. : The Autobiography of DMX.
DMX released a mixtape The Weigh In as a prelude/promotion towards his album Undisputed ( 2012 ).
DMX has sold over 30 million records worldwide, making him one of the best-selling hip-hop artists of all time.
Professional certification, trade certification, or professional नामांकन, often called simply certification or qualification, is a designation earned by a person to assure qualification to perform a job or task.
Not all certifications that use post-nominal letters are an acknowledgement of educational achievement, or an agency appointed to safeguard the public ब्याज.
Bugs Bunny is a funny animal कार्टून character, best remembered for his starring roles in the Looney Tunes and Merrie Melodies series of theatrical short films produced by Warner Bros. during the Golden age of American animation.
His लोकप्रियता during this era led to his becoming a corporate mascot of Warner Bros. entertainment.

What 's up, doc ? ''
( usually said while chewing a carrot ).

In reality, he was brought to life by the animators and staff of Leon schlesinger Productions ( later Warner Bros. Cartoons ) : including Tex Avery, who directed Bugs ' जल्दी definitive short A Wild Hare ( 1940 ) ; Robert McKimson, who created Bugs ' definitive character design ; and Mel Blanc, who originated the voice of Bugs.
the mucous membranes ( or mucosae or mucosas ; singular mucosa ) are linings of mostly endodermal origin, covered in epithelium, which are involved in absorption and secretion.
They line cavities that are exposed to the external environment और internal organs.
They are at अनेक स्थान contiguous with skin : at the नथुनों, the होठ of the mouth, the eyelids, the ears, the genital area, and the anus.
the स्टिकी, thick fluid secreted by the श्लेष्मक membranes and ग्रंथियों is termed mucus.
The term mucous membrane refers to where they are found in the body and not every mucous membrane secretes mucus.
The glans clitoridis, glans शिश्न ( head of the penis ), along with the inside of the foreskin और the clitoral hood, are mucous membranes.
The urethra is also a mucous membrane.
The secreted mucus traps the pathogens in the body, preventing any further activities of diseases.

Cake is a form of ब्रैड or bread-like खाना.
In its modern forms, it is typically a मीठी baked dessert.
In its oldest फ़ॉर्म, cakes were normally fried breads or cheesecakes, and normally had a disk shape.
Determining whether a दिए food should be classified as bread, cake, or pastry can be difficult.
Modern cake, विशेषकर परत cakes, normally contain a combination of flour, शुगर, eggs, और butter or oil, with कुछ किस्में also requiring liquid ( typically milk or water ) and leavening agents ( such as yeast or baking powder ).
Flavorful ingredients like fruit purées, nuts, dried or candied fruit, or extracts are often added, and numerous substitutions for the primary ingredients हैं possible.
Cakes are often filled with fruit preserves or dessert sauces ( जैसे pastry cream ), आइस्ड with buttercream or other icings, and decorated साथ marzipan, piped borders or candied fruit.
Cake is often the dessert of choice for meals at ceremonial occasions, particularly weddings, वर्षगांठ, and birthdays.
There हैं countless केक recipes ; some are bread-like, some rich and elaborate, and many are centuries old.
केक making is no longer a complicated procedure ; while at one time considerable मजदूर went into cake making ( विशेषकर the whisking of egg foams ), baking equipment and directions have been simplified so that even the most amateur cook may bake a cake.

it is part of the Madison Metropolitan Statistical Area.
Public policy is the principled guide to action taken by the administrative executive branches of the state with regard to a class of issues in a manner consistent with विधि and institutional कस्टम.
In सामान्य, the foundation is the pertinent national and substantial constitutional law और implementing legislation such as the US Federal code.
Further substrates include both judicial interpretations और regulations which are generally authorized by legislation.
Other scholars define it as a system of `` पाठ्यक्रम of action, regulatory measures, कानून, and funding priorities concerning a given टॉपिक promulgated by a governmental entity or its representatives. ''
Public policy is commonly embodied `` in constitutions, legislative acts, and judicial decisions. ''
In the United States, this concept refers not only to the result of policies, लकिन more broadly to the decision-making and analysis of governmental decisions.
As an academic discipline, public policy is studied by professors और students at public policy schools of major universities throughout the country.
The U.S. professional association of public policy practitioners, researchers, scholars, and students is the Association for Public नीति Analysis and Management.
पाचन is the mechanical and chemical breakdown of food into smaller components that are more easily absorbed into a blood stream, for instance.
Digestion is a form of catabolism : a breakdown of विशाल food molecules to smaller ones.
When खाना enters the mouth, digestion of the खाना starts by the कार्रवाई of mastication, a form of mechanical digestion, and the wetting contact of saliva.
Saliva, a liquid secreted by the salivary ग्रंथियों, contains salivary amylase, an enzyme which starts the पाचन of starch in the food.
After undergoing mastication and starch पाचन, the food will be in the form of a small, round slurry mass called a bolus.
It will then travel down the esophagus और into the stomach by the कार्रवाई of peristalsis.
Gastric juice in the stomach starts प्रोटीन digestion.
Gastric juice mainly contains hydrochloric acid and pepsin.
As these two chemicals may damage the stomach wall, mucus is secreted by the पेट, providing a slimy layer that acts as a shield against the damaging effects of the chemicals.
At the same time protein digestion is occurring, mechanical mixing occurs by peristalsis, which are waves of muscular contractions that मूव साथ the stomach wall.
This allows the mass of food to further mix with the digestive enzymes.
After some time ( typically an hour or two in humans, 4–6 hours in dogs, somewhat shorter duration in house cats ), the resulting thick liquid is called chyme.
When the pyloric sphincter valve opens, chyme enters the duodenum where it mixes with digestive enzymes from the pancreas, and then passes through the small intestine, in which digestion continues.
When the chyme is fully digested, it is absorbed into the blood.
95 % of absorption of nutrients occurs in the छोटी intestine.
Water and minerals हैं reabsorbed back into the blood in the कोलन ( large intestine ) where the pH is slightly acidic about 5.6 ~ 6.9.
Some विटामिन, such as biotin and विटामिन K ( K2MK7 ) उत्पादित by bacteria in the कोलन are also absorbed into the blood in the colon.
Waste material is eliminated from the rectum during defecation.
Henry VIII ( 28 June 1491 – 28 January 1547 ) was king of England from 21 April 1509 until his death.
He was lord, and बाद king, of Ireland, as well as continuing the nominal claim by the English monarchs to the किंगडम of France.
Henry थी the second monarch of the Tudor dynasty, succeeding उसके father, Henry VII.
Besides his छह marriages, Henry viii is known for his role in the separation of the Church of England from the Roman Catholic Church.
Henry 's struggles साथ Rome led to the विरह of the Church of England from papal authority, the Dissolution of the Monasteries, and his own establishment as the Supreme Head of the Church of England.
Yet he remained a believer in core कैथोलिक theological teachings, even after his excommunication from the Roman Catholic Church.
Henry oversaw the legal union of England and Wales with the Laws in Wales अधिनियमों 1535 and 1542.
In 1513, the new king allied with the Holy Roman Emperor, maximillian I, and invaded France in 1513 with a large, well-equipped army, but achieved little at a considerable financial cost.
Maximillian, for his part, प्रयुक्त the English invasion to his own ends, और this prejudiced England 's ability to defeat the French.
This foray would prove the start of an obsession for Henry, who invaded again in 1544.
इस time, Henry 's forces captured the important नगर of Boulogne, but again the Holy Roman Emperor, Charles V, supported Henry only as long as he needed to and England, strained by the विशाल cost of the युद्ध, ransomed the city back for peace.
उसके contemporaries considered Henry in his prime to be an attractive, educated and accomplished king, and he has been described as `` one of the most charismatic rulers to sit on the English throne ''.
Besides ruling with absolute शक्ति, he also engaged himself as an author and composer.
His ख्वाहिश to provide England with a male heir – which stemmed partly from personal vanity and partly because he believed a daughter would be unable to consolidate the Tudor dynasty and the fragile peace that existed following the Wars of the Roses – led to the two things for which Henry is most remembered : his six marriages and the English Reformation.
Henry became morbidly obese and his health suffered, contributing to his death in 1547.
He is frequently characterised in his बाद life as a lustful, egotistical, harsh, and insecure king.
Bongos ( स्पेनी : bongó ) are an Afro-Cuban percussion instrument.
The drums are of different size : the larger drum is called in Spanish the hembra ( female ) and the smaller the macho ( पुरूष ).
They are membranophones, or instruments that create ध्वनि by a vibration of a stretched membrane.
Different धार्मिक groups include different books in their Biblical canons, in varying orders, and sometimes divide or combine books, or incorporate additional material into canonical books.
Christian Bibles range from the sixty-six books of the Protestant canon to the eighty-one books of the Ethiopian परंपरागत Tewahedo Church canon.
The Hebrew Bible, or Tanakh, contains twenty-four books divided into three parts ; the five books of the Torah ( `` teaching '' or `` law '' ), the Nevi'im ( `` prophets '' ), and the Ketuvim ( `` writings '' ).
The first part of ईसाई Bibles is the Old Testament, which contains, at minimum, the twenty-four books of the Hebrew Bible divided into thirty-nine books and ordered differently from the Hebrew बाइबल.
The Catholic Church and Eastern Christian churches also hold निश्चित deuterocanonical books and passages to be part of the Old Testament canon.
The second part is the New Testament, containing twenty-seven books ; the four Canonical gospels, अधिनियमों of the रसूलों, twenty-one Epistles or letters and the Book of Revelation.
The Eastern Orthodox, Oriental Orthodox and Eastern Catholic churches may have minor मतभेद in their lists of accepted books.
The list given here for these churches is the most समावेशी : if at least one पूर्वी church accepts the किताब it is included here.
the national flag of the United States of America, often simply referred to as the American flag, consists of thirteen equal horizontal stripes of रेड ( top and bottom ) alternating with white, साथ a blue rectangle in the canton ( referred to specifically as the `` संघ '' ) bearing fifty small, white, five-pointed stars arranged in nine offset आड़ा पंक्ति of six stars ( top and bottom ) alternating with rows of five stars.
The 50 stars on the flag represent the 50 states of the United States of America और the 13 stripes represent the तेरह अंग्रेजों colonies that declared independence from the Kingdom of Great Britain and became the first states in the Union.
Nicknames for the flag include the `` Stars and धारियाँ '', `` Old Glory ``, and `` The Star-Spangled Banner. ''
Dred स्कॉट v. Sandford,, भी known as the Dred Scott निर्णय, was a landmark decision by the U.S. Supreme Court.
It made two main rulings.
The पहला ruling थी कि African-Americans were not citizens, and therefore had no standing to sue in federal court.
the second ruling was that the federal government had no शक्ति to regulate slavery in any territory acquired subsequent to the सृष्टि of the United States.
Given the पहला ruling, most scholars and अनेक contemporary political figures ( सहित the नेतृत्व of the then-new Republican पार्टी ) considered कि the second ruling was not binding precedent, but mere dictum.
The rationale of the Supreme Court regarding the jurisdictional ruling implied that people of African descent ( both slave and free ) were not protected by the Constitution and were not U.S. citizens.
Since passage of the 14th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, दोनो rulings are superseded and no longer valid precedent.
Nonetheless, the case retains historical significance as it is widely regarded as the worst decision ever made by the Supreme Court.
The opinion of the court, written by Chief Justice Roger B. Taney, stirred debate.
the decision was 7–2, and every Justice besides Taney wrote a separate concurrence or dissent.
For the first time since Marbury v. Madison, the Court held an Act of Congress to be unconstitutional.
Dred Scott, an African-American slave, had asked a संयुक्त States Circuit Court to award him his freedom because he and his master था resided in a state ( Illinois ) and a territory ( Wisconsin Territory ) where slavery had been banned.
Chief Justice Roger Taney, writing for the court, held that स्कॉट, as a person of African ancestry, was not a citizen of the United States and therefore had no right to sue in संघीय court.
इस holding was contrary to the practice of numerous states at the time, particularly Free states, where free blacks किया in fact enjoy the rights of citizens, ऐसे as the right to vote and hold public office.
In what is sometimes considered mere obiter dictum, the Court गई on to hold that Congress had no authority to prohibit slavery in संघीय territories because slaves are personal property and the पांचवां Amendment to the Constitution protects property owners against पिछडे of their property बगैर due process of law.
In reaching this decision, Taney had hoped to settle the growing controversy surrounding slavery in the United States, but it had the opposite effect.
The decision was fiercely debated across the country, as perhaps best exemplified by the Lincoln–Douglas debates of 1858.
Abraham Lincoln, the second-ever Republican nominee लिये President, was able to जीत the presidential election in 1860 ; the stopping of the further expansion of slavery was a कुंजी Republican पार्टी plank.
The decision played an important role in the timing of state secession and the Civil War, although it is extreme to say the निर्णय `` caused '' the war.
The निर्णय is acknowledged for the influential role it played in altering the national political landscape : it is credited with launching Abraham Lincoln’s national political career and ultimately allowing for his election.
Although the Supreme Court has never explicitly overruled the Dred Scott case, the Court stated in the Slaughter-House Cases that at least one part of it had already been overruled by the Fourteenth Amendment in 1868, which begins by stating, `` All persons born or naturalized in the United States, and विषय to the jurisdiction thereof, are citizens of the United States and of the State wherein they reside. ''
To जिससे the Court noted:
The first observation we have to make on this clause is, कि it puts at rest both the questions which we stated to have been the subject of मतभेद of opinion.
It declares that persons may be citizens of the United राज्य बगैर regard to their नागरिकता of a particular State, and it overturns the dred Scott निर्णय by बनाना all persons born within the United States and subject to its jurisdiction citizens of the United States.
वहीँ are dozens of neighborhoods in Columbus, Ohio.
Some are hard to define, as they encompass large areas विकसित at different times—often with sub-neighborhoods within them.
Borders can also change based on popular understanding of the area, as well as the whims of the residents.
This article uses data from the Datasourcecolumbus Web site, Spotcrime.com, HelloColumbus.com, as well as the विभिन्न Columbus Area Commissions to define the various areas.
Excerpts and border सूचना are drawn directly from the main articles.
A biologist is a scientist who studies living organisms and their relationship to their environment.
Biologists involved in basic research attempt to discover underlying mechanisms that govern how organisms work.
Biologists involved in applied research attempt to develop or improve medical, industrial or agricultural processes.

Base jumping from a चट्टान in a wingsuit.
BASE jumping, also sometimes written as b.a.s.e. कूद, is an activity where participants जम्प from fixed objects and उपयोग a parachute to break their fall.
`` BASE '' is an acronym that stands for चार categories of fixed objects इससे which one can jump : buildings, antennas, spans ( bridges ), and earth ( cliffs ).
the British Shorthair is a domesticated cat whose features make it a popular breed in cat shows.
It has been the most लोकप्रिय breed of cat पंजीकृत by the UK 's Governing Council of the Cat Fancy ( GCCF ) since 2001, when it overtook the Persian नस्ल.
The USA Basketball मेन 's Senior National Team, commonly known as the United States men 's national basketball team, represents the United States of America in अंतरराष्ट्रीय men 's basketball.
The USA is the सबसे successful team in international competition, winning medals in all seventeen Olympic tournaments it has entered, coming away साथ fourteen golds.
दो of its gold medal-winning squads were inducted to the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame as teams in अगस्त 2010—the 1960 team, जिससे featured six हॉल of Famers ( 4 players, 2 coaches ), and the 1992 `` Dream Team '', featuring 14 Hall of Famers ( 11 players, 3 coaches ).
The United States is currently ranked first in the FIBA World Rankings.
Traditionally composed of amateur players, a 1989 rule change by FIBA allowed USA Basketball to field teams with professional players.
The first such team, ज्ञात as the `` Dream Team '', won the gold medal at the 1992 Summer Olympics in Barcelona, Spain, playing in the final against Croatia.
With the introduction of professionals, the team was able to spark a second run of dominance after capturing only a bronze medal in 1988.
a team of पेशेवर players competed at the 1994 FIBA World Championship, finishing first.
In 1996, 2000, 2008, and 2012 the USA again captured सुनहरा medals.
Facing increased competition, the USA failed to win a पदक at the 2002 FIBA World Championship, finishing sixth.
The 2004 गर्मियाँ Olympic टोली lost three games on its way to a bronze medal, a record that represented more losses in a single year than the country 's Olympic teams had suffered in all previous Olympiads combined.
Determined to put an end to these failures, USA Basketball initiated a long-term project aimed at creating better, more cohesive teams.
The USA won its first seven games at the 2006 FIBA World Championship in Japan before losing against Greece in the semi-finals, ending the competition with the कांस्य medal.
The USA won gold two years later, though, at the 2008 गर्मियाँ Olympics with a प्रबल performance.
इस success was followed up at the 2010 FIBA World Championship, where despite क्षेत्ररक्षण a roster featuring no players from the 2008 Olympic team, the USA did not lose a single game en route to defeating host Turkey for the सुनहरा medal.
The USA continued this streak of दबदबा by going undefeated and capturing gold once more at the 2012 Summer Olympics.

Joe Theismann 's Super Bowl Ring ( right )
The Super Bowl ring is an award in the National Football League दिए to the winners of the league 's annual संसार Championship खेल, the Super Bowl.
Since only one Vince Lombardi Trophy is awarded to the team ( ownership ) itself, the Super Bowl ring offers a collectible memento for the actual players and team members to keep for themselves to symbolize the victory.
