It also ran on Nickelodeon and the Faith and Values Channel/Odyssey ( now the Hallmark Channel ) as well as many PBS stations throughout the United States.
It was set in a department store, based on the flagship location of the now defunct Simpson 's in Toronto.
Many sequences for it were shot at the Queen गली West and Yonge Street स्टोर after hours.
Constitutionalism, in its most general meaning, is `` a complex of ideas, attitudes, and patterns of behavior elaborating the principle कि the authority of government derives from and is limited by a body of fundamental law ''.
A political organization is constitutional to the extent कि it `` contain [ s ] institutionalized mechanisms of power control for the protection of the interests and liberties of the citizenry, including those that may be in the अल्पसंख्यक ``.
As described by political scientist and constitutional scholar David fellman :
An ice-cream headache, also known as brain freeze, cold-stimulus headache, or its given scientific name sphenopalatine ganglioneuralgia ( meaning `` nerve pain of the sphenopalatine ganglion `` ), is a form of brief cranial पीड़ा or headache commonly associated with consumption ( particularly quick consumption ) of cold beverages or foods such as ice cream and ice चबूतरे.
It is caused by having something cold touch the roof of the mouth ( palate ), and is believed to result from a nerve response causing rapid constriction and swelling of blood vessels or a `` referring `` of pain from the roof of the mouth to the head.
The rate of intake for cold foods has been studied as a contributing factor.
There are people who can not experience `` brain freeze '' or समान symptoms.
the term ice-cream headache has been in use चूंकि at least 31 January 1937, contained in a journal entry by रेबेका Timbres published in the 1939 book We did n't ask Utopia : a Quaker family in Soviet Russia.
The first प्रकाशित use of the term brain freeze, as it pertains to cold-induced headaches, was on 27 May 1991.
`` Auld Lang Syne '' ( : नोट `` s '' rather than `` z '' ) is a Scots poem written by Robert Burns in 1788 and set to the tune of a traditional folk song ( Roud # 6294 ).
It is well known in many countries, especially in the English-speaking world ; its traditional use being to celebrate the start of the New Year at the stroke of midnight.
by extension, it is also sung at funerals, graduations and as a farewell or ending to other occasions.
The international Boy Scout youth movement, in many countries, uses it as a close to jamborees and other functions.
The song 's Scots title may be translated into English literally as `` old long since '', or more idiomatically, `` long long ago '', `` days gone by '' or `` old times ''.
Consequently `` For auld lang syne '', as it appears in the first line of the chorus, might be loosely translated as `` for ( the sake of ) old times ''.
The phrase `` Auld Lang Syne '' is also used in similar poems by Robert ayton ( 1570–1638 ), Allan Ramsay ( 1686–1757 ), and James Watson ( 1711 ) as well as पुरानी folk songs predating Burns.
Matthew Fitt uses the phrase `` In the days of auld lang syne '' as the equivalent of `` Once upon a time...
`` in his retelling of fairy tales in the Scots भाषा.
Ben Schulz, player of Leeroy Jenkins at BlizzCon 2007
Leeroy Jenkins, sometimes misspelled Leroy Jenkins and often elongated साथ numerous अतिरिक्त letters, is an Internet मीम नामित for a खिलाड़ी character निर्मित by Ben Schulz in Blizzard Entertainment 's MMORPG, World of warcraft.
The character became popular due to a video of the game that परिचालित around the Internet.
The phenomenon has चूंकि spread beyond the boundaries of the गेमिंग जातियाँ into other online and mainstream media.
Oscar Grant was fatally shot by BART police officer Johannes Mehserle in Oakland, California, United States, in the early morning hours of New Year 's Day 2009.
Responding to reports of a fight on a crowded Bay Area रैपिड Transit train returning from San Francisco, BART Police officers detained Oscar Grant and several अन्य passengers on the platform at the Fruitvale BART Station.
Officer Johannes mehserle and another अधिकारी were restraining Grant, who थी सजदा and allegedly resisting arrest.
Officer Mehserle stood and, according to witnesses, said : `` Get back, I 'm gon na tase him. ''
Then Mehserle drew his gun and shot Grant once in the back ; Mehserle appeared stunned, put his hands to his head and exclaimed, `` Oh, my God ! ''
During उसके court testimony, Mehserle said that Grant then exclaimed, `` You शॉट me ! ''
Grant turned out to be unarmed ; he was pronounced dead the next morning at Highland Hospital in Oakland.
The events were captured on multiple digital video and cell phone cameras.
The फुटेज was disseminated to media outlets and to various websites, where it was watched लाखो of टाइम्स.
The following days saw both peaceful and violent protests.
The shooting has been variously labeled an involuntary manslaughter और a summary execution.
On January 13, Alameda County prosecutors charged Mehserle with murder for the shooting.
He resigned his position and pleaded not guilty.
The trial began on June 10, 2010.
Michael Rains, Mehserle 's criminal रक्षा attorney, argued कि Mehserle mistakenly shot ग्रान्ट with his pistol, intending to use his Taser when he देखी Grant reaching for his waistband.
Pretrial filings argue कि his client did not commit first-degree murder and asked a Los Angeles judge to instruct the jury to सीमा इसके deliberations to either second-degree murder or acquittal.
Oakland civil rights attorney John Burris filed a $ 25 million wrongful death claim against BART on behalf of Grant 's family.
On July 8, 2010, the jury returned its verdict : Mehserle थी मिला अपराधी of involuntary manslaughter and not guilty of second-degree murder and voluntary manslaughter.
Initial protests against the ruling were peacefully organized ; लूटने, arson, destruction of property, and small riots broke out after अंधेरा.
Nearly 80 people were आखिरकार arrested.
On Friday, जुलाई 9, 2010, the U.S. Justice Department opened a civil rights case against Mehserle ; the federal government can prosecute him independently for the same act under the separate sovereigns exception to double jeopardy.
The Department of Justice will be working with the U.S. Attorney 's office in San फ्रांसिस्को और the FBI.
On November 5, 2010, Mehserle was sentenced to two years, minus time served.
He served his time in the Los Angeles County Jail, occupying a private cell away from other prisoners.
He was released on June 13, 2011 and is now on parole.
Major representatives of the Harlem Renaissance.
The Harlem Renaissance was a सांस्कृतिक movement that spanned the 1920s.
At the time, it थी known as the `` New Negro Movement '', named after the 1925 anthology by Alain Locke.
Though it was centered in the हार्लेम neighborhood of New York City, many French-speaking black writers from African and Caribbean colonies who lived in पेरिस were also बहकावे by the Harlem Renaissance.
The Harlem Renaissance is unofficially recognized to have spanned from about 1919 until the early or mid-1930s.
Many of its ideas lived on much longer.
The zenith of this `` flowering of Negro literature '', as James Weldon Johnson preferred to call the Harlem Renaissance, was placed between 1924 ( the साल that Opportunity : a Journal of Negro Life hosted a party for black writers where many white publishers were in attendance ) and 1929 ( the साल of the stock market crash and the beginning of the Great Depression ).
African राज्य between 500 BCE and 1500 CE
Obelisk at temple of Luxor, Egypt.
c. 1200 BCE.
African knight of Baguirmi in full padded armour suit.
The history of Africa begins with the prehistory of Africa and the emergence of Homo sapiens in East Africa, continuing into the present as a patchwork of diverse and politically developing nation states.
Some early evidence of agriculture in Africa dates from 16,000 bce, and metallurgy from about 4000 bce.
The recorded history of early civilization arose in Egypt, and later in Nubia, the Maghreb and the Horn of Africa.
During the Middle Ages, Islam spread through the regions.
Crossing the Maghreb and the Sahel, a major बीच of Muslim culture was Timbuktu.
Some notable pre-colonial states and societies in Africa शामिल the Nok culture, Mali Empire, Ashanti Empire, Kingdom of Mapungubwe, Kingdom of Sine, Kingdom of Saloum, Kingdom of Baol, Kingdom of Zimbabwe, Kingdom of Kongo, Ancient Carthage, Numidia, Mauretania, the Aksumite Empire, the Ajuuraan State and the Adal Sultanate.
From the लेट 15th century, europeans and arabs took slaves from वेस्ट, Central and Southeast Africa overseas in the African slave trade.
European colonization of Africa developed rapidly in the Scramble for Africa of the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
Following struggles for independence in many parts of the continent, as well as a weakened Europe after the Second World War ; decolonization took place.
अफ़्रीकी 's history has been challenging for researchers in the field of African studies because of the scarcity of written sources in large parts of sub-Saharan Africa.
Scholarly techniques such as the recording of oral history, historical linguistics, archaeology and genetics have been crucial.
Curry फोली थी the first player in Major League Baseball history to hit for the cycle.
in baseball, hitting for the cycle is the accomplishment of one batter hitting a single, a double, a triple, and a home run in the same game.
Collecting the hits in that order is ज्ञात as a `` natural cycle ''.
Cycles are uncommon in Major लीग Baseball ( MLB ), and have occurred 294 times since the first by curry Foley in 1882.
The साईकिल is roughly as common as a no-hitter ( 279 occurrences in MLB history ) ; it has been called `` एक of the rarest '' and `` most difficult feats '' in baseball.
Based on 2009 offensive levels, the probability of an average MLB खिलाड़ी hitting for a cycle against an average team in a game is approximately 0.00590 % ; this corresponds to about 2.5 cycles in a 162-game season साथ 30 teams.
In other baseball लीग, the cycle is achieved less frequently.
through September 4, 2008, 62 players in Nippon Professional Baseball ( NPB ), the top-level baseball organization in जापानी, have hit for the cycle, the most recent being Michihiro ogasawara.
Two players have hit for the cycle on the same day once in NPB history ; this has occurred twice in एमएलबी history.
One NPB player has also hit for the cycle in an NPB All-Star game.
No player रै ever hit for the cycle in the MLB All-Star Game or the postseason.
The main slave रूट in medieval Africa.
This article discusses systems, इतिहास, and effects of slavery within Africa.
See Arab स्लेव trade, Atlantic slave trade, maafa, and Slavery in contemporary Africa for अन्य discussions.
`` Slave transport in Africa ''.
Europeans usually did not डालें the interior regions.
गुलामी in Africa has existed throughout the continent लिये many centuries, and continues in the current day.
प्रणालियों of servitude and slavery were common in many parts of the continent, as they were in much of the ancient world.
In most African societies where slavery was prevalent, the enslaved people were largely treated as indentured servants and not treated as chattel slaves.
When the Arab slave trade and Atlantic slave trade began, अनेक of the local slave systems changed and began supplying captives for slave markets outside of Africa.
गुलामी in historical Africa was practiced in many different forms and some of these do not clearly fit the definitions of slavery elsewhere in the world.
Debt slavery, enslavement of war captives, military slavery, and criminal slavery were all practiced in various भाग of अफ़्रीकी.
Although वहीँ had been some trans-Saharan trade इससे the interior of Sub-Saharan Africa to other regions, slavery was a small part of the economic जीवन of many societies in Africa until the introduction of transcontinental slave ट्रेड ( Arab and Atlantic ).
Slave practices were again transformed with European colonization of Africa and the formal abolition of गुलामी in the early 1900s.
Windows Task Manager is a task manager or System monitor application included with the Microsoft खिड़कियाँ NT family of ऑपरेटिंग systems that provides limited सूचना about computer प्रदर्शन and running applications, processes and CPU usage, commit charge and मेमोरी information, network activity and statistics, logged-in users, और system services ( and as often is the case साथ software tools provided by Microsoft for Windows, 3rd party software is available which fills the requirements more thoroughly, e.g, `` Process Explorer '', `` Extended Task Manager '', `` Anvir Task Manager '', `` Process Hacker '', and `` System Explorer '' ).
The Task Manager can also be प्रयुक्त to set प्रक्रम प्राथमिकताएं, processor affinity, forcibly terminate processes, and shut down, restart, hibernate or log off from Windows.
Windows Task Manager was introduced with Windows NT 4.0.
Previous versions of Windows NT included the Task List application, जिससे had far कम सुविधाएँ.
The task list was capable of लिस्टिंग currently running processes and killing them, or creating a new process.
In Windows XP only, a Shutdown menu is also present that allows access to Standby, Hibernate, Turn off, Restart, Log Off and Switch User.
Earlier versions of Microsoft Windows ( Microsoft Windows 3.x, Windows 95, Windows 98 ) had a program known as tasks to display the programs currently running.
This file was executed by running the taskman.exe file from the C : \Windows directory.

Sparsely आबादी in relation to its area, the Democratic Republic of the Congo ( DRC ) is घर to a vast potential of natural resources and mineral wealth, its untapped deposits of raw minerals are estimated to be worth in excess of US $ 24 trillion, yet the economy of the DRC has declined drastically since the mid-1980s.
At the time of its independence in 1960, DRC was the second most industrialized country in Africa after South Africa ; it boasted a thriving खनन sector and its agriculture sector was relatively productive.
If the viewer stares at this image for 20–60 seconds and stares at a white object, a negative afterimage will appear ( in this case, it will be cyan on magenta ).
This can also be achieved by the दर्शक closing his/her eyes and tilting their head up.
An afterimage or ghost image or image burn-in is an optical illusion कि refers to an image continuing to appear in one 's vision after the exposure to the original image has ceased.
One of the most common afterimages is the bright glow that seems to float before एक 's eyes after looking into a light सोर्स for a few seconds.
Closing the eye can help achieve a better sense of the color in its own aspect.
Afterimages come in two forms, negative ( inverted ) and positive ( retaining original रंग ).
The प्रक्रम behind positive afterimages is unknown, though thought to be related to neural adaptation.
on the other hand, negative afterimages are a retinal phenomenon and are well understood.
Lost is an American serial drama television series that premiered on सितंबर 22, 2004 on the American Broadcasting Company ( ABC ).
The series was created by J. J. Abrams and Damon Lindelof, based upon an original pilot script titled Nowhere लिखा by Jeffrey lieber.
Six seasons of the show aired, in addition to numerous काटें shows to recap previous episodes.
ABC announced that Lost होता end after six seasons, having produced a total of 121 episodes.
The series follows the पास्ट, present, and future experience ( s ) of the survivors of a plane crash on a passenger jet, Oceanic Flight 815, flying from Sydney to Los Angeles after it crashes on a tropical island in the South Pacific.
The series also includes stories of the lives of people already living on the island — they शामिल the `` Others ``, who initially antagonize the survivors, as well as a group of people who arrive on the freighter Kahana.
Each episode typically सुविधाएँ action on the island as well as a secondary storyline from another point in a character 's life.
Season 6 features a detailing of the lives of the survivors in a different reality, as if the flight had never क्रैश.
In the following list, the पद `` featured character ( s ) '' refers to the character or characters who are featured in the secondary storyline of each episode.
`` No.
in series '' refers to the एपीसोड 's क्रमांक in the overall series, whereas `` No.
in ऋतु '' refers to the episode 's क्रमांक in each particular season.
`` U.S. viewers ( million ) '' refers to the number of Americans in millions who watched the episode live.
A कुल of 121 एपीसोड of Lost यहूद produced, the last of which aired on May 23, 2010.
All seasons are available on DVD in Regions 1–4 and on Blu-ray in Regions A and B.
Flat feet ( also called pes planus or गिरे arches ) is a औपचारिक reference to a medical condition in which the arch of the foot collapses, with the entire sole of the foot coming into पूरा or near-complete contact with the ground.
In some individuals ( an estimated 20–30 % of the general population ) the arch simply never develops in one foot ( unilaterally ) or दोनो feet ( bilaterally ).
Three studies ( see citations below in military section ) of military recruits have दिखाया no evidence of later increased injury, or foot problems, due to flat फीट, in a population of people जो reach military service age without prior foot problems.
However, these studies can not be used to judge possible भविष्य damage from this condition when diagnosed at younger ages.
They also can नहीं be applied to persons whose flat feet are associated with foot symptoms, or certain symptoms in other parts of the body ( ऐसे as the लेग or back ) possibly referable to the foot.
Generation X, commonly abbreviated to Gen X, is the generation born after the Western post-World War II baby boom.
Demographers, historians and commentators use beginning birth dates from the early 1960s to the early 1980s.
The term was popularized by Douglas Coupland 's 1991 novel Generation X : Tales for an Accelerated Culture.
Before that, it had been used for विभिन्न subcultures or countercultures after the 1950s.
दबाव ulcers, also known as decubitus ulcers or bedsores, हैं localized injuries to the skin and/or underlying tissue usually over a bony prominence, as a result of दबाव, or दबाव in combination with shear and/or friction.
Most commonly इस will be the sacrum, coccyx, heels or the hips, but other sites such as the elbows, knees, ankles or the back of the cranium can be affected.
The cause of pressure ulcers is pressure applied to soft tissue so that blood flow to the soft tissue is completely or partially obstructed.
Shear is also a cause ; shear pulls on blood vessels that फीड the skin.
Pressure ulcers most commonly develop in persons who are not moving about or are confined to wheelchairs.
It is widely believed that other कारकों can influence the tolerance of skin for pressure and shear thereby increasing the risk of दबाव ulcer development.
These factors are protein-calorie malnutrition, microclimate ( skin wetness caused by sweating or incontinence ), diseases that reduce blood flow to the skin, such as arteriosclerosis or diseases that reduce the feeling in the skin, such as paralysis or neuropathy.
The healing of pressure ulcers may be slowed by the age of the व्यक्ति, medical शर्तें ( such as arteriosclerosis, diabetes or infection ), smoking or medications such as antiinflammatory drugs.
Although often prevented and treatable if found early, दबाव ulcers can be बहुत difficult to prevent in critically ill patients, frail elders, wheelchair users ( especially where spinal injury is involved ) and terminally ill patients.
Primary prevention is to redistribute pressure by turning the रोगी regularly.
The benefit of turning to avoid further sores is well documented since at least the 19th century.
In addition to turning and re-positioning the patient in bed or wheelchair, eating a balanced diet साथ adequate protein and keeping the skin free from exposure to urine and stool is very महत्वपूर्ण.
The prevalence of दबाव ulcers in hospital settings is high, but improvements are being made.
According to the 2010 IPUP ( International Pressure Ulcer Prevalence Survey ) conducted in Canada, there was a significant decrease in the overall facility-acquired prevalence of pressure ulcers from 2009-2010.
Ulcers were most commonly identified at the sacral/coccyx ulcer location ; however, heel छाले were the most common facility-acquired location in the survey.

Green Bay is a city in and the county seat of Brown County in the U.S. state of Wisconsin, located at the head of Green Bay, a sub-basin of Lake Michigan, at the mouth of the Fox River.
It रै an elevation of above sea level and is located north of Milwaukee.
The population was 104,057 at the 2010 census.
it is the third-largest city in the राज्य of Wisconsin, after Milwaukee and Madison.
It is also the third-largest city on the west shore of Lake Michigan, after Chicago और Milwaukee.
Green Bay is home to the ग्रीन Bay Packers of the National Football League, making it by far the smallest metropolitan area in the USA to host a major professional sports मताधिकार.
Green Bay is the principal city of the Green Bay Metropolitan Statistical Area, जिससे covers Brown, Kewaunee, and Oconto Counties and had a combined population of 282,599 at the 2000 census.
Green Bay is an industrial city with several meatpacking and पेपर plants, and a port on Green Bay, an arm of Lake Michigan that स्थानीय call the Bay of Green Bay, to avoid conflating it with the eponymous city.
It is home to the National Railroad Museum ; the Neville Public Museum, with exhibitions of art, इतिहास, and science ; और the विश्वविद्यालयों of Wisconsin–Green खाड़ी.
Luteinizing hormone ( lh, also known as lutropin and sometimes lutrophin ) is a hormone produced by gonadotroph cells in the anterior pituitary gland.
In females, an अधि rise of LH ( `` LH surge '' ) triggers ovulation and development of the corpus luteum.
In males, जहाँ LH had also been called interstitial cell-stimulating hormone ( ICSH ), it stimulates Leydig cell production of testosterone.
It acts synergistically with FSH.
Selena quintanilla-pérez ( April 16, 1971 – March 31, 1995 ), known simply as Selena, was an American singer-songwriter.
She was named the `` top Latin artist of the '90s '' and `` Best selling Latin artist of the decade '' by Billboard for her fourteen top-ten singles in the Top Latin Songs चार्ट, including सात number-one हिट्स.
Selena had the most successful singles of 1994 और 1995, `` Amor Prohibido `` and `` No Me Queda Más ``.
She थी called `` The महारानी of Tejano music `` और the Mexican equivalent of Madonna.
Selena released her first album, Selena y Los Dinos, at the age of twelve.
वो won Female Vocalist of the Year at the 1987 Tejano Music Awards and landed a recording contract साथ EMI a few years later.
Her fame grew throughout the early 1990s, विशेषकर in Spanish-speaking countries, and she था begun recording in English as well.
Selena was murdered at the age of 23 on March 31, 1995 by Yolanda Saldívar, the former president of her fan club.
On April 12, 1995, two सप्ताह after उसके death, जार्ज W. Bush, governor of Texas at the time, घोषित her birthday `` Selena Day '' in Texas.
Warner Bros. produced Selena, a film based on उसके life starring Jennifer लोपेज़, in 1997.
Selena 's life was also the basis of the musical सेलिना Forever starring Veronica Vazquez as Selena.
In June 2006 Selena was commemorated with a life-sized bronze statue ( Mirador de la Flor in कॉर्पस christi, Texas ) and a Selena museum opened there.
वो has sold over 60 million albums worldwide, making her one of the best-selling artists of all time.
वो is also the only female artist to have पाँच albums in u.s. Billboard 200 at the same time.
German Stahlhelm from World War II
Insignia of the Bolivian Army Colorados regiment, showing a Stahlhelm and two crossed bayonets
Stahlhelm ( plural, Stahlhelme ) is German for `` steel helmet ''.
The Imperial German Army began to replace the traditional boiled-leather Pickelhaube ( spiked combat helmet ) with the stahlhelm during World War I in 1916.
The term Stahlhelm refers both to a generic steel हेल्मेट, and अधिक specifically to the distinctive ( and iconic ) German design.
The Stahlhelm, with its distinctive `` coal scuttle `` shape, was an instantly recognizable icon लिये military imagery और became a common element of military propaganda on both sides, just like the Pickelhaube before it.
Its name was also used by the Stahlhelm, a paramilitary nationalist संगठन established at the end of 1918.
Glow-in-the-dark may refer to:
Bioluminescence, the production और emission of light by a living organism
Chemiluminescence, is the emission of light ( luminescence ) without emission of heat
Phosphorescence, a specific type of photoluminescence related to fluorescence
Radioluminescence, production of luminescence in a material by the bombardment of ionizing radiation

Frankfurt विमानक्षेत्र serves as a hub city लिये Lufthansa and receives flights from स्टार Alliance carriers.
Airline hubs are airports ranked as विशाल, मीडियम, small, और non-hubs as one of the FAA airport categories which are re-evaluated every year आधारित on number of commercial passengers.
The more common but informal use for the phrase एयरलाइन hub is an विमानक्षेत्र that an airline uses as a transfer पाइंट to get passengers to their intended destination.
It is part of a hub and spoke model, where travelers moving between airports not served by direct flights change planes en route to उनके destinations.
This is as opposed to the Point to Point मॉडल.
Many hubs of the airlines are also situated at airports in the cities of the respective head offices.
Some airlines may use only a single hub, while other airlines use multiple hubs.
Hubs are used for both यात्री flights as खूब as cargo flights.
अनेक airlines also उपयोग focus cities, which फलन much the same as hubs.
Airlines may also use secondary hubs, a non-technical पद for large focus cities.
A hub in the middle of a route is अधिक effective than at either end as connecting traffic more easily fills the plane - passengers prefer a one-stop ( two-leg ) रूट over a two-stop ( three-leg ) route.
Hollow Lacedaemon.
Site of the menelaion, the shrine to Helen and Menelaus constructed anciently in the Bronze Age city that stood on the hill of Therapne on the left bank of the Eurotas River overlooking the future site of Dorian Sparta.
Across the valley the successive ridges of Mount Taygetus are in evidence.
Sparta ( Doric Greek : ; अटारी Greek : ), or Lacedaemon, was a prominent city-state in ancient Greece, situated on the banks of the Eurotas River in Laconia, in south-eastern Peloponnese.
It emerged as a political entity around the 10th century BC, when the invading Dorians subjugated the local, non-Dorian population.
Around 650 BC, it rose to become the dominant military land-power in प्राचीन Greece.
Given its military pre-eminence, Sparta was पहचाना as the overall leader of the combined Greek forces during the Greco-Persian Wars.
Between 431 and 404 BC, Sparta was the principal enemy of Athens during the Peloponnesian War, from which it emerged victorious, though at great लागत.
Sparta 's defeat by Thebes in the Battle of Leuctra in 371 BC ended Sparta 's prominent role in Greece.
However, it maintained its political independence until the Roman conquest of Greece in 146 BC.
It then underwent a long period of decline, especially in the Middle Ages, when many Spartans स्थानांतरित to live in Mystras.
Modern Sparta is the पूंजी of the Greek regional unit of Laconia and a center for the processing of goods such as citrus and olives.
Sparta was unique in ancient Greece लिये its social प्रणाली and constitution, which completely focused on military training and excellence.
Its inhabitants were classified as spartiates ( Spartan नागरिकों, who enjoyed full rights ), Mothakes ( non-Spartan free men raised as Spartans ), Perioikoi ( freedmen ), and Helots ( state-owned serfs, enslaved non-Spartan local population ).
Spartiates underwent the rigorous agoge training and education regimen, and Spartan phalanges were widely considered to be among the best in battle.
Spartan women enjoyed considerably अधिक rights और equality to men than elsewhere in the classical संसार.
स्पार्टा थी the subject of fascination in its own day, as well as in the West following the revival of शास्त्रीय learning.
This love or admiration of Sparta is ज्ञात as Laconism or Laconophilia.
Fantasy football is an interactive competition in which उपयोक्ता compete against each other as general managers of virtual teams.
the players that an individual is able to manage are professional American football players in the National Football League.
The different actions people are able to make are drafting, trading, adding or dropping players, and changing rosters.
due to the growth of the Internet, Fantasy football has vastly increased in popularity, particularly because काल्पनिक football providers such as ESPN, Yahoo, CBS, and the NFL itself are able to keep track of statistics entirely online, eliminating the need to check box scores and newspapers regularly to keep track of players.
Most leagues have a single week championship in सप्ताह 16 of the NFL season.
World population estimates from 1800 to 2100, based on UN 2010 projections ( red, orange, green ) and US Census Bureau historical estimates ( black ).
Actual recorded population आंकड़े हैं in blue.
According to the highest estimate, the world population may rise to 16 billion by 2100 ; according to the lowest estimate, it may decline to 6 billion.
The world population is the total number of living humans on Earth.
As of today, it is estimated to number billion by the United States Census Bureau ( USCB ).
The USCB estimates that the संसार population exceeded 7 billion on March 12, 2012.
According to a पृथक estimate by the United Nations Population Fund, it reached इस milestone on October 31, 2011.
The world population has experienced continuous growth since the end of the Great Famine and the Black Death in 1350, when it stood at around 370 million.
The उच्चतम दरों of growth – global population increases above 1.8 % प्रति year – were seen briefly during the 1950s, and for a longer period दौरान the 1960s और 1970s.
The growth रेट peaked at 2.2 % in 1963, and had declined to 1.1 % by 2011.
Total annual births were highest in the late 1980s at about 138 million, and are now expected to remain essentially constant at their 2011 level of 134 million, while deaths number 56 लाख per year, and are expected to increase to 80 लाख per year by 2040.
Current projections show a continued increase in population in the near future ( लकिन a steady decline in the population growth rate ), with the global population expected to reach between 7.5 and 10.5 billion by 2050.
Various longer-term estimates predict further growth, stagnation, or even overall decline in the global population by 2150.
कुछ analysts have questioned the sustainability of further world population growth, citing the growing pressures on the environment, global food supplies, and energy resources.
Skeletal muscles होमो sapiens
This is a table of muscles of the human anatomy.
There हैं approximately 642 skeletal muscles within the typical इंसान, and almost every muscle constitutes one part of a pair of identical bilateral मांसपेशियां, found on both sides, resulting in approximately 320 pairs of muscles, as presented in this article.
Nevertheless, the exact number is difficult to define because अलग sources group muscles differently, e.g. regarding कया is defined as different parts of a single muscle or as several muscles.
Examples range इससे 640 to 850.
The muscles of the human body can be categorized into a number of groups which include muscles relating to the head and neck, muscles of the torso or trunk, muscles of the upper limbs, and muscles of the lower limbs.
The action refers to the action of each muscle from the standard anatomical position.
In other positions, other actions may be performed.
A gold bar is a quantity of refined metallic gold of कोई shape that is made by a bar producer meeting standard conditions of manufacture, labeling, and record keeping.
Larger gold bars that are produced by pouring the molten metal into molds are called ingots.
Smaller bars may be manufactured by minting or stamping from appropriately rolled gold sheets.
The standard gold bar held as gold reserves by central banks और traded among bullion dealers is the 400-troy-ounce ( 12.4 kg or 438.9 ounces ) Good Delivery सुनहरा बार.
The kilobar, which is to say 1000 grams in mass, is the bar that is more manageable and is used extensively for trading and investment.
The प्रीमियम on these bars when traded is very low over the spot value of the gold making it ideal for छोटी transfers between बैंको and traders.
सबसे kilobars are flat, although some investors, particularly in Europe, prefer the brick आकार.
Elisha Archibald `` Archie '' Manning III ( born May 19, 1949 ) is a former American football quarterback in the National Football लीग, playing for the New Orleans Saints from 1971 to 1982, then for the Houston Oilers and Minnesota Vikings.
He is the father of current डेनवर Broncos quarterback Peyton Manning, current New York Giants starting quarterback Eli Manning, and former Ole Miss receiver Cooper Manning.
Advocacy is a political process by an individual or group जिससे aims to influence public-policy and resource allocation decisions within राजनैतिक, economic, and सोशल systems and institutions.
Advocacy can include many activities that a person or organization undertakes including media अभियान, public speaking, commissioning and publishing research or polls or the filing of an amicus brief.
Lobbying ( often by lobby groups ) is a form of advocacy where a सीधा approach is made to विधायक on an issue which plays a significant role in modern politics.
शोध is beginning to explore how advocacy groups in the U.S. and Canada are using social media to सुकर civic engagement and collective action.
The flag of मैक्सिको ( Spanish : Bandera de México ) is a vertical tricolor of green, white, and red with the national कोट of arms charged in the center of the श्वेत stripe.
While the meaning of the colors has changed over समय, these three colors were adopted by Mexico following independence from Spain during the country 's War of Independence, and subsequent First Mexican Empire.
The current flag was adopted in 1968, but the overall design has been used since 1821, जब the First National Flag was created.
The current law of national symbols, Law on the National Arms, Flag, and Anthem, that governs the use of the national flag has been in place since 1984.
Red, white, and green are the colors of the national liberation army in Mexico.
the central emblem is the Aztec pictogram for tenochtitlan ( now Mexico City ), the center of their empire.
It recalls the legend that inspired the Aztecs to settle on कया was originally a lake-island.
The form of the coat of arms थी most recently revised in 1968.
A ribbon in the national colors is at the bottom of the coat of arms.
throughout history, the flag has changed four टाइम्स, as the design of the coat of arms and the length-width ratios of the flag have been modified.
However, the coat of arms has had the same features throughout : an eagle, holding a serpent in इसके talon, is perched on top of a prickly pear cactus ; the cactus is situated on a चट्टान that rises above a lake.
The coat of arms is derived from an Aztec legend that their देवताओं told them to build a नगर where they spot an eagle on a nopal eating a serpent, which is now Mexico City.
the वर्तमान national flag, the Fourth National Flag, is also used as the Mexican naval ensign by ships registered in Mexico.
A destination marketing organization or convention and visitor ब्यूरो promotes a town, city, region, or country in order to increase the number of visitors.
It promotes the development and marketing of a destination, focusing on convention sales, पर्यटन marketing, and services.
Such organizations promote economic development of a destination by increasing visits from tourists और business travelers, which generates overnight lodging for a destination, visits to रेस्तरां, and shopping revenues.
Convention and visitor bureaus are the most important tourism marketing organizations in their respective tourist destinations, as they are सीधे responsible लिये marketing the destination brand through सफर and tourism `` product awareness '' to visitors.
DMOs produce billions of dollars in direct and indirect revenue और taxes for उनके destinations ' economies with their marketing and sales विशेषज्ञता.
Destination marketing organizations are often called travel, convention, visitors, or tourism bureaux, welcome centers, information centers and more.
Regardless of the name, these organizations offer many services to the traveling public.
The elk or wapiti ( Cervus canadensis ) is एक of the largest species of deer in the world, and one of the largest land mammals in North America and eastern Asia.
It was long believed to be a subspecies of the European red deer ( Cervus elaphus ), but evidence from a 2004 पढ़ाई of the mitochondrial DNA indicates that the two are distinct species.
This एनिमल should not be confused with the larger moose ( Alces alces ), to which the name `` elk '' applies in Eurasia.
Apart from the moose, the only other member of the deer family to rival the elk in size is the south Asian sambar ( Rusa unicolor ).
Elk range in forest and forest-edge habitat, feeding on grasses, plants, leaves, and bark.
Although native to North America and eastern Asia, they have adapted well to countries where they have been introduced, including Argentina, Australia, and New Zealand.
उनके great adaptability may threaten endemic species और ecosystems into which they have been introduced.
Male elk have large antlers which are shed each year.
Males also engage in ritualized mating व्यवहार during the rut, including posturing, antler wrestling ( sparring ), और bugling, a loud series of vocalizations which establishes dominance over other males और attracts females.
Elk are susceptible to a number of infectious diseases, some of which can be transmitted to livestock.
प्रयत्न to eliminate infectious diseases from elk populations, largely through vaccination, have था mixed success.
कुछ cultures revere the elk as a spiritual force.
In parts of Asia, antlers and their velvet are used in traditional medicines.
Elk are hunted as a game species ; the meat is leaner and higher in protein than beef or chicken.
The George Washington University ( GW, GWU, or George Washington ) is a comprehensive private, coeducational research university located in Washington, D.C..
It awards प्रमाणपत्र, Bachelor degrees, Masters degrees, and PhDs across several dozen disciplines.
The university was chartered by an अधिनियम of कॉंग्रेस on February 9, 1821 as The Columbian College in the District of कोलंबिया.
The lion ( Panthera leo ) is one of the four big cats in the genus Panthera and a member of the family Felidae.
With some males exceeding in weight, it is the second-largest living cat बाद the tiger.
Wild lions currently exist in sub-Saharan Africa and in Asia ( where an endangered remnant population resides in Gir Forest National Park in इण्डिया ) जबकि other types of शेर have disappeared इससे North अफ़्रीकी and Southwest Asia in historic times.
Until the late Pleistocene, about 10,000 years पहले, the lion थी the most widespread large land mammal after humans.
They were found in सबसे of अफ़्रीकी, across यूरेशिया इससे western Europe to India, and in the Americas from the Yukon to Peru.
the lion is a vulnerable प्रजाति, having seen a major population decline of 30–50 % over the past two decades in its African range.
Lion populations are untenable outside designated reserves and national parks.
Although the cause of the decline is not fully understood, habitat loss and conflicts with humans are currently the greatest causes of concern.
Within Africa, the West अफ़्रीकी lion population is particularly endangered.
Lions live for 10–14 years in the wild, while in captivity they can live longer than 20 years.
In the wild, males seldom live longer than 10 years, as injuries sustained इससे continual fighting with rival males greatly reduce their आयु.
They typically inhabit savanna and grassland, although they may take to bush और forest.
Lions are unusually social compared to other cats.
A pride of lions consists of related females and offspring and a small number of adult males.
Groups of मादा lions typically hunt together, preying ज़्यादातर on large ungulates.
Lions हैं apex and keystone predators, although they scavenge as opportunity allows.
While lions do not typically हंट इंसानो, some have been ज्ञात to do so.
Sleeping mainly during the day, lions are primarily nocturnal, although bordering on crepuscular in nature.
Highly distinctive, the पुरूष lion is easily recognised by its mane, and its face is one of the most widely recognised animal symbols in human culture.
Depictions have existed from the Upper Paleolithic period, with carvings and paintings from the Lascaux and Chauvet Caves, through virtually all ancient and medieval cultures where वे once occurred.
It रै been extensively depicted in sculptures, in paintings, on national flags, and in contemporary films and literature.
शेर have been रखा in menageries since the time of the Roman Empire, and have been a key species sought for exhibition in zoos over the world since the late 18th century.
Zoos are cooperating worldwide in breeding programs for the endangered एशियाटिक subspecies.
In the history of video games, the seventh generation of consoles is the previous generation, and includes consoles released since late by Nintendo, Microsoft, और सोनी.
For घर consoles, the seventh generation began on 22 November 2005 with the release of Xbox 360 और continued with the release of PlayStation 3 on 11 November 2006, and Wii on 19 November 2006.
Each new console introduced a new type of breakthrough in technology.
The Xbox 360 offered games rendered natively at HD resolutions, the PlayStation 3 offered, in addition to FHD gaming, HD movie playback via a built-in 3D Blu-ray Disc player, and the Wii focused on integrating controllers with movement sensors as well as joysticks.
Joining Nintendo in the motion market, Sony released the PlayStation Move in September 2010.
The PlayStation Move features motion sensing gaming, similar to that of the Wii.
microsoft also joined Sony and Nintendo, with its Kinect.
Unlike the other two systems ( PlayStation 3 and Wii ), Kinect does not use any controllers of कोई sort and makes the उपयोक्ता the `` controller. ''
Having sold 8 million units in its first 60 days on the market, kinect has claimed the Guinness World Record of being the `` fastest selling consumer electronics device ''.
While the Xbox 360 offers wired controllers as a standalone product, all PlayStation 3 controllers can be used in wired and wireless configurations.
starting with handheld consoles, the seventh generation began on 21 November 2004 with the North American introduction of the Nintendo DS as a `` third pillar '', alongside Nintendo 's existing खेल Boy Advance and GameCube consoles.
The Nintendo DS ( NDS ) features a touch screen and built-in microphone, and supports wireless IEEE 802.11 ( Wi-Fi ) standards.
Additionally, the संशोधित version of the NDS, the DSi, features two built in cameras, the ability to download games from the DSi store, और a web browser.
The PlayStation Portable, or PSP, released later the same साल on 12 December 2004, followed a different pattern.
It became the पहला handheld video game console to use an optical disc स्वरूप, Universal Media Disc ( UMD ), as its primary storage media.
Sony also gave the PSP robust multi-media capability, connectivity with the PlayStation 3 and other PSPs, and Internet connectivity.
The Nintendo DS likewise has connectivity to the internet through the Nintendo Wi-Fi कनेक्शन and Nintendo DS Browser, as well as wireless connectivity to अन्य DS systems और Wii consoles.
Despite high sales numbers for both consoles, PlayStation Portable sales have consistently lagged behind those of the Nintendo DS ; nevertheless, the प्लेस्टेशन Portable has the distinction of being the best-selling non-Nintendo handheld gaming system.
Sgt. Pepper 's Lonely Hearts Club Band ( often shortened to Sgt. Pepper ) is the eighth studio album by English rock band the बीटल्स.
Released in June 1967, the album included songs ऐसे as `` With a Little Help from My Friends ``, `` लुसी in the Sky with ईंट ``, and `` A Day in the जीवन ``.
Continuing the artistic maturation seen on the band 's album रिवाल्वर ( 1966 ), Sgt. Pepper further departed from the conventional pop rock idiom of the time and incorporated balladry, psychedelic, music hall, and symphonic influences.
During the Sgt. Pepper sessions, the group improved upon the quality of their music 's production while exploring experimental रिकॉर्डिंग techniques.
Producer George Martin 's innovative approach included the use of an orchestra.
Widely acclaimed और imitated, the album cover, designed by English pop artists Peter Blake और Jann Haworth, was inspired by a sketch by Paul mccartney that depicted the band posing in front of a collage of some of their favourite celebrities.
Sgt. Pepper was a विश्वव्यापी critical और commercial success, spending 27 weeks at the top of the UK Album Chart and 15 weeks at number one on the US Billboard 200.
A seminal work in the emerging psychedelic rock style, the album was critically acclaimed upon release and won four Grammy पुरस्कार in 1968.
साथ an estimated 32 million copies sold, it is one of the world 's best selling एल्बम.
Sgt. Pepper is considered by many to be the most influential and famous rock album ever, and has been नामित the greatest album of all time by दोनो All Time शीर्ष 1000 Albums and Rolling Stone.
The temporal lobe is a region of the cerebral cortex that is located beneath the lateral fissure on both cerebral hemispheres of the mammalian brain.
The temporal lobes are involved in the retention of visual memories, processing संवेदी input, comprehending language, storing new memories, emotion, and deriving meaning.
The human lungs are the organs of respiration in humans.
Humans have two फेफड़े, a सही फेफड़ों and a left फेफड़ों.
The right फेफड़ों consists of three lobes while the left lung is slightly smaller consisting of only two lobes ( the left lung has a `` cardiac notch '' allowing space for the heart भीतर the chest ).
साथ, the lungs contain approximately of airways and 300 to 500 million alveoli, having a total surface area of about ( ) in adults — roughly the same area as one side of a tennis court.
Furthermore, if all of the capillaries that surround the alveoli were unwound and laid end to end, they would extend for परिचय.
Each lung weighs, therefore making the entire organ about.
Human lungs
The trachea divides into two bronchi ( one for each side ) at the स्तर of T4.
This junction is also known as the carina.
The conducting zone contains the trachea, the bronchi, the bronchioles, और the टर्मिनल bronchioles The respiratory zone contains the respiratory bronchioles, the alveolar ducts, and the alveoli.
The conducting zone and the respiratory stuffers ( but not the alveoli ) हैं made up of airways.
The conducting zone has no gas exchange with the blood, and is reinforced with cartilage in order to hold open the airways.
The conducting मण्डल warms the air to and humidifies the air.
It also cleanses the air by removing particles via cilia located on the दीवारें of all the passageways.
The lungs are घिरी by the rib cage.
The respiratory zone is the site of gas exchange with blood.
The sympathetic nervous system via noradrenaline acting on the beta receptors causes bronchodilation.
The parasympathetic बेचैन system via acetylcholine, which acts on the M-3 muscarinic receptors, maintains the resting tone of the bronchiolar smooth muscle.
This कार्रवाई is related, although considered distinct from bronchoconstriction.
Many अन्य non-autonomic nervous and biochemical stimuli, including कार्बन डाइऑक्साइड and oxygen, are also involved in the regulation process.
The pleural cavity is the potential स्पेस between the parietal pleura, lining the inner wall of the thoracic cage, and the visceral pleura lining the lungs.
the फेफड़ों parenchyma is strictly used to refer solely to alveolar tissue with respiratory bronchioles, alveolar ducts और terminal bronchioles.
However, it often includes any form of lung tissue, also including bronchioles, bronchi, blood बरतन and lung interstitium.
the margarita is a Mexican cocktail consisting of tequila mixed with Cointreau or similar नारंगी -flavoured liqueur and lime or lemon juice, often served with salt on the glass rim.
It is the most common tequila-based cocktail in the United States.
The drink is served shaken with ice ( on the rocks ), blended with ice ( frozen margarita ), or बगैर ice ( straight up ).

Burgundy is a dark red color associated with the Burgundy wine of the same name, which in turn is named after the Burgundy region of France.
The color burgundy is similar to other shades of dark red such as maroon.
When referring to the color, `` burgundy '' is usually not capitalized.
The first recorded use of `` burgundy '' as a color name in English was in 1881.

लापता in action ( MIA ) is a casualty Category assigned under the Status of Missing to armed services personnel जो are reported missing दौरान active service.
They may have been killed, wounded, become a prisoner of war, or deserted.
If deceased, neither their remains nor grave can be positively identified.
Becoming MIA has been an occupational risk for service personnel for as long as there has been warfare.

Intense red-eye effect in blue eyes with dilated pupil
the red-eye effect in छायाचित्र is the common appearance of red pupils in color photographs of eyes.
It occurs when using a photographic flash very close to the camera lens ( as साथ most compact cameras ), in परिवेश low light.
The effect appears in the eyes of इंसानो and animals that have tapetum lucidum.
Theatrical followspot operators, positioned nearly coincidentally with a very bright light and somewhat distant from the actors, occasionally witness red-eye in actors on stage.
The effect is not visible to the rest of the audience because it is reliant on the very small angle between the followspot operator and the light.
The University of California, Santa Barbara ( commonly referred to as UC Santa Barbara or UCSB ) is a public research university and one of the ten general campuses of the University of California system.
the main campus is located on a site in Goleta, California, United राज्य, from Santa Barbara and northwest of Los Angeles.
Tracing its roots back to 1891 as an independent teachers ' college, UCSB joined the University of कैलिफ़ोर्निया system in 1944 and is the third-oldest general-education campus in the system.
UCSB is एक of America 's Public Ivy universities, which recognizes top public research universities in the United States.
The university is a comprehensive doctoral university और is organized into five colleges and schools offering 87 undergraduate degrees and 55 graduate degrees.
The campus is the 6th-largest in the UC system by enrollment with 18,977 undergraduate and 2,950 graduate students.
In 2012, UCSB was ranked 41st among `` National Universities '' and 10th among public universities by U.S. News & World Report.
The विश्वविद्यालयों was also ranked 35th worldwide by the Times Higher Education World University Rankings and 34th worldwide ( 6th worldwide for engineering ) by the Academic Ranking of World Universities in 2012. < ref name= '' shanghairanking.com/fieldeng2012 '' >
UC Santa Barbara is a `` very high activity '' research university and spent $ 191.2 million on research expenditures in the 2007 fiscal year, 97th-largest in the संयुक्त States.
UCSB घरों twelve national research centers, including the renowned Kavli Institute for Theoretical Physics.
UCSB faculty includes five Nobel Prize laureates, one Fields Medalist, 29 members of the National Academy of Sciences, 27 members of the National Academy of Engineering, and 31 members of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences.
UCSB was the No. 3 host on the ARPAnet and थी elected to the Association of American विश्वविद्यालयों in 1995.
The uc Santa Barbara gauchos compete in the NCAA Division I Big West Conference.
The Gauchos have won NCAA national championships in men 's soccer and men 's water पोलो.
Saint Joseph with the Infant Jesus by Guido Reni
Saint Joseph 's Day, March 19, the Feast of St. Joseph is in पश्चिमी Christianity the principal feast day of Saint Joseph, Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary.
He is भी the step-father of Jesus of Nazareth /Jesus Christ.
It has the rank of a solemnity in the Roman Catholic Church ; Catholics who follow the Missal of 1962 celebrate it as a first class feast.
Previous to 1962 it was celebrated as a feast of the rank of double of the first class.
It is a feast or commemoration in the provinces of the Anglican नियाज़, and a feast or festival in the Lutheran Church.
Saint Joseph 's दिन is the Patronal Feast day for Poland as well as for कनाडा, persons named Joseph, josephine, etc., for religious institutes, schools और parishes bearing his नाम, और for carpenters.
It is also Father 's दिन in some Catholic countries, mainly Spain, Portugal, और Italy.
March 19 was समर्पित to Saint Joseph in several Western calendars by the tenth century, और this custom was स्थापित in रोम by 1479.
Pope St. Pius V extended its use to the entire Roman Rite by his Apostolic Constitution Quo Primum ( July 14, 1570 ).
Since 1969, Episcopal Conferences may, if they wish, transfer it to a date outside lent.
Between 1870 and 1955, a feast was celebrated in honor of St. Joseph as Spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary and Patron of the Universal Church, the latter शीर्षक having been given to him by पोप Pius IX.
Originally celebrated on the तीसरा Sunday after Easter with an अष्टक, after Divino Afflatu of st. पायस X ( see सुधार of the रोमन Breviary by Pope Pius X ), it was moved to the preceding Wednesday.
The feast was also retitled The Solemnity of Saint जोसेफ.
This जश्न and इसके accompanying octave was abolished during the modernisation and simplification of rubrics under Pope Pius XII in 1955.
it is स्टिल maintained by Catholics who follow the missal of 1962 or earlier missals.
As the परंपरागत holiday of the Apostles ss. Philip and James, May 1, had faded from the memory of most Catholics by the mid-twentieth century, that of Joseph the Worker was created in order to coincide with the celebration of international Labour Day ( May Day ) in many countries.
The feast of Ss. Philip and James, which had महरूम celebrated on that date चूंकि the sixth सदी, was moved from its परंपरागत place.
In the new calendar published in 1969, the feast, which at one time occupied the highest possible rank in the गिरिजाघर calendar, was reduced to an optional Memorial, the lowest rank for a saint 's day.
The Eastern Orthodox गिरिजाघर celebrates Saint Joseph on the Sunday after Christmas.
Mariah Carey ( born March 27, 1970 ) is an American singer, songwriter, record producer, actress, and philanthropist.
Under the मार्गदर्शन of Columbia Records executive Tommy Mottola, Carey released her self-titled debut studio album Mariah Carey in 1990 ; it went multi-platinum and spawned four consecutive number एक singles on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 chart.
Following her marriage to Mottola in 1993 and success with hit records Emotions ( 1991 ), Music बक्सा ( 1993 ), और Merry Christmas ( 1994 ), Carey was established as Columbia 's highest-selling act.
Daydream ( 1995 ) made म्यूज़िक history when इसके दूसरी single `` One Sweet Day ``, a duet with Boyz II Men, spent a record sixteen weeks on top of the Billboard Hot 100, and remains the longest-running number-one song in U.S. chart history.
During the recording of the album, Carey began to deviate from उसके R & B and pop beginnings and slowly traversed into hip hop.
This musical change became evident with the release of Butterfly ( 1997 ), at which time Carey had अलग from Mottola.
Carey left Columbia in 2000, and हस्ताक्षरित a record-breaking $ 100 million recording contract with वर्जिन Records.
पहले the release of her first feature film Glitter ( 2001 ), she suffered a physical and emotional breakdown and was hospitalized for कठोर exhaustion.
Following the film 's poor रिसेप्शन, वो was bought out of her recording contract for $ 50 लाख, which led to a decline in her career.
She signed a multi-million dollar contract deal with Island Records in 2002, and after an unsuccessful period, returned to the top of music charts साथ the Emancipation of Mimi ( 2005 ).
Its second single `` We Belong Together `` became her सबसे कामयाब सिंगल of the 2000s, and was later named `` Song of the दशक '' by Billboard.
कैरी once again ventured into film with a well-received starring role in ( 2009 ) ; she was awarded the `` Breakthrough Performance Award '' at the ताड़ Springs International Film Festival, और Black Reel and NAACP Image Award nominations.
In a career spanning over two decades, कैरी has sold more than 200 million records worldwide, making her एक of the best-selling music artists of all time.
In 1998, वो was honored as the world 's best-selling recording artist of the 1990s at the World म्यूज़िक Awards.
Carey was भी named the best-selling female artist of the millennium in 2000.
According to the Recording Industry Association of America, she is the third best-selling female artist in the United States, with 63.5 million certified albums.
With the release of `` Touch My Body `` ( 2008 ), Carey gained उसके eighteenth number one single in the United States, more than any other solo artist.
In 2012, Carey was ranked second on VH1 's list of the `` 100 Greatest Women in Music ''.
Aside from उसके commercial accomplishments, Carey has won five Grammy Awards, 17 World Music Awards, 11 अमरीकी Music Awards, and 31 Billboard Music Awards.
Referred to as the `` songbird supreme '' by the Guinness World Records, she is famed for उसके five-octave vocal range, power, melismatic style and signature use of the whistle register.
A bumblebee is any member of the bee genus Bombus, in the family apidae.
There are over 250 known प्रजाति, existing primarily in the उत्तरी Hemisphere हालांकि they also occur in South America.
They have been introduced to New Zealand and the Australian state of Tasmania.
Bumblebees are social insects that are characterised by black and yellow body बालों, often in bands.
However, some species have orange or red on their bodies, or may be entirely black.
another obvious ( but not unique ) characteristic is the soft nature of the बाल ( long, branched setae ), called pile, that covers their entire body, making them appear and feel फजी.
They are बेहतरीन distinguished from similarly large, fuzzy bees by the form of the female hind leg, which is modified to form a corbicula : a shiny concave surface that is bare, but surrounded by a fringe of hairs used to transport pollen ( in similar bees, the hind leg is completely बालदार, and pollen grains are wedged into the hairs for transport ).
Like their relatives the honey bees, bumblebees feed on nectar and gather pollen to feed their young.
A man openly carrying a handgun in a Burger King in Eagle, Colorado.
In the United States, open carry is shorthand terminology for `` खुलकर carrying a firearm in public '', as distinguished from concealed carry, where firearms can not be seen by the casual observer.
The अभ्यास of open carry, where gun owners openly carry firearms while they go परिचय their daily business, has seen an increase in the U.S. in हाल years.
इस has been marked by a number of organized events intended to increase the visibility of open carry और public awareness about the practice.
Proponents of open carry point to history and statistics, noting that criminals usually conceal their weapons.
Encouraged by groups like OpenCarry.org, GeorgiaCarry.org and some भागीदार of the Free State Project, open carry has seen a revival in हाल years, but it is not yet clear if this represents just a short-term trend.
The gun rights community रै been mixed in its response.
Alan Gottlieb of the Second Amendment Foundation and the NRA have been cautious in expressing support, while special-interest groups such as the aforementioned OpenCarry.org and GeorgiaCarry.org, and certain national groups such as the Gun Owners of America ( GOA ) have been more outspoken in favor of the अभ्यास.
Open carry is strongly opposed by gun control groups such as the Brady अभियान और the Coalition to Stop Gun Violence.
The Cattenom Nuclear Power Plant in France.
France produces around three quarters of its electricity by nuclear power.
the Grafenrheinfeld Nuclear शक्ति Plant in Germany.
Chancellor Angela Merkel 's गठबन्धन announced on May 30, 2011, that germany’s 17 nuclear power stations होगा be shut down by 2022, in a policy reversal following Japan 's Fukushima Daiichi nuclear विपत्ति.
Currently, 68 reactors are under construction in 15 countries.
Nuclear power स्टेशन operate in thirty countries.
In 2010, before the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear विपत्ति, it was reported that an average of about 10 nuclear reactors were expected to become operational per year, although according to the World Nuclear Association, of the 17 civilian reactors नियोजित to become operational between 2007 and 2009, तभी five actually came on stream.
As of June 2011, Germany and Switzerland are phasing-out nuclear power.
As of June 2011, countries such as Australia, ऑस्ट्रिया, डेनमार्क, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Luxembourg, Malaysia, Malta, New Zealand, Norway and Portugal remain opposed to nuclear power.
Color motion picture film refers both to unexposed color photographic film in a format suitable for use in a motion चित्र camera, and to finished motion picture film, ready for use in a projector, which bears images in color.
The first color cinematography was by means of additive color systems such as the one patented in England by Edward Raymond Turner in 1899 and tested in 1902.
A simplified additive system was developed by George Albert Smith and successfully commercialized in 1909 as Kinemacolor.
These जल्दी प्रणालियों used black-and-white film to photograph and प्रोजेक्ट दो or more component images through different color filters.
Still from footage recorded by Edward Turner in 1902
साथ the present-day technology, there are two distinct प्रक्रियाओं : Eastman Color Negative 2 chemistry ( camera negative stocks, duplicating interpositive and internegative stocks ) and Eastman Color धनात्मक 2 chemistry ( positive prints लिये direct projection ), usually abbreviated as ECN-2 and ECP-2.
Fuji 's उत्पाद are compatible साथ ECN-2 and ECP-2.
Ashanti Shequoiya डगलस ( born October 13, 1980 ) is an American singer-songwriter, record producer, and actress.
Ashanti is most प्रसिद्ध for her eponymous debut album, which featured the hit song `` Foolish ``, and sold over 503,000 copies in its first week of release throughout the U.S. in April 2002.
the album set a Soundscan record as the biggest opening week sales for a नई female artist, outselling debuts by Alicia Keys and Lauryn Hill.
In the same week, she became the first female performer to simultaneously hold the top दो places on the Billboard Hot 100 singles chart साथ `` Foolish '', and `` What 's Luv ? ``
( with Fat Joe ).
ashanti broke records again by having three top टेन songs, `` Foolish, '' `` What 's Luv ? '' और `` Always on Time ``, on the Billboard Hot 100 charts in the same week, being the पहला woman to accomplish this feat and being second only to the Beatles.
In 2003, the self-titled debut album जीती Ashanti her first Grammy Award for Best Contemporary R & B album.
As of April 1st 2013, Ashanti has sold over 27.7 million records worldwide.
Ashanti ended the decade ( 2000–09 ) as the third top new R & B artist behind Alicia Keys and Beyoncé.
She also ended the decade at क्रमांक 38 on the Top Artist of the Decade list.
She is currently on the list of The Twenty Best Selling म्यूज़िक Singles Since 1990 for her single Foolish for selling 7.2 million copies to-date.
Ashanti has an estimated net worth of $ 40 million dollars [ USD ].
Ashanti wrote and संग background on जेनिफर Lopez 's `` Ai n't It Funny ( Murder Remix ) ``, which reached number one on बिलबोर्ड Hot 100, which was also in the top 10 chart at the same time as `` Foolish '', `` Always on Time '' ( with Ja Rule ), and `` What 's Luv '' ( with Fat Joe ).
Later that year, she was acclaimed as the `` Princess Of Hip-Hop & R & B '' by her label और capped off her successful debut by winning eight Billboard awards and दो American म्यूज़िक Awards.
Within seven years of Ashanti 's career, वो has scored 16 top 40 hits on the Hot 100.
Ashanti रै endorsed numerous products including Gap, Herbal Essences and Mudd जीन्स.
Ashanti cites Whitney Houston, Janet Jackson, Prince, Madonna, Tupac Shakur, Mary J. Blige, Ella Fitzgerald, Smokey Robinson, डोना Summer, and Blue Magic as her musical influences.
Praised as a gifted songwriter by her peers और critics alike, Ashanti has written/co-written the bulk of all her music.
She is currently working on her own publishing company entitled Written Entertainment.
She released her fourth studio album हकदार The Declaration on June 3, 2008 and is currently in the studio working on her fifth.
She also performed the charity tune `` Just Stand Up `` alongside 15 other female singers for the `` Stand Up to Cancer '' live television special which helped raise $ 100 million dollars for cancer research.
The United States Army एयर Forces ( USAAF or AAF ) was the military aviation arm of the United States of America during and immediately after World War II, and the direct predecessor of the संयुक्त राज्य Air Force.
The AAF was a component of the United States Army, which in 1942 was divided functionally by executive अनुक्रम into three autonomous forces : the Army Ground Forces, the Services of Supply ( which in 1943 became the Army Service Forces ), and the AAF.
Each of these forces had a commanding general who reported directly to the Chief of स्टाफ of the United States Army.
The aaf administered all parts of military aviation formerly distributed among the Army Air Corps, General Headquarters एयर Force, and ground forces corps area commanders, and thus became the first air organization of the U.S. Army to control its own installations and support personnel.
In practice, the AAF was virtually autonomous inside the Army.
The शिखर size of the AAF was over 2.4 million men and women in service and nearly 80,000 aircraft in 1944, and 783 domestic bases in दिसम्बर 1943.
By VE Day it had 1.25 million men stationed overseas and operated from more than 1,600 airfields worldwide.
The Air Corps became the Army Air Forces in June 1941 to provide the air arm a वृहद autonomy in which to expand more efficiently, and to provide a structure for the additional command echelons required by a vastly increased force.
Although other nations already had पृथक air forces independent of the army or navy ( such as the British royal Air Force and the German Luftwaffe ), the aaf remained a part of the संयुक्त States Army until the United States Air फ़ोर्स came into being in September 1947.
However, in its expansion and conduct of the युद्ध, the AAF became more than just an arm of the greater organization.
By the end of World War II the AAF had become virtually an स्वतंत्र service.
By regulation and executive order, the AAF was a subordinate agency of the युद्ध Department tasked only with organizing, training, and equipping combat units, limited in responsibility to the continental United States, as were the Army Ground Forces and the Army Service Forces.
In reality, मुख्यालय AAF controlled the conduct of all aspects of the air war in every भाग of the world, determining air policy and issuing orders without transmitting them through the Chief of Staff.
इस `` contrast between theory and fact is... fundamental to an understanding of the AAF. ''
The Freedom of Information Act ( FOIA ) is a संघीय freedom of information law that allows for the full or partial disclosure of previously unreleased information and documents controlled by the United States government.
The Act defines agency records subject to disclosure, outlines mandatory disclosure procedures and grants nine exemptions to the statute.
It was originally signed into law by President Lyndon B. Johnson, despite उसके misgivings, on July 4, 1966 as and went into effect the following year.
The Federal Government 's Freedom of Information Act should not be confused with the different and varying Freedom of सूचना Acts passed by the individual states.
Many of those state acts may be similar but not identical to the federal act.
the European Union ( EU ) is an economic and political union of 27 member states that are located primarily in यूरोपीय.
The EU operates through a system of supranational independent institutions and intergovernmental negotiated decisions by the member states.
संस्थानों of the EU शामिल the European Commission, the Council of the यूरोपीय Union, the यूरोपीय Council, the Court of Justice of the European Union, the European Central Bank, the Court of Auditors, and the European पार्लियामेंट.
The European Parliament is elected प्रत्येक five years by EU नागरिकों.
The EU 's de facto capital is ब्रसेल्स.
The EU traces its origins इससे the European Coal and Steel Community ( ECSC ) and the European Economic Community ( EEC ), formed by the Inner Six countries in 1951 and 1958 respectively.
In the intervening years the community and its successors have grown in size by the accession of new member states and in power by the addition of नीति areas to its remit.
The Maastricht Treaty स्थापित the European Union under its current name in 1993.
The latest major amendment to the constitutional basis of the EU, the Treaty of Lisbon, came into force in 2009.
The EU has developed a single market through a standardised system of कानून that apply in all member states.
Within the Schengen Area ( which includes 22 eu and 4 non-EU states ) passport controls have been abolished.
EU policies उद्देश्य to ensure the free movement of people, goods, services, and capital, enact legislation in justice and घर affairs, and maintain common policies on व्यापार, agriculture, fisheries and regional development.
A monetary union, the eurozone, was established in 1999 and is composed of 17 member states.
Through the Common Foreign और Security Policy the EU has developed a role in external relations and defence.
स्थाई diplomatic missions have been established around the world.
The EU is represented at the संयुक्त Nations, the WTO, the G8 and the G-20.
With a combined जनसांख्यिकी of over 500 million inhabitants, or 7.3 % of the संसार population, the eu, in 2012, generated a nominal gross domestic product ( GDP ) of 16.584 trillion US dollars, representing लगभग 20 % of the global GDP when measured in terms of purchasing power parity, and represents the largest nominal GDP and GDP PPP in the world.
The EU was the recipient of the 2012 Nobel Peace Prize.
The Wales national रग्बी league टोली represent Wales in international rugby league football matches.
Currently the team is seventh in the RLIF World Rankings.
The team were run under the auspices of the Rugby Football League, but an independent body, Wales Rugby League, now runs the टोली from कार्डिफ.
A total of three Welsh players have been entered into the Rugby League Hall Of Fame.
Similar to many other Welsh नेशनल sporting teams, वेल्स strip has been primarily red for many years, including now.
However in their last World Cup campaign in 2000 they did पहनें a shirt featuring the Welsh flag, adding a touch of green and श्वेत.
The team is known as `` The Dragons '' and so the teams logo on the shirt is a red dragon.
The team date वापस to 1907, making them the third oldest national side after England and New Zealand.
And it was a touring New Zealand side that Wales first played against in 1908, जीतना 9-8 at Aberdare.
Since then Wales have regularly निभाई England, चूंकि 1935 France, as well as welcomed the touring Australia and New Zealand teams, although they rarely toured themselves, not playing a match in the Southern Hemisphere until 1975.
For twenty-six सालो Wales competed against their two biggest rivals, England and France, in the European Nations कप, winning the trophy four times.
Wales have भी competed in the World Cup on three occasions, the first time being in 1975.
In 1995 and 2000 they had their most successful tournaments to date, surprisingly making the Semi-Finals on both occasions before being beaten by England and ऑस्ट्रेलिया respectively.
Wales failed to qualify for the 2008 World Cup, being the second highest ranked side not to do so, having lost to Scotland on points difference over two matches.
In 2008 Australian John Dixon became the new head कोच and appointed Lee Briers as captain, having played for Wales since 1998.
In recent सीज़न Wales have taken massive strides under former player Iestyn Harris who has coached Wales to back to back European Cup successes, which culminated in a Four Nations appearance in 2011.
Cardiomyopathy ( literally `` heart muscle disease '' ) is the measurable deterioration of the function of the myocardium ( the heart muscle ) for any reason, usually leading to heart विफलता ; common symptoms are dyspnea ( breathlessness ) and peripheral edema ( swelling of the legs ).
People with cardiomyopathy are often at risk of dangerous forms of irregular heart beat and sudden cardiac death.
The सबसे common रूप of cardiomyopathy is dilated cardiomyopathy.
Fuck in its literal meaning refers to the अधिनियम of sexual intercourse.
It is an अंग्रेज़ी word that is often used as a profanity, either to denote disdain or as an intensifier.
The origin of the word is obscure.
It is usually माना to be पहला attested to around 1475, but it may be considerably older.
In modern usage, बकवास and its derivatives ( such as fucker and fucking ) can be used in the position of a noun, a verb, an adjective or an adverb.
वहीँ are many common phrases which make use of the word, as खूब as a number of यौगिकों incorporating it, such as motherfucker.
Note : this article adopts the U.S. Department of परिवहन 's definition of a passenger vehicle, to mean a car or truck, used for passengers, excluding buses and trains.
The United States is home to the largest passenger vehicle market of any country in the world.
Overall, there यहूद an estimated 254.4 million registered passenger vehicles in the United States according to a 2007 DOT study.
This number, along with the average age of vehicles, has increased steadily since 1960, indicating a growing number of vehicles per capita.
The Chinese car market, however, is poised to soon exceed the United States ; by the end of 2012, there were over 240 million cars on the road in China.
The United States is also home to तीन large vehicle manufacturers : General Motors, Ford Motor कम्पनी and क्रिसलर, which have historically been referred to as the `` Big Three. ''
Chrysler however is no longer among the top three ; but is number five, behind Toyota and Honda.
The motor car has clearly become an integral part of American life, with vehicles outnumbering licensed drivers.
Clinical laboratory in a Hospital setting showing अनेक automated analysers.
A medical laboratory or नैदानिक laboratory is a laboratory where tests are done on clinical specimens in order to get information about the health of a patient as pertaining to the निदान, treatment, and prevention of disease.
In poker, खिलाड़ी construct hands of five cards according to predetermined नियम, which vary according to which variant of poker is being played.
These hands are compared using a हाथ ranking system that is standard across all variants of poker, the player साथ the highest-ranking hand winning that particular deal in most variants of poker.
In some variants, the lowest-ranking hand can win or tie.
These hand rankings are also used in some other card games, and in poker dice.
The ranking of a particular hand is increased by including multiple cards of the same card rank, by all five cards being from the same suit, or by सब five cards being of consecutive rank.
The relative रैंकिंग of the various hand categories is based on the probability of being randomly dealt such a hand from a well- shuffled deck.
ब्रूस Randall Hornsby ( born November 23, 1954 ) is an American virtuoso ; a singer, pianist, synthesizer, accordion, and dulcimer खिलाड़ी, and songwriter.
Known for the spontaneity और creativity of his सजीव प्रदर्शन, Hornsby draws frequently from classical, jazz, bluegrass, folk, Motown, gospel, rock, blues, and jam band musical traditions with his songwriting and the seamless improvisations contained within.
Hornsby 's recordings have been recognised on a number of occasions with उद्योग awards, including the Best New Artist Grammy in 1987 with Bruce Hornsby and the Range, the Best Bluegrass Recording ग्रैमी in 1990, and the Best Pop इंस्ट्रूमेंटल Grammy in 1993.
Hornsby has also achieved recognition for his solo albums and performances, his touring band Bruce Hornsby and the Noisemakers, his bluegrass project with Ricky Skaggs and his appearances as a session- and guest-musician.
he also collaborated with Grateful Dead और was a member of the बैंड from September 1990 to March 1992, playing at over one hundred shows दौरान that period.
Sugarcane plantation in rural Cuba
Agriculture in Cuba has played an important part in the economy for several hundred years.
Agriculture contributes less than 10 percent to the gross घरेलू product ( जीडीपी ), but it employs roughly 20 percent of the working population.
About 30 percent of the country 's जमीन is used for crop cultivation.
The inefficient agricultural industry in Cuba has led to the need to import large amounts of foods.
Cuba now imports about 80 % of the food it rations to the public.
The rationing program accounts for about a third of the food energy the average Cuban consumes.
Overall, however, क्यूबा is dependent on imports for only 16 % of its food.
