Mega Millions ( initially called The Big Game आचमन Millions as the successor of The Big Game ) is an American multi-jurisdictional $ 1 lottery खेल.
The first ( The Big Game ) Mega Millions drawing was in 2002 ( see नीचे ).
The minimum आचमन Millions advertised jackpot is $ 12,000,000, paid in 26 equal yearly किश्तों ( unless the cash option is chosen ) ; usually, the जैकपॉट increases when there is no top-prize winner.
However, despite no jackpot winner for the $ 12,000,000 December 18, 2012 आरेखण, the jackpot remained at $ 12,000,000 for the drawing to be held on December 21.
( See नीचे for information on कैसा the खेल 's jackpot is funded. )
Reflecting common practice among American lotteries, the जैकपॉट is advertised as a नाममात्र value of annual installments.
A cash value option ( the usual choice ), when chosen by a jackpot विजेता ( see below ), pays the approximate उपस्थित value of the installments.
Mega Millions currently uses a 5/56 ( white गेंदें ) plus 1/46 ( the आचमन Ball ) double matrix to select इसके winning numbers.
Each game costs $ 1.
In 43 of the 44 Mega लाखो jurisdictions ( California is the exception ), there is an option, called Megaplier ( such games are $ 2 each ) where non-jackpot prizes are multiplied by 2, 3, or 4.
The Megaplier was made उपलब्धियाँ to all आचमन Millions jurisdictions in January 2011 ; it began as a Texas -only विकल्प.
Mega लाखो is drawn at 10:59 p.m. पूर्वी time Tuesdays and Fridays, including holidays.
Mega Millions is administered by a consortium of इसके 12 original lotteries and the drawings are held at WSB-TV in Atlanta, Georgia.
supervised by the Georgia लॉटरी.
The largest jackpot in Mega Millions, as well as in American lottery history, थी $ 656,000,000 annuitized ( साथ a cash option of $ 474,000,000 ) for the March 30, 2012 आरेखण in which there were three jackpot-winning tickets ; one each in Illinois, Kansas, and Maryland.
All three tickets had been claimed as of April 18, with each set of winners choosing the नकदी option.
is a Japanese manga series निर्मित by writer Tsugumi Ohba and manga artist Takeshi Obata.
The main character is Light Yagami, a high school student जो discovers a supernatural notebook, the `` Death Note '', dropped on Earth by a shinigami ( a god of death ) named Ryuk.
The Death Note grants its user the ability to kill anyone whose name and face they know, by writing the name in the notebook while picturing their face.
The series centers around Light 's attempt to create and rule a संसार `` cleansed of evil '' as `` God '' using the notebook, and the efforts of a detective known as L to stop him.
Death Note was first serialized in 108 chapters by Shueisha in the Japanese manga magazine Weekly Shōnen Jump from December 2003 to May 2006.
The series was also published in tankōbon स्वरूप in Japan starting in May 2004 and ending in October 2006 with a total of thirteen volumes.
the anime series aired in Japan from October 3, 2006, to June 26, 2007.
रचित of 37 episodes, the anime was developed by Madhouse and directed by Tetsuro Araki.
A light novel based on the series, written by Nisio Isin, was released in Japan.
Additionally, various video games have been published by Konami for Nintendo DS.
The series was adapted into live-action films released in Japan on June 17, 2006, November 3, 2006, और February 2, 2008.
Viz Media licensed the Death Note manga in North America and has published all the twelve volumes from the series, a 13th volume which serves as a `` reader 's guide '', as well as the light novels.
The episodes from the anime first appeared in उत्तर America as downloadable by IGN.
Viz later licensed the anime series and it aired on Bionix in Canada and on कार्टून संजाल in the United States.
the live-action films briefly played in certain North American theaters since 2008.
However, none of the video games have thus far been published in North America or यूरोपीय.
Death Note is one of Weekly shōnen Jumps best-selling manga series of all समय, with sales over 26.5 million copies.
Halloween or Hallowe'en ( a contraction of `` All Hallows ' Evening `` ), also known as All hallows ' Eve, is a yearly celebration observed in a number of countries on October 31, the eve of the Western Christian feast of All Hallows ( or All Saints ) and the day initiating the triduum of Hallowmas.
According to many scholars, All Hallows ' Eve is a Christianised feast originally बहकावे by western European harvest festivals, and festivals of the मुर्दे with possible pagan roots, particularly the Celtic Samhain.
Other scholars maintain that it originated independently of Samhain and has solely Christian जड़ें.
Typical festive Halloween activities include trick-or-treating ( also known as `` guising `` ), attending costume parties, carving pumpkins into jack-o'-lanterns, lighting bonfires, apple bobbing, visiting haunted attractions, playing pranks, telling scary stories, and watching horror films.
New York City taxicabs during Midtown rush hour in Manhattan
The taxicabs of New York नगर, with उनके distinctive yellow paint, are a widely पहचाना icon of the city.
taxicabs are operated by private companies और licensed by the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission ( TLC ).
It also oversees over 40,000 other for-hire vehicles, including `` black cars '', commuter vans and ambulettes.
`` Medallion taxis, '' the familiar yellow cabs, are the only vehicles in the city permitted to pick up passengers in response to a street hail.
Schematic cross section of part of leaf, xylem shown as red circles at figure 8.
Xylem is one of the two types of हस्तांतरण tissue in vascular पौधे ( phloem is the other ).
The शब्द जाइलम is derived from the Greek word ξύλον ( xylon ), meaning `` wood '' ; the best-known xylem tissue is wood, हालांकि it is found throughout the plant.
Its basic function is to transport water, but it also transports कुछ nutrients through the plant.
U.S. women suffragists demonstrating for the right to vote, February 1913.
Women 's suffrage also known as woman suffrage is the right of women to vote and to run for office.
सीमित voting अधिकारों were gained by women in Sweden, Finland and some western U.S. states in the late 19th century.
International organizations were formed to निर्देशांक efforts, especially the International Council of Women ( 1888 ) and the International Woman suffrage गठबंधन ( 1904 ).
In 1893, New Zealand, then a self-governing British colony, granted adult women the right to vote और the self-governing British colony of South Australia did the वही in 1895, but also permitted महिलाओं to run for office.
Australia federated in 1901, and women acquired the सही to vote and स्टैंड in federal elections from 1902, though uneven restrictions on Aboriginal women voting in नेशनल elections were not completely removed until 1962.
The first European country to introduce women 's suffrage थी the Grand duchy of Finland, then part of the Russian Empire, which also produced the world 's first female सदस्यों of parliament in the 1907 parliamentary elections.
Norway followed, granting full women 's suffrage in 1913.
In most Western countries, women 's suffrage आए after World I War I I, with some important late adopters होने France in 1944 और Switzerland in 1971.
Women 's suffrage has generally been recognized after political अभियान to obtain it were waged.
In many countries it was granted before universal suffrage.
Women 's suffrage is explicitly stated as a right under the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women, adopted by the United Nations in 1979.
The Thirteenth Tale ( 2006 ) by Diane Setterfield is a gothic suspense novel, the author 's first published book.
Jehovah 's Witnesses is a millenarian restorationist Christian denomination with nontrinitarian beliefs distinct from mainstream Christianity.Sources for descriptors : • Millenarian : • Restorationist : • Christian : • Denomination : The organization reports worldwide सदस्यता of over 7.78 million adherents involved in evangelism, convention attendance of over 12 million, and annual Memorial attendance of over 19 million.
They are directed by the Governing Body of Jehovah 's Witnesses, a group of elders in Brooklyn, New York, that establishes all doctrines.
Jehovah 's Witnesses ' मान्यताओं are based on their interpretations of the Bible and they prefer to use their own translation, the New World Translation of the Holy शास्त्रों.
They believe that the destruction of the present world system at Armageddon is imminent, और that the establishment of God 's किंगडम on earth is the only solution for all problems faced by mankind.
The group emerged from the बाइबल Student movement —founded in the late 1870s by Charles Taze Russell with the formation of Zion 's Watch Tower Tract Society —with significant organizational and doctrinal changes under the leadership of Joseph Franklin Rutherford.
The name Jehovah 's witnesses, आधारित on Isaiah 43:10–12, was adopted in 1931 to distinguish themselves from other Bible Student groups and symbolize a break with the legacy of Russell 's traditions.
यहोवा 's Witnesses are best known for their door-to-door preaching, distributing साहित्य such as The Watchtower and Awake !
, and refusing military service और blood transfusions.
They consider use of the name Jehovah vital for proper worship.
They reject Trinitarianism, inherent immortality of the soul, and hellfire, जिससे they consider to be unscriptural doctrines.
They do नहीं observe Christmas, Easter, जन्मदिन, or other holidays and customs they consider to have pagan origins incompatible with Christianity.
Adherents commonly refer to their body of beliefs as `` the truth '' and consider themselves to be `` in the truth ''.
They consider secular society to be morally corrupt and under the influence of Satan, और most limit their सोशल interaction with non-Witnesses.
Congregational disciplinary actions include disfellowshipping, their term for formal expulsion and shunning.
Baptized individuals who formally leave are considered disassociated और are also shunned.
Disfellowshipped and disassociated individuals may eventually be reinstated if deemed repentant.
the religion 's position regarding conscientious objection to military service and refusal to salute national flags has brought it into conflict with some governments.
Consequently, Jehovah 's Witnesses have been persecuted and their activities are banned or restricted in some countries.
Persistent legal challenges by Jehovah 's Witnesses have influenced विधान सम्बन्धित to civil rights in several countries.
Last Tango in Paris ( ) is a 1972 Franco-Italian romantic Drama film directed by Bernardo Bertolucci which portrays a हाल American widower who begins an anonymous sexual relationship with a young, betrothed Parisian स्त्री.
It stars मार्लोन Brando, Maria Schneider, और Jean-Pierre Léaud.
The film 's कच्चा portrayal of यौन हिंसा and emotional turmoil led to international controversy and drew various levels of government सेंसरशिप.
The mpaa gave the film an X rating upon release in the संयुक्त राज्य.
After revisions were made to the MPAA दरजा code, it was classified as an NC-17 in 1997.
MGM released a censored R-rated काटें in 1981.
The film has its NC-17 rating for `` कुछ explicit sexual content. ''
Windows XP is an operating प्रणाली produced by Microsoft for use on निजी computers, including home and business desktops, laptops और मीडिया centers.
First released to computer manufacturers on अगस्त 24, 2001, it is the second most popular संस्करण of Windows, based on संस्थापित user base.
The name `` XP '' is short for `` eXPerience '', highlighting the enhanced उपयोक्ता experience.
Windows XP, the successor to Windows 2000 and Windows ME, was the first consumer-oriented operating system produced by Microsoft to be built on the Windows NT kernel.
Windows XP was released worldwide for retail sale on October 25, 2001, and over 400 million copies were in use in January 2006.
It थी succeeded by Windows Vista in जनवरी 2007.
Direct OEM and retail sales of खिड़कियाँ XP ceased on June 30, 2008.
Microsoft continued to sell Windows XP through their System Builders ( छोटी OEMs who sell समवेत computers ) program until January 31, 2009.
On April 10, 2012, Microsoft reaffirmed that extended support for Windows XP and दफ्तर 2003 would समाप्त on April 8, 2014 and सुझाया कि प्रशासकों begin preparing to migrate to a newer OS.
the NT -based versions of Windows, which हैं programmed in C, C++, and assembly, are known for their improved stability and efficiency over the 9x versions of Microsoft Windows.
Windows XP presented a significantly redesigned graphical user interface, a change Microsoft promoted as more user-friendly than previous versions of Windows.
In an attempt to further ameliorate the `` DLL hell `` that plagued the past versions of खिड़कियाँ, improved side-by-side assembly technology in Windows XP allows side-by-side installation, registration and servicing of multiple versions of globally shared software components in full isolation.
It is also the first version of Windows to use product activation to combat illegal copying.
During Windows XP 's development, the project थी codenamed `` Whistler '', बाद Whistler, British Columbia, as many Microsoft employees skied at the Whistler-Blackcomb ski रिज़ॉर्ट.
according to web analytics data generated by Net Applications, Windows XP थी the most widely used operating system until August 2012, when खिड़कियाँ 7 overtook it.
, Windows XP मार्केट share is at 38.99 %, having decreased almost every month since at least November 2007, the पहला month for which statistics are publicly available from Net Applications.
`` Por una Cabeza '' is an अर्जेंटाइन tango with music and गीत लिखा in 1935 by Carlos Gardel and Alfredo Le Pera respectively.
The name is a Spanish horse-racing phrase meaning `` by a head '', जिससे refers to a horse winning a race by the length of one head.
The lyrics speak of a compulsive horse-track gambler who compares his addiction for horses with his attraction to women.
Alfredo Le Pera was a Brazilian इससे São Paulo, a much Italian-influenced area in Brazil, and also the birthplace of Zequinha de Abreu, composer of Tico-Tico no Fubá.
Le Pera and Gardel died in an airplane crash in Medellín, ( Colombia ), on June 24, 1935.
Por una Cabeza
The टैंगो has since been performed by numerous tango orchestras.
Tango scenes साथ `` Por una cabeza '' appear in delicatessen ( 1991 ), Scent of a Woman ( 1992 ), Schindler 's List ( 1993 ), True Lies ( 1994 ), Titanic ( 1996 ), Bad Santa ( Uncut Version, 2003 ), All the King 's Men ( 2006 ), Planet 51 ( 2009 ), episode 37 of nip/tuck ( 2003–2010 ), episode 9 of South Korean drama series Sweet Spy ( 2005–08 ), the beginning and ending credits of the South Korean drama broadcast I 'm Sorry, I Love तुम ( 2004 ), और the episode `` Down the Rabbit Hole `` ( 2007 ).
in the movie Frida ( Salma Hayek, 2002 ), Gardel is heard singing it on a radio.
It is also quoted in David Del tredici 's `` Good News !
Nilda is Back '' ( from the song cycle Miz Inez Sez ).
In Scent of a Woman ( 1992 ), the tango is performed by the `` The Tango Project '', who दरअसल appear in the dancing scene starring Al Pacino ( the recording used is available on one of their CD albums ).
John Williams arranged a version of the piece कि appears on the album `` Cinema Serenade '' with the violin solo performed by itzhak Perlman.
पर्लमैन and Williams ( conducting ) have also performed the टुकड़ा together in live concerts.
In 2012 a dance version was released by the group `` Da Carrera '' featuring the original vocal recording by Carlos Gardel.
the baroreflex or baroreceptor reflex is one of the body 's homeostatic mechanisms for maintaining blood pressure.
It provides a ऋणात्मक feedback loop in जिससे an elevated blood pressure reflexively causes heart रेट to decrease इसलिए causing blood pressure to decrease ; likewise, decreased blood pressure activates the baroreflex, causing heart rate to increase यूँ causing an increase in blood pressure.
The system relies on specialized neurons, known as baroreceptors, in the aortic arch, carotid sinuses, and elsewhere to monitor changes in blood pressure and relay them to the brainstem.
Subsequent परिवर्तन in blood pressure are mediated by the autonomic nervous system.
Atrial natriuretic peptide फ़ॉर्म a समानांतर negative feedback loop in an endocrinological contrast to the renin-angiotensin प्रणाली.
The Loma Prieta earthquake, also known as the Quake of '89 and the World Series Earthquake, was a major earthquake that struck the San Francisco Bay Area of California on October 17, 1989, at 5:04 pm local time.
Caused by a slip along the San andreas Fault, the quake lasted 10–15 seconds and measured 6.9 on both the moment magnitude scale ( surface-wave परिमाण 7.1 ) and on the open-ended Richter Scale.
The quake killed 63 people throughout northern California, injured 3,757 and left some 3,000–12,000 people homeless.
The earthquake occurred during the warm-up practice for the third खेल of the 1989 World Series, featuring both of the Bay Area 's Major League Baseball टीमों, the Oakland Athletics and the San Francisco Giants.
Because of game-related sports coverage, this was the पहला major earthquake in the United States to have its initial jolt broadcast live on television.
Pawn in the standard Staunton pattern
the pawn ( ♙♟ ) is the most numerous and in most circumstances the weakest piece in the game of chess, historically representing infantry or, अधिक particularly, armed peasants or pikemen.
In chess, each player begins the game with eight pawns, one on each वर्गाकार of the रैंक immediately in front of the other pieces.
( In algebraic notation, the white pawns प्रारंभ on a2, b2, c2,..., h2, while black pawns start on a7, b7, c7,..., h7. )
Individual pawns are referred to by the file on which they stand.
For example, one बोलती of `` White 's f-pawn '' or `` Black 's b-pawn '', or less commonly ( using descriptive संकेतन ), `` White 's king 's बिशप pawn '' or `` Black 's queen 's knight pawn ''.
It is also common to refer to a rook pawn, meaning any pawn on the a- or h-file, a knight pawn ( on the b- or g-file ), a bishop pawn ( on the c- or f-file ), a queen pawn ( on the d-file ), a king pawn ( on the e-file ), and a सेंट्रल pawn ( on either the d- or e-file ).
The military forces of the world have differing approaches to the enlistment of homosexual ( gay and lesbian ) and bisexual individuals.
The armed forces of most developed countries have now removed नीतियों excluding non-heterosexual individuals ( with strict policies on यौन harassment ).
Nations कि परमिट gay people to serve openly in the military include the 4 of the 5 members of the UN सुरक्षा Council ( United States, United Kingdom, France, and Russia ), the Republic of China ( Taiwan ), Australia, Israel, South Africa, Argentina, and all NATO members excluding तुर्कों.
Hydrogen production is the family of औद्योगिक methods for generating hydrogen.
फिलहाल the dominant technology लिये direct production is steam reforming from hydrocarbons.
Many other methods are known including electrolysis and thermolysis.
In 2006, the संयुक्त States was estimated to have a production capacity of 11 million tonnes of hydrogen.
5 million tonnes of hydrogen were consumed on-site in oil refining, and in the production of ammonia ( Haber process ) और methanol ( reduction of carbon monoxide ).
0.4 million tonnes were an incidental by-product of the chlor-alkali process.
Hydrogen production is an estimated $ 100 billion industry.
A basis point ( often denoted as bp, colloquially referred to in the plural as `` bips '', also known as a `` beep '' ) is a unit equal to one hundredth of a percentage point, or one part per ten thousand, 1/10000.
the same unit is also ( rarely ) called a permyriad, literally meaning 'for ( every ) myriad ( ten thousand ) ', and in that context is written साथ which looks like a percent sign ( % ) with two अतिरिक्त zeroes at the end ( like a stylized form of the four zeros in the denominator, although it originates as a natural extension of the percent ( % ) and permille ( ‰ ) signs ).
a basis पाइंट is defined as:
1 basis पाइंट = 1 permyriad = one one-hundredth percent
1 bp = 1 = 0.01 % = 0.1‰ = 10−4 = = 0.0001
1 % = 100 bp = 100
Basis अंक are used as a convenient unit of मापन in contexts where percentage मतभेद of कम than 1 % are discussed.
The most common उदाहरण is interest rates, where differences in interest rates of कम than 1 % per year are usually सार्थक to बात about.
For example, a difference of 0.10 percentage points is equivalent to a change of 10 basis points ( e.g. a 4.67 % rate increases by 10 आधार points to 4.77 % ).
Like प्रतिशत points, basis points avoid the ambiguity between relative and absolute discussions about interest rates by dealing तभी with the absolute change in numeric value of a rate.
For example, if a report says there has been a `` 1 % increase '' from a 10 % interest rate, this could refer to an increase either from 10 % to 10.1 % ( relative, 1 % of 10 % ), or from 10 % to 11 % ( absolute, 1 % plus 10 % ).
If, however, the report says there has been a `` 10 basis point increase '' from a 10 % interest rate, then we know that the ब्याज rate of 10 % has increased by 0.10 % ( the निरपेक्ष change ) to a 10.1 % rate.
It is common practice in the वित्तीय industry to use basis points to denote a rate change in a financial instrument, or the difference ( स्प्रेड ) between two interest rates, सहित the yields of fixed-income securities.
Since certain loans and bonds may commonly be quoted in relation to some index or underlying security, वे will often be quoted as a spread over ( or under ) the index.
For example, a loan that bears interest of 0.50 % per annum above the London Interbank Offered Rate ( LIBOR ) is said to be 50 basis अंक over LIBOR, which is commonly expressed as `` L+50bps '' or simply `` L+50 ''.
The term `` basis पाइंट '' has its origins in trading the `` basis '' or the spread between two interest rates.
Since the basis is usually small, these are quoted multiplied up by 10000, and hence a `` full point '' movement in the `` basis '' is a basis point.
Contrast with pips in FX forward markets.
The relationship between percentage परिवर्तन and basis points can be summarized as follows : 1 percentage point change = 100 basis points, and 0.01 percentage points = 1 basis point.
So, a bond whose yield increases from 5 % to 5.5 % is said to increase by 50 basis points ; or interest rates that have risen 1 percentage पाइंट are said to have increased by 100 basis points.
The British Royal Family is the group of close relatives of the monarch of the United Kingdom.
The term is also commonly लागू to the same group of people who are the relations of the monarch in her or his role as sovereign of any of the other Commonwealth realms, thus sometimes at variance साथ official national terms for the family.
Members of the Royal Family belong to, either by birth or विवाह, the House of Windsor, since 1917, when जार्ज V changed the नाम of the royal house from Saxe-Coburg and Gotha.
This निर्णय was primarily taken because Britain and उसके Empire were at war with Germany और given the British Royal Family 's दमदार German ancestry ; it was felt that its public image could be improved by choosing a more British house name.
The new name chosen, Windsor, had absolutely no connection other than as the name of the castle which was and continues to be a royal निवास.
Although in the United Kingdom there is no strict legal or formal definition of who is or is not a member of the royal Family, and different lists will include different लोगों, those carrying the style Her or उसके majesty ( HM ), or Her or उसके Royal Highness ( HRH ) are always considered members, which usually results in the अनुप्रयोग of the पद to the monarch, the consort of the monarch, the widowed consorts of previous monarchs, the children of the monarch and previous monarchs, the male-line grandchildren of the monarch and previous monarchs, and the spouses and the widows of a monarch 's and previous monarch 's sons and male-line grandsons.
On 30 November 1917, King George V issued Letters Patent धमक जो are members of the Royal Family ; the text of the notice from the London Gazette is as follows:
In 1996, Her Majesty the Queen modified these Letters Patent, as was evidenced by इस Notice from the London Gazette:
In 2013 Letters पेटेंट were issued to extend a title और a style borne by members of the Royal Family to additional persons to be born, evidenced by इस Notice from the London Gazette:
Members and रिश्तेदारों of the British Royal Family historically represented the monarch in various places throughout the British Empire, sometimes for extended periods as viceroys, or लिये specific ceremonies or कार्यक्रम.
Today, they often perform ceremonial and social duties throughout the संयुक्त Kingdom and abroad on behalf of the United Kingdom.
Aside from the monarch, their तभी constitutional भूमिका in the affairs of government is to serve, if eligible and जब appointed by letters patent, as a Counsellor of राज्य, two or more of जिसको exercise the authority of the Crown ( within stipulated limits ) in the indisposal or absence from the British realm of the monarch.
In the other realms of the Commonwealth royalty do not serve as Counsellors of State.
However in each such realm the monarch 's परिवार members may act on behalf of, are funded by, and represent the sovereign of that particular राज्य, and not the United Kingdom.
the Queen, her consort, her children and grandchildren, as well as all former sovereigns ' children and grandchildren hold places in the first sections of the official orders of precedence in England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland.
Wives of the said enjoy their husbands ' precedence, and पतियों of princesses are unofficially but habitually placed with their wives as well.
However, the महारानी changed the private order of precedence in the Royal Family in पक्ष of Princesses Anne and Alexandra, who henceforth take private precedence over the Duchess of Cornwall, who is otherwise the realm 's highest ranking woman after the Queen herself.
वो किया not alter the सापेक्ष precedence of other born-princesses, ऐसे as the daughters of उसके younger sons.
Haiti ( ; Haitian Creole Ayiti ), officially the Republic of हैती ( ; ), is a Caribbean देश.
It occupies the western, smaller portion of the द्वीप of Hispaniola, in the Greater Antillean archipelago, which it shares with the डोमिनिकन Republic.
Ayiti ( land of high mountains ) was the indigenous Taíno or amerindian name for the island.
the देश 's highest point is Pic la selle, at.
The total क्षेत्रफल of Haiti is and इसके capital is Port-au-Prince.
Haitian Creole और French are the official languages.
Haiti 's regional, historical, and ethno-linguistic position is अद्वितीय for several reasons.
It was the first independent nation of Latin America and the Caribbean, the first black -led republic in the world, and the second republic in the Americas when it gained independence in 1804 as भाग of a successful slave revolution lasting nearly a दशक.
In 2012, Haiti announced इसके intention to seek associate membership status in the African Union.
Haiti is the most populous of the predominantly Francophone independent nations in the Americas.
It is one of only two independent nations in the Americas ( along with Canada ) to designate French as an official language ; the other French-speaking areas are सब overseas départements, or collectivités, of France.
Haiti is the most populous full member-state of the Caribbean Community ( CARICOM ).
It is the poorest country in the Americas as measured by the Human Development Index.
Political violence has occurred regularly throughout its history, leading to government instability.
Most recently, in फ़रवरी 2004, a तख्तापलट d'état originating in the उत्तर of the country forced the इस्तीफा and निर्वासन of President Jean-Bertrand Aristide.
A provisional government took कंट्रोल with security provided by the United Nations Stabilization Mission in Haiti ( MINUSTAH ).
Michel Martelly, the current president, was elected in the Haitian सामान्य election, 2011.
The island रै had a history of destructive भूकंप.
A 7.0 magnitude earthquake struck Haiti on 12 January 2010 and devastated Port-au-Prince.
The highest reliable death count was estimated at 220,000.
Haitian government estimates were higher.
The Presidential palace, Parliament and many other important structures were destroyed, along with countless homes and व्यवसायों, leaving hundreds of हज़ारों of people homeless.
the country has yet to recover from the 2010 earthquake ( और subsequent incidents ) due to both the severity of the क्षति Haiti endured in 2010, as well as a government that was ineffective खूब before the earthquake.
United राज्य aid organizations have donated $ 2 billion.
Combined with other international donations, these funds are intended to contribute to the rebuilding of the country.
The Bloody Beetroots is the pseudonym of Sir Bob Cornelius Rifo, the Italian electro house and dance-punk music producer, DJ and photographer.
The Bloody Beetroots is well-known for the black venom mask he wears during performances.
In fact, the only identifying public feature of Rifo is the year `` 1977 '' tattooed across his छाती, which is both the साल that the producer and punk-rock थी born.
`` The Bloody Beetroots DJ set '' contains Sir Bob Cornelius Rifo और Tommy Tea.
A Motorola Advisor alphanumeric pager प्रयुक्त in ब्राज़ील in the 1990s, operated by Teletrim
A pager is a wireless दूरसंचार device that receives and displays numeric or text messages, or receives and announces voice messages.
one-way pagers can only receive संदेश, जबकि response pagers and two-way pagers can also acknowledge, reply to, and originate messages using an internal ट्रांसमीटर.
Pagers operate as part of a paging प्रणाली जिससे includes one or अधिक fixed transmitters ( or in the case of response pagers and two-way pagers, one or more base stations ), as well as a number of pagers carried by mobile users.
These systems can range from a restaurant system with a single low-power transmitter, to a देशभर system साथ thousands of high-power base स्टेशन.
One of the first practical paging सेवाएं was शुभारम्भ in 1950 for physicians in the New यॉर्क City area.
Physicians paid US $ 12 प्रति माह for the service और carried a ( 6 oz ) pager that would receive phone messages within ( 25 mi ) of a सिंगल transmitter मीनार.
The system was manufactured by the Reevesound Company और operated by Telanswerphone.
In 1960, John फ्रांसिस Mitchell combined elements of Motorola 's Walkie Talkie and automobile रेडियो technologies to create the first transistorized pager, और from इस point, paging technology continued to advance, and pager adoption continued to expand, until the early 1990s.
However, by the mid-1990s, as cellular technologies became cheaper and more widely available, advanced services began to displace paging as a commercial product.
Today, pagers exist largely as niche products, finding preferential use in applications such as अस्पताल, public safety, and retail locations where their simplicity, high reliability, and कम cost represent significant advantages.
Reevesville is a कस्बा in Dorchester County, दक्षिण Carolina, United States.
The population was 196 at the 2010 census.
As defined by the U.S. Office of प्रबन्धन and Budget, and प्रयुक्त by the U.S. Census Bureau लिये statistical purposes only, reevesville is शामिल within the Charleston-North Charleston-Summerville metropolitan area.
Frida Kahlo de Rivera ( born Magdalena Carmen Frieda Kahlo y calderón ; July 6, 1907 – July 13, 1954 ) was a Mexican चित्रकार, born in coyoacán, who is best known for her self-portraits.
Kahlo 's life began and ended in Mexico City, in her home known as the Blue House.
She gave her birth तिथि as July 7, 1910, but her birth certificate shows जुलाई 6, 1907.
Kahlo had allegedly wanted the year of her birth to coincide with the year of the beginning of the Mexican क्रान्ति so that her जीवन would begin with the birth of modern Mexico.
Her work has been celebrated in Mexico as emblematic of नेशनल and indigenous tradition, and by feminists for its uncompromising depiction of the female experience and form.
Mexican culture and Amerindian cultural tradition are important in her work, which has been sometimes characterized as naïve art or folk art.
Her work has also महरूम described as `` surrealist '', and in 1938 André Breton, principal initiator of the surrealist movement, described Kahlo 's art as a `` ribbon around a bomb ''.
Kahlo had a volatile विवाह with the प्रसिद्ध Mexican artist Diego Rivera.
She suffered lifelong health समस्याएं.
Many of her स्वास्थ्य problems were the result of a traffic accident she survived as a किशोरावस्था.
Recovering from her injuries isolated her इससे other people and this isolation influenced her works, many of which are self-portraits of one sort or another.
Kahlo suggested, `` I paint myself because I am so often alone and because I am the subject I know best. ''
She also stated, `` I was born a bitch.
I was born a painter. ''

Theresienwiese on the day before oktoberfest 2006
oktoberfest is a 16-day festival celebrating beer held annually in Munich, Bavaria, जर्मनी, running from late September to the पहला weekend in अक्तूबर.
It is one of the most famous events in Germany and is the world 's largest fair, with more than 6 million people from around the world attending the event every year.
To the locals, it is not पुकारा Oktoberfest, लकिन `` die Wiesn '', after the colloquial name of the fairgrounds themselves.
The Oktoberfest is an important part of Bavarian culture, having been held चूंकि 1810.
Other cities आरपार the world also hold Oktoberfest celebrations, modeled after the original Munich event.
The Munich Oktoberfest originally took place during the sixteen दिनों up to, and including, the पहला संडे in October.
In 1994, the schedule was modified in response to German reunification so that if the first Sunday in October falls on the 1st or 2nd, then the festival होता go on until October 3 ( German Unity Day ).
Thus, the festival is now 17 days when the first संडे is October 2 and 18 days when it is October 1.
In 2010, the पर्व lasted until the first Monday in October, to mark the anniversary of the event.
The festival is held in an area named the Theresienwiese ( field, or meadow, of Therese ), often पुकारा Wiesn for short, located near Munich 's center.
Large quantities of Oktoberfest Beer are consumed, साथ लगभग 7 million liters served during the 16 day festival in 2007.
Visitors may also आनंद a wide variety of traditional food such as Hendl ( chicken ), Schweinebraten ( roast pork ), Schweinshaxe ( grilled हैम hock ), Steckerlfisch ( grilled fish on a stick ), Würstl ( sausages ) along with Brezeln ( Pretzel ), knödel ( potato or bread dumplings ), Käsespätzle ( चीज noodles ), Reiberdatschi ( potato pancakes ), sauerkraut or Rotkohl/Blaukraut ( रेड cabbage ) along with such Bavarian delicacies as Obatzda ( a spiced cheese-butter spread ) and Weisswurst ( a white सॉसेज ).
A platter with cheese and garnishes
पहियों of gouda
Cheese is a generic term for a diverse group of milk-based food उत्पाद.
Cheese is produced in wide-ranging flavors, textures, and forms.
Cheese consists of proteins and मोटे from मिल्क, usually the मिल्क of cows, buffalo, goats, or sheep.
It is produced by coagulation of the milk protein casein.
Typically, the milk is acidified and addition of the enzyme rennet causes coagulation.
the solids are अलग and pressed into final रूप.
Some cheeses have molds on the rind or throughout.
Most cheeses melt at cooking temperature.
Hundreds of types of cheese from various countries are उत्पादित.
Their styles, textures and flavors depend on the origin of the milk ( including the animal 's diet ), whether they have been pasteurized, the butterfat content, the bacteria and mold, the processing, and aging.
Herbs, spices, or wood smoke may be used as flavoring agents.
The पीला to red color of many cheeses, ऐसे as Red Leicester, is normally formed from adding annatto.
For a few cheeses, the milk is curdled by adding acids such as vinegar or lemon juice.
Most cheeses are acidified to a lesser degree by bacteria, which turn milk sugars into lactic acid, then the जोड of rennet completes the curdling.
Vegetarian alternatives to rennet are available ; most are produced by fermentation of the fungus Mucor miehei, but others have been extracted from various प्रजाति of the Cynara thistle family.
Cheese is valued for its portability, long life, and high content of मोटे, protein, कैल्सियम, and phosphorus.
Cheese is more compact and has a longer shelf life than milk, although how long a cheese होगा keep may निर्भर on the प्रकार of cheese ; labels on packets of cheese often अर्जी that a cheese should be consumed within three to five days of opening.
Generally speaking, मुश्किल cheeses last longer than soft cheeses, such as Brie or goat 's milk cheese.
Cheesemakers near a dairy region may benefit from fresher, lower-priced milk, and lower shipping costs.
The long storage life of some cheese, especially if it is encased in a protective rind, allows selling when markets are favorable.
Additional ingredients may be added to some cheeses, such as black मिर्च, garlic, chives or cranberries.
A विशेषज्ञ seller of cheese is sometimes known as a cheesemonger.
To become an expert in this field, like wine or कुकिंग, requires some formal education and years of tasting and hands-on experience.
इस position is typically responsible for all aspects of the cheese inventory ; selecting the cheese menu, purchasing, receiving, storage, and ripening.
Legal citation signals are a set of brief abbreviated phrases or words used to clarify the authority or significance of a विधिक citation as it relates to a proposition.
Signals help a reader quickly discern meaning or usefulness of a particular reference when the reference itself does not provide adequate information.
Most citation signals are placed in front of the citation to which they apply.
For example, in the paragraph जब writing a legal तर्क, it is important to refer to primary sources.
To assist readers in locating these sources, it is desirable to use a standardized citation format.
See generally Harvard Law Review Association, The Bluebook : A वर्दी System of Citation ( 18th ed. 2005 ).
Note, however, that some न्यायालयों may require any legal papers that are submitted to them to conform to a different citation format.
the signal is the phrase `` see generally, '' which indicates that the citation `` The Bluebook : A Uniform System of Citation ( 18th ed. 2005 ) '' provides general background information on the topic.
Neil Alden Armstrong ( August 5, 1930 – August 25, 2012 ) was an American astronaut and the first व्यक्ति to walk on the Moon.
he was also an aerospace engineer, naval aviator, test pilot, and university professor.
पहले becoming an astronaut, Armstrong was an अधिकारी in the U.S. नेवी and served in the Korean War.
After the war, he earned his स्नातक 's degree at Purdue University and served as a test पायलट at the National सलाहकार Committee for Aeronautics high-speed Flight Station, now known as the Dryden Flight Research Center, where he logged over 900 flights.
He later समाप्त graduate studies at the University of Southern California.
A participant in the U.S. Air फ़ोर्स 's Man in Space Soonest and X-20 Dyna-Soar human spaceflight programs, Armstrong joined the NASA astronaut Corps in 1962.
He made his first space flight, as command pilot of Gemini 8, in 1966, becoming NASA 's first civilian astronaut to fly in स्पेस.
On this mission, he performed the first docking of two spacecraft, with pilot David स्कॉट.
Armstrong 's second and last spaceflight was as mission कमांडर of the Apollo 11 moon landing, in July 1969.
On this mission, आर्मस्ट्रांग and Buzz Aldrin descended to the lunar surface and खर्च two and a half hours exploring, while Michael Collins remained in lunar orbit in the कमांड Module.
Along with कॉलिन्स and Aldrin, Armstrong was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President Richard Nixon ; in 1978, President Jimmy Carter presented Armstrong the Congressional Space Medal of Honor in 1978 ; he and his former crewmates received the Congressional Gold Medal in 2009.
Armstrong died in Cincinnati, Ohio, on August 25, 2012, at the age of 82, बाद complications from coronary artery bypass surgery.
Secretariat ( March 30, 1970 – October 4, 1989 ) was an American Thoroughbred racehorse कि in 1973 became the first U.S. Triple Crown चैंपियन in 25 years.
He नियत race records in all three events in the श्रेणी — the Kentucky Derby ( 1:59.4 ), the preakness Stakes ( 1:53 ), और the Belmont Stakes ( 2:24 ) — records that still stand today.
He is considered to be one of the greatest Thoroughbreds of all time.
In 1999, ईएसपीएन ranked सचिवालय the 35th best athlete of the 20th century, the highest ranking racehorse on the list URL_http.
He ranked second behind Man o ' युद्ध in the Blood-Horse 's सूची of the Top 100 U.S. Racehorses of the 20th Century.
Secretariat was sired by Bold Ruler out of Somethingroyal, by Princequillo.
He was foaled at The Meadow in कैरोलीन County, Virginia.
Like his famous पूर्ववर्ती Man o ' War, Secretariat was a large chestnut colt and was given the same nickname, `` बिग Red. ''
सचिवालय 's grandsire, nasrullah, is also the great-great-grandsire of 1977 Triple Crown विजेता सिएटल Slew.
Owned by Penny chenery, he was trained by Lucien Laurin and mainly ridden by Canadian jockey Ron Turcotte, along with apprentice jockey Paul Feliciano ( first two races ), and veteran Eddie Maple ( last race ).
He raced in Chenery 's Meadow Stable 's blue and white checkered colors and his groom was Eddie Sweat.
Secretariat stood approximately tall, and weighed, साथ a 75-inch girth, in his racing prime.
Madrid (, ) is the पूंजी और largest city of Spain.
The population of the city is roughly 3.3 million and the entire population of the मैड्रिड metropolitan क्षेत्रफल is calculated to be around 6.5 million.
It is the third-largest city in the European Union, बाद London and Berlin, and its metropolitan area is the third-largest in the European Union after London and Paris.
The city spans a total of.
The city is located on the Manzanares नदी in the centre of both the country and the Community of Madrid ( which comprises the city of Madrid, its conurbation and extended suburbs and villages ) ; इस community is bordered by the autonomous communities of Castile and león and Castile-La Mancha.
As the capital city of Spain, seat of government, and residence of the Spanish monarch, Madrid is also the political, economic and cultural centre of Spain.
The current mayor is Ana Botella from the People 's Party ( PP ).
The Madrid urban agglomeration has the third-largest GDP in the European Union and its influences in राजनीती, education, entertainment, environment, media, fashion, science, culture, and the arts all contribute to its status as एक of the world 's major global cities.
Due to its economic output, high standard of living, and मार्केट size, Madrid is माना the major financial centre of Southern Europe and the Iberian Peninsula ; it hosts the head offices of the vast majority of the major Spanish कंपनियाँ, such as Telefónica, Iberia or Repsol.
Madrid is the most touristic city of Spain, the fourth-most touristic of the continent, and the seventh most visited city in the संसार according to Forbes.
Is the 10th most livable city in the world according to monocle magazine, in its 2010 index.
Madrid also बाँधने among the 12 greenest European cities in 2010. < ref name= '' http : //www.citymayors.com/environment/greenest-cities-europe.html '' > Madrid is currently a Candidate नगर for the 2020 Summer Olympics.
Madrid houses the headquarters of the World Tourism Organization ( WTO ), belonging to the United Nations Organization ( UN ), the segib, the Organization of Ibero-American States ( OEI ), and the Public Interest Oversight Board ( PIOB ).
It also hosts major international institutions regulators of Spanish : the Standing Committee of the Association of Spanish भाषा Academies, headquarters of the Royal Spanish Academy ( RAE ), the cervantes Institute और the Foundation of तात्कालिक Spanish ( Fundéu ).
Madrid organizes fairs as FITUR, ARCO, SIMO TCI and the Cibeles Madrid Fashion Week.
While Madrid possesses a modern infrastructure, it has preserved the look and feel of many of its historic neighbourhoods and streets.
Its लैंडमार्क include the Royal Palace of Madrid ; the Teatro Real ( Royal theatre ) with its लौटी 1850 Opera House ; the Buen Retiro Park, founded in 1631 ; the 19th-century National Library building ( founded in 1712 ) containing some of स्पेन 's historical archives ; a large क्रमांक of National museums, and the Golden Triangle of Art, स्तिथ along the Paseo del Prado and comprising three art museums : प्राडो Museum, the museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía, a museum of modern art, and the Thyssen-Bornemisza संग्रहालय, which completes the shortcomings of the other two museums.
cibeles Palace and Fountain have become the monument symbol of the city.
The path of the via Appia और of the via Appia Traiana.
Remains of the Appian Way in Rome, near Quarto Miglio
Near Rome.
the Appian Way ( Latin and Italian : Via Appia ) was one of the earliest and strategically most important रोमन सड़कें of the ancient गणतंत्र.
It connected Rome to Brindisi, Apulia, in southeast Italy.
Its importance is indicated by इसके common name, recorded by Statius :
Appia teritur regina longarum viarum
`` the appian way is the queen of the long roads ''
The road is named after Appius Claudius Caecus, the Roman censor who began and completed the first खण्ड as a military road to the south in 312 BC दौरान the Samnite Wars.
The Draupner wave, a single दानव wave measured on New Year 's Day 1995, finally confirmed the existence of freak waves, which had previously been considered near-mythical
Rogue waves ( also known as freak waves, monster waves, कातिल waves, extreme waves, and abnormal लहरें ) are relatively large and spontaneous ocean surface waves कि occur far out at sea, and are a threat even to large ships and ocean liners.
In oceanography, वे are अधिक precisely defined as waves whose height is more than twice the significant wave height ( SWH ), which is itself defined as the mean of the largest third of waves in a wave record.
Therefore rogue waves are not necessarily the biggest waves found at sea ; they are, rather, surprisingly large waves for a given sea राज्य.
Rogue waves seem not to have a single distinct cause, but occur where physical factors such as ऊँची winds and दमदार currents cause waves to merge to create a सिंगल exceptionally large wave.
Electress Sophia of Hanover ( 1630–1714 )
The line of succession to the British throne is the ordered sequence of all those people eligible to succeed to the throne of the United Kingdom और the other 15 Commonwealth realms.
The Act of Settlement 1701 bestowed succession on the Electress Sophia of Hanover and her descendants while excluding Roman Catholics.
the British government does not publish an official list of सब those in line to succeed, but the work of genealogical authors and amateur researchers suggests that there are several thousand people potentially in line.
At a summit in Perth, Western Australia in 2011, the heads of government of all 16 Commonwealth realms agreed to take steps to adopt absolute primogeniture, end the exclusion of people married to Roman Catholics, और make other changes in the succession rules.
The line of succession is also used to select the Counsellors of State ( and a regent if the need arises ) under the provisions of the Regency Act 1937.
For earlier versions of the line of succession, see History of the British line of succession.
Edward Montgomery Clift ( October 17, 1920July 23, 1966 ) was an American film and stage कर्ता The New York Times’ obituary noted his portrayal of `` moody, संवेदनशील young men ''.
He often played outsiders and `` victim-heroes '' ; examples include the social climber in George Stevens 's A Place in the Sun, the anguished Catholic priest in Hitchcock 's I कबूल, the doomed regular soldier Robert E. Lee Prewitt in Fred Zinnemann 's From Here to Eternity, and the Jewish GI bullied by antisemites in Edward Dmytryk 's The Young Lions.
Later, after a disfiguring car crash in 1956, and alcohol and prescription drug abuse, he became erratic.
nevertheless important roles were still his, including `` the reckless, alcoholic, mother-fixated rodeo performer '' in John Huston 's The Misfits, the title role in Huston 's, and the विशेषज्ञता camp victim in Stanley Kramer 's Judgment at Nuremberg. ''
क्लिफ्ट received four Academy Award nominations दौरान उसके करियर, three for Best Actor और one for Best Supporting कर्ता.
The War on Terror ( also known as the Global War on आतंक ) is a term commonly applied to an international सैन्य campaign which started as a result of the 11 September 2001 terrorist attacks on the United States.
इस resulted in an अंतरराष्ट्रीय military campaign to eliminate al-Qaeda and other militant organizations.
The United Kingdom and many अन्य NATO and non-NATO राष्ट्र participate in the conflict.
The phrase 'War on Terror ' was first used by US President George W. Bush on 20 September 2001.
The Bush administration and the Western media have since used the term to signify a वैश्विक military, political, lawful, and conceptual struggle—targeting both organizations designated as terrorist and regimes accused of supporting them.
it was typically प्रयुक्त with a particular focus on militant islamists, al-Qaeda, and other jihadi groups.
Although the term is not officially used by the administration of US President Barack Obama ( which बजाय uses the term विदेशी Contingency Operation ), it is still commonly used by politicians, in the media and by some aspects of government officially, such as the United States ' Global War on Terrorism Service Medal.

the main causes of World युद्ध II were nationalistic मुद्दे, unresolved मुद्दे, and resentments resulting from World War I and the interwar period in Europe, in addition to the effects of the Great Depression in the 1930s.
The culmination of events that led to the outbreak of war are generally समझा to be the 1939 invasion of Poland by जर्मनी और Soviet Russia and the 1937 invasion of the Republic of China by the Empire of Japan.
These military aggressions were the result of decisions made by the authoritarian ruling Nazi elite in Germany and by the leadership of the Kwantung Army in Japan.
World War II started after these aggressive actions were मिले with an official declaration of war and/or armed resistance.

The Mitsubishi Galant is an automobile manufactured by Mitsubishi Motors between 1969 and 2012.
The name was derived from the French शब्द galant, meaning `` chivalrous ''.
There have been nine distinct generations, and cumulative sales अभी exceed five million.
It began as a compact sedan, but over the course of its life रै evolved into a larger mid-size car.
Initial production was only based in Japan, but since 1994 the American market has been served by vehicles assembled at the former Diamond-Star Motors ( dsm ) facility in Normal, Illinois.
Blood pressure ( bp ), sometimes referred to as arterial blood pressure, is the pressure exerted by circulating blood upon the walls of blood बरतन, and is one of the principal vital signs.
When used without further specification, `` blood pressure '' usually refers to the arterial pressure of the प्रणालीगत circulation.
During each heartbeat, blood pressure varies between a maximum ( systolic ) and a minimum ( diastolic ) pressure.
The blood pressure in the circulation is principally due to the pumping action of the heart.
Differences in mean रक्त pressure are responsible for blood flow from one location to another in the circulation.
The rate of औसत रक्त flow depends on the resistance to flow presented by the blood vessels.
Mean blood दबाव decreases as the circulating blood moves away from the heart through arteries and capillaries due to viscous losses of energy.
Mean blood pressure drops over the whole circulation, although most of the fall occurs along the small arteries and arterioles.
Gravity affects blood pressure via hydrostatic forces ( e.g., during standing ) और valves in veins, श्वास, and pumping from contraction of skeletal muscles also influence blood pressure in veins.
Blood दबाव without further specification usually refers to the systemic arterial दबाव measured at a person 's upper arm and is a measure of the pressure in the brachial artery, the major धमनी in the upper arm.
A person’s blood pressure is प्रायः expressed in terms of the systolic दबाव over diastolic pressure and is measured in millimetres of पारा ( mmHg ), for example 120/80.
A veto – Latin for `` I forbid '' – is the power ( used by an officer of the राज्य, लिये example ) to unilaterally stop an आधिकारिक action, especially the enactment of legislation.
A veto can be absolute, as for instance in the United Nations Security Council, whose permanent members ( China, France, Russia, United Kingdom, United States of America ) can ब्लाक any resolution.
Or it can be limited, as in the legislative process of the United States, where a two-thirds vote in both the House और Senate may override a Presidential veto of legislation.
A veto only gives power to stop changes, not to adopt उन्हें ( मगर for the rare `` amendatory veto '' ).
Thus a veto allows its holder to protect the status quo.
The अवधारणा of a veto body originated with the रोमन consuls and tribunes.
Either of the two consuls holding office in a given year could block a military or civil decision by the other ; any tribune had the power to unilaterally block legislation passed by the Roman Senate.
Sulfur डाइऑक्साइड ( also sulphur डाइऑक्साइड ) is the chemical compound with the formula.
It is a toxic gas with a pungent, तकलीफदेह smell, that is released by volcanoes and in विभिन्न industrial processes.
Since coal and petroleum often contain sulfur compounds, उनके combustion generates sulfur dioxide unless the sulfur compounds are removed before burning the fuel.
Further oxidation of SO2, usually in the उपस्थिति of a catalyst such as NO2, forms h2so4, and thus acid rain.
Sulfur dioxide emissions are also a precursor to particulates in the atmosphere.
Both of these impacts are cause for concern over the environmental impact of these fuels.
Myasthenia gravis ( from Greek μύς `` मांसपेशी '', `` weakness '', and `` serious '' ; abbreviated mg ) is an autoimmune neuromuscular disease leading to fluctuating muscle weakness and fatigability.
It is an autoimmune विकार, in which weakness is caused by circulating antibodies that block acetylcholine receptors at the postsynaptic neuromuscular junction, inhibiting the excitatory प्रभाव of the neurotransmitter acetylcholine on nicotinic receptors throughout neuromuscular junctions.
myasthenia is treated medically with acetylcholinesterase inhibitors or immunosuppressants, and, in selected cases, thymectomy.
The disease incidence is 3–30 मामले per million per year and rising as a result of increased awareness.
MG must be विशिष्ट from congenital myasthenic syndromes that can present similar symptoms but offer no response to immunosuppressive treatments.
Reflective मुड़ nematic द्रव crystal display.
Polarizing filter फिल्मी with a vertical axis to polarize light as it enters.
Glass substrate with ITO electrodes.
The shapes of these electrodes will determine the shapes कि will appear when the LCD is turned ON.
Vertical ridges etched on the surface are smooth.
Twisted nematic liquid crystal.
Glass substrate with common electrode film ( ITO ) with आड़ा ridges to line up with the horizontal filter.
Polarizing filter film साथ a horizontal axis to block/pass light.
Reflective surface to send light back to viewer.
( In a backlit LCD, इस layer is replaced with a light सोर्स. )
A liquid-crystal display ( LCD ) is a चपटा panel display, electronic visual display, or video display that uses the light modulating properties of liquid crystals.
Liquid crystals do नहीं emit light directly.
LCDs are available to display arbitrary images ( as in a general-purpose computer display ) or फिक्स्ड बिंब which can be displayed or hidden, such as preset words, digits, and 7-segment displays as in a digital क्लॉक.
वे use the same basic technology, except that arbitrary images are बना up of a large number of small pixels, while अन्य displays have larger elements.
LCDs are used in a wide दायरा of applications including computer monitors, televisions, instrument panels, aircraft कॉकपिट displays, and signage.
They are common in consumer devices such as video खिलाड़ी, gaming devices, clocks, watches, calculators, and telephones, and have replaced cathode ray tube ( CRT ) displays in सबसे applications.
They are available in a wider range of screen sizes than CRT and प्लाज्मा displays, and since they do not use phosphors, they do not suffer image burn-in.
LCDs are, however, susceptible to image persistence.
The LCD screen is more energy efficient और can be disposed of more सकुशल than a CRT.
Its low विद्युत power consumption enables it to be used in battery -powered electronic उपकरण.
It is an electronically modulated optical device made up of any number of segments filled with liquid crystals and arrayed in front of a light source ( backlight ) or reflector to produce images in color or मोनोक्रोम.
Liquid crystals were first खोजा in 1888.
By 2008, worldwide sales of televisions with LCD screens exceeded सालाना sales of CRT units ; the CRT became obsolete for most purposes.
The Borgata Hotel Casino and Spa is a luxury hotel, casino, and spa in Atlantic City, New Jersey, United States.
It is owned by मरीना District Development, a joint venture between boyd Gaming and a divesture trust established by MGM Resorts International.
The $ 1.1 billion casino hotel features 2,002 rooms and is the largest hotel in New जर्सी.
The Borgata opened in जुलाई 2003 as a Las Vegas-style megaresort and is the top-grossing casino in Atlantic City.
A bottle of high potency B-complex vitamin supplement pills.
A vitamin ( or ) is an organic यौगिक required by an organism as a vital nutrient in limited amounts.
An organic chemical compound ( or related set of compounds ) is called a vitamin when it can not be synthesized in sufficient quantities by an organism, और must be obtained from the diet.
Thus, the term is conditional both on the हालातों and on the particular organism.
For example, ascorbic acid ( vitamin C ) is a vitamin for humans, but not for most other animals, and biotin and vitamin D are required in the human आहार only in certain circumstances.
By convention, the पद vitamin includes neither अन्य essential nutrients, such as dietary minerals, essential fatty acids, or essential amino acids ( which are needed in larger amounts than vitamins ) nor the large number of other nutrients that promote health but are otherwise required less often.
Thirteen vitamins are universally पहचाना at present.
Vitamins are वर्गीकृत by their biological and chemical कार्यकलाप, not उनके structure.
Thus, each `` vitamin '' refers to a number of vitamer compounds that सब show the biological activity associated with a particular विटामिन.
Such a set of chemicals is grouped under an alphabetized vitamin `` generic descriptor '' title, such as `` vitamin A ``, जिससे includes the compounds retinal, retinol, and four known carotenoids.
Vitamers by definition are convertible to the क्रियाशील form of the vitamin in the body, and are sometimes inter-convertible to one another, as well.
Vitamins have विविध biochemical functions.
Some have hormone-like functions as regulators of mineral metabolism ( such as vitamin D ), or regulators of cell and tissue growth and differentiation ( such as कुछ forms of vitamin A ).
Others function as antioxidants ( e.g., vitamin E and sometimes vitamin C ).
The largest number of vitamins ( such as b जटिल vitamins ) function as precursors लिये enzyme cofactors, कि help enzymes in their work as catalysts in metabolism.
In this भूमिका, vitamins may be tightly bound to enzymes as part of prosthetic groups : लिये example, biotin is part of enzymes involved in making fatty acids.
Vitamins may also be less tightly bound to एंजाइम catalysts as coenzymes, detachable molecules that function to carry रासायनिक groups or electrons between molecules.
For example, folic acid may carry methyl, formyl, and methylene groups in the cell.
Although these roles in assisting enzyme-substrate प्रतिक्रियाएँ are vitamins ' best-known function, the other vitamin functions are equally महत्वपूर्ण.
जबतक the mid-1930s, when the first वाणिज्यिक yeast-extract विटामिन B complex और semi-synthetic vitamin C supplement tablets were sold, vitamins were obtained solely through food सेवन, and changes in diet ( which, for example, could occur during a particular growing season ) usually greatly altered the types और amounts of vitamins ingested.
however, vitamins have been produced as commodity रसायन and made widely available as inexpensive semisynthetic and synthetic-source multivitamin dietary and food supplements and additives, since the middle of the 20th century.
संसार मुस्लिम population by percentage ( Pew Research Center, 2009 )
World Muslim population in लाखो
Islam is the world 's second largest religion after Christianity.
According to a 2010 study, Islam रै 1.62 billion adherents, बनाना up over 23 % of the world population.
Islam is the predominant religion in the Middle East, in Sahel, in the Horn of Africa and उत्तरी अफ़्रीकी, और in some parts of Asia.
Large communities of Muslims are also found in China, the balkans, and Russia.
Other parts of the world host large Muslim immigrant communities ; in Western Europe, for instance, Islam is the second largest religion बाद Christianity, where it represents 6 % of the total population.
According to the Pew Research Center in 2010 there were 49 Muslim-majority countries.
around 62 % of the world 's Muslims live in South and Southeast Asia, with over 1 billion adherents.
The largest Muslim country is Indonesia, home to 12.7 % of the world 's Muslims, followed by Pakistan ( 11.0 % ), India ( 10.9 % ), and Bangladesh ( 9.2 % ).
About 20 % of Muslims सजीव in Arab countries.
In the Middle East, the non-Arab countries of Turkey and Iran are the largest Muslim-majority countries ; in Africa, Egypt and Nigeria have the most populous Muslim communities.
A study conducted by the Pew Research Center in 2010 और released January 2011 found that there are 1.62 billion Muslims around the world.
The study मिला more मुसलमान in the United Kingdom than in लेबनान and अधिक in China than in Syria.
Rhode Island ( or ), officially the State of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations, is a state in the New England region of the United States.
Rhode Island is the smallest in area, the eighth least populous, but the second most densely populated of the 50 US states behind New Jersey.
Rhode Island is bordered by Connecticut to the west and मैसाचुसेट्स to the north and east, and it shares a water boundary with New York 's Long Island to the दक्षिणपश्चिम.
Rhode Island was the first of the 13 original colonies to declare independence from British rule, declaring itself independent on may 4, 1776, two months before any other colony.
The State was also the last of the thirteen original colonies to ratify the संयुक्त States Constitution.
Rhode Island 's official nickname is `` The Ocean State '', a reference to the State 's geography, since Rhode Island has several large bays and inlets that राशि to about 14 % of its total area.
Its land area is, लकिन its total area is significantly larger.
Dubai ( ; ', ) is a city in the संयुक्त Arab Emirates, located within the emirate of the same name.
the emirate of दुबई is located on the southeast coast of the Persian Gulf on the arabian Peninsula and is one of the seven emirates that make up the देश.
It has the largest जनसांख्यिकी in the uae ( 2,106,177 ) और the second-largest land territory by area ( 4,114 km2 ) after Abu धाबी.
Dubai और Abu Dhabi, the national capital, हैं the only two emirates to have veto power over critical matters of national importance in the country 's legislature.
The city of Dubai is located on the emirate 's northern coastline and heads up the Dubai-Sharjah-Ajman metropolitan area.
Dubai is nowadays often misperceived as a country or city-state and, in some cases, the UAE as a whole has been वर्णित as 'Dubai '.
The earliest mention of Dubai is in 1095 AD, और the earliest recorded settlement in the region dates from 1799.
The Sheikhdom of Dubai was formally established in 1833 by Sheikh Maktoum bin Butti Al-Maktoum when he persuaded around 800 members of his जनजाति of the Bani Yas, living in what थी then the Second Saudi State और now part of Saudi Arabia, to follow him to the Dubai Creek by the Abu Falasa clan of the Bani Yas.
It remained under the tribe 's control when the United Kingdom assumed protection of the Sheikhdom in 1892 and joined the nascent United Arab Emirates upon independence in 1971 as the country 's second emirate.
इसके strategic geographic location made the town an important trading hub and by the beginning of the 20th century, Dubai was already an important regional port.
Today, दुबई has उभरा as a cosmopolitan metropolis that रै grown steadily to become a global city and a business and cultural hub of the Middle East and the Persian Gulf प्रदेश.
Although Dubai 's economy थी historically निर्मित on the oil industry, the अमीर 's Western-style model of business drives its अर्थव्यवस्था with the main revenues now coming from tourism, real estate, and financial services.
Dubai रै recently attracted world attention through अनेक innovative विशाल construction projects and sports events.
The नगर has become symbolic for its skyscrapers and high-rise buildings, such as the world 's tallest Burj Khalifa, in addition to ambitious development प्रोजेक्ट सहित man-made islands, hotels, and some of the largest shopping malls in the प्रदेश and the world.
इस increased attention has also highlighted मजदूर and human rights issues concerning the city 's largely दक्षिण Asian paid workforce.
Dubai 's property market experienced a major deterioration in 2008–2009 as a result of the worldwide economic downturn following the financial crisis of 2007-2008.
However, Dubai has made a steady and gradual recovery with सहायता coming from neighboring emirates.
The handful of new projects that are in the pipeline have been able to सहायता Dubai real estate make a comeback.
As of 2012, Dubai is the 22nd most expensive city in the world, and the most expensive city in the Middle ईस्ट, surpassing Israel 's Tel Aviv ( 31st ).
Dubai has also been rated as one of the best places to live in the Middle East, including by US American वैश्विक consulting firm Mercer who रेटेड the city as the best place to live in the Middle East in 2011.
