An ocean ( ; the World Ocean of classical antiquity ) is a body of saline water that composes a large part of a planet 's जलमंडल.
In the context of Earth, it refers to one or all of the major divisions of the planet 's World Ocean – they are, in descending order of area, the Pacific, Atlantic, Indian, Southern ( Antarctic ), and आर्कटिक Oceans.
The word `` sea `` is often used interchangeably with `` ocean '', but strictly speaking a sea is a देह of saline जल ( possibly a प्रभाग of the संसार Ocean ) partly or fully enclosed by land.
Earth is the only planet known to have an समंदर ( or कोई large amounts of open liquid water ).
Approximately 72 % of the planet 's surface ( ~3.6x108 km2 ) is covered by saline water कि is customarily divided into several principal oceans और smaller seas, with the ocean covering approximately 71 % of the Earth 's surface.
In terms of the hydrosphere of the Earth, the ocean contains 97 % of the Earth 's water.
Oceanographers have stated that out of 97 %, only 5 % of the ocean as a whole on Earth has been explored.
Because it is the principal component of Earth 's hydrosphere, the world ocean is integral to all known life, forms part of the carbon cycle, and influences climate and weather patterns.
The total volume is approximately 1.3 billion cubic kilometres ( 310 million cu mi ) with an औसत depth of.
It is the आवास of 230,000 known species, हालांकि much of the ocean 's depths remain unexplored and it is estimated that over two million marine प्रजाति exist.
The origin of Earth 's oceans is still unknown, but oceans are believed to have formed in the Hadean period और may have been the impetus for the emergence of life.
Extraterrestrial oceans may be रचित of a wide range of elements and यौगिकों.
The only confirmed large stable bodies of extraterrestrial surface liquids are the lakes of टाइटन, although there is evidence for the existence of oceans elsewhere in the सौर System.
Early in their geologic histories, Mars and Venus are theorized to have had large water महासागर.
The Mars ocean hypothesis suggests that nearly a तीसरा of the सतह of Mars was once covered by water, though the water on Mars is no longer oceanic, and a runaway greenhouse effect may have boiled दूर the global ocean of Venus.
Compounds such as salts and अमोनिया dissolved in जल lower इसके freezing पाइंट, so that water might exist in large quantities in extraterrestrial environments as brine or convecting ice.
Unconfirmed oceans are speculated beneath the surface of many बौना planets and natural satellites ; notably, the ocean of Europa is believed to have over twice the water volume of धरती.
The Solar प्रणाली 's gas giant planets are also believed to possess liquid atmospheric layers of yet to be पुष्टि compositions.
Oceans may also exist on exoplanets and exomoons, सहित surface oceans of liquid water within a circumstellar habitable zone.
Ocean planets are a hypothetical type of ग्रह with a surface completely covered with liquid.
Elvis Aaron Presley ( January 8, 1935 – August 16, 1977 ) was an अमरीकी singer and actor.
a cultural icon, he is commonly known by the single name Elvis.
One of the most लोकप्रिय musicians of the 20th century, he is often referred to as the `` किंग of Rock और Roll '' or `` the King ''.
born in Tupelo, Mississippi, प्रेस्ली moved to Memphis, Tennessee, साथ his family at the age of 13.
He began his करियर there in 1954, working साथ सूर्य Records owner Sam Phillips, who wanted to लाओ the sound of African-American music to a wider audience.
Accompanied by guitarist Scotty Moore and bassist Bill ब्लैक, Presley was the most important popularizer of rockabilly, an uptempo, backbeat -driven fusion of country and rhythm and blues.
RCA Victor acquired his contract in a सौदे arranged by Colonel Tom Parker, who went on to manage the singer for over two decades.
Presley 's first RCA single, `` Heartbreak Hotel ``, released in January 1956, was a number-one hit.
He became the leading figure of the newly popular sound of चट्टान and roll with a series of network television appearances and chart-topping records.
His energized interpretations of songs, अनेक from African-American sources, and his uninhibited performance style made him enormously popular—and विवादास्पद.
in November 1956, he made his film debut in Love Me Tender.
Drafted into military service in 1958, Presley relaunched his recording career two years बाद with some of his most commercially successful work.
He staged few concerts however, and guided by Parker, proceeded to devote much of the 1960s to making Hollywood movies and soundtrack albums, most of them critically derided.
In 1968, after seven years away from the stage, he returned to live performance in a celebrated comeback television special that led to an विस्तारित Las वेगास concert residency and a string of profitable tours.
in 1973 Presley मंचन the first concert broadcast globally via उपग्रह, Aloha from हवाई.
Prescription drug abuse severely deteriorated his health, and he died suddenly in 1977 at the age of 42.
Presley is regarded as one of the most important figures of 20th-century popular culture.
He had a versatile voice and unusually wide success encompassing many genres, including देश, pop ballads, gospel, and blues.
He is the best-selling solo artist in the history of लोकप्रिय music.
Nominated लिये 14 competitive Grammys, he won three, and received the Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award at age 36.
He has been inducted into multiple music halls of कीर्ति.
A glass of root beer with foam
Root beer is a carbonated, sweetened beverage, originally बना using the root of a sassafras plant ( or the छाल of a sassafras tree ) as the primary flavor.
Root beer, popularized in North America, comes in two forms : alcoholic and soft drink.
The historical root beer was analogous to small beer in that the process provided a drink with a very low alcohol content.
Although roots are used as the source of many soft drinks throughout the world, often different names are used.
Fluorescent minerals emit दृश्य light when उजागर to पराबैंगनी light
Fluorescence is the उत्सर्जन of light by a substance that has absorbed light or other electromagnetic विकिरण.
it is a form of luminescence.
In most cases, the emitted light has a longer wavelength, and therefore lower energy, than the absorbed radiation.
However, when the absorbed electromagnetic radiation is intense, it is संभावित for one electron to absorb two photons ; इस two-photon absorption can lead to emission of radiation having a shorter wavelength than the absorbed radiation.
The emitted radiation may also be of the same wavelength as the absorbed radiation, termed `` resonance fluorescence ''.
The most striking examples of fluorescence occur when the absorbed radiation is in the ultraviolet region of the spectrum, and thus invisible to the human eye, and the emitted light is in the visible region.
प्रतिदीप्ति has many practical applications, including mineralogy, gemology, chemical sensors ( प्रतिदीप्ति spectroscopy ), fluorescent labelling, dyes, biological detectors, and, most commonly, fluorescent दीये.
Informal logic, intuitively, refers to the principles of logic and logical विचार outside of a formal setting.
however, शायद because of the informal in the title, the precise definition of informal logic is a matter of some dispute.
Ralph H. Johnson and J. Anthony ब्लेयर define अनौपचारिक logic as `` a branch of logic whose task is to develop non-formal standards, criteria, प्रक्रियाओं लिये the analysis, interpretation, evaluation, criticism and construction of argumentation. ''
इस definition reflects what had been implicit in their practice and what others were doing in their informal logic texts.
अनौपचारिक logic is associated with ( informal ) fallacies, critical thinking, the Thinking Skills Movement and the interdisciplinary पूछताछ known as argumentation theory.
Frans H. van Eemeren writes that the label `` informal logic '' covers a `` collection of normative approaches to the study of reasoning in ordinary language that remain closer to the अभ्यास of argumentation than औपचारिक logic. ''
USA annual real GDP 1910–60, with the years of the Great Depression ( 1929–1939 ) highlighted.
Unemployment rate in the US 1910–1960, with the years of the Great Depression ( 1929–1939 ) highlighted.
The Great Depression began in August of 1929, when the United States economy first went into an economic मंदी.
Although the country spent two महीने with declining GDP, it was नहीं until the Wall Street Crash of October, 1929 that the effects of a declining economy यहूद लगा, and a major worldwide economic downturn ensued.
The market crash marked the beginning of a decade of high unemployment, गरीबी, low profits, deflation, plunging फार्म incomes, and lost opportunities for economic growth and personal advancement.
Although इसके causes are स्टिल uncertain and controversial, the net effect was a sudden and general loss of confidence in the economic भविष्य.
The usual explanations include numerous factors, especially high consumer debt, ill-regulated markets that permitted overoptimistic loans by banks and investors, and the lack of high-growth new industries, all interacting to create a downward economic spiral of reduced spending, falling confidence, and lowered production.
Industries that suffered the most included construction, agriculture as dust-bowl शर्तें persisted in the agricultural heartland, shipping, mining, और लॉगिंग as well as durable goods like automobiles और appliances that could be postponed.
The economy पहुँचे bottom in the winter of 1932–33 ; then came four years of very rapid growth until 1937, when the Recession of 1937 brought वापस 1934 levels of unemployment.
The Depression caused major political परिवर्तन in America.
Three years into the depression, Herbert Hoover lost the 1932 presidential election to फ्रैंकलिन Delano Roosevelt in a sweeping landslide.
Roosevelt 's economic रिकवरी plan, the New Deal, instituted unprecedented कार्यक्रम for relief, recovery and reform, and brought about a major realignment of American politics.
The Depression also resulted in an increase of emigration of people to अन्य countries for the first time in American history.
For example, कुछ immigrants went back to their native countries, and some native US citizens went to Canada, Australia, and South Africa.
It also resulted in the mass migration of people from badly hit areas in the Great Plains and the South to places such as California and the North, respectively ( see Okies and the Great Migration of African Americans ).
Racial tensions also increased during this समय.
By the 1940s immigration had लौटे back to normal, and emigration declined.
A well-known example of an emigrant was Frank McCourt, who went to Ireland, as recounted in his book एंजेला 's Ashes.
The memory of the Depression also shaped modern theories of economics and resulted in many changes in how the government dealt with आर्थिक downturns, such as the use of stimulus packages, Keynesian economics, और Social Security.
It also shaped modern American साहित्य, resulting in famous novels such as John Steinbeck 's `` The Grapes of प्रकोप `` and `` Of Mice and Men ``.
The Great Depression of the 1930s started with the stock market crash of October 1929.
Turkey ( ), officially the Republic of Turkey, is a transcontinental country, located mostly on Anatolia in Western Asia and on East Thrace in Southeastern यूरोपीय.
Turkey is bordered by eight countries : Bulgaria to the northwest ; यूनानियों to the वेस्ट ; Georgia to the northeast ; Armenia, इरान and the Azerbaijani exclave of nakhchivan to the east ; and Iraq and Syria to the southeast.
The Mediterranean Sea is to the दक्षिण ; the Aegean Sea is to the west ; and the ब्लैक समुद्र is to the north.
The Sea of Marmara, the Bosphorus and the Dardanelles ( which together form the Turkish Straits ) demarcate the boundary between Thrace and Anatolia ; they also पृथक Europe and एशिया.
Turkey 's location at the crossroads of Europe and Asia makes it a country of significant geostrategic importance.
the country 's official language is Turkish, a turkic language, which is spoken by approximately 85 % of the population as mother tongue.
The most numerous ethnic group is the Turks, who constitute between 70 % and 75 % of the population according to The World Factbook.
Kurds हैं the largest ethnic minority and, according to the same source, number around 18 % of the population while other ethnic minorities are अनुमानित to be at 7–12 %.
The vast majority of the population is Muslim.
The area now called तुर्कों has been inhabited since the Paleolithic, including various Ancient Anatolian civilizations और Thracian peoples.
After Alexander the Great 's conquest, the क्षेत्रफल was Hellenized, which continued with the Roman rule and the transition into the Byzantine Empire.
the Seljuk Turks began migrating into the area in the 11th century, starting the process of turkification, which was greatly accelerated by the सलजूक़ victory over the Byzantines at the बैटल of manzikert in 1071.
The Seljuk Sultanate of rûm ruled Anatolia until the Mongol invasion in 1243, upon which it disintegrated into several small Turkish beyliks.
Starting from the late 13th सदी, the Ottoman beylik united Anatolia and created an empire encompassing much of Southeastern Europe, Western Asia and North Africa.
After the उस्मानी Empire collapsed following its defeat in World War I, parts of it were occupied by the विजयी allies.
A cadre of young military officers, led by Mustafa kemal Atatürk and his सहयोगियों, व्यवस्थित a successful resistance to the Allies ; in 1923 they established the modern Republic of Turkey, with Atatürk as its first president.
Turkey is a democratic, secular, unitary, constitutional republic with a diverse cultural heritage.
Turkey has become increasingly integrated साथ the West through membership in organisations such as the Council of Europe, NATO, OECD, OSCE and the G-20 major economies.
Turkey began full membership negotiations with the European Union in 2005, having been an associate member of the European Economic Community चूंकि 1963 and having joined the eu कस्टम Union in 1995.
Turkey has also fostered close cultural, political and economic relations with the Middle ईस्ट, Caucasus, the Turkic states of Central Asia and the अफ़्रीकी countries through membership in organisations such as the Turkic Council, Joint Administration of Turkic Arts and Culture, Organisation of इस्लामी Cooperation और the Economic Cooperation संगठन.
Turkey 's growing economy और diplomatic initiatives have led to its recognition as a regional power.
Turkey is the world 's 17th largest economy by nominal GDP and the 16th largest by purchasing power parity.
Caryn Elaine Johnson, best known as whoopi गोल्डबर्ग (, ( born November 13, 1955 ) is an American comedienne, actress, singer-songwriter, political activist, author and talk show host.
Goldberg made her film debut in The Color Purple ( 1985 ), playing Celie, a mistreated black woman in the Deep South.
She प्राप्त a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Actress and जीती her first Golden Globe Award for उसके role in the film.
In 1990, she played Oda mae Brown, a wacky psychic helping a slain man ( Patrick Swayze ) save his lover ( Demi Moore ) in the blockbuster Ghost.
इस performance won her a second Golden ग्लोब and an Academy Award for Best Supporting अभिनेत्री ; this made गोल्डबर्ग तभी the दूसरी black woman in the history of the अकादमी Awards to win an acting Oscar—the first being Hattie McDaniel who जीती for गए With the Wind in 1939.
Notable later films include Sister Act and Sister Act 2, The Player, Made in America, How Stella Got Her नाली वापस, Girl, Interrupted and Rat रेस.
She is also acclaimed लिये her roles as the bartender Guinan in Star Trek : The Next Generation, as टेरी Doolittle in Jumpin ' Jack Flash, and as Carmen Tibideaux in Glee, as खूब as the voice of Shenzi the hyena in The Lion King.
Goldberg has been nominated लिये 13 Emmy पुरस्कार for her work in television.
She was co-producer of the popular game show हॉलीवुड वर्गों from 1998 to 2004.
वो has been the moderator of the daytime talk show the View चूंकि 2007.
Goldberg has a Grammy, two Daytime Emmys, two Golden Globes, a Tony ( for उत्पादन, not acting ), and an Oscar.
In addition, Goldberg has a British अकादमी Film Award, four People 's Choice Awards, and has been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.
She is one of the few entertainers who have won an Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony Award.
Augusta is a consolidated city in the U.S. state of Georgia, located at the fall line of the Savannah River, at the head of its navigable portion.
As of the 2010 census, the Augusta– Richmond County population was 195,844 not counting the unconsolidated cities of hephzibah and Blythe.
Augusta is the principal city of the augusta – Richmond County Metropolitan Statistical क्षेत्रफल, जिससे as of 2010 had an estimated population of 556,877, making it both the second-largest city और the second-largest metro area in the state after Atlanta.
It is the 116th-largest city in the United States.
Internationally, Augusta is best known for hosting The Masters Tournament in golf each spring.
A CD-ROM ( ) is a pre-pressed compact disc which contains data.
The name is an acronym which stands for `` Compact Disc read-only memory ``.
Computers can read cd-roms, but can not लिखें on them.
CD-ROMs are popularly used to distribute computer software, including video games and multimedia applications, हालांकि any data can be stored ( up to the capacity limit of a disc ).
Some CDs, called enhanced cds, hold both कंप्यूटर data and audio with the latter capable of being निभाई on a CD player, while data ( such as software or डिजिटल video ) is only usable on a computer ( such as ISO 9660 format PC cd-roms ).
The Yellow Book is the technical standard that defines the format of CD-ROMs.
One of a set of color-bound books that contain the technical specifications for सब CD formats, the Yellow Book, created by Sony and Philips, was the first extension of Compact Disc Digital ऑडियो.
It adapted the format to hold any form of data.
the Chicago ब्लैकहॉक्स ( spelled as Black Hawks before 1986, and known colloquially as the Hawks ) हैं a professional ice hockey team आधारित in शिकागो, Illinois.
They are members of the सेंट्रल Division of the Western Conference of the National Hockey League ( NHL ).
They have won four Stanley Cup championships since their founding in 1926, most recently in 2009–10.
The Blackhawks are one of the Original छह NHL टीमों, along with the Detroit Red विंग्स, Montreal canadiens, Toronto Maple Leafs, Boston Bruins and New York Rangers.
Since the Blackhawks have played their home games at the United Center after having spent 65 सालो playing at Chicago Stadium.

granada, Nicaragua.
lent ( Latin : Quadragesima ) is a solemn observance in the liturgical year of many Christian denominations, lasting लिये a काल of approximately six weeks leading up to Easter Sunday.
In the general Latin-rite and most Western denominations Lent is taken to run इससे Ash Wednesday to maundy Thursday ( Holy Thursday ) morning or to Easter Eve.
In the Catholic Church, Lent lasts until Holy Thursday, while other denominations run until Easter Eve.
The traditional purpose of Lent is the preparation of the आस्तिक through prayer, penance, repentance, almsgiving, and self-denial.
Its institutional purpose is heightened in the annual commemoration of Holy Week, marking the death, burial and क़यामत of Jesus, which recalls the events of the Bible when Jesus is crucified on Good Friday, which then culminates in the celebration on Easter Sunday of the Resurrection of Jesus Christ.
During Lent, many of the faithful commit to fasting or giving up certain types of luxuries as a form of penitence.
The Stations of the Cross, a devotional commemoration of Christ 's carrying the Cross and of his execution, are often observed.
Many Roman Catholic and some Protestant churches remove flowers from their altars, while crucifixes, religious statues, और other elaborate religious symbols are often veiled in violet fabrics in solemn observance of the event.
In certain pious कैथोलिक देशों, कुछ adherents mark the season with the परंपरागत abstention from the consumption of meat.
In some countries, grand religious processions and cultural customs are observed, and the faithful attempt to visit seven churches दौरान Holy Week in honor of Jesus मसीह heading to Mount Calvary.
lent is traditionally described as lasting for forty days, in commemoration of the forty days which, according to the Gospels of मैथ्यू, Mark और Luke, यीशु spent fasting in the मरुस्थल पहले the beginning of his public ministry, where he endured temptation by the Devil.
However, different Christian denominations calculate the forty दिनों of Lent differently.
In most Western traditions the Sundays are not counted as part of Lent ; thus the period from Ash Wednesday until Easter consists of 40 days when the Sundays are excluded.
However in the Roman Catholic Church Lent is now taken to end on Holy Thursday बल्कि than Easter Eve, and hence lasts 38 days excluding Sundays, or 44 days in total.
This event, along with its pious customs are observed by catholics, lutherans, Methodists, Presbyterians, and Anglicans.

The Chernobyl disaster (, Chornobylska Katastrofa – Chornobyl Catastrophe ) was a catastrophic nuclear accident that occurred on 26 अप्रैल 1986 at the Chernobyl Nuclear शक्ति Plant in Ukraine ( then officially the Ukrainian SSR ), which was अंतर्गत the सीधा jurisdiction of the सेंट्रल authorities of the Soviet Union.
An explosion and fire released विशाल quantities of रेडियोसक्रिय particles into the atmosphere, which spread over much of the western ussr and Europe.
The Chernobyl disaster is widely considered to have been the worst nuclear power plant accident in history, and is एक of only two classified as a level 7 इवेंट on the अंतरराष्ट्रीय Nuclear Event Scale ( the other being the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 ).
The battle to contain the contamination and avert a greater catastrophe ultimately involved over 500,000 workers और cost an estimated 18 billion rubles.
The official Soviet casualty count of 31 मौतों has been disputed, and long-term effects such as cancers और deformities are still being accounted for.
In grammar, a subject complement is a predicative expression कि फ़ॉलो a linking क्रिया ( copula ) and that complements ( completes ) the subject of the sentence by either ( 1 ) renaming it or ( 2 ) describing it.
In the former case, a renaming noun phrase such as a संज्ञा or pronoun is called a predicative nominal.
an adjective following the copula और describing the subject is called a predicative adjective.
In either case the predicative complement in effect mirrors the subject.
Subject complements are used with a small class of verbs called linking verbs or copula, of which be is the most common.
चूंकि copula are stative verbs, subject complements are not affected by any action of the क्रिया.
Subject complements are typically not clause arguments, nor are they clause adjuncts.
Throughout the fifty-five year history of the Grammy Awards, many significant रिकॉर्ड have been नियत.
This page only includes the प्रतिस्पर्धी awards won by various artists.
This does not include the various special awards that are presented by the National अकादमी of रिकॉर्डिंग Arts and Sciences such as Lifetime Achievement Awards, Trustees Awards, Technical Awards or Legend Awards.
The page however does include other non-performance related Grammys ( known as the Craft & Production Fields ) that may have महरूम presented to the artist ( s ).
Marshall Bruce Mathers iii ( born October 17, 1972 ), better known by his stage name एमिनेम ( stylized as EMINƎM ) and by his alter ego Slim Shady, is an American rapper, record producer, songwriter and actor.
Eminem, along with his solo career, is a member of his group d12, and also one half of the hip hop duo Bad Meets Evil, with Royce da 5'9 ''.
Eminem is one of the best-selling artists in the world and is the best-selling artist of the 2000s.
He has been listed and क्रमित as one of the greatest artists of all time by अनेक magazines, including Rolling Stone magazine which ranked him 82nd on its list of The 100 Greatest Artists of All Time.
The same magazine declared him The King of Hip Hop.
सहित his work with D12 and Bad Meets Evil, Eminem has achieved ten number-one albums on the बिलबोर्ड 200.
He has sold अधिक than 100 million records worldwide, including 42 million tracks and 49.1 million albums in the United States.
As an underground rapper Eminem released his debut solo album, Infinite in 1996.
The album was a critical and commercial failure.
He gained mainstream popularity in 1999 after the रिलीज of उसके major-label debut album The पतला Shady LP.
The LP also earned Eminem his first Grammy Award for Best Rap Album.
His next two records the Marshall Mathers LP, and The Eminem Show, also won Best Rap Album Grammy पुरस्कार, making Eminem the पहला artist to win Best Rap Album for तीन consecutive LPs.
This थी followed by another studio रिलीज in 2004 titled Encore.
Eminem then went on hiatus after touring in 2005.
He released his first album in five years titled Relapse, on may 15, 2009.
In 2010, Eminem released his seventh studio album Recovery.
रिकवरी was an international success and was named the best selling album of 2010 worldwide, joining the Eminem Show, which was the best seller of 2002.
Eminem won Grammy Awards for both Relapse and Recovery, giving him a total of 13 Grammys in his career.
Eminem has opened other ventures, including his own रिकार्ड label Shady Records साथ his manager पॉल Rosenberg.
He भी has उसके own radio चैनल, Shade 45 on Sirius XM Radio.
Eminem began an acting career in 2002, when he starred in the hip hop drama film 8 Mile.
He won the Academy Award लिये Best Original Song, becoming the first rap artist ever to win the award.
He has also made cameo appearances in The Wash ( 2001 ), Funny People ( 2009 ) and the टेलीविज़न series Entourage.
The acre is a unit of area used in the imperial और U.S. customary systems.
An acre is about 40 % of a हेक्टेयर – slightly smaller than an American football field.
The acre is no longer commonly used, although a few notable exceptions include the United States, Australia, Burma and the United Kingdom ( as of 2010, the acre is no longer officially प्रयुक्त in the United Kingdom, though is still used in real estate descriptions ).
It is still used, to some extent, in Canada.
The international symbol of the acre is ac, and is पारिभाषित as 1/640 of a square mile.
The most commonly used acre today is the अंतरराष्ट्रीय acre.
in the संयुक्त States both the international acre and the slightly different US survey acre are in use.
The most common use of the एकड़ is to माप tracts of जमीन.
One international acre is defined as 4046.8564224 square metres.
During the मध्य Ages, an acre was the amount of जमीन that could be plowed in one day with a yoke of oxen.
Antoine Lavoisier 's discovery of the Law of Conservation of Mass led to many new findings in the 19th सदी.
Joseph proust 's law of definite proportions and John Dalton 's atomic theory branched from the discoveries of Antoine Lavoisier.
Lavoisier 's quantitative experiments revealed that combustion involved ऑक्सीजन rather than what was previously thought to be phlogiston.
the law of संरक्षण of mass, or principle of mass conservation, states कि for any प्रणाली closed to all transfers of matter और energy ( both of which have mass ), the द्रव्यमान of the system must remain निरंतर over time, as system mass can not change quantity if it is not added or removed.
Hence, the मात्रा of mass is `` conserved '' over time.
The law implies that mass can neither be created nor destroyed, although it may be rearranged in space, or the entities associated with it may be changed in form, as for example when light or physical work is transformed into particles that contribute the same mass to the system as the light or work had contributed.
The law implies ( requires ) that during any chemical reaction, nuclear reaction, or radioactive decay in an isolated system, the mass of the reactants or starting material must equal the mass of the उत्पाद.
The concept of mass conservation is widely used in अनेक fields such as chemistry, mechanics, and fluid dynamics.
Historically, mass conservation was discovered in chemical reactions by Antoine Lavoisier in the late 18th century, and was of crucial importance in the प्रगति from alchemy to the आधुनिक प्राकृतिक science of chemistry.
The closely related concept of matter conservation was found to hold good in chemistry to such high approximation that it failed only for the high energies treated by the later refinements of relativity theory, लकिन otherwise remains useful and sufficiently accurate लिये most chemical calculations, even in modern practice.
In special relativity, needed for accuracy when large energy transfers between systems is शामिल, the difference between thermodynamically closed and isolated systems becomes important, since conservation of mass is strictly and perfectly upheld only for so-called isolated systems, i.e. those completely isolated from all exchanges साथ the environment.
In this circumstance, the mass-energy equivalence theorem states that mass conservation is equivalent to total energy conservation, which is the first law of thermodynamics.
By कंट्रास्ट, for a thermodynamically closed system ( i.e., one which is closed to exchanges of matter, but खोलें to exchanges of non-material energy, such as heat and work, with the surroundings ) mass is ( प्रायः ) तभी approximately conserved.
The input or output of non-material energy must change the mass of the system in relativity theory, although the change is usually small, since relatively large amounts of such energy ( by comparison with ordinary experience ) carry only a small amount of mass ( again by ordinary standards of measurement ).
In special relativity, mass is not converted to energy, since energy in all of its forms always retains its equivalent amount of mass throughout any transformation or translocation into, or out of, a प्रणाली.
However, certain types of matter ( a different concept ) may be converted to energy, so long as the mass of the system is unchanged in the process.
However, if such energy is removed from systems, they must lose the mass कि is associated with it.
in general relativity, mass ( and energy ) conservation in expanding volumes of space is a complex अवधारणा, subject to different definitions, and neither द्रव्यमान nor energy is as strictly and simply conserved as is the case in special relativity and in Minkowski space.
For a discussion, see mass in general relativity.
A pig is any of the animals in the genus Sus, भीतर the Suidae family of even-toed ungulates.
Pigs शामिल the domestic pig, its ancestor the जंगली boar, and several other wild relatives.
Young and छोटी pigs are known as piglets.
Pigs are omnivores and are highly social and intelligent पशु.
8-inch, -inch, and -inch floppy disks
8-inch, -inch ( full height ), and -inch drives
A 3.5-inch diskette 's `` floppy '' magnetic material, removed from its housing
A floppy disk, or diskette, is a डिस्क storage medium रचित of a disk of thin and flexible magnetic storage medium, sealed in a rectangular plastic carrier lined with fabric that removes dust particles.
They are पढ़ा and written by a फ्लॉपी disk drive ( FDD ).
Floppy disks, initially as media and later in and 3.5-inch ( 90 mm ) sizes, were a ubiquitous form of data storage and एक्सचेंज from the mid-1970s well into the first decade of the 21st century.
By 2010, कंप्यूटर motherboards यहूद rarely manufactured with फ्लॉपी drive support ; `` floppies could be used as an external USB drive, but ``, 8 ``, and non-standard drives could only be handled by old उपकरण.
While floppy disk drives still have some limited uses, especially with legacy औद्योगिक computer equipment, they have been superseded by data भंडार methods with much greater capacity, such as USB flash drives, portable external hard disk drives, optical discs, memory cards, and computer networks.
An animated diagram of a cutter
In baseball, a cutter, or cut fastball, is a type of fastball which breaks slightly toward the pitcher 's glove पक्ष as it reaches home plate.
This pitch is somewhere between a slider and a fastball, as it is usually thrown faster than a slider but with more motion than a typical fastball.
Some pitchers use a cutter as a way to prevent hitters from expecting their regular fastballs.
A common technique used to throw a cutter is to उपयोग a four-seam fastball grip with the बेसबॉल set slightly off center in the hand.
When a batter is able to hit a cutter pitch, it often results in soft contact and an आसान out, due to the pitch 's गति keeping the ball away from the bat 's sweet spot.
The cutter is typically 2–5 mph slower than a pitcher 's four-seam fastball.
In 2010, the average pitch classified as a cutter by PITCHf/x thrown by a right-handed pitcher was 88.6 किमी ; the average four-seamer was 92.1 mph.
`` What It Takes '' is a power ballad by American hard चट्टान band Aerosmith.
It was written by Steven Tyler, Joe Perry, and Desmond Child.
It was released in 1990 as the third single from Aerosmith 's critically and commercially successful 1989 album Pump.
In the वीडियो the Making of Pump, A & R man John Kalodner described the song as `` a masterpiece ''.
During live performances, Tyler sings the first verse a cappella और belts out one of his signature screams सही before the chorus.
The album संस्करण of the song is followed by an untitled hidden track.

Odysseus ( or ; Greek :, ), also known by the Roman name ulysses ( ; ), was a legendary Greek king of Ithaca and a hero of Homer 's एपिक poem the Odyssey.
Odysseus also plays a key role in Homer 's Iliad and other works in that same Epic Cycle.
Husband of Penelope, father of Telemachus, and son of Laërtes ( or Sisyphus ) and Anticlea, Odysseus is renowned for his brilliance, guile, and versatility ( polytropos ), और is hence known by the epithet Odysseus the Cunning ( mētis, or `` cunning intelligence `` ).
He is most famous for the ten eventful years he took to return home after the decade-long Trojan युद्ध और his famous Trojan Horse ploy to capture the city of Troy.
Erie is a Statutory Town in Boulder and Weld counties in the U.S. state of Colorado.
The population according to the 2010 जनसांख्यिकी is 18,135 and was अंकित as 6,291 at the 2000 census.
The Town of Erie is located just west of I-25 for easy access to I-70, Denver International Airport and Colorado 's entire Front Range.
Erie 's Planning Area spans 48 square miles, extending from the उत्तर side of State Highway 52 दक्षिण to State Highway 7, and between US 287 on the west and Interstate 25 to the east.
Erie is approximately 35 minutes from Denver International Airport, 25 minutes to Denver and 20 minutes from Boulder.
The Board of Trustees serves as the legislative and governing body of the Town of Erie and is responsible for establishing Town policies and goals.
The Board has the authority to adopt laws, ordinances और resolutions as needed to conduct the business of the Town, and by ordinance may enter into contracts or intergovernmental समझौतों to furnish, receive services or to provide for cooperative service delivery.
Appointed by and serving at the pleasure of the Board of Trustees, the Town Administrator is the मुख्य operating and administrative officer of the कस्बा and is responsible लिये providing professional leadership in the प्रशासन and execution of policies and objectives प्रतिपादित by the Board.
The mission of the erie Police विभाग is to communicate और कार्य with the community to maintain a safe environment, prevent crime and enforce the law, while protecting the rights of all.
erie Municipal Airport ( EIK ) is owned and operated by the Town of Erie और is strategically located in the Denver-Boulder metropolitan area on Colorado Highway 7, a little over three miles west of Interstate 25.
The main runway is concrete paved और 4,700 feet long.
The is a home video game console उत्पादित by Sony Computer Entertainment.
It is the successor to the PlayStation 2, as part of the PlayStation series.
The PlayStation 3 competes with Microsoft 's Xbox 360 and Nintendo 's Wii as भाग of the seventh generation of video game consoles.
It was first released on नवम्बर 11, 2006, in Japan, with international markets following shortly thereafter.
The console was first officially घोषित at E3 2005.
Originally set for a spring 2006 release तिथि, it was delayed several टाइम्स until finally hitting stores at the end of the year.
It was the first और currently only console to use Blu-ray Disc as its प्राथमिक storage medium.
Major features of the कंसोल include its एकीकृत ऑनलाइन gaming service, the PlayStation Network, and its connectivity with the PlayStation Portable and PlayStation वीटा, In September 2009 the updated PlayStation 3 Slim, was released.
This Slim is lighter and thinner than the original version, although it lacks प्लेस्टेशन 2 पीछे compatibility ( removed on later original models ), but notably featured a re-designed लोगो and marketing design.
As of November 4, 2012, 70 million PlayStation 3s have been sold worldwide.
Its successor, PlayStation 4, is set for a Q4 2013 release.
Salvador Domingo Felipe Jacinto Dalí i Domènech, 1st Marqués de Dalí de Pubol ( May 11, 1904January 23, 1989 ), known as Salvador Dalí ( ), थी a prominent Spanish surrealist चित्रकार born in Figueres, Spain.
Dalí was a skilled draftsman, best known for the striking और bizarre बिंब in his surrealist work.
His painterly skills are often attributed to the influence of Renaissance मास्टर्स.
His best-known work, The Persistence of Memory, was completed in 1931.
Dalí 's expansive artistic repertoire included film, sculpture, and photography, in collaboration साथ a range of artists in a variety of media.
Dalí attributed his `` love of everything that is gilded and excessive, my passion for luxury and my love of oriental clothes '' to a self-styled `` Arab lineage '', claiming that his ancestors were descended from the Moors.
dalí थी highly imaginative, and also enjoyed indulging in unusual and grandiose behavior.
His eccentric manner and attention-grabbing public actions sometimes खींचा more attention than his artwork, to the dismay of those who held his work in high esteem, and to the irritation of his critics.

The humanities are academic disciplines कि study human culture, using methods that हैं primarily analytical, critical, or speculative, and having a significant historical element, as distinguished from the मुख्यतः empirical approaches of the natural sciences.
The humanities include ancient and आधुनिक languages, literature, philosophy, religion, and visual and performing arts such as music and theatre.
The मानवता that हैं also regarded as social sciences include history, anthropology, क्षेत्रफल अध्ययन, communication studies, cultural studies, law, economics and linguistics.
Scholars working in the humanities are sometimes described as `` humanists ''.
However, that term also describes the philosophical position of humanism, which some `` antihumanist `` scholars in the humanities reject.
Some secondary schools offer humanities classes, usually consisting of English literature, global studies, और art.
Human disciplines like history, cultural anthropology and psychoanalysis study subject matters to which the experimental method does नहीं apply, and they have access instead to the comparative method and comparative research.
The 2005 Blue Room Christmas Tree
The White House क्रिसमस Tree, also known as the Blue Room Christmas पेड़, is the official indoor Christmas tree at the residence of the President of the United States, the White House.
The first indoor Christmas पेड़ was installed in the White House sometime in the 19th century ( there are varying claims as to the exact year ) and since 1961 the tree has had a themed motif at the discretion of the First महिला of the United States.
The President of the United राज्य of America ( POTUS ) is the head of state and head of government of the United States.
The president leads the executive शाखा of the संघीय government and is the commander-in-chief of the संयुक्त States Armed Forces.
Article II of the U.S. Constitution vests the executive power of the United States in the अध्यक्ष और charges him with the निष्पादन of federal law, alongside the responsibility of appointing federal executive, diplomatic, regulatory, और judicial officers, and concluding treaties with foreign powers, with the advice और consent of the Senate.
The president is further empowered to grant federal pardons and reprieves, and to convene and adjourn either or both houses of कॉंग्रेस under extraordinary circumstances.
चूंकि the founding of the संयुक्त States, the power of the अध्यक्ष and the federal government have grown substantially and each modern president, despite possessing no formal विधान powers beyond signing or vetoing congressionally passed bills, is largely responsible for dictating the legislative agenda of his पार्टी and the foreign and domestic policy of the United States.
The अध्यक्ष is frequently described as the सबसे powerful person in the world.
The president is indirectly elected by the लोगों through the Electoral College to a four-year पद, and is one of only दो nationally निर्वाचित संघीय officers, the other being the Vice President of the United States.
The Twenty-second Amendment, adopted in 1951, prohibits anyone from ever होने elected to the presidency for a third पूरा term.
It also prohibits a person from being elected to the presidency अधिक than once if that person previously had served as president, or acting अध्यक्ष, for more than two years of another person 's term as president.
In all, 43 individuals have served 55 four-year terms.
On January 20, 2009, Barack Obama became the 44th and current president.
On November 6, 2012, he was re-elected and is scheduled to serve until January 20, 2017.
Senses are physiological capacities of organisms that provide data for perception.
The senses and their operation, वर्गीकरण, and theory are overlapping topics studied by a variety of fields, most notably neuroscience, cognitive मनोविज्ञान ( or cognitive science ), and philosophy of perception.
The nervous system has a specific sensory system or organ, dedicated to each sense.
Humans have a multitude of senses.
Sight ( ophthalmoception ), hearing ( audioception ), taste ( gustaoception ), smell ( olfacoception or olfacception ), and touch ( tactioception ) are the five traditionally recognized.
While the ability to detect other stimuli beyond those governed by the traditional senses exists, including temperature ( thermoception ), kinesthetic sense ( proprioception ), pain ( nociception ), balance ( equilibrioception ), acceleration ( kinesthesioception ), and various internal stimuli ( e.g. the different chemoreceptors for detecting salt and carbon dioxide concentrations in the blood ), only a small number of these can safely be classified as separate senses in and of themselves.
What constitutes a sense is a matter of some debate, leading to difficulties in defining what exactly a sense is.
पशु भी have receptors to sense the world around them, with degrees of capability varying greatly between species.
Humans have a comparatively weak भाव of smell, while some animals may lack one or more of the traditional five senses.
Some animals may also intake and interpret sensory stimuli in very different ways.
Some species of animals are able to sense the world in a way that इंसानो can not, with some species able to sense electrical and magnetic fields, and detect water pressure और currents.
Spiders ( order Araneae ) are air-breathing arthropods that have eight टाँगे और chelicerae with fangs that inject venom.
They हैं the largest order of arachnids and rank seventh in total species diversity among all अन्य groups of organisms.
Spiders are found worldwide on every continent except for Antarctica, and have become established in nearly every habitat with the exception of air and sea colonization.
As of 2008, at least 43,678 spider species, and 109 families have been recorded by taxonomists ; however, there has been confusion within the वैज्ञानिक community as to how सब these परिवारों should be classified, as evidenced by the over 20 different classifications that have been proposed since 1900.
Anatomically, spiders differ from other arthropods in that the usual body segments are fused into two tagmata, the cephalothorax and abdomen, and joined by a small, cylindrical pedicel.
Unlike insects, spiders do नहीं have antennae.
In all except the most आदिम group, the Mesothelae, spiders have the most centralized nervous systems of all arthropods, as all their ganglia are fused into एक द्रव्यमान in the cephalothorax.
Unlike most arthropods, spiders have no extensor muscles in their limbs and instead extend them by hydraulic pressure.
Their abdomens bear appendages that have been modified into spinnerets that extrude silk from up to six types of silk glands within their abdomen.
Spider webs vary widely in size, shape and the amount of sticky thread used.
It अभी appears that the spiral orb web may be one of the earliest forms, और spiders that produce tangled cobwebs are more abundant और diverse than orb-web spiders.
spider-like arachnids with silk-producing spigots appeared in the Devonian period about, but these animals apparently lacked spinnerets.
True spiders have महरूम found in Carboniferous rocks from, and are very similar to the most primitive surviving order, the Mesothelae.
The प्रमुख groups of modern spiders, Mygalomorphae and Araneomorphae, first appeared in the Triassic period, before.
A herbivorous species, Bagheera kiplingi, was described in 2008, but all other ज्ञात species are परभक्षी, mostly preying on insects and on other spiders, although a few large species भी take birds and lizards.
Spiders उपयोग a wide range of strategies to capture prey : trapping it in sticky webs, lassoing it with sticky bolas, mimicking the prey to avoid detection, or running it down.
Most detect prey mainly by sensing vibrations, but the active hunters have acute vision, and hunters of the genus Portia show signs of intelligence in their choice of tactics and ability to develop new ones.
मकड़ियों ' guts are too narrow to take solids, and they liquidize their खाना by flooding it with digestive enzymes and grinding it with the bases of उनके pedipalps, as they do not have true jaws.
Male spiders identify themselves by a variety of complex courtship rituals to avoid being eaten by the females.
Males of सबसे species survive a few matings, limited mainly by their short life spans.
महिलाओं weave रेशा egg-cases, each of which may contain hundreds of eggs.
Females of many species care for their young, लिये example by carrying them around or by sharing food with them.
A minority of species are social, building communal webs that may हाउस anywhere from a few to 50,000 individuals.
Social बर्ताव ranges from precarious toleration, as in the widow spiders, to co-operative hunting and food-sharing.
हालांकि most spiders live for at most two years, tarantulas and अन्य mygalomorph spiders can live up to 25 years in captivity.
While the venom of a few species is dangerous to humans, scientists are now researching the use of spider venom in medicine and as non-polluting pesticides.
Spider रेशा provides a combination of lightness, strength and elasticity that is superior to that of synthetic materials, और spider silk genes have been inserted into mammals और plants to see if these can be used as silk factories.
As a result of their wide range of behaviors, spiders have become common symbols in art and mythology symbolizing various combinations of patience, cruelty and creative powers.
Grey 's Anatomy is an American television medical drama that premiered on the American Broadcasting Company ( ABC ), as a mid-season replacement on March 27, 2005.
The series रै aired nine seasons, and focuses on the fictional lives of surgical interns and निवासियों as they gradually evolve into seasoned doctors, while trying to maintain personal lives.
The show 's premise originated साथ Shonda Rhimes, जो serves as an executive producer, along with Betsy Beers, Mark Gordon, Krista Vernoff, Rob Corn, Mark Wilding, and Allan Heinberg.
The series was created to be racially diverse, utilizing a color-blind casting technique.
It is primarily फिल्माया in Los एंजिल्स, California.
The series ' protagonist is Dr. मेरेडिथ Grey ( एलेन pompeo ), who originally is accepted into the residency program at the fictional Seattle Grace Hospital.
Meredith is assigned to work under Dr. Miranda बेली ( Chandra Wilson ), along with Dr. Cristina Yang ( Sandra Oh ), Dr. George O'Malley ( T. R. Knight ), Dr. Izzie Stevens ( Katherine Heigl ), and Dr. Alex Karev ( Justin Chambers ).
Following o'malley 's मौत and Stevens ' departure, the hospital 's merger साथ Mercy West brings in Dr. Jackson Avery ( Jesse विलियम्स ) and dr. April Kepner ( Sarah Drew ), in the sixth season.
The surgical wing is primarily supervised by dr. Richard webber ( James Pickens, Jr. ), who is आखिरकार replaced by Dr. Derek Shepherd ( Patrick Dempsey ), और later Dr. Owen Hunt ( केविन McKidd ).
Dr. Preston Burke ( Isaiah Washington ) departs at the conclusion of the third season, and is replaced by Dr. एरिका Hahn ( ब्रुक Smith ), who पत्ते the show during the fifth season, and later dr. Teddy Altman ( Kim Raver ), who प्रस्थान at the end of the eighth ऋतु.
Introduced in the second ऋतु is Dr. Addison Montgomery ( Kate वाल्श ), who पत्ते the दिखाएँ at the end of the third season, in order to launch her own spin-off medical drama Private Practice.
Dr. Callie Torres ( Sara Ramirez ) and Dr. Mark Sloan ( Eric Dane ) also enter the दिखाएँ in the second season, while the latter dies in the premiere of the ninth season.
Meredith 's half-sister, Dr. Lexie Grey ( Chyler Leigh ), appears from season three and dies at the end of season आठ.
dr. Arizona Robbins ( Jessica Capshaw ) is given series regular औकात at the beginning of the छठे season.
Grey 's Anatomy is the highest-rated drama in the key 18–49 demographic.
Previously among the overall top-ten rated shows in the United States, Grey 's Anatomy has been well received by critics.
Considered an impact on culture, the series has प्राप्त numerous awards, और has also महरूम included in various critics ' top ten lists.
The show रै produced several specials, as well as distributed all सीज़न to DVD, and released a collection of merchandise.
In 2012, Grey 's Anatomy was नामित the fifth-highest revenue earning show, in terms of advertising per half-hour.
On May 11, 2012, the series was renewed लिये a ninth ऋतु, which premiered on September 27, 2012.
Schizophrenia ( or ) is a mental disorder characterized by a breakdown of thought processes and by a deficit of typical emotional responses.
आम symptoms include auditory hallucinations, paranoid or bizarre delusions, or disorganized speech and सोच, और it is accompanied by significant सोशल or occupational dysfunction.
The onset of symptoms typically occurs in young adulthood, with a global lifetime prevalence of about 0.3–0.7 %.
Diagnosis is based on observed behavior and the patient 's reported experiences.
Genetics, early environment, neurobiology, and psychological and social processes appear to be important contributory factors ; कुछ recreational and prescription दवाएँ appear to cause or worsen symptoms.
Current शोध is केन्द्रित on the role of neurobiology, although no single isolated organic cause has been found.
The many possible combinations of symptoms have triggered debate about whether the diagnosis represents a single disorder or a number of discrete syndromes.
Despite the etymology of the term from the Greek roots skhizein ( σχίζειν, `` to split '' ) and phrēn, phren- ( φρήν, φρεν- ; `` mind '' ), schizophrenia does नहीं imply a `` split personality '', or `` multiple personality disorder '' ( which is known ये days as dissociative identity disorder ) —a condition साथ which it is often उलझन in public perception.
Rather, the term means a `` splitting of mental functions '', because of the symptomatic presentation of the illness.
The mainstay of treatment is antipsychotic medication, which primarily suppresses dopamine ( and sometimes serotonin ) receptor activity.
मनोचिकित्सा and vocational and सोशल rehabilitation are also important in treatment.
In more गंभीर cases—where there is risk to self and others— involuntary hospitalization may be necessary, although hospital stays हैं now shorter and less frequent than they एकबार were.
The disorder is thought mainly to affect cognition, but it also प्रायः contributes to chronic problems साथ behavior and emotion.
People with schizophrenia are likely to have additional ( comorbid ) conditions, including major depression and चिंता disorders ; the lifetime occurrence of substance use disorder is almost 50 %.
सोशल problems, such as long-term unemployment, poverty, and homelessness are common.
The average life expectancy of people with the disorder is 12 to 15 years कम than those without, the result of increased physical health problems and a उच्चतर suicide rate ( about 5 % ).
Paul Leslie Snider ( April 15, 1951–August 14, 1980 ) was the estranged husband and मैनेजर of प्लेबॉय model Dorothy Stratten, whom he murdered before killing himself the same day.
The Epic of Gilgamesh, an epic poem from Mesopotamia, is amongst the earliest surviving works of literature.
The साहित्यिक history of Gilgamesh begins with पाँच independent Sumerian poems परिचय 'Bilgamesh ' ( Sumerian for Gilgamesh ), king of Uruk.
Four of these were used as source material for a combined epic in Akkadian.
This first combined epic, known as the `` Old Babylonian '' version, dates to the 18th century BC and is titled बाद its incipit, Shūtur eli sharrī ( `` Surpassing All Other Kings '' ).
Only a few fragments of it have survived.
The बाद `` Standard Babylonian '' version dates इससे the 13th to the 10th centuries BC and bears the incipit Sha naqba īmuru ( `` He who Saw the Deep '' ).
Fragments of approximately two thirds of this longer, twelve-tablet version have been recovered.
Some of the best copies were discovered in the library ruins of the 7th-century BC Assyrian king Ashurbanipal.
The story centers on a friendship between Gilgamesh and Enkidu.
Enkidu is a जंगली man created by the gods as Gilgamesh 's equal to distract him from oppressing the लोगों of Uruk.
Together, वे journey to the Cedar Mountain to defeat Humbaba, its monstrous guardian.
Later they kill the Bull of Heaven, which the goddess Ishtar sends to punish Gilgamesh for spurning her advances.
As a punishment for these actions, the gods वाक्य Enkidu to death.
the दूसरी half of the epic focuses on Gilgamesh 's distress at Enkidu 's death, and his quest for immortality.
In order to सीख the secret of eternal life, Gilgamesh undertakes a long and perilous journey.
He learns that `` The life that you are seeking you will never find.
When the gods created man they आवंटित to him death, लकिन life they retained in their own keeping. ''
This quote was originally attributed to Siduri in the Old Babylonian version of the epic, and then attributed to the immortal flood नायिका Utnapishtim in the Akkadian version of the epic.
nevertheless, Gilgamesh 's कीर्ति lived on after his death, because of his great building प्रोजेक्ट, और उसके account of what Utnapishtim told him happened during the flood.
The story has been translated into many different languages, and Gilgamesh has since become adapted in works of popular fiction.
A eukaryote ( or ) is an organism whose cells contain complex structures enclosed within membranes.
Eukaryotes may more formally be referred to as the टैक्सोन Eukarya or Eukaryota.
The defining membrane-bound structure that sets eukaryotic cells apart from prokaryotic cells is the nucleus, or nuclear लिफाफा, within which the genetic material is carried.
The उपस्थिति of a nucleus gives eukaryotes their name, which comes from the Greek ( eu, `` good '' ) and ( karyon, `` nut '' or `` kernel '' ).
Most eukaryotic cells also contain other membrane-bound organelles such as mitochondria, chloroplasts and the Golgi apparatus.
All large जटिल organisms are eukaryotes, including animals, plants और fungi.
The group भी शामिल many unicellular organisms.
Cell प्रभाग in eukaryotes is different इससे कि in organisms without a nucleus ( Prokaryote ).
It involves separating the duplicated chromosomes, through movements directed by microtubules.
वहीँ are दो प्रकार of division processes.
In mitosis, one cell divides to produce two genetically identical cells.
In meiosis, जिससे is required in sexual reproduction, one द्विगुणित cell ( having two instances of each chromosome, one इससे each parent ) undergoes recombination of each जोड़ी of parental chromosomes, and तब दो stages of cell प्रभाग, resulting in four haploid cells ( gametes ).
Each gamete has just one complement of chromosomes, each a unique mix of the सम्बन्धित जोड़ी of parental chromosomes.
Eukaryota appears to be monophyletic, and so makes up one of the three domains of life.
The दो other domains, जीवाणु and Archaea, are prokaryotes and have none of the above features.
Eukaryotes represent a tiny minority of सब living things ; even in a human body there are 10 times more microbes than human cells.
However, due to their much larger size their collective worldwide बायोमास is estimated at about equal to that of prokaryotes.
They are considered to have first developed approximately 1.6–2.1 billion years ago.
The use of Internet सेवाएं or software with Internet access to defraud victims or to otherwise take advantage of them, for example by stealing personal information, जिससे can even lead to identity theft.
A very common form of Internet fraud is the distribution of rogue security software.
Internet services can be used to present fraudulent solicitations to prospective victims, to conduct fraudulent transactions, or to transmit the proceeds of fraud to financial institutions or to others connected with the scheme.
Internet fraud can occur in chat rooms, email, message boards, or on websites.
the International Security Assistance Force ( ISAF ) is a NATO -led security mission in Afghanistan that was established by the United Nations Security Council in December 2001 by Resolution 1386, as envisaged by the Bonn Agreement.
Its main purpose is to train the Afghan National Security Forces ( ANSF ) and assist Afghanistan in rebuilding key government institutions but is also engaged in the 2001-present war with insurgent groups.
ISAF was initially charged with securing Kabul and surrounding areas इससे the Taliban, al Qaeda and factional warlords, so as to allow for the establishment of the Afghan Transitional Administration headed by Hamid Karzai.
In October 2003, the UN Security Council प्राधिकृत the expansion of the isaf मिशन throughout Afghanistan, and ISAF subsequently expanded the mission in four main stages over the पूरे of the देश.
From 2006 to 2011, ISAF had been involved in increasingly अधिक intensive कॉम्बैट operations in southern and eastern Afghanistan.
Troop contributors include from the United States, United Kingdom, NATO member states and a number of other देशों.
The intensity of the combat faced by contributing nations varies greatly, with the United States, United Kingdom, and Canada sustaining the majority of casualties in intensive combat operations, with other contributors sustaining significantly less.
As of early 2010, there were at least 700 military bases inside Afghanistan but more were अपेक्षित to be built in the coming years.
About 400 of these were प्रयुक्त by American‐led NATO forces and 300 by ANSF.
Cocaine ( benzoylmethylecgonine ) ( INN ) is a crystalline tropane alkaloid that is obtained from the leaves of the coca plant.
The name comes from `` coca '' and the alkaloid suffix -ine, forming cocaine.
It is a stimulant, an appetite suppressant, and a topical anesthetic.
Biologically, cocaine acts as a serotonin–norepinephrine–dopamine reuptake inhibitor, also known as a triple reuptake inhibitor ( TRI ).
It is addictive because of its effect on the mesolimbic reward pathway.
Unlike सबसे molecules, cocaine has pockets with both high hydrophilic and lipophilic efficiency, violating the rule of hydrophilic-lipophilic balance.
This causes it to cross the blood–brain barrier far better than other psychoactive रसायन और may even induce blood-brain barrier breakdown.
It is illegal to possess, produce, or distribute cocaine for non-medicinal and non-government-sanctioned purposes in almost every country.
Whole beef tri-tip rump, roasted medium rare
The tri-tip is a cut of beef from the bottom sirloin primal cut.
It is a small triangular muscle, usually 1.5 to 2.5 पाउंड. ( 675 to 1,150g ) प्रति side of beef.
The scientific name of this muscle is tensor fasciae latae, inserted in the fascia lata, the connective tissue covering the quadriceps femoris, also called quadriceps extensor, a group of four मांसपेशियां which in turn insert in the patella, or knee cap of the animal.
Willmar is a city in, and the county सीट of, Kandiyohi County, Minnesota, United States.
The population was 19,610 at the 2010 census.
Willmar has been assigned ZIP code 56201 by the United States Postal Service.
u.s. Routes 12 and 71 and Minnesota State Highways 23 and 40 are four of the main रूट in the city.
The स्पीकर of the United States House of Representatives ( or Speaker of the House ) is the presiding अधिकारी of the chamber.
The office was established in 1789 by आलेख I, Section 2 of the United States Constitution, which राज्य in part, `` The House of Representatives shall chuse their Speaker... ''
The वर्तमान Speaker is John Boehner, a Republican who represents Ohio 's 8th congressional district.
The Constitution does not require that the Speaker be a Member of Congress, but no non-member has ever been elected to the office.
The Speaker is second in the संयुक्त States presidential line of succession, after the Vice President and ahead of the अध्यक्ष pro tempore of the U.S. सीनेट.
Unlike some Westminster system parliaments, in which the office of Speaker is माना non-partisan, in the United States the Speaker of the House is a leadership position and the office-holder actively works to set the majority पार्टी 's legislative agenda.
The Speaker usually does not personally preside over debates, instead delegating the duty to members of the House from the majority party.
Aside from duties relating to heading the House and the majority political party, the Speaker also performs प्रशासनिक and procedural functions, and represents his or her Congressional district.
A bicycle फ़्रेम is the main component of a bicycle, on to which wheels and other components are fitted.
The modern और most common frame design for an upright bicycle is based on the safety bicycle, and consists of two त्रिकोण, a main triangle and a paired पश्च triangle.
This is known as the diamond frame.
Frames are required to be strong, stiff and light, which they do by combining different materials and shapes.
`` Simple gravity pendulum '' model assumes no friction or air resistance.
An exemplar animation of a pendulum showing the गति and acceleration vectors
A लोलक is a weight suspended from a so that it can swing freely.
When a pendulum is displaced sideways इससे its resting equilibrium position, it is subject to a restoring force due to gravity कि will accelerate it वापस toward the equilibrium position.
When released, the restoring force combined with the pendulum 's mass causes it to oscillate about the equilibrium position, swinging back and forth.
The time for एक complete cycle, a left swing and a right swing, is called the period.
A pendulum swings with a specific period which depends ( mainly ) on इसके length.
इससे इसके discovery around 1602 by Galileo Galilei the regular गति of pendulums was used for timekeeping, and was the world 's most accurate timekeeping technology until the 1930s.
Pendulums are used to regulate pendulum clocks, and are used in scientific instruments such as accelerometers and seismometers.
Historically they यहूद used as gravimeters to measure the त्वरण of gravity in geophysical सर्वेक्षण, and even as a standard of length.
The शब्द 'pendulum ' is नई Latin, from the Latin pendulus, meaning 'hanging '.
The simple gravity pendulum is an idealized गणितीय model of a pendulum.
This is a weight ( or bob ) on the end of a massless cord suspended from a, without friction.
When given an initial push, it will swing back और forth at a constant amplitude.
Real pendulums are subject to friction and air drag, so the amplitude of their swings गिरावट.
The First Battle of सांड चलाएं, also known as First manassas ( the name used by Confederate forces ), was fought on जुलाई 21, 1861, in Prince William County, Virginia, near the नगर of manassas.
It was the first major land battle of the American Civil War.
Just महीने after the प्रारंभ of the युद्ध at Fort Sumter, the Northern public clamored for a march against the Confederate capital of Richmond, Virginia, जिससे they expected to bring an early समाप्त to the rebellion.
yielding to political pressure, Brig. gen. irvin McDowell led उसके unseasoned Union Army across Bull Run against the equally inexperienced Confederate Army of Brig. Gen. P. G. T. beauregard camped near Manassas जंक्शन.
McDowell 's ambitious plan for a surprise flank attack on the Confederate left was poorly executed by his officers and men ; nevertheless, the Confederates, who had been planning to attack the Union left flank, found themselves at an initial disadvantage.
Confederate सुदृढीकरण under Brig. Gen. Joseph E. Johnston arrived from the Shenandoah Valley by railroad and the course of the battle quickly changed.
A brigade of Virginians under a relatively unknown colonel from the Virginia Military Institute, Thomas J. Jackson, stood their ground and जैक्सन प्राप्त his famous nickname, `` Stonewall जैक्सन ''.
The Confederates then launched a strong counterattack, and as the Union troops began withdrawing under fire, many panicked और it turned into a rout as McDowell 's men frantically ran without order in the direction of Washington, D.C.
Both armies were sobered by the fierce fighting and many casualties, and realized the युद्ध was going to be much longer and bloodier than either had anticipated.
