A छोटी story is a brief work of literature, usually written in narrative prose.
Emerging from earlier oral storytelling traditions in the 17th century, the short story has grown to encompass a body of work so diverse as to defy easy characterization.
At its most prototypical the short story features a small cast of named characters, and focuses on a self-contained घटना with the intent of evoking a `` single effect '' or mood.
In so doing, छोटी stories make use of plot, resonance, and other dynamic components to a far greater degree than is typical of an किस्सा, yet to a far lesser degree than a novel.
While the छोटी स्टोरी is largely distinct from the novel, authors of both generally draw from a आम pool of literary techniques.
Short stories have no set length.
In terms of word count there is no official demarcation between an anecdote, a short story, and a novel.
Rather, the form 's parameters are given by the rhetorical and practical context in जिससे a दिए स्टोरी is produced और माना, so कि what constitutes a short story may differ between जाति, countries, eras, and commentators.
Like the novel, the short story 's predominant shape reflects the demands of the available markets for publication, and the evolution of the form seems closely tied to the evolution of the publishing उद्योग और the submission दिशानिर्देश of its constituent houses.
The short story has been considered both an apprenticeship form preceding more lengthy works, and a crafted form in its own right, collected together in books of similar length, price, और distribution as novels.
Short story writers may define their works as part of the कलाकारी and personal expression of the form.
They may also attempt to resist categorization by genre and fixed form.
Area codes in Michigan
क्षेत्रफल code 810 is the telephone area code सेवारत eastern Michigan.
the raccoon (, Procyon lotor ), sometimes spelled racoon, also known as the common raccoon, North अमरीकी raccoon, northern raccoon and colloquially as coon, is a medium-sized स्तनधारी native to North America.
The raccoon is the largest of the procyonid family, having a body लंबाई of and a body weight of.
Its grayish coat mostly consists of dense underfur which insulates against cold weather.
Two of the raccoon 's most distinctive features are its extremely dexterous front paws and इसके facial mask, which are themes in the mythology of several Native American tribes.
Raccoons are noted for their intelligence, with studies showing that they are able to याद the solution to tasks लिये up to three years.
The diet of the omnivorous raccoon, which is usually nocturnal, consists of about 40 % invertebrates, 33 % plant foods, and 27 % vertebrates.
The original habitats of the raccoon are deciduous and mixed forests, but due to उनके adaptability वे have extended their range to mountainous areas, coastal marshes, and शहरी क्षेत्रों, where some homeowners consider them to be pests.
As a result of escapes and deliberate introductions in the mid-20th century, raccoons are अभी also distributed आरपार the European mainland, the Caucasus region and Japan.
Though previously thought to be solitary, there is now evidence that raccoons engage in gender-specific social behavior.
Related females often share a common area, while unrelated males live साथ in groups of up to four animals to maintain their positions against foreign males during the mating ऋतु, and other potential invaders.
Home range sizes vary anywhere from 3 hectares ( 7 acres ) for महिलाओं in cities to 50 km2 ( 20 sq mi ) for males in prairies.
After a gestation period of about 65 दिनों, two to five young, known as `` kits '', are born in spring.
The kits are subsequently raised by their mother until dispersion in late fall.
Although captive raccoons have been known to live over 20 years, उनके average life expectancy in the wild is only 1.8 to 3.1 years.
In many areas, hunting and vehicular injury are the two most common कल्याणकारी of death.
The 2010 Haiti earthquake थी a अनर्थकारी परिमाण 7.0 Mw earthquake, साथ an epicenter near the कस्बा of Léogâne ( Ouest Department ), approximately west of Port-au-Prince, Haiti 's capital.
The earthquake occurred at 16:53 लोकल time ( 21:53 UTC ) on Tuesday, 12 January 2010.
By 24 January, at तनिक 52 aftershocks measuring 4.5 or वृहद had been अंकित.
An estimated three million people were affected by the quake.
The highest reliable death count was estimated at 220,000.
Haitian government estimates were higher.
The government of Haiti estimated that 250,000 निवास and 30,000 commercial इमारतें had collapsed or यहूद severely damaged.
The earthquake caused major damage in Port-au-Prince, Jacmel and other settlements in the region.
Many notable landmark buildings यहूद significantly damaged or destroyed, including the Presidential राजमहल, the National Assembly building, the Port-au-Prince Cathedral, and the main jail.
Among those killed were Archbishop of Port-au-Prince Joseph Serge Miot, and opposition leader Micha gaillard.
The headquarters of the United Nations Stabilization Mission in Haiti ( MINUSTAH ), located in the capital, collapsed, killing many, including the Mission 's Chief, Hédi Annabi.
Many countries responded to appeals लिये humanitarian aid, pledging funds and dispatching rescue and medical teams, engineers and support personnel.
Communication systems, air, land, and sea transport facilities, hospitals, and electrical networks had been damaged by the earthquake, which hampered rescue and aid efforts ; confusion over who was in चार्ज, air traffic congestion, and समस्याएं with prioritisation of flights further complicated early relief work.
port-au-prince 's morgues were overwhelmed with tens of thousands of bodies.
These had to be buried in mass graves.
As rescues tailed बंद, supplies, medical care and स्वच्छता became priorities.
Delays in aid distribution led to angry appeals from सहायता workers and survivors, and looting and sporadic violence were observed.
On 22 January the United राष्ट्र noted that the आपात phase of the relief operation was drawing to a बंद, and on the following day the haitian government officially called off the ढूंढें for survivors.
Mister Ed is a fictional talking घोड़ा, originally appearing in short stories by Walter R. Brooks, and later in an American television हालात comedy produced by Filmways that first aired in syndication from जनवरी 5 to July 2, 1961, and then on CBS इससे October 1, 1961 to February 6, 1966.
The stars of the show were Mister Ed, a palomino horse who could `` talk '', played by gelding बाँसुरी Harvester and voiced by former Western star Allan Lane ( who went uncredited for the entire लंबाई of the series ), और his owner, an eccentric and enormously klutzy, yet friendly, architect named Wilbur Post ( Alan Young ).
Much of the program 's humor stemmed from the fact Mister Ed would speak only to wilbur, as well as Ed 's notoriety as a troublemaker.
Other running jokes centered on Wilbur 's character being a huge klutz and inadvertently causing नुक़सान to himself or others.
According to the show 's producer, Arthur lubin, Young was chosen as the lead character because he `` just seemed like the sort of guy a घोड़ा would talk to ''.
Lubin, a friend of Mae West, scored a coup by persuading the screen icon to guest star in one episode.
in the United States, reruns aired on Nick at Nite from March 3, 1986, to February 1, 1993.
Sister station TV Land also reran the show from 1996–98 and again from 2003-06.
The series is currently broadcast every morning on This TV, along with Highway Patrol, and The Patty Duke Show.
It is also currently broadcast on Hallmark Movie Channel.
As of जनवरी 1, 2011, the first two seasons of the show हैं available on Hulu.
The rapture is a term in Christian eschatology which refers to the `` being caught up '' discussed in 1 Thessalonians 4:17, when the `` dead in Christ '' and `` we who are alive and remain '' will be `` caught up in the clouds '' to meet `` the Lord in the एयर ''.
The term `` Rapture '' is used in at least दो senses.
In the pre-tribulation view, a group of people will be left behind on धरती after another group literally पत्ते `` to meet the Lord in the एयर. ''
This is now the most आम use of the term, especially among fundamentalist Christians and in the United States.
The other, पुरानी use of the पद `` Rapture '' is simply as a synonym for the final resurrection generally, without a विश्वास that a group of people is left behind on earth for an extended Tribulation काल after the events of 1 Thessalonians 4:17.
This distinction is important as some types of Christianity never refer to `` the Rapture '' in religious शिक्षा, but might use the older और more सामान्य sense of the word `` rapture '' in referring to what happens दौरान the final resurrection.
There are अनेक views among Christians regarding the timing of मसीह 's return ( including whether it will occur in one event or two ), and various views regarding the destination of the aerial gathering described in 1 Thessalonians 4.
Denominations such as Roman Catholics, Orthodox Christians, Lutheran Christians, and reformed Christians believe in a rapture तभी in the भाव of a सामान्य final resurrection, when Christ returns a single time.
They do not believe कि a group of people is left behind on earth for an extended Tribulation period after the events of 1 thessalonians 4:17.
Pre-tribulation rapture theology was विकसित in the 1830s by John Nelson Darby and the Plymouth Brethren, and popularized in the United राज्य in the early 20th century by the wide circulation of the Scofield सन्दर्भ Bible.
Kris Nathan Humphries ( born February 6, 1985 ) is an American professional basketball player with the Brooklyn Nets.
The Philistine cities of Gaza, Ashdod, ashkelon, Ekron, and Gath
The Philistines (,,, or ;, Plištim ), Pleshet or Peleset, were a लोगों who as part of the Sea Peoples appeared in the southern coastal area of Canaan at the beginning of the Iron आयु ( circa 1175 BC ), most probably from the Aegean region.
According to the बाइबल, they ruled the five city-states ( the `` philistine pentapolis '' ) of Gaza, Ashkelon, Ashdod, ekron and Gath, from Wadi Gaza in the दक्षिण to the Yarqon River in the उत्तर, but with no fixed border to the ईस्ट.
The Bible paints them as the Kingdom of Israel 's most dangerous enemy.
Originating somewhere in the ईजियन, their population was around 25,000 in the 12th century BC, rising to a peak of 30,000 in the 11th century BC, of which the Aegean element was not more than half the total, and perhaps much less.
Nothing is known for certain about the original language or languages of the Philistines, however they were not part of the Semitic canaanite जनसांख्यिकी.
There is some limited evidence in favour of the assumption that the Philistines were indo-european-speakers either from यूनानियों and/or Luwian speakers from the coast of Asia Minor.
Philistine-related words found in the Bible are not Semitic, and can in some cases, with reservations, be traced back to Proto-Indo-European roots.
By the beginning of the 1st मिलेनियम BCE they had अपनाया the general canaanite language of the region.
The Armed Services Vocational Aptitude Battery ( ASVAB ) is a multiple चुनाव test, administered by the United States सैन्य Entrance Processing Command, used to determine qualification for enlistment in the संयुक्त States armed शक्तियां.
It is often offered to American ऊँची school students when वे are in the 10th, 11th and 12th grade, though anyone eligible for enlistment may take it.
Although the test is administered by the military, it is not ( and never has been ) a requirement that a test-taker with a qualifying score enlist in the armed forces.
In financial accounting, a balance sheet or statement of financial position is a summary of the वित्तीय balances of a एकमात्र proprietorship, a business partnership, a corporation or other business organization, such as an LLC or an LLP.
Assets, liabilities और ownership equity are listed as of a specific date, such as the end of its financial year.
A balance sheet is often वर्णित as a `` snapshot of a company 's financial condition ''.
Of the चार basic financial statements, the balance sheet is the only statement जिससे applies to a single point in time of a business ' calendar year.
a standard company balance sheet has three parts : एसेट, liabilities and ownership equity.
The main categories of एसेट are usually listed first, and typically in order of liquidity.
एसेट are followed by the liabilities.
The difference between the assets and the देनदारी is known as equity or the net assets or the net worth or capital of the company and according to the accounting equation, net worth must equal assets minus liabilities.
Another way to look at the वही equation is that assets बराबरी liabilities plus owner 's equity.
Looking at the समीकरण in this way shows how एसेट were financed : either by उधार money ( liability ) or by using the owner 's money ( owner 's equity ).
Balance sheets are usually presented with assets in one खण्ड and liabilities and net worth in the other section साथ the दो sections `` balancing. ''
A business ऑपरेटिंग entirely in cash can measure its profits by withdrawing the entire bank balance at the end of the period, plus any नकदी in hand.
However, अनेक businesses are not paid immediately ; they build up inventories of goods and they acquire buildings and उपकरण.
in other words : व्यवसायों have assets and so they can not, भी if they want to, immediately turn these into cash at the end of each period.
Often, these businesses owe money to suppliers and to tax authorities, and the proprietors do not withdraw all their असली capital and profits at the end of each period.
In other words businesses also have liabilities.
.17 Hornady Magnum Rimfire, commonly known as the.17 HMR, is a rimfire rifle cartridge developed by the ammunition company Hornady in 2002.
It descended from the.22 Magnum by necking down the.22 Magnum case to take a.17 कैलिबर ( 4.5 mm ) bullet, and it is more costly to shoot than traditional.22 caliber rimfire cartridges.
Commonly loaded with a 17 grain ( 1.1 g ) bullet, it can deliver muzzle velocities in excess of 2550 ft/s ( 775 m/s ).
The Schaumburg Flyers were a professional baseball team based in schaumburg, Illinois, in the United States.
The flyers were to be a charter member of the North American League, which is not संबद्ध with Major League Baseball, however, the team folded in March 2011, before they began play in the NAL.
From the 1999 season to the 2010 season, the flyers played their home games at Alexian Field, near the Elgin O'Hare Expressway.
The team formerly played in Thunder Bay, Ontario, where they were known as the Thunder Bay Whiskey Jacks.
The team was originally a member of the Northern League इससे 1993 to 2010.
On July 27, 2009, the flyers played मेजबान to Battle of the Sexes II, जिससे pitted the Flyers against the National Pro Fastpitch Softball Champions, the Chicago Bandits.
Played by आधिकारिक softball rules, the खेल was seen by an overflow record crowd of 8,918, and was won by the Bandits 4-2.
In 1999, the Flyers hired their first manager, रॉन Kittle.
Kittle is best known लिये his playing days with the शिकागो White Sox, and former Chicago Cubs और श्वेत Sox player Greg Hibbard was the pitching coach.
During the early years of the franchise, Kittle did a series of TV commercials to promote the team, using the gimmick `` ma Kittle. '' where he played both himself and his `` Ma. ''
the ads were successful at sparking some initial interest in the team as the Flyers hoped to steal away fans from the nearby Kane County Cougars.
The ad mimicked the highly successful Converse ads where लैरी Johnson starred as both himself and `` Gramama. ''
At the end of the 2001 season, however, Kittle resigned from his managerial position, और Jim Boynewicz थी hired to बदलें him.
In 2004, the Flyers बना it to the Northern League Championship Series विरूद्ध the st. Paul Saints.
Despite leading the five-game series 2-1, Schaumburg eventually lost the series.
In Game 5, Flyers relief pitcher Lyle Prempas allowed a game winning grand slam by St. Paul infielder Marc Mirizzi in the ninth inning.
The Flyers appeared in the Northern League Playoffs four times ( 1999, 2003, 2004, 2006 ) but never won the championship.
Some famous खिलाड़ी who played for the Flyers were former Oakland A 's outfielder ozzie Canseco and former शिकागो Cubs outfielder Dwight Smith.
Rachel Hannah Weisz ( / vice / ; born 7 March 1970 ) is an English film and theatre actress and former fashion model.
Weisz began her acting career at ट्रिनिटी Hall, कैम्ब्रिज in the early 1990s, then started working in television, appearing in Inspector Morse, the अंग्रेजों mini-series Scarlet and Black, and the television film अधिवक्ताओं II.
She made her film début in the film Death Machine ( 1994 ), but her breakthrough role came in the film कड़ी Reaction ( 1996 ), leading to a high-profile भूमिका as Evelyn Carnahan-O'Connell in the films The मम्मी ( 1999 ) और The मम्मी Returns ( 2001 ).
Other notable films featuring Weisz हैं Enemy at the Gates, About a Boy, Constantine, The फव्वारा and The Constant Gardener, for which she प्राप्त an Academy Award, a Golden Globe and a Screen Actors ' Guild award for her supporting भूमिका as Tessa Quayle.
She has been labelled an `` English rose '' since her minor भूमिका in Stealing Beauty ( 1996 ).
Weisz भी works in theatre.
Her stage भेदन was the 1994 revival of Noël Coward 's खेल डिज़ाइन for Living, which earned उसके the लंदन Critics Circle Award लिये the most promising newcomer.
Weisz 's performances also include the 1999 Donmar Warehouse उत्पादन of Tennessee Williams ' Suddenly, पिछला Summer, and their 2009 revival of A Streetcar Named Desire.
Her portrayal of Blanche DuBois in the latter play earned her the Critics ' Circle Theatre Award for बेहतरीन Actress.
वो has recently played Evanora in Oz the Great and Powerful.
the American Civil War ( ACW ), also known as the War between the States or simply the सिविल War ( see naming ), was a civil war fought from 1861 to 1865 between the United States ( the `` Union '' or the `` North '' ) and several Southern slave states that declared their secession and formed the Confederate States of America ( the `` Confederacy '' or the `` South '' ).
The war had its origin in the समस्या of slavery, especially the extension of slavery into the western territories.
विदेशी powers did not intervene.
After four years of bloody combat that left over 600,000 soldiers dead and destroyed much of the South 's infrastructure, the Confederacy collapsed, slavery was abolished, and the मुश्किल Reconstruction process of restoring नेशनल unity और guaranteeing rights to the freed slaves began.
In the 1860 presidential election, Republicans, led by Abraham Lincoln, opposed expanding slavery into United States ' territories.
Lincoln won, but before his inauguration on March 4, 1861, seven cotton-based slave states formed the Confederacy.
Outgoing Democratic President James Buchanan and the incoming Republicans rejected secession as illegal.
Lincoln 's inaugural address declared his administration would not initiate civil war.
Eight remaining slave states continued to reject calls for secession.
Confederate forces seized numerous federal forts within territory claimed by the confederacy.
A Peace Conference failed to find a compromise, and both पहलू prepared for war.
The Confederates assumed कि European countries were so dependent on `` King Cotton `` that they होता intervene ; none did and none recognized the नई Confederate States of America.
hostilities began on April 12, 1861, when Confederate forces fired upon फोर्ट Sumter, a key fort held by Union troops in South Carolina.
Lincoln पुकारा for each state to provide troops to retake the fort ; consequently, four more slave states joined the Confederacy, bringing their total to eleven.
The संघ soon controlled the border states and established a naval blockade that crippled the southern अर्थव्यवस्था.
The Eastern Theater was inconclusive in 1861–62.
The autumn 1862 Confederate campaign into मेरीलैंड ( a Union state ) ended with Confederate रिट्रीट at the Battle of Antietam, dissuading British intervention.
Lincoln issued the Emancipation उदघोषणा, which made ending slavery a war goal.
To the west, by summer 1862 the Union destroyed the Confederate river navy, then much of their western armies, और the Union at vicksburg split the Confederacy in two at the Mississippi River.
In 1863, Robert E. Lee 's confederate incursion north ended at the Battle of Gettysburg.
Western successes led to Ulysses S. Grant command of all Union armies in 1864.
In the Western Theater, William T. Sherman drove east to capture अटलांटा और marched to the sea, destroying Confederate अवसंरचना along the way.
The Union marshaled the resources and जनशक्ति to attack the Confederacy from all directions, and could afford to fight battles of attrition through the Overland Campaign towards Richmond, the Confederate capital.
The defending Confederate army failed, leading to Lee 's surrender to Grant at Appomattox Court House on April 9, 1865.
The American Civil War was one of the earliest true industrial wars.
Railroads, the telegraph, steamships, and mass-produced weapons यहूद employed extensively.
the mobilization of civilian factories, mines, shipyards, banks, transportation and food supplies all foreshadowed संसार War I.
it remains the deadliest युद्ध in अमरीकी history, resulting in the deaths of an estimated 750,000 soldiers and an undetermined number of civilian casualties.
Historian John Huddleston estimates the death toll at ten प्रतिशत of all Northern males 20–45 years बूढ़ा, and 30 percent of all Southern white males aged 18–40.
आलू bread is a form of bread in which potato replaces a portion of the regular wheat flour.
It is पकाया in a variety of methods, including by baking it on a hot griddle or pan, or in an ओवन.
It may be leavened or unleavened, and may have a variety of other ingredients baked into it.
The ratio of potato to wheat आटा varies significantly इससे recipe to रेसिपी, with some recipes having a majority of potato, and others having a बहुमत of wheat आटा.
Some recipes call for mashed potatoes, साथ others calling for dehydrated potato flakes.
It is उपलब्धियाँ as a commercial product in many countries, with similar variations in ingredients, cooking method, and other variables.
The Pacific Time Zone observes मानक time by subtracting eight घंटों from Coordinated Universal समय ( ).
The clock time in this zone is based on the mean solar time of the 120th meridian west of the Greenwich Observatory.
During daylight saving time, its समय offset is.
In the United States and Canada, this time zone is generically called Pacific Time ( pt ).
Specifically, it is Pacific Standard Time ( PST ) जब observing standard time ( winter ), और प्रशांत Daylight Time ( पीडीटी ) when observing daylight saving time ( summer ).
Most of Canada uses daylight saving time.
In Mexico the UTC−8 time zone is known as the Northwest Zone, which is synchronized with the U.S. PDT daylight saving schedule.
The largest city in the Pacific Time Zone is Los Angeles in California from USA ; the city 's metropolitan area is the largest in the zone.
The zone is one hour ahead of the Alaska Time Zone, one hour behind the Mountain Time Zone and three hours behind the Eastern Time Zone.
स्टीरियो 8, commonly known as the eight-track cartridge, eight-track tape, or simply eight-track, is a magnetic tape sound recording technology.
It was लोकप्रिय in the United States from the mid-1960s through to the early 1980s, but was relatively unknown in many European countries.
It was, however, very लोकप्रिय in the United Kingdom during इस period.
स्टीरियो 8 was created in 1964 by a consortium led by Bill Lear of Lear जेट Corporation, along with Ampex, Ford Motor Company, General Motors, Motorola, और RCA Victor Records ( RCA ).
It was a further development of the समान Stereo-Pak four-track cartridge created by Earl `` Madman '' Muntz.
a later quadraphonic version of the format was announced by RCA in April 1970 and first known as Quad-8, then later changed to just q8.
Ramesses II ( 1303 BC – July or August 1213 BC ; Egyptian :, alternatively transcribed as Rameses and Ramses or ), referred to as Ramesses the Great, was the तीसरा Egyptian pharaoh ( reigned 1279 BC – 1213 BC ) of the Nineteenth dynasty.
He is often regarded as the greatest, most मनाये, and most powerful pharaoh of the Egyptian Empire.
His successors and later Egyptians called him the `` Great Ancestor. ''
Ramesses ii led several military expeditions into the Levant, re-asserting Egyptian control over Canaan.
He also led expeditions to the south, into Nubia, commemorated in inscriptions at beit el-Wali and Gerf Hussein.
At age चौदह, Ramesses was appointed Prince रीजेंट by his father Seti I.
He is believed to have taken the throne in his late teens and is known to have ruled Egypt from 1279 BC to 1213 BC for 66 years and 2 months, according to both Manetho and Egypt 's contemporary historical records.
He थी once said to have lived to be 99 years old, but it is more likely that he died in his 90th or 91st year.
If he became Pharaoh in 1279 BC as most Egyptologists आज believe, he would have assumed the throne on May 31, 1279 BC, based on his known accession date of III Shemu day 27.
Ramesses II celebrated an unprecedented 14 sed festivals ( the first held after thirty years of a pharaoh 's reign, and then प्रत्येक three years ) during his reign—more than any other pharaoh.
On his death, he was buried in a मकबरा in the Valley of the Kings ; his body was later moved to a royal cache जहाँ it was discovered in 1881, and is now on display in the कायरो संग्रहालय.
The early part of his reign थी focused on building cities, temples and monuments.
he established the city of Pi-Ramesses in the Nile डेल्टा as his new capital and main base for his campaigns in Syria.
This city was built on the remains of the नगर of Avaris, the capital of the Hyksos when वे took over, and was the स्थान of the main Temple of Set.
He is also known as Ozymandias in the Greek sources, from a transliteration into Greek of a part of Ramesses 's throne name,, `` Ra 's mighty truth, chosen of Ra ''.
The Texas Rangers are a professional baseball team located in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex, based in Arlington, टेक्सास.
The Rangers franchise is currently a member of the Western Division of Major League Baseball 's American League.
चूंकि, the Rangers have played in Rangers Ballpark in Arlington in Arlington, Texas.
The team 's name is borrowed from the famous law enforcement agency of the same name.
The franchise was established in 1961 by the name of the Washington सीनेटरों, an expansion team awarded to Washington, d.C., after the city 's first ballclub, the असली Washington Senators, moved to Minnesota and became the Twins.
After the season, the new Senators moved to Arlington, Texas, and debuted as the Rangers the following spring.
The Texas Rangers Baseball Club has made six appearances in the एमएलबी postseason, all following division championships, in 1996, 1998, 1999, 2010, 2011 and 2012.
In 2010, the रेंजरों advanced past the Division Series for the first time, defeating the Tampa Bay Rays.
Texas then brought home their first American League Pennant after beating the New York Yankees in six games.
In the 2010 संसार Series, the franchise 's first, the Rangers fell to the San Francisco Giants in five खेल.
Their lone victory made them the first Texas team to win a World Series खेल, the Houston Astros having been swept in उनके 2005 World Series appearance.
They repeated as American League champions the following year, then lost the 2011 World Series to the St. Louis Cardinals in seven games.
Gaius Julius Caesar (, July 100 BC – 15 कूच 44 BC ) was a Roman general, statesman, कौंसुल and notable author of Latin गद्य.
He played a critical role in the events that led to the demise of the Roman Republic and the rise of the Roman साम्राज्य.
In 60 BC, Caesar, Crassus and Pompey formed a political alliance that was to dominate Roman politics for several years.
Their attempts to amass power through populist tactics were opposed by the conservative elite भीतर the Roman Senate, among them Cato the Younger with the frequent support of सिसरो.
Caesar 's conquest of Gaul, completed by 51 BC, extended रोम 's territory to the English Channel and the Rhine.
Caesar became the first Roman general to cross both when he built a bridge across the Rhine and conducted the first invasion of Britain.
These achievements granted him unmatched military power and threatened to eclipse the standing of Pompey, who had realigned himself with the Senate after the मौत of Crassus in 53 BC.
With the Gallic Wars concluded, the Senate ordered Caesar to lay down his military command and वापसी to Rome.
Caesar refused, and marked his defiance in 49 BC by crossing the rubicon with a legion, leaving his province and illegally entering Roman territory under arms.
Civil war resulted, from which he emerged as the unrivaled leader of रोम.
बाद assuming control of government, Caesar began a program of social and सरकारी reforms, including the creation of the Julian calendar.
He centralised the bureaucracy of the Republic और was आखिरकार proclaimed `` dictator in perpetuity ''.
But the underlying political conflicts had not been resolved, and on the Ides of March ( 15 March ) 44 BC, सीज़र was assassinated by a group of senators led by Marcus junius ब्रूटस.
A new series of civil wars broke out, and the constitutional government of the Republic थी never restored.
Caesar 's adopted heir Octavian, later known as Augustus, rose to sole power, और the era of the Roman Empire began.
much of Caesar 's life is known from his own accounts of his military campaigns, और from other समकालीन स्त्रोत, mainly the letters and speeches of Cicero and the historical writings of Sallust.
The later biographies of Caesar by Suetonius and Plutarch are also major स्त्रोत.
Caesar is deemed to be one of the greatest military कमांडरों of history.
Linguistic map of Nigeria, Cameroon, and Benin.
Sign in English, outside the University of Lagos
There are hundreds of languages spoken in Nigeria.
The प्रमुख languages are Yoruba, Hausa, Igbo, Edo, Fulfulde, Kanuri, and Ibibio.
The official language of Nigeria, English, the पूर्व colonial language, was chosen to facilitate the cultural and linguistic unity of the country.
English, however, remains an exclusive preserve of the country 's urban elite, and is not widely spoken in rural areas, which comprise three quarters of the countries population.
Nigeria 's linguistic विविधता is a microcosm of Africa as a whole, encompassing तीन major African languages परिवारों : Afroasiatic, Nilo-Saharan, and Niger–Congo.
Nigeria also has several as-yet unclassified languages, such as Cen Tuum, जिससे may represent a relic of an even greater diversity prior to the spread of the current language परिवारों.
Daucus carota ( common names include wild गाजर, ( uk ) bird 's nest, bishop 's lace, and Queen Anne 's lace ( North America ) ) is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae, native to temperate regions of Europe, southwest Asia and naturalised to North America and Australia.
Domesticated गाजर are cultivars of a subspecies, Daucus carota subsp. sativus.
In the United States, the title of federal judge usually means a न्यायधीश appointed by the President of the United States and confirmed by the United राज्य Senate pursuant to the Appointments Clause in Article II of the United States Constitution.
In addition to the Supreme Court of the United States, whose existence and some aspects of whose jurisdiction are beyond the constitutional power of Congress to alter, acts of Congress have established 13 courts of appeals ( also called `` circuit courts '' ) with appellate jurisdiction over different regions of the United राज्य, and 94 संयुक्त States district courts.
Every न्यायधीश appointed to such a court may be categorized as a संघीय judge ; such positions include the Chief Justice and Associate Justices of the Supreme Court, Circuit Judges of the courts of appeals, and district judges of the United States district courts.
All of ये judges described thus far are referred to sometimes as `` Article III judges '' क्युकी they exercise the न्यायिक power vested in the न्यायिक branch of the federal government by Article III of the U.S. Constitution.
In addition, judges of the Court of International Trade exercise न्यायिक power pursuant to Article III.
अन्य judges serving in the federal courts, including मजिस्ट्रेट judges and bankruptcy judges, हैं also sometimes referred to as `` संघीय judges '' ; however, they are neither नियुक्त by the President nor confirmed by the Senate, and their power derives from Article I instead.
See Article I and Article III tribunals.
Nelly Kim Furtado ( born December 2, 1978 ) is a Canadian singer, songwriter and अभिनेत्री.
She has sold 20 million albums worldwide and more 20 million singles, bringing उसके total sales to over 40 लाख रिकॉर्ड around the world.
फ़र्टाडो first gained fame साथ her debut album, वाह, Nelly !
, जिससे spawned two successful singles, `` I 'm Like a Bird `` and `` Turn Off the Light ``. ``
I 'm Like A Bird '' won a 2001 Juno पुरस्कार for Single of the Year and a 2002 Grammy Award for बेहतरीन Female Pop Vocal Performance.
In 2003, Furtado released Folklore, which produced three international singles— `` Powerless ( Say What You Want ) ``, `` कोशिश `` and `` Força ``.
Three years later she released Loose, a विश्वव्यापी वाणिज्यिक success.
The album spawned four number-one hits : `` Promiscuous ``, `` maneater ``, `` कह it Right `` and `` All Good Things ( Come to an समाप्त ) ``.
After a three-year break, she released her first full-length स्पेनी album, Mi योजना, and Furtado received a Latin Grammy for Best मादा Pop Vocal Album.
In 2012, Furtado 's fourth English-language studio album, The स्पिरिट अविनाशी was released.
Furtado 's work has earned उसके numerous awards and accolades, including 2 ग्रैमी Awards, 10 juno Awards, 3 MuchMusic Video Awards and a star on Canada 's Walk of Fame.
Creatures of the Night is the tenth studio album by Kiss.
It is the band 's last album for Casablanca Records, the only label the group had कभी recorded for at that point.
The album was समर्पित to the मेमोरी of कासाब्लांका founder and early Kiss supporter Neil Bogart, who had died of cancer during the recording sessions.
it is also the band 's last album अंकित with Ace Frehley credited as an official member ( until 1998 's psycho Circus ), and इसके first album with Vinnie Vincent as the initially uncredited lead guitarist ( Vincent would later be credited, but not featured pictorially on the cover, of 1985 's reissue of the album ).
Touch is a crucial means of receiving information.
This photo shows tactile markings identifying stairs लिये visually impaired people.
The somatosensory system is a विविध sensory system comprising the receptors and processing centres to produce the sensory modalities such as touch, temperature, proprioception ( body position ), and nociception ( pain ).
the sensory receptors cover the skin and epithelia, skeletal muscles, bones and joints, internal organs, and the cardiovascular system.
While touch is considered one of the five traditional senses, the impression of touch is formed from अनेक modalities.
In medicine, the colloquial term `` touch '' is usually replaced with `` somatic होश '' to better reflect the किस्में of mechanisms involved.
Somatic senses are sometimes referred to as somesthetic senses, with the understanding that somesthesis includes touch, proprioception and ( depending on usage ) also haptic perception.
The system reacts to diverse stimuli using different receptors : thermoreceptors, nociceptors, mechanoreceptors and chemoreceptors.
Transmission of information from the receptors passes via sensory nerves through tracts in the spinal cord and into the दिमाग.
Processing primarily occurs in the primary somatosensory area in the parietal lobe of the cerebral cortex.
The cortical homunculus थी devised by Wilder penfield.
At its simplest, the system works when activity in a संवेदी neuron is triggered by a specific stimulus such as heat ; this signal eventually passes to an area in the brain uniquely attributed to that area on the body—this allows the processed stimulus to be felt at the correct location.
The point-to-point मानचित्रण of the देह surfaces in the brain is called a homunculus and is essential in the creation of a body image.
This brain-surface ( `` cortical '' ) map is not immutable, however.
Dramatic shifts can occur in response to stroke or injury.
Magnolia is a large genus of about 210 flowering plant species in the subfamily magnolioideae of the family Magnoliaceae.
It is named after French botanist Pierre Magnol.
Magnolia is an ancient genus.
Appearing before मधुमक्खियों did, the flowers evolved to encourage pollination by beetles.
To avoid damage from pollinating beetles, the carpels of Magnolia flowers हैं extremely tough.
Fossilised specimens of Magnolia acuminata have been found dating to 20 million years ago, and of plants identifiably belonging to the Magnoliaceae डेटिंग to 95 million years ago.
Another aspect of Magnolias that is considered to represent an ancestral state is that the flower bud is enclosed in a bract rather than in sepals ; the perianth parts are undifferentiated and called tepals rather than distinct sepals and petals.
Magnolia shares the tepal characteristic with several other flowering plants near the base of the flowering plant lineage such as Amborella and Nymphaea ( as well as साथ many more recently derived plants such as लिलि ).
The natural range of Magnolia species is a disjunct distribution, with a main centre in east and southeast Asia and a secondary केन्द्र in eastern North America, सेंट्रल America, the West Indies, and some species in South America.

`` White Christmas '' is an Irving Berlin song reminiscing about an old-fashioned Christmas setting.
According to the Guinness Book of World Records, the संस्करण sung by Bing Crosby is the best-selling सिंगल of all time, with estimated sales in excess of 50 million copies worldwide.
Accounts vary as to when and where Berlin लिखा the song.
One story is that he wrote it in 1940, in warm la quinta, California, while staying at the La Quinta होटल, a frequent Hollywood retreat also favored by writer-producer Frank Capra, although the Arizona Biltmore also claims the song was written there.
He often stayed up all night writing — he told his secretary, `` Grab your pen and take down this song.
I just wrote the best song I 've ever written — heck, I just wrote the best song that anybody 's ever written ! ''
Cross-country skiing ( or XC skiing ) is a form of ski touring in which participants propel themselves across snow-covered terrain using skis and डंडे.
The activity is popular in many places with large snowfields, primarily Northern Europe, Canada, and Alaska.
Cross-country skiing is part of the Nordic skiing sport family, which includes ski jumping, Nordic combined ( cross-country स्कीइंग and ski jumping ), Biathlon ( skiing and rifle marksmanship ) and ski-orienteering ( which includes map navigation along snow trails and tracks ).
Cross-country skiing is the modern style of skiing that most resembles prehistoric skiing, particularly when done in the backcountry.
it is also related to Telemark skiing.
A use tax in United States is complementary to sales tax which means, if you buy a Taxable product/services without paying any Sales tax to vendor, you owe use tax.
You must स्वः assess उपयोग tax and pay it directly to the state where the products were consumed or services were rendered.
Use tax typically is a tax on consumption but if you buy an item ( without paying sales tax ) and store it in your गोदाम initially, उपयोग tax applies to that location where goods were stored.
Later on when the final consumption takes place at some other location, you are जरूरी to pay the differential of tax रेट to the jurisdiction of ultimate place of consumption.
This really means that you do n't have to pay both Sales Tax as well as Use Tax on one transaction.
It is तभी one or the other that तुम are जरूरी to pay on purchase of taxable products/services.
If vendor does n't charge any Sales tax on its invoice then it is the obligation of the buyer to self assess Use tax and pay it to the appropriate Jurisdication.
Use Tax is generally charged at the वही tax रेट of बिक्री Tax but in some states the tax rate is different.
Use tax is also termed as `` Consumption कर '' or `` Consumer Use Tax ''.
A use tax is a type of excise tax levied in the United States by numerous state governments.
It is assessed upon tangible personal property purchased by a resident of the assessing state for use, storage, or consumption in that state ( not for resale ), regardless of जहाँ the purchase took place.
if a resident of a state makes a purchase within his home state, full sales tax is paid at the time of the transaction.
The use tax applies when a resident of the assessing state purchases an item that is not विषय to his home state 's बिक्री tax.
Usually, this is due to out-of-state purchases, as well as ordering items through the मेल, by phone, or over the Internet from other states.
the use tax is typically assessed at the वही rate as the sales कर that would have been owed ( if any ) had the same goods been purchased in the state of residence.
लिये example, a resident of Massachusetts, with a 6.25 % `` बिक्री and use tax '' on certain goods and सेवाएं, purchases non-exempt goods or services in New Hampshire for use, storage or other consumption in Massachusetts.
Under New Hampshire law, the New Hampshire vendor collects no sales taxes on the goods, but the मैसाचुसेट्स purchaser/user must still pay 6.25 % of the sales price सीधे to the Department of Revenue in मैसाचुसेट्स as a उपयोग tax.
If the same goods are purchased in a US state that does collect sales tax for such goods at time of purchase, whatever taxes were paid by the purchaser to that state can be deducted ( as a tax credit ) from the 6.25 % owed for subsequent use, storage or consumption in मैसाचुसेट्स.
With few exceptions, no state 's vendors will charge the native state 's sales tax on goods shipped out of state, meaning सब goods ordered from out-of-state are essentially free of sales tax.
The क्रेता is therefore required to declare and pay the use tax to his home state on these ordered goods.
The assessing jurisdiction may make the use कर देय annually, लकिन some states require a monthly payment.
For example, where a Vermont resident has not paid at least 6 % sales tax on property brought in for use in the state, Vermont law requires दाखिल a tax return ( रूप SU-452 और payment ) by the 20th day of the month following non-exempt purchases to avoid a $ 50 late fee, a 5 % penalty प्रति month, to a maximum of 25 %, plus statutory interest on the unpaid कर and penalties.
ठेठ exemptions शामिल purchases by charitable non-profit organizations or governmental एजेंसियों, purchases for resale in commerce, and purchases via `` casual sales '' by individuals not in the ordinary course of business.
Also note that there हैं thousands of कर jurisdictions in the U.S. and many have ever-changing lists of specific types of goods and services that are not taxable.
As an illustration of the complexities : a 2006 Massachusetts law requires भुगतान of tax on `` pre-written '' ( not custom ) software purchased and downloaded over the Internet for संस्थापना and उपयोग in Massachusetts, regardless of where it originates.
However, the actual use of the same software डाउनलोड by a Massachusetts resident to a server in another state remains a non-taxed `` service ''.
In contrast, Arkansas generally does not tax anything delivered over the Internet ( such as downloaded software or music ), except VoIP which is specifically defined as taxable `` telecommunications services ''.
Software ( pre-written or custom ) `` delivered thru a tangible medium '' ( i.e., on disk ) in Arkansas is taxable even if ordered online, मगर `` custom software for a particular customer '' which is non-taxable `` programming services '' even if delivered on a disk.
In most cases, this complexity is part of the underlying sales tax laws ; but जबकि a brick-and-mortar store has to deal with तभी the sales tax कानून of its own location, रिमोट sellers have to deal with the use tax laws of अनेक jurisdictions—up to every US state and locality that assesses them, if the company has a presence or `` नेक्सस '' in प्रत्येक state ( as large `` brick-and-mortar '' sellers like Wal-Mart and Best Buy do ).
In medicine, pulmonary hypertension ( PH ) is an increase of blood pressure in the pulmonary artery, pulmonary vein, or pulmonary capillaries, साथ known as the फेफड़ों vasculature, leading to shortness of breath, dizziness, fainting, and other symptoms, all of जिससे are exacerbated by exertion.
Pulmonary hypertension can be a कठोर disease with a markedly decreased exercise tolerance and heart failure.
It was first identified by Dr. Ernst von Romberg in 1891.
According to the सबसे recent classification, it can be one of five अलग types : arterial, venous, hypoxic, thromboembolic or miscellaneous.

Sanuk, a प्रभाग of Deckers Outdoor Corporation, is a footwear brand based in Southern California.
Sanuk, the Thai word for fun, was founded by Southern California देशी Jeff kelley when he started making sandals out of indoor-outdoor carpet.
The first उत्पाद created was green carpeted and entitled the `` फर रियल '' after one shop owner asked if the novelty sandal was `` For Real. ''
The Fur Real first became a runaway hit through boutique stores and not the intended surf shops.
The novelty act was followed up by a चन्दन wrapped in wire mesh, a तेंदुआ print version, and styles made out of a poncho material in a variety of colors.
Sanuk has grown to include style options for मेन, women and youth and is distributed across the United States and in over 50 countries throughout Europe, Asia, दक्षिण America and Australia.
Sanuk centers itself around a positive lifestyle advocating the स्लोगन, `` Smile, Pass it on ! ``.
In computer science, array programming languages ( also known as vector or multidimensional languages ) generalize operations on scalars to लागू transparently to vectors, matrices, and higher dimensional arrays.
Array programming primitives concisely express व्यापक ideas about data manipulation.
The level of conciseness can be dramatic in certain cases : it is not uncommon to find array programming language one-liners that require more than a couple of pages of Java कोड.
APL, designed by Ken Iverson, was the first programming language to provide array प्रोग्रामिंग capabilities.
The mnemonic APL refers to the title of उसके seminal book `` A Programming Language '' and not to arrays per se. Iverson 's contribution to rigor and clarity was probably more important than the सरल extension of dimensions to functions.
in the United States an annuity contract is created when an insured party, usually an individual, pays a life बीमे company a single premium that होगा later be distributed back to the insured party over time.
Annuity contracts traditionally provide a guaranteed distribution of income over time, such as via fixed payments, until the death of the person or persons named in the contract or until a final date, whichever comes first.
However, the majority of modern annuity customers use annuities only to accumulate funds free of income and capital gains taxes and to later take lump-sum withdrawals बगैर using the guaranteed-income-for-life feature.
President Barack Obama.
Barack Obama with उसके पहला Supreme Court nominee, Sonia Sotomayor.
Following is a list of all United States संघीय judges appointed by President बराक Obama during his presidency.
As of April 30, 2013, 187 Obama nominees to Article III judgeships have been confirmed by the United States Senate, namely two Justices to the Supreme Court of the United States, 35 judges to the United States courts of appeals और 150 judges to the United States district courts.
25 further nominations are currently awaiting Senate action.
There हैं currently 16 vacancies on the United States Courts of appeals, 67 vacancies on the United States district courts and 22 अतिरिक्त federal judiciary vacancies that are anticipated to occur before the end of Obama 's second term.
Obama रै not बना any recess appointments to the federal courts.
Obama has made two nominations to the United States Court of International Trade, an Article III ट्रिब्यूनल.
Obama also designated sitting judge Emily C. Hewitt of the United States Court of Federal Claims, an आलेख I court, to be Chief Judge of that court.

Agency debt also known as an Agency bond is a security, usually a bond, issued by a U.S. government-sponsored agency.
The offerings of these agencies are backed but not guaranteed by the US government since the agencies are private entities.
Some prominent issuers of ये प्रतिभूति हैं Student Loan Marketing Association ( Sallie Mae ), Federal National Mortgage Association ( Fannie Mae ) and Federal Home Loan बंधक Corporation ( Freddie Mac ).
Agency securities are usually exempt इससे state and local taxes, but not संघीय tax.
एजेंसी debt is also called an agency security.
The Susquehanna Steam इलेक्ट्रिक Station, a boiling water reactor.
The reactors are located inside the rectangular containment buildings towards the front of the cooling towers.
Three nuclear-powered American warships, ( top to नीचे ) nuclear cruisers USS Bainbridge and USS Long Beach साथ uss Enterprise the first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier in 1964.
Crew members are spelling out Einstein 's mass-energy equivalence formula E = mc2 on the flight deck.
The Russian nuclear-powered icebreaker NS Yamal on a 1994 joint expedition with the NSF.
नाभिकीय power is the उपयोग of sustained nuclear fission to generate heat and electricity.
Nuclear शक्ति पौधे provided about 5.7 % of the world 's energy and 13 % of the world 's electricity, in 2012.
In 2013, the IAEA report that there are 437 operational nuclear शक्ति reactors ( although not all are producing electricity ), in 31 countries.
In addition, there are approximately 140 naval vessels using nuclear नोदन in operation, powered by कुछ 180 reactors.
There is an ongoing debate about the use of nuclear energy.
Proponents, such as the World Nuclear Association, the IAEA and Environmentalists for Nuclear Energy contend that nuclear power is a sustainable उर्जा source कि reduces carbon emissions.
Opponents, such as Greenpeace International and nirs, believe that nuclear power poses many threats to people and the environment.
Nuclear power plant accidents शामिल the Chernobyl disaster ( 1986 ), Fukushima Daiichi nuclear विपत्ति ( 2011 ), and the Three Mile Island accident ( 1979 ).
There have also been some nuclear-powered submarine mishaps.
Research into safety improvements is continuing and nuclear fusion, believed to be safer, may be used in the future.
as of 2012, according to the IAEA, worldwide there were 68 civil nuclear power रिएक्टरों under construction in 15 countries.
In the US the licenses of almost half its reactors have महरूम extended to 60 years, and plans to build another dozen are under serious consideration.
However, जापानी 's 2011 Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster prompted a rethink of nuclear उर्जा policy in many countries.
Germany decided to close all its reactors by 2022, and Italy has banned nuclear शक्ति.
Following Fukushima, the International Energy Agency halved its estimate of additional nuclear generating capacity to be निर्मित by 2035.
Photograph of the Berlin वॉल taken from the West side.
The Wall थी built in 1961 to prevent East Germans from fleeing from Communism.
It was an iconic symbol of the Cold War and its fall in 1989 marked the समाप्त of the War.
The Cold War, often dated from 1947 to 1991, was a sustained state of political and military tension between powers in the Western Bloc, वर्चस्व by the United States साथ NATO among its allies, and powers in the Eastern Bloc, dominated by the Soviet Union along with the Warsaw Pact.
This began after the success of उनके temporary wartime alliance विरूद्ध नाजी Germany, leaving the USSR and the US as two superpowers with profound economic and political differences.
A neutral faction arose with the Non-Aligned Movement founded by Egypt, India, and Yugoslavia ; this faction rejected association with either the us-led West or the Soviet-led East.
The Cold War was so नामित because the two major powers—each possessing nuclear weapons and thereby threatened with परस्पर assured destruction —never met in direct military combat.
Instead, in their struggle for वैश्विक influence they engaged in जारी psychological warfare and in regular indirect confrontations through proxy युद्धों.
Cycles of relative calm would be followed by high tension, which could have led to world war.
The tensest times यहूद during the Berlin Blockade ( 1948–1949 ), the Korean War ( 1950–1953 ), the Suez Crisis ( 1956 ), the बर्लिन संकट of 1961, the क्यूबन missile crisis ( 1962 ), the Vietnam War ( 1959–1975 ), the Yom Kippur War ( 1973 ), the Soviet war in Afghanistan ( 1979–1989 ), the Soviet downing of Korean Air लाइनों उड़ान 007 ( 1983 ), and the `` Able Archer '' NATO military exercises ( 1983 ).
The conflict was expressed through military coalitions, strategic conventional force deployments, extensive aid to client states, espionage, massive propaganda campaigns, conventional और nuclear arms races, appeals to neutral nations, rivalry at sports events ( in particular the Olympics ), and technological competitions such as the Space Race.
The US and USSR became involved in political and military conflicts in the Third World देशों of Latin America, Africa, the Middle ईस्ट, and Southeast Asia.
To alleviate the risk of a potential nuclear war, both sides sought relief of political tensions through détente in the 1970s.
In the 1980s, the United राज्य increased diplomatic, military, and economic pressures on the सोवियत Union, at a time when the communist state was already suffering from economic stagnation.
in the mid-1980s, the नई Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev introduced the liberalizing reforms of perestroika ( `` reorganization '', 1987 ) and glasnost ( `` openness '', ca. 1985 ).
Pressures for national independence grew stronger in Eastern Europe, especially Poland.
They reached a breaking point when Gorbachev refused to use Soviet troops to support the faltering government of East Germany in late 1989.
Within weeks all the satellite states broke free from Moscow in a peaceful wave of revolutions ( there was some violence in Romania ).
The pressures escalated अंदर the Soviet Union, where Communism fell and the USSR was formally dissolved in late 1991.
The United States remained as the world 's only superpower.
The Cold War and its events have left a significant विरासत, and it is often referred to in popular culture, especially in media featuring themes of espionage and the threat of nuclear warfare.
Pikes Peak State Park is a state park of Iowa, USA, featuring a bluff overlooking the Upper Mississippi River विपरीत the संगम of the Wisconsin River.
The पार्क is operated by the आयोवा Department of Natural Resources.
It is nearly a thousand acres ( 4 km2 ) in extent.
The निकटतम city is McGregor, Iowa.
Iowa Highway 76 approximately defines its उत्तरी boundary.
It gets its name from the Iowa incarnation of Pikes Peak, a विशेषकर ऊँची point overlooking the gorge of the Upper Mississippi, and जैसे Pikes शिखर in Colorado, is named for Zebulon Pike.
There are hiking trails, campgrounds और RV facilities.
Mountain bikes are permitted in certain portions of the park.
Aside from recreational development, the land in the park was never cleared and to a large extent remains as it was before the advent of white उपनिवेश.
It is part of a larger complex of parks, reserves and refuges which include Effigy mounds National Monument, the various components of the Yellow River State Forest, the enormous Upper मिसिसिपी River National Wildlife and Fish Refuge और much smaller, much less well known Driftless Area नेशनल Wildlife Refuge.
The Northeast आयोवा Legacy Trail System is undergoing विकास, and will connect elements of ये sites.
Zac Brown Band is an American country/folk band based in Atlanta, Georgia.
The lineup consists of Zac Brown ( सीसे vocals, guitar ), Jimmy De मार्टिनी ( fiddle, vocals ), John Driskell हॉपकिंस ( bass guitar, vocals ), coy bowles ( guitar, keyboards ), Chris Fryar ( drums ), Clay Cook ( guitar, keyboards, mandolin, steel guitar, vocals ), and Daniel de los Reyes ( percussion ).
The band has toured throughout the संयुक्त राज्य, including a slot on the 2009 and 2010 Bonnaroo Music Festival.
They have also recorded five studio albums, और charted नौ Number One singles on the Billboard country charts : `` Chicken Fried ``, `` Toes ``, `` Highway 20 Ride ``, `` Free ``, `` As She 's Walking Away ``, `` Colder Weather ``, `` Knee Deep ``, `` Keep me In Mind ``, and `` Goodbye in उसके Eyes `` in addition to the singles `` Whatever It Is `` and `` No Hurry ``, जिससे peaked at number 2 on the same चार्ट.
बात radio is a radio format containing चर्चा about topical issues.
Most shows are regularly hosted by a single individual, and often feature interviews with a क्रमांक of different guests.
Talk radio typically includes an element of श्रोता भागीदारी, usually by broadcasting live conversations between the host and listeners who `` call in '' ( usually via telephone ) to the show.
Listener contributions are usually screened by a show 's निर्माता ( s ) in order to maximize audience interest and, in the case of commercial talk radio, आकर्षित advertisers.
Generally, the shows are organized into segments, each अलग by a pause for advertisements ; however, in public or non-commercial radio, music is sometimes निभाई in place of commercials to separate the program segments.
Variations of talk radio include conservative talk, hot talk, liberal talk and sports talk.
While talk radio has historically been associated with AM/FM, starting around 2005 the technology for Internet-based talk-radio shows became cost effective in the form of podcasts.
Now, it is possible for an individual to उपयोग a variety of services to host an Internet-based talk-radio show बगैर carriage by a traditional radio station.
In addition TV programming from talk and news outlets such as BBC, CNN, Bloomberg and Fox are now often available expanding the world of talk radio further.
बात radio listening is now enjoyed not only on radios, but a चौड़ी variety of other devices and services including PCs using itunes, station directories such as Tunein, show directory smartphones with apps such as Stitcher.
hippa is a genus of decapod crustaceans in the family Hippidae, containing the following species:
Hippa adactyla Fabricius, 1787

Hippa alcimede ( De Man, 1902 )
Hippa australis Hale, 1927
Hippa carcineutes Holthuis & Manning, 1970
hippa celaeno ( de Man, 1896 )
Hippa granulatus ( Borradaile, 1904 )
Hippa hirtipes ( Dana, 1852 )
Hippa indica Haig, मुरुगन & Balakrishnan Nair, 1986
Hippa marmorata ( Hombron & Jacquinot, 1846 )
Hippa ovalis ( A. Milne-Edwards, 1862 )
Hippa picta ( Heller, 1861 )
Hippa strigillata ( Stimpson, 1860 )
Hippa testudinaria ( Herbst, 1791 )
Hippa truncatifrons ( Miers, 1878 )
It is closely सम्बन्धित to the genus emerita, and species have often been transferred between the two genera.
Jakarta ( ), officially known as the Special Capital Region of जकार्ता ( ), is the capital and largest city of Indonesia.
Located on the northwest coast of Java, Jakarta is the country 's economic, सांस्कृतिक और political centre, and with a population of 10,187,595 as of November 2011, it is the most populous city in Indonesia and in Southeast Asia, and is the thirteenth सबसे populated city in the world.
the official metropolitan क्षेत्रफल, known as Jabodetabek ( a name formed by combining the initial syllables of Jakarta, Bogor, Depok, Tangerang and bekasi ), is the second largest in the world, yet the metropolis 's suburbs still continue beyond it.
Jakarta is listed as a global city in the 2008 वैश्वीकरण and संसार Cities Study Group and Network ( gawc ) research.
and has an area of.
This area has population of well over 28 million, बनाना it one of the world 's largest conurbations in terms of number of inhabitants.
In 2011, Jakarta ranked 17th among the world 's 200 largest cities, a jump from its 2007 ranking of 171.
Jakarta has grown more rapidly than Kuala Lumpur, Beijing and Bangkok.
Established in the fourth century, the city became an important trading port for the Kingdom of Sunda.
It was the de facto capital of the Dutch East इंडीज ( when it was known as Batavia ) and has continued as the capital of Indonesia चूंकि the country 's independence was declared in 1945.
The city is the seat of the आसियान Secretariat.
Jakarta is served by the Soekarno–Hatta International Airport, Halim Perdanakusuma International Airport, and Tanjung Priok Harbour ; it is connected by several intercity and commuter railways, and served by several bus लाइनों running on reserved busways.
A typical home एयर conditioning window unit.
Air conditioning is the process of altering the properties of air ( primarily temperature और humidity ) to more favourable conditions.
More generally, air conditioning can refer to any form of technological cooling, heating, ventilation, or disinfection that modifies the कंडीशन of air.
An एयर conditioner ( often referred to as air con, AC or A/C, और not to be confused with the abbreviation for प्रत्यावर्ती current ) is a major or घर appliance, system, or mechanism designed to change the air temperature and humidity within an area ( used for कूलिंग and sometimes हीटिंग depending on the एयर properties at a given time ).
The cooling is typically done using a simple refrigeration cycle, but sometimes evaporation is used, commonly for सुकून cooling in buildings और motor vehicles.
In निर्माण, a complete system of हीटिंग, ventilation and एयर conditioning is referred to as `` HVAC ``.

DC Talk ( styled as dc बात ), is a Grammy -winning Christian rap trio.
The group was formed in Lynchburg, वर्जिनिया in 1987 by टोबी McKeehan, Michael Tait, and Kevin Max Smith.
They have released five major studio albums together : dc बात ( 1989 ), Nu Thang ( 1990 ), Free at Last ( 1992 ), Jesus Freak ( 1995 ), और Supernatural ( 1998 ).
in 2002, the Encyclopedia of Contemporary ईसाई Music called DC Talk `` the most popular overtly Christian act of all time. ''
In 2000, the समूह released an EP titled Solo which contained two solo songs from each member.
Since that time, DC Talk has been on an indefinite hiatus, and the तीन band members have each led solo careers.
They have performed and recorded individual गीतों together several times during the 2000s, although the समूह never officially reunited or disbanded.
The group 's musical style evolved significantly throughout their career.
Their first two releases, DC Talk and nu Thang, were of the hip hop genre.
DC Talk 's third album, Free at Last, also mainly took influence from the hip hop style, हालांकि their music began taking on a rock sound.
The trio 's last two एल्बम, Jesus Freak and Supernatural, were predominantly pop rock.
the Bible is a compilation of many shorter books written at अलग times और later assembled into the biblical canon.
All but the shortest of these books have महरूम divided into अध्याय, generally a page or so in length, since the early 13th century.
चूंकि the mid-16th century, each chapter has महरूम further divided into `` verses '' of a few short लाइनों or sentences.
sometimes a sentence spans more than one verse, as in the case of, and sometimes there is more than एक sentence in a single verse, as in the case of.
As the chapter and श्लोक divisions were not part of the original texts, they form part of the paratext of the Bible.
The Jewish divisions of the Hebrew text differ at various points from those used by Christians.
For instance, in Jewish tradition, the ascriptions to many Psalms are regarded as independent verses, making 116 more verses, whereas the established Christian practice is to count and number each Psalm ascription together with the first verse following it.
Some अध्याय divisions also occur in different places, e.g. in यहूदी Bibles is numbered as in Christian translations.
An index ( बहुवचन : indexes ) is a list of words or phrases ( 'headings ' ) and associated pointers ( 'locators ' ) to where useful material relating to that heading can be found in a document.
In a traditional back-of-the-book index the headings will include names of people, places और events, and concepts selected by a person as being relevant and of interest to a possible reader of the book.
The pointers are typically page numbers, paragraph numbers or section numbers.
In a library catalog the words are authors, titles, subject headings, etc., and the pointers are call numbers.
Internet search engines, ऐसे as Google, and full text searching सहायता provide access to information लकिन are not as selective as an index, as they provide non-relevant links, and may miss relevant information if it is नहीं phrased in exactly the way they expect.
In United States financial regulation, a suspicious activity report ( or sar ) is a report made by a वित्तीय institution to the Financial Crimes प्रवर्तन Network ( FinCEN ), an agency of the United States Department of the Treasury, regarding suspicious or potentially suspicious activity.
Facebook on the Ad-tech 2010
Facebook is an online social नेटवर्किंग service, whose नाम stems from the colloquial name for the book given to students at the प्रारंभ of the academic year by some university administrations in the United States to help students get to know each other.
It थी founded in February 2004 by Mark Zuckerberg with his college roommates and fellow Harvard University students Eduardo Saverin, Andrew McCollum, Dustin Moskovitz and Chris Hughes.
The website 's membership was initially limited by the founders to Harvard students, लकिन was expanded to other कॉलेजों in the Boston area, the Ivy लीग, and Stanford University.
It gradually added support for विद्यार्थी at various अन्य universities before opening to high school students, and eventually to anyone aged 13 and over.
Facebook now allows any users who declare themselves to be at least 13 years old to become registered users of the site.
Users must register before using the site, after जिससे they may create a personal profile, add other users as friends, and exchange संदेश, including automatic notifications when they update their profile.
Additionally, users may join common-interest user groups, organized by workplace, school or college, or other विशेषताएँ, and categorize their friends into lists ऐसे as `` People From Work '' or `` Close Friends ''.
as of September 2012, Facebook has over one billion active users.
According to a May 2011 Consumer Reports survey, there are 7.5 million children under 13 with accounts and 5 million under 10, violating the साईट 's terms of service.
In May 2005, Accel partners invested $ 12.7 million in Facebook, and Jim breyer added $ 1 million of his own धन to the pot.
A January 2009 Compete.com study ranked Facebook as the most used social networking सेवा by worldwide monthly active users.
Entertainment Weekly included the site on its end-of-the-decade `` best-of '' list, saying, `` कैसा on धरती किया we stalk our exes, याद our co-workers ' birthdays, bug our friends, and play a rousing game of Scrabulous before Facebook ? ''
Critics, such as Facebook Detox, state that Facebook has turned into a national obsession in the United States, resulting in vast amounts of time lost and encouraging narcissism.
Quantcast estimates Facebook has 138.9 million monthly अद्वितीय U.S. visitors in may 2011.
According to Social Media Today, in April 2010 an estimated 41.6 % ( 129.5 million ) of the U.S. जनसांख्यिकी था a फेसबुक account.
Nevertheless, Facebook 's market growth started to stall in some regions, with the साईट losing 7 million active उपयोक्ता in the United States और Canada in May 2011.
Facebook eventually filed for an initial public offering on February 1, 2012, and was headquartered in Menlo पार्क, California.
Facebook Inc. began selling stock to the public and trading on the NASDAQ on May 18, 2012.
Sulfonamide functional समूह
Hydrochlorothiazide is a sulfonamide और a thiazide.
Furosemide is a sulfonamide, but not a thiazide.
Sulfonamide or sulphonamide is the basis of several groups of drugs.
The original antibacterial sulfonamides ( sometimes called sulfa दवाएँ or sulpha drugs ) are synthetic antimicrobial agents that contain the sulfonamide group.
Some sulfonamides are also devoid of जीवाणुरोधी activity, e.g., the anticonvulsant sultiame.
The sulfonylureas and thiazide diuretics are नए drug groups based on the antibacterial sulfonamides.
Sulfa allergies are common, hence medications containing sulfonamides are विहित carefully.
It is important to make a distinction between sulfa drugs and other sulfur-containing drugs and additives, such as sulfates and sulfites, जिससे are chemically unrelated to the sulfonamide group, and do not cause the same hypersensitivity reactions seen in the sulfonamides.

घरेलू geese ( Anser anser domesticus or Anser cygnoides ) are domesticated grey geese ( either Greylag Geese or Swan Geese ) kept as poultry for their meat, eggs, and down feathers since प्राचीन times.
30 Seconds to Mars is an American rock बैंड from Los Angeles, formed in 1998.
Since 2007, the band has consisted of actor Jared Leto ( lead vocals, rhythm guitar, songwriter ), Shannon Leto ( drums, percussion ) and Tomo Miličević ( lead guitar, keyboards ).
Following the departure of Matt Wachter ( now of Angels & Airwaves ) in 2007, Tim Kelleher became the bassist for the समूह, performing live only with both Jared and Miličević रिकॉर्डिंग bass for स्टुडियो recordings, जबकि Braxton olita ( keyboards ) was added to the touring लाइनअप in 2009.
Previously, the group also featured guitarists Solon Bixler ( now of Great Northern ) and Kevin Drake ( now of Polaroid Kiss ).
To date, 30 Seconds to Mars have released three studio albums – 30 Seconds to Mars ( 2002 ), A Beautiful Lie ( 2005 ), This Is War ( 2009 ) and तीन extended plays – AOL सत्र Undercover ( 2007 ), To the Edge of the Earth ( 2008 ), and MTV Unplugged : 30 Seconds to Mars ( 2011 ).
30 Seconds to Mars ' music has been associated mostly with neo-prog, progressive metal and post-grunge, but they have also included भावनाएं, screamo, space rock and synthrock into their music.
They have महरूम compared to Pink Floyd ( who were an influence on उनके work ) and Tool क्युकी of उनके use of philosophical and spiritual lyrics, अवधारणा albums and their use of experimental म्यूज़िक.
A Christmas Story is a 1983 American Christmas comedy film based on the short stories and semi-fictional anecdotes of author and raconteur Jean Shepherd, based on his किताब In God We Trust, All Others Pay Cash, with some elements derived from Wanda Hickey 's Night of Golden Memories.
It was directed by Bob Clark.
The फिल्मी has since become a holiday क्लासिक and is shown numerous times on television during the Christmas season on the network TBS, often in a 24-hour marathon.
In 2012, the film was selected for preservation in the National Film रजिस्ट्री by the Library of Congress for being `` culturally, historically, or aesthetically significant ''.

नई York City Cruise Liner Terminal in Hell 's Kitchen at 52nd Street.
The New York Passenger Ship Terminal ( also known as the Luxury Liner पंक्ति or Manhattan Cruise Terminal or New York Cruise टर्मिनल ) is a terminal for ocean-going passenger ships on Manhattan 's वेस्ट side.
The terminal consists of North River Piers 88, 90, 92 and 94 on the Hudson River between West 46th and West 54th Street.
( As a general नियम, pier numbers in Manhattan can be determined by adding 40 to the corresponding cross-street. )
Ships now dock at पियर 88, 90 and 92.
Pier 94 on the उत्तर पक्ष is now used for exhibition स्पेस.
Pier 86, once used by United States Lines, is now home to the USS Intrepid.
In 2003, the टर्मिनल handled 900,000 passengers.
The city is forecasting that 1.5 million will उपयोग the टर्मिनल by 2017.
The piers are long and अलावा.
They यहूद first completed in 1935 to replace the Chelsea Piers as the city 's luxury liner terminal.
The new terminal was built to handle bigger ships that had outgrown the Chelsea Piers.
The piers were renovated in 1970 and are currently undergoing another $ 150 million renovation.
The renovated plans call for it to handle three large ships at a time.
In doing renovations, the city is also considering decommissioning Pier 92.
Logo of the New York Cruise Terminal.For
decades the terminal was the only ocean-going passenger terminal in New York हार्बर.
With an upsurge in cruise ship traffic and the टर्मिनल 's ability to handle comfortably only three large जहाजों at a time, two new terminals have खोली in the harbor — the Cape Liberty Cruise Port opened in 2004 in Bayonne, New Jersey ( used by Royal Caribbean Cruise Line, Celebrity Cruises and Azamara Cruises ), and the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal ( used by the Queen Mary 2 and अन्य ships of the Carnival Corporation cruise brands ) opened in 2006 in Brooklyn, New York.
The West Side Highway takes a small jog east from the piers to below West 42nd Street क्युकी when the terminal was built land had to be taken away from Manhattan to allow for longer piers.
The US Army Corps of Engineers, who control the waterfront आयाम, would not extend the pierhead लकीर farther into the river, so the city extended the pier by cutting away at the land.
The city earlier did this for the Chelsea Piers ; however in चेल्सी only landfill was taken away.
At the Passenger Terminal actual Manhattan schist was taken away.
From downstream in the river
Many major passenger ships have docked there, including the RMS Queen Mary 2 and Freedom of the Seas, before the Brooklyn and Bayonne terminals opened.
The SS Normandie caught fire and subsequently capsized at its Pier 88 berth दौरान World युद्ध II.
the Normandie, renamed USS Lafayette, झूठ capsized in the frozen mud at Pier 88 in the winter of 1942
Norwegian Cruise लकीर 's soon to be newest ship the Norwegian Breakaway will sail year-round out of the New York Passenger Ship Terminal.
The city will खर्च $ 4 million to renovate and upgrade the cruise terminal to accommodate the ship.

Christian right is a term used in the United States to describe right-wing Christian political groups that are characterized by their strong support of socially conservative policies.
Christian conservatives principally seek to apply their understanding of the teachings of Christianity to politics और public policy by proclaiming the value of those teachings and/or by seeking to use those teachings to influence law and public policy.
In the U.S., the Christian right is an अनौपचारिक coalition formed around a core of evangelical Protestants कि draws `` support from politically conservative Catholics, Jews, Mormons, and occasionally secularists '' who share their goals.
The गति has its roots in अमरीकी politics going back as far the 1940s and has been especially influential चूंकि the 1970s.
Their influence draws, in भाग, from grassroots activism as well as their focus on social issues and ability to motivate the electorate around those issues.
The Christian right is notable today लिये advancing socially conservative positions on issues including school दुआ, stem cell शोध, homosexuality, contraception, abortion, and pornography.
Although the ईसाई right is usually associated with the U.S., the गति has been a key factor in the politics of Canada, The Netherlands, Northern आयरलैंड and Australia, among others.
Far East Movement ( stylized as Far★East Movement or abbreviated FM ) is an अमरीकी hip hop band quartet based in Los एंजिल्स.
The group formed in 2003 and consists of Kev nish ( Kevin Nishimura ), Prohgress ( James Roh ), J-Splif ( jae choung ), and DJ Virman ( Virman Coquia ).
Far East Movement 's first claim to fame was their song `` गोलाकार Round '' featured in the Hollywood movie, The Fast और the Furious : Tokyo Drift, and its subsequent soundtrack, video game and DVD.

Their single `` Like a G6 `` hit number एक on the Billboard Hot 100 Chart and on iTunes as well in late October 2010.
Far ईस्ट Movement also has the distinction of being the पहला Asian-American group to earn a # 1 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 in the United States.
LR44 is the IEC designation लिये an alkaline 1.5 volt button कोशिका, commonly used in small LED flashlights, digital thermometers, calculators, calipers, watches, clocks, toys and लेज़र pointers.
lr44 alkaline cell
The battery nomenclature is defined by the International Electrotechnical Commission ( IEC ) in its 60086-3 standard ( Primary batteries, part 3 Watch बैटरी ).
The letter L indicates the electrochemical system used ; a zinc negative electrode, manganese dioxide depolarizer and positive electrode, and an क्षारीय electrolyte.
R44 indicates a round cell 11.4±0.2 mm diameter और 5.2±0.2 mm height as पारिभाषित by the आईईसी standard 60086.
Manufacturers have their अपना part numbers for IEC type LR44 batteries including:
LR44, LR44G, LR44GD, LR44H
LR1154, L1154, L1154C, L1154F, L1154G, L1154H
6135-99-792-8475 ( NSN )
1166A
AG13, A613, AG14, AG-14, G13A, G13-A
157, 303, 357
A76, GDA76, GP76A, GPA7, GPA75, GPA76, GPS76A,
1128MP, 208-904, A-76, CA18, CA19, CR44, D76A, KA, KA76, MS76H, PX76A, PX675A, RPX675, RW82, sb-f9, v13ga
4.5-volt, D, C, aa, AAA, AAAA, A23, 9-volt, CR2032 and LR44 batteries
Other प्रकार of batteries are or were made in the R44 size.
Formerly, mercury batteries were made as button cells ( types MR44 and NR44 ).
Zinc-air batteries type PR44 require एयर to work.
Silver-oxide batteries type SR44 may provide extra capacity compared to LR44 types but have slightly different voltage characteristics.
Performance of a यंत्र meant to use a silver-oxide battery may be degraded साथ substitution of LR44 प्रकार.
Manufacturer 's numbers for silver ऑक्साइड r44 size cells include:
SR44/SR44W/SR44SW
6135-99-651-3240 ( NSN )
SR1154
