Exxon Mobil Corporation, or ExxonMobil, is an American multinational आयल and gas corporation headquartered in Irving, Texas, United राज्य.
It is a direct descendant of John D. Rockefeller 's Standard Oil company, और was formed on November 30, 1999, by the merger of exxon and Mobil.
It is संबद्ध with Imperial Oil जिससे operates in Canada.
ExxonMobil is the संसार 's largest company by revenue and in 2013, became the largest publicly traded company by market capitalization in the world.
The company is ranked # 5 globally in Forbes Global 2000 list in 2013.
Exxon mobil 's reserves were 72 billion oil-equivalent barrels at the end of 2007 and, at then ( 2007 ) rates of production, are expected to last over 14 years.
साथ 37 oil refineries in 21 countries constituting a combined daily refining क्षमता of, Exxon Mobil is the largest refiner in the world, a title that was also associated with Standard Oil since its incorporation in 1870.
ExxonMobil is the largest of the world 's supermajors with daily उत्पादन of 3.921 million BOE ( barrels of oil equivalent ).
In 2008, इस थी approximately 3 % of संसार उत्पादन, which is कम than several of the largest state-owned petroleum companies.
When ranked by oil and gas reserves it is 14th in the world with less than 1 % of the total.
A 2012 article in The रोज़ Telegraph says that ExxonMobil has `` grown into one of the planet’s most hated corporations, able to determine American foreign policy and the fate of entire nations ''.
In शर्तें of its environmental record, ExxonMobil increasingly drills in terrains leased to उन्हें by dictatorships, such as those in Chad and Equatorial Guinea.
Lee Raymond, the corporation’s chief executive until 2005, was `` notoriously sceptical about climate change and disliked government interference at any level ''.
The company was widely criticized लिये इसके slow जवाब to cleaning its 1989 Valdez oil spill in Alaska.
This article is about the Globe Theatre of Shakespeare.
For the modern पुनर्निर्माण in London, see शेक्सपियर 's Globe.
For other उपयोग, see Globe Theatre ( disambiguation ).
The Globe Theatre was a theatre in London associated with William Shakespeare.
it was built in 1599 by Shakespeare 's playing company, the Lord Chamberlain 's Men, on land owned by Thomas Brend and inherited by his son, Nicholas Brend and grandson Sir Matthew Brend, and was destroyed by fire on 29 June 1613.
A second ग्लोब Theatre was built on the same site by June 1614 and closed in 1642.
A modern पुनर्निर्माण of the Globe, named `` Shakespeare 's ग्लोब ``, opened in 1997 लगभग from the site of the original theatre.
It 's a Wonderful Life is a 1946 American Christmas drama film produced and directed by Frank Capra, आधारित on the short story `` The महानतम तोहफा ``, which Philip Van doren Stern wrote in 1939 and privately published in 1945.
The film is considered one of the most loved films in American cinema and has become traditional viewing during the Christmas season, alongside popular classics ऐसे as Charles Dickens ' A Christmas Carol.
The film stars James Stewart as George Bailey, a man who has given up उसके dreams in order to help others और whose imminent suicide on Christmas Eve brings about the intervention of his guardian angel, Clarence Odbody ( Henry Travers ).
Clarence shows George all the lives he has touched and how different life in his community of Bedford Falls would be had he never been born.
Despite initially performing poorly at the box office due to high production costs and stiff competition at the time of its release, the film has come to be regarded as a classic and is a staple of Christmas television around the world.
Theatrically, the film 's break-even point was actually $ 6.3 million, approximately twice the production cost, a figure it never came close to achieving in its initial release.
An appraisal in 2006 reported : `` Although it was नहीं the complete box office failure that today everyone believes... it was initially a major disappointment और confirmed, at least to the studios, that Capra was no longer सक्षम of turning out the populist features that made his films the must-see, money-making events they once were. ''
The film was मनोनीत for पाँच Oscars और has been recognized by the अमरीकी Film Institute as one of the 100 best American films ever made, placing number 11 on its initial 1998 greatest movie list, and would also place number one on its list of the most inspirational American films of all time.
आंकड़ा Warehouse Overview
In computing, a data warehouse or enterprise data warehouse ( DW, DWH, or EDW ) is a database used for reporting और data analysis.
It is a central repository of आंकड़ा which is created by integrating data from one or more disparate sources.
Data warehouses store current as well as historical data and are used for creating trending reports for senior management रिपोर्टिंग such as annual and quarterly comparisons.
The data stored in the warehouse are uploaded from the operational systems ( such as marketing, sales etc., shown in the figure to the right ).
The data may pass through an operational data store for additional operations before they are used in the DW for reporting.
The typical ETL -based data गोदाम uses staging, data integration, and access layers to house its कुंजी functions.
The staging परत or staging database stores कच्चा data extracted इससे each of the disparate source data systems.
The integration layer integrates the disparate data sets by transforming the data from the staging layer प्रायः storing this transformed data in an operational data store ( ods ) database.
The integrated data are then moved to yet another database, often called the data warehouse database, where the data is arranged into hierarchical समूह often called dimensions and into facts and कुल facts.
The combination of facts and dimensions is sometimes पुकारा a star schema.
The access layer helps users retrieve data.
A data warehouse constructed from an integrated आंकड़ा source systems करता not require ETL, staging databases, or operational data store databases.
The integrated data source प्रणालियों may be considered to be a part of a distributed operational data store layer.
Data संघ methods or data virtualization methods may be प्रयुक्त to access the distributed integrated सोर्स आंकड़ा systems to consolidate and aggregate data directly into the data warehouse database tables.
Unlike the ETL-based data warehouse, the integrated source data systems and the data warehouse are all integrated since there is no transformation of dimensional or reference data.
This एकीकृत data गोदाम architecture supports the drill down from the aggregate data of the data warehouse to the transactional data of the integrated source आंकड़ा प्रणालियों.
Data warehouses can be subdivided into data marts.
Data marts store subsets of data from a warehouse.
This definition of the data warehouse focuses on data storage.
The main source of the data is cleaned, रूपांतरित, cataloged and made available for उपयोग by managers and other business professionals for data mining, online analytical processing, market research and decision support ( Marakas & O'Brien 2009 ).
However, the means to retrieve and analyze data, to extract, transform and load data, and to manage the data dictionary are भी considered essential components of a data warehousing system.
Many references to data warehousing use this broader कॉन्टेक्स्ट.
Thus, an expanded definition for data warehousing includes business intelligence tools, टूल्स to extract, transform and load data into the repository, and tools to manage and retrieve metadata.
Portland stone quarry on the Isle of Portland, England
An abandoned construction कुल quarry near एडिलेड, South Australia
A quarry is a type of open-pit mine from which चट्टान or minerals are extracted.
Quarries are generally used for extracting building सामग्री, such as dimension stone, construction aggregate, riprap, sand, and gravel.
वे are often collocated with concrete and asphalt plants due to the requirement for large amounts of aggregate in those materials.
Open mines that produce minerals are typically referred to as open pit mines.
The word पाषाण can शामिल underground quarrying for stone, such as Bath stone.
Mormons ( ) are a religious and cultural समूह related to Mormonism, the principal शाखा of the Latter Day Saint movement of Restorationist Christianity, which began with the visions of Joseph Smith in upstate New York during the 1820s.
After Smith 's death in 1844 the Mormons followed Brigham Young to what होता become the Utah Territory.
Today Mormons are understood to be members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints ( LDS Church ).
Some mormons are also either independent or non-practicing.
The center of Mormon cultural influence is in Utah, and North America has more Mormons than any other continent, हालांकि the majority of Mormons सजीव outside the United States.
Mormons have developed a strong sense of communality that stems from their doctrine and history.
दौरान the 19th century Mormon converts tended to gather to a central geographic location, और between 1852 and 1890 a minority of mormons खुलकर practiced plural marriage, a रूप of religious polygamy.
Mormons dedicate large amounts of time and resources to serving in their church, and many young mormons choose to serve a full-time proselytizing mission.
Mormons have a health code that eschews alcoholic beverages, tobacco, कॉफी, चाय, and other addictive substances.
They tend to be very family-oriented, and have दमदार connections across generations and with extended family, reflective of their belief कि families can be sealed together beyond मौत and throughout eternity.
Mormons also have a strict law of शुद्धता, requiring abstention from sexual relations outside of marriage and सख्त fidelity भीतर marriage.
Mormons self-identify as ईसाई, though some of their beliefs differ इससे mainstream Christianity.
Mormons believe in the Bible, as well as other books of scripture, such as the Book of Mormon.
They have a unique view of cosmology, and believe कि all people are spirit-children of God.
Mormons believe that returning to God requires following the example of Jesus Christ, and accepting his atonement through ordinances such as baptism.
They believe that Christ 's church was restored through Joseph Smith, and is guided by जीना prophets and रसूलों.
Central to Mormon faith is the belief that God speaks to his children and answers their prayers.
In financial हिसाब, assets are economic resources.
Anything tangible or intangible that is capable of being owned or controlled to produce मान and that is held to have positive economic value is considered an एसेट.
बस stated, assets represent value of स्वामित्व that can be converted into cash ( although cash itself is also considered an asset ).
The balance sheet of a firm records the monetaryJ.
G. Siegel, N. Dauber & J. K. Shim, `` The Vest Pocket CPA '', Wiley, 2005.There are different methods of assessing the monetary value of the एसेट recorded on the Balance Sheet.
In some cases, the Historical Cost is used ; such that the value of the asset when it was खरीदा in the past is used as the monetary value.
In अन्य instances, the present fair market value of the asset is प्रयुक्त to determine the value shown on the balance चादर.
value of the assets owned by the firm.
It is money and other valuables belonging to an व्यक्तिगत or business.
Two major asset classes हैं ठोस एसेट and intangible assets.
Tangible assets contain various subclasses, including current assets and fixed assets.J.
Downes, J.E. Goodman, `` Dictionary of Finance & Investment Terms '', Baron 's Financial मार्गदर्शिका, 2003 Current assets शामिल inventory, while fixed assets include such items as buildings and equipment.J. Downes, J.E. Goodman, `` Dictionary of Finance & Investment Terms '', सामन्त 's Financial Guides, 2003 ; and J. G. Siegel, N. Dauber & J. K. Shim, `` The Vest Pocket CPA '', Wiley, 2005.
Intangible assets are nonphysical resources and rights that have a मान to the firm because they give the firm some kind of advantage in the market place.
Examples of intangible assets are goodwill, copyrights, trademarks, patents and computer programs, and financial assets, including such items as accounts receivable, bonds and stocks.
A neuron ( or ; also known as a neurone or तंत्रिका cell ) is an electrically excitable cell that processes and transmits information through electrical and chemical signals.
A chemical सिग्नल occurs via a synapse, a specialized connection with other कोशिकाएं.
न्यूरॉन्स connect to each other to form neural networks.
Neurons are the core components of the nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord, and peripheral ganglia.
A number of specialized types of neurons exist : संवेदी neurons respond to touch, sound, लाइट and numerous अन्य stimuli affecting cells of the sensory organs that then भेजें signals to the spinal cord and brain.
Motor neurons receive signals from the brain and spinal cord, cause muscle contractions, and affect glands.
Interneurons connect neurons to other neurons within the same region of the brain or spinal cord.
A typical neuron possesses a कोशिका body ( often called the soma ), dendrites, and an axon.
Dendrites are thin structures that arise from the cell body, often extending लिये hundreds of micrometres and branching multiple times, giving rise to a जटिल `` dendritic पेड़ ''.
An axon is a special cellular extension that arises from the cell body at a site called the axon hillock and ट्रेवल्स for a distance, as far as 1 meter in humans or even more in other species.
The cell body of a neuron frequently gives वृद्धि to multiple dendrites, but never to more than एक axon, although the axon may branch hundreds of times before it terminates.
At the majority of synapses, signals are sent from the axon of एक neuron to a dendrite of another.
There हैं, however, many exceptions to these rules : neurons that lack dendrites, neurons that have no axon, synapses कि connect an axon to another axon or a dendrite to another dendrite, etc.
All neurons हैं electrically excitable, maintaining voltage gradients across their membranes by means of metabolically चलित ion pumps, which combine with ion channels अंतःस्थापित in the membrane to generate intracellular-versus-extracellular concentration differences of ions ऐसे as sodium, potassium, chloride, and calcium.
परिवर्तन in the cross-membrane voltage can alter the function of voltage-dependent आयन channels.
If the voltage परिवर्तन by a large enough amount, an all-or-none electrochemical pulse called an कार्रवाई potential is generated, which travels rapidly along the cell 's axon, and activates synaptic connections with other cells when it arrives.
Neurons do not undergo cell division.
In most cases, neurons are generated by special types of stem cells.
astrocytes, a type of glial cell, have also been observed to turn into neurons by virtue of the stem cell characteristic pluripotency.
In humans, neurogenesis largely ceases during adulthood—but in two brain areas, the hippocampus and olfactory बल्ब, there is strong evidence for generation of substantial numbers of new neurons.
Super Bowl XLIII was an अमरीकी फ़ुटबॉल game between the American Football Conference ( AFC ) champion Pittsburgh Steelers and the National Football Conference ( NFC ) champion Arizona Cardinals to decide the National फ़ुटबॉल League ( NFL ) champion for the 2008 season.
The Steelers defeated the Cardinals by the score of 27–23.
The खेल was played on February 1, 2009, at Raymond James Stadium in tampa, Florida.
With this win, the Steelers became the first team to win six Super Bowls.
Pittsburgh, who finished the regular season with a 12–4 रिकार्ड, also जीती their second Super Bowl in four years after winning Super Bowl XL at the end of the 2005 ऋतु.
The Cardinals entered the game seeking उनके first NFL title since 1947, the longest championship drought in the league.
The club became an unexpected winner during the regular season, compiling a 9–7 record, and the playoffs with the aid of सिर coach केन Whisenhunt, who was the Steelers ' offensive coordinator in Super Bowl XL, and the re-emergence of quarterback Kurt Warner, who was the Super कटोरी MVP in Super Bowl XXXIV with his former team, St. लुई Rams.
Pittsburgh jumped to a 17–7 halftime lead, aided by linebacker जेम्स Harrison 's Super Bowl record 100-yard interception return for a touchdown.
Trailing 20–7 at the start of the fourth quarter, Arizona scored 16 unanswered points, including wide receiver Larry Fitzgerald 's 64-yard touchdown रिसेप्शन, to लो the lead with 2:37 remaining in the game.
But the Steelers marched 78 yards to score on wide receiver Santonio Holmes ' 6-yard game-winning touchdown catch with 35 seconds left.
Holmes, जो caught nine passes for 131 गज and a touchdown, including four receptions for 73 yards on that फाइनल game-winning drive, was named Super Bowl MVP.
He became the sixth wide receiver to win the award, और भी was the third Pittsburgh receiver to win the award, following Lynn Swann and Hines Ward.
Despite the global वित्तीय crisis and limited amount of ancillary festivities that are normally held before the game, the NBC टेलीविज़न संजाल ब्रॉडकास्ट attracted an average U.S. audience of 98.7 million viewers, making it the most watched Super Bowl in इतिहास to that पाइंट.
A diagram of the electromagnetic spectrum, showing various properties across the range of frequencies and wavelengths
The electromagnetic spectrum is the range of all possible frequencies of electromagnetic radiation.
The `` electromagnetic spectrum '' of an object has a different अर्थ, and is instead the characteristic distribution of electromagnetic radiation emitted or absorbed by that particular object.
the इलेक्ट्रोमैग्नेटिक spectrum extends from below the low frequencies used for modern रेडियो communication to gamma विकिरण at the short- wavelength ( high-frequency ) end, thereby covering wavelengths from thousands of kilometers down to a भिन्न of the size of an atom.
The limit for long wavelengths is the size of the universe itself, while it is thought that the short wavelength limit is in the vicinity of the Planck length, although in principle the spectrum is infinite and continuous.
Most parts of the electromagnetic वर्णक्रम are used in science for spectroscopic and other probing interactions, as ways to study and characterize matter.
In addition, radiation from various parts of the spectrum has found many other उपयोग for communications और निर्माण ( देखिए electromagnetic radiation for अधिक applications ).
Legend
Marchantia, a liverwort
Bryophyte is a traditional name प्रयुक्त to refer to all embryophytes ( land plants ) that do not have true vascular tissue and are therefore called ' non-vascular plants '.
Some bryophytes do have specialized tissues for the transport of water ; however since these do नहीं contain lignin, they हैं not considered to be true vascular tissue.
Currently bryophytes are thought not to be a natural or monophyletic group ; however the name is convenient and remains in use as a collective पद for mosses, hornworts, and liverworts.
Bryophytes उपज enclosed reproductive structures ( gametangia and sporangia ), but they produce neither flowers nor seeds, reproducing via spores.
The term bryophyte comes from Greek βρύον, bryon, `` tree-moss, oyster-green '' + φυτόν - phyton `` plant ''.
A bank is a financial institution and a financial intermediary that स्वीकृत deposits and channels those जमा into lending activities, either directly by loaning or indirectly through पूंजी markets.
a bank is the connection between customers that have capital deficits and customers with capital surpluses.
due to their influence within a financial system and an economy, banks हैं generally highly regulated in most countries.
Most banks operate under a system known as fractional reserve बैंकिंग where they hold only a small reserve of the funds deposited and lend out the rest लिये profit.
वे are generally subject to minimum पूंजी requirements which are based on an international set of capital मानकों, known as the Basel Accords.
The oldest bank स्टिल in existence is मोंटे dei Paschi di Siena, headquartered in Siena, Italy, which has been operating continuously since 1472.
It is followed by Berenberg Bank of Hamburg ( 1590 ) और Sveriges riksbank of Sweden ( 1668 ).
बैंकिंग in its modern sense evolved in rich शहरों of Renaissance Italy, such as Florence, Venice और Genoa.
In the history of banking, a number of banking dynasties —among them notably Medici, Fugger, Welser, Berenberg, Baring and Rothschild —have played a central role over many centuries.
The Xbox is a video game console manufactured by Microsoft.
It was released on November 15, 2001 in North America, February 22, 2002 in Japan, and कूच 14, 2002 in Australia and Europe.
It was Microsoft 's first foray into the gaming console market.
As part of the sixth-generation of gaming, the Xbox competed with Sony 's PlayStation 2, Sega 's Dreamcast ( which stopped American sales before the Xbox went on sale ), and Nintendo 's gamecube.
The Xbox was the first console offered by an American company after the Atari जैगुआर stopped बिक्री in 1996.
the integrated एक्सबॉक्स Live service शुभारम्भ in November 2002 allowed players to खेल games online with a broadband connection.
It first competed with Dreamcast 's online service but later primarily competed with PlayStation 2 's online service.
Although these two are free while Xbox सजीव required a subscription, as well as broadband-only connection which थी not completely adopted yet, Xbox Live थी a success due to better servers, features such as a दोस्त सूची, and milestone शीर्षक like Halo 2 released in November 2004, which is the best-selling Xbox video game and was by far the most popular online game for years.
एक्सबॉक्स 's successor, the Xbox 360, was launched in नवम्बर 2005.
The Xbox was discontinued in late 2005 in जापानी where sales were poor.
It was discontinued in late 2006 in Europe and early 2007 in North America.
the last Xbox game in Europe was Tony हॉक 's Project 8 released in November 2006, and the last game in North अमेरिका थी Madden एनएफएल 09 released in August 2008.
Support for out-of-warranty Xbox consoles was discontinued on March 2, 2009, stating that any in-warranty repair अभी needed will not be undertaken.
Xbox access to एक्सबॉक्स Live was stopped on April 15, 2010.
The Gospel According to जॉन ( Greek τὸ κατὰ Ἰωάννην εὐαγγέλιον ), commonly referred to as the इन्जील of John or simply John and often referred to in New Testament scholarship as the Fourth Gospel, is an account of the public मंत्रालय of Jesus.
It begins with the witness and affirmation by John the Baptist and concludes with the मौत, burial, resurrection, and post-resurrection appearances of Jesus.
This account is fourth of the canonical gospels, after the synoptics Matthew, चिह्नित and Luke.
राज्य that the book derives from the testimony of the ' disciple whom Jesus loved. '
Along with Peter, the unnamed disciple is विशेषकर close to Jesus, and early-church tradition identified him as John the Apostle, one of Jesus ' Twelve Apostles.
The gospel is closely related in style and content to the three surviving Epistles of John such that टीकाकारों treat the four books together, yet, according to most modern scholars, John थी not the author of any of these books.
Recent Christian Scripture scholarship more and more has placed John within a first-century Jewish context.
Raymond E. भूरा किया pioneering work to trace the development of the tradition from which the gospel arose.
The discourses seem to be concerned with the actual मुद्दे of the church-and-synagogue debate at the time जब the Gospel was written.
It is notable that, in the gospel, the community still appears to define itself primarily against Judaism, rather than as part of a wider Christian church.
Though Christianity started as a movement within Judaism, gradually Christians and Jews became bitterly opposed.
जॉन presents a `` higher '' Christology than the synoptics, meaning that it describes Jesus as the अवतार of the divine Logos through whom all बाते यहूद made, as the object of veneration, and more explicitly as God incarnate.
Only in John does Jesus talk at length about himself and his divine भूमिका, often shared with the शिष्यों only.
Against the synoptics, John focuses largely on different miracles ( including resurrecting Lazarus ), दिए as signs meant to engender faith.
Synoptic elements ऐसे as parables and exorcisms are not found in जॉन.
It presents a realized eschatology in which salvation is already present for the believer.
The Plagues of Egypt ( ), also called the Ten Plagues ( ) or the Biblical plagues, were ten calamities that, according to the biblical Book of Exodus, Israel 's God, Yahweh, inflicted upon मिश्र to persuade Pharaoh to release the ill-treated israelites from slavery.
Pharaoh capitulated बाद the tenth प्लेग, triggering the Exodus of the Jewish people.
The plagues were designed to कंट्रास्ट the power of Yahweh with the impotence of Egypt 's विभिन्न gods.
Some commentators have associated several of the plagues with judgment on specific gods associated साथ the Nile, fertility और natural phenomena.
the plagues of Egypt are also mentioned in the Quran ( 7,133–136 ).
According to the Book of Exodus, God proclaims that all the gods of Egypt will be judged through the tenth and final plague:
John Martin 's painting of the plague of hail and आग ( 1823 ).
A role-playing game ( RPG and sometimes roleplaying game ) is a game in जिससे खिलाड़ी assume the roles of characters in a fictional setting.
Players take responsibility for acting out ये भूमिकाएँ within a narrative, either through शाब्दिक acting or through a process of structured decision-making or character विकास.
Actions taken within many games succeed or fail according to a formal प्रणाली of rules and guidelines.
वहीँ are several forms of RPG.
The original form, sometimes called the tabletop RPG, is conducted through discussion, whereas in live action role-playing games ( LARP ) players physically perform their characters ' actions.
In both of these forms, an arranger called a game master ( GM ) usually decides on the rules and setting to be used and acts as referee, while each of the other players plays the role of a single character.
Several varieties of आरपीजी also मौजूद in electronic मीडिया, such as multi-player text-based MUDs and their graphics-based successors, massively multiplayer online role-playing games ( mmorpgs ).
Role-playing games also include single-player offline role-playing video games in which players control a character or team who undertake quests, and may include capabilities that advance using statistical mechanics.
These खेल often share settings and rules साथ tabletop RPGs, but emphasize character advancement more than collaborative storytelling.
Despite this variety of forms, some game forms ऐसे as trading card खेल and wargames that are related to role-playing games may not be included.
Role-playing कार्यकलाप may sometimes be present in such games, लकिन it is not the primary focus.
The term is also sometimes used to describe लिए सिमुलेशन games and exercises used in teaching, training, and अकादमिक research.
The American Civil War ( ACW ), also ज्ञात as the War between the States or simply the Civil War ( see naming ), was a civil war fought from 1861 to 1865 between the United States ( the `` Union '' or the `` North '' ) and several Southern slave states that declared their secession and formed the Confederate राज्य of America ( the `` confederacy '' or the `` South '' ).
The war had its origin in the issue of गुलामी, especially the extension of गुलामी into the western territories.
Foreign शक्तियां did not intervene.
बाद four years of bloody combat that left over 600,000 soldiers dead and destroyed much of the South 's infrastructure, the Confederacy collapsed, slavery was abolished, and the difficult Reconstruction process of restoring national एकता and guaranteeing rights to the freed slaves began.
In the 1860 presidential election, republicans, led by Abraham Lincoln, opposed expanding slavery into United States ' territories.
Lincoln won, but before his inauguration on March 4, 1861, seven cotton-based slave states formed the Confederacy.
Outgoing Democratic अध्यक्ष James Buchanan और the incoming Republicans rejected secession as illegal.
Lincoln 's inaugural address declared his administration would नहीं initiate civil war.
आठ remaining slave states continued to reject calls लिये secession.
Confederate forces seized numerous federal forts within territory claimed by the Confederacy.
A Peace Conference failed to find a compromise, and both sides prepared for युद्ध.
The Confederates assumed that यूरोपीय countries were so dependent on `` King Cotton `` कि they would intervene ; none did and none recognized the new Confederate States of अमेरिका.
Hostilities began on April 12, 1861, when Confederate शक्तियां fired upon Fort sumter, a key fort held by Union troops in South कैरोलिना.
Lincoln called लिये each state to provide troops to retake the fort ; consequently, four more slave राज्य joined the Confederacy, bringing their total to ग्यारह.
The Union soon controlled the border states and स्थापित a naval blockade that crippled the southern economy.
The Eastern Theater was inconclusive in 1861–62.
The autumn 1862 Confederate campaign into Maryland ( a Union state ) ended with Confederate retreat at the Battle of Antietam, dissuading British intervention.
lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation, which made ending slavery a युद्ध goal.
To the west, by summer 1862 the Union destroyed the Confederate river navy, then much of their western armies, and the Union at Vicksburg split the Confederacy in two at the Mississippi नदी.
In 1863, Robert E. Lee 's Confederate incursion उत्तर ended at the Battle of Gettysburg.
Western successes led to Ulysses S. Grant command of all Union armies in 1864.
in the Western Theater, William T. शरमन drove east to capture Atlanta and marched to the sea, destroying Confederate infrastructure along the way.
The Union marshaled the संसाधन and manpower to attack the Confederacy from all directions, और could afford to fight battles of attrition through the Overland Campaign towards Richmond, the Confederate पूंजी.
The defending Confederate army failed, leading to Lee 's surrender to Grant at Appomattox Court हाउस on April 9, 1865.
the American Civil War was one of the earliest true औद्योगिक युद्धों.
Railroads, the telegraph, steamships, and mass-produced weapons were employed extensively.
The mobilization of civilian factories, mines, shipyards, banks, transportation and food supplies all foreshadowed संसार War I.
it remains the deadliest war in American history, resulting in the deaths of an estimated 750,000 soldiers and an undetermined number of civilian casualties.
Historian John Huddleston estimates the death toll at ten percent of all Northern males 20–45 years बूढ़ा, and 30 percent of all Southern white males aged 18–40.
The definition of the world 's busiest airport has महरूम specified by the एयरपोर्ट Council International in Geneva, Switzerland.
The ACI defines and measures the following three types of airport traffic:
Passenger traffic : total passengers emplaned and deplaned, passengers in transit counted एकबार
Cargo traffic : loaded और unloaded freight and mail in metric tonnes
Traffic movements : landings and take-offs of aircraft
World War I ( WWI ) was a global war centred in Europe that began on 28 July 1914 and lasted जबतक 11 November 1918.
It was predominantly called the World War or the Great युद्ध from its occurrence until the start of World War ii in 1939, and the First World War or World War I thereafter.
It involved all the world 's great powers, which were assembled in two opposing alliances : the Allies ( आधारित on the Triple Entente of the United Kingdom, France and Russia ) and the Central Powers ( originally the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary और Italy ; लकिन, as Austria–Hungary had लिया the अप्रिय against the अनुबंध, Italy did not enter into the war ).
These alliances were both reorganised and expanded as more nations entered the war : Italy, Japan and the United States joined the Allies, and the Ottoman Empire and Bulgaria the Central Powers.
Ultimately, more than 70 million military personnel, including 60 million europeans, were mobilised in one of the largest wars in history.
More than 9 million combatants were killed, largely because of technological advancements that led to enormous increases in the lethality of weapons without corresponding improvements in protection or mobility.
It was the fifth- deadliest conflict in world history, subsequently paving the way for various political changes, such as revolutions in many of the nations involved.
One of the long-term causes of the युद्ध was the resurgence of imperialism in the foreign policies of the great शक्तियां of Europe.
More immediately, the assassination of Archduke Franz फर्डिनेंड of Austria, the heir to the throne of Austria-Hungary, on 28 June 1914 by Yugoslav nationalist Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo triggered a diplomatic crisis when Austria-Hungary subsequently delivered an ultimatum to the किंगडम of Serbia.
Several alliances formed over the previous decades were invoked.
भीतर सप्ताह, the प्रमुख powers were at war and, via their colonies, the conflict soon स्प्रेड around the world.
On 28 जुलाई, the Austro-Hungarians fired the first shots of the war as preparation लिये the invasion of Serbia.
While the Russians mobilised, the Germans invaded neutral Belgium and Luxembourg on the way to France, providing a casus belli for Britain 's declaration of war against Germany.
After the German march on Paris was brought to a halt—the so-called Miracle of the Marne —the Western Front settled into a स्थिर battle of attrition with a trench लकीर that changed little until 1917.
On the Eastern सामने, the Russian army was successful against the Austro-Hungarians, but was stopped in its invasion of East Prussia by the Germans.
In November the उस्मानी Empire joined the war, opening up fronts in the Caucasus, Mesopotamia and the Sinai.
Italy and Bulgaria went to war in 1915 and Romania in 1916.
In Russia, the tsar 's सरकारी collapsed in March 1917 and a subsequent revolution in November brought the Russians to terms with the Central Powers.
After a 1918 German offensive along the western front, the Allies drove back the Germans in a series of successful offensives and American forces began entering the trenches.
Germany, जिससे had its own trouble with revolutionaries, agreed to an armistice on 11 November 1918.
The war ended in victory for the Allies.
Events on the home fronts were as tumultuous as on the battle fronts, as the participants tried to mobilize their manpower and economic resources to fight a total war.
By the end of the war, four major imperial powers—the German, Russian, Austro-Hungarian and उस्मानी empires—ceased to exist.
The successor states of the former two lost a great राशि of territory, while the latter two were dismantled entirely.
The map of central Europe was redrawn into several smaller states.
The League of Nations was formed in the hope of preventing another such conflict.
The European nationalism spawned by the युद्ध and the breakup of empires, the repercussions of Germany 's defeat and problems with the Treaty of Versailles are agreed to be factors contributing to World युद्ध ii.
The Deepwater Horizon आयल spill ( also referred to as the BP oil spill, the BP oil disaster, the Gulf of Mexico oil spill, and the Macondo blowout ) was an oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico on the BP -operated Macondo Prospect, considered the largest accidental marine आयल spill in the history of the petroleum उद्योग, estimated to be between 8 % and 31 % larger in volume than the earlier Ixtoc i oil spill.
Following the explosion and डूब of the Deepwater Horizon oil rig, which claimed 11 lives, a sea-floor oil gusher flowed unabated for 87 days, जबतक it was capped on 15 July 2010.
the total discharge is estimated at.
A massive response ensued to protect beaches, wetlands and estuaries from the spreading oil utilizing skimmer ships, floating booms, controlled burns and of Corexit oil dispersant.
After several विफल प्रयत्न to contain the प्रवाह, the well was declared sealed on 19 September 2010.
Some reports indicate the well साईट continues to leak.
Due to the months-long spill, along with प्रतिकूल effects from the response and cleanup activities, extensive damage to marine and wildlife habitats, फ़िशिंग and tourism industries, and human health problems have जारी through 2013.Three years after the spill, tar balls could still be found on the Mississippi coast.
Numerous investigations explored the causes of the explosion and record-setting spill.
Notably, the U.S. government 's September 2011 report pointed to defective cement on the well, faulting mostly BP, but also well operator Transocean and contractor Halliburton.
Earlier in 2011, a White House commission likewise blamed BP and its partners for a series of cost-cutting decisions and an insufficient safety system, but also concluded that the spill resulted from `` systemic '' root causes और `` absent significant reform in both industry practices and government policies, might खूब recur ''.
In November 2012, BP and the United States Department of Justice settled federal criminal charges with BP pleading guilty to 11 counts of manslaughter, two misdemeanors, and a felony count of lying to Congress.
BP also agreed to four years of government monitoring of its सुरक्षा practices and ethics, और the Environmental Protection Agency announced that BP would be temporarily banned from new अनुबंध with the US government.
BP और the Department of Justice agreed to a record-setting $ 4.525 billion in जुर्माना and other payments but further legal proceedings not expected to conclude until 2014 are जारी to determine payouts and fines under the Clean Water अधिनियम and the Natural Resources Damage Assessment.
As of February 2013, criminal and civil settlements and payments to a trust fund had cost the company $ 42.2 billion.
`` Where the Streets Have No नाम '' is a song by rock band U2.
It is the opening track from their 1987 album The Joshua Tree and was released as the album 's third single in August 1987.
The song 's hook is a repeating guitar arpeggio using a विलंब effect, played during the song 's introduction and again at the end.
Lead vocalist Bono wrote the lyrics in response to the notion that it is possible to identify a person 's religion and income आधारित on the street on which they lived, particularly in Belfast.
During the band 's difficulties रिकॉर्डिंग the song, producer Brian Eno माना erasing the song 's tapes to have them start from scratch.
`` Where the Streets Have No Name '' was praised by critics and became a commercial success, peaking at क्रमांक thirteen in the US, number fourteen in कनाडा, number टेन in the Netherlands, and number four in the United Kingdom.
The song has become one of the band 's most लोकप्रिय songs and has remained a staple of their live अधिनियम since the song debuted in 1987 on The Joshua Tree दौरे.
The song was notably performed on a Los Angeles rooftop for the filming of its music video, which won a Grammy Award for Best Performance Music Video.Recently the song has महरूम used by the NFL 's Baltimore ravens as their entrance song in Super Bowl xlvii
थामस Jeffrey `` Tom '' Hanks ( born July 9, 1956 ) is an American actor, निर्माता, writer, and निदेशक.
Hanks is known for his roles in Apollo 13, Big, That Thing You Do !
, The Green Mile, You 've Got Mail, Sleepless in सिएटल, Charlie Wilson 's War, Catch Me If You Can, Forrest Gump, डाल Away, A League of Their Own, The da Vinci Code, Angels & Demons, as खूब as एनिमेटेड films like the Toy स्टोरी film series, The Polar Express, और The Simpsons Movie.
He has earned and been nominated for numerous awards during उसके career, including winning a Golden Globe for Best Actor and an Academy Award for Best Actor for his role in Philadelphia and a Golden Globe, an Academy Award, a Screen Actors Guild Award, and a People 's Choice Award for बेहतरीन Actor लिये his role in Forrest Gump, and earning the Stanley Kubrick Britannia पुरस्कार for Excellence in Film from the BAFTAs in 2004.
Hanks is also known for his collaboration with film director Steven Spielberg on Saving Private Ryan and the mini-series Band of Brothers, which शुभारम्भ Hanks भी as a successful director, producer and writer.
As of 2012, Hanks ' films have grossed over $ 4.2 billion at the United राज्य box office alone, और over $ 8.5 billion worldwide making him the highest all-time box दफ्तर star.
The Cape is an American superhero drama series.
It premiered on NBC दौरान the 2010–2011 television season as a mid-season replacement beginning with a two-hour pilot episode on Sunday, January 9, 2011 at 9 pm Eastern and Pacific Time.
An encore played on Monday, January 10, with follow-up episodes continuing on Monday evenings in the 9 pm timeslot beginning on January 17.
एनबीसी subsequently cut the कुल number of episodes to be aired from 13 to 10 as a result of low दरजा.

Halley 's Comet or Comet Halley ( or ), officially designated 1P/Halley, is the best-known of the short-period comets and is visible from Earth every 75–76 सालो.
Halley is the only short-period comet that is clearly visible to the naked eye from धरती, and thus the only naked-eye comet that might appear twice in a human आजीवन.
Other naked-eye धूमकेतुओं may be brighter and more spectacular, but will appear only once in thousands of सालो.
Halley 's returns to the inner Solar System have been observed and recorded by astronomers since at तनिक 240 BCE.
Clear records of the comet 's appearances were made by Chinese, Babylonian, and medieval European chroniclers, but were not recognized as reappearances of the same object at the time.
The धूमकेतु 's periodicity was पहला संकल्पित in 1705 by English astronomer Edmond Halley, after whom it is now नामित.
Halley 's Comet last appeared in the inner Solar प्रणाली in 1986 and will next appear in mid-2061.
During its 1986 apparition, Halley became the first comet to be observed in detail by spacecraft, providing the पहला observational data on the structure of a comet nucleus and the यांत्रिकी of coma and tail formation.
These observations supported a number of longstanding hypotheses about comet construction, particularly Fred Whipple 's `` dirty snowball '' मॉडल, जिससे correctly predicted that Halley would be composed of a mixture of volatile ices – such as water, carbon dioxide and ammonia – and dust.
The missions also provided आंकड़ा जिससे substantially reformed and reconfigured these ideas ; for instance it is now understood that Halley 's सतह is largely composed of dusty, non-volatile materials, and that only a small portion of it is icy.
The following is a list of the most populous incorporated places of the United States of America.
as defined by the United States Census Bureau, an `` incorporated place `` includes a variety of designations, including city, town, village, borough, and municipality.
a few exceptional Census Designated Places ( CDPs ) are also included in the Census Bureau 's listing of incorporated places.
Consolidated city-counties represent a distinct type of government that includes the entire population of a county, or काउंटी equivalent.
Some consolidated city-counties, however, include multiple incorporated places.
This list presents only that portion ( or `` balance '' ) of such consolidated city-counties that are not a part of another incorporated place.
Note कि this list refers only to the population of individual municipalities भीतर their defined limits, which does not include other municipalities or unincorporated suburban areas within urban agglomerations.
A different रैंकिंग is evident when considering U.S. metropolitan area populations.
The Mayflower was the ship that in 1620 transported 102 English Pilgrims, including a core group of Separatists, to New England.
Their story is one of travail and survival in a harsh New World environment.
A New Zealand forward ( in white ) takes a shot on goal against Cameroon in the 2011 FIFA U-20 संसार Cup.
Forwards, also known as strikers, are the players on a team in association football who play निकटतम to the opposing team 's goal, and are therefore principally responsible for scoring goals.
This very advanced position and its limited रक्षात्मक responsibilities mean आगे normally score more goals than other players.
इस position requires intelligence, speed, and power, both of execution and of विचार, to perform the role well.
Modern team formations usually include one to three forwards ; two is the most आम.
Coaches typically field one striker who plays in an advanced position ( the centre आगे ), and another attacking forward who plays somewhat deeper and assists in making goals as खूब as scoring ( the दूसरी striker ).
it चाहिए be noted that inside forwards develop from attacking midfield स्थितियाँ and hence are naturally midfielders.
Barcelona FC star Lionel Messi is a ठेठ Attacking Midfielder seen as a forward due to his शॉट सटीकता.
A California domestic partnership is a legal relationship available to same-sex couples, and to certain opposite-sex couples in which at least one party is at least 18 years of age.
It affords the couple `` the same rights, protections, and benefits, and... the same responsibilities, obligations, and duties under law... '' as married spouses.
Enacted in 1999, the domestic partnership registry was the first of its kind in the United States created by a legislature बगैर अदालत intervention.
Initially, domestic partnerships enjoyed very few privileges—principally just hospital-visitation rights and the right to be claimed as a next of kin of the estate of a deceased partner.
The विधानमंडल has since expanded the scope of California domestic partnerships to include all of the rights and responsibilities common to marriage.
As such, California domestic partnerships are functionally equivalent to civil संघ offered in several other states.
Although the program enjoys broad support in California, it has been the source of some controversy.
Groups opposed to the recognition of same-sex families have challenged the expansion of domestic partnerships in court.
Conversely, advocates of same-sex marriage contend that anything less than full marriage rights विस्तारित to same-sex partners is analogous to the `` separate but equal '' racial laws of the जिम Crow era.
Mark A. Jackson ( born April 1, 1965 ) is an American basketball coach, and पूर्व player who is the वर्तमान head coach of the Golden राज्य Warriors of the NBA.
A point गार्ड from St. John 's University, he played for the New York Knicks, Indiana Pacers, Los एंजिल्स Clippers, Denver Nuggets, Toronto Raptors, Utah Jazz and Houston rockets in the NBA in a career spanning from 1987 to 2004.
Jackson has also worked as a commentator for ESPN and ABC alongside his former coach Jeff Van Gundy and play-by-play man Mike Breen.
he थी previously an NBA analyst for The YES Network 's New Jersey Nets games.
South Africa has eleven official languages : Afrikaans, English, Ndebele, Northern Sotho, sotho, Swazi, Tswana, Tsonga, Venda, Xhosa and Zulu.
Fewer than two percent of South africans speak a first language other than an official one.
Most South Africans can speak more than एक language.
Dutch और English were the first official languages of South Africa from 1910 to 1925.
Afrikaans was added as a part of Dutch in 1925.
Dutch was replaced by Afrikaans जब South Africa became a republic in 1961, and Dutch was dropped in 1983, so between 1983 and 1994, South Africa had two official languages : English and Afrikaans.
The English version of the South African constitution refers to the languages by the names in those languages : isiZulu, isiXhosa, Afrikaans, Sepedi ( referring to Northern Sotho ), Setswana, English, Sesotho ( referring to Southern Sotho ), xitsonga, Siswati, Tshivenda and isiNdebele ( referring to दक्षिणी Ndebele ).
In South Africa, Southern Ndebele is known simply as Ndebele, as most speakers of Northern Ndebele live in Zimbabwe.
The 1993 version of the Constitution referred to Northern Sotho as Sesotho sa leboa, but the 1996 version referred to the language as Sepedi.
Different government विभाग and official bodies use different terms to denote Northern Sotho.
The main language of government is English even if South Africans often take pride in using indigenous languages for any purpose.
Afrikaans also features prominently in कॉमर्स together with English as the languages with the highest number of fluent speakers are Afrikaans and English.
In terms of linguistic classification, the official languages include दो West-Germanic languages ( English and Afrikaans ) and nine Bantu languages.
Four of these are Nguni languages ( Zulu, Xhosa, Swati and Ndebele ) and three are Sotho–Tswana languages ( Northern Sotho, Southern Sotho and Tswana ).
Tsonga is a Tswa–Ronga language.
South African Sign Language is a distinct though incompletely emerged national मानक language which also subsumes a cluster of semi-standardised dialects.
Aluminium nitrate is a नमक of aluminium and nitric acid, existing normally as a crystalline hydrate, most commonly as aluminium nitrate nonahydrate, Al ( NO3 ) 3·9H2O.
The New York Jets हैं a professional football team headquartered in florham Park, New Jersey, representing the New York metropolitan area.
The team is a member of the Eastern Division of the American फ़ुटबॉल Conference ( AFC ) in the National Football League ( NFL ).
in a unique arrangement for the league, the Jets share MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, नई Jersey with the New York दिग्गज.
The franchise is legally and corporately registered as New York Jets, LLC.
The टोली was founded in 1959 as the Titans of New York, an original member of the American फ़ुटबॉल League ; later, the franchise joined the NFL in the AFL–NFL विलय.
The team began to play in 1960 at the पोलो Grounds.
Under नई ownership, the current name was adopted in 1963 and the franchise थी relocated to Shea Stadium in 1964 and then to the Meadowlands खेल Complex in 1984.
The Jets advanced to the playoffs for the first time in 1968 and went on to compete in Super Bowl iii where they defeated the Baltimore Colts, becoming the first AFL team to defeat an NFL club in an AFL-NFL World Championship Game.
Since 1968, the jets have appeared in the playoffs thirteen times, and in the AFC Championship Game four times, most recently खोने to the Pittsburgh Steelers in 2010.
However, the Jets have never returned to the Super Bowl, making them one of three NFL teams to win their lone Super Bowl appearance, along with the New Orleans Saints and Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
The team 's training facility, Atlantic Health Jets Training बीच, जिससे opened in 2008, is located in Florham Park.
The team currently holds their annual प्रशिक्षण camp sessions on the campus of the State University of New York at Cortland in cortland, New York while holding occasional sessions at the florham पार्क complex.
Psilocybe semilanceata
Psilocybin mushrooms, also known as psychedelic mushrooms, are fungi that contain psychoactive indole alkaloids.
There are multiple colloquial terms for psilocybin मशरूम, the most common being shrooms and magic mushrooms.
Biological genera containing psilocybin mushrooms include Agrocybe, Conocybe, Copelandia, Galerina, gerronema, Gymnopilus, hypholoma, Inocybe, Mycena, Panaeolus, Pluteus, and Psilocybe.
There हैं approximately 190 species of psilocybin mushrooms and most of them fall in the genus Psilocybe.
Psilocybin mushrooms have likely been used since prehistoric times and may have been depicted in rock आर्ट.
Many cultures have used ये mushrooms in religious संस्कार.
In आधुनिक Western society they are used recreationally for their psychedelic effects.
Recent studies done at Imperial College London and Johns Hopkins School of Medicine conclude that when used properly, psilocybin acts as an anti-depressant as suggested by fMRI brain scans.
Alaska ( ) is a state in the United States, situated in the northwest extremity of the North American महाद्वीप, साथ the international boundary with Canada to the east, the Arctic Ocean to the north, and the Pacific Ocean to the west और south, with Russia further west आरपार the Bering Strait.
Alaska is the largest state in the United States by area, the 4th least populous and the least densely populated of the 50 United States.
Approximately half of Alaska 's 731,449 निवासियों live within the Anchorage metropolitan area.
Alaska 's economy is dominated by the oil, natural gas, and fishing industries ; it has these resources in abundance.
अलास्का was purchased from Russia on March 30, 1867, लिये $ 7.2 million ( $ adjusted for महंगाई ) at approximately two cents per acre ( $ 4.74/km2 ).
The land went through several administrative changes before becoming an organized ( or incorporated ) territory on may 11, 1912, and the 49th state of the U.S. on January 3, 1959.
The name `` Alaska '' ( Аляска ) was already introduced in the Russian colonial काल, when it was used only for the peninsula and is निकला from the Aleut alaxsxaq, meaning `` the mainland '' or, more literally, `` the object towards which the action of the sea is directed ''.
It is also known as Alyeska, the `` great land '', an Aleut शब्द derived from the same root.
The 101 फ्रेंच departments are divided into 342 arrondissements, which may be translated into English as districts.
The capital of an arrondissement/district is called a subprefecture.
जब an arrondissement contains the prefecture ( capital ) of the department, कि prefecture is the capital of the arrondissement, acting both as a prefecture and as a subprefecture.
Arrondissements are further divided into cantons and communes.
The vagina ( from Latin vāgīna, literally `` sheath '' or `` scabbard `` ) is a tubular tract which is a sex organ and has two main functions ; sexual मैथुन and childbirth.
In humans, this passage लीड from the opening of the vulva to the गर्भाशय ( womb ), but the vaginal tract ends at the cervix.
Unlike men, who have only one genital orifice, women have दो, the urethra and the vagina.
The vaginal opening is much larger than the urethral opening, and both openings are protected by the labia.
The inner mould of the vagina has a foldy texture which can create friction for the penis during intercourse.
During arousal, the vagina gets नम to facilitate the entrance of the penis.
The Latinate plural `` vaginae '' is rarely used in English.
Colloquially, the word vagina is often used to refer to the vulva or to the female genitals in general.
However, by its dictionary and anatomical definitions, vagina refers exclusively to the specific internal structure.
The Cincinnati Reds are a Major League Baseball team आधारित in Cincinnati, Ohio.
They are members of the National League Central Division.
Established in 1881 as an independent club, the टोली became a charter member of the अमरीकी Association in 1882, and joined the National League in 1890.
The club traditionally traces its origin to baseball 's first openly professional team in 1869.
The Reds have won five World Series शीर्षक, one American Association pennant, nine National League pennants and ten division शीर्षक.
The Reds played in the National लीग West between 1969 and 1993 and have been in the National League Central since 1994.
चूंकि 2003, the Reds have played at Great American Ball Park, built next to their home from 1970 to 2002, Riverfront स्टेडियम.
Bob Castellini has owned the Cincinnati Reds since 2006.
A prank stink बमबारी.
A stink bomb is a device designed to create an unpleasant smell.
They range in प्रभावकारिता from सरल pranks to military grade malodorants or riot control chemical agents.
The Guinness किताब of Records lists two smelliest substances.
One is `` US Government Standard Bathroom Malodor '' ; a mixture of eight chemicals with a stench resembling human feces, only much stronger, designed to test the efficacy of deodorizers and air fresheners.
Another एक, `` Who me ? ``, is a mixture of five sulfur-containing chemicals and smells like rotting food and carcasses.
The adage `` A picture is worth a thousand words '' refers to the notion that a complex idea can be conveyed with just a single still image.
It also aptly characterizes one of the main goals of visualization, namely making it possible to absorb large amounts of data quickly.
The expression `` Use a picture.
It 's worth a thousand words. '' appears in a 1911 newspaper article quoting समाचारपत्र editor Arthur Brisbane discussing journalism and publicity.
1913 newspaper advertisement
A similar phrase, `` One Look Is Worth A Thousand Words '', appears in a 1913 newspaper advertisement for the Piqua Auto Supply House of Piqua, Ohio.
an early use of the exact phrase appears in an 1918 newspaper advertisement for the San Antonio Light which says : One of the Nation 's Greatest Editors Says : One Picture is लायक a Thousand Words The San Antonio Light 's Pictorial Magazine of the War Exemplifies the truth of the above statement -- judging from the warm reception it has received at the hands of the Sunday Light readers.
It is believed by some कि the modern use of the phrase stems from an article by Fred R. Barnard in the advertising trade journal मुद्रक ' Ink, promoting the use of images in advertisements that appeared on the sides of streetcars.
The December 8, 1921 issue carries an ad entitled, `` One Look is Worth A Thousand Words. ''
Another ad by बर्नार्ड appears in the March 10, 1927 issue with the phrase `` One Picture Worth Ten Thousand Words, '' जहाँ it is labeled a Chinese कहावत ( 一圖勝萬言 ).
The Home Book of Proverbs, maxims, and Familiar Phrases quotes Barnard as saying he called it `` a Chinese कहावत, so that people would take it seriously. ''
Soon after, the proverb would become popularly attributed to Confucius.
The discussion of `` One Picture Worth Thousand Words '' versus `` One Picture Worth Ten Thousand Words '' Wan yen I hua and 10.000 miles worth 10.000 books is cited in सूचना graphics where the concept of many in different disciplines और cultures.
A picture is worth a thousand words
Despite this modern origin of the popular phrase, the sentiment रै been expressed by earlier writers.
For उदाहरण the Russian लेखक Ivan Turgenev wrote ( in fathers and Sons in 1862 ), `` A picture shows me at a glance what it takes dozens of pages of a book to expound. ''
Computer programmer and लेखक Fred Brooks makes an opposite statement regarding programming in The Mythical Man-Month : `` दिखाएँ me your flowcharts and conceal your tables, and I shall continue to be mystified.
Show me your tables, and i won’t प्रायः need your flowcharts ; they’ll be obvious. ''
The phrase has also been spoofed by जॉन McCarthy, the famous computer scientist, to make the opposite point : `` As the Chinese say, 1001 words is worth more than a चित्र. ''
A season is a subdivision of the year, marked by changes in weather, ecology, and घंटों of daylight.
Seasons result from the yearly revolution of the धरती around the सूर्य and the tilt of the Earth 's axis सापेक्ष to the plane of revolution.
In temperate and polar regions, the seasons are चिह्नित by changes in the intensity of धूप that reaches the Earth 's surface, variations of which may cause animals to go into hibernation or to migrate, and plants to be dormant.
During May, June and July, the northern hemisphere is exposed to more direct sunlight because the hemisphere faces the sun.
The वही is true of the southern hemisphere in November, दिसम्बर and January.
It is the tilt of the Earth that causes the Sun to be higher in the sky during the summer months which increases the solar flux.
However, due to seasonal lag, June, July और August are the hottest months in the northern गोलार्ध and December, January and February are the hottest months in the southern hemisphere.
In temperate and subpolar regions, generally four calendar -based seasons ( with their adjectives ) are recognized : वसन्त ( vernal ), summer ( estival ), autumn ( autumnal ) and winter ( hibernal ).
however, ecologists mostly use a six season model for temperate climate regions that includes pre-spring ( prevernal ) and late summer ( serotinal ) as distinct seasons along with the traditional four.
Hot regions have दो or three seasons ; the बरसात ( or wet, or monsoon ) season and the शुष्क season, and in कुछ tropical areas, a कूल or mild season.
in some भाग of the संसार, special `` seasons '' are loosely defined based on important कार्यक्रम such as a hurricane season, tornado season or a wildfire season.
The छह ecological सीज़न
The four calendar seasons, depicted in an ancient Roman mosaic from Tunisia

At the समय of writing the Netherlands is the 17th largest economy of the world.
( see : List of countries by GDP ( नाममात्र ) )
GDP प्रति capita is roughly $ 42,000 which puts it in the top 10 of richest nations in the world ( see : List of countries by GDP ( PPP ) per capita ).
Between 1996 and 2000 annual economic विकास ( GDP ) averaged over 4 %, well above the European average.
Growth slowed considerably in 2001-05 as part of the global economic slowdown.
2006 and 2007 however showed economic growth of 3.4 % and 3.9 %.
The Dutch economy was hit considerably by the ongoing global financial crisis and the ensuing European debt संकट.
Several banks went bankrupt, और a number of others had to receive governmental सहायता.
In 2009 the economy declined with 3.5 %, followed by two years of mild growth.
The डच economy is currently in a recession again, with an economic decline of 0.5 % in 2012.
Inflation is at 3.2 % in February 2013.
Unemployment has been relatively low compared to other EU nations for decades but after mid-2012 it has seen a fast increase and in February 2013 it has hit 7.7 %.
The Netherlands managed to maintain its AAA rating at तनिक until March 2013 according to the three major क्रेडिट rating agencies.
Historically, the Dutch introduced and invented the stock market by the merchandise trading through Dutch West India Company.
The Netherlands is a founding member of the European Union, the OECD and the World Trade Organization.

The original panel of The View ; Meredith Vieira, Star Jones, Debbie Matenopoulos and Barbara Walters in 1997.
the View is an American talk show broadcast on ABC that debuted in 1997 as part of the network 's daytime programming block.
Created by Barbara Walters and Bill Geddie, who both also serve as the दिखाएँ 's executive producers, the program सुविधाएँ a panel of women as co-hosts.
Along with Walters, the current panel includes whoopi Goldberg, who serves as the moderator, Joy Behar, Elisabeth hasselbeck, and Sherri Shepherd.
अंतरराष्ट्रीय versions of the program are aired in several countries.
As of the 2012–13 season, its 16th, The View is the fourth-longest running national daytime talk show in history, behind The Phil Donahue Show ( 29 ), the variously-named Live !
programs ( 25 ), and The Oprah Winfrey Show ( 25 ).
Prunus virginiana, commonly called bitter-berry, chokecherry, Virginia bird cherry and western chokecherry ( also black chokecherry for P. virginiana var. demissa ), is a species of bird cherry ( Prunus subgenus Padus ) देशी to North America ; the natural historic range of P. virginiana includes most of the continent, except for the far north and far दक्षिण.
Los Angeles अंतरराष्ट्रीय Airport is the primary airport serving the Greater Los Angeles Area, the second-most populated महानगर area in the United States.
It is most often referred to by its iata airport code LAX, with the letters pronounced individually.
LAX is located in southwestern Los Angeles along the प्रशांत coast in the पड़ोस of Westchester, from the downtown core and is the primary airport of Los Angeles World Airports ( LAWA ), an agency of the Los Angeles city सरकारी formerly known as the Department of Airports.
In 2011, LAX was the sixth busiest airport in the world after Hartsfield-Jackson अटलांटा International Airport, बीजिंग Capital International Airport, London Heathrow Airport, Chicago O'Hare International Airport, and Tokyo Haneda International विमानक्षेत्र with 61,862,052 passengers.
The airport holds the claim for `` the world 's busiest origin and destination ( O & d ) airport '' in 2011 that involves non-connecting यात्री traffic.
It is also the only विमानक्षेत्र to rank among the top five U.S. airports for both यात्री and cargo traffic.
LAX is the busiest airport in the Greater Los Angeles क्षेत्रफल, लकिन other एयरपोर्ट including Bob आशा Airport, जॉन Wayne Airport, Long Beach Airport, LA/Ontario International Airport, and Palm Springs International Airport also serve the region.
lax is also the busiest airport in California and the West Coast of the United States in terms of flight operations, passenger ट्रैफ़िक and air cargo activity, अग्रणी it to be referred to as the `` Gateway to the Pacific Rim ``.
Peyton विलियम्स Manning ( born March 24, 1976 ) is an American football quarterback for the Denver Broncos of the National Football League ( NFL ).
He played लिये the Indianapolis Colts for 14 seasons इससे 1998 to 2011.
He is the son of former NFL quarterback Archie Manning and an elder brother of New York Giants quarterback Eli Manning.
Manning played college football for the University of Tennessee, leading the Volunteers to the 1997 सेक चैंपियनशिप in his senior season.
However, No. 3 Tennessee lost to the No. 2 Nebraska Cornhuskers 42-17 in the Orange Bowl giving Nebraska and Tom Osborne their 3rd national चैंपियनशिप in 4 years.
He was chosen by the Indianapolis Colts with the first overall pick in the 1998 NFL Draft.
From 1998 to 2010, he led the Colts to eight ( seven AFC South and one AFC East ) division championships, two AFC championships, and to a Super Bowl championship ( Super Bowl XLI ).
He has won a record four लीग most valuable player awards, was the most valuable player of Super Bowl XLI, रै been named to twelve Pro Bowls, has twelve 4,000-yard passing seasons, and is the इंडियानापोलिस Colts ' all-time leader in passing yards ( 54,828 ) and touchdown passes ( 399 ).
In 2009, he was named the best player in the NFL and Fox Sports साथ with Sports Illustrated named him the NFL player of the decade of the 2000s.
in May 2011, he underwent neck surgery to alleviate neck pain and arm weakness he dealt with during the previous few seasons before signing a five-year, $ 90 million contract extension with the Colts in जुलाई 2011.
मैनिंग had hoped to play in the 2011 season, but in September 2011, he underwent a much more गंभीर second surgery : a level one cervical fusion procedure.
Manning had never missed an NFL game in his career, but was forced to miss the entire 2011 season.
He was released by the Colts on March 7, 2012, and after an almost two-week period where he visited with and worked आउट for several NFL teams, he signed with the Denver Broncos on March 20, 2012.
Manning 's pre-snap routine has earned him the nickname, `` The Sheriff '' and is one of the most recognizable and parodied in the NFL.
The Indianapolis Colts ' almost exclusive use of the hurry-up ठोकर led to Manning using an array of gestures and verbal commands to call the play at the लकीर of scrimmage rather than in the huddle.
The America Tower of the American सामान्य Center, the मुख्यालय of Baker Hughes
बेकर Hughes is एक of the world 's largest oilfield services companies.
It operates in over 90 countries, providing the oil and gas industry with products और services for drilling, formation evaluation, completion, production and reservoir consulting.
Baker Hughes has its headquarters in the अमेरिका Tower in the American सामान्य Center in Neartown, Houston.
Baker Hughes Incorporated was formed when Baker International and Hughes Tool Company merged in 1987.
Baker Hughes operates worldwide with major offices in Liverpool, United Kingdom ; Singapore ; Dubai ; a research and maintenance facility in Celle, Germany ; Lafayette, Louisiana ; ह्यूस्टन, Texas ; Pescara, Italy ; और kuala Lumpur, मलेशिया.
The company is administered broadly in two hemispheres : the पूर्वी hemisphere with five regions ( Europe, Africa, the Middle East, Asia Pacific और Russia/Caspian ) and the western गोलार्ध with four regions ( Canada, US Land, US Gulf, and Latin अमेरिका ).
Each of these regions is subdivided into markets.
The United States one- cent coin, commonly known as a penny, is a unit of currency equaling one one-hundredth of a United States dollar.
The cent 's symbol is ¢.
Its obverse रै featured the profile of President Abraham Lincoln since 1909, the centennial of his birth.
From 1959 ( the sesquicentennial of Lincoln 's birth ) to 2008, the reverse featured the Lincoln Memorial.
Four different reverse designs in 2009 honored Lincoln 's 200th birthday and a new, permanent reverse – the Union Shield – was introduced in 2010.
The coin is 0.75 inches ( 19.05 mm ) in diameter and 0.061 inches ( 1.55 mm ) in thickness.
The U.S. Mint 's official name for a penny is `` '' and the U.S. Treasury 's official name is `` one cent piece ''.
The colloquial term पैनी derives from the British coin of the same name, the pre-decimal version of which had a similar value.
In American English, pennies is the plural रूप, other plural forms पेंस और पेशाब ( standard use in British English ) are not used.
As of 2012, it costs the U.S. Mint 2.00 cents to make a cent because of the लागत of materials and production.
This figure includes the Mint’s fixed components for distribution and fabrication, estimated at $ 13 लाख in FY 2011.
It also includes Mint ओवरहेड allocated to the penny, which was $ 17.7 million लिये 2011.
फिक्स्ड लागत and overhead would have to be absorbed by other circulating coins without the पैनी.
The loss in profitability due to producing the one cent सिक्का in the United States for the year of 2012 was $ 58,000,000.
This was a slight decrease from 2011, the year before, which had a उत्पादन loss of $ 60,200,000.

कोई किस्में are distinguished by coloration, patterning, and scalation.
Some of the major colors are white, black, red, yellow, blue, and cream.
The most लोकप्रिय category of कोई is the Gosanke, which is made up of the Kohaku, Taisho Sanshoku, और Showa sanshoku varieties.
The American Federation of सरकारी Employees ( AFGE ) is an American labor union representing over 650,000 employees of the federal government, about 5,000 कर्मचारी of the District of Columbia, and a few hundred private sector employees, mostly in and around federal facilities.
AFGE is the largest union for civilian, non- postal federal employees and the largest union लिये District of Columbia employees who report directly to the mayor ( i.e., outside of D.C. public schools ).
It is affiliated with the AFL-CIO.
