`` What You Need '' is an episode of the American television anthology series The Twilight Zone.
It is based on the short story of the same name by Lewis Padgett ( Henry Kuttner and C. L. Moore ).
PlayhouseSquare, in the Cleveland Theater ज़िला in शहर Cleveland, Ohio, is the second-largest theater complex in the United States, second only to New यॉर्क City 's Lincoln Center ).
Constructed in a span of 19 months in the early 1920s, the theaters were subsequently closed down, लकिन यहूद revived through a grassroots effort.
Their renovation और reopening helped usher in a new era of downtown revitalization in Cleveland, and was called `` one of the top ten successes in Cleveland इतिहास. ''
The driver and passenger front airbags, after having been deployed, in a British Peugeot 306 car.
An airbag is a vehicle safety device.
It is an occupant restraint system consisting of a flexible fabric envelope or cushion designed to inflate rapidly during an automobile collision.
Its purpose is to cushion occupants during a crash and provide protection to उनके bodies when they strike interior objects such as the steering wheel or a खिड़की.
Modern vehicles may contain multiple airbag modules in various side और frontal locations of the passenger seating positions, and सेंसर may deploy one or more airbags in an प्रभाव zone at variable rates based on the type, angle and severity of impact ; the airbag is designed to only inflate in moderate to कठोर frontal crashes.
Airbags are सामान्यतः designed with the intention of supplementing the protection of an occupant who is correctly restrained with a seatbelt.
Most designs are inflated through pyrotechnic means and can only be operated once.
Newer side-impact airbag modules consist of संपीडित air cylinders that are triggered in the event of a side impact vehicle impact.
The first commercial designs were introduced in passenger automobiles during the 1970s with limited success.
Broad commercial adoption of airbags occurred in अनेक markets during the late 1980s and early 1990s with a driver airbag, and a front यात्री airbag as well on some cars ; and many modern vehicles now include four or more units.
irs tax forms are used for taxpayers and tax-exempt organizations to report financial information to the Internal Revenue Service ( IRS ) of the United States.
They are used to report आय, calculate taxes to be paid to the federal government of the United States, and disclose other information as required by the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC ).
There are over 800 various forms and schedules.
The best-known of these is Form 1040 used by individuals.
In the United States, driver 's licenses are issued by each व्यक्तिगत state ( including Washington, D.C. and territories ), rather than the federal government क्युकी of the political concept of federalism.
Drivers are normally required to obtain a license from their state of residence and all states recognize each other 's licenses for temporary visitors subject to normal age requirements.
A state may also suspend an individual 's ड्राइविंग privilege within its borders for traffic उल्लंघनों.
Many states share a common प्रणाली of license classes, with some exceptions, and commercial license classes are standardized by federal विनियमन at 49 CFR part 383.
China रै been the source of many inventions, including the Four Great आविष्कारों : papermaking, the compass, gunpowder, and printing ( both woodblock and movable type ).
The list below contains these and other inventions.
The Chinese invented technologies involving mechanics, hydraulics, and mathematics applied to horology, metallurgy, astronomy, agriculture, अभियान्त्रिकी, music theory, craftsmanship, nautics, and warfare.
By the Warring States Period ( 403–221 BC ), they had advanced metallurgic technology, including the blast furnace and cupola furnace, while the finery forge and puddling process were known by the Han Dynasty ( 202 BC – AD 220 ).
A sophisticated economic system in China gave जनम to inventions such as paper money during the Song Dynasty ( 960–1279 ).
The invention of gunpowder by the 10th century led to an array of inventions such as the fire lance, land mine, naval mine, हाथ cannon, exploding cannonballs, multistage rocket, and rocket bombs with aerodynamic wings and explosive payloads.
With the navigational aid of the 11th-century compass and ability to steer at high sea with the 1st-century sternpost अरित्र, premodern Chinese sailors sailed as far as East Africa and Egypt.
In water-powered clockworks, the premodern Chinese had प्रयुक्त the escapement mechanism since the 8th century and the endless power-transmitting chain drive in the 11th century.
They भी made large mechanical puppet theaters driven by waterwheels and carriage wheels and wine-serving automatons driven by paddle wheel boats.
The contemporaneous Peiligang and Pengtoushan cultures represent the oldest Neolithic cultures of China और were formed around 7000 BC.
Some of the first आविष्कारों of पाषाणकालीन, प्रागैतिहासिक China include semilunar and rectangular stone knives, stone hoes and हुकुम, the cultivation of millet, rice and the soybean, the refinement of sericulture, the building of rammed earth structures with lime -plastered house floors, the creation of the potter 's wheel, the creation of pottery with cord-mat-basket designs, the सृष्टि of pottery tripods and pottery steamers, और the development of ceremonial vessels and scapulimancy for उद्देश्य of divination.
फ्रांसिस्का Bray argues कि the domestication of the ox and buffalo during the Longshan culture ( c. 3000–c. 2000 BC ) period, the absence of Longshan-era irrigation or high-yield crops, full evidence of Longshan cultivation of dry-land खाद्यान्न crops जिससे gave high yields `` only when the soil was carefully cultivated, '' suggest that the plow was known at least by the Longshan culture period and explains the high agricultural production yields which allowed the rise of Chinese civilization during the Shang Dynasty ( c. 1600–c. 1050 bc ).
With later inventions such as the multiple-tube seed drill and heavy moldboard iron plow, China 's agricultural output could sustain a much larger population.
For the purposes of this list, inventions are regarded as technological firsts developed in China, and as such does not include foreign technologies जिससे the Chinese acquired through सम्पर्क, such as the windmill from the Middle East or the telescope from Early modern Europe.
It also does not include technologies developed elsewhere and later invented separately by the Chinese, such as the odometer and chain pump.
Scientific, mathematic or natural discoveries, changes in minor अवधारणाओं of design or style and artistic innovations can not be regarded as inventions and do not appear on the list.
Gross domestic product in 2011 US dollars per capita, adjusted for inflation and purchasing power parity ( log scale ) from 1860 to 2011, with population ( disk area ) for the US ( yellow ), uk ( orange ), Japan ( red ), China ( red ), and India ( blue ).
Globalization ( or globalisation—see spelling differences ) is the process of international integration arising from the interchange of world views, products, ideas, and other पहलुओं of संस्कृति.
Put in simple terms, globalization refers to processes that promote world-wide exchanges of नेशनल and cultural resources.
अग्रिम in transportation and telecommunications infrastructure, including the rise of the Internet, are major factors in globalization, generating further interdependence of economic and cultural activities.
Though several scholars place the origins of globalization in modern times, others trace its history long पहले the यूरोपीय age of discovery and voyages to the New World.
Some even trace the origins to the third मिलेनियम BCE.
Since the शुरूआत of the 20th century, the pace of globalization रै intensified at a rapid rate, especially during the Post Cold War era.
The term globalization has महरूम in increasing उपयोग since the mid-1980s and especially since the mid-1990s.
In 2000, the International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) पहचाना four basic aspects of globalization : trade and transactions, capital और investment आंदोलनों, migration and गति of people and the dissemination of knowledge.
Further, पर्यावरणीय challenges such as climate change, cross-boundary water and air pollution, और over-fishing of the ocean are linked with globalization.
globalizing processes affect and are affected by business and work organization, economics, socio-cultural resources, और the natural environment.

It stars Keanu Reeves, Gene hackman, and Brooke Langton.
an American Airlines aircraft takes off from Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport.
This विमानक्षेत्र is the airline 's largest hub.
American Airlines flies to 79 domestic destinations and 78 अंतरराष्ट्रीय destinations in 48 countries.
( as of December 2012 )
The list includes the city, country, the codes of the International Air Transport Association ( iata airport code ) and the International Civil Aviation Organization ( ICAO airport code ), and the airport 's name, with the airline 's hubs, focus cities and seasonal destinations marked.
The list also contains destinations no longer served by the airline, which are marked as terminated destinations.
It करता not include destinations served for American Airlines by its क्षेत्रीय affiliates American Eagle Airlines, Executive Airlines, and AmericanConnection.
`` Day-O ( the banana Boat Song ) '' is a traditional Jamaican mento folk song, the best-known version of which was sung by Harry Belafonte and an वैकल्पिक संस्करण interspersed with another Jamaican folksong, Hill and Gully Rider, by dame Shirley Bassey.
Despite the song 's mento influences, `` Day-O ( The banana Boat Song ) '' is widely known as an example of calypso music.
It is a work song, from the point of view of dock workers working the night shift loading bananas onto ships.
Daylight रै come, the shift is over and वे want their work to be counted up so that they can go home.
World War I ( WWI ) was a global war केंद्रित in Europe कि began on 28 July 1914 and lasted until 11 November 1918.
It was predominantly called the World War or the Great War from its occurrence until the start of World War II in 1939, and the First World युद्ध or World War I thereafter.
it शामिल all the world 's great powers, which were assembled in two opposing alliances : the Allies ( based on the Triple Entente of the United किंगडम, France and Russia ) and the Central Powers ( originally the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy ; but, as austria–hungary था taken the अप्रिय against the agreement, Italy did not enter into the war ).
These alliances were both reorganised and expanded as more nations entered the war : Italy, Japan and the United States joined the Allies, and the Ottoman Empire and Bulgaria the Central Powers.
Ultimately, more than 70 million military personnel, including 60 million Europeans, were mobilised in one of the largest wars in इतिहास.
More than 9 million combatants were killed, largely क्युकी of technological advancements that led to enormous increases in the lethality of weapons without corresponding improvements in protection or mobility.
It was the fifth- deadliest conflict in संसार history, subsequently paving the way for various political changes, such as revolutions in many of the nations involved.
One of the long-term causes of the war was the resurgence of imperialism in the foreign policies of the great powers of Europe.
More तत्काल, the assassination of Archduke फ्रांज Ferdinand of ऑस्ट्रिया, the heir to the सिंहासन of Austria-Hungary, on 28 June 1914 by Yugoslav nationalist Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo triggered a diplomatic crisis when Austria-Hungary subsequently delivered an ultimatum to the Kingdom of Serbia.
Several alliances formed over the previous decades were invoked.
Within weeks, the major powers were at war and, via their colonies, the conflict soon spread around the world.
On 28 July, the Austro-Hungarians fired the first गोलियाँ of the युद्ध as preparation for the invasion of Serbia.
जबकि the Russians mobilised, the Germans invaded neutral Belgium and Luxembourg on the रास्ता to France, providing a casus belli for Britain 's declaration of war विरूद्ध Germany.
After the German march on Paris was brought to a halt—the so-called Miracle of the Marne —the पश्चिमी Front settled into a static battle of अपघर्षण with a trench line that changed little until 1917.
On the Eastern Front, the Russian army was कामयाब against the austro-hungarians, but was stopped in its invasion of East Prussia by the germans.
In November the उस्मानी Empire joined the war, opening up fronts in the Caucasus, Mesopotamia and the Sinai.
Italy and Bulgaria गई to war in 1915 and Romania in 1916.
In Russia, the tsar 's government collapsed in March 1917 and a subsequent revolution in नवम्बर brought the Russians to terms with the Central शक्तियां.
After a 1918 German offensive along the पश्चिमी front, the allies drove back the Germans in a series of successful offensives and American forces began entering the trenches.
जर्मनी, which had its अपना trouble with revolutionaries, agreed to an armistice on 11 November 1918.
the war ended in victory for the Allies.
Events on the home fronts were as tumultuous as on the battle fronts, as the participants tried to mobilize their manpower and economic संसाधन to fight a total war.
By the end of the war, four major imperial powers—the German, Russian, Austro-Hungarian and Ottoman empires—ceased to exist.
The successor states of the former two lost a great amount of territory, while the latter two were dismantled entirely.
The map of central Europe was redrawn into several smaller states.
The League of Nations was formed in the hope of preventing another ऐसे conflict.
The European nationalism spawned by the war and the breakup of empires, the repercussions of जर्मनी 's defeat and problems with the Treaty of Versailles are agreed to be factors contributing to World War II.
Nurse Jackie is an American series कि premiered on जून 8, 2009, on Showtime, Movie Central and The Movie Network.
The series stars Edie Falco as the title character Jackie Peyton, an emergency department nurse at All Saints ' Hospital in New York City.
For Jackie, `` प्रत्येक day is a high तार अधिनियम of juggling patients, doctors, fellow nurses and her own indiscretions. ''
Keeping Up with the Kardashians ( often referred to simply as The Kardashians ) is an अमरीकी reality television series that premiered on October 14, 2007, on e !.
It follows the lives of the Kardashian/Jenner family, including sisters Kourtney, Kim, and Khloé Kardashian.
the series ' success रै led to the spin-offs कोर्टनी and Kim Take New York, Khloé & Lamar, Kourtney and Khloé Take Miami, and Kourtney and Kim Take Miami.
Afghanistan ( ; ; ), officially the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan, is a landlocked sovereign state forming part of South Asia, Central Asia, and to some extent पश्चिमी Asia.
It has a population of around 30 लाख inhabiting an क्षेत्रफल of approximately, making it the 42nd most populous and 41st largest स्वदेश in the world.
It is bordered by Pakistan in the south and the east, Iran in the west, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan and Tajikistan in the north, and China in the far northeast.
Afghanistan has been an ancient focal point of the रेशा Road and human migration.
Archaeologists have found evidence of इंसान habitation from as far back as the Middle Paleolithic.
Urban civilization may have begun in the area as early as 3,000 to 2,000 BCE.
Sitting at an important geostrategic location that connects the मध्य East culture with Central Asia and the Indian उपमहाद्वीप, the land has been home to various peoples through the आयु and witnessed many military campaigns, notably by Alexander the Great, Genghis Khan, and in modern era Western forces.
The land also served as a source from which the Greco-Bactrians, Kushans, Hephthalites, Saffarids, Ghaznavids, ghorids, Khiljis, Timurids, Mughals, Durranis, and others have risen to form major empires.
The political history of the modern state of Afghanistan begins in 1709, when the Hotaki राजवंश was established in Kandahar followed by Ahmad Shah Durrani 's rise to power in 1747.
In the late 19th century, Afghanistan became a buffer state in the `` Great Game `` between the British और रूसी empires.
Following the 1919 Anglo-Afghan War, King Amanullah began a European style modernization of the country but was रोका by the ultra-conservatives.
During the ठंडा War, after the withdrawal of the British from neighboring India in 1947, the United States and the Soviet Union began spreading influences in Afghanistan, which led to a bloody war between the US-backed mujahideen forces and the Soviet-backed Afghan government in which over a लाख Afghans lost their जीवनदान.
This was followed by the 1990s civil war, the rise and fall of the extremist Taliban government and the 2001–present war.
In December 2001, the United राष्ट्र Security Council authorized the creation of the International Security Assistance Force ( ISAF ) to help maintain security in Afghanistan and assist the Karzai administration.
Three decades of war made Afghanistan one of the world 's most dangerous countries, including the largest producer of refugees and asylum seekers.
While the international community is rebuilding war-torn Afghanistan, terrorist groups such as the Haqqani Network and Hezbi Islami are actively involved in a nationwide Taliban -led insurgency, which शामिल hundreds of assassinations and suicide attacks.
According to the United Nations, the insurgents were responsible for 80 % of civilian casualties in 2011 and 2012.
The American सिविल War ( ACW ), also known as the War between the States or simply the Civil War ( देखिए naming ), थी a civil war fought from 1861 to 1865 between the United States ( the `` Union '' or the `` North '' ) and several Southern slave states that declared उनके secession and formed the confederate States of America ( the `` Confederacy '' or the `` South '' ).
The war had its origin in the issue of slavery, especially the extension of slavery into the पश्चिमी territories.
Foreign powers did not intervene.
After four years of खूनी combat that left over 600,000 soldiers dead and destroyed much of the South 's infrastructure, the Confederacy collapsed, गुलामी was abolished, and the difficult Reconstruction process of restoring national unity and guaranteeing rights to the freed slaves began.
In the 1860 presidential election, Republicans, led by Abraham Lincoln, opposed expanding slavery into संयुक्त States ' territories.
Lincoln won, but before his inauguration on March 4, 1861, seven cotton-based slave states formed the Confederacy.
Outgoing Democratic President James Buchanan and the incoming Republicans rejected secession as illegal.
Lincoln 's inaugural address declared his प्रशासन would not initiate civil war.
Eight remaining slave states continued to reject calls for secession.
Confederate forces seized numerous संघीय forts within territory claimed by the Confederacy.
A Peace Conference failed to find a compromise, and both sides prepared for war.
The Confederates assumed that European देशों were so dependent on `` King Cotton `` that वे would intervene ; none did and none recognized the new Confederate States of America.
Hostilities began on April 12, 1861, when Confederate forces fired upon Fort Sumter, a key fort held by Union troops in South Carolina.
Lincoln called for each state to provide सैनिकों to retake the fort ; consequently, four more slave states joined the Confederacy, bringing their total to eleven.
The Union soon controlled the border states and established a naval blockade कि crippled the southern economy.
the Eastern Theater was inconclusive in 1861–62.
The autumn 1862 Confederate campaign into Maryland ( a Union राज्य ) ended with Confederate retreat at the बैटल of Antietam, dissuading British intervention.
Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation, which made ending slavery a युद्ध goal.
To the west, by summer 1862 the Union नष्ट the confederate river navy, then much of their western armies, और the Union at Vicksburg split the Confederacy in two at the Mississippi River.
in 1863, Robert E. Lee 's Confederate incursion north ended at the Battle of Gettysburg.
Western successes led to ulysses S. Grant command of all Union armies in 1864.
In the Western Theater, William T. Sherman drove ईस्ट to capture Atlanta and marched to the sea, destroying Confederate infrastructure along the way.
The Union marshaled the resources and manpower to attack the Confederacy from all directions, and could afford to fight battles of attrition through the Overland Campaign towards Richmond, the Confederate capital.
the defending Confederate army failed, leading to Lee 's surrender to Grant at Appomattox Court House on April 9, 1865.
The American Civil War was one of the earliest true industrial wars.
Railroads, the टेलीग्राफ, steamships, and mass-produced weapons were employed extensively.
The mobilization of civilian factories, mines, shipyards, banks, transportation and food supplies all foreshadowed World War I.
It remains the deadliest युद्ध in अमरीकी history, resulting in the deaths of an estimated 750,000 soldiers and an undetermined number of civilian casualties.
Historian John Huddleston estimates the death toll at ten percent of all Northern males 20–45 years old, and 30 percent of all Southern white males aged 18–40.
Cost of goods sold ( COGS ) refer to the inventory costs of those goods a business has sold during a particular period.
Costs हैं associated with particular goods using one of several formulas, सहित specific identification, first-in first-out ( fifo ), or average cost.
Costs include all लागत of purchase, costs of conversion and other costs incurred in bringing the inventories to their present location and कंडीशन.
Costs of goods made by the business include material, labor, and allocated overhead.
The costs of those goods not yet sold are deferred as costs of inventory until the inventory is sold or written down in value.

A confectionery store ( more commonly referred to as a sweet shop in the United Kingdom, a candy store in the North America, or a lolly shop in Australia ) sells confectionery and is usually targeted to children.
Most confectionery stores are filled साथ an assortment of मिठाई far larger than a पंसारी or convenience store could accommodate.
They often offer a selection of old fashioned treats, and मिठाई from different देशों.
Very often अपरिवर्तित in layout since their inception, confectioneries are ज्ञात for their warming and उदासीन feel.
The village of Pateley Bridge claims to have the oldest confectionery store in England.
The oldest sweet shop in England, in the village of Pateley Bridge
Oklahoma ( ) ( Pawnee : Uukuhuúwa, Cayuga : Gahnawiyoˀgeh ) is a state located in West South Central संयुक्त States.
Oklahoma is the 20th most extensive and the 28th most populous of the 50 United States.
The राज्य 's name is derived from the Choctaw words okla and humma, meaning `` red people '', and it is known informally by its nickname, The Sooner State.
Formed by the combination of ओक्लाहोमा Territory and भारतीय Territory on November 16, 1907, ओक्लाहोमा was the 46th state to enter the union.
Its residents are known as Oklahomans or, informally `` Okies '', and its capital and largest city is Oklahoma City.
A major producer of natural gas, oil, and agriculture, Oklahoma relies on an economic base of aviation, energy, दूरसंचार, and biotechnology.
It has one of the fastest growing economies in the nation, ranking among the top राज्य in per capita income growth and सकल domestic उत्पाद growth.
Oklahoma City and Tulsa serve as Oklahoma 's primary economic anchors, with nearly two thirds of Oklahomans living भीतर their metropolitan statistical areas.
With small mountain सीमाएँ, prairie, mesas, and eastern forests, most of Oklahoma lies in the Great Plains and the U.S. Interior Highlands —a प्रदेश विशेषकर prone to severe weather.
In addition to having a prevalence of English, German, Scottish, Irish and देशी American ancestry, more than 25 Native American भाषाएं are spoken in Oklahoma, second only to California.
ओक्लाहोमा is located on a confluence of three major American cultural regions और historically परोसा as a route for cattle drives, a destination for southern settlers, and a government-sanctioned territory for Native Americans.
Stacked and standing car tires
A tire ( or tyre ) is a ring-shaped covering that fits around a wheel 's rim to protect it and enable better vehicle performance.
Most tires, such as those for automobiles and bicycles, provide traction between the vehicle and the road while providing a लचीली cushion that absorbs shock.
The materials of modern pneumatic tires हैं synthetic rubber, प्राकृतिक rubber, fabric and wire, along with carbon black and other रासायनिक compounds.
They consist of a tread and a body.
The tread provides traction while the body provides containment for a मात्रा of compressed air.
Before rubber was developed, the first versions of tires were simply bands of metal that fitted around wooden wheels to prevent wear and आंसू.
Early रबर tires were solid ( not pneumatic ).
Today, the majority of tires are न्यूमेटिक inflatable structures, comprising a doughnut-shaped देह of cords and wires encased in rubber and generally filled with compressed air to form an inflatable cushion.
Pneumatic tires are used on many types of vehicles, including cars, bicycles, motorcycles, trucks, earthmovers, and वायुयान.
Metal tires हैं still used on locomotives and railcars, and solid rubber ( or अन्य polymer ) tires are still used in various non-automotive applications, such as some casters, carts, lawnmowers, and wheelbarrows.
Dr. Joseph Warren ( June 11, 1741 – June 17, 1775 ) was an American doctor who played a leading role in American Patriot organizations in Boston in early days of the American Revolution, eventually सेवारत as अध्यक्ष of the revolutionary Massachusetts Provincial Congress.
Warren enlisted Paul Revere and William Dawes on April 18, 1775, to leave Boston and spread the alarm that the British garrison in Boston थी setting out to raid the town of Concord and arrest rebel leaders John Hancock and Samuel Adams.
Warren participated in the next दिन 's Battles of Lexington और Concord, which are commonly माना to be the opening engagements of the American Revolutionary War.
Warren था been commissioned a प्रमुख General in the colony 's militia shortly before the June 17, 1775 Battle of Bunker Hill.
Rather than exercising his रैंक, Warren served in the बैटल as a private soldier, and was killed in combat when British troops stormed the redoubt atop Breed 's Hill.
उसके मौत, immortalized in John trumbull 's painting, The Death of General Warren at the Battle of Bunker 's Hill, June 17, 1775, galvanized the rebel forces, and he has been memorialized in many place names in the संयुक्त States.
STM image of self-assembled supramolecular chains of the organic semiconductor Quinacridone on ग्रेफाइट.
an organic semiconductor is an organic material with semiconductor गुण, that is, with an electrical conductivity between that of insulators and that of metals.
Single molecules, छोटी chain ( oligomers ) और organic polymers can be semiconductive.
Semiconducting small molecules ( aromatic hydrocarbons ) include the polycyclic aromatic compounds pentacene, anthracene, and rubrene.
Polymeric organic semiconductors include poly ( 3-hexylthiophene ), poly ( p-phenylene vinylene ), as well as polyacetylene and its derivatives.
वहीँ are दो major overlapping classes of organic semiconductors.
These are organic charge-transfer complexes and various linear-backbone conductive polymers derived from polyacetylene.
Linear backbone organic semiconductors include polyacetylene itself और its डेरिवेटिव polypyrrole, and polyaniline.
At least locally, charge-transfer complexes often exhibit similar conduction mechanisms to inorganic semiconductors.
Such mechanisms arise from the presence of hole and electron conduction परतों separated by a band gap.
While such classic mechanisms are important locally, as with inorganic amorphous semiconductors, tunnelling, localized states, mobility gaps, and phonon -assisted hopping also significantly contribute to conduction, particularly in polyacetylenes.
Like inorganic semiconductors, organic semiconductors can be doped.
Organic semiconductors susceptible to doping such as polyaniline ( Ormecon ) and are also known as organic metals.
ठेठ current carriers in सशुल्क semiconductors are holes and electrons in π-bonds.
Almost all organic solids are insulators.
But when their constituent molecules have π-conjugate systems, electrons can move via π-electron cloud overlaps, especially by hopping, tunnelling and related mechanisms.
Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons और phthalocyanine salt crystals are उदाहरण of this type of सशुल्क semiconductor.
Mainly due to low mobility, even unpaired electrons may be stable in charge-transfer complexes.
Such unpaired electrons can function as current carriers.
This type of semiconductor is also obtained by pairing an electron donor molecule साथ an electron acceptor molecule.
Female ejaculation is the expulsion of fluid by human females इससे the paraurethral ducts through and around the female urethra during or before an orgasm.
it is also known colloquially as gushing or squirting, हालांकि these are considered to be different phenomena in some research publications.
The सटीक source और nature of the fluid continue to be a topic of debate among medical professionals, which is also related to doubts over the existence of the G-Spot.
The FIFA Women 's World Cup is an international association football competition contested by the वरिष्ठ women 's national teams of the members of Fédération Internationale de Football Association ( FIFA ), the sport 's global governing body.
the चैंपियनशिप has been awarded every four years since the inaugural tournament in 1991.
Japan won the 2011 टूर्नामेंट in a penalty shootout.
The current format of the tournament involves 16 teams competing for the शीर्षक at venues within the host nation ( s ) over a period of about तीन weeks ; – this phase is often called the World Cup Finals.
A qualification phase, which फिलहाल takes place over the preceding three years, is प्रयुक्त to determine which teams qualify for the टूर्नामेंट साथ साथ the host nation ( s ).
the FIFA Women 's World कप is recognized as the most important International competition in women 's football and is played amongst women 's national football teams of the member states of फीफा, the sport 's global governing body.
The first Women 's World Cup tournament, named the Women 's World Championship, was held in 1991, sixty-one years after the men 's first FIFA World Cup tournament in 1930.
The six World Cup tournaments have been won by four different national teams.
The next World Cup will be hosted by Canada in 2015.

'Son of man ' is the अनुवाद of various Hebrew and यूनानी phrases used in both the यहूदी Bible and the New वसीयत.
It has diverse meanings, ranging इससे a normal human being to a prophesied eternal, divine ruler.
The Hebrew expression `` son of man '' ( בן–אדם i.e. ben-'adam ) appears one hundred and सात times in the Hebrew Bible.
इस is the most common Hebrew construction for the singular but is used mostly in Ezekiel ( 93 times ) and 14 times elsewhere.
In thirty two मामले the phrase appears in intermediate plural form `` sons of men '', i.e. इंसान beings.
As generally interpreted by Jews, it denotes humankind generally.
in the Koine Greek of the New Testament, `` the son of man '' is invariably used as `` ὁ υἱὸς τοὺ ἀνθρώπου '' with a definite article.
The use of the definite article in `` the बेटे of man '' in the Christian gospels is novel, and before its use वहीँ, no records of its use in any of the surviving Greek documents of antiquity exist.
Geza Vermes has stated that `` the Son of man '' in the ईसाई gospels is unrelated to Hebrew Bible usages.
In Christian usage, unlike the Son of God title, which has been an essential तत्व of Christian creeds since the Apostolic age, the proclamation of `` Jesus as the Son of man '' has never been an article of faith in Christianity.
The interpretation of the use of `` the बेटे of man '' in the New Testament has remained challenging और बाद 150 years of debate no consensus on the समस्या has उभरा among scholars.
Master of foxhounds leads the field from Powderham Castle in Devon, England, साथ the hounds in front.
Fox hunting is an कार्यकलाप involving the tracking, chase, and sometimes killing of a fox, traditionally a red fox, by trained foxhounds or other scent hounds, and a समूह of निहत्थे अनुसरणकर्ता led by a master of foxhounds, who follow the hounds on foot or on horseback.
Fox hunting originated in the form practised until recently in the United Kingdom in the 16th century, but is practised all over the world, सहित in Australia, Canada, France, Ireland, Italy and the United States.
In Australia, the term also refers to the hunting of foxes with firearms similar to spotlighting or deer hunting.
In much of the world hunting in general is समझा to relate to कोई game animals or हथियार ( e.g., हिरण hunting साथ bow and arrow ) ; in Britain और Ireland, `` शिकार '' without qualification implies fox hunting ( or other forms of hunting साथ hounds- beagling, stag hunting, mink hunting, drag hunting or hunting the clean boot ) as described here.
The sport is controversial, particularly in the UK, where it was banned in Scotland in 2002, and in England and Wales in November 2004 ( law enforced from February 2005 ), though shooting foxes as vermin remained legal.
Proponents of fox hunting view it as an important part of rural culture and useful लिये reasons of conservation and pest control, while opponents argue that it is cruel and unnecessary.
Tobacco advertising is the advertising of tobacco उत्पाद or use ( typically cigarette smoking ) by the tobacco industry through a variety of media सहित sponsorship, particularly of sporting events.
It is now one of the सबसे highly regulated forms of marketing.
Some or all forms of tobacco advertising are banned in many countries.
Bally Technologies, Inc. is a manufacturer of slot machines and other gaming technology based in Las Vegas, Nevada.
The company was founded in 1968 as Advanced Patent Technology.
It eventually बदला its नाम to Alliance Gaming and acquired, in 1996, Bally Gaming International, a former division of Bally Manufacturing.
In 2006, the entire company adopted the Bally name, a trademark that originated in 1932 by the Bally Manufacturing Corporation.
Gustave Doré 's engravings illustrated the Divine Comedy ( 1861–1868 ) ; here, Dante is lost in Canto 1 of the Inferno.
inferno ( Italian for `` Hell `` ) is the first part of Dante Alighieri 's 14th-century epic poem Divine Comedy.
It is followed by purgatorio and paradiso.
It is an allegory telling of the journey of Dante through Hell, guided by the Roman poet Virgil.
In the poem, Hell is depicted as nine circles of suffering located within the Earth.
Allegorically, the Divine Comedy represents the journey of the soul towards God, with the Inferno describing the recognition and rejection of sin.
Smirnoff is a brand of vodka owned and produced by the British company Diageo.
The Smirnoff brand began with a vodka distillery founded in Moscow by Pyotr Arsenievich Smirnov ( 1831–1898 ).
It is now distributed in 130 countries.
It is produced in several देशों including India, Ireland, Italy, the United Kingdom and the United States.
स्मरनॉफ उत्पाद include vodka, flavoured vodka, and malt beverages.
In March 2006, Diageo North America claimed that स्मरनॉफ vodka थी the best-selling distilled spirit brand in the world.
Big Brown ( foaled April 10, 2005 in Kentucky ) is a retired चैंपियन अमरीकी thoroughbred racehorse and विजेता of the 2008 Kentucky Derby and 2008 Preakness Stakes.
Bred by dr. Gary B. Knapp 's Monticule Farms in Lexington, Kentucky, he won his first पाँच race starts.
He was sired by Grade iii winner Boundary, a son of North American Champion sire Danzig, a बेटे of Northern Dancer.
Big Brown 's dam was Mien, also a granddaughter of Northern Dancer through her sire, Nureyev.
The Serenity Prayer is the common name for an originally untitled prayer by the American theologian Reinhold niebuhr ( 1892–1971 ).
It has been adopted by Alcoholics Anonymous and other twelve-step programs.
The best-known form is : God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I can नहीं change,
The courage to change the things I can,
And wisdom to जान the difference.
The Declaration and Resolves of the First Continental Congress ( also known as the Declaration of Colonial अधिकारों, or the Declaration of Rights ), was a statement adopted by the First Continental Congress on October 14, 1774, in response to the Intolerable अधिनियमों passed by the British Parliament.
The घोषणा outlined colonial objections to the Intolerable Acts, सूचीबद्ध a colonial विधेयक of rights, and provided a विस्तृत list of grievances.
It was similar to the Declaration of Rights and Grievances, passed by the Stamp Act Congress a decade earlier.
the Declaration concluded with an outline of Congress 's plans : to enter into a boycott of British trade ( the Continental Association ) until their grievances were redressed, to publish addresses to the people of Great Britain and British America, and to send a petition to the King.
Pulse दबाव is the pressure that is felt when feeling the pulse.
Measured in millimeters of mercury ( mmHg ), the pressure difference between the systolic और diastolic pressures is the pressure change to create the pulse, which is the pulse pressure.
If resting blood दबाव is ( systolic/diastolic ) 120/80 millimeters of mercury ( mmHg ), pulse pressure is 40.
The Hills is a reality television series which originally aired on MTV from May 31, 2006 जबतक July 13, 2010.
The show uses a reality television format, following the personal lives of several young adults living in Los Angeles, California, but tends towards a narrative format more commonly found in scripted genres such as साबुन operas.
The series originally followed the personal जीवन of former Laguna Beach star Lauren Conrad and her friends ' new lives in Los Angeles.
After five सीज़न, Conrad left the series and was replaced by another former Laguna Beach star, Kristin Cavallari, beginning in the second half of the fifth season.
The series concluded at the end of the sixth season.
entertainment Weekly ranked The Hills 82nd on उनके list of `` The 100 Best Shows of the Last 25 Years, '' stating that the series was a `` New Classic. ''
AOL TV called it TV 's Biggest Guilty Pleasure.
the series premiered in syndication in the fall of 2009 alongside Laguna Beach : The Real Orange काउंटी.
In poker, bad beat is a subjective term for a hand in which a player साथ what appear to be strong cards nevertheless loses.
It most often occurs where one player bets the clearly stronger hand and their प्रतिद्वन्दी makes a ग़रीब कॉल that eventually `` hits '' and wins.
वहीँ is no consensus among poker players as to what exactly constitutes a bad beat and often players होगा disagree about whether a particular hand थी a bad beat.
The goldfish ( Carassius auratus auratus ) is a freshwater fish in the family Cyprinidae of order Cypriniformes.
It was one of the earliest fish to be domesticated, and is one of the सबसे commonly kept aquarium fish.
A relatively small member of the carp family ( which also includes the koi carp and the crucian carp ), the goldfish is a domesticated version of a less-colorful कार्प ( Carassius auratus ) native to ईस्ट Asia.
It थी first domesticated in China more than a thousand years ago, and several distinct breeds have since been विकसित.
Goldfish breeds vary greatly in size, देह shape, fin configuration and coloration ( various combinations of white, yellow, orange, red, brown, and black हैं known ).
Uncooked Rouladen
Rouladen ( or Rinderroulade, singular : roulade ) is a German meat roulade usually consisting of bacon, onions, mustard and pickles wrapped in thinly sliced beef which is then पकाया.
In some countries, the roulade is also known as `` beef olive ''.
Beef or veal is used as मांस though some food scholars tend to believe that the original version थी probably venison or pork, and pork is still popular in some areas.
The बीफ rouladen as we जान them today have become लोकप्रिय over the last century.
The cut is usually topside beef or silverside since this is the cheaper cut.
The more expensive version would be the round steak, also known as rump steak.
The meat is cut into विशाल, thin slices.
The filling is a mixture of smoked and cooked pork belly, chopped onions and chopped अचार ( gurken ) जिससे is at times varied by adding minced meat, sausage meat, pine nuts and mustard.
The mixture varies from region to region.
Rouladen are traditionally served for dinner.
रेड wine is often served with this dish.
Typical eukaryotic cell.
Cellular respiration is the set of the metabolic reactions and processes that take place in the cells of organisms to convert biochemical energy from nutrients into adenosine triphosphate ( ATP ), and तब release waste products.
The reactions involved in respiration are catabolic reactions, which break large molecules into smaller ones, releasing energy in the प्रक्रम as weak so-called `` high-energy '' bonds are replaced by stronger bonds in the products.
Respiration is एक of the key ways a cell gains useful उर्जा to fuel cellular activity.
सेल्यूलर respiration is considered an exothermic redox reaction.
The overall reaction is broken into many smaller ones जब it occurs in the body, most of which are redox reactions themselves.
Although technically, cellular respiration is a combustion reaction, it clearly does not resemble one when it occurs in a living cell.
This difference is क्युकी it occurs in many separate steps.
While the overall reaction is a combustion reaction, no single reaction कि comprises it is a combustion reaction.
nutrients that are commonly used by animal and संयंत्र cells in respiration include sugar, amino acids and fatty acids, and a आम oxidizing agent ( electron acceptor ) is molecular ऑक्सीजन ( O2 ).
The energy stored in ATP ( its third phosphate group is weakly bonded to the rest of the molecule and is cheaply broken allowing stronger bonds to form, thereby transferring energy for use by the cell ) can then be used to drive processes requiring energy, including biosynthesis, locomotion or transportation of molecules across cell membranes.
Countries by 2011 GDP ( nominal ) according to the CIA World Factbook.
This article includes a list of countries in the world sorted by their gross domestic product ( GDP ), the market value of all final goods and services from a nation in a given year.
The GDP dollar estimates presented here are calculated at market or सरकारी official exchange rates.
Several economies which are not considered to be countries ( world, the EU, and some dependent territories ) are included in the lists because they appear in the sources.
These economies are not ranked in the charts यहाँ, but are listed जहाँ applicable.
The figures presented here do not take into account मतभेद in the cost of living in different countries, and the results can vary greatly from one year to another based on fluctuations in the exchange rates of the country 's करेंसी.
Such fluctuations may change a country 's ranking from one साल to the next, even though they often make little or no difference to the standard of living of its population.
Therefore these figures should be प्रयुक्त with caution.
Some countries/regions may have नागरिकों which are on average wealthy.
These countries/regions could appear in this list as having a small GDP.
This would be because the country/region listed has a small population, and therefore small total economy ; the GDP is calculated as the जनसांख्यिकी times the wealth per capita.
Comparisons of national wealth are also frequently made on the basis of purchasing power parity ( PPP ), to adjust for मतभेद in the cost of living in different countries.
( See List of countries by GDP ( PPP ) )
ppp largely removes the exchange rate problem, but has its own drawbacks ; it does not reflect the मान of आर्थिक output in international trade, and it also requires more estimation than nominal GDP.
On the whole, PPP per capita figures are अधिक narrowly spread than nominal GDP per capita figures.
the पहला list includes data compiled by the United Nations Statistics प्रभाग for 2011.
The second list largely includes data ( estimate ) compiled by the International Monetary Fund लिये 2012.
The third list shows the World Bank 's mostly 2011 estimates, and the fourth list शामिल mostly 2012 estimates from the CIA World Factbook.
Lapping is a machining प्रक्रम, in which two surfaces are rubbed together साथ an abrasive between them, by hand गति or by way of a machine.
This can take two forms.
The first type of lapping ( traditionally called पीस ), typically involves rubbing a brittle सामग्री such as कांच against a surface such as आयरन or glass itself ( also known as the `` lap '' or grinding tool ) with an abrasive such as aluminum oxide, jeweller 's rouge, optician 's rouge, emery, silicon carbide, diamond, etc., in between them.
This produces microscopic conchoidal fractures as the abrasive rolls about between the two surfaces और removes material from both.
the other रूप of lapping involves a softer material such as pitch or a ceramic for the lap, which is `` charged '' with the abrasive.
The lap is then used to cut a harder material—the workpiece.
The abrasive embeds within the softer material which holds it and permits it to score across and cut the harder material.
Taken to a finer limit, this will produce a polished surface such as with a polishing cloth on an automobile, or a polishing cloth or polishing pitch upon glass or स्टील.
Taken to the ultimate limit, with the aid of accurate interferometry and specialized polishing machines or skilled hand polishing, lensmakers can produce surfaces that are flat to better than 30 nanometers.
This is one twentieth of the wavelength of light from the commonly used 632.8 nm helium neon laser light source.
Surfaces this flat can be molecularly bonded ( optically contacted ) by bringing them together under the right conditions.
( This is not the same as the wringing effect of जोहानसन blocks, although it is similar ).
The term `` America 's Team '' is a popular उपनाम in the United States that refers to the Dallas cowboys in the नेशनल Football League.
The nickname originated with the team 's 1978 highlight फिल्मी, जहाँ the narrator opens साथ the following introduction : The term is recognized and often used by media outlets, including ESPN, Yahoo !, HBO Sports, और खेल Illustrated.
My Babysitter 's a Vampire ( French : Ma gardienne est un vampire ) is a 2011 Canadian television series, based on the टेलीविज़न film of the same name.
In Canada, the series premiered in French on Télétoon on February 28, 2011, in English on Teletoon on March 14, 2011, and on डिज़्नी Channel in the United States on June 27, 2011.
The show was created by Fresh TV, creators of 6teen and Total Drama.
The show follows Ethan Morgan ( Matthew नाईट ), who, in the television film, learns कि his babysitter Sarah ( Vanessa Morgan ) is a vampire.
in the film, he learns he is समर्थ to have visions and his best friend Benny वीयर ( Atticus Mitchell ) is a spellmaster.
the series follows the three as they take on supernatural forces and have adventures, with occasional help from fellow vampires Rory ( Cameron कैनेडी ) and Erica ( Kate Todd ), while dealing with the troubles of regular high school जीवन.
A second season was confirmed to start production in September 2011 and it first premiered on डिज़्नी Channel on June 29, 2012, it premiered on Teletoon September 6, 2012.
télétoon started featuring season 2 sneak-peak episodes on October 28, 2012 और premiered it on January 10, 2013

A पिकअप truck or pick-up, often simply referred to as a pickup, is a light motor vehicle with an open-top, rear cargo area ( bed ).
In North America, the term pickup is प्रयुक्त for light trucks with a हल्का duty chassis और फैक्टरी built, integrated bed, as well as for coupé utility vehicles, often based on a निजी car chassis, but also प्रायः on a special dedicated chassi for such use.
Some countries have their own terms similar to पिकअप, such as ute in Australia and New Zealand, or bakkie in South Africa.
Large pickup trucks are somewhat rare in Europe, where vans and लाइट lorries are commonly used for similar भूमिकाएँ.
The President of the United States of America ( POTUS ) is the head of state and head of government of the United States.
The president leads the executive branch of the federal government and is the commander-in-chief of the संयुक्त States Armed Forces.
Article II of the U.S. Constitution vests the executive power of the United States in the president and आरोप him with the निष्पादन of federal law, alongside the responsibility of appointing संघीय executive, राजनयिक, regulatory, and judicial officers, and concluding treaties with foreign powers, with the advice and consent of the सीनेट.
The president is further सशक्त to grant federal pardons and reprieves, and to convene and adjourn either or both houses of Congress under extraordinary circumstances.
Since the founding of the United States, the शक्ति of the president और the federal सरकारी have grown substantially and प्रत्येक modern president, despite possessing no formal legislative शक्तियां beyond signing or vetoing congressionally passed bills, is largely responsible for dictating the legislative कार्यसूची of उसके party and the foreign and domestic policy of the United राज्य.
The president is frequently described as the most powerful person in the world.
The president is indirectly निर्वाचित by the people through the Electoral College to a four-year term, and is एक of only two nationally elected federal officers, the other being the वाइस President of the United States.
The Twenty-second Amendment, adopted in 1951, prohibits anyone from ever होने elected to the प्रेसिडेंसी for a third full term.
It भी prohibits a person from being निर्वाचित to the प्रेसिडेंसी more than once if that person previously had served as president, or एक्टिंग अध्यक्ष, for more than two years of another person 's term as president.
In all, 43 individuals have served 55 four-year terms.
On जनवरी 20, 2009, Barack Obama became the 44th and वर्तमान president.
On नवम्बर 6, 2012, he was re-elected और is अनुसूचित to serve until January 20, 2017.
Bottled mineral water
Bottled water is drinking water ( e.g., खूब water, distilled water, Mineral water, or spring water ) packaged in plastic or glass water bottles.
Bottled जल may be कार्बोनेटेड or not.
Sizes range from small single serving bottles to large carboys for water coolers.
Map of the major rivers, lakes, and reservoirs in India
Map showing rivers and flood prone areas in India
Rivers of इण्डिया play an important role in the lives of the Indian people.
the river systems provide irrigation, potable water, cheap transportation, electricity, और the livelihoods for a large number of people all over the country and to rural areas.
This easily explains why nearly all the major शहरों of India are located by the बैंको of rivers.
The rivers भी have an important role in Hindu mythology and are considered holy by all Hindus in the country.
Seven major rivers along with their numerous tributaries make up the river system of India.
Most of the rivers pour their waters into the Bay of Bengal ; however, some of the rivers whose courses take them through the western part of the country और towards the east of the state of Himachal pradesh खाली into the Arabian Sea.
भाग of Ladakh, उत्तरी parts of the aravlli range and the arid parts of the थार Desert have inland drainage.
Dr.Francis Buchanan surveyed the courses of the rivers of India along with their tributaries and branches in 1810-11 AD and presented a minute account of it.
The shifting of the courses and bed over the centuries is very remarkable.
Many of the channels mentioned in कि survey have now become dead, dried or even extinct.
All major नदियाँ of India originate from one of the three main watersheds :
The हिमालय and the Karakoram ranges
Vindhya और Satpura ranges और Chotanagpur plateau in central India
sahyadri or Western Ghats in western India
The Bretton Woods system of monetary management established the rules for commercial and financial relations among the world 's major industrial states in the mid-20th century.
The Bretton Woods system was the पहला example of a fully negotiated monetary order intended to govern monetary relations among independent nation-states.
Preparing to rebuild the international economic system as World युद्ध ii was still raging, 730 delegates from all 44 Allied nations gathered at the Mount वॉशिंगटन Hotel in Bretton Woods, New Hampshire, United States, for the संयुक्त Nations Monetary and Financial Conference.
The delegates deliberated during 1–22 July 1944, और signed the Agreement on its final day.
Setting up a system of rules, institutions, and procedures to regulate the अंतरराष्ट्रीय monetary प्रणाली, the planners at Bretton Woods established the International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) and the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development ( IBRD ), जिससे today is भाग of the World Bank Group.
These organizations became operational in 1945 after a sufficient number of countries had ratified the agreement.
The chief features of the Bretton Woods system यहूद an obligation for each country to adopt a monetary policy कि maintained the exchange rate by tying its currency to the U.S. डालर and the ability of the IMF to bridge temporary imbalances of payments.
On 15 August 1971, the संयुक्त States unilaterally terminated convertibility of the US $ to सुनहरा.
This brought the Bretton Woods प्रणाली to an end and saw the dollar become fiat करेंसी.
This कार्रवाई, referred to as the Nixon shock, created the situation in which the United States dollar became a आरक्षित currency used by many states.
At the same time, many fixed currencies ( such as GBP, for example ), also became free floating.
Ducati Motor Holding S.p.A. is an Italian company that designs and manufactures motorcycles.
Headquartered in Bologna, Italy, Ducati is owned by Audi through its Italian subsidiary Lamborghini.
A credit score is a numerical expression based on a statistical analysis of a person 's credit files, to represent the creditworthiness of that person.
A credit score is primarily based on credit report information typically sourced from credit bureaus.
Lenders, such as banks और credit card companies, use credit scores to evaluate the संभावित रिस्क posed by lending money to consumers and to mitigate losses due to bad debt.
lenders use credit scores to determine who qualifies for a loan, at what interest rate, and what credit limits.
Lenders also use credit scores to determine which customers are likely to bring in the most revenue.
The use of credit or identity scoring prior to authorizing access or granting क्रेडिट is an implementation of a विश्वसनीय system.
Credit scoring is नहीं limited to banks.
Other organizations, such as mobile phone companies, insurance companies, landlords, and government departments employ the same techniques.
Credit scoring also has a lot of overlap with data mining, which uses many similar techniques.
These techniques combine हज़ारों of factors but they are more or less similar or the same.
The seven SI base units और the interdependency of their definitions : for example, to extract the definition of the मीटर from the speed of लाइट, the definition of the second must be known while the ampere and candela are both dependent on the definition of energy which in turn is defined in terms of length, mass and time.
The अंतरराष्ट्रीय System of Units ( si ) defines seven units of measure as a basic set from which all other si units are derived.
These SI base units और their physical quantities are:
metre for length ( us English : meter )
kilogram for द्रव्यमान ( note : not the gram )
second लिये time
ampere for electric वर्तमान
kelvin for temperature
candela for luminous intensity
mole for the amount of पदार्थ.
The SI base quantities form a set of mutually independent dimensions as required by dimensional analysis commonly employed in science and technology.
However, in a given realization of these units वे may well be interdependent, i.e. defined in terms of each other.
The names of SI units are written in lowercase characters ( the 'degree Celsius ' meets this rule, as 'degree ' is the unit, and 'Celsius ' is a modifier ).
The symbols of units are written in lowercase ( e.g. metre has the symbol m ), except that symbols for units named after व्यक्तियों are written with an initial capital letter ( e.g., the hertz has the uppercase symbol Hz ).
Many other units, such as the litre ( US English : liter ), are formally not part of the SI, but are accepted for use साथ SI.
Monument Canyon
Colorado नेशनल Monument ( locally referred to as The Monument ) is a part of the National Park Service निकट the city of Grand Junction, Colorado.
Spectacular canyons cut deep into sandstone and even granite–gneiss–schist rock formations, in some areas.
This is an area of desert land high on the कोलोराडो Plateau, with pinion and juniper forests on the plateau.
The park hosts a wide range of wildlife, including red-tailed hawks और golden eagles, ravens, jays, desert bighorn sheep, and coyotes.
Activities include hiking, horseback riding, road bicycling, and scenic drives ; a visitor center on the वेस्ट side contains a natural history museum and gift shop.
There are magnificent views from trails and the Rim Rock Drive, which winds along the plateau.
Nearby are the किताब Cliffs, and the largest flat-topped mountain in the संसार, the Grand Mesa.
Its विशेषता attraction is Monument Canyon, जिससे runs the चौडाई of the park, and includes rock formations such as Independence Monument, the Kissing Couple, and Coke Ovens.
The monument includes 20,500 एकड़ ( 32 square miles ), much of जिससे रै been recommended to Congress for designation as wilderness.

The Uniforms of the United States Marine Corps serve to distinguish Marines from members of other services.
Among current uniforms in the United States Armed Forces, the Marines ' uniforms have been in service the longest.
The Marine Dress Blue uniform has, with few changes, been worn in essentially its current form since the 19th century.
उत्तर American telephone area codes 419 and 567 serve the northwest quadrant of the U.S. state of Ohio.
The largest city served by these area codes is Toledo ( and its suburbs of Holland, Maumee, Northwood, Oregon, Ottawa Hills, Perrysburg, Rossford, Sylvania, Swanton, Waterville, and Whitehouse ).
Other cities served by these area codes include Ada, Ashland, Bellevue, Bluffton, Bowling ग्रीन, Bryan, Bucyrus, Celina, Clyde, Crestline, Defiance, Delphos, Edison, Erastus, Findlay, Fostoria, Fremont, Galion, Kenton, Lima, Mansfield, माउंट Gilead, Napoleon, Norwalk, Oak Harbor, Port Clinton, Sandusky, Shelby, St. Marys, Tiffin, Upper Sandusky, Van Wert, Wapakoneta, Wauseon, Willard.
Other areas served include the Lake Erie Islands north of Port Clinton and west of Sandusky.
The main area code, 419, was created as one of the original area codes in अक्तूबर 1947 ; the overlay area code 567 was निर्मित on January 1, 2002.
Despite the presence of Toledo, the state 's fourth-largest city, 419 was the last of Ohio 's original four area codes to have been विभाजित or overlaid.
Mickey Leroy Gilley ( born March 9, 1936 ) is an American country music singer and musician.
Although he started आउट गायन straight-up country and western material in the 1970s, he moved towards a more pop -friendly sound in the 1980s, bringing him further success on not just the country charts, but the पॉप charts as well.
Among his biggest hits are `` Room Full of गुलाब, '' `` Do n't the Girls All Get Prettier at Closing Time, '' and the रीमेक of the Soul hit `` Stand by Me ``.
he is also the cousin of Jerry Lee Lewis, Carl McVoy, Jim Gilley and Jimmy Swaggart.
According to the Federal Aviation Administration, Gilley is a licensed पायलट, जो holds an instrument rating with commercial pilot privileges for multi-engine airplanes, as well as private pilot privileges for single engine aircraft.
The September 11 attacks ( also referred to as September 11, सितंबर 11th, or 9/11 ) were a series of four coordinated terrorist attacks launched by the Islamic terrorist group al-Qaeda upon the United States in New York City and the Washington, D.C. area on September 11, 2001.
Four passenger airliners were hijacked by 19 al-Qaeda आतंकवादी so they could be flown into buildings in suicide attacks.
Two of those planes, American Airlines Flight 11 and United Airlines Flight 175, were crashed into the North and South towers, respectively, of the World Trade Center complex in New York City.
Within two hours, both towers collapsed with debris and the resulting fires causing partial or complete collapse of all other buildings in the WTC complex, as well as major damage to ten other विशाल surrounding structures.
A third plane, American Airlines Flight 77, was क्रैश into the प्रस्तुतीकरण ( the headquarters of the United States विभाग of Defense ), leading to a partial collapse in its western side.
the fourth plane, United Airlines Flight 93, was targeted at the संयुक्त States Capitol in Washington, D.C., but crashed into a field near shanksville, Pennsylvania, after its passengers tried to overcome the hijackers.
in total, almost 3,000 people died in the attacks, including the 227 civilians और 19 hijackers aboard the four planes.
Suspicion quickly fell on al-Qaeda.
Although the group 's leader, Osama bin Laden, initially denied any involvement, in 2004 he claimed responsibility for the attacks.
Al-Qaeda and बिन Laden cited U.S. support of इसराईल, the presence of U.S. troops in Saudi Arabia, and sanctions against Iraq as motives for the attacks.
The United States responded to the attacks by launching the War on आतंक and invading Afghanistan to depose the Taliban, which had harbored al-Qaeda.
Many देशों strengthened their anti-terrorism legislation and expanded law enforcement powers.
Having evaded capture for years, bin Laden was located और killed by U.S. forces in May 2011.
The destruction of the Twin Towers and other properties caused गंभीर damage to the economy of Lower Manhattan and था a significant effect on global markets.
Cleanup of the World Trade Center साईट was completed in may 2002, and the Pentagon was repaired within a year.
Numerous memorials have महरूम constructed, including the नेशनल September 11 Memorial & Museum in New York, the Pentagon Memorial, and the Flight 93 National Memorial in Pennsylvania.
After a lengthy विलंब, the One World व्यापार Center is expected to be completed at मैदान शून्य in नई York City in 2013.
Finding Nemo is a 2003 American computer-animated comedy-drama adventure film written and directed by Andrew Stanton, released by Walt Disney Pictures, and the fifth film produced by पिक्चर्स Animation Studios.
It tells the story of the over-protective clownfish named Marlin ( Albert Brooks ) who, along with a regal tang named Dory ( Ellen DeGeneres ), searches for his abducted बेटे Nemo ( Alexander Gould ) all the way to Sydney harbour.
Along the रास्ता, Marlin learns to take risks and let Nemo take care of himself.
It is Pixar 's first फिल्मी to be released in cinemas in the northern hemisphere summer.
The film थी re-released for the first time in 3D on September 14, 2012, and it was released on Blu-ray on December 4, 2012.
A sequel, Finding Dory, is currently in development, set to be released on November 25, 2015.
The film received universal critical acclaim and won the Academy Award for बेहतरीन एनिमेटेड Feature, and थी मनोनीत in three more categories including Best Original Screenplay.
It was the second highest-grossing film of 2003, earning a total of $ 921 million worldwide.
Finding Nemo is also the best-selling DVD of all time, with over 40 million copies sold as of 2006, and was the highest-grossing G-rated फिल्मी of all समय before Pixar 's own Toy Story 3 overtook it.
It is भी the 23rd highest-grossing film of all समय, as well as the 3rd highest-grossing animated film.
In 2008, the American Film Institute named it the tenth greatest animated film कभी made during their Top 10.
the sixth season of America 's Best Dance Crew, also known as America 's Best Dance Crew : Season of the Superstars, premiered on April 7, 2011 and concluded on June 5, 2011.
Auditions were held in चार cities from January 21 through February 5 : Chicago, Houston, नई York, और Los Angeles.
This season takes a different route from past seasons.
The crews must perform to the म्यूज़िक of one specific artist each week, सहित Rihanna, Lil Wayne, and other popular stars.
This season भी features special guest appearances by various music celebrities including Justin बीबर, The Black Eyed Peas, Katy Perry, Kesha, Nicki Minaj, and Kanye West.
Dominic `` D-Trix '' Sandoval, a former member of क्वेस्ट Crew, the winner of the तीसरा season of America 's Best Dance Crew, joins returning judges Lil Mama and JC chasez as the newest judge.
In the season finale, I aM mE was declared the winner of Season 6 and received the $ 100,000 ( USD ) prize.
In the United States, Social Security refers to the old-age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance ( OASDI ) federal कार्यक्रम.
The original Social Security Act ( 1935 ) and the वर्तमान version of the Act, as amended, encompass several social welfare and social insurance programs.
Social Security is primarily funded through dedicated payroll taxes called Federal Insurance Contributions Act tax ( FICA ).
Tax deposits are formally entrusted to the Federal Old-Age and Survivors बीमे विश्वास Fund, the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund, the Federal Hospital Insurance Trust Fund, or the Federal Supplementary Medical Insurance Trust Fund which comprise the सोशल Security Trust Fund.
Upward redistribution of income is responsible for परिचय 43 % of the projected Social Security shortfall over the next 75 years.
According to economist Martin Feldstein, the combined spending for all social insurance programs in 2003 constituted 37 % of government expenditure and 7 % of the gross domestic product.
Social Security is currently estimated to keep roughly 40 percent of all अमेरिकी age 65 or older out of poverty.
The Social Security Administration is headquartered in woodlawn, Maryland, just west of Baltimore.
The दारू by volume shown on a bottle of absinthe.
दारू by volume ( abbreviated as ABV, abv, or alc/vol ) is a standard measure of how much दारू ( ethanol ) is contained in an alcoholic beverage ( expressed as a percentage of total volume ).
the ABV standard is used worldwide.
In some countries, दारू by आवाज़ is referred to as डिग्री Gay-Lussac ( after the French chemist Joseph लुई Gay-Lussac ).
Laurel Hollow is a village in the Town of Oyster Bay in Nassau County, New York in the United States.
The population was 1,952 at the 2010 census.
Charles John Huffam Dickens ( ; 7 February 1812 – 9 June 1870 ) was an English writer and social critic.
He created some of the world 's most memorable fictional वर्ण and is generally regarded as the greatest novelist of the Victorian period.
During his जीवन, his works enjoyed unprecedented fame, and by the twentieth century his literary genius was broadly acknowledged by critics और scholars.
His novels and short stories continue to be widely popular.
Born in portsmouth, England, Dickens बाएँ school to work in a factory after his पिता was thrown into debtors ' prison.
Although he had little formal education, his जल्दी impoverishment drove him to succeed.
Over his career he edited a weekly journal for 20 years, wrote 15 novels, 5 novellas and hundreds of short stories and non-fiction articles, lectured and performed extensively, was an indefatigable अक्षर writer, and campaigned vigorously for children 's rights, education, and अन्य social reforms.
Dickens sprang to fame with the 1836 सीरियल publication of The Pickwick Papers.
Within a few years he had become an international literary celebrity, famous लिये his ह्यूमर, satire, and keen observation of character and society.
His novels, most published in monthly or weekly instalments, pioneered the serial publication of narrative fiction, which became the dominant Victorian mode for novel publication.
The instalment format allowed Dickens to evaluate his audience 's reaction, and he often modified उसके plot and character development based on such feedback.
For example, जब his wife 's chiropodist expressed तकलीफ at the way Miss mowcher in David Copperfield seemed to reflect her disabilities, Dickens went on to improve the character with positive lineaments.
fagin in Oliver Twist apparently mirrors the famous बाड़ ikey Solomon ; His caricature of Leigh Hunt in the figure of Mr Skimpole in Bleak House was likewise toned down on advice from some of उसके friends, as वे read episodes.
In the वही novel, both Lawrence Boythorne and Mooney the beadle are drawn from real जीवन – Boythorne from Walter Savage landor and Mooney from 'Looney ', a beadle at Salisbury Square.
His plots were carefully constructed, and Dickens often wove in elements from topical events into his narratives.
Masses of the अनपढ़ ग़रीब chipped in ha'pennies to have each new monthly episode read to them, opening up और inspiring a new class of readers.
Dickens was regarded as the literary colossus of his age.
His 1843 novella, A Christmas Carol, is one of the most influential works कभी written, and it remains लोकप्रिय and continues to inspire adaptations in every artistic genre.
His creative genius has been praised by fellow writers—from Leo Tolstoy to G. K. Chesterton and George Orwell —for its realism, comedy, prose style, unique characterisations, and social criticism.

The civil अधिकारों movement was a series of worldwide political movements for equality पहले the law that peaked in the 1960s.
In many situations it took the form of campaigns of civil resistance aimed at achieving change by nonviolent forms of resistance.
in some situations it was accompanied, or followed, by civil unrest and हथियारबंद rebellion.
The process was long and tenuous in many countries, and many of these movements did नहीं fully achieve their goals although, the प्रयत्न of these movements did lead to improvements in the legal rights of previously दलित groups of people.
The प्रमुख aim of the सिविल rights movement included, and include, ensuring that the rights of सब people are equally protected by the law, including the rights of minorities.
Civil rights movements ranging from the global LGBT rights movement to the global Women 's rights movement to various racial minority rights movements around the संसार continue.
The 2010 FIFA World Cup was the 19th FIFA World Cup, the world championship for मेन 's national association football teams.
It took place in South Africa from 11 June to 11 July 2010.
The bidding process for होस्टिंग the टूर्नामेंट finals थी open तभी to African nations ; in 2004, the international football federation, FIFA, selected South Africa over Egypt and Morocco to become the first African nation to host the finals.
The matches were played in ten stadiums in nine host cities around the country, with the final played at the Soccer City स्टेडियम in South Africa 's largest नगर, Johannesburg.
Thirty-two teams were selected for participation via a विश्वव्यापी qualification टूर्नामेंट that began in August 2007.
In the first गोलाकार of the tournament finals, the teams competed in round-robin groups of four teams for points, with the top two teams in each group proceeding.
These sixteen teams advanced to the knockout stage, where three rounds of play decided which teams होता participate in the final.
In the final, Spain, the European champions, defeated third-time finalists the Netherlands 1–0 after extra time, with Andrés Iniesta 's goal in the 116th minute giving Spain their first world title, becoming the आठवीं nation to win the tournament, and the first European nation to win the टूर्नामेंट outside its home continent.
Host nation South Africa, 2006 world champions Italy and 2006 runners-up France were all eliminated in the first round of the tournament.
It was the first time that the hosts were eliminated in the first round.
New Zealand with their three draws were the only undefeated team in the tournament, but were also eliminated in the first round.

New Orleans ( or, locally or ; ) is a major United States port and the largest city and metropolitan area in the state of Louisiana.
The population of the नगर was 343,829 as of the 2010 U.S. Census.
The नई Orleans metropolitan क्षेत्रफल ( New Orleans–Metairie–Kenner Metropolitan Statistical Area ) had a population of 1,167,764 in 2010 and was the 46th largest in the United States.
The New Orleans–Metairie–Bogalusa Combined Statistical Area, a larger व्यापार area, had a 2010 population of 1,214,932.
The city is named after Orléans, a city located on the Loire River in Centre, France, and is well known for its distinct French Creole architecture, as well as its cross-cultural and multilingual heritage.
New Orleans is also famous for इसके cuisine, music ( particularly as the जन्मस्थान of jazz ), और its annual celebrations and festivals, most notably Mardi Gras.
The city is often referred to as the `` most unique '' in अमेरिका.
New Orleans is located in southeastern Louisiana, straddling the Mississippi River.
The city and Orleans Parish ( ) are.
The city and parish are bounded by the parishes of st. Tammany to the north, St. Bernard to the east, Plaquemines to the south and Jefferson to the south and west.
Lake Pontchartrain, part of which is included in the city limits, झूठ to the north and Lake Borgne lies to the ईस्ट.
The संयुक्त States presidential election of 1968 was the 46th quadrennial presidential election, आयोजित on Tuesday, November 5, 1968.
The Republican nominee, former Vice-President Richard Nixon, won the election over the Democratic nominee, incumbent Vice-President Hubert Humphrey.
Nixon ran on a campaign that promised to restore law and order to the nation 's cities, torn by दंगे and crime.
Analysts have argued the election of 1968 is a realigning election as it permanently disrupted the New Deal Coalition that had dominated presidential politics for 36 years.
Coming four years after Democrat Lyndon B. Johnson won in a historic landslide, the election saw the incumbent president forced out of the race and a Republican elected for the first time in twelve years.
It was a wrenching national experience, conducted दौरान a year of violence that included the assassination of civil rights leader Martin Luther King, Jr., and subsequent race दंगे across the nation, the assasination of Democratic presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy, widespread opposition to the Vietnam War across university campuses, and violent confrontations between police and anti-war protesters at the 1968 Democratic National Convention as the Democratic party split again and again.
The election featured the strongest तीसरा party effort चूंकि 1912 by former Alabama Governor George Wallace, a Democrat.
क्युकी Wallace 's campaign opposed federal intervention in the South to end school पृथक्करण, he carried the Deep South and ran well in ethnic industrial districts in the North.
This was the last election in which New York had the most votes in the electoral college ( 43 votes ).
After the 1970 census, California gained the most electoral votes and has remained the most populous state since तब.
This is the latest election where a presidential ticket won without carrying the vice presidential candidate 's home state.

Kurt डोनाल्ड Cobain ( February 20, 1967 – April 5, 1994 ) was an American musician and कलाकार, best known as the lead singer, guitarist and primary songwriter of the grunge band Nirvana.
Cobain formed Nirvana with Krist Novoselic in Aberdeen, Washington in 1985 and स्थापित it as part of the Seattle music scene, having its debut album Bleach released on the independent record label Sub Pop in 1989.
After signing with major label DGC Records, the band found breakthrough success with `` Smells Like Teen Spirit `` from its second album Nevermind ( 1991 ).
following the success of Nevermind, Nirvana was labeled `` the flagship band '' of Generation X, and कोबेन hailed as `` the spokesman of a generation ''.
Cobain, however, was often uncomfortable and frustrated, believing his message और artistic दृष्टि to have been misinterpreted by the public, with his personal issues often subject to media attention.
He challenged Nirvana 's audience with its final studio album In Utero ( 1993 ).
During the last years of his life, Cobain struggled साथ heroin addiction, illness and depression.
He also had difficulty coping with his fame and public image, and the professional और lifelong personal pressures surrounding himself and his wife, musician Courtney Love.
On April 8, 1994, Cobain was मिला dead at his घर in Seattle, the victim of what was officially ruled a suicide by a self-inflicted shotgun wound to the head.
The circumstances of his death at age 27 have become a topic of public fascination and debate.
चूंकि their debut, Nirvana, साथ Cobain as a songwriter, has sold over 25 million albums in the U.S., and over 50 million worldwide.
a millwright is a craftsman or tradesman engaged with the construction and मेंटेनेंस of मशीनरी.
More generally in the English बोलना संसार, early millwrights were specialist carpenters who erected machines used in agriculture, food processing and processing lumber और paper.
In the early part of the Industrial Revolution, their skills were pressed into service building the earliest powered textile mills.
आधुनिक millwrights कार्य with steel and other materials in addition to wood and must often combine the skills of several skilled trades in order to successfully fabricate industrial machinery or to assemble machines इससे pre-fabricated parts.
The modern millwright must also be able to read blueprints और other schematics to aid him in the construction of जटिल systems.
Millwrights are frequently unionized, with around 45 % unionized in the US, although experienced millwrights often set themselves up as independent contractors.
