हावर्ड Jones ( born John Howard Jones, 23 February 1955, Southampton, Hampshire, England ) is a British musician, singer and songwriter.
According to the Guinness Book of British Hit Singles & Albums, `` Jones is an accomplished singer-songwriter who was a regular chart आगंतुक in the mid-1980s with his brand of synthpop.
Jones, who was equally popular in the U.S., appeared at सजीव Aid ``.
Allmusic journalist, Stephen Thomas Erlewine adds, `` Jones was one of the defining figures of mid-1980s synthpop.
His music merged the technology intensive sound of New Wave with the cheery optimism of hippies and late 1960s pop.
Jones racked up a string of hits in the mid and late 1980s, before he retreated into being a cult figure in the 1990s ''.
The International Isle of man TT ( Tourist Trophy ) Race is a motorcycle racing event held on the Isle of Man और was for many years the most prestigious मोटरसाइकिल race in the world.
The event was part of the FIM Motorcycle Grand Prix World चैंपियनशिप during the period 1949–1976 before being transferred to the संयुक्त Kingdom after सुरक्षा concerns and run by the FIM as the British Grand Prix for the 1977 season.
The Isle of Man TT Races became part of the TT Formula 1 Championship from 1977 to 1990 to preserve the event 's racing status.
From 1989 the racing has been developed by the Isle of man Department of Tourism as the Isle of Man TT Festival.
The race is run in a time-trial format on पब्लिक roads closed लिये racing by the provisions of an Act of Tynwald ( the parliament of the Isle of Man ).
The पहला race was held on Tuesday 28 May 1907 and was called the International Auto-Cycle Tourist Trophy.
The event was organised by the Auto-Cycle Club over 10 laps of the St John 's छोटी Course of 15 miles 1,470 yards for road-legal touring मोटरसाइकिल with exhaust silencers, saddles, pedals and mud-guards.
The winner of the single-cylinder class, and overall winner of the first event in 1907, was Charlie Collier riding a Matchless motorcycle in a time of 4 hours, 8 minutes and 8 सेकेंड at an average race speed of 38.21 mph.
The winner of the twin-cylinder class was Rem Fowler riding a Peugeot engined Norton in a time of 4 hours 21 minutes and 52 seconds at an average race speed of 36.21 mph.
The trophy presented to Charlie Collier as the winner of the 1907 Isle of Man TT Race, was donated by the Marquis de Mouzilly St. Mars.
It featured a stylised version of Olympic God Hermes by Giovanni Da Bologna as a silver figurine astride a winged wheel.
The trophy was similar in design to the 18 carat gold montague Trophy प्रस्तुत to John Napier ( Arrol-Johnston ) as the inaugural winner of the Isle of Man Tourist Trophy car race in 1905 now known as the RAC Tourist Trophy.
The Marquis de Mouzilly St. Mars Trophy is now presented annually to the winner of the Isle of Man Senior tt Motor-Cycle Race.
The 2007 Isle of Man tt was the Centenary event which ran between 26 May and 8 June 2007 and प्रदर्शित a special Re-enactment of the 1907 Isle of Man TT Race held on the village green अगला to Tynwald Hill in st John 's on सोमवार 28 May 2007.
the vintage parade of 100 classic motorcycles for the Centenary Re-enactment on the original St John 's छोटी Course was flagged away by पूर्व World Motor-Cycle Champion Geoff Duke.
The पहला of the participants to be flagged away was the recently restored twin-cylinder Peugeot-Norton ridden by Rem fowler during the first Isle of Man TT Race in 1907.
भी participating in the 2007 Re-enactment was TT रेस competitor Guy Martin सवारी a 1938 Triumph Tiger 100 500 cc and other former TT competitors सहित Alan Cathcart, Sammy Miller, Nick Jefferies and Mick Grant also completed the Re-enactment lap.

Unemployment ( or joblessness ) occurs जब people are without work and actively seeking work.
The unemployment rate is a माप of the prevalence of unemployment and it is calculated as a percentage by dividing the number of unemployed individuals by all individuals currently in the labor force.
During periods of recession, an economy usually experiences a अपेक्षाकृत ऊँची unemployment rate.
according to International Labour Organization report, more than 197 million लोगों globally are out of work or 6 % of the world 's workforce were without a job in 2012.
वहीँ remains considerable theoretical बहस regarding the causes, consequences and solutions for unemployment.
Classical economics, New classical economics, and the Austrian School of economics argue कि market mechanisms are reliable means of resolving unemployment.
ये theories argue against interventions imposed on the labor market from the outside, such as unionization, minimum wage laws, taxes, and other regulations that they claim discourage the hiring of workers.
Keynesian अर्थशास्त्र emphasizes the cyclical nature of unemployment and recommends government interventions in the economy that it दावा will reduce unemployment दौरान recessions.
This theory focuses on recurrent shocks that suddenly reduce aggregate demand for goods and services and thus reduce demand for workers.
Keynesian models recommend government interventions designed to increase demand for workers ; these can include financial stimuli, publicly funded job creation, and expansionist monetary policies.
In addition to these comprehensive theories of unemployment, there are a few categorizations of unemployment that are used to more precisely model the effects of unemployment within the economic system.
The main types of unemployment include structural बेरोजगारी which focuses on structural problems in the economy and inefficiencies inherent in labour markets, including a mismatch between the supply and demand of laborers with necessary skill sets.
Structural वितर्क emphasize कल्याणकारी and solutions related to disruptive technologies and globalization.
Discussions of frictional unemployment focus on voluntary decisions to कार्य आधारित on प्रत्येक individuals ' valuation of their own work and how that compares to current wage rates plus the time and effort required to find a job.
Causes and solutions for frictional unemployment प्रायः address job entry threshold and wage rates.
Behavioral economists highlight individual biases in decision making, and often involve problems and solutions concerning sticky wages and efficiency wages.
Collectivism is any philosophic, political, religious, economic, or social outlook that emphasizes the interdependence of every इंसान being in a society or civilization.
Collectivism is a basic cultural element that exists as the reverse of individualism in इंसान nature ( in the same way high context culture exists as the reverse of low context culture ).
collectivist orientations stress the importance of cohesion within social groups ( ऐसे as an `` in-group '', in कया विशिष्ट context it is पारिभाषित ) and in some cases, the priority of group goals over individual goals.
Collectivists often focus on community, society, nation or country.
It has महरूम used as an element in अनेक different and diverse types of government and political, economic और educational philosophies throughout history और most human societies in practice contain elements of both individualism and collectivism.
Some examples of collectivist संस्कृतियों include India and Japan.
Collectivism can be divided into horizontal collectivism and vertical collectivism.
Horizontal collectivism stresses collective decision-making among equal individuals, and is thus प्रायः आधारित on decentralization and egalitarianism.
Vertical collectivism is based on hierarchical structures of power and on moral and cultural conformity, and is therefore based on centralization and hierarchy.
A cooperative enterprise would be an example of horizontal collectivism, whereas a military hierarchy would be an example of vertical collectivism.
Acute disseminated encephalomyelitis ( ADEM ) is an immune mediated disease of the brain.
It usually occurs following a viral infection but may appear following vaccination, bacterial or parasitic infection, or even appear spontaneously.
As it involves autoimmune demyelination, it is similar to multiple sclerosis, and is considered part of the Multiple sclerosis borderline diseases.
The incidence rate is about 8 per 1,000,000 people प्रति year.
Although it occurs in all ages, most reported cases are in children and adolescents, with the average age around 5 to 8 years old.
The mortality rate may be as high as 5 %, full recovery is seen in 50 to 75 % of cases, while up to 70 to 90 % recover with कुछ minor residual disability.
The औसत time to recover is one to छह months.
ADEM produces अनेक inflammatory lesions in the brain and spinal cord, particularly in the white matter.
Usually these are found in the subcortical and central श्वेत matter and cortical gray-white junction of both cerebral hemispheres, cerebellum, brainstem, और spinal cord, but periventricular श्वेत matter and gray पदार्थ of the cortex, thalami and basal ganglia may also be involved.
When the patient suffers more than एक demyelinating episode, it is called recurrent disseminated encephalomyelitis or multiphasic disseminated encephalomyelitis ( MDEM ).
The stomach is a muscular, hollow, dilated part of the पाचन system which functions as an important organ of the digestive tract in कुछ animals, including vertebrates, echinoderms, insects ( mid-gut ), and molluscs.
It is involved in the second phase of digestion, following mastication ( चबाने ).
The पेट is located between the esophagus and the small intestine.
It secretes protein-digesting enzymes called protease and दमदार acids to aid in food digestion, ( sent to it via esophageal peristalsis ) through smooth muscular contortions ( called segmentation ) before sending partially पचता food ( chyme ) to the small intestines.
The word stomach is derived इससे the Latin stomachus which is derived from the Greek word stomachos ( στόμαχος ), ultimately from stoma ( ), `` mouth ''.
The words gastro- and gastric ( meaning related to the stomach ) are both निकला इससे the Greek word gaster ( ).
1940 Pontiac Special श्रेणी 25 Woodie
A woodie is a car body style, especially a स्टेशन wagon, where the rear bodywork is constructed of wood framework with infill panels of wood or painted metal.
After the demise of actual wood construction, manufacturers used simulated woodgrain sheet vinyl—sometimes augmented with three-dimensional, simulated framework—to recall wood construction.
in 2008, wood construction was evoked abstractly on the Ford Flex with a series of side और rear horizontal grooves.
A pearl is a hard object produced within the soft tissue ( specifically the mantle ) of a living shelled mollusc.
Just like the shell of a clam, a pearl is बना up of calcium carbonate in minute crystalline form, which has been deposited in concentric layers.
The ideal pearl is perfectly round and smooth, but many other shapes of pearls ( baroque pearls ) occur.
The finest quality natural pearls have been highly valued as gemstones और objects of beauty for many centuries, and because of this, the word pearl has become a metaphor for something very rare, fine, admirable, and मूल्यवान.
The most valuable pearls occur spontaneously in the जंगली, but they हैं extremely विरल.
These wild pearls are referred to as natural pearls.
Cultured or farmed मोती from pearl oysters and freshwater mussels make up the majority of those that are currently sold.
Imitation pearls are also widely sold in inexpensive jewelry, but the quality of their iridescence is usually very poor, and often, artificial pearls are easily distinguished from genuine pearls.
मोती have been harvested and cultivated primarily लिये use in jewelry, but in the past they यहूद also सिले onto lavish clothing.
Pearls have also been कुचल and used in cosmetics, medicines, and in paint formulations.
Whether wild or cultured, gem quality pearls are लगभग always nacreous and, as is the आंतरिक of the shell that produces them.
However, almost all species of shelled molluscs are capable of producing मोती ( formally referred to as `` calcareous concretions '' by some sources ) of lesser shine or less spherical shape.
Although these may also be legitimately referred to as `` मोती '' by gemological labs and also under U.S. Federal Trade Commission rules, and are formed in the same way, most of them have no value, except as curiosities.
Bing ( known previously as Live Search, Windows Live Search, और MSN Search ) is a वेब search engine ( advertised as a `` decision engine `` ) from Microsoft.
Bing was unveiled by Microsoft CEO Steve बाल्मर on May 28, 2009 at the All Things Digital conference in San Diego for release on June 1.
Notable changes include the listing of search suggestions while queries are entered and a list of सम्बन्धित searches ( called `` explore pane '' ) based on semantic technology from Powerset which Microsoft purchased in 2008.
On July 29, 2009, Microsoft और Yahoo ! announced a deal in which Bing would power Yahoo ! Search.
All Yahoo ! Search global customers and partners are अपेक्षित to have made the transition by जल्दी 2012.
In October 2011, Bing announced it was working on new back-end search infrastructure, with the goal of delivering faster और slightly more relevant search results for users.
Known as `` Tiger '', the new index-serving technology has been incorporated into Bing globally, since अगस्त 2011.
In May 2012, Bing घोषित another redesign of इसके search engine that includes `` Sidebar '', a social विशेषता that searches users ' social networks for information relevant to the search query.
A diagram showing an I Formation on offense and a 4-3 Formation on defense
In American football, each team रै eleven players on the फ़ील्ड at one time.
The specific भूमिका कि a खिलाड़ी takes on the field is called their position.
अंतर्गत the modern rules of American football, टीमों are allowed unlimited subsititutions, that is teams may change any number of players बाद any play.
This has resulted in the development of three `` platoons '' of players, the ठोकर ( the team with the ball, who is trying to score ), the defense ( the team trying to prevent the other team from scoring, and to take the ball from them ), and the special teams ( who खेल in kicking situations ).
Within those platoons, various specific स्थितियाँ exist depending on what the player 's main job is.
The Irish people ( or na hÉireannaigh ; Ulster-Scots : Airish fowk ) are an ethnic group who originate in Ireland, an island in northwestern यूरोपीय.
Ireland रै महरूम populated for around 9,000 years ( according to archaeological studies, see Prehistoric आयरलैंड ).
The Irish people 's earliest ancestors are recorded in महापुरूष – वे are claimed to be descended from groups such as the Nemedians, Fomorians, Fir Bolg, Tuatha Dé Danann and the Milesians.
Lebor Gabála Érenn, a book of Irish mythology tells that Milesians were Scythian descendants.
The main groups that interacted with the Irish in the Middle Ages include the Picts, Scots, और the Vikings.
Due to this contact, Icelanders are noted for having some Irish descent.
The Anglo-Norman आक्रमण of the High Middle Ages, the English plantations and the subsequent English rule of the country introduced the Normans and Flemish into Ireland.
Welsh, Picts, Bretons, और small parties of Gauls and भी anglo-saxons are known in आयरलैंड from much पहले टाइम्स.
There have been many notable आयरिश people throughout history.
The 6th century Irish monk and missionary Columbanus is regarded as एक of the `` fathers of Europe '', followed by Kilian of Würzburg and Vergilius of Salzburg.
The scientist Robert Boyle is considered the `` father of chemistry ``.
Famous Irish explorers include Brendan the Navigator, Robert McClure, Ernest Shackleton and Tom Crean.
By कुछ खाते, the first यूरोपीय child born in North America had Irish descent on both sides ; and an irishman was the first European to set foot on American soil in Columbus ' expedition of 1492.
वहीँ are descendants of Irish people जीना in many western countries, particularly in english-speaking countries.
Historically, emigration has been caused by politics, famine and economic issues.
An estimated 50 to 80 million people हैं descendants of Irish people, primarily in the United Kingdom, the संयुक्त States, Australia, Canada and Iceland ; there are also smaller numbers in Argentina, चिली, Mexico, जमैका, Barbados, South Africa, New Zealand, France, Germany and Brazil.
The largest number of वंशजों of Irish people live in the United States.
The number of people living in Australia who are of Irish descent is higher, as a percentage of total population, than that of कोई other country.
Approximately forty percent of the settlement population of Iceland came इससे Ireland or Scotland.
The very first inhabitants of Iceland were आयरिश.
the Hubble Space Telescope ( HST ) is a space telescope that was carried into orbit by a Space Shuttle in 1990 and remains in operation.
a aperture telescope in low Earth orbit, Hubble 's four प्रमुख instruments observe in the near ultraviolet, visible, और near infrared.
the telescope is नामित after the astronomer Edwin Hubble.
Hubble 's orbit outside the distortion of Earth 's माहौल allows it to take extremely sharp images with almost no background light.
Hubble 's Deep Field have been some of the most विस्तृत visible-light images ever, allowing a deep view into space and समय.
Many Hubble observations have led to breakthroughs in astrophysics, such as accurately determining the rate of expansion of the ब्रह्मांड.
Although not the first space telescope, हबल is one of the largest and most बहुमुखी, and is well known as both a vital research tool and a public relations boon for astronomy.
The HST was built by the United States space agency NASA, with contributions from the European Space Agency, and is operated by the Space Telescope Science Institute.
The hst is one of NASA 's Great Observatories, along with the Compton Gamma Ray वेधशाला, the Chandra X-ray Observatory, and the Spitzer Space Telescope.
Space telescopes were proposed as early as 1923.
Hubble was funded in the 1970s, साथ a proposed launch in 1983, but the project was beset by technical delays, budget problems, and the Challenger disaster.
When finally launched in 1990, scientists found that the main mirror had been मैदान incorrectly, compromising the telescope 's capabilities.
The दूरदर्शी was restored to its intended quality by a servicing मिशन in 1993.
Hubble is the only telescope designed to be serviced in space by astronauts.
Between 1993 and 2002, चार missions repaired, upgraded, and replaced systems on the telescope ; a fifth mission was canceled on safety grounds following the Columbia disaster.
However, after spirited public discussion, NASA administrator Mike Griffin approved एक final servicing mission, completed in 2009 by Space शटल Atlantis.
The telescope is now expected to function until at तनिक 2013.
इसके scientific successor, the James Webb Space Telescope ( JWST ), is to be launched in 2018 or possibly later.
Anti-inflammatory refers to the property of a substance or treatment that reduces inflammation.
anti-inflammatory drugs make up about half of analgesics, remedying pain by reducing inflammation as opposed to opioids, which affect the central nervous system.
The Tonight Show is a US late-night talk show that has aired on NBC since 1954.
It is the longest currently running regularly scheduled entertainment program in the US and the third longest-running show on NBC after Meet the Press and आज.
The Tonight Show was hosted by Steve Allen ( 1954–1957 ), Jack Paar ( 1957–1962 ), Johnny Carson ( 1962–1992 ), Jay Leno ( 1992–2009, 2010–present ), and कोनन O'Brien ( 2009–2010 ).
Several guest hosts also appeared, particularly during the Paar and Carson eras.
The longest-serving मेजबान to date was Johnny Carson, who hosted The Tonight Show Starring Johnny Carson लिये 30 सीज़न from the fall of 1962 through the वसन्त of 1992.
The current host of the दिखाएँ is jay Leno, who had previously hosted the show from 1992 to 2009 और began his second tenure on March 1, 2010.
on April 3, 2013, NBC announced Jimmy Fallon would become the new host of The tonight Show.
The Tonight Show with Jimmy fallon will premiere February 24, 2014, the day after the closing ceremonies of the 2014 Winter Olympics.
SS एंड्रिया Doria.
Pronounced was an ocean liner for the Italian Line ( Società di navigazione Italia ) घर ported in Genoa, Italy, सबसे famous लिये its sinking in 1956, when 52 people died ( 51 from immediate impact ).
Named बाद the 16th-century Genoese admiral Andrea Doria, the ship had a gross register tonnage of 29,100 and a capacity of about 1,200 passengers and 500 क्रू.
For a country attempting to rebuild its economy and reputation after World War II, Andrea Doria was an icon of इतालवी national pride.
of सब Italy 's ships at the time, Andrea Doria was the largest, fastest and supposedly safest.
Launched on 16 June 1951, the ship undertook its maiden voyage on 14 January 1953.
On 25 July 1956, while the Andrea Doria was approaching the coast of Nantucket, Massachusetts, bound for New यॉर्क City, the eastbound of the स्वीडिश American Line collided with it in what became one of history 's most infamous maritime disasters.
struck in the side, the top-heavy एंड्रिया Doria immediately started to list severely to starboard, जिससे left half of its lifeboats unusable.
the consequent shortage of lifeboats might have resulted in significant loss of life, but the efficiency of the ship 's technical design allowed it to stay afloat for over 11 hours after the ramming.
The good बर्ताव of the crew, improvements in communications and the रैपिड जवाब of other ships averted a disaster similar in scale to that of the in 1912.
1,660 passengers and crew were rescued and survived, while 46 people died as a consequence of the collision.
The evacuated luxury लाइनर capsized and sank the following morning.
This accident remains the worst maritime disaster to occur in United States waters since the sinking of the in 1915.
The incident and its aftermath were heavily covered by the news मीडिया.
While the rescue efforts were दोनो successful and commendable, the cause of the collision with the Stockholm and the loss of Andrea Doria generated much interest in the media and many lawsuits.
Largely because of an out-of-court settlement agreement between the two shipping companies during hearings immediately after the disaster, no determination of the cause ( s ) was ever formally published.
Although greater blame appeared initially to fall on the Italian लाइनर, अधिक recent discoveries have indicated कि a misreading of रडार on the Swedish ship may have initiated the टक्कर कोर्स, leading to errors on both ships.
Andrea Doria was the last major transatlantic passenger vessel to डूबना before aircraft became the preferred method of travel.
Dialysis tubing
Dialysis tubing is a type of सेमi- or partially permeable membrane tubing made from regenerated cellulose or cellophane.
It can be used for diffusion साथ solutes or osmosis if used with जल only.
Osmosis is when water passes through a semi-permeable layer to reach equilibrium.
Diffusion, on the other hand, allows the movement of अणुओं from high concentration to कम concentration.
It will only allow molecules to pass through a semi-permeable membrane or layer if the molecule is छोटी enough to fit through the membrane or a membrane 's pore.
This usually results with the effects of diffusion through a membrane only really affects small अणुओं, and almost never larger molecules.
Dialysis tubing is used in clinical circumstances to ensure a filtered flow of molecules, preventing the flow of larger solute molecules.
Small molecules can be `` washed '' out of a solution which is pumped through the tubing into a solvent, usually water, which surrounds it and in which they can be flushed away.
In demonstrations of semi-permeable झिल्लियों, a solution containing several types of molecules, usually glucose and starch, is placed into a semi-permeable dialysis bag, such as a cellulose membrane with pores, and the bag is sealed with a गांठ or elastic band.
the sealed डायलिसिस bag is placed in a container of a different solution, or water.
Molecules small enough to pass through the tubing ( water, salts, monosaccharides, and other small molecules ) tend to move into or out of the dialysis bag in the direction of decreasing concentration, therefore displaying diffusion.
Larger अणुओं ( such as proteins, or polysaccharides ) that have dimensions significantly greater than the pore diameter are retained inside the dialysis bag.
The water and smaller solutes in a hypotonic समाधान ( a solution that has a lesser solute concentration than the solution it is संदर्भित to ) will cross a semi-permeable झिल्ली, like dialysis tubing, into a hypertonic solution ( a solution that has a higher solute concentration than the solution it is referenced to ) in an attempt to reach equilibrium, where the solute concentration of each solution is in संतुलन.
Mercury laboratory thermometer
A थर्मामीटर ( from the Greek, thermos, meaning `` hot '' and μἐτρον, metron, `` measure '' ) is a device that measures temperature or temperature gradient using a variety of different सिद्धान्त.
A thermometer has दो important elements : the temperature sensor ( e.g. the bulb on a mercury-in-glass thermometer ) in which some physical change occurs with temperature, plus some means of converting this physical change into a numerical value ( e.g. the दृश्य scale that is चिह्नित on a mercury-in-glass thermometer ).
There are many types and many uses लिये thermometers, as detailed below in sections of this article.
Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs is a 1937 American animated musical fantasy film produced by Walt Disney and released by RKO Radio Pictures.
Based on the German परी tale by the Brothers grimm, it is the first full-length cel animated feature फिल्मी and the earliest in the Walt Disney Animated क्लासिक series.
The story was adapted by storyboard artists डोरोथी Ann रिक्त, Richard Creedon, Merrill De Maris, Otto Englander, Earl Hurd, Dick Rickard, Ted Sears and Webb Smith.
David Hand was the supervising director, while William cottrell, Wilfred Jackson, Larry Morey, Perce Pearce, and Ben sharpsteen directed the film 's individual sequences.
Snow White premiered at the Carthay वृत्त Theatre on December 21, 1937, followed by a nationwide release on February 4, 1938, and with international earnings of $ 8 million during its initial रिलीज briefly assumed the record of उच्चतम grossing ध्वनि फिल्मी at the time.
The popularity of the film has led to it being re-released theatrically many times, until its home video release in the 1990s.
Adjusted for inflation, it is one of the top ten performers at the North American box office.
At the 11th Academy Awards, Walt Disney was awarded an honorary Oscar, and the film was nominated for Best Musical Score.
It was added to the United राज्य नेशनल Film रजिस्ट्री in 1989 and is ranked in the अमरीकी Film Institute 's list of the 100 greatest American films, who also named the film as the greatest American animated film of सब time in 2008.
Disney 's take on the परी tale रै had a big cultural impact, resulting in a popular theme park attraction, a video game, and a Broadway musical.
Childbirth, labour, delivery, birth, partus, or parturition is the culmination of a pregnancy period साथ the expulsion of one or more newborn infants from a woman 's uterus.
The process of normal childbirth is categorized in three stages of labour : the shortening and dilation of the cervix, descent and birth of the infant, and birth of the placenta.
In many मामले and साथ increasing आवृत्ति, childbirth is achieved through induction of labor or caesarean section, which is the removal of the neonate through a surgical incision in the abdomen, rather than through vaginal birth.
Childbirth by C-Sections increased 50 % in the U.S. from 1996 to 2006, and comprise nearly 32 % of births in the U.S. and Canada.
With respect to induced labor, more than 22 % of women undergo induction of labour in the United States.
Medical पेशेवर policy makers find that induced births and elective cesarean can be harmful to the fetus and neonate as well as नुकसानदेह or without benefit to the mother, and have established strict guidelines for non-medically indicated induced births and elective cesarean पहले 39 weeks.

The show ran for 5 सीज़न between 2003 और 2005.
Flushed Away is a 2006 British/American computer animated action / adventure comedy film directed by David Bowers and Sam गिरी.
It थी made in the साझेदारी between Aardman Animations and DreamWorks Animation, and is Aardman 's पहला completely computer-animated feature as opposed to the usual stop-motion.
The film stars the आवाज़ talents of Hugh Jackman, Kate विंसलेट, Andy Serkis, Bill Nighy, Ian McKellen, Shane Richie and Jean Reno.
The story थी by sam Fell, Peter Lord, Dick Clement, and Ian La frenais, and the screenplay was written by Dick Clement, Ian La Frenais, क्रिस्टोफर Lloyd, Joe Keenan, और William Davies.
The film was released in US on 3 November 2006, और in UK on December 1 2006, and was distributed by Paramount Pictures, मगर लिये Switzerland, Spain, and the Netherlands, which were handled by Universal Pictures.
The Atlanta Braves are a professional baseball team based in Atlanta.
the Braves are a member of the Eastern Division of Major League Baseball 's National League.
The Braves have played in टर्नर Field चूंकि 1997.
The `` braves '' name, which was first used in 1912, originates from a term for a Native अमरीकी warrior.
They are nicknamed `` the bravos '', and often referred to as `` अमेरिका 's Team `` in reference to the team 's games being broadcast on the nationally उपलब्धियाँ TBS from the 1970s until 2007, gaining a wide fanbase.
From 1991 to 2005 the Braves were one of the most successful franchises in baseball, winning division titles an unprecedented 14 consecutive times in that period ( omitting the strike-shortened 1994 season in which there were no official division champions ).
The Braves won the NL West 1991–93 and the NL East 1995–2005, and returned to the playoffs as the National League Wild कार्ड in 2010.
The Braves advanced to the World Series five times in the 1990s, जीतना the शीर्षक in 1995.
Since उनके डेब्यू in the National League in 1876, the franchise has won 16 divisional शीर्षक, 17 National League pennants, as well as three World Series championships—in 1914 as the Boston Braves, in 1957 as the Milwaukee Braves, and in 1995 in Atlanta.
the Braves are the only MLB franchise to have won the World Series in तीन different home cities.
The club is one of the नेशनल लीग 's two remaining charter franchises ( the अन्य being the Chicago Cubs ) and was founded in Boston, Massachusetts, in 1871 as the Boston Red stockings ( not to be उलझन with the American League 's बोस्टन Red Sox ).
They are considered `` the oldest continuously playing टोली in major North अमरीकी sports. ''
There is an argument as to who is actually older because although the Cubs हैं a full season `` older '' ( formed as the Chicago White stockings in 1870 ) Chicago lost two seasons to the Great Chicago Fire, thus the braves have played more consecutive seasons.
After various name changes ( such as the Boston Beaneaters ), the team operated as the Boston Braves for most of the first half of the 20th century.
In 1953, the team moved to Milwaukee, Wisconsin and became the Milwaukee Braves, followed by the मूव to अटलांटा in 1966.
The team 's tenure in Atlanta is famous for Hank Aaron breaking Babe Ruth 's career home run record in 1974, though the majority of आरोन 's home runs were hit जबकि the team was in Milwaukee.
His रिकार्ड stood until 2007, when सैन Francisco left क्षेत्ररक्षक Barry Bonds broke the record.
The leaves of a Beech tree
3D rendering of a μCT scan of a leaf piece, resolution circa 40 μm/ voxel.
A leaf is an organ of a vascular plant, as defined in botanical terms, and in particular in plant morphology.
Foliage is a mass noun that refers to leaves as a feature of plants.
Typically a leaf is a thin, flattened organ borne above ground and specialized for photosynthesis, but many प्रकार of leaves are adapted in ways almost unrecognisable in those terms : some are not flat ( for example many रसीले leaves and conifers ), some are not above ground ( such as bulb तराजू ), and some are without major photosynthetic function ( consider for example cataphylls, spines, and cotyledons ).
Conversely, many structures of non-vascular plants, or even of some lichens, which are not plants at all ( in the sense of being members of the kingdom Plantae ), do look and फलन much like leaves.
Furthermore, several structures found in vascular plants look like leaves but are नहीं दरअसल leaves ; वे differ from leaves in their structures and origins.
Examples include phyllodes, cladodes, and phylloclades.
Title card for the 1937 Our Gang comedy Rushin ' Ballet.
Our Gang ( also known as The Little Rascals or Hal Roach 's Rascals ) are a series of American comedy short films about a group of poor neighborhood children and their adventures.
Created by comedy producer Hal Roach, the श्रेणी is noted for showing children behaving in a relatively natural way, as Roach and original director Robert F. McGowan worked to film the unaffected, raw nuances apparent in regular children rather than have उन्हें imitate adult acting styles.
In addition, Our Gang notably put boys, girls, whites and blacks साथ in a group as equals, something that `` broke नई मैदान, '' according to film historian Leonard Maltin.
Such a thing had never been done before in cinema but has since महरूम दोहराया after the success of Our Gang.
The first production at the Roach studio in 1922 was a series of silent short subjects.
When Roach changed distributors from Pathé to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer ( MGM ) in 1927, and converted the series to sound in 1929, the series took off even further.
Production continued at the Roach studio until 1938, when the series was sold to MGM, who then continued producing the comedies until 1944.
The Our Gang series includes a total of 220 shorts and one feature film, General Spanky, featuring over forty-one child actors.
As MGM retained the rights to the Our Gang trademark following their purchase of the production rights, the 80 Roach-produced `` टॉकीज़ '' were syndicated लिये television under the title The Little Rascals beginning in 1955.
Both Roach 's The Little Rascals package ( now स्वामित्व by CBS Television Distribution ) and MGM 's Our Gang package ( now स्वामित्व by warner Bros. Entertainment ) have since remained in syndication, with periodic नई productions based on the shorts surfacing over the years, including a 1994 Little Rascals feature film released by Universal तस्वीरें.
zacharias Janssen ( भी Zacharias Jansen or Sacharias Jansen ) ( b.1580-88, d.pre-1632 to 1638 ) was a Dutch spectacle-maker from Middelburg associated with the invention of the first optical telescope.
Janssen is sometimes also credited for inventing the पहला truly compound microscope.
However, the origin of the microscope, just like the origin of the दूरदर्शी, is a matter of debate.
Lake Tahoe ( ; Washo : dáʔaw ) is a large freshwater lake in the Sierra Nevada of the United States.
At a surface elevation of, it is स्तिथ along the border between California and Nevada, west of Carson City.
Lake Tahoe is the largest alpine lake in North America.
Its गहराई is, making it the United State 's second-deepest ( the deepest is crater झील in Oregon, होने deeper, at ).
Additionally, Lake Tahoe is listed as the 26th largest lake by volume in the world at.
The lake was formed about 2 million years ago and is a भाग of the Lake Tahoe Basin with the modern झील being shaped during the ice आयु.
It is known for the clarity of its water and the panorama of surrounding mountains on all sides.
The area surrounding the lake is also referred to as Lake Tahoe, or simply Tahoe.
Lake Tahoe is a major tourist attraction in both Nevada and California.
It is home to a number of ski resorts, summer outdoor recreation, and tourist attractions.
Snow and skiing are a significant part of the area 's economy and reputation.
Mountain and lake scenery are attractions throughout the year.
The Nevada side also includes विशाल casinos.
Highways provide year-round access from Reno, Carson नगर, and Sacramento.

The Twenty-seventh Amendment ( Amendment XXVII ) prohibits any law that increases or decreases the salary of members of the Congress from taking effect until the start of the next set of terms of office for Representatives.
It is the most recent amendment to the United States Constitution.
It was submitted to the states for ratification in 1789 and was adopted in 1992.
“First they came... ” is a famous statement and provocative poem attributed to pastor Martin Niemöller ( 1892–1984 ) about the sloth of जर्मनी intellectuals following the Nazis ' rise to power and the subsequent purging of their chosen targets, group after group.
There is some disagreement over the exact wording of the quotation and when it was created ; the content of the quotation may have been presented differently by Niemöller on different occasions.

Four Thirds logo
The Four Thirds प्रणाली is a standard created by Olympus and Kodak लिये digital single-lens reflex camera ( DSLR ) design and development. < ref name='DPReview.com 2001-02-13 ' >
the system provides a standard that, with digital cameras और lenses available from अनेक manufacturers, allows for the interchange of lenses and bodies from different manufacturers.
seems to cover the standard.
Proponents describe it as an open standard, लकिन companies may तभी use it under a non-disclosure agreement.
Unlike older SLR systems, Four तिहाई has been designed from the ground up to be entirely digital.
Many lenses are extensively computerized, to the पाइंट that Olympus offers firmware updates for many of them.
Lens design has been tailored to the requirements of digital sensors, most notably through telecentric designs.
The size of the sensor is significantly smaller than for most DSLRs and इस implies that lenses, especially telephoto lenses, can be smaller.
लिये example, a Four Thirds lens साथ a 300 mm focal length would cover about the same angle of view as a 600 mm focal length lens for the 35 mm film standard, and is correspondingly अधिक compact.
Thus, the Four Thirds System has crop factor ( focal length multiplier ) of about 2, and while this enables longer focal length for वृहद magnification, it करता n't aid the manufacture of wide angle lenses.
The image sensor format, generally intermediate between those of larger SLRs and छोटी compact cameras, generally gives levels of cost, performance and convenience intermediate between those दो वर्ग.
HVAC प्रणालियों use ventilation air ducts installed throughout a building to सप्लाई conditioned एयर to a room through आउटलेट vents, called diffusers ; and ducts to remove air through return-air grilles.
HVAC ( heating, ventilation, and air conditioning ) is the technology of indoor and automotive environmental comfort.
HVAC system design is a subdiscipline of mechanical engineering, based on the principles of thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and heat transfer.
Refrigeration is sometimes added to the field 's abbreviation as HVAC & R or HVACR, or ventilating is dropped as in HACR ( such as the designation of HACR-rated circuit breakers ).
HVAC is important in the design of medium to विशाल industrial and office buildings such as skyscrapers and in marine environments such as aquariums, where safe और healthy building शर्तें हैं regulated with respect to temperature and humidity, using fresh air from outdoors.
Ventilation on the downdraught system, by impulsion, or the 'plenum ' principle, applied to schoolrooms ( 1899 )
Heating, ventilating, and air conditioning is based on inventions and discoveries made by निकोलय Lvov, Michael Faraday, Willis Carrier, Reuben Trane, James Joule, William Rankine, sadi Carnot, and many others.
The invention of the components of HVAC systems went hand-in-hand with the औद्योगिक revolution, and new methods of modernization, higher efficiency, and system control are constantly introduced by companies and inventors worldwide.
The three central functions of heating, ventilating, and air-conditioning are interrelated, especially with the need to provide thermal comfort and acceptable indoor एयर quality within reasonable संस्थापना, operation, and maintenance costs.
HVAC systems can provide ventilation, reduce air infiltration, and maintain pressure relationships between spaces.
The अर्थात् of air delivery and removal from spaces is known as room air distribution.
The starting point in carrying out an estimate both लिये कूलिंग and heating depends on the exterior जलवायु and interior specified शर्तें.
However before taking up the heat load calculation, it is necessary to find fresh air requirements for प्रत्येक क्षेत्रफल in detail, as pressurization is an important consideration.
In modern buildings the design, installation, and control systems of these functions are integrated into one or more HVAC systems.
For बहुत small buildings, ठेकेदारों normally capacity engineer and select hvac systems and equipment.
For larger buildings, building services designers and engineers, such as mechanical, architectural, or building services engineers analyze, design, and specify the HVAC systems, and specialty mechanical contractors fabricate and commission them.
Building permits and code-compliance inspections of the installations are normally required for all sizes of buildings.
The hvac industry is a worldwide enterprise, with roles including operation and maintenance, system डिज़ाइन and construction, equipment manufacturing and sales, and in शिक्षा and research.
The HVAC industry was historically regulated by the manufacturers of HVAC equipment, लकिन regulating and standards संगठन such as HARDI, ASHRAE, SMACNA, ACCA, Uniform Mechanical कोड, International Mechanical Code, and AMCA have महरूम established to support the industry and encourage high standards and achievement.
Royal Navy Commander James Bond, CMG, rnvr, is a fictional character created by British पत्रकार and novelist Ian Fleming in 1953.
He is the protagonist of the जेम्स Bond series of novels, films, comics and video games.
फ्लेमिंग wrote twelve Bond novels and two short story collections before his death, हालांकि the last two books— The Man with the Golden Gun and Octopussy and The Living Daylights —were published मरणोपरांत.
The Bond अक्षर is a Secret सेवा agent, code number 007, residing in London but active internationally.
Bond was a composite character who was based on a number of commandos whom Fleming knew during उसके service in the Naval Intelligence Division during World War II, to whom Fleming added his own स्टाइल और a number of his own tastes ; Bond 's name was appropriated from American ornithologist James Bond.
Bond has a number of character traits which चलाएं throughout the books, सहित an enjoyment of cars, a love of food and drink, and an average intake of sixty custom-made cigarettes a दिन.
Since Fleming 's death in 1964, there have been other authorised writers of Bond material, including John Gardner, who wrote fourteen novels and two novelizations and Raymond Benson, who wrote six novels, three novelizations and three short stories.
There have also been three authors जो wrote एक book each, Kingsley Amis ( writing as रॉबर्ट Markham ), Sebastian Faulks and Jeffery Deaver.
Additionally a series of novels based on Bond 's youth— Young Bond —was written by Charlie higson.
As spin-offs from the literary works, there was a television adaptation of the first novel, Casino Royale, in which Bond was played as an American agent.
A comic strip series also ran in the Daily Express समाचारपत्र.
There have भी been twenty-five बंध films ; seven actors have played Bond in these films.
`` Nature Boy '' is a song by Eden ahbez, published in 1947.
The song tells a fantasy of a `` strange enchanted boy... who wandered very far '' only to learn that `` the greatest thing... was just to love and be loved in return ''.
Nat King Cole 's 1948 recording of the song थी a major hit and `` Nature Boy '' has since become a pop and jazz मानक, with dozens of major artists interpreting the song.
Louisiana ( or ;, ; Louisiana क्रियोल : Léta de la Lwizyàn ) is a state located in the southern region of the United States of अमेरिका.
Louisiana is the 31st most extensive and the 25th most populous of the 50 United States.
Its पूंजी is Baton Rouge and largest city is New Orleans.
Louisiana is the only state in the U.S. with political subdivisions termed parishes, which are local सरकारी 's equivalent to counties.
The largest parish by population is East Baton Rouge Parish, and the largest by land area is Cameron मोहल्ला.
Much of the state 's lands were formed from sediment washed down the Mississippi River, leaving enormous deltas और vast areas of तटीय दलदल and swamp.
These contain a rich southern biota ; typical उदाहरण include birds such as ibis and egrets.
There are also many species of tree frogs, and fish such as sturgeon and paddlefish.
In more elevated क्षेत्रों, fire is a प्राकृतिक process in the landscape, and has produced extensive areas of longleaf pine forest and wet savannas.
These support an exceptionally large number of plant प्रजाति, including many species of orchids and carnivorous plants.
Some Louisiana urban environments have a multicultural, multilingual heritage, being so strongly influenced by an admixture of 18th-century French, Spanish, Native American ( Indian ) और African cultures that they are considered to be somewhat exceptional in the U.S.
Before the American खरीदें of the territory, the current Louisiana State had been both a Spanish और French colony.
In addition, the pattern of development included importing numerous African slaves in the 18th century, with many from the same प्रदेश of West Africa, thus concentrating their culture.
In the post-Civil War environment, anglo-americans increased the pressure for Anglicization, and in 1915, English was बना the only official language of the state.
Women 's अधिकारों are the अधिकारों and entitlements claimed लिये women and girls of many societies worldwide.
In some places these rights are institutionalized or supported by law, local custom, and behaviour, whereas in अन्य they may be ignored or suppressed.
They differ from broader notions of human rights through claims of an inherent historical and traditional bias against the exercise of rights by women and girls in पक्ष of men और boys.
Issues commonly associated with notions of महिलाओं 's rights include, though are not limited to, the right : to bodily integrity and autonomy ; to vote ( suffrage ) ; to hold public दफ्तर ; to work ; to fair wages or equal pay ; to own property ; to education ; to serve in the military or be conscripted ; to डालें into legal contracts ; and to have marital, parental and religious rights.
the laws of science or scientific कानून are कथन that describe, predict, and perhaps बताइये why, a range of phenomena behave as they appear to in nature.
The term `` law '' रै diverse usage in many cases : approximate, accurate, broad or narrow theories, in all natural scientific disciplines ( physics, chemistry, जीवविज्ञान, भूविज्ञान, astronomy etc. ).
An analogous term for a scientific law is a principle.
Scientific laws:
summarize a large collection of facts determined by experiment into a सिंगल statement,
can usually be formulated mathematically as one or several statements or equation, or at तनिक stated in a single sentence, so that it can be used to predict the outcome of an experiment, given the initial, boundary, and other physical conditions of the processes which take place,
are strongly supported by empirical evidence - they are scientific knowledge कि experiments have repeatedly verified ( and never falsified ).
Their accuracy does not change when new theories are worked out, but बल्कि the scope of application, चूंकि the equation ( if any ) representing the law does not change.
As with other scientific knowledge, they do not have absolute certainty like mathematical theorems or identities, and it is always possible for a law to be overturned by future observations.
are often quoted as a आधारभूत controlling influence rather than a description of observed facts.
I.e. `` the laws of motion require that ''
Laws differ इससे hypotheses और postulates, which हैं proposed during the scientific process before and during validation by experiment and observation.
These are not कानून since they have not been verified to the same degree और may not be sufficiently general, although वे may सीसे to the formulation of laws.
A विधि is a अधिक solidified and formal statement, distilled from repeated experiment.
Although the concepts of a law or principle in nature is borderline to philosophy, and presents the depth to जिससे गणित can describe nature, scientific laws are considered इससे a scientific perspective and follow the वैज्ञानिक method ; they `` serve their purpose '' rather than `` questioning reality '' ( philosophical ) or `` statements of logical absolution '' ( mathematical ).
For example, whether a law `` refers to reality '' is a philosophical issue, बल्कि than scientific.
Fundamentally, all scientific laws follow from physics, laws which occur in other sciences ultimately follow from physical laws.
Often, from mathematically fundamental viewpoints, सार्वभौमिक constants emerge from scientific laws.

The system was released seven days later on 17 November in the United States.
Introduction into अन्य world markets was delayed by a shortage of diodes for use in the Blu-ray disc player ; the device थी launched in European and other world markets in the first half of 2007.
Lauren Fenmore Baldwin ( formerly Williams और grainger ) is a fictional character from the CBS soap operas The यंग and the Restless और The Bold and the खूबसूरत, portrayed by Tracey E. Bregman.
She made her debut during the एपीसोड airing on January 21, 1983.
In 1992, Bregman began making sporadic appearances on The Bold and the Beautiful, later resulting in the character migrating there fully in 1995.

In 2013, it was announced that Bregman had महरूम placed on contract.
Much of Lauren 's history has revolved around her romances with Paul विलियम्स, Scott Grainger, Sr., and माइकल Baldwin among many others causing a fierce rivalry with Traci Abbott Connolly.
Lauren is also famous for her long, violent rivalry with Sheila Carter.
The 2010 NBA फाइनल was the National बास्केट Association ( NBA ) चैंपियनशिप series for the 2009–10 ऋतु.
The best-of-seven playoff was लडे between the Los Angeles Lakers, champions of the Western Conference and defending एनबीए champions, and the Boston Celtics, champions of the Eastern Conference.
The Lakers defeated the Celtics, four games to three, to win the मताधिकार 's 16th NBA championship.
The 64th edition of the championship श्रेणी was played between June 3 and June 17, was broadcast on ABC, and was watched by an average of 18.1 million people.
The Celtics earned their berth into the playoffs by winning the Atlantic Division.
The Lakers won the Pacific Division to earn their berth.
The Celtics reached the एनबीए Finals by defeating the Miami Heat in the best-of-seven Eastern Conference First Round, the Cleveland Cavaliers in the best-of-seven Eastern सम्मेलन Semifinals, and defending Eastern conference champion Orlando Magic in the best-of-seven Eastern Conference Finals.
The Lakers reached the NBA Finals by defeating the ओक्लाहोमा City Thunder in the best-of-seven Western Conference First Round, the Utah Jazz in the best-of-seven Western Conference Semifinals, and the Phoenix Suns in the best-of-seven Western Conference Finals.
The NBA Finals यहूद अनुसूचित in the Major League Baseball World Series 2–3–2 seven game format, with the Lakers possessing home-court लाभ as a reward for finishing with better regular season record than the Celtics.
Repeated baskets from starters Kobe Bryant, Pau Gasol, and रॉन Artest brought the Lakers close to विजय in Game 1.
A record तोड़कर प्रदर्शन from Ray Allen 's eight three-point baskets ensured the Celtics a Game 2 triumph.
Derek Fisher ’s 11 points in the fourth quarter helped the Lakers win Game 3.
the Celtics won खेल 4 ; it did n't hurt that they netted an excellent performance in baskets by the team’s reserves, while Paul Pierce led the team to a Game 5 win साथ 27 points on 57 % shooting from the floor.
The Lakers avoided elimination by जीतना a decisive Game 6 with 24 points contributed by their bench.
हालांकि they trailed the Celtics by 13 points जल्दी in the third quarter, the Lakers rallied and won their second consecutive championship by taking over an रोमांचक Game 7 aided by late contributions on offense by Pau Gasol and Artest and rebounding.
Bryant was named Most Valuable Player of the Finals for his second consecutive trophy.
This थी the first NBA Finals to go the full seven games since and only the fourth since the एनबीए Finals लौटे to a 2–3–2 format in.
The Laker मताधिकार has 16 NBA Championships ( Five in Minneapolis, 11 in Los Angeles ) trailing the Celtics ' seventeen championships.
The NBA Finals used the `` World Series '' Format in 1949 Minneapolis Lakers defeated the वॉशिंगटन Capitols 4 games to 2 ; in 1953 Minneapolis defeated the New York Knicks 4 games to 1 ; in 1954 Minneapolis पराजित the Syracuse Nationals 4 games to 3 ; and in 1955 Syracuse Nationals defeated the Fort Wayne Pistons 4 games to 3.
The NBA would return to the 2–2–1–1–1 National हॉकी League seven game series स्वरूप until 1985.
Black pepper ( Piper nigrum ) is a flowering बेल in the family Piperaceae, cultivated for its fruit, which is usually dried and used as a spice और seasoning.
The फल, known as a peppercorn when dried, is approximately in व्यास, dark red when fully mature, and, like all drupes, contains a single seed.
Peppercorns, and the मैदान pepper derived from them, may be described simply as pepper, or more precisely as black pepper ( cooked and dried unripe fruit ), green pepper ( dried unripe फल ) और श्वेत pepper ( dried ripe seeds ).
Black pepper is native to south India, and is extensively cultivated वहीँ and elsewhere in तीव्र regions.
Currently वियतनाम is the world 's largest producer and exporter of pepper, producing 34 % of the world 's Piper nigrum crop as of 2008.
सूखी ground pepper has been used since प्राचीनता for दोनो its flavour और as a medicine.
Black pepper is the world 's most traded spice.
It is एक of the most common मसाले added to यूरोपीय cuisine and its descendants.
The spiciness of black pepper is due to the chemical piperine, not to be confused with the capsaicin कि gives fleshy peppers theirs.
It is in the modern world, often paired with salt.
In cardiovascular physiology, ejection fraction ( EF ) represents the volumetric fraction of blood pumped out of the ventricle ( heart ) with each heart beat or cardiac cycle.
It can be applied to either the right ventricle which ejects via the pulmonary valve into the pulmonary circulation or the left ventricle which ejects via the aortic valve into the systemic परिसंचरण.
इमेजिंग of the physiology of the mammalian heart is the art that allows meaningful mathematical अभिव्यक्ति defining EF.
Noninvasive cardiac imaging has become a worldwide utility enabling पढ़ाई of cardiac performance reproducibly and inexpensively.
Simplified, Ejection fraction is a mathematical product allowed by cardiac imaging.
As a mathematical term, Ejection Fraction is an extension of the work of Adolph फिक in cardiac output.
Dedicated technology such as Echocardiography, Computed Tomography, Magnetic Resonance Imaging and MUGA scanning have definitively allowed clinically relevant गणित regarding Ischemia, Congenital Heart Disease and Heart Failure.
The prosecutor is the chief legal representative of the prosecution in countries with either the common law adversarial system, or the civil law inquisitorial system.
The prosecution is the विधिक party responsible for presenting the case in a criminal trial against an individual accused of breaking the law.

Abū al-Qāsim Muḥammad ibn ʿAbd Allāh ibn ʿAbd al-Muṭṭalib ibn Hāshim ( ) ( circa| 570 – circa| 8 June 632 ), also transliterated as Muhammad ( ), was a धार्मिक, political, and military leader from Mecca जो unified Arabia into a single religious polity under Islam.
He is believed by Muslims and Bahá'ís to be a messenger and prophet of God.
Muhammad is almost universally माना by Muslims as the last prophet sent by God for mankind.
Non-Muslims regard मुहम्मद as the founder of Islam.
मुसलमान consider him to be the restorer of an unaltered original monotheistic faith of Adam, नूह, Abraham, मूसा, Jesus, and other prophets.
Born in about 570 CE in the Arabian city of Mecca, he was orphaned at an early age and brought up under the care of his uncle Abu Talib.
he later worked mostly as a merchant, as well as a shepherd, and थी first married by age 25.
Being in the habit of periodically retreating to a गुफा in the surrounding mountains for several nights of seclusion and prayer, he later reported that it was there, at age 40, that he received his first revelation from God.
Three years after this event Muhammad started preaching ये revelations publicly, proclaiming that `` God is एक ``, that complete `` आत्मसमर्पण '' to Him ( lit.
islām ) is the only way ( dīn ) acceptable to परमेश्वर, and that he himself was a prophet and messenger of God, in the same vein as other Islamic prophets.
Muhammad gained few followers early on, and was met with hostility from some meccan tribes ; he and his followers यहूद treated harshly.
To एस्केप persecution, Muhammad sent some of his अनुसरणकर्ता to अबीसीनिया before he and his followers in Mecca migrated to Medina ( then known as Yathrib ) in the साल 622.
This event, the Hijra, marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar, which is भी known as the Hijri Calendar.
In Medina, Muhammad united the tribes under the Constitution of Medina.
After eight years of fighting with the Meccan tribes, his अनुसरणकर्ता, who by then had grown to 10,000, took control of Mecca in the largely peaceful Conquest of Mecca.
He destroyed the pagan idols in the city and then sent his अनुसरणकर्ता out to destroy all of the remaining pagan temples in Eastern Arabia.
in 632, a few months after returning to Medina from The Farewell Pilgrimage, Muhammad fell ill and died.
By the time of his death, most of the Arabian Peninsula had converted to Islam, and he had united अरब into a single मुस्लिम धार्मिक polity.
The revelations ( or Ayah, lit.
`` Signs [ of God ] '' ) — which Muhammad reported receiving until his death – form the verses of the Quran, regarded by Muslims as the `` Word of God '' and around which the धर्म is based.
Besides the Quran, Muhammad 's life ( sira ) and traditions ( sunnah ) are also upheld by Muslims as the sources of sharia law.
They discuss Muhammad and other prophets of Islam with reverence, adding the phrase peace be upon him whenever their names are mentioned.
While conceptions of Muhammad in medieval Christendom and premodern times यहूद largely negative, appraisals in modern history have been far less so.
The Great Books ( second edition )
Great Books of the Western World is a series of books originally प्रकाशित in the United States in 1952 by ब्रिटैनिका विश्वकोष Inc. to present the Great Books in a सिंगल package of 54 volumes.
The series is अभी in its second edition and contains 60 volumes.
The original editors of the series chose तीन criteria for inclusion : a book must be relevant to contemporary issues, and not तभी important in its historical context ; it must reward rereading ; and it must be a part of `` the great conversation परिचय the great ideas, '' relevant to at least 25 of the 102 ग्रेट विचार identified by the editors.
Books यहूद not chosen on the basis of ethnic or cultural inclusiveness, historical influence, or the editors ' अनुबंध with the views expressed.
`` Cocaine '' is a song written and recorded by JJ Cale in 1976, but also ज्ञात as a cover version recorded by Eric Clapton.
Allmusic calls the latter `` among [ क्लैप्टन 's ] most enduringly popular hits '' and notes that `` even for an artist like Clapton with a huge body of high-quality work, 'Cocaine ' ranks among his बेहतरीन. ''
Glyn Johns, who had previously worked साथ The Who, Led Zeppelin and The Rolling Stones, produced the Clapton recording, which was released on Clapton 's 1977 album Slowhand and as a single in 1980.
The live version of `` Cocaine '', from the Just One Night album recorded in Tokyo, charted on the Billboard Hot 100 as the B-side of `` तुलसा Time ``, which was a No. 30 hit in 1980. ``
Cocaine '' थी one of अनेक of Cale 's songs अंकित by Clapton, including `` After मध्यरात्रि `` and `` Travelin ' Light ''.
The attack on Pearl Harbor ( पुकारा Hawaii Operation or Operation AI by the Japanese Imperial General Headquarters ( Operation Z in planning ) and the Battle of पर्ल Harbor ) was a surprise military strike conducted by the Imperial Japanese Navy against the United राज्य naval base at Pearl हार्बर, Hawaii, on the morning of December 7, 1941 ( December 8 in Japan ).
From the standpoint of the defenders, the attack commenced at 7:48 a.m. Hawaiian Time.
The attack was intended as a preventive कार्रवाई in order to keep the U.S. Pacific Fleet इससे दखल with military actions the Empire of Japan थी planning in Southeast Asia against overseas territories of the United Kingdom, the Netherlands, and the United States.
The base was attacked by 353 Japanese fighters, bombers and torpedo planes in two waves, launched from six aircraft carriers.
सब eight U.S. Navy battleships यहूद क्षतिग्रस्त, with four being sunk.
Two of these यहूद later उठाया, and with the remaining four repaired, six battleships returned to service later in the war.
the Japanese also sank or damaged three cruisers, three destroyers, an anti-aircraft training ship, and one minelayer.
188 U.S. aircraft were destroyed ; 2,402 Americans were killed and 1,282 wounded.
Important base installations such as the power station, shipyard, maintenance, और fuel and torpedo भंडार facilities, as well as the पनडुब्बी piers and headquarters building ( also home of the intelligence section ) were not attacked.
Japanese नुकसान were light : 29 aircraft and five midget submarines lost, और 65 servicemen killed or wounded.
One Japanese sailor was captured.
The attack came as a profound shock to the American people and led directly to the American entry into World War II in both the Pacific and यूरोपीय theaters.
the following day ( December 8 ), the United राज्य declared war on Japan.
Domestic support लिये non-interventionism, which had been strong, disappeared.
Clandestine support of Britain ( for example the neutrality Patrol ) was replaced by active alliance.
Subsequent परिचालन by the U.S. prompted Germany and Italy to घोषित war on the U.S. on December 11, which was reciprocated by the U.S. the same day.
There were numerous historical precedents for unannounced military action by Japan.
However, the कमी of any formal warning, particularly while negotiations were still apparently ongoing, led अध्यक्ष Franklin D. Roosevelt to proclaim December 7, 1941, `` a date which will live in infamy ``.
Project Runway Season 2 was the second season of Bravo 's successful Project Runway, a reality competition for fashion designers.
Season 2 began airing on December 7, 2005.
Following a nationwide search earlier in the year, sixteen designers were chosen as semi-finalists and brought to New York City in जून, 2005.
After the first challenge, called `` Road To The Runway '', fourteen went on to compete as finalists.
The winning designer, Chloe dao, received $ 100,000 in seed money to help launch her own line, a 2007 Saturn Sky roadster, a spread in ELLE magazine, and a mentorship साथ the Banana गणतंत्र Design Team.
Winning alongside dao was her model, Grace Kelsey, who received the ELLE Magazine spread.
Michael Kors and Nina Garcia returned as judges for the second season.
The fourth judging seat rotated each week, based on the चुनौती.
Tim Gunn, fashion chair at Parsons The New School for Design, returned as a mentor for the designers.
Kara Janx later appeared in Project Runway : All Stars in 2012, where she finished 7th out of 13.
andrae Gonzalo, in the same year, competed in the second season of the All Stars edition placing 10th out of 13.
An example of a Heraclius mule
In numismatics, a mule is a coin or medal minted with obverse and reverse designs not normally seen on the same piece.
These can be intentional or produced by error.
This type of error is highly sought after, and examples can fetch steep prices from collectors.
The earliest mules are found among ancient Greek and Roman coins.
Opinion is divided between those who think that they are accidental, the result of an incorrect combination of a new die with one that had officially been withdrawn from उपयोग, or the कार्य of coiners working with dies stolen from an official mint, perhaps at a time when one of them should have been destroyed.
The name derives इससे the खच्चर, the hybrid offspring of a घोड़ा और a donkey, due to such a coin having two sides intended for different coins, much as a mule has parents of two different प्रजाति.
This page documents the tornadoes और tornado outbreaks of 2010.
The majority of tornadoes form in the U.S., but they can occur almost anywhere अंतर्गत the right conditions.
A lesser number occur outside the U.S., most notably in parts of neighboring southern Canada during the Northern गोलार्ध 's summer season, लकिन are also known in South America, Europe, Asia, and Australia.
There were 1,531 tornadoes reported in the United States in 2010 ( of जिससे at तनिक 1,266 were confirmed ), with 45 पुष्टि fatalities.
elsewhere in the world, 11 people were मारे in tornadoes, छह in Argentina, three in the Bahamas, one in Bangladesh, and one in जर्मनी.
The year was near average for tornadoes despite an extremely quiet early spring period, however such changed after a huge upswing starting in late April and a busy लेट spring and summer period.
The autumn months were slightly above औसत.
A lymphocyte is a type of white blood कोशिका in the vertebrate immune प्रणाली.
Under the microscope, lymphocytes can be divided into large lymphocytes and small lymphocytes.
Large granular lymphocytes include natural कातिल cells ( NK cells ).
Small lymphocytes consist of T cells and B कोशिकाएं.
Windows PowerShell is microsoft 's task automation framework, consisting of a command-line shell and associated scripting language built on.NET Framework.
powershell provides full access to COM and WMI, enabling administrators to perform administrative tasks on both local and remote Windows systems.
In PowerShell, administrative tasks are generally performed by cmdlets ( pronounced command-lets ), which are specialized.NET classes implementing a particular operation.
Sets of cmdlets may be combined साथ in स्क्रिप्ट, executables ( जिससे are standalone applications ), or by instantiating regular.NET classes ( or WMI/COM Objects ).
These work by accessing data in different data stores, like the filesystem or registry, which are made available to the powershell runtime via Windows PowerShell providers.
Windows powershell also provides a hosting API with which the Windows PowerShell runtime can be embedded inside other applications.
These applications can then use Windows PowerShell functionality to implement certain operations, including those exposed via the graphical interface.
इस capability has been used by Microsoft Exchange Server 2007 to expose its management functionality as PowerShell cmdlets and providers and implement the graphical प्रबन्धन tools as PowerShell hosts which invoke the necessary cmdlets.
Other Microsoft applications including Microsoft SQL Server 2008 also expose their management interface via PowerShell cmdlets.
With PowerShell, graphical interface-based management applications on Windows are परतदार on top of Windows PowerShell.
A PowerShell एनक्रिप्शन interface for खिड़कियाँ products is mandated by the Common Engineering Criteria.
Windows PowerShell includes its own extensive, console-based help, similar to man pages in Unix shells, via the Get-Help cmdlet.
Mary Poppins is a 1964 musical film अभिनीत Julie Andrews, Dick Van Dyke, David Tomlinson, and Glynis Johns, उत्पादित by Walt Disney, and based on the Mary Poppins books series by P. L. Travers.
The film was directed by Robert Stevenson and written by Bill Walsh and Don DaGradi, साथ songs by the Sherman Brothers.
it was shot at Walt Disney Studios in Burbank, कैलिफ़ोर्निया.
Julie Andrews won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her performance as Mary Poppins and the film also won ऑस्कर for Best Film Editing, Original Music Score, Best Song for `` Chim Chim Cher-ee '' and Best Visual Effects, और received a total of 13 nominations.
A स्टोरी चाप is an विस्तारित or continuing कथानक in episodic storytelling media such as television, comic books, comic strips, boardgames, video games, and in some cases, films.
On a television program, for example, the story होता unfold over many episodes.
In टेलीविज़न, the use of the story arc is much more common in dramas than in comedies, especially in soap operas.
Webcomics are more likely to उपयोग स्टोरी arcs than newspaper comics, as most web comics have readable archives ऑनलाइन कि a newcomer to the strip can read in order to understand what is going on.
Although story arcs have existed for decades, the term `` story arc '' was coined in 1988 in relation to the television series Wiseguy, and was जल्दी adapted for other uses.
Many अमरीकी comic book series are now written in चार or six-issue arcs, within a continuing श्रेणी.
Short story arcs are easier to पैकेज as trade paperbacks लिये resale, and more accessible to the casual reader than the never-ending continuity कि once characterised comics.
Black Friday is the day following Thanksgiving Day in the United States, often regarded as the beginning of the Christmas shopping season.
In recent सालो, most प्रमुख retailers have opened extremely early and offered promotional sales to kick off the holiday shopping season, similar to Boxing Day sales in many Commonwealth Nations.
Black Friday is not an official public holiday as such, but many non-retail employees and schools have both Thanksgiving and the day after off, followed by a weekend, thereby increasing the number of potential shoppers.
It has routinely been the व्यस्ततम shopping day of the year चूंकि 2005, although news रिपोर्ट्स, which at that time were inaccurate, have described it as the busiest shopping day of the year for a much longer काल of time.
The day 's name originated in Philadelphia, where it originally थी used to describe the heavy and disruptive pedestrian and गाडी traffic which would occur on the day after Thanksgiving.
उपयोग of the term started before 1961 and began to देखिए broader use outside फिलाडेल्फिया around 1975.
Later an alternative explanation began to be offered : कि `` Black Friday '' indicates the point at which retailers begin to turn a profit, or are `` ''.
लिये many years, it थी common for retailers to open at 6:00 a.m., but in the late 2000s many had crept to 5:00 or even 4:00.
This was taken to a new extreme in 2011, when several retailers ( including Target, Kohl 's, Macy 's, Best Buy, और Bealls ) opened at midnight for the first time.
In 2012, Walmart and several other retailers announced that they would open most of their stores at 8:00 p.m. on Thanksgiving Day ( except in राज्य where खोलने on Thanksgiving is prohibited due to blue laws, such as Massachusetts where they still opened around midnight ), prompting calls for a walkout among some workers.
ब्लैक Friday shopping is known for attracting aggressive crowds, with annual reports of assaults, shootings, और throngs of people trampling on other shoppers in an attempt to get the best deal on a product before आपूर्तियाँ run out.
The परिवार That Preys is a 2008 American movie drama written, produced, and directed by Tyler Perry.
The screenplay focuses on two families, one wealthy and the other working class, whose lives are intertwined in both love and कारोबार.
The movie is the second of four in which Perry 's signature character, Madea, does not make an appearance.
It is also the second Perry-directed film ( alongside Daddy 's Little Girls ) कि is not आधारित on any of the filmmaker 's stage plays.
Net 10, जाल 15, Net 30 and Net 60 ( also Net 10 days, et al ) are forms of trade credit which specify that the net amount ( the total outstanding on the invoice ) is अपेक्षित to be paid in full and received by the seller within 10, 15, 30 or 60 days after the goods are dispatched or service is completed.
Net 30 or Net 60 terms are often coupled with a credit for early payment.
The word net in this sense means `` total after all discounts. ''
It originally गर्भाशयी from the Latin nitere ( to shine ) and nitidus ( elegant, trim ), and more recently from the French net ( sharp, neat, clean ).
Roadtown, Tortola
The British West इंडीज were the islands in and around the Caribbean that were भाग of the British Empire.
In 1912, the British West Indies were विभाजित into eight colonies : The Bahamas, Barbados, अंग्रेजों Guiana, British Honduras, Jamaica ( with इसके dependencies the Turks and Caicos Islands and the Cayman Islands ), त्रिनिदाद और टोबैगो, the Windward Islands and the leeward Islands.
Between 1958 and 1962, all of the island territories except the British Virgin आइलैंड्स, the Bahamas, British Honduras and British Guiana यहूद organised into the West Indies Federation.
It was hoped कि the Federation would become स्वतंत्र as a single nation, but it had limited powers, many practical problems, and a lack of popular support.
Consequently, the West Indies Federation was dissolved.
Most of the territories, including all the larger ones, are now independent as separate countries, with membership to many अंतरराष्ट्रीय forums such as the Organization of American States, the Association of Caribbean States, the World Trade Organization, the United Nations, the Caribbean Community, the Commonwealth of Nations and the Caribbean विकास Bank among अन्य.
The remainder are British overseas territories.
All the former राष्ट्र of the British West Indies, except the Commonwealth of Dominica, Guyana and Trinidad and Tobago, are Commonwealth realms.
The term is still used for अंग्रेजों Overseas territories in the Caribbean, such as the Cayman Islands.
