`` What a Wonderful World '' is a song written by Bob Thiele ( as `` George Douglas '' ) and George David Weiss.
It was first recorded by Louis Armstrong and released as a single in 1967.
Thiele and Weiss were both prominent in the music world ( Thiele as a producer and Weiss as a composer/performer ).
आर्मस्ट्रांग 's recording was inducted in the Grammy Hall of Fame in 1999.
The publishing for this song is नियंत्रित by Memory Lane Music Group, Carlin Music Corp., and कीड़ा Music, Inc.
Inauguration Day 2009 on the west steps of the U.S. Capitol.
President George W. बुश and First Lady Laura Bush lead the inaugural parade down Pennsylvania Avenue to the White House, 2005
The inauguration of the president of the United States is a ceremonial event marking the commencement of a new four-year term of a president of the United States.
The day a presidential inauguration occurs is known as `` Inauguration Day '' and occurs on January 20 ( or 21st if the 20th is a Sunday ).
( prior to the Twentieth Amendment, the date was March 4, the day of the year on which the Constitution of the United States first took effect in 1789 ; the last inauguration to take place on the older date was Franklin D. Roosevelt 's first one on कूच 4, 1933. )
The most recent public presidential inauguration रस्म, the swearing in of अध्यक्ष Barack ओबामा to begin his second four-year पद in दफ्तर, took place on Monday, January 21, 2013.
The only inauguration element mandated by the United States Constitution is that the president make an oath or affirmation पहले that व्यक्ति can `` enter on the Execution '' of the office of the presidency.
However, over the years, various traditions have arisen that have expanded the inauguration from a simple oath-taking रस्म to a day-long event, सहित parades, speeches, and balls.
From the presidency of Andrew Jackson through that of Jimmy Carter, the primary Inauguration Day ceremony took place on the Capitol 's East Portico.
Since the 1981 उद्घाटन of Ronald Reagan, the ceremony has been held at the Capitol 's West Front.
The inaugurations of William Howard Taft in 1909 and Reagan in 1985 were moved indoors at the Capitol due to cold weather.
the War of 1812 and World War II caused दो inaugurations to be held at other locations in Washington, d.c.
When George Washington थी inaugurated, the oath was administered by Robert Livingston, चांसलर of New York State, in 1789, and by William Cushing, संबद्ध Justice of the Supreme Court, in 1793.
Since Chief Justice Oliver Ellsworth swore in President John Adams, no chief इंसाफ has missed an उद्घाटन Day.
When Inauguration दिन has fallen on a Sunday, the chief justice has administered the oath to the president on the Sunday privately and then again the next day publicly.
When a new president takes over mid-term due to the death or resignation of a president, the oath of office is administered but औपचारिक, public उद्घाटन events have not been held.
Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta ( ; born कूच 28, 1986 ), known by her stage name Lady Gaga, is an American सिंगर, songwriter, record producer, नर्तकी, activist, businesswoman, fashion designer, actress and philanthropist.
Born and raised in New यॉर्क City, she primarily studied at the Convent of the Sacred Heart and briefly attended New York University 's Tisch School of the Arts before withdrawing to focus on her musical career.
She soon began performing in the rock music scene of Manhattan 's निम्नतर East Side.
By the end of 2007, record executive and producer Vincent हर्बर्ट signed her to his label Streamline रिकॉर्ड, an imprint of Interscope रिकॉर्ड.
Initially working as a songwriter at Interscope Records, उसके vocal abilities captured the attention of recording artist Akon, who also signed her to kon Live Distribution, his own label under Interscope.
Lady Gaga came to prominence as a recording कलाकार following the release of her debut album, The Fame ( 2008 ), which was a नाजुक and commercial success that topped charts around the world and included the international number-one singles `` Just Dance `` and `` Poker Face ``.
After embarking on the the Fame Ball दौरे, she followed the album with The Fame Monster ( 2009 ), which spawned the worldwide hit singles `` Bad Romance ``, `` Telephone ``, and `` Alejandro ``.
The Fame Monsters success allowed her to embark on the eighteen-month long Monster Ball Tour, which later became one of the highest-grossing concert tours of all time.
Her most recent album, Born This Way ( 2011 ), topped the charts of सबसे प्रमुख markets and generated more international chart-topping singles, including `` Born This Way ``, `` यहूदा ``, and `` The Edge of Glory ``.
Influenced by Britney Spears, David Bowie, Michael Jackson, Madonna, and Queen, Lady Gaga is recognized for her flamboyant, diverse and outré contributions to the music industry through her fashion, प्रदर्शन and music वीडियो.
As of October 2011, she has sold an estimated 23 million albums and 64 million singles worldwide and her singles are some of the best-selling worldwide.
Her achievements include five Grammy Awards and 13 MTV Video Music Awards.
Lady Gaga has consecutively appeared on Billboard magazine 's Artists of the Year ( scoring the definitive शीर्षक in 2010 ), ranked fourth in VH1 's list of 100 Greatest Women in Music, is the sixth best selling digital singles artist in US according to RIAA, is regularly placed on lists composed by Forbes magazine and was named one of the most influential people in the world by Time पत्रिका.
Besides her musical career, she involves herself with humanitarian causes and LGBT activism.

The Florida Gators baseball team represents the University of Florida in the sport of baseball.
The Florida Gators compete in Division I of the National Collegiate Athletics Association ( NCAA ), and the पूर्वी Division of the Southeastern Conference ( SEC ).
They play their home games in Alfred A. McKethan Stadium on the university 's Gainesville, Florida कैम्पस, और are currently led by head coach Kevin O'Sullivan.
In the ninety-eight season history of the Gators baseball program, the team has won बारह SEC championships and has appeared in eight College World Series tournaments.

A political campaign is an organized effort which seeks to influence the decision making process within a specific group.
In democracies, political campaigns often refer to electoral campaigns, wherein representatives are chosen or referendums are decided.
In modern politics, the most high profile political अभियान are focused on candidates for head of state or head of government, often a President or प्रधान Minister.
Elizabeth Cady Stanton and her daughter, Harriot
Elizabeth Cady Stanton ( November 12, 1815 – October 26, 1902 ) was an American social activist, abolitionist, and leading figure of the early women 's rights movement.
Her Declaration of Sentiments, presented at the first women 's rights convention held in 1848 in Seneca Falls, New यॉर्क, is प्रायः credited with initiating the first organized women 's rights and women 's suffrage movements in the United States.
Before Stanton narrowed her political focus almost exclusively to women 's rights, she was an active abolitionist साथ with her husband, हेनरी Brewster Stanton and cousin, gerrit Smith.
Unlike many of those involved in the women 's rights movement, Stanton addressed विभिन्न issues pertaining to women beyond voting rights.
Her चिंताएं included महिलाओं 's parental and custody rights, property rights, employment and income rights, divorce, the economic health of the family, and birth कंट्रोल.
She was also an outspoken supporter of the 19th-century temperance movement.
After the American Civil War, Stanton 's commitment to female suffrage caused a schism in the महिलाओं 's rights movement when वो, together with Susan B. Anthony, declined to support passage of the Fourteenth and पंद्रहवीं Amendments to the United States Constitution.
She opposed giving added legal protection और voting rights to African American men while women, black and white, were denied those same rights.
Her position on this समस्या, साथ with her thoughts on organized Christianity और women 's issues beyond voting rights, led to the formation of दो separate women 's rights organizations कि were finally rejoined, with Stanton as president of the joint organization, approximately twenty years after her break from the असली women 's suffrage movement.
Stanton died in 1902 having authored both The स्त्री 's Bible and her autobiography, along with many articles and pamphlets concerning female suffrage and women 's rights.
My Fair Lady is a musical based upon George Bernard Shaw 's pygmalion और with book and गीत by Alan Jay Lerner and music by Frederick loewe.
The story concerns Eliza Doolittle, a Cockney flower girl who takes speech lessons from professor Henry Higgins, a phoneticist, so that she may pass as a well-born lady.
The musical 's 1956 Broadway production was a hit, setting what was then the record for the longest run of any प्रमुख musical theatre production in history.
It was followed by a hit London production, a popular film संस्करण, and numerous revivals.
It has been called `` the perfect musical ''.
Deregulation is the act or process of removing or reducing state regulations.
It is therefore opposite of regulation, which refers to the process of the government regulating निश्चित क्रियाएँ.

`` There Will Come Soft Rains '' is a short story by science fiction author Ray Bradbury which was first published in the May 6, 1950 issue of Collier 's.
Later that same year the story was included in bradbury 's the Martian Chronicles ( 1950 ).
With over 1.2 billion लोगों, Han Chinese is the largest ethnic group in the world.
Pashtun people of the Pashtunistan region, which sits in an area between south of the Hindu Kush in Afghanistan and the Indus River in Pakistan.
They number around 50 million.
The Korowai people of Papua numbered just around 3,000 people, and were uncontacted जबतक the 1970s.
Ethnicity or ethnic group is a socially defined category based on common संस्कृति or nationality.
नस्ल can, but does not have to, include common ancestry, appearance, भोजन, ड्रेसिंग style, heritage, history, language or dialect, religion, प्रतीकों, traditions, or अन्य cultural factor.
Ethnic identity is constantly reinforced through common characteristics which नियत the group apart from other groups.
The 19.9 MW Gemasolar solar plant in Spain सुविधाएँ 15 hours of storage और can supply power 24 hours a day.
Solar energy, radiant light and heat from the sun, रै been harnessed by humans since ancient times using a range of ever-evolving technologies.
Solar energy technologies include solar heating, solar photovoltaics, solar thermal electricity, solar architecture and artificial photosynthesis, which can make considerable contributions to solving some of the सबसे urgent energy problems the world अभी faces.
Solar technologies are broadly characterized as either passive सौर or active solar depending on the way they capture, convert and distribute solar energy.
Active solar techniques include the use of photovoltaic panels and solar thermal collectors to harness the energy.
passive solar techniques include orienting a building to the Sun, selecting materials with favorable thermal mass or light dispersing properties, and designing स्पेसेस that naturally circulate air.
In 2011, the International Energy Agency said that `` the development of affordable, inexhaustible and clean solar energy technologies will have huge longer-term benefits.
It will increase countries’ उर्जा security through reliance on an स्वदेशी, inexhaustible and mostly import-independent resource, enhance स्थिरता, reduce pollution, lower the costs of mitigating climate change, and keep fossil fuel कीमतें निम्नतर than otherwise.
ये advantages are global.
Hence the additional costs of the incentives for early deployment चाहिए be considered learning investments ; they must be wisely spent and need to be widely shared ''.
The classical Latin alphabet or Roman alphabet विकसित from a western किस्में of the यूनानी alphabet पुकारा the cumaean alphabet, which was adopted and modified by the etruscans who ruled early Rome.
The Etruscan alphabet was in turn अपनाया and further modified by the ancient Romans to write the Latin language.
During the Middle आयु, the Latin alphabet was adapted to Romance languages, direct descendants of Latin, as well as to Celtic, Germanic, बाल्टिक, और some Slavic languages.
साथ the age of colonialism and ईसाई evangelism, the Latin script was spread overseas, and applied to indigenous American, Australian, ऑस्ट्रोनीशियाई, Austroasiatic, and African languages.
More recently, linguists have also tended to prefer the Latin script or the International Phonetic Alphabet ( itself largely based on Latin script ) when transcribing or creating written standards for non-European भाषाएं, ऐसे as the African reference alphabet.
The term Latin alphabet may refer to either the alphabet used to write Latin ( as described in this article ), or अन्य alphabets based on the Latin script, which is the basic set of letters common to the various alphabets descended from the classical Latin one, such as the English alphabet.
These Latin-derived alphabets may discard letters, like the Rotokas alphabet, or add new letters, like the Danish and Norwegian alphabet.
Letter shapes have changed over the centuries, including the creation for Medieval Latin of lower case forms which did not exist in the Classical period.
The assassination of United States President Abraham Lincoln took place on Good Friday, अप्रैल 14, 1865, as the American Civil War was drawing to a close.
The assassination occurred five days after the commander of the Confederate फौज of Northern Virginia, General Robert E. Lee, surrendered to Lieutenant General Ulysses S. Grant and the Union Army of the Potomac.
Lincoln थी the first अमरीकी president to be assassinated, though an unsuccessful attempt had महरूम made on Andrew Jackson 30 years before in 1835.
The assassination was planned and carried out by the well-known stage actor John Wilkes Booth, as part of a larger conspiracy in a bid to revive the Confederate cause.
Booth 's co-conspirators were Lewis Powell and David Herold, who were आबंटित to kill Secretary of State William H. Seward, and George Atzerodt who was to kill Vice President एंड्रयू Johnson.
By simultaneously eliminating the top three people in the administration, Booth and his co-conspirators hoped to sever the continuity of the संयुक्त राज्य government.
Lincoln was shot while watching the play Our American Cousin with his wife Mary Todd lincoln at Ford 's Theatre in Washington, D.C. on the night of April 14, 1865.
He died early the next morning.
The बाकी of the षड्यंत्रकारियों ' plot failed ; Powell only managed to wound Seward, while Atzerodt, Johnson 's would-be assassin, lost his तंत्रिका and fled Washington.

Peripheral, an optional computer hardware component that significantly supplements or enhances the functionality of the original unit
Video game accessory, a piece of hardware used in conjunction with a video game console for playing video games
Club level seating is a special खण्ड of seating in modern sports stadiums.
The Club Level is usually located towards the middle of the stage of seating sections, above the lower deck but below the upper deck.
They are usually right next to the Luxury बाक्स, either right above, right नीचे, or sandwiched between two levels of Luxury Boxes.
Club Level seating is considered as higher class than sitting anywhere else in the arena, but lower class compared to the Luxury Boxes.
Unlike the Luxury Boxes, most club levels do not wrap entirely around the एरिना.
Some क्लबों levels stop at a certain पाइंट, giving way to an expansion of the मेज़ानाइन, जबकि others give way to lower class Luxury Boxes ( such as `` पार्टी Suites '' ).
A notable exception to इस is Emirates Stadium in London, which has a complete tier of club seating.
Club Levels allow fans multiple levels of entertainment.
Club Level seating is open to the elements, as opposed to the entirely enclosed luxury boxes, which देता more of an outdoors छाप at roofless and open-roof stadiums and arenas.
Club स्तर seating is normally bought on a contract basis to allow for maximum profit on the part of the stadium.
the Club Level provides प्रशंसक with special access to an indoor part of the arena exclusive to fans with special tickets.
These areas are air conditioned and allow access to special restaurants, merchandise stands, and lounge areas of the stadium that are not otherwise available.
Concession stands and vendors on the Club Level भी often offer different menus than in other stands to give more of a special feel to the Club.
These areas are closed off to the rest of the stadium, and they usually can only be पहुँचा through the exclusive, निजी club entrances.
Sophia लोरेन ( ; born Sofia Villani scicolone ; 20 September 1934 ) is an Italian actress.
Loren is widely पहचाना as Italy 's most renowned and honored actress.
वो थी the first actress of the talkie era to win an अकादमी Award for a non-English-speaking performance, for उसके portrayal of Cesira in Vittorio De Sica 's Two Women.
उसके other awards include a Grammy Award, five खास Golden Globes, a BAFTA Award और a Laurel Award.
In 1995 she received the Cecil B. DeMille Award लिये lifetime achievements, one of many such awards.
Her films include : Houseboat ( 1958 ), El Cid ( 1961 ), Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow ( 1963 ), Marriage Italian-Style ( 1964 ), and A Special Day ( 1977 ).
In later years she has appeared in American blockbusters such as Grumpier Old Men ( 1995 ), and Nine ( 2009 ).
In 1994 she starred in Robert Altman 's Prêt-à-Porter, which earned उसके a सुनहरी Globe nomination the same year.
She रै also achieved critical और commercial success in TV movies such as Courage ( 1986 ).
मौतों for self-inflicted injuries per 100,000 inhabitants in 2004.
Incidence of suicide is underreported due to both religious and social pressures, and संभवतः completely unreported in some areas.
Nevertheless, from reported cases, certain trends are apparent.
Since the data is skewed, comparing suicide rates between nations is statistically unsound.
The trends themselves are not the cause, but may be indicative of a root cause.

Hospital आपात कोड are प्रयुक्त in hospitals worldwide to चेतावनी staff to various emergencies.
The use of कोड is intended to convey essential information quickly and साथ minimal misunderstanding to staff, while preventing stress and दहशत among विज़िटर to the hospital.
These codes may be posted on placards throughout the hospital, or printed on employee identification badges लिये ready reference.
Back of a hospital ID badge showing disaster codes.
Hospital emergency codes may denote different events at different अस्पताल, including nearby ones.
Because many physicians work at more than one facility, this may सीसे to भ्रम in emergencies, so uniform systems have been प्रस्तावित.
The route of the Eifel जलसेतु, with its average slope.
The Eifel Aqueduct was एक of the longest aqueducts of the Roman Empire.
The aqueduct, constructed in AD 80, carried water some from the hilly Eifel region of what is now Germany to the ancient city of Colonia Claudia Ara Agrippinensium ( present-day Cologne ).
If the auxiliary spurs to additional स्रोतों are included, the length was.
The construction was almost entirely नीचे ground, and the flow of the water was produced entirely by gravity.
A few bridges, including one up to in length, were needed to pass over valleys.
नापसंद some of the other famous Roman aqueducts, the Eifel aqueduct was specifically designed to minimize the above-ground portion to protect it from damage and freezing.
In chemistry, a disulfide बंध ( Br.E. disulphide बंध ) is a covalent bond, usually derived by the coupling of two thiol groups.
The linkage is also called an SS-bond or disulfide bridge.
the overall connectivity is therefore R-S-S-R.
The terminology is widely used in biochemistry.
In formal terms, the connection is a persulfide, in analogy to its congener, peroxide ( R-O-O-R ), but this terminology is obscure and is no longer used ( except in reference to r-s-s-h or H-S-S-H compounds ).
Formal depiction of disulfide bond formation as an oxidation.

Religion in the United Kingdom and in the countries that preceded it, has been dominated, लिये over 1,400 years, by various forms of Christianity.
according to some surveys, a majority of citizens still identify साथ Christianity, although regular church attendance has fallen dramatically since the middle of the 20th century, and immigration and demographic change have contributed to the growth of other faiths.
Religious affiliations of UK citizens are recorded by regular surveys, the four major ones being the UK Census, the Labour Force Survey, the British Social Attitudes survey and the European Social Survey.
According to the 2001 UK census, Christianity is the major religion, followed by Islam, Hinduism, Sikhism, judaism and Buddhism in terms of number of adherents.
This, और the relatively large number of individuals with nominal or no religious affiliations has led commentators to variously describe the संयुक्त Kingdom as a multi-faith, secularised, or post-Christian समाज.
The संयुक्त Kingdom was formed by the union of previously independent countries from 1707, and consequently most of the largest religious groups do not have uk-wide organisational structures.
While some groups have separate structures for the individual countries of the United Kingdom, others may have a single structure covering England and वेल्स or Great Britain.
Similarly, due to the relatively recent creation of Northern Ireland in 1921, most major religious groups in Northern Ireland are organised on an all-Ireland आधार.
The 1967 Newark riots were a major civil disturbance that occurred in the city of Newark, New Jersey between जुलाई 12 and July 17, 1967.
The six days of rioting, looting, and destruction left 26 dead and hundreds injured.
In United States college athletics, redshirt is a delay or suspension of an athlete 's participation in order to lengthen उसके or her period of eligibility.
Typically, a student 's athletic पात्रता in a given sport is four seasons, a number derived from the four years of academic classes that are normally required to obtain a bachelor 's degree at an अमरीकी कॉलेज or university.
however, a छात्र athlete may be offered the opportunity to redshirt for up to two सालो, which allows the athlete to spread those चार years of eligibility over five, or sometimes six years.
In a redshirt year, a student athlete may attend वर्ग at the college or university, practice with an athletic team, and dress for play but he or वो may not compete during the game.
Using this mechanism, a student athlete has up to five academic years to उपयोग the चार years of eligibility, thus becoming a fifth-year senior.
the term is used as a verb, noun, and adjective.
For example, a coach may choose to redshirt a player who is then referred to as a redshirt freshman or simply a redshirt.
The opposite of this is a `` true freshman. ''
World युद्ध I ( WWI ) was a global war centred in Europe that began on 28 July 1914 and lasted जबतक 11 नवम्बर 1918.
It was predominantly called the World War or the Great War from इसके occurrence until the प्रारंभ of World War ii in 1939, and the First World युद्ध or World War I thereafter.
It involved सब the world 's great powers, जिससे were assembled in two opposing alliances : the Allies ( based on the Triple entente of the United Kingdom, France and Russia ) and the सेंट्रल Powers ( originally the Triple गठबंधन of Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy ; but, as Austria–Hungary had taken the offensive against the agreement, इटली did not enter into the war ).
These alliances were both reorganised and expanded as more nations entered the war : Italy, Japan और the United राज्य joined the Allies, and the उस्मानी Empire and Bulgaria the Central Powers.
Ultimately, अधिक than 70 million military personnel, including 60 million Europeans, were mobilised in एक of the largest wars in इतिहास.
More than 9 million combatants were killed, largely because of technological advancements that led to enormous increases in the lethality of weapons बगैर corresponding improvements in protection or mobility.
It was the fifth- deadliest विरोध in world इतिहास, subsequently paving the way for विभिन्न political परिवर्तन, such as revolutions in many of the nations involved.
एक of the long-term causes of the war was the पुनरुत्थान of साम्राज्यवाद in the foreign policies of the great powers of Europe.
More immediately, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria, the heir to the throne of Austria-Hungary, on 28 June 1914 by यूगोस्लाव nationalist Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo triggered a diplomatic crisis when Austria-Hungary subsequently वितरित an ultimatum to the Kingdom of Serbia.
Several alliances formed over the previous decades were invoked.
Within weeks, the major powers were at war and, via their colonies, the conflict soon spread around the world.
On 28 July, the Austro-Hungarians fired the पहला shots of the war as preparation for the invasion of Serbia.
While the Russians mobilised, the Germans invaded neutral Belgium and Luxembourg on the way to France, providing a casus belli for Britain 's declaration of war against Germany.
After the German march on Paris was brought to a halt—the so-called Miracle of the Marne —the Western सामने settled into a static battle of attrition with a गर्त line कि changed little until 1917.
On the Eastern Front, the Russian army was successful against the austro-hungarians, but was stopped in its invasion of East Prussia by the Germans.
In November the Ottoman Empire joined the war, opening up fronts in the Caucasus, Mesopotamia and the sinai.
इटली और Bulgaria went to war in 1915 and रोमानिया in 1916.
In Russia, the त्सार 's government collapsed in March 1917 and a subsequent revolution in November brought the Russians to terms with the Central Powers.
After a 1918 German offensive along the western front, the Allies drove back the Germans in a series of successful offensives and American forces began entering the trenches.
Germany, which had its own trouble with क्रांतिकारियों, agreed to an armistice on 11 November 1918.
the war ended in victory for the Allies.
Events on the home fronts were as tumultuous as on the battle fronts, as the participants tried to mobilize their manpower and economic resources to fight a total युद्ध.
By the end of the war, four major इम्पीरियल powers—the German, Russian, Austro-Hungarian and Ottoman empires—ceased to exist.
The successor states of the former two खोया a great amount of territory, while the latter two were dismantled entirely.
The map of central Europe was redrawn into several smaller states.
the League of Nations was formed in the hope of preventing another such conflict.
The European nationalism spawned by the war and the breakup of empires, the repercussions of Germany 's defeat and problems with the Treaty of Versailles are सहमत to be कारकों contributing to World War II.
Map of countries that declared themselves to be socialist states under the Marxist–Leninist or Maoist definition - that is to say, `` कम्युनिस्ट states '' - between 1979 और 1983.
This period marked the महानतम territorial extent of Communist states.
A communist state is a राज्य where the means of उत्पादन are collectively owned by the समाज.
It has a रूप of government characterized by single-party rule or dominant-party rule of a communist party ( referred as Dictatorship of the Proletariat by its proponents ) and a professed allegiance to a Leninist or Marxist–Leninist ideology as the guiding principle of the state.
Technically, `` communist state '' is a contradictio in terminis as a communist society as defined by both Marxists and anarcho-communists is in principle stateless.
From this perspective, the पद Marxist-Leninist state is more appropriate.
Historically, a `` communist state '' referred to a system where public ownership of all or most means of production by the Communist पार्टी -run state is deemed necessary to further the interests of the working class ; today, a communist state can also, लिये instance, refer to contemporary China and Vietnam, where a Communist Party-run state exists alongside a mixed economy.
According to marxist–leninists, the state is a tool in the hands of the ruling क्लास, which in a socialist society is the working class, so a socialist state is, according to Leninists, a state of the working class.
In practice, communist states do not actually refer to themselves as such.
They do this not to भेस the fact that the ruling party is कम्युनिस्ट, but rather because they do not consider themselves to be a communist society at present.
Instead, they constitutionally identify themselves as socialist states or workers ' states.
The primary लक्ष्य of ये states, जिससे also explains their आधिकारिक name, is to guide their respective countries in the process of building socialism, ultimately leading to communism.
Communist states may have अनेक legal political parties, but the communist party is usually granted a special or dominant role in government, often by statute or under the constitution.
Consequently, the संस्थानों of the state and of the communist party become intimately entwined, such as in the development of parallel institutions.
In the 20th century, सबसे communist states adopted नियोजित economies.
However, there were exceptions : The Soviet Union during the 1920s and late 1980s and Yugoslavia after World War ii allowed सीमित markets and a degree of worker self-management, while China, Vietnam and Laos introduced far-reaching market reforms after the 1980s.
In the 21st century, China and Vietnam have allowed a मिश्रित economy to develop.
The आधारभूत अवधारणाओं of कम्युनिस्ट states often diverge इससे the original socio-economic ideologies from which they develop.
As a result, many adherents of these ideologies often oppose the political systems commonly associated with these राज्य.
For उदाहरण, dissenting communists such as Trotskyists were often opposed to the communist states of the 20th century, claiming either that they had nothing to do with `` real '' communism or that the ideology of such states had reached a point of irrevocable corruption.
Michael Fred Phelps II ( born June 30, 1985 ) is a retired American swimmer and the most decorated Olympian of all time, with a total of 22 medals.
Phelps also holds the all-time records for Olympic gold medals ( 18, double the second highest record धारकों ), Olympic सुनहरा medals in individual events ( 11 ), and Olympic medals in individual कार्यक्रम for a male ( 13 ).
In winning आठ gold medals at the 2008 Beijing Games, Phelps took the record for the most first-place finishes at any single Olympic Games.
Five of those victories were in individual events, tying the single Games record.
In the 2012 Summer ओलंपिक in London, Phelps won four golds and two silver medals, making उसे the most successful athlete of the Games for the third ओलंपिक in a row.
Phelps is the long course world recordholder in the 100-meter butterfly, 200-meter butterfly and 400-meter individual medley as well as the former long course world recordholder in the 200-meter freestyle and 200-meter individual medley.
He has won a total of 71 medals in major अंतरराष्ट्रीय long-course competition, 57 gold, 11 silver, and three bronze spanning the ओलंपिक, the संसार, and the Pan Pacific Championships.
Phelps 's international शीर्षक and record-breaking performances have earned him the World Swimmer of the Year Award seven times and American Swimmer of the Year Award nine times as well as the FINA Swimmer of the Year Award in 2012.
His unprecedented ओलम्पिक success in 2008 earned Phelps Sports Illustrated magazine 's Sportsman of the साल award.
After the 2008 Summer Olympics, Phelps started the Michael Phelps Foundation, which focuses on growing the sport of swimming and promoting healthier lifestyles.
He expects to do further work with his foundation after the 2012 Olympics, जिससे he has said will be उसके last.
Lenovo Group Limited ( ) is a Chinese multinational कंप्यूटर hardware and electronics company with its मुख्यालय in Beijing, China and Morrisville, North Carolina and its registered office in Hong काँग, China.
Its products include personal computers, tablet computers, mobile phones, workstations, servers, electronic storage devices, IT management software and smart televisions.
Lenovo is the संसार 's second-largest PC vendor by 2012 unit sales.
It markets the ThinkPad लकीर of notebook computers और the ThinkCentre लकीर of desktops.
Lenovo has परिचालन in more than 60 देशों and sells its products in around 160 countries.
लेनोवो was संस्थापित in Beijing in 1984 और incorporated in Hong Kong in 1988 under its previous name, लेजेंड.
Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange and is a constituent of the Hang Seng China-Affiliated Corporations Index.
Slug is a common name लिये an apparently shell-less terrestrial gastropod mollusk.
The word `` स्लग '' is also often used as part of the common name of any gastropod mollusc that has no shell, has a very reduced shell, or has only a small internal shell.
( This is in contrast to the common name `` snail ``, which is applied to gastropods that have a coiled shell that is large enough कि the नरम parts of the एनिमल can retract fully into it. )
Slugs exist on land and in the sea, and there is even one genus of freshwater slugs, acochlidium.
The unadorned word `` slug '' is however applied primarily to जमीन slugs, whereas slugs from the sea or from freshwater हैं usually referred to as `` sea slugs `` and `` freshwater slugs ''.
Land gastropods with a shell that is not quite vestigial, but is too small to retract into ( like अनेक in the family Urocyclidae ), are known as semislugs.
The various taxonomic families of slugs form भाग of several quite different evolutionary lineages which also include snails.
Thus, for उदाहरण, the various families of land slugs are not बहुत closely related to one another, despite a superficial similarity in the overall body form.
the shell-less condition has arisen many times independently during the evolutionary past, and thus the category `` slug '' is emphatically a polyphyletic one.
Slugs, like all other gastropods, undergo torsion ( a 180° twisting of the internal organs ) दौरान development.
Internally, slug anatomy clearly shows the effects of this rotation, but externally the bodies of land slugs appear to be अधिक or कम symmetrical, मगर for the positioning of the pneumostome, which is on one side of the animal, normally the right hand side.
The नरम, slimy bodies of slugs are prone to desiccation, so land-living slugs are confined to नम environments and must retreat to damp hiding places जब the weather is dry.
The subsequent information in this article applies to land slugs.

Sic, Cluj, a commune in Romania

Imperial Standard of Napoleon I
Napoleon Bonaparte (, ; 15 August 1769 – 5 May 1821 ) was a French military and political leader who rose to prominence during the latter stages of the French Revolution and its associated wars in Europe.
As Napoleon I, he was Emperor of the French from 1804 to 1815.
His legal reform, the Napoleonic Code, has been a major influence on many civil law jurisdictions worldwide, but he is best remembered for his role in the wars led against France by a series of coalitions, the so-called Napoleonic Wars.
He established hegemony over most of continental Europe and sought to spread the ideals of the French Revolution, while consolidating an imperial monarchy which restored पहलुओं of the deposed Ancien Régime.
Due to his success in these wars, often against numerically superior enemies, he is generally regarded as one of the greatest military commanders of all time, and his campaigns are studied at military academies worldwide.
Napoleon was born at Ajaccio in Corsica in a family of noble इतालवी ancestry which had settled corsica in the 16th century.
He trained as an artillery officer in mainland फ़्रांस.
He रोज़ to prominence under the French First Republic and led successful campaigns against the पहला और Second Coalitions arrayed against France.
He led a successful invasion of the Italian peninsula.
In 1799, he staged a coup d'état and installed himself as पहला Consul ; five सालो later the French Senate proclaimed him emperor, following a plebiscite in his favour.
In the first decade of the 19th century, the French Empire under Napoleon engaged in a series of conflicts—the Napoleonic Wars —that involved every major European power.
After a streak of victories, France secured a प्रबल position in महाद्वीपीय Europe, and Napoleon maintained the French sphere of influence through the formation of extensive alliances and the appointment of friends and family members to rule other European countries as French client states.
The Peninsular War and 1812 French invasion of Russia marked turning points in Napoleon 's fortunes.
His Grande Armée was badly damaged in the campaign and never fully recovered.
In 1813, the छठे Coalition defeated his forces at Leipzig ; the following year the Coalition invaded फ़्रांस, forced Napoleon to abdicate and exiled him to the island of Elba.
Less than a year later, he escaped Elba and returned to शक्ति, but was पराजित at the Battle of Waterloo in June 1815.
Napoleon spent the last six years of his life in confinement by the British on the island of Saint हेलेना.
An autopsy concluded he died of stomach cancer, but there has been some debate about the cause of his death, as some scholars have speculated that he was a शिकार of arsenic poisoning.
This is a chronological listing of the United States सीनेटरों from Pennsylvania.
United States Senators are popularly elected, for a six-year term, beginning जनवरी 3.
Elections are held the first Tuesday after November 1.
Before 1914, they were chosen by the Pennsylvania General Assembly, and before 1935, their terms began March 4.
The South Africa national rugby संघ team ( known as the Springboks ) represents South Africa in rugby union.
They compete in the annual Rugby Championship, along with southern-hemisphere counterparts अर्जेंटीना, Australia and New Zealand.
They have won this championship on three occasions in sixteen सालो.
They are currently ranked second in the world by the International Rugby Board, and were named 2008 World टोली of the Year at the Laureus World Sports Awards.
Although South Africa was instrumental in the creation of the Rugby World Cup competition, the Springboks did not compete in the पहला two World Cups in 1987 and 1991 because of anti-apartheid sporting boycotts of South Africa.
The team made its World Cup debut in 1995, when the newly democratic South Africa hosted the tournament.
The Springboks then पराजित the All Blacks 15–12 in the final, जिससे is अभी remembered as one of the महानतम moments in South अफ़्रीकी 's sporting history, and a watershed moment in the post-Apartheid nation-building process.
South Africa regained their title as champions 12 years later, when they defeated इंग्लैण्ड 15–6 in the 2007 final.
As a result of the 2007 World Cup tournament the Springboks were promoted to first place in the IRB World Rankings, a position they held until जुलाई the following year when New Zealand regained the top spot.
The Springboks खेल in ग्रीन and सुनहरा jerseys, और their emblems are the Springbok and the Protea.
the side has been playing international rugby since 1891, when a British isles side toured the nation, playing दक्षिण Africa in their first Test on 30 July.
South अफ़्रीकी थी coached by Jake White, who led the Boks to the 2007 World Cup title, announcing his resignation effectively from the end of 2007.
His replacement 's ( Peter de Villiers ) contract expired in 2011, following a 11–9 defeat to Australia in the Rugby World Cup quarter-final, who then stated he होता not be signing a new deal.
The previous captain was John Smit, who before he retired in 2011 played hooker for most of his career, although he रै also been a prop, mainly in 2008 and 2009.
due to Smit being unavailable for the November 2010 Tests बाद surgery, lock Victor Matfield took Smit 's place as captain for कि दौरे.
The current captain is Jean de Villiers.
The Battle of Gettysburg (, साथ an sound ), was fought July 1–3, 1863, in and around the town of Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.
It was the battle with the largest क्रमांक of casualties in the American Civil War and is often described as the war 's turning point.
Union Maj. Gen. George Gordon Meade 's Army of the Potomac defeated attacks by Confederate Gen. Robert E. Lee 's Army of Northern Virginia, ending Lee 's invasion of the North.
बाद his success at Chancellorsville in Virginia in may 1863, ली led his army through the Shenandoah Valley to begin his second invasion of the North—the Gettysburg Campaign.
With his फौज in high spirits, Lee intended to shift the focus of the summer campaign from war-ravaged northern Virginia and hoped to influence Northern politicians to give up their prosecution of the war by penetrating as far as Harrisburg, Pennsylvania, or भी Philadelphia.
Prodded by President Abraham Lincoln, Maj. Gen. Joseph Hooker moved his army in pursuit, but was relieved just three days before the battle and replaced by meade.
Elements of the two armies initially collided at Gettysburg on July 1, 1863, as Lee urgently concentrated his forces there, his objective being to engage the Union army and नष्ट it.
Low ridges to the northwest of town were defended initially by a Union cavalry division under Brig. Gen. जॉन Buford, and soon reinforced with two corps of Union infantry.
However, two large confederate corps assaulted them from the northwest and north, collapsing the hastily developed Union lines, sending the defenders retreating through the streets of town to the पहाड़ियाँ just to the south.
On the second day of बैटल, most of both सेना had assembled.
The Union line was laid out in a रक्षात्मक formation resembling a fishhook.
In the लेट afternoon of July 2, Lee launched a heavy assault on the Union left flank, and fierce fighting raged at Little Round Top, the wheatfield, Devil 's Den, and the Peach Orchard.
on the Union right, demonstrations escalated into full-scale assaults on Culp 's Hill और Cemetery Hill.
All across the battlefield, despite significant losses, the संघ defenders held their lines.
On the third दिन of battle, July 3, fighting resumed on Culp 's Hill, and cavalry battles raged to the ईस्ट and south, but the main event was a dramatic infantry assault by 12,500 Confederates विरूद्ध the center of the Union line on कब्रिस्तान Ridge, known as Pickett 's Charge.
The charge थी repulsed by Union rifle और artillery fire, at great losses to the Confederate army.
Lee led उसके army on a torturous रिट्रीट back to Virginia.
Between 46,000 and 51,000 soldiers from both armies were casualties in the three-day battle.
That November, President Lincoln used the समर्पण ceremony for the Gettysburg National Cemetery to सम्मान the fallen Union soldiers and redefine the purpose of the युद्ध in his historic Gettysburg Address.
An academic discipline, or field of study, is a शाखा of knowledge that is taught and researched at the college or university स्तर.
Disciplines are defined ( in part ), and recognized by the academic journals in which research is published, and the learned societies and academic विभाग or faculties to which their practitioners belong.
However, there exists no formal criteria for when educational programs and scholarly journals form an academic discipline.
A huge difference exists between, on the one hand, well established disciplines that exist in almost all universities all over the world, have a long history, and have a well established set of journals and conferences, और, on the other hand, suggestions for new fields supported only by few universities and publications.
Fields of study usually have several sub-disciplines or branches, और the distinguishing lines between these हैं often both arbitrary and ambiguous.
पीएचपी is a server-side scripting language designed लिये web development but also used as a general-purpose programming language.
PHP is now installed on more than 244 million websites and 2.1 million वेब servers.
Originally created by rasmus Lerdorf in 1995, the reference implementation of PHP is now produced by The PHP Group.
While पीएचपी originally stood लिये Personal Home Page, it now stands for PHP : Hypertext Preprocessor, a recursive acronym.
PHP code is interpreted by a web server with a PHP processor module which generates the resulting web page : PHP commands can be embedded directly into an HTML source document rather than कॉलिंग an external file to process data.
It has also evolved to include a command-line interface capability and can be used in standalone आलेखीय applications.
PHP is free software released under the PHP License, which is incompatible with the GNU General Public License ( जीपीएल ) due to restrictions on the usage of the term पीएचपी.
PHP can be deployed on most web servers and also as a स्टैंडअलोन shell on almost every operating system and मंच, free of charge.
John Fitzgerald `` Jack '' Kennedy ( May 29, 1917 – November 22, 1963 ), often referred to by his initials JFK, was the 35th अध्यक्ष of the संयुक्त States, सेवारत from 1961 until his मौत in 1963.
After military service as commander of the Motor Torpedo Boats PT-109 and PT-59 during World War II in the South Pacific, Kennedy represented Massachusetts ' 11th congressional district in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1947 to 1953 as a Democrat.
Thereafter, he served in the U.S. Senate from 1953 until 1960.
Kennedy पराजित Vice President and Republican candidate Richard Nixon in the 1960 U.S. presidential चुनाव.
At 43 years of आयु, he is the youngest to have been elected to the office, the second-youngest President ( after Theodore Roosevelt ), and the first person born in the 20th century to serve as president.
A Catholic, Kennedy is the only non- Protestant president, and is the only president to have won a Pulitzer Prize.
Events during his प्रेसिडेंसी शामिल the Bay of Pigs Invasion, the Cuban Missile संकट, the building of the Berlin Wall, the Space Race, the African-American Civil Rights Movement, और early stages of the Vietnam War.
Therein, कैनेडी increased the क्रमांक of military advisers, special operation forces, and helicopters in an effort to curb the spread of communism in South East Asia.
The Kennedy administration adopted the policy of the Strategic Hamlet Program which was implemented by the दक्षिण Vietnamese government.
It involved certain forced relocation, village internment, और segregation of rural South Vietnamese from the northern and southern communist insurgents.
Kennedy was assassinated on November 22, 1963 in Dallas, Texas.
Lee Harvey Oswald was charged with the अपराधों, but he was shot और killed by Jack Ruby two days later, before a trial could take place.
The FBI and the Warren Commission officially concluded that Oswald was the lone assassin.
However, the United States हाउस Select Committee on Assassinations ( HSCA ) concluded that those investigations were flawed and that Kennedy was probably assassinated as the result of a conspiracy.
However, ABC News in their investigation, The Kennedy Assassination : Beyond Conspiracy, confirmed the findings of the Warren Commission ; having concluded Oswald acted alone.
Kennedy 's controversial Department of Defense TFX fighter bomber program led to a Congressional investigation that lasted from 1963 to 1970.
Since the 1960s information concerning Kennedy 's private life has आइये to light.
Details of Kennedy 's health problems in जिससे he struggled have become better ज्ञात, especially since the 1990s.
Although initially kept secret from the सामान्य public, reports of Kennedy 's philandering have garnered much press.
Kennedy बाँधने highly in पब्लिक opinion दरजा of U.S. presidents.
`` Stand by me '' is a song originally performed by Ben E. King and written by King, Jerry leiber, and Mike Stoller, inspired by the spiritual `` Lord Stand by Me, '' plus two lines rooted in Psalms 46:2–3.
वहीँ have been over 400 recorded versions of the song.
a political cartoon from an 1894 Puck magazine by illustrator S.D. Ehrhart, shows a farm woman labeled `` Democratic Party '' sheltering from a tornado of political change.
A metaphor is a figure of speech that describes a subject by asserting that it is, on some point of comparison, the same as another otherwise unrelated object.
रूपक is a type of analogy and is closely related to other rhetorical figures of वाक that achieve their effects via association, comparison or प्रतिरूप including allegory, अतिशयोक्ति, and simile.
In simpler terms, a metaphor compares two objects or things without using the words `` like '' or `` as ''.
One of the most prominent examples of a metaphor in English literature is the All the world 's a stage monologue from As तुम Like It :
All the world 's a stage,
And all the मेन and women merely players ;
They have their exits and their entrances ; — William Shakespeare, as You Like It, 2/7
This quote is a metaphor because the world is नहीं literally a stage.
By figuratively asserting that the world is a stage, Shakespeare uses the points of comparison between the world और a stage to convey an understanding about the mechanics of the world and the lives of the people within it.

Felix Vallotton, La raison probante ( The Cogent Reason ), woodcut from the series Intimités, 1898
Printmaking is the process of making artworks by printing, normally on paper.
Printmaking normally covers only the प्रक्रम of creating prints with an तत्व of originality, rather than just being a photographic reproduction of a painting.
Except in the case of monotyping, the process is capable of producing multiples of the same piece, which is पुकारा a print.
प्रत्येक print produced is not considered a `` copy '' but rather is considered an `` original ''.
This is because typically each print varies to an extent due to variables intrinsic to the printmaking process, और also because the imagery of a print is typically not बस a reproduction of another work but बल्कि is often a unique चित्र designed इससे the start to be expressed in a particular printmaking technique.
A print may be known as an impression.
Printmaking ( other than monotyping ) is not chosen only लिये its ability to produce multiple impressions, but बल्कि for the unique qualities that each of the printmaking processes lends itself to.
Prints are created by transferring ink from a matrix or through a prepared screen to a sheet of paper or अन्य material.
Common types of matrices include : metal plates, usually copper or जस्ता, or polymer plates for engraving or etching ; stone, aluminum, or polymer for lithography ; ब्लॉक of लकडी for woodcuts and wood engravings ; and linoleum for linocuts.
Screens made of silk or सिंथेटिक fabrics are used for the screenprinting process.
अन्य types of matrix substrates and related processes are discussed below.
Multiple impressions printed from the same matrix form an edition.
Since the late 19th century, artists have generally signed व्यक्तिगत impressions from an edition and often number the impressions to form a limited edition.
Prints may also be मुद्रित in book form, ऐसे as illustrated books or artist 's books.
Il divo is an English multinational operatic pop vocal group created by म्यूज़िक manager, executive, and reality TV star Simon Cowell.
Formed in the United Kingdom, वे are also signed to Cowell 's record label, Syco Music.
Il Divo is a group of four male singers : French pop singer सेबेस्तियन Izambard, Spanish baritone कार्लोस Marín, American tenor David Miller, and Swiss tenor Urs Bühler.
To तिथि, they have sold more than 26 लाख albums worldwide.
Su-15, one of the principal Soviet Air Defence interceptors in the 1970s and 1980s
An interceptor aircraft ( or simply interceptor ) is a type of fighter aircraft designed specifically to prevent missions of enemy aircraft, particularly bombers and reconnaissance aircraft, and destroy them, relying usually on great speed और powerful armament.
Being used since the First World War, after the late 1960s, interceptors became कम important due to shifting from bombers to intercontinental ballistic missiles ( ICBMs ) for nuclear warfare.
A Vietnamese American ( ) is an American of वियतनामी descent.
They make up about half of all overseas Vietnamese ( Người Việt hải Ngoại ) and are the fourth-largest Asian American group.
Mass Vietnamese immigration to the United States started after 1975, बाद the end of the Vietnam युद्ध.
Early immigrants were refugee boat people fleeing persecution or poverty.
Forced to भागो इससे उनके homeland and often thrust into poor urban neighborhoods, these newcomers have nevertheless managed to establish दमदार communities in a short amount of समय.
More than sixty percent of वियतनामी Americans reside in the states of California, Texas, वॉशिंगटन, Florida, and Virginia.
Front page of the U.S. Armed Forces newspaper, Stars and Stripes, 2 May 1945
Adolf Hitler committed आत्महत्या by gunshot on 30 April 1945 in his Führerbunker in Berlin.
His wife Eva ( née braun ) committed suicide साथ him by ingesting cyanide.
That afternoon, in accordance with Hitler 's prior instructions, their remains were carried up the stairs through the bunker 's emergency exit, doused in petrol and set alight in the Reich chancellery garden बाहर the bunker.
The Soviet archives record that their burnt remains were recovered and interred in successive स्थितियाँ जबतक 1970 when they were again exhumed, cremated and the ashes scattered.
Accounts differ as to the cause of death ; one that he died by poison only and another that he died by a self-inflicted gunshot, while biting down on a cyanide capsule.
Contemporary historians have अस्वीकृत these accounts as being either Soviet propaganda or an attempted compromise in order to reconcile the different conclusions.
One eye-witness recorded that the body दिखाया signs of having been shot through the mouth, but this रै been सिद्ध unlikely.
There is also controversy regarding the authenticity of कपाल and jaw fragments जिससे were recovered.
In 2009, DNA tests were performed on a skull Soviet officials had long believed to be Hitler 's.
The tests नाज़िल that the skull was actually that of a woman less than 40 years old.
Location of Missouri
The alcohol laws of Missouri are among the least प्रतिबंधक and most lax and permissive in the United States.
Missouri is ज्ञात throughout the मिडवेस्ट for its largely laissez-faire approach to alcohol regulation, in sharp contrast to the बहुत सख्त alcohol laws of some of its neighbors, like Kansas and Oklahoma.
Necrotizing fasciitis ( or ) or NF, commonly ज्ञात as flesh-eating disease or flesh-eating bacteria syndrome, is a rare infection of the deeper layers of स्किन and subcutaneous tissues, easily spreading across the fascial plane within the subcutaneous tissue.
necrotizing fasciitis is quickly progressing, having greater risk of developing in the immunocompromised due to conditions like diabetes, cancer, etc.
It is a severe बीमारी of sudden onset and is usually treated immediately with high doses of intravenous एंटीबायोटिक.
Type I describes a polymicrobial infection, whereas Type II describes a monomicrobial infection.
Many types of bacteria can cause necrotizing fasciitis ( e.g., Group A streptococcus ( Streptococcus pyogenes ), staphylococcus aureus, Clostridium perfringens, Bacteroides fragilis, Aeromonas hydrophila ).
Such infections are more likely to occur in people with compromised immune systems.
Historically, Group A streptococcus made up most cases of Type II infections.
however, since as early as 2001, another serious form of monomicrobial necrotizing fasciitis has been observed साथ increasing frequency, caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus ( MRSA ).
Some published case reports have implied a possible link between use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and NF, though the evidence of the link was said to be weak because of a छोटी number of case patients and it was unclear whether the drugs just masked the symptoms of a secondary infection or were a cause per se.
World War II ( wwii or ww2 ), also known as the Second World War, was a global war that lasted from 1939 to 1945.
It involved the vast majority of the world 's nations —including सब of the great powers —eventually forming two opposing military alliances : the Allies and the Axis.
It was the most widespread war in history, with more than 100 million people serving in military units from over 30 different countries.
In a state of `` total war ``, the major participants placed their entire economic, industrial, and scientific capabilities at the सेवा of the war effort, erasing the distinction between civilian and military resources.
चिह्नित by mass deaths of civilians, including the Holocaust and the तभी use of nuclear हथियार in warfare, it resulted in 50 million to over 75 लाख fatalities.
These deaths make संसार युद्ध II by far the deadliest conflict in इंसान history.
The Empire of Japan aimed to dominate East Asia and was already at war साथ the Republic of China in 1937, but the world war is generally said to have begun on 1 September 1939 with the invasion of कैंडल by Germany and subsequent declarations of war on जर्मनी by France and Britain.
From late 1939 to early 1941, in a श्रेणी of campaigns and treaties, Germany formed the Axis alliance with Italy, conquering or subduing much of continental Europe.
Following the molotov–ribbentrop Pact, Germany and the Soviet Union partitioned and annexed territories between themselves of their European neighbours, including Poland.
The United Kingdom और the other members of the British Commonwealth were the only major Allied forces continuing the fight against the Axis, with battles taking place in North Africa as well as the long-running Battle of the अटलांटिक.
In June 1941, the European अक्ष शुभारम्भ an invasion of the Soviet Union, giving a प्रारंभ to the largest land theatre of युद्ध in इतिहास, which tied down the major part of the अक्ष ' military शक्तियां for the rest of the war.
In December 1941, Japan joined the Axis, attacked the United States and European territories in the Pacific Ocean, and जल्दी conquered much of the Western Pacific.
The Axis advance was stopped in 1942, after Japan lost a series of naval battles और European Axis troops were defeated in North Africa and, decisively, at Stalingrad.
In 1943, साथ a श्रेणी of German defeats in Eastern Europe, the Allied invasion of Italy, and American victories in the Pacific, the Axis lost the initiative and undertook strategic retreat on all fronts.
In 1944, the Western Allies invaded France, while the Soviet Union regained all of its territorial losses and invaded Germany and its allies.
During 1944 और 1945 the United States defeated the Japanese Navy and captured key Western Pacific islands.
the war in यूरोपीय ended with the capture of Berlin by Soviet and Polish troops and the subsequent German unconditional surrender on 8 May 1945.
Following the Potsdam Declaration by the Allies on 26 July 1945, the United States dropped atomic bombs on the Japanese cities of Hiroshima on 6 August, and Nagasaki on 9 अगस्त.
With an invasion of the Japanese archipelago imminent, and the Soviet Union having declared war on जापानी by आक्रमणकारी Manchuria, Japan surrendered on 15 August 1945, ending the war in Asia और cementing the total victory of the Allies over the Axis.
World War II altered the political alignment and social structure of the world.
The United Nations ( UN ) was स्थापित to foster international सहयोग and prevent future conflicts.
The great शक्तियां that were the victors of the war—the United राज्य, the Soviet Union, China, the United Kingdom, and France—became the स्थाई members of the संयुक्त Nations Security Council.
The Soviet Union and the United States emerged as rival superpowers, setting the stage for the Cold War, which lasted for the अगला 46 सालो.
Meanwhile, the influence of European great powers started to decline, while the decolonisation of Asia and Africa began.
Most countries whose industries had महरूम damaged moved towards economic recovery.
Political integration, especially in Europe, emerged as an effort to stabilise postwar relations and fight more effectively in the Cold War.
A सीमित liability company ( LLC ) is a flexible form of enterprise that blends elements of partnership and corporate structures.
Note than an LLC is not a corporation, and calling an LLC a corporation is technically incorrect.
An LLC is a legal form of company that provides limited liability to its owners in the vast majority of United States jurisdictions.
LLCs do not need to be organized for profit.
Five k-cups
The inside of a used K-Cup, with the top foil and the प्रयुक्त coffee grounds removed.
This shows the filter inside the K-Cup.
K-Cup portion packs are used with Keurig or other single cup brewing प्रणालियों to brew a cup of coffee, tea, or hot chocolate.
प्रत्येक K-Cup is a plastic container with a coffee filter inside.
मैदान coffee beans are packed in the K-Cup and sealed air-tight with a combination plastic and foil lid.
When the K-Cup is placed in a Keurig brewer, the brewer punctures the foil ढक्कन and the bottom of the K-Cup and forces hot water under pressure through the K-Cup और into a mug.
Keurig licenses its K-Cup technology to coffee roasters and tea makers such as Green Mountain Coffee Roasters, diedrich/ Gloria Jeans, Timothy 's World Coffee, Van Houtte, Caribou Coffee, Celestial Seasonings, Bigelow Tea Company, Twinings, Tully 's, Coffee People and Newman 's Own.
Keurig 's patents on the original K-Cup design expired in September 2012.
Keurig holds at least one additional, still-active US patent and another patent application, detailing improvements that have subsequently been incorporated in their K-Cup design.

Citizen Atessa Eco-Drive ATV53-3023 analog-digital chronograph with 4 area रेडियो Controlled reception ( North America, Europe, China, Japan ).
A chronograph is a specific type of watch that is used as a stopwatch combined with a display watch.
A मौलिक chronograph has an independent sweep second hand ; it can be started, stopped, और returned to zero by successive pressure on the stem.
Louis Moinet invented the chronograph in 1816
Conventional PCI ( PCI is an initialism formed from Peripheral Component Interconnect, part of the PCI Local Bus standard और often shortened to just PCI ) is a लोकल computer bus लिये attaching hardware devices in a computer.
the PCI bus supports the functions found on a processor बस, but in a standardized format that is independent of any particular processor.
Devices connected to the bus appear to the प्रोसेसर to be connected directly to the processor bus, and are assigned addresses in the processor 's address space.
Attached devices can take either the रूप of an integrated सर्किट fitted onto the motherboard itself, called a planar device in the PCI specification, or an expansion कार्ड that fits into a slot.
The PCI Local Bus थी first implemented in IBM PC compatibles, where it displaced the combination of ISA plus one VESA Local Bus as the bus विन्यास.
It has subsequently been adopted for other computer types.
PCI and PCI-X are being replaced by PCI Express, but, most motherboards are still made साथ one or अधिक PCI slots, which are sufficient for many uses.
the PCI specification covers the physical size of the bus ( including the size and spacing of the circuit फलक edge विद्युत contacts ), electrical characteristics, bus timing, and प्रोटोकॉल.
The specification can be purchased from the PCI Special Interest Group ( PCI-SIG ).
Typical PCI cards used in PCs include : network cards, sound cards, modems, extra ports such as USB or serial, TV tuner cards and disk controllers.
PCI video cards replaced isa and vesa cards, until growing बैंडविड्थ आवश्यकताएँ outgrew the सामर्थ्य of PCI ; the preferred interface for video cards became AGP, और then PCI Express.
PCI video cards remain available लिये use साथ old PCs without AGP or PCI Express slots.
Many devices previously provided on PCI expansion cards are now commonly integrated onto motherboards or available in universal सीरियल bus and PCI एक्स्प्रेस versions.
Michael Whitaker Smith ( born October 7, 1957 ) is an American contemporary Christian musician, who has charted primarily in the contemporary Christian and occasionally in the mainstream charts.
His biggest success in mainstream music थी in 1991 when `` Place in this World '' hit No. 6 on the Billboard Hot 100.
Smith is a three-time Grammy Award winner, and has earned 40 Dove Awards.
over the course of his career, he sold अधिक than 13 million albums and recorded 29 No. 1 hit songs, fourteen gold albums, and five platinum एल्बम.
Smith is an American Music Award प्राप्तकर्ता ; he was also नामित one of People magazine 's `` Most Beautiful People ''.
An American poster from the World War II -era that was used to inform people about what they should do if they suspect sabotage.
Sabotage is a deliberate कार्रवाई aimed at weakening another entity through subversion, obstruction, disruption, or destruction.
In a workplace setting, sabotage is the conscious वापसी of efficiency generally directed at causing some change in workplace conditions.
One जो engages in sabotage is a saboteur.
As a rule, saboteurs try to conceal their identities because of the consequences of their actions.
For उदाहरण, whereas an environmental pressure group might be happy to be identified with an act of sabotage, it would not want the individual identities of the perpetrators known.
पैट्रिक Henry College ( PHC ) is a private, स्वतंत्र college with an धर्मान्तरण Christian basis that focuses on शिक्षण classical liberal arts and government, located in Purcellville, Virginia, United States.
Patrick Henry is known for its conservative evangelical Christian focus.
As of April 17, 2007, the college was accredited by the Transnational Association of Christian Colleges and स्कूलों, a national faith-related accrediting organization recognized by the Department of Education and the Council for Higher Education Accreditation.
The school was founded with the help of the Home School Legal Defense Association, and now serves as the मुख्यालय for the organization, with which it is still closely connected.
The history of television comprises the कार्य of numerous engineers and inventors in several देशों over many दशकों.
The earliest proposal was in 1908, in a paper by A. A. Campbell-Swinton and postulated the उपयोग of cathode rays.
The first practical demonstrations of television, however, were developed using electromechanical methods to scan, transmit, and reproduce an image.
As electronic camera and display tubes यहूद perfected, electromechanical television gave way to all-electronic systems in nearly all applications.
L'Idéal Cinéma - Jacques Tati at Aniche opened November 23rd 1905 ; the oldest still-active movie theater in the world
A सिनेमा in Australia
A typical multiplex ( एएमसी Promenade 16 in Woodland पहाड़ियाँ, Los Angeles, U.S. )
A movie theater ( भी called a cinema, movie house, फिल्मी house, फिल्मी theater or picture house ) is a venue, usually a building, for viewing films.
Most but नहीं all movie theaters are वाणिज्यिक परिचालन catering to the general public, who attend by purchasing a ticket.
The movie is projected with a movie projector onto a large projection screen at the front of the auditorium.
Most movie theaters are अभी equipped for digital cinema projection, removing the need to बनाएँ and transport a physical film print.

Lyme disease, Lyme borreliosis is an infectious disease caused by at least three species of bacteria belonging to the genus Borrelia.
borrelia burgdorferi sensu stricto is the main cause of Lyme disease in North America, whereas Borrelia afzelii and Borrelia garinii cause most European cases.
The disease is named after the towns of Lyme and Old Lyme, Connecticut, USA, जहाँ a number of मामले were identified in 1975.
Although Allen Steere एहसास that Lyme बीमारी was a tick-borne disease in 1978, the cause of the disease remained a mystery until 1981, when B. burgdorferi थी identified by Willy Burgdorfer.
Lyme disease is the most common tick-borne disease in the Northern Hemisphere.
Borrelia is transmitted to humans by the bite of infected ticks belonging to a few species of the genus Ixodes ( `` hard ticks '' ).
जल्दी symptoms may include ज्वर, सिरदर्द, fatigue, depression, and a characteristic circular skin rash called erythema migrans ( EM ).
Left untreated, later symptoms may involve the joints, heart, and central nervous system.
In most cases, the infection and its symptoms are eliminated by एंटीबायोटिक, विशेषकर if the illness is treated early.
Delayed or inadequate treatment can lead to more serious symptoms, which can be disabling and difficult to treat.

Penis ( plural penises or penes ) is a general term for the organs with which male and hermaphrodite animals introduce sperm into receptive females दौरान copulation.
Such organs occur in many animals, both vertebrate और invertebrate, but males do not भालू a penis in every एनिमल species, and in those species in which the male करता bear a so-called शिश्न, the penes in the various species are not necessarily homologous.
For example, the penis of a mammal is at most analogous to the penis of a male insect or barnacle.
The term penis applies to many reproductive intromittent अंगों, but not to all ; for example the intromittent अंग of most cephalopoda is the hectocotylus, a specialised arm, and male spiders use their pedipalps.
In most species of animals in which there is an organ that might reasonably be described as a penis, it has no major फलन अन्य than intromission, or at least conveying the sperm to the मादा, but in the placental स्तनधारियों the penis bears the distal part of the urethra, which discharges both urine during urination and semen during copulation as the occasion requires.
Artists and repertoire ( A & R ) is the division of a record label or music publishing company कि is responsible for हुनर scouting and overseeing the artistic development of recording कलाकारों and/or songwriters.
It also acts as a liaison between artists and the record label or publishing company ; every activity involving artists to the point of album release is generally considered under the purview of, and जिम्मेदारी of, A & R.
A furlong is a measure of distance in imperial units and U.S. customary units equal to one-eighth of a mile, समतुल्य to 220 yards, 660 feet, 40 rods, or 10 chains.
The exact value of the furlong varies थोड़ा among English-speaking countries.
Five furlongs हैं approximately 1 किलोमीटर ( 1.0058 km is a करीब approximation ).
Since the original definition of the metre was one-quarter of one ten-millionth of the circumference of the Earth ( along the great circle coincident with the meridian of longitude passing through Paris ), the circumference of the Earth is about 40,000 km or about 200,000 furlongs.

Lithium batteries हैं disposable ( प्राथमिक ) batteries that have lithium metal or lithium compounds as an anode.
They stand apart from other batteries in their high charge density ( long life ) और high cost per unit.
Depending on the design and chemical compounds used, lithium cells can उपज voltages from 1.5 V ( comparable to a zinc–carbon or alkaline battery ) to about 3.7 V. Lithium batteries are widely used in products such as portable consumer electronic devices.

LaMontagne has released four studio एल्बम, Trouble, Till the Sun Turns Black, गपशप in the Grain and God Willin ' & the Creek Do n't Rise.
he was born in New Hampshire and was inspired to create music after hearing an album by Stephen Stills.
Critics have compared LaMontagne 's music to that of The Band, Van मॉरिसन, उपनाम Drake, and Tim buckley.
he lives in Massachusetts साथ his wife and two children.

Over the course of the team 's history, the टोली has had several लोगो while wearing virtually the same uniforms over the सालो, with subtle changes made to give the uniforms an updated look.

Facebook is an online social networking service, whose name stems from the colloquial name for the book given to students at the start of the अकादमिक year by some university administrations in the United States to सहायता students get to know each other.
It was founded in February 2004 by Mark Zuckerberg with his college roommates and fellow Harvard University students Eduardo Saverin, Andrew McCollum, Dustin Moskovitz and Chris Hughes.
The website 's membership was initially limited by the संस्थापकों to Harvard students, but was विस्तारित to अन्य colleges in the Boston area, the Ivy League, और Stanford विश्वविद्यालयों.
it gradually added support for students at various other विश्वविद्यालयों before opening to high school students, and eventually to anyone aged 13 and over.
Facebook now allows any users who declare themselves to be at least 13 years old to become registered users of the site.
Users must register before using the site, after which they may create a personal profile, add other users as friends, and exchange messages, including स्वचालित notifications when they update their profile.
Additionally, users may join common-interest user समूह, organized by workplace, school or college, or other characteristics, and categorize उनके friends into सूचियाँ such as `` People From Work '' or `` Close Friends ''.
As of September 2012, Facebook has over one billion active users.
According to a May 2011 Consumer Reports survey, there are 7.5 million children under 13 with accounts and 5 लाख under 10, violating the site 's terms of service.
In May 2005, Accel partners invested $ 12.7 million in Facebook, and Jim Breyer added $ 1 million of his own money to the pot.
A January 2009 Compete.com पढ़ाई क्रमित फेसबुक as the most प्रयुक्त social networking service by विश्वव्यापी monthly active users.
Entertainment Weekly included the site on its end-of-the-decade `` best-of '' list, saying, `` How on earth did we stalk our exes, remember our co-workers ' birthdays, bug our friends, and play a rousing game of Scrabulous before Facebook ? ''
Critics, such as Facebook Detox, state that Facebook has turned into a national obsession in the United States, resulting in vast amounts of time lost and encouraging narcissism.
Quantcast estimates Facebook has 138.9 million monthly unique U.S. visitors in May 2011.
According to Social Media Today, in April 2010 an estimated 41.6 % ( 129.5 million ) of the U.S. population had a फेसबुक account.
Nevertheless, Facebook 's market growth started to stall in कुछ regions, with the site losing 7 million active users in the United States and Canada in May 2011.
Facebook eventually दायर for an initial public offering on February 1, 2012, and was headquartered in Menlo पार्क, California.
Facebook Inc. began selling stock to the public and trading on the NASDAQ on May 18, 2012.
Erwin Johannes Eugen ख़बरों ( 15 नवम्बर 1891 – 14 October 1944 ), popularly known as The मरुस्थल Fox ( wüstenfuchs, ), was a German फ़ील्ड Marshal of संसार War II.
He earned the आदर of both उसके own troops and the दुश्मनों he fought.
Rommel थी a highly सजा officer in World War I and was awarded the डालना le Mérite for his exploits on the Italian front.
in संसार War II, he further distinguished himself as the commander of the 7th Panzer Division during the 1940 invasion of France.
His नेतृत्व of German and Italian forces in the North African campaign established him as one of the most able commanders of the war, and earned उसे the appellation of the Desert Fox.
He is regarded as one of the सबसे skilled commanders of desert warfare in the conflict.
he later commanded the German शक्तियां opposing the Allied cross-channel आक्रमण in Normandy.
His assignments never took him to the Eastern Front.
Rommel is regarded as having महरूम a दयालु and professional officer.
His Afrika कोर्प्स was never अभियुक्त of war crimes, and soldiers captured दौरान his Africa campaign were reported to have been treated humanely.
Orders to kill Jewish soldiers, civilians and captured commandos were ignored.
Late in the युद्ध, Rommel was linked to the conspiracy to assassinate एडोल्फ हिटलर.
Since ख़बरों was a national hero, Hitler desired to eliminate him चुपचाप.
He मजबूर Rommel to commit suicide with a cyanide pill, in वापसी for assurances that Rommel 's family would not be persecuted following his मौत.
