A hand ( med. / lat. : manus, pl. manūs ) is a prehensile, multi- fingered extremity स्तिथ at the end of an arm or forelimb of primates and humans, chimpanzees, monkeys, and lemurs.
A few अन्य vertebrates such as the koala ( which has two opposable thumbs on each `` हाथ '' and फिंगरप्रिंट remarkably similar to human फिंगरप्रिंट ) are often described as having either `` hands '' or `` paws '' on their front limbs.
Hands are the main structures लिये physically manipulating the environment, used for both gross motor skills ( such as grasping a large object ) and fine motor skills ( such as picking up a small pebble ).
The fingertips contain some of the densest areas of nerve endings on the body, are the richest source of tactile feedback, and have the greatest positioning capability of the body ; यूँ the sense of touch is intimately संबद्ध with hands.
Like अन्य paired organs ( eyes, feet, legs ), each hand is dominantly controlled by the opposing brain hemisphere, so that handedness, or the पसन्दीदा hand choice for single-handed activities such as writing with a pencil, reflects individual brain functioning.
Some evolutionary anatomists use the term hand to refer to the appendage of digits on the forelimb more generally — for example, in the context of whether the तीन digits of the bird hand involved the same homologous loss of two digits as in the dinosaur hand.
The human hand has 27 bones, not including the sesamoid हड्डियों which number varies between people.
14 of which are the phalanges ( proximal, intermediate and distal ) of the उंगलियाँ.
The metacarpals are the bones that connects the fingers and the wrist.
Each human hand has 5 metacarpals और 8 carpal हड्डियों.
Too कूल थी a professional wrestling tag team and former faction most notably active in World Wrestling Federation/Entertainment between 1998 and 2001 and for a short समय in 2004.
Basic digital सचेतक clock without a radio.
The mark in the top-left of the प्रदर्शक indicates that the समय is 4:00pm, not 4:00am.
A 1969 रेडियो alarm clock ( Sony Digimatic 8FC-59W ) साथ an early mechanical-digital display.
A digital clock is a type of clock that displays the समय digitally, i.e. in numerals or other symbols, as opposed to an analog clock, where the time is indicated by the positions of rotating hands.
Digital clocks are often associated with electronic drives, but the `` digital '' description refers only to the display, not to the drive mechanism.
( Both analog and digital घड़ियाँ can be driven either mechanically or electronically, but `` घटीयंत्र '' mechanisms साथ digital displays हैं rare. )
the biggest digital clock is the Lichtzeitpegel ( `` Light Time Level '' ) on the television tower Rheinturm Düsseldorf, Germany.
परिवार guy creator Seth MacFarlane also provides the voices of Peter Griffin, Stewie Griffin, Brian Griffin, और Glenn Quagmire.
Family Guy is an American animated sitcom that features five main voice actors, and numerous regular cast and recurring guest stars.
the principal voice cast consists of show creator सेठ MacFarlane, Alex Borstein, Seth Green, Mila Kunis ( who replaced Lacey Chabert after the first season ) and Mike Henry and now, the new actor Beau Osborne.
Recurring voice अभिनेताओं include Patrick Warburton, Adam West, John G. Brennan, Nicole Sullivan and Jennifer tilly, and repeat guest stars include Phyllis Diller, Charles Durning, Rush Limbaugh, and फिल LaMarr.
Many cast members provide voices for multiple characters.
The आवाज़ actors, in portraying the various अक्षर personalities on the दिखाएँ, draw inspiration from celebrities and pop संस्कृति.
Family Guy characters have been played by more than one actor, after members of the show left the series or had conflicting obligations.
Kunis was nominated for an Annie Award for voicing Meg Griffin in the season 5 episode `` Barely विधिक `` and MacFarlane रै also won an Emmy Award for Outstanding Voice-Over Performance and an Annie Award for Best Voice Acting in an Animated Television Production, though no अन्य cast member रै won an award for their work on the series.
The five sets of the board game Monopoly depicted here show the evolution of the game 's artwork and designs in the United States इससे 1935–2005.
The history of the board game Monopoly can be traced back to the early 20th century.
The earliest known डिज़ाइन was by the American, Elizabeth Magie, patented in 1904 but existing as early as 1902.
magie 's original intent was to publish a board game to illustrate an economic principle, namely the georgist concept of a single land value tax.
A series of board games were developed from 1906 through the 1930s that involved the buying and selling of land and the development of that land.
By 1934, a board game had महरूम created much like the version of Monopoly बेची by Parker Brothers and इसके related companies through the rest of the 20th century, and into the 21st.
Several people, ज़्यादातर in the Midwestern United States और near the East Coast, contributed to the game 's डिज़ाइन and एवोल्यूशन.
By the 1970s, the idea कि the game had been created solely by Charles Darrow had become popular folklore ; it was printed in the game 's instructions for many years, in a 1974 book devoted to Monopoly, and was cited in a general book about toys even as recently as 2007.
Even a guide to family games published for Reader 's Digest in 2003 only gave credit to Darrow and Elizabeth Magie, erroneously stating कि Magie 's original game was created in the 1800s, and not acknowledging any of the game 's development between Magie 's सृष्टि of the game, and the eventual publication by Parker Brothers.
Also in the 1970s, Professor Ralph Anspach, who had himself published a board game intended to illustrate the सिद्धान्त of both monopolies और trust busting, fought Parker Brothers और its then parent company, General Mills, over the trademarks of the Monopoly board game.
Through the research of anspach and others, much of the early history of the खेल was `` rediscovered ''.
Anspach confronted Maxine Brady, author of the 1974 book The Monopoly Book : Strategy and Tactics of the World 's Most Popular Game over the वास्तविक history of the game on Barry Farber 's New यॉर्क City talk show in 1975.
Because of the lengthy court process, including appeals, the विधिक status of Parker Brothers ' trademarks on the game was not settled until 1985.
The game 's name remains a registered trademark of पार्कर Brothers, as do its specific design elements.
At the निष्कर्ष of the court case, the game 's logo and graphic design elements became part of a larger Monopoly brand, licensed by Parker Brothers ' parent companies onto a variety of items through the present day.
Despite the `` rediscovery '' of the board game 's early history in the 1970s and 1980s, and several books and journal articles on the subject, Hasbro ( Parker Brothers ' current parent company ) did not acknowledge any of the game 's history पहले Charles Darrow on its official Monopoly website as recently as June 2012.
Nor किया Hasbro acknowledge anyone other than Darrow in materials published or sponsored by them, at least as recently as 2006.
International tournaments, first held in the early 1970s, continue to the उपस्थित, with the अगला world championship likely scheduled for 2013.
Starting in 1985, a new generation of spin-off board games and card games appeared on दोनो पहलू of the Atlantic Ocean.
In 1989, the first of many video game and computer game editions was published.
Since 1994, many official variants of the game, based on locations other than Atlantic City, New Jersey ( the आधिकारिक U.S. setting ) or London ( the official Commonwealth setting, excepting Canada ), have महरूम published by Hasbro or its licensees.
In 2008, Hasbro permanently changed the color scheme and some of the gameplay of the standard U.S. Edition of the game to मैच the UK Edition, although the U.S. standard edition maintains the Atlantic City property names.
Hasbro also modified the official logo to दे the `` mr. Monopoly '' अक्षर a 3-D computer-generated look, which has since been adopted by licensees USAopoly, Winning Moves and Winning समाधान.
And Hasbro has also been including the गति Die, introduced in 2006 's Monopoly : The Mega Edition by Winning Moves Games, in versions produced directly by Hasbro ( such as the 2009 Championship Edition ).
In baseball, a sacrifice fly is a batted ball कि satisfies four criteria:
वहीँ are fewer than two outs जब the बॉल is hit.
The ball is hit to the outfield ( fair or foul ), or to infield foul territory.
The batter is put out because an outfielder ( or an infielder running in the outfield, or foul territory ) catches the बॉल on the fly ( alternatively if the batter would have महरूम out if not for an error or if the outfielder drops the ball and another धावक is put out ).
A runner who is already on base scores on the play.
It is called a `` sacrifice '' fly because the batter presumably intends to cause a teammate to score a run, while sacrificing his अपना क्षमता to do so.
Minnesota ( ) is a U.S. state located in the midwestern United States.
Minnesota was carved out of the eastern half of the Minnesota Territory and admitted to the Union as the 32nd state on May 11, 1858.
Known as the `` Land of 10,000 झीलों '', the state 's name आता from a Dakota शब्द for `` sky-tinted जल ''.
Those waters, साथ with forests, parks, and wilderness areas, offer residents and tourists a किस्में of outdoor recreational opportunities.
Minnesota is the 12th most extensive and the 21st most populous of the u.S. states.
Nearly 60 % of its residents live in the minneapolis–saint Paul metropolitan area ( known as the `` Twin Cities '' ), the बीच of transportation, business, industry, education, government and home to an internationally known arts community.
The remainder of the state consists of western prairies now given over to intensive agriculture ; deciduous forests in the southeast, now cleared, farmed और settled ; and the less populated उत्तर Woods, used for mining, forestry, and recreation.
Minnesota is known for its relatively mixed social और राजनैतिक orientations, and has a high rate of civic भागीदारी and voter turnout.
Minnesota ranks among the healthiest states, और has a highly literate population.
The large majority of निवासियों are of Scandinavian और German descent.
The state is known as a center of Scandinavian American culture.
Ethnic विविधता has increased in recent decades.
Substantial influxes of Asian, African, and Latin American immigrants have joined the descendants of European settlers and the original Native American inhabitants.
Grants are non-repayable funds by one party ( grant makers ), प्रायः a government department, corporation, foundation or trust, to a, often ( but not always ) a nonprofit entity, educational institution, business or an individual.
in order to receive a grant, some form of `` Grant Writing '' often referred to as either a proposal or an application is usually required.
सबसे grants हैं made to fund a specific project and require some level of compliance and रिपोर्टिंग.
The grant writing process involves an applicant submitting a proposal ( or submission ) to a संभावित funder, either on the applicant 's own initiative or in response to a Request लिये Proposal from the funder.
Other grants can be given to individuals, such as victims of प्राकृतिक disasters or individuals who seek to open a small business.
Sometimes grant makers require grant seekers to have some form of tax-exempt status, be a registered nonprofit organization or a local government.
For उदाहरण, tiered funding for a freeway हैं very large अनुदान negotiated at government policy level.
However smaller grants may be provided by a government agency ( e.g. municipal government ).
Project-related funding involving governments, business, communities, and individuals is often arranged by application either in writing or online.
Naturally occurring cobalt ( Co ) is composed of 1 stable isotope, 59Co. 28 radioisotopes have been characterized with the most stable being 60Co with a half-life of 5.2714 years, 57Co with a half-life of 271.79 days, 56Co with a half-life of 77.27 days, and 58Co साथ a half-life of 70.86 days.
All of the remaining radioactive isotopes have half-lives that are less than 18 hours and the majority of these have half-lives that are कम than 1 second.
This element also has 11 meta states, all of which have half-lives less than 15 minutes.
The isotopes of cobalt range in atomic वज़न from 47Co to 75co.
The primary decay mode for isotopes with atomic द्रव्यमान unit values less than that of the most abundant stable isotope, 59Co, is electron capture और the primary mode of decay for those of greater than 59 atomic mass units is beta decay.
The primary decay products before 59Co are iron isotopes and the primary products after are nickel isotopes.
Standard atomic mass : 58.933195 ( 5 ) u
Who Moved My Cheese ?
An Amazing Way to Deal with बदलें in Your Work and in Your Life, published in 1998, is a motivational book by Spencer Johnson written in the style of a parable or business fable.
It describes change in one 's work and life, and four typical reactions to said change by दो चूहे and two `` littlepeople '', during their hunt for cheese.
A New यॉर्क Times business bestseller since release, जो Moved My Cheese ?
remained on the सूची for almost five years and spent over 200 weeks on Publishers Weekly 's hardcover nonfiction list.
It has sold more than 26 million copies विश्वव्यापी in 37 languages और remains to be one of the best-selling business books.
Nikita sergeyevich Khrushchev ( – September 11, 1971 ) led the Soviet Union during part of the Cold War.
he served as First Secretary of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union from 1953 to 1964, and as Chairman of the Council of Ministers, or Premier, from 1958 to 1964.
Khrushchev was responsible for the partial de-Stalinization of the Soviet Union, लिये backing the progress of the early Soviet space program, and for several relatively liberal reforms in क्षेत्रों of domestic policy.
Khrushchev 's party colleagues removed him from power in 1964, replacing him with Leonid Brezhnev as First Secretary and Alexei Kosygin as Premier.
Khrushchev was born in the Russian village of Kalinovka in 1894, close to the present-day border between Russia and Ukraine.
He was employed as a metalworker in his youth, and during the Russian सिविल War was a political commissar.
With the help of Lazar Kaganovich, he worked उसके रास्ता up the Soviet hierarchy.
He supported Joseph Stalin 's purges, और approved thousands of arrests.
In 1939, Stalin sent him to govern Ukraine, and he continued the purges there.
During what was known in the Soviet Union as the Great Patriotic War ( Eastern Front of World War II ), Khrushchev थी again a commissar, serving as an intermediary between Stalin and his generals.
Khrushchev was present at the bloody defense of Stalingrad, a फैक्ट he took great pride in throughout his life.
बाद the war, he लौटे to Ukraine before being recalled to Moscow as one of Stalin 's close advisers.
In the power struggle triggered by Stalin 's death in 1953, Khrushchev, after several years, emerged victorious.
On February 25, 1956, at the 20th Party Congress, he delivered the `` Secret Speech, '' denouncing Stalin 's purges and ushering in a less repressive era in the Soviet Union.
His domestic policies, aimed at bettering the lives of ordinary citizens, were often ineffective, especially in the area of agriculture.
Hoping eventually to rely on मिसाइलें for national defense, Khrushchev ordered major cuts in conventional forces.
Despite the cuts, Khrushchev 's rule saw the tensest years of the Cold War, culminating in the Cuban Missile Crisis.
Some of khrushchev 's policies were seen as erratic, particularly by his emerging rivals, जो quietly rose in strength and deposed उसे in October 1964.
He did नहीं suffer the घातक fate of some previous losers of Soviet power struggles, लकिन was pensioned off with an apartment in Moscow and a dacha in the countryside.
His lengthy memoirs were smuggled to the West and published in part in 1970.
khrushchev died in 1971 of heart disease.
Upper gastrointestinal ( GI ) bleeding refers to hemorrhage in the upper gastrointestinal tract.
The anatomic cut-off for upper GI bleeding is the ligament of Treitz, which connects the चौथी portion of the duodenum to the diaphragm near the splenic flexure of the colon.
Upper GI bleeds are considered medical emergencies, and require admission to hospital for urgent diagnosis and प्रबन्धन.
Due to advances in medications and endoscopy, upper GI hemorrhage is now usually treated without surgery.
World population estimates from 1800 to 2100, based on UN 2010 projections ( red, orange, green ) and US Census ब्यूरो historical estimates ( black ).
Actual recorded population figures are in blue.
According to the highest estimate, the world population may rise to 16 billion by 2100 ; according to the lowest estimate, it may decline to 6 billion.
The संसार population is the total number of living humans on Earth.
As of today, it is estimated to number billion by the United States जनसांख्यिकी Bureau ( uscb ).
The USCB estimates that the world population exceeded 7 billion on March 12, 2012.
According to a separate estimate by the United राष्ट्र जनसांख्यिकी Fund, it पहुँचे this milestone on October 31, 2011.
The world जनसांख्यिकी has experienced continuous growth since the end of the Great Famine and the Black Death in 1350, जब it stood at around 370 million.
The highest rates of growth – global population increases above 1.8 % per साल – were seen briefly during the 1950s, and for a longer period during the 1960s and 1970s.
the growth rate peaked at 2.2 % in 1963, and had declined to 1.1 % by 2011.
Total annual births were उच्चतम in the late 1980s at about 138 million, and are now expected to remain essentially constant at their 2011 level of 134 लाख, while deaths number 56 million per year, and are expected to increase to 80 million per year by 2040.
Current projections show a continued बढ़ाएँ in population in the near future ( but a steady decline in the population growth rate ), with the global जनसांख्यिकी expected to reach between 7.5 and 10.5 billion by 2050.
Various longer-term estimates predict further growth, stagnation, or even overall decline in the global population by 2150.
Some analysts have questioned the sustainability of further world population growth, citing the growing pressures on the environment, global food supplies, and energy resources.
Philips Lumileds Lighting Company is the manufacturer of a wide range of high-power/high-efficiency light-emitting diodes ( LEDs ).
It is a now a fully owned प्रभाग of फिलिप्स Lighting.
Knuckle mnemonic for the number of days in each month of the Gregorian Calendar.
Each projecting knuckle represents a 31-day month.
A mnemonic (, with a silent `` m '' ), or mnemonic device, is any learning technique that aids information retention.
Mnemonics aim to अनुवाद information into a form that the human brain can retain better than इसके original form.
Even the process of applying इस परिवर्तन might already aid the transfer of information to long-term memory.
Commonly encountered mnemonics हैं often for lists and in auditory form, such as short poems, acronyms, or memorable phrases, but mnemonics can also be for other types of information and in visual or kinesthetic forms.
Their use is based on the observation that the human mind more easily remembers spatial, personal, surprising, physical, sexual, humorous, or otherwise 'relatable ' information, बल्कि than more abstract or impersonal forms of information.
the word mnemonic is derived from the Ancient यूनानी word μνημονικός ( mnēmonikos ), meaning `` of memory '' और is related to Mnemosyne ( `` remembrance '' ), the name of the goddess of memory in Greek mythology.
Both of these words हैं derived from μνήμη ( mnēmē ), `` remembrance, memory ''.
mnemonics in antiquity were most often माना in the context of what is today known as the Art of memory.
Ancient Greeks and Romans distinguished between two types of memory : the 'natural ' memory and the 'artificial ' memory.
The former is inborn, and is the one that everyone uses automatically and without सोच.
The artificial memory in contrast has to be trained and developed through the learning and practicing of a variety of mnemonic techniques.
Mnemonic systems are special techniques or strategies consciously used to improve memory, it helps employ information already stored in long-term memory to make memorization an easier task.
President Bush signing the No Child Left Behind Act at Hamilton H.S. in Hamilton, Ohio.
The No Child Left Behind Act of 2001 ( NCLB ) is a United States Act of Congress that is a reauthorization of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act, which included Title I, the government 's flagship aid program for disadvantaged students.
NCLB supports standards-based education reform based on the आधार that सेटिंग high standards and establishing measurable goals can improve individual outcomes in education.
The Act requires राज्य to develop assessments in basic कौशल.
States must give these assessments to all students at select ग्रेड levels in अनुक्रम to receive federal school funding.
the Act does not assert a national achievement standard ; standards are set by each individual state.
NCLB expanded the federal role in पब्लिक education through annual testing, annual अकादमिक progress, report cards, teacher योग्यता, and funding changes.
The bill passed in the U.S. Congress with bipartisan support.

A pickup truck or pick-up, often simply referred to as a pickup, is a light मोटर vehicle with an open-top, rear cargo area ( bed ).
In उत्तर America, the term pickup is used for light trucks साथ a lighter duty chassis and factory built, integrated bed, as well as लिये coupé utility vehicles, often based on a personal car chassis, but also often on a special dedicated chassi for ऐसे use.
कुछ countries have their own terms similar to pickup, such as ute in Australia and New Zealand, or bakkie in दक्षिण Africa.
Large pickup trucks are somewhat rare in Europe, where vans and light lorries are commonly used for similar roles.
This 15th-century depiction of Charlemagne and Pope Adrian i shows a well-bred medieval horse with arched neck, परिष्कृत head and elegant gait.
Horses in the Middle Ages differed in आकार, build and नस्ल from the modern horse, and were, on average, छोटी.
They were also more central to society than their modern counterparts, being essential for war, agriculture, and transport.
Consequently, विशिष्ट types of horse विकसित, many of which have no modern समतुल्य.
While an understanding of modern horse breeds and equestrianism is vital for any analysis of the medieval horse, researchers also need to consider documentary ( both written and pictorial ) and archaeological evidence.
Horses in the Middle Ages were rarely differentiated by breed, but बल्कि by use.
This led उन्हें to be described, for उदाहरण, as `` chargers `` ( युद्ध horses ), `` palfreys `` ( riding horses ), cart घोड़े or packhorses.
Reference is also given to their place of origin, such as `` Spanish horses, '' but whether this referred to एक breed or several is अनजान.
Another difficulty arising during any study of मध्यकालीन documents or literature is the flexibility of the medieval languages, where several words can be used for one thing ( or, conversely, several वस्तुएँ are referred to by one word ).
Words such as ' courser ' and 'charger ' are used interchangeably ( even within one document ), and जहाँ one epic may speak disparagingly of a rouncey, another गुणगान its कौशल and swiftness.
Significant technological advances in equestrian equipment, प्रायः introduced from other cultures, allowed for significant changes in both warfare and agriculture.
In particular, improved designs for the solid-treed saddle as well as the arrival of the stirrup, horseshoe and horse collar were significant advances in medieval society.
Consequently, the assumptions and theories developed by historians are not definitive, and बहस still rages on many issues, ऐसे as the breeding or size of the घोड़ा, and a number of sources must be consulted in order to understand the breadth of the subject.
The Music Man is a musical with book, music, and lyrics by Meredith Willson, आधारित on a story by Willson and Franklin Lacey.
The plot चिंताएं con man Harold Hill, who poses as a boys ' band आयोजक and leader और sells band instruments and वर्दी to naive townsfolk before skipping town with the cash.
In River City, Iowa, prim librarian and piano teacher Marian Paroo sees through him, लकिन when Hill helps her younger brother overcome उसके fear of social interactions due to his lisp, Marian begins to fall in प्रेम with Harold.
Harold, in turn falling for Marian, risks being caught to win her.
In 1957, the show became a hit on Broadway, winning five Tony Awards, including Best Musical, and running for 1,375 performances.
The cast album जीती the first Grammy Award for `` Best Original Cast Album '' and was number one on the Billboard charts लिये 245 weeks.
The show 's success led to revivals and a popular 1962 film adaptation and a 2003 television remake.
It frequently is produced by both professional and amateur theater companies.
Surveyor 's wheel
A surveyor 's wheel, also called a clickwheel, hodometer, waywiser, trundle wheel, measuring wheel, or perambulator is a device for measuring distance.
Largest non-polar deserts
Sand dunes in the Rub ' al Khali ( `` खाली quarter '' ) of Saudi Arabia.

A desert is a landscape or region of land that is very dry because of low rainfall amounts ( precipitation ), प्रायः has little coverage by plants, and in which streams dry up unless they are supplied by water from outside areas.
Deserts can also be described as areas where more water is lost by evapotranspiration than falls as precipitation.
Desert plants जरूर have special adaptations to survive with this little water.
Deserts generally receive less than 25 cm of rain ( precipitation ) each year.
Semideserts or steppes are regions which receive between और.
In the köppen climate classification system, deserts are classed as bwh ( hot desert ) or BWk ( temperate desert ).
In the Thornthwaite climate classification system, deserts would be वर्गीकृत as arid megathermal climates.
World War i ( WWI ) was a global war centred in Europe that began on 28 July 1914 and lasted until 11 November 1918.
It was predominantly called the World War or the Great युद्ध from its occurrence until the start of World War II in 1939, and the First World War or World युद्ध i thereafter.
It शामिल all the संसार 's great powers, which were assembled in दो opposing alliances : the Allies ( based on the Triple Entente of the United Kingdom, France and Russia ) and the Central Powers ( originally the Triple Alliance of Germany, Austria-Hungary and Italy ; लकिन, as Austria–Hungary था taken the offensive against the अनुबंध, Italy did not enter into the war ).
These alliances यहूद both reorganised and expanded as more nations entered the war : Italy, Japan and the United States joined the Allies, and the Ottoman Empire and Bulgaria the Central Powers.
Ultimately, more than 70 million military personnel, including 60 million Europeans, were mobilised in one of the largest wars in history.
अधिक than 9 million combatants were मारे, largely because of technological advancements that led to विशाल increases in the lethality of weapons without corresponding improvements in protection or mobility.
It थी the fifth- deadliest conflict in world history, subsequently paving the way for various political changes, such as revolutions in many of the nations involved.
One of the long-term कल्याणकारी of the war was the resurgence of साम्राज्यवाद in the foreign policies of the great powers of Europe.
More immediately, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria, the heir to the throne of austria-hungary, on 28 June 1914 by Yugoslav nationalist Gavrilo Princip in Sarajevo triggered a diplomatic crisis जब Austria-Hungary subsequently delivered an ultimatum to the Kingdom of Serbia.
Several alliances formed over the previous दशकों were invoked.
Within weeks, the प्रमुख powers were at war and, via their colonies, the conflict soon spread around the world.
On 28 July, the Austro-Hungarians fired the first shots of the war as preparation for the आक्रमण of Serbia.
While the Russians mobilised, the Germans invaded neutral बेल्जियम and Luxembourg on the way to France, providing a casus belli for Britain 's declaration of युद्ध against Germany.
After the German march on Paris थी brought to a halt—the so-called Miracle of the marne —the Western Front settled into a static battle of attrition with a trench line that changed little until 1917.
On the Eastern Front, the Russian army was successful against the Austro-Hungarians, but was stopped in its invasion of East Prussia by the Germans.
in November the Ottoman Empire joined the war, खोलने up fronts in the Caucasus, Mesopotamia और the Sinai.
Italy and Bulgaria went to war in 1915 and Romania in 1916.
In Russia, the tsar 's government collapsed in March 1917 and a subsequent revolution in November brought the Russians to terms with the Central Powers.
After a 1918 German offensive along the western front, the Allies drove वापस the germans in a series of successful offensives and American forces began entering the trenches.
Germany, जिससे had its own trouble with revolutionaries, agreed to an armistice on 11 November 1918.
The war ended in विजय for the Allies.
कार्यक्रम on the home fronts were as tumultuous as on the battle fronts, as the participants tried to mobilize their manpower and आर्थिक resources to fight a total war.
By the end of the war, four प्रमुख imperial powers—the German, Russian, Austro-Hungarian and Ottoman empires—ceased to exist.
The successor states of the पूर्व two lost a great amount of territory, while the latter two were dismantled entirely.
The map of central Europe was redrawn into several smaller states.
The League of Nations was formed in the hope of preventing another such conflict.
The European nationalism spawned by the war and the breakup of empires, the repercussions of Germany 's defeat and problems with the Treaty of Versailles are agreed to be factors contributing to World War II.
`` Girls Just Want to Have Fun '' is a 1979 song originally written by Robert जोखिम and made famous by singer cyndi Lauper.
It was the first major single released by Lauper as a solo artist and the lead-off single from her debut album She 's So Unusual.
Lauper’s version gained recognition as a feminist anthem and promoted by an award-winning video.
It has been covered on either an album or in live concert by over 30 other artists.
The single was Lauper 's breakthrough hit, reaching # 2 on the Billboard Hot 100 and becoming a worldwide hit throughout late 1983 and early 1984.
It remains one of Lauper 's signature गीतों and was a widely लोकप्रिय song during the era of its रिलीज, the 1980s.
The `` Rolling Stone & MTV : '100 Greatest Pop Songs ' : 1-50 '', `` Rolling Stone : `` the 100 Top Music Videos '' '' और the `` VH1 : 100 Greatest Videos '' सूचियाँ ranked the song at # 22, # 39 and # 45, respectively.
The song received a Grammy Award nomination for Record of the Year and Best Female Pop Vocal Performance.
View of defibrillator एलेक्ट्रोड position and placement.
Defibrillation is a common treatment लिये life-threatening cardiac dysrhythmias, ventricular fibrillation, and pulseless ventricular tachycardia.
defibrillation consists of delivering a therapeutic dose of electrical energy to the affected heart with a यंत्र called a defibrillator.
This depolarizes a critical mass of the heart muscle, terminates the dysrhythmia, and allows normal sinus rhythm to be reestablished by the body 's natural pacemaker, in the sinoatrial नोड of the heart.
Defibrillators can be बाह्य, transvenous, or implanted, depending on the type of device used or needed.
Some external इकाई, known as automated external defibrillators ( AEDs ), automate the diagnosis of treatable rhythms, meaning that lay responders or bystanders are able to use them successfully with little, or in some cases no training at all.
The Cato Institute is an American libertarian think tank headquartered in Washington, D.C.
It was संस्थापित as the Charles koch Foundation in 1974 by Murray Rothbard, Ed Crane and Charles Koch, chairman of the board and chief कार्यपालिका officer of the conglomerate Koch Industries, Inc..
In July 1976, the name was changed to the Cato Institute.
according to the 2011 Global Go To सोचो Tank Index, Cato is the 6th सबसे influential US based think tank, रैंकिंग 3rd in Economic Policy and 2nd in Social Policy.
The Institute 's stated mission is `` to increase the understanding of public policies based on the principles of limited government, free बाज़ार, individual liberty, and peace.
The Institute will use the most प्रभावी means to originate, advocate, promote, and disseminate applicable policy proposals that बनाएँ free, open, and civil societies in the United States और throughout the world. ''
Cato scholars were नाजुक of George W. Bush 's Republican administration ( 2001–2009 ) on several issues, including the Iraq War, civil liberties, education, agriculture, energy policy, and excessive government spending.
On other issues, they supported Bush प्रशासन initiatives, most notably health care, Social Security, global warming, tax नीति, and immigration.
दौरान the 2008 U.S. presidential election, Cato scholars criticized both major-party candidates, जॉन McCain and Barack Obama.
Cato has criticized President ओबामा 's stances on नीति issues चूंकि उसके inauguration, such as fiscal stimulus, healthcare सुधार, foreign policy, and the War on Drugs, while supporting his stance on the repeal of Do n't Ask, do n't Tell and liberal immigration policy.
Dracula is an 1897 Gothic हॉरर novel by Irish author Bram Stoker.
प्रसिद्ध for introducing the character of the vampire Count Dracula, the novel tells the story of Dracula 's attempt to relocate from transylvania to इंग्लैण्ड, and the battle between Dracula और a small group of men and women led by Professor Abraham Van Helsing.
Dracula has been assigned to many literary genres including vampire literature, horror fiction, the gothic novel and invasion literature.
The novel touches on विषयवस्तु ऐसे as the role of women in Victorian culture, sexual conventions, immigration, colonialism, and post-colonialism.
हालांकि Stoker did नहीं invent the vampire, he defined its modern form, and the novel has spawned numerous theatrical, फिल्मी and television interpretations.
quidditch is a competitive sport in the wizarding world of the हैरी Potter universe, and is from the series of children 's novels और movies.
it is an extremely rough but very popular semi-contact sport, played by wizards and witches.
Matches are played between two teams of seven players riding flying broomsticks, using चार balls and six elevated ring-shaped goals, three on each पक्ष of the quidditch पिच ( field ).
In the Harry Potter universe, Quidditch holds a fervent following similar to the position that association football holds as a globally popular sport.
The sport is monumental throughout the wizarding world.
Harry plays an important position for his हाउस team at हॉग्वार्ट्स : he is the seeker and becomes the captain in his sixth year there.
Regional and international competitions are mentioned throughout the श्रेणी.
In Goblet of Fire, Quidditch at Hogwarts is cancelled for the Tri-Wizard Tournament, but Harry and the Weasleys attend the Quidditch World Cup.
In addition, Harry उपयोग his Quidditch skills to capture a golden egg from a dragon called the Hungarian Horntail ( in the first task of the Tri-Wizard टूर्नामेंट ), to capture a flying key in Philosopher 's Stone, and on two key occasions in Deathly Hallows — getting hold of Ravenclaw 's Diadem, and during the final लड़ो with Voldemort — the `` unerring कौशल of the seeker '' is useful to him in snatching the Elder Wand out of the air.
Harry Potter रै owned two broomsticks, the Nimbus 2000 and the firebolt, both of which are destroyed by the श्रेणी ' end.
The game has been adopted in the real world in the form of Muggle Quidditch.
The United States Congress is the bicameral legislature of the federal सरकारी of the United States consisting of two houses : the lower house known as the House of Representatives and the upper house known as the सीनेट.
Congress meets in the Capitol in Washington, D.C.
Both प्रतिनिधि and senators are chosen through direct election.
Congress has a total of 535 voting members : 435 members in the हाउस of Representatives and 100 members in the Senate.
Members of the House of Representatives serve two-year terms representing the people of a district.
Congressional districts are apportioned to states by population using the United States Census results, each state in the union having at least one प्रतिनिधि in the House of Representatives.
Regardless of population, each of the 50 राज्य has two senators ; the 100 senators each serve a six-year term.
The terms हैं staggered so every two years approximately one-third of the Senate is up for election.
Each staggered group of one-third of the senators are called 'classes '.
No state of the United States has two senators from the same class.
Most incumbents seek re-election, and their historical likelihood of winning subsequent elections exceeds 90 percent.
In अगस्त 2012, a Gallup poll reported that congress’s approval दरजा amongst Americans was at 10 %, matching a 38-year low reached in November 2011.
`` A Little More Country Than That '' is the शीर्षक of a song written by Joey + Rory 's Rory Lee Feek, Wynn Varble, and Don Poythress, and recorded by अमरीकी country कलाकार Easton Corbin.
It was released in August 2009 as Corbin 's debut single and is included on his self-titled debut album.
In April 2010, the song पहुँचे Number One on the country म्यूज़िक charts, making Corbin the first male solo artist in सात सालो to send a debut single to Number एक.
It has been certified Gold by the RIAA.
The BlackBerry is a line of बेतार handheld devices and services designed and marketed by Research In Motion Limited ( रिम ) operating as BlackBerry.
The first ब्लैकबेरी device, an email pager, was released in 1999 ; the most recent BlackBerry devices, the Z10 and Q10, were announced on January 30, 2013.
The user interface varies by मॉडल ; most feature a physical QWERTY keyboard, जबकि newer generations have relied on a multi-touch स्क्रीन और virtual keyboard.
A ब्लैकबेरी can shoot video, take photos, play music, और perform online functions such as web-browsing and emailing.
They can also send and प्राप्त push email and instant messages while maintaining a high level of security through on-device message encryption, and are designed to फलन as personal digital assistants.
BlackBerry डिवाइस support a large variety of instant messaging features, साथ the सबसे popular being the proprietary BlackBerry Messenger service.
The BlackBerry PlayBook is a tablet computer offered by the company.
The 100 millionth BlackBerry smartphone was shipped in June quarter of 2010 and the 200 millionth smartphone was shipped in September quarter of 2012.
BlackBerry खाते for 3 % of मोबाईल device sales worldwide in 2011, making its manufacturer the sixth most लोकप्रिय device maker ( 25 % of mobile device sales are smartphones ).
the consumer BlackBerry Internet Service is available in 91 countries worldwide on over 500 mobile service operators using विभिन्न mobile technologies.
As of September 2012, there were eighty million subscribers विश्वव्यापी to BlackBerry.
In 2011 the Caribbean and Latin America had the highest penetrations of BlackBerry smartphones worldwide, with up to about 45 per cent in the region having a RIM यंत्र.
BlackBerry, iphone, Android, and Windows Phone are माना the four major smartphone brands.
BlackBerry is widely referred to as `` CrackBerry '' in the United States, which alludes to its excessive use by its owners and is a reference to the addictiveness of crack cocaine.
Use of the term CrackBerry became so widespread that in November 2006 वेबस्टर 's New World College शब्दकोष named `` crackberry '' the `` New Word of the साल. ''
An example of a demand curve shifting.
The shift from D1 To D2 means an increase in माँग with consequences for the other variables
In economics, the demand curve is the graph depicting the relationship between the price of a certain commodity and the amount of it that consumers are willing and able to purchase at that given price.
It is a graphic representation of a demand schedule.
The demand curve for all consumers साथ follows from the demand curve of every individual consumer : the individual demands at each price are added together.
Demand curves are प्रयुक्त to estimate behaviors in competitive बाज़ार, and are प्रायः combined with सप्लाई curves to estimate the equilibrium price ( the price at which sellers together are willing to sell the वही amount as buyers together are willing to buy, also known as market clearing price ) और the equilibrium quantity ( the amount of कि good or service that will be produced and bought without surplus/excess supply or shortage/excess demand ) of that market.
In a monopolistic market, the demand curve facing the monopolist is simply the market demand curve.
Historia
by Nikolaos Gysis ( 1892 )
History ( from Greek - historia, meaning `` inquiry, knowledge acquired by investigation '' ) is an umbrella term that relates to past events as well as the discovery, collection, organization, and presentation of information about these events.
The term includes cosmic, geologic, and organic history, लकिन is प्रायः generically implied to mean human history.
Scholars who write about history are called इतिहासकारों.
History can also refer to the academic discipline which uses a narrative to examine and analyse a sequence of past events, and objectively determine the patterns of cause and effect that determine them.
Historians sometimes debate the nature of history and its usefulness by discussing the study of the discipline as an end in itself and as a way of providing `` perspective '' on the problems of the present.
Stories common to a particular culture, लकिन not supported by external sources ( such as the tales surrounding King Arthur ) are usually classified as cultural heritage or legends, because they do not support the `` disinterested छानबीन '' required of the discipline of history.
कार्यक्रम occurring prior to written record are considered प्रागितिहास.
Herodotus, a 5th सदी B.C. Greek historian is considered within the Western tradition to be the `` father of history '', and, along with his contemporary Thucydides, helped form the foundations for the modern study of इंसान history.
उनके work continues to be read today and the divide between the culture-focused Herodotus and the military-focused Thucydides remains a point of contention or approach in modern historical writing.
In the Eastern tradition, a state chronicle the Spring and Autumn Annals was known to be compiled from as early as 722 BCE although only 2nd century bce texts survived.
Ancient influences have helped spawn variant interpretations of the nature of history जिससे have evolved over the सदियां and continue to change today.
The modern study of history is wide-ranging, and includes the study of specific regions and the study of certain topical or thematical elements of historical investigation.
Often history is सिखाया as part of प्राथमिक and secondary education, and the academic study of history is a major discipline in University studies.
Malcolm X ( ; May 19, 1925February 21, 1965 ), born Malcolm Little and also known as el-hajj Malik El-Shabazz ( ), थी an African-American मुस्लिम minister and human rights activist.
To his admirers, he was a courageous advocate for the rights of blacks, a man who indicted श्वेत America in the harshest terms for its crimes against black Americans.
Detractors accused him of preaching racism, ब्लैक supremacy, and violence.
He has been called one of the greatest and most influential African Americans in history.
Malcolm X 's father died—killed by white supremacists, it was rumored—when he was young, and at least one of his uncles was lynched.
When he was 13, his माँ was placed in a mental hospital, and he was placed in a series of foster homes.
In 1946, at age 20, he went to थाना for तोड़कर and प्रवेश.
In prison, Malcolm X became a सदस्य of the Nation of Islam ; after his parole in 1952, he quickly rose to become one of its leaders.
लिये a dozen years, Malcolm X was the public face of the controversial समूह, but disillusionment with Nation of Islam head इलियास Muhammad led him to leave the Nation in March 1964.
After a काल of travel in Africa and the Middle ईस्ट, he लौटे to the United States, where he founded Muslim Mosque, Inc. और the Organization of Afro-American Unity.
In February 1965, less than a year after leaving the Nation of islam, he was assassinated by three members of the group.
Malcolm X 's expressed मान्यताओं changed substantially over समय.
As a spokesman for the Nation of Islam he taught black supremacy and advocated separation of black and white Americans —in contrast to the civil rights movement 's emphasis on integration.
After breaking with the Nation of Islam in 1964—saying of his संघ with it, `` I did many things as a [ ब्लैक ] Muslim that i 'm sorry for now.
i was a प्रेत then... pointed in a certain direction और told to march '' —and becoming a Sunni Muslim, he disavowed racism and expressed willingness to work with civil अधिकारों leaders, he continued to emphasize Pan-Africanism, black self-determination, and self-defense.
हेनरी Merritt `` हांक '' Paulson, jr. ( born March 28, 1946 ) is an American banker who served as the 74th United States Secretary of the Treasury.
He had served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Goldman Sachs, and is now chairman of the Paulson Institute, which he founded in 2011 to promote sustainable economic growth and a cleaner environment around the world, with an initial focus on the United States and China.
A virtual machine ( VM ) is a तन्त्र implemented abstraction of the underlying hardware, which is presented to the application layer of the system.
Virtual machines may be based on specifications of a hypothetical computer or emulate the computer architecture and functions of a real संसार computer.
Spiders ( order Araneae ) are air-breathing arthropods that have eight legs and chelicerae with fangs that inject venom.
They are the largest order of arachnids and rank seventh in total species diversity among all other groups of organisms.
Spiders are मिला worldwide on every continent except लिये Antarctica, and have become established in nearly every habitat with the exception of air and sea colonization.
As of 2008, at least 43,678 spider species, और 109 families have been recorded by taxonomists ; however, there रै been confusion within the वैज्ञानिक community as to how all these families should be classified, as evidenced by the over 20 different classifications that have been proposed since 1900.
anatomically, spiders differ from other arthropods in that the usual body segments are fused into two tagmata, the cephalothorax and abdomen, and joined by a small, cylindrical pedicel.
Unlike insects, spiders do not have antennae.
In all except the most primitive group, the Mesothelae, spiders have the most centralized nervous systems of all arthropods, as all their ganglia हैं fused into one mass in the cephalothorax.
Unlike most arthropods, spiders have no extensor muscles in their limbs and instead extend उन्हें by hydraulic pressure.
Their abdomens bear appendages that have been modified into spinnerets that extrude silk from up to six प्रकार of silk ग्रंथियों भीतर their abdomen.
Spider webs vary widely in size, shape and the amount of sticky thread used.
It now appears that the spiral orb web may be one of the earliest forms, and spiders that produce tangled cobwebs are more abundant and diverse than orb-web spiders.
Spider-like arachnids with silk-producing spigots appeared in the Devonian period about, but ये animals जाहिर lacked spinnerets.
True spiders have been found in Carboniferous rocks इससे, and are very similar to the सबसे primitive surviving order, the Mesothelae.
The main समूह of आधुनिक spiders, Mygalomorphae and Araneomorphae, first appeared in the Triassic period, before.
A herbivorous species, Bagheera kiplingi, was described in 2008, but all other known species are predators, ज़्यादातर preying on insects and on other मकड़ियों, हालांकि a few large species also take birds and lizards.
Spiders use a wide range of strategies to capture prey : trapping it in sticky webs, lassoing it with sticky bolas, mimicking the prey to avoid detection, or running it down.
Most detect prey mainly by संवेदन vibrations, but the active hunters have acute vision, और hunters of the genus portia show signs of intelligence in their choice of tactics and ability to develop new ones.
Spiders ' guts are too narrow to take solids, and they liquidize their food by flooding it with digestive enzymes और grinding it with the bases of their pedipalps, as they do not have true jaws.
Male spiders identify themselves by a variety of complex courtship संस्कार to avoid being eaten by the females.
Males of most species survive a few matings, limited mainly by their short life spans.
Females weave silk egg-cases, each of which may contain hundreds of eggs.
Females of many species परवाह for उनके young, for example by carrying them around or by sharing food with them.
A minority of species are सोशल, building communal webs that may house anywhere from a few to 50,000 individuals.
Social बर्ताव सीमाएँ from precarious toleration, as in the widow spiders, to co-operative शिकार and food-sharing.
Although most spiders live for at most two years, tarantulas and other mygalomorph spiders can live up to 25 सालो in captivity.
While the venom of a few species is dangerous to humans, scientists are now researching the use of मकड़ी venom in medicine and as non-polluting pesticides.
Spider silk provides a संयोजन of lightness, strength and elasticity कि is superior to that of synthetic materials, and spider silk genes have been inserted into mammals और plants to see if these can be used as silk कारखानों.
as a result of their wide दायरा of behaviors, spiders have become common symbols in art and mythology symbolizing various combinations of patience, cruelty and creative powers.

Portrayed by Laura Prepon, डोना is the love interest to Eric Forman.

Household income is a माप commonly used by the United States government and private institutions.
Each household is measured by the income of every resident over the age of 15.
Income शामिल wages and salaries, बेरोजगारी insurance, disability payments, child support payments received, regular rental receipts, as well as any personal business, investment, or other kinds of income प्राप्त routinely.
While inflation-adjusted ( `` real '' ) household income था महरूम increasing almost प्रत्येक year from 1945 to 1999, it has since been flat and even decreased recently.
U.S. median household income गिरी from $ 51,144 in 2010 to $ 50,502 in 2011.
Extreme गरीबी in the United राज्य, meaning households living on less than $ 2 per दिन before government benefits, doubled from 1996 to 1.5 million households in 2011, including 2.8 million children.
The residents of the household do not have to be related to the head of the household for their earnings to be considered part of the household 's income.
As households tend to share a similar economic context, the use of household income remains among the most widely accepted measures of income.
That the size of a household is not commonly लिया into account in ऐसे measures may distort कोई विश्लेषण of fluctuations within or among the household income categories, and may रेंडर direct comparisons between quintiles difficult or even impossible.
A registered agent, also known as a resident agent or statutory agent, in United States business law, is a business or individual designated to receive service of process ( SOP ) जब a business entity is a party in a legal action such as a lawsuit or summons.
The पंजीकृत agent 's address may also be where the state will send the कागजी for the yearly renewal of the business entity 's charter.
The registered agent for a business entity may be an व्यक्तिगत member of the company, or ( more often ) a third party, such as the संगठन 's lawyer or a service company.
Failure to properly maintain a registered agent can affect a company negatively.

`` Life, Liberty, and the pursuit of Happiness '' is a well-known phrase in the United States घोषणा of Independence.
The phrase is meant to exemplify the `` unalienable rights '' with जिससे all human beings are endowed by their creator for उनके सुरक्षा of which they institute governments.
Fencing, is typically divided into Olympic fencing, शास्त्रीय fencing and historical तलवारबाजी,.
The sport of fencing ( commonly called olympic fencing or competitive fencing ) is divided into three weapon categories : foil, sabre and épée.
Classical fencing uses the same three weapons, but approaches fencing as a martial art.
Competitive Fencing is one of five sports which has been featured at प्रत्येक one of the modern Olympic Games, the अन्य four being Athletics, साइकिलिंग, Swimming, and Gymnastics.
The quadriceps femoris ( Latin लिये `` four-headed muscle of the femur `` ), also called simply the quadriceps, quadriceps extensor, quads, is a large मांसपेशी group कि includes the four prevailing मांसपेशियां on the front of the जांघ.
It is the great extensor muscle of the knee, forming a large fleshy mass which covers the front and पहलू of the femur.
The proper Latin plural form of the adjective quadriceps होता be quadricipites.
In modern English usage, quadriceps is used in both singular and plural.
The singular form quadricep, उत्पादित by hypercorrection, is frequently used.
RMS Titanic was a British passenger liner that sank in the North अटलांटिक Ocean on 15 April 1912 after colliding with an iceberg during her maiden voyage from southampton, UK to New York City, us.
The sinking of Titanic caused the deaths of 1,502 people in one of the deadliest peacetime maritime disasters in modern history.
The RMS Titanic was the largest ship afloat at the time of her maiden voyage.
She थी the second of three Olympic class ocean liners operated by the White Star Line, and वो was built by the Harland and Wolff shipyard in Belfast with Thomas एंड्रयूज, who perished with the ship, as her naval architect.
On उसके maiden voyage, वो carried 2,224 passengers and क्रू.
Under the command of Edward Smith, her passengers included some of the wealthiest people in the world, as well as सैंकड़ों of emigrants इससे Great Britain and आयरलैंड, Scandinavia और elsewhere throughout Europe seeking a new life in North America.
the जलयान was designed to be the last word in comfort and luxury, with an on-board gymnasium, swimming pool, libraries, high-class restaurants and opulent cabins.
She also had a powerful बेतार telegraph provided for the convenience of passengers as well as for operational use.
Though she had advanced safety features such as watertight compartments and remotely activated watertight doors, she lacked enough lifeboats to accommodate all of those aboard.
Because of outdated maritime safety regulations, she carried तभी enough lifeboats for 1,178 people—slightly more than half of the number यात्राएं on the maiden voyage, and one-third her total passenger and crew capacity.
After leaving Southampton on 10 April 1912, Titanic called at Cherbourg in फ़्रांस and Queenstown ( now Cobh ) in Ireland before heading westwards towards New यॉर्क.
On 14 April 1912, four days into the crossing and परिचय 375 miles ( 600 km ) south of न्यूफ़ाउंडलैंड, she hit an iceberg at 11:40 pm ship 's time.
The glancing collision caused Titanics hull plates to buckle inwards साथ her starboard side and opened five of her सोलह watertight compartments to the sea ; the ship धीरे filled with water.
Meanwhile, passengers और some crew members were evacuated in lifeboats, many of which were launched तभी partly loaded.
a disproportionate number of men were left सवार because of a `` women and children पहला `` protocol followed by some of the officers loading the lifeboats.
By 2:20 AM, she broke apart and foundered, with well over one thousand people still aboard.
बस under two hours after the Titanic foundered, the Cunard liner RMS Carpathia arrived on the scene of the sinking, where she brought aboard an estimated 705 survivors.
The disaster was greeted with worldwide shock and आक्रोश at the huge loss of life and the regulatory and operational failures कि had led to it.
Public inquiries in Britain and the United राज्य led to major improvements in maritime safety.
One of their most important legacies was the establishment in 1914 of the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea ( SOLAS ), which still governs maritime सुरक्षा today.
Additionally, अनेक new wireless regulations were passed around the world in an effort to learn from the many missteps in wireless communications -- -which could have saved many more passengers.
Many of the survivors lost all of their money and possessions and were left destitute ; many families, particularly those of crew members from Southampton, lost their primary bread-winners.
They were helped by an outpouring of public sympathy and charitable donations.
Some of the male survivors were accused of cowardice for leaving the ship while लोगों were still on फलक ; the श्वेत Star Line 's chairman, J. Bruce Ismay, faced social ostracism for the rest of his life.
The wreck of the Titanic remains on the seabed, split in two और gradually disintegrating at a depth of.
Since its discovery in 1985, thousands of artefacts have been recovered and put on display at museums around the world.
Titanic has become one of the most famous ships in history, her memory kept alive by numerous books, folk songs, films, exhibits, and memorials.
The human leg is the entire lower extremity or limb of the human body, including the foot, thigh and even the hip or gluteal region ; however, the precise परिभाषा in human anatomy refers only to the section of the lower limb extending from the knee to the टखने.
Legs are used for standing, चलना, jumping, running, kicking, and समान activities, and constitute a significant portion of a person 's mass.
This article is about the demographic features of the जनसांख्यिकी of Turkey, including जनसांख्यिकी density, ethnicity, education level, health of the populace, economic status, religious affiliations and other पहलुओं of the जनसांख्यिकी.
As of 2010, the जनसांख्यिकी of Turkey is estimated to be 73.7 million with a growth rate of 1.21 % per annum ( 2009 figure ).
The population is relatively young with 26.6 % falling in the 0-14 age bracket.
According to the OECD/World Bank population statistics in Turkey the population growth from 1990 to 2008 थी 16 million or 29 %.

Joel Grey ( born April 11, 1932 ) is an अमरीकी stage and screen actor, singer, and नर्तकी, ज्ञात for his role as the Master of Ceremonies in both the स्टेज and film adaptation of the kander & Ebb musical Cabaret.
He has won the अकादमी Award, Tony पुरस्कार and Golden Globe Award.

in 1973, the Wizard in the musical Wicked.

James Madison, Jr. ( कूच 16, 1751 ( O.S. March 5 ) – June 28, 1836 ) was an American statesman and political theorist, the चौथी President of the United States ( 1809–1817 ).
He is hailed as the “Father of the Constitution” for being instrumental in the drafting of the United States Constitution and as the कुंजी champion and author of the United States Bill of अधिकारों.
He served as a politician much of his वयस्क life.
After the constitution had been drafted, Madison became one of the leaders in the movement to ratify it.
His collaboration with Alexander Hamilton and John Jay produced the Federalist Papers ( 1788 ).
Circulated only in New York at the समय, they would later be considered among the most important polemics in support of the Constitution.
He was also a delegate to the Virginia constitutional ratifying convention, और was instrumental to the successful अनुसमर्थन effort in Virginia.
Like most of his contemporaries, Madison changed his political views during his life.
During the drafting and अनुसमर्थन of the constitution, he favored a strong national government, though later he grew to favor stronger state governments, before settling between the two extremes late in his life.
In 1789, Madison became a leader in the new House of Representatives, drafting many basic laws.
He is notable for drafting the first टेन amendments to the Constitution, and यूँ is known as the `` Father of the Bill of Rights ``.
Madison worked closely with President George Washington to organize the new federal government.
Breaking with Hamilton और what became the Federalist Party in 1791, Madison and Thomas Jefferson organized what they called the Republican Party ( later called by historians the Democratic-Republican Party )
As Jefferson’s Secretary of State ( 1801–1809 ), Madison supervised the Louisiana Purchase, जिससे doubled the nation’s size.
After his election to the प्रेसिडेंसी, he presided over नवीनीकृत prosperity for several years.
As president ( 1809–17 ), after the failure of diplomatic protests and a trade embargo against Great Britain, he led the nation into the War of 1812.
He was responding to British encroachments on American honor and rights ; in addition, he wanted to end the influence of the British among their Indian allies, whose resistance अवरोधित United States settlement in the Midwest around the Great झीलों.
Madison मिला the war to be an administrative nightmare, as the United States had neither a strong army nor financial system ; as a result, he afterward supported a stronger national government and a strong military, as well as the national bank, which he had long opposed.
Like other Virginia statesmen in the slave society, he was a slaveholder who inherited his plantation known as Montpelier, and स्वामित्व hundreds of slaves during his lifetime to cultivate tobacco and other crops.
Madison supported the three-fifths compromise that allowed three-fifths of the enumerated population of slaves to be counted for representation.
`` Roman 's Revenge '' is a song performed by American rapper Nicki minaj from her debut studio album Pink Friday.
It was written by Minaj and rapper Eminem, who is also featured in the song, and was produced by Swizz Beatz.

the song references Minaj 's alter-ego, Roman Zolanski, and Eminem 's alter-ego, Slim Shady.
The song garnered very positive reviews from critics, most of which praised the सोंग as a stand-out track on the album.

The instrumental was used in the song 'firing Squad ' by Horseshoe G.A.N.G.
Hydraulic fluid being poured.
हाइड्रोलिक fluids, also called hydraulic liquids, हैं the medium by which power is transferred in hydraulic machinery.
Common hydraulic fluids are based on mineral oil or water.
Examples of equipment that might use hydraulic fluids include excavators and backhoes, hydraulic brakes, power steering systems, transmissions, garbage trucks, aircraft flight control प्रणालियों, lifts, and industrial machinery.
Hydraulic systems like the ones mentioned above will work most efficiently if the hydraulic fluid used has no compressibility
Mahindra Tractor
Mahindra Tractors, the farm equipment division of Mahindra & Mahindra, builds और sources tractors that हैं sold worldwide across six continents.
Mahindra is also among the top three tractor निर्माताओं in the world.
Mahindra has a huge consumer आधार in India, China and America and a growing base in Australia.
The company builds more tractors in India than any other manufacturer, and has the capacity to build 150,000 tractors a year.
In 1963, m & M formed a संयुक्त venture with International Harvester to manufacture tractors carrying the Mahindra nameplate for the Indian market.
Armed with engineering, tooling and manufacturing know-how gained from this relationship, M & M developed its first tractor, the B-275.
Mahindra Tractors with बिक्री of nearly 85,000 units annually is एक of the largest tractor companies in the world, and is number one in sales in India - the largest tractor market in the world.
To expand into the growing tractor market in चीन, Mahindra acquired majority stake in Jiangling.
To उठाएँ awareness about महिंद्रा in the US, Mahindra USA announced इसके new sponsorship in the NASCAR Nationwide Series with R3 मोटरस्पोर्ट, which is participating with a # 23 Mahindra Tractors Chevrolet.
the car will be driven by Robert रिचर्डसन, Jr. Mahindra USA, Inc. announced a 17-race प्राथमिक and 18-race associate sponsorship for the 2009 NASCAR Nationwide Series.
With this sponsorship, Mahindra was the first Indian कम्पनी to sponsor a car in NASCAR.

The POWER6 is a microprocessor developed by IBM that implemented the Power ISA v.2.03.
When it became available in systems in 2007, it succeeded the POWER5+ as IBM 's flagship Power माइक्रोप्रोसेसर.
It is भाग of the eCLipz project, said to have a goal of converging IBM 's सर्वर हार्डवेयर where practical ( hence `` ipz '' in the acronym : iSeries, pseries, and zseries ).
The American middle class is a social class in the United States.
While the अवधारणा is typically ambiguous in popular opinion and common भाषा use, contemporary social scientists have put forward several, more or कम congruent, theories on the American middle class.
Depending on class model प्रयुक्त, the middle class may constitute anywhere from 25 % to 66 % of households.
One of the first major studies of the मध्य class in America was White Collar : The American Middle Classes, published in 1951 by sociologist C. Wright Wright_Mills Mills Wright_Mills.
Later sociologists such as Dennis Gilbert of Hamilton College commonly divide the middle class into two sub-groups.
Constituting roughly 15 % to 20 % of households is the upper or professional middle class consisting of highly educated, salaried professionals और managers.
Constituting roughly one third of households is the lower middle class consisting mostly of semi-professionals, skilled craftsmen and lower-level management.
Middle-class persons commonly have a comfortable मानक of living, significant economic security, considerable work autonomy and rely on their expertise to sustain themselves.
Members of the middle class belong to विविध groups which overlap with each अन्य.
Overall, middle-class व्यक्तियों, especially upper-middle-class individuals, हैं characterized by conceptualizing, creating and consulting.
Thus, college education is one of the main indicators of middle-class status.
Largely attributed to the nature of middle-class occupations, middle class values tend to emphasize independence, adherence to intrinsic standards, valuing नवीनता and respecting non-conformity.
Politically more active than other demographics, college educated मध्य class professionals are split between the दो major parties.
Income varies considerably from near the national median to well in excess of $ 100,000.
Household income figures, however, do not always reflect class status and standard of living, as they are largely influenced by the number of income earners and fail to recognize household size.
It is therefore possible for a large, dual-earner, lower middle class household to out-earn a small, one-earner, upper middle class household.
The middle classes are very influential, as they encompass the majority of voters, writers, teachers, journalists, and editors.
Most societal trends in the US originate within the middle वर्ग.
