The cast members of Saturday Night Live were originally referred to as the `` Not तैयार For Prime Time Players ''.
The original cast ( l to r ) : Laraine Newman, John Belushi, Jane कर्टिन, gilda Radner, डान Aykroyd, Garrett मॉरिस, and Chevy Chase
तबाह from the 1906 San Francisco earthquake, remembered as one of the worst natural disasters in United States history
A disaster is a natural or man-made ( or technological ) hazard resulting in an event of substantial extent causing significant physical damage or destruction, loss of life, or drastic change to the environment.
A disaster can be ostensively defined as any tragic event stemming from events such as earthquakes, floods, catastrophic accidents, fires, or विस्फोट.
It is a phenomenon that can cause damage to life और प्रॉपर्टी and नष्ट the economic, social और cultural life of लोगों.
In contemporary academia, disasters are seen as the consequence of inappropriately managed risk.
These risks are the product of a combination of both hazard/s and vulnerability.
Hazards that strike in areas साथ low vulnerability will never become disasters, as is the मामला in uninhabited regions.
Developing देशों suffer the greatest costs when a विपत्ति hits – more than 95 percent of all मौतों caused by disasters occur in developing countries, and losses due to natural disasters are 20 times greater ( as a प्रतिशत of GDP ) in developing countries than in industrialized countries.
in computing, booting ( also known as booting up ) is the आरंभिक set of operations that a computer system performs when electrical power to the CPU is switched on.
The process begins when a computer is turned on for the first time or is re-energized after being turned बंद, and ends जब the computer is ready to perform its normal operations.
On आधुनिक general purpose computers, this can take tens of seconds and typically involves performing a power-on self-test, locating and initializing peripheral devices, and then finding, loading and starting an operating system.
Many computer systems भी allow these परिचालन to be initiated by a software command without cycling power, in what is known as a soft reboot, though कुछ of the initial operations might be छोड़ा on a soft reboot.
A boot loader is a computer program that loads the main operating system or runtime environment for the computer after completion of the self-tests.
The computer term boot is short for bootstrap or bootstrap load and derives from the phrase to pull oneself up by एक 's bootstraps.
The usage calls attention to the requirement that, if most software is loaded onto a computer by other software already running on the computer, some mechanism must exist to load initial software onto the computer.
Early computers used a variety of ad-hoc methods to get a small program into memory to solve this problem.
The invention of integrated circuit read-only memory ( ROM ) of various types solved this paradox by allowing कंप्यूटर to be shipped with a start up program that could not be erased.
Growth in the capacity of ROM has allowed कभी more elaborate start up procedures to be implemented.
On general purpose कंप्यूटर, the बूट process begins with the execution of an initial program stored in boot ROMs or read in another fashion.
In some older computers, the initial program might have been the application to run, if no operating system was used, or the operating system.
In अन्य computers, the initial program is a boot loader that may then load into random-access memory ( RAM ), from nonvolatile secondary storage ( such as a hard disk drive ) or, in some older computers, from a medium such as punched cards, punched tape, or magnetic tape in older computers, the binary code of an operating system or runtime environment and then चलाएँ it.
if the boot loader is सीमित in its size and capabilities, it may, instead, लोड a larger and more capable secondary boot loader, which would then load the operating system or runtime environment.
Some embedded systems do not require a noticeable boot sequence to शुरू कामकाज and when turned on may simply run operational programs that are stored in rom.
Firebird is an open source SQL relational database management system कि runs on Linux, Windows, and a variety of Unix.
the database forked from borland 's open source edition of InterBase in 2000, but since Firebird 1.5 the code has been largely rewritten.
Outsourcing is the contracting out of an internal business process to a third-party organization.
The अभ्यास of contracting a business process out to a third party rather than स्टॉफ it internally is common in the modern economy.
The term `` outsourcing '' became popular in the United States near the turn of the 21st century.
Outsourcing sometimes involves transferring employees and assets from one कड़ to another, but not always.
the definition of outsourcing includes दोनो foreign and domestic contracting, and sometimes includes offshoring, which अर्थात् relocating a business function to another country.
Financial savings from lower international labor rates is a big motivation for outsourcing/offshoring.
The opposite of outsourcing is called insourcing, जिससे entails bringing processes handled by third-party firms in-house, और is sometimes accomplished via vertical integration.
However, a business can provide a contract service to another business बगैर necessarily insourcing that business process.
Human immunodeficiency virus ( HIV ) is a lentivirus ( धीरे replicating retrovirus ) that causes acquired immunodeficiency syndrome ( AIDS ), a कंडीशन in humans in which progressive failure of the immune system allows life-threatening opportunistic infections and cancers to thrive.
संक्रमण with HIV occurs by the transfer of blood, semen, vaginal fluid, pre-ejaculate, or breast milk.
Within these bodily fluids, HIV is present as both free virus particles and virus within infected immune cells.
HIV infects vital cells in the human immune system such as helper T cells ( specifically CD4 + t cells ), macrophages, and dendritic कोशिकाएं.
HIV infection leads to low levels of CD4+ T cells through a number of mechanisms including : apoptosis of uninfected bystander cells, direct viral killing of infected cells, and killing of infected CD4+ T cells by CD8 cytotoxic lymphocytes कि recognize infected cells.
When CD4+ T कोशिका numbers decline below a critical level, cell-mediated immunity is lost, and the body becomes progressively more susceptible to opportunistic infections.
The firepole in a fire station in Toronto
A fireman 's pole ( also called a sliding pole or firepole ) is a wooden pole or a मेटल tube or pipe installed between floors in fire stations, allowing firefighters responding to an alarm to quickly descend to the ground floor faster than by using a standard staircase.
the device was invented in the 1870s by David Kenyon, in शिकागो, Illinois, although it is often incorrectly credited to the Boston Fire Department.
मरियम Poppins is the title character of a series of children 's books लिखा by P. L. Travers.
Throughout the Mary Poppins series, which lasted from 1934 to 1988, Mary Shepard was the illustrator और acted as a second author.
The books centre on a magical English nanny, Mary Poppins.
She is blown by the East wind to Number Seventeen चेरी Tree Lane, London, and into the Banks ' household to परवाह for their children.
Encounters with chimney sweeps, shopkeepers and various adventures follow जबतक Mary Poppins abruptly leaves, i.e., `` pops-out ''.
The adventures take place over a total of eight books.
However, only the first three books feature Mary Poppins arriving और leaving.
The later five books recount previously unrecorded adventures from her असली three visits.
As P. L. Travers explains in her introduction to Mary Poppins in the Park, `` She can not forever arrive and depart. ''
The books were adapted in 1964 into a musical Disney film अभिनीत Julie Andrews and Dick Van Dyke.
In 2004, Disney Theatrical produced a stage musical adaptation in the West समाप्त theatre.
The स्टेज musical was transferred to Broadway in 2006 where it ran until its closing on March 3, 2013.
It रै been highly successful, as थी the 1964 film.
The Last Song is a 2010 American coming of age teen romantic drama film developed alongside Nicholas Sparks ' novel by the वही name.
The फिल्मी was directed by जूली Anne Robinson in her feature film directorial डेब्यू and co-written by Sparks and Jeff Van Wie.
The Last Song stars miley Cyrus, Liam Hemsworth, और Greg Kinnear and follows a troubled teenager as she reconnects with her estranged father and falls in love during a summer in a quiet Southern United States beach town.
The फिल्मी is distributed by Touchstone Pictures.
Sparks was approached to write both the film 's screenplay and the novel.
Sparks completed the screenplay in January 2009, prior to the पूर्णता of the novel, making The Last Song his first script to be optioned for film.
The setting, originally in North Carolina like the novel, moved to Georgia बाद the राज्य had campaigned for months to host production.
Upon beginning production in Tybee Island, Georgia and nearby Savannah, The Last Song became the first movie to be both shot and set in Tybee Island.
Filming lasted from June 15 to August 18, 2009 with much of it occurring on the island 's beach and pier.
The Last Song was originally scheduled for wide release on January 8, 2010, but was postponed to March 31, 2010.
Written Simlish
Simlish is a fictional language featured in ea खेल ' Sim series of games.
It debuted in SimCopter, और has been especially prominent in The Sims, The Sims 2 and The सीम 3.
The Sims development team created the unique simlish language by experimenting with fractured Ukrainian, French, Latin, Finnish, English, Fijian, Cebuano, and Tagalog.
Simlish can also be heard in SimCity 4, SimCity Societies and SimCity 2013, but far less frequently.
Civilized Creatures in Spore can also be taught to speak Simlish.
It is also featured to an extent in Firaxis Games ' Sid Meier 's SimGolf.
Designer Will राइट was conscious of the need for dialogue in the game, but thought that using a real भाषा would make it sound too repetitive and would also be too costly to hire अनुवादक for world languages.
Initially, प्रेरित by the Native American code talkers of संसार War II, Sims creator Will Wright and language expert Marc Gimbel suggested experimenting with the Navajo language to create Simlish.
however, they ultimately decided that Simlish worked best as a `` language '' made up of gibberish words that could n't be translated, so that its अर्थ होता be left खोलें to the imagination of the player.
Wright later commented that using `` nonsense language '' turned out to be the सही development choice, as people यहूद capable of imagining it more realistically than a computer could सिमुलेट a real one.
The actual sound of Simlish was created improvisationally by voice actors Stephen Kearin और Gerri Lawlor.
An उदाहरण of Ultrasonic Testing ( ut ) on ब्लेड roots of a V2500 IAE aircraft engine.
Step 1 : The UT probe is placed on the root of the blades to be inspected with the सहायता of a special borescope tool ( video probe ).
Step 2 : Instrument settings are input.
Step 3 : the probe is scanned over the blade root.
In this case, an indication ( peak in the data ) through the red line ( or gate ) indicates a good blade ; an indication to the left of कि range indicates a crack.
Principle of ultrasonic testing.
बाएँ : A probe sends a sound वेव into a test material.
There are two indications, one from the initial pulse of the probe, and the second due to the back wall echo.
RIGHT : A defect creates a third indication and simultaneously reduces the आयाम of the back wall indication.
The depth of the defect is determined by the ratio D/E
In ultrasonic testing ( UT ), very short ultrasonic pulse-waves with center frequencies ranging from 0.1-15 MHz and occasionally up to 50 MHz are launched into materials to detect internal flaws or to characterize materials.
a common example is ultrasonic thickness measurement, which tests the thickness of the test object, लिये example, to monitor pipework corrosion.
Ultrasonic testing is often performed on steel and other metals and alloys, though it can also be used on कंक्रीट, wood and composites, albeit with less resolution.
It is a रूप of non-destructive परीक्षण used in many उद्योग including aerospace, automotive and other transportation sectors.
The vas deferens ( बहुवचन : vasa deferentia ), भी called ductus deferens ( Latin : `` carrying-away vessel '' ; plural : ductus deferentes ), is part of the male anatomy of many vertebrates ; they transport sperm from the epididymis in anticipation of ejaculation.
Vascular ischemia of the toes with characteristic cyanosis.
In medicine, ischemia, also spelled as ischaemia or ischæmia, ( ; from Greek language ισχαιμία, ischaimía ; isch- root denoting a restriction or thinning or to make or grow thin/lean, haema blood ) is a restriction in blood supply to tissues, causing a shortage of oxygen and glucose needed for सेल्यूलर चयापचय ( to keep tissue alive ).
Ischemia is generally caused by problems with blood vessels, with resultant damage to or dysfunction of tissue.
It also means लोकल रक्ताल्पता in a given part of a body sometimes resulting from congestion ( such as vasoconstriction, thrombosis or embolism ).
Down सिंड्रोम ( DS ) or Down 's syndrome, also ज्ञात as trisomy 21, is a genetic disorder caused by the presence of all or part of a third copy of chromosome 21.
Down syndrome is the सबसे common chromosome abnormality in humans.
It is typically associated with a delay in cognitive ability ( दिमागी retardation, or MR ) and physical growth, और a particular set of facial characteristics.
The औसत IQ of young adults साथ Down syndrome is around 50, whereas young adults without the condition typically have an IQ of 100.
( MR has historically been defined as an IQ below 70. )
A large proportion of individuals with Down syndrome have a कठोर degree of intellectual disability.
Down syndrome is named after John Langdon bas, the British physician who described the syndrome in 1866.
The condition was clinically described earlier by Jean Etienne Dominique Esquirol in 1838 and Edouard Seguin in 1844.
Down syndrome was identified as a chromosome 21 trisomy by Dr. Jérôme lejeune in 1959.
Down syndrome can be identified in a baby at birth or पहले birth by prenatal screening.
Pregnancies with this diagnosis are often terminated.
The CDC estimates that about one of every 691 babies born in the United States each year is born with Down syndrome.
Many children with Down syndrome are educated in regular school classes while others require specialised educational facilities.
Some children graduate from high school, and, in the US, there are increasing opportunities for participating in post-secondary education.
Education and proper care has महरूम shown to improve quality of life significantly.
Many adults with Down Syndrome are able to work at paid employment in the community, while others require a more sheltered work environment.
Hot flashes ( also known as hot flushes, or रात्रि sweats if they happen at night ) are a लक्षण which may have several other causes, but which is often caused by the बदलना hormone levels that are characteristic of menopause.
The Servicemen 's Readjustment Act of 1944 ( P.L. 78-346, 58 स्टेट. 284m ), ज्ञात informally as the G.I. Bill, was a law that provided a range of benefits लिये returning World War II veterans ( commonly referred to as g.i.s ).
Benefits शामिल low-cost mortgages, low-interest loans to start a कारोबार or farm, cash payments of tuition and living expenses to attend college, high school or vocational education, as well as one year of unemployment compensation.
It was उपलब्धियाँ to every veteran जो had been on active duty during the war years for at least ninety days और had not been dishonorably discharged ; combat was not required.
By the end of the program in 1956, roughly 2.2 million veterans था प्रयुक्त the G.I. Bill education benefits in order to attend colleges or universities, and an additional 6.6 million used these benefits लिये some kind of training program.
चूंकि the original 1944 law, the term has come to include other veteran benefit programs निर्मित to assist veterans of subsequent wars as खूब as peacetime service.
Historians and economists consider the G.I. Bill a major political success—especially in contrast to the treatments of World War I veterans—and a major contribution to America 's stock of human capital that sped long-term economic growth.
The Watergate scandal was a political scandal that occurred in the United States in the 1970s as a result of the June 17, 1972 break-in at the Democratic नेशनल Committee headquarters at the Watergate office complex in Washington, D.C., and the Nixon administration 's attempted cover-up of इसके भागीदारी.
The scandal eventually led to the resignation of Richard Nixon, the President of the United States, on August 9, 1974 — the only resignation of a U.S. President.
The scandal also resulted in the indictment, trial, conviction, and incarceration of forty-three persons, dozens of whom were Nixon 's top administration officials.
The affair began साथ the arrest of five men for तोड़कर and entering into the Democratic National Committee ( DNC ) headquarters at the Watergate complex on June 17, 1972.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation ( FBI ) connected cash found on the burglars to a slush fund used by the Committee for the re-election of the President, the official organization of Nixon 's campaign.
In July 1973, as evidence mounted against the president 's स्टाफ, including testimony provided by former staff members in an investigation conducted by the Senate Watergate Committee, it was revealed that President Nixon था a tape-recording system in his कार्यालयों and he had recorded many conversations.
Recordings इससे these tapes implicated the president, revealing he had attempted to cover up the questionable ( and illegal ) goings-on that था taken place दौरान his administration, both before and after the break-in.
After a protracted series of bitter court battles, the U.S. परम् Court unanimously ruled that the president had to hand over the tapes to government investigators ; he ultimately complied.
Facing near-certain impeachment in the House of Representatives and a strong possibility of a conviction in the Senate, Nixon resigned the presidency on August 9, 1974.
His successor, Gerald Ford, then issued a pardon to उसे.
Elizabeth Imogene Webber ( formerly Lansing and Spencer ) is a fictional character on the ABC Daytime soap opera सामान्य Hospital.
Elizabeth is the granddaughter of Dr. Steve Hardy ( John Beradino ), one of the originating कोर characters of the series.
Rebecca herbst originated the character on August 1, 1997 and has been the only contract actress to play the role.
Elizabeth is part of two supercouple pairings, Lucky Spencer and Elizabeth Webber and जेसन Morgan and Elizabeth Webber.
The United States presidency of Ronald Reagan, also known as the Reagan administration, थी a रिपब्लिकन administration headed by रोनाल्ड Reagan from January 20, 1981, to January 20, 1989.
Domestically, the administration favored reducing government programs और introduced the largest across-the-board tax cuts in American history.
The economic policies enacted in 1981, known as `` Reaganomics ``, were an example of supply-side अर्थशास्त्र.
Reagan aimed to encourage entrepreneurship and सीमा the growth of social spending, as well as the कटौती of regulation and inflation.
Economic growth saw a strong recovery in the 1980s, helping Reagan to win a landslide re-election.
The national debt increased significantly, however.
Regarding foreign policy, the administration was steadfastly anti-communist, calling the Soviet Union an `` evil empire `` and ending 1970s détente.
Reagan accelerated the massive buildup of the military started by his predecessor, including an invasion of Grenada, the first major विदेशी action by U.S. troops since the end of the Vietnam War.
The `` Reagan Doctrine `` controversially granted aid to paramilitary forces seeking to overthrow कम्युनिस्ट सरकारें, particularly in war-torn Central America and Afghanistan.
Reagan भी promoted new technologies such as missile defense systems in order to confront the Soviets and their allies.
In diplomacy, Reagan forged a strong गठबंधन with UK Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher, and he met with Soviet General Secretary Mikhail Gorbachev four times, aiming to shrink the superpowers ' nuclear arsenals.
Reagan 's presidency has महरूम termed the `` Reagan Revolution '', or the Age of Reagan in recognition of the political realignment both within and beyond the U.S. in एहसान of his brand of conservatism and his आस्था in free markets.
The Reagan administration worked toward the collapse of Soviet Communism, and it did collapse just as he left office.
Victory in the Cold War led to a unipolar world with the U.S. as the world 's sole superpower.
While the damaging Iran-Contra affair engulfed several Reagan aides during his दूसरी term, Reagan himself बाएँ office with a 63 percent स्वीकृति rating, one of the higher approval ratings of departing presidents.
After years of unstinting praise from the right, and unrelenting criticism from the left, historian David हेनरी finds that by 2009 a consensus had उभरा among scholars that Reagan revived कोसा and turned the nation to the right by demonstrating a `` pragmatic conservatism '' that प्रचारित ideology within the constraints imposed by the divided political system.
Furthermore, says हेनरी, the consensus viewpoint agrees that he revived faith in the प्रेसिडेंसी and American self-confidence, and contributed critically to ending the Cold War.
Crude death rate by country ( 2006 ).
Mortality rate is a measure of the number of deaths ( in general, or due to a specific cause ) in a population.
Scaled to the size of that population, per ईकाई of time.
Mortality rate is typically expressed in units of deaths per 1000 individuals प्रति year ; यूँ, a mortality rate of 9.5 ( out of 1000 ) in a population of 1,000 would mean 9.5 deaths per year in that entire population, or 0.95 % out of the total.
It is पृथक from morbidity rate, which refers to the number of individuals in poor health during a given समय period ( the prevalence rate ) or the number of newly appearing cases of the disease per unit of time ( incidence rate ).
The term `` mortality `` is also sometimes inappropriately used to refer to the number of deaths among a set of diagnosed hospital cases for a disease or injury, rather than for the general जनसांख्यिकी of a country or ethnic group.
This disease mortality statistic is more precisely referred to as `` case fatality rate `` ( CFR ).
One distinguishes:
The crude death rate, the total number of मौतों per year per 1000 people.
the crude death rate for the whole world is about 8.37 प्रति 1000 per year according to the current CIA World Factbook.
The perinatal mortality rate, the sum of neonatal deaths and fetal deaths ( stillbirths ) per 1000 births.
the maternal mortality अनुपात, the number of maternal deaths प्रति 100,000 live births in same time period.
the maternal mortality rate, the number of maternal deaths per 1,000 women of reproductive age in the population ( generally पारिभाषित as 15–44 years of age ).
The शिशु मृत्यु rate, the number of मौतों of children less than 1 year बूढ़ा per 1000 सजीव births.
The child mortality rate, the number of deaths of children less than 5 years बूढ़ा per 1000 live births.
The standardised mortality ratio ( SMR ) - This represents a proportional comparison to the numbers of deaths that would have been expected if the population had been of a मानक composition in terms of age, gender, etc.
The age-specific mortality rate ( ASMR ) - This refers to the total क्रमांक of मौतों per year per 1000 people of a given age ( e.g. age 62 last जन्मदिवस ).
In regard to the or failure of medical treatment or procedures, one होता also distinguish:
The early mortality रेट, the कुल number of deaths in the early stages of an ongoing treatment, or in the काल immediately following an उपचार.
The लेट mortality rate, the total number of deaths in the late stages of an ongoing treatment, or a significant length of time after an acute treatment.
Note that the crude death rate as defined above and applied to a whole population can give a misleading impression.
The crude death rate depends on the age ( and gender ) specific mortality rates and the age ( and gender ) वितरण of the population.
the number of deaths per 1000 people can be उच्चतर for developed nations than in less-developed countries, despite life expectancy being higher in developed countries due to standards of health being better.
This happens because developed countries typically have a completely different population age distribution, with a much higher proportion of older people, due to both lower recent birth rates and lower mortality rates.
A अधिक complete picture of मृत्यु is given by a life table which shows the mortality rate separately for each age.
A life table is necessary to दे a good अनुमान of life expectancy.
An otoacoustic emission ( OAE ) is a sound which is generated from within the inner ear.
Having been predicted by Thomas Gold in 1948, its existence was first demonstrated experimentally by David Kemp in 1978 and otoacoustic emissions have since महरूम shown to उठता by a number of different cellular mechanisms within the inner ear.
Studies have shown that OAEs गायब after the inner कान रै been damaged, so OAEs are often used in the laboratory and the clinic as a measure of भीतरी ear health.
Broadly speaking, there are two types of otoacoustic emissions : spontaneous otoacoustic emissions ( SOAEs ), which can occur without external stimulation, and evoked otoacoustic emissions ( eoaes ), which require an evoking stimulus.
Hurricane Tomas was the nineteenth named storm and twelfth hurricane of the 2010 Atlantic hurricane season.
Tomas developed from a tropical wave east of the Windward Islands on October 29.
Quickly intensifying into a hurricane, it moved through the Windward Islands और passed very near Saint Lucia.
After reaching Category 2 status on the Saffir-Simpson scale, Tomas quickly weakened to a tropical storm in the central Caribbean Sea, due to strong हवा shear और शुष्क एयर.
टॉमस later regained hurricane status as it reorganized near the Windward passage.
Throughout the hurricane 's path, 71 लोगों are known to have been killed, 14 of whom were in Saint Lucia.
Monetary losses throughout the Windward Islands were अनुमानित at US $ 588 million, मुख्यतः in Saint Lucia.
In the wake of the storm in Haiti, flooding intensified an ongoing cholera outbreak indirectly causing more fatalities.
according to a report released in December 2010, 55 people were killed in Cuba और Hispanola, though the distribution of these fatalities हैं unknown.
Overall damage from the storm was at least $ 741 million.
Victoria Jackson ( born August 2, 1959 ) is an American comedian, अभिनेत्री, satirist, singer and internet blogger best ज्ञात as a cast member of the NBC टेलीविज़न sketch कॉमेडी series Saturday Night Live ( SNL ) from 1986 to 1992.
She has received attention as a vocal critic of President Barack Obama, and is an active participant in the चाय Party movement.
Postmodern literature is literature characterized by heavy reliance on techniques जैसे fragmentation, विरोधाभास, and questionable narrators, and is often ( though नहीं exclusively ) defined as a style or trend which emerged in the post–World War II era.
Postmodern works are seen as a प्रतिक्रिया against आत्मज्ञान thinking and Modernist approaches to literature.
Postmodern literature, like postmodernism as a पूरे, tends to resist definition or classification as a `` movement ''.
बेशक, the convergence of postmodern literature with various modes of critical theory, particularly reader-response and deconstructionist approaches, and the subversions of the implicit अनुबंध between author, text and reader by which its works are often characterised, have led to pre-modern fictions such as cervantes ' Don Quixote ( 1605,1615 ) and Laurence Sterne 's eighteenth-century satire Tristram Shandy होने retrospectively inducted into the fold.
While there is little consensus on the precise characteristics, scope, and importance of postmodern literature, as is often the case with artistic movements, postmodern literature is commonly defined in relation to a precursor.
For example, a postmodern literary work tends not to conclude with the neatly tied-up ending as is often found in modernist literature, but often parodies it.
Postmodern authors tend to celebrate chance over craft, और further employ metafiction to undermine the लेखक 's authority.
Another characteristic of postmodern literature is the questioning of distinctions between high and low संस्कृति through the use of pastiche, the combination of subjects and genres not previously deemed fit for literature.
Enigma is an electronic musical प्रोजेक्ट founded in Germany by Michael Cretu, David Fairstein and Frank Peterson in 1990.
The Romanian-born Cretu conceived the Enigma project while working in Germany, but based his recording studio A.R.T. Studios in Ibiza, Spain, from the early 1990s until May 2009, where he has अंकित all of Enigma 's studio releases to date.
Cretu is both the composer and the producer of the project.
His former wife, पॉप singer Sandra, often provided vocals on Enigma tracks.
Jens Gad co-arranged and played guitar on three of the Enigma albums.
Peter Cornelius also contributed to Enigma during the 1990s.
Seven studio albums have been produced under the name of the project.
Scooby-Doo is an American animated cartoon franchise, comprising several animated television श्रेणी produced from 1969 to the present day.
the original series, Scooby-Doo, Where Are You !
, was created for Hanna-Barbera Productions by writers Joe Ruby and केन Spears in 1969.
This Saturday morning cartoon series featured four teenagers— Fred जोन्स, daphne Blake, Velma Dinkley, and Norville `` Shaggy '' Rogers — and their talking brown Great Dane dog named scooby-doo, who solve mysteries involving माना अलौकिक जीव through a series of antics and missteps.
Following the success of the original series, Hanna-Barbera and its successor Warner ब्रदर्स. Animation have produced numerous follow-up and spin-off एनिमेटेड series and several related works, including television specials and telefilms, a line of direct-to-video films, and two Warner Bros. –produced theatrical feature films.
Some versions of Scooby-Doo feature different variations on the show 's supernatural theme, and include characters ऐसे as Scooby 's cousin Scooby-Dum and nephew Scrappy-Doo in जोड to or instead of some of the असली characters.
Scooby-Doo was originally broadcast on CBS from 1969 to 1976, when it moved to ABC.
ABC aired the दिखाएँ until canceling it in 1986, and presented a spin-off featuring the characters as children, A Pup नामित Scooby-Doo, from 1988 until 1991.
Two new Scooby-Doo series, What 's New, scooby-doo ?
and Shaggy and Scooby-Doo Get a a Clue ! ] ], aired as part of Kids WB on The WB network and its successor, The CW network, from 2002 until 2008.
The most हाल Scooby-Doo series, Scooby-Doo !
Mystery Incorporated, aired on Cartoon Network from 2010 to 2013.

Call of Duty is a first-person and third-person shooter computer/ video game franchise.
The series began on the PC, and later expanded to consoles and handhelds.
Several spin-off games have also been released.
the earlier games in the series are set primarily in World War II, this includes : Call of Duty, Call of Duty 2, and Call of ड्यूटी 3.
Beginning with Modern Warfare, which is set in modern times, the series has shifted focus away इससे World War II.
Call of Duty 4 : Modern Warfare ( released November 2007 ) was followed by Call of Duty : World at War and Call of Duty : Modern Warfare 2.
Black Ops ( released November 2010 ) takes place in the Cold War, while आधुनिक Warfare 3 ( released नवम्बर 2011 ) takes place in the near-future setting.
Black Ops 2 ( released November 13, 2012 ) takes place in the साल 2025.
The Call of Duty games are published and स्वामित्व by Activision with Aspyr Media publishing it for Apple OS X.
While the studio Infinity वार्ड primarily still develops उन्हें, Treyarch has also developed several of the titles with the release of the studios ' खेल interlaced with प्रत्येक other.
Some games have been developed by Gray Matter Interactive, Spark Unlimited, Amaze Entertainment, n-Space, Rebellion Developments, Ideaworks Game स्टुडियो, Sledgehammer Games and nStigate खेल.
The games use a variety of engines, including the id Tech 3, the Treyarch NGL, and the IW 5.0.
Other products in the franchise include a लकीर of action figures designed by Plan-B Toys, a card game created by Upper Deck, and a comic book mini-series प्रकाशित by WildStorm.
As of November 11, 2011, the Call Of Duty series have sold over 100 million copies.
As of March 31, 2012 there are 40 million monthly active players across all of the कॉल of Duty titles, with 10 million Call of Duty : Elite users and 2 लाख paying annual सदस्यों.
Over 1.6 billion hours of online gameplay have been logged Modern Warfare 3 since its 2011 रिलीज.
The estate tax in the संयुक्त States is a tax imposed on the transfer of the `` taxable estate `` of a deceased person, whether such property is transferred via a होगा, according to the state laws of intestacy or otherwise made as an incident of the death of the owner, such as a ट्रांसफ़र of property from an intestate estate or trust, or the payment of certain life insurance benefits or financial account sums to beneficiaries.
The estate tax is one part of the Unified Gift and Estate Tax system in the United States.
The other part of the system, the gift tax, imposes a कर on transfers of property during a person 's life ; the gift tax prevents avoidance of the estate tax should a person want to give away his/her एस्टेट.
In addition to the federal government, many states also impose an estate tax, with the state version called either an estate tax or an inheritance tax.
Opponents of the एस्टेट कर call it the `` death tax ''.
If an एसेट is left to a spouse or a Federally recognized charity, the tax usually does नहीं apply.
In addition, up to $ 5,250,000 can be given by an individual, before and/or upon their death, without incurring federal gift or estate taxes.
Gavin मैकग्रेगर Rossdale ( born 30 October 1967 ) is an English actor and musician, known as the सीसे singer and rhythm guitarist of the rock band Bush.
Following Bush 's separation in 2002, which lasted लिये eight years, he थी the lead singer and guitarist for Institute, and later began a solo करियर.
When performing solo, Gavin plays songs from his extensive musical libraries.
rossdale has been ranked in the Top 100 Heavy मेटल Vocalists by Hit Parader ( # 75 ).
Raffaello Sanzio da Urbino ( April 6 or March 28, 1483 – April 6, 1520 ), better known simply as Raphael, was an Italian painter and architect of the High Renaissance.
His work is admired for इसके clarity of form and ease of composition and लिये its visual achievement of the Neoplatonic ideal of human grandeur.
Together with Michelangelo and Leonardo da Vinci, he forms the traditional trinity of great masters of that period.
Raphael was enormously productive, running an unusually large workshop, and despite उसके death at 37, a large body of his work remains.
Many of his works are found in the Vatican Palace, where the frescoed राफेल Rooms were the central, and the largest, work of his career.
The best known work is The School of Athens in the वेटिकन Stanza della Segnatura.
After his early years in Rome much of his work was self-designed, लकिन for the most part executed by the workshop इससे his drawings, with considerable loss of quality.
He was extremely influential in his lifetime, though outside Rome his work was mostly ज्ञात from his collaborative printmaking.
After his death, the influence of his great rival Michelangelo was more widespread until the 18th and 19th centuries, when Raphael 's more निर्मल and harmonious qualities were again regarded as the highest models.
His career falls naturally into three phases and three styles, first वर्णित by Giorgio Vasari : उसके early years in Umbria, then a period of about four years ( from 1504–1508 ) absorbing the artistic traditions of Florence, followed by his last hectic and triumphant बारह years in Rome, working for two Popes and उनके close associates.
जूलिया फिओना Roberts ( born October 28, 1967 ) is an American actress.
She became a Hollywood star after headlining the romantic comedy Pretty Woman ( 1990 ), which grossed $ 464 million worldwide.
After receiving Golden Globe Awards and Academy Award nominations for Steel Magnolias ( 1989 ) and Pretty Woman, she won the Academy Award लिये Best Actress for her performance in Erin Brockovich ( 2000 ).
Her films The Pelican Brief ( 1993 ), My Best dost 's Wedding ( 1997 ), Mystic Pizza ( 1988 ), Notting Hill ( 1999 ), Runaway Bride ( 1999 ), Ocean 's ग्यारह ( 2001 ), Ocean 's Twelve ( 2004 ), Charlie Wilson 's War ( 2007 ), Valentine 's Day ( 2010 ), Eat Pray Love ( 2010 ), and Mirror Mirror ( 2012 ) have collectively brought बक्सा office receipts of over $ 2.6 billion, making her एक of the most कामयाब actresses in terms of box office रसीदें.
Roberts had become one of the highest-paid actresses in the world, टॉपिंग the Hollywood Reporters annual `` power list '' of top-earning female stars from 2005 to 2006.
Her fee for 1990 's Pretty Woman was $ 300,000 ; in 2003, she was paid an unprecedented $ 25 million for her role in Mona Lisa मुस्कान ( 2003 ).
as of 2010, Roberts 's net worth was estimated to be $ 140 million.
Roberts has been named one of People magazine 's `` 50 Most Beautiful People in the World '' eleven times, tied with Halle Berry.
In 2011, she was named one of the `` 100 Hottest Women of All-Time '' by Men 's Health.
In 2001, Ladies Home Journal ranked her as the 11th most powerful woman in the United States.
Mark Elliot Zuckerberg ( born May 14, 1984 ) is an American computer programmer and Internet उद्योगों.
He is best known as one of five co-founders of the सोशल networking website Facebook.
As of April 2013, Zuckerberg is the chairman and chief executive of Facebook, Inc. and in 2013 his personal wealth was अनुमानित to be US $ 13.3 billion.
Together with his college roommates and fellow Harvard University students Eduardo Saverin, Andrew McCollum, Dustin Moskovitz and Chris Hughes, Zuckerberg launched Facebook from Harvard 's dormitory rooms.
The group then introduced Facebook onto other campuses nationwide and moved to Palo Alto, California, United States ( U.S. ) shortly afterwards.
In 2007, at the age of twenty-three years, zuckerberg became a billionaire as a result of Facebook and the number of Facebook users worldwide reached a total of one billion in 2012.
zuckerberg was involved in विभिन्न विधिक disputes that were initiated by others in the group, who claimed a share of the company based upon their involvement during the development phase of Facebook.
Since 2010, Zuckerberg has been named among the 100 wealthiest and most influential people in the world by Time magazine as a part of its Person of the Year accolade.
Zuckerberg was निभाई by actor Jesse Eisenberg in the 2010 Hollywood film The Social Network in which the rise of Facebook is portrayed.
The Mayflower was the ship that in 1620 transported 102 English तीर्थयात्रियों, including a core group of Separatists, to New England.
उनके story is one of travail और survival in a harsh New World environment.

Committee of Ways and अर्थात् is the chief tax -writing committee of the United States House of Representatives.
Members of the Ways और Means Committee are not allowed to serve on any अन्य House Committees unless they apply लिये a waiver from उनके party 's congressional leadership.
The Committee has jurisdiction over all taxation, tariffs and other revenue-raising measures, as खूब as a number of other programs including:
Social Security
Unemployment लाभ
Medicare
Enforcement of child support laws
Temporary Assistance for Needy Families, a federal welfare program
Foster care and adoption programs
The u.S. Constitution requires कि all bills regarding taxation must originate in the House of Representatives.
Since House procedure is कि all bills regarding taxation must go through this committee, the committee is very influential, as is its Senate counterpart, the U.S. Senate Committee on Finance.
The Ways और Means Committee in the 111th Congress थी chaired by चार्ली Rangel, who had taken a leave of absence as chairman until House ethics उल्लंघनों were resolved.
However, his leave of अनुपस्थिति as chairman was ruled to be a resignation.
Pete Stark resigned as acting chairman, so Sander Levin आयोजित that position until the start of the 112th Congress.
Dave Camp became the committee chair for the 112th कॉंग्रेस, बाद the Republicans won control of the House in the 2010 election.
The ब्लू whale ( Balaenoptera musculus ) is a समुद्री mammal belonging to the suborder of baleen whales ( called mysticeti ).
At in length and or more in weight, it is the largest ज्ञात animal to have ever existed.
Long and slender, the blue whale 's body can be various shades of bluish-grey dorsally और somewhat lighter underneath.
There are at least three distinct subspecies : B. m. musculus of the North अटलांटिक and North Pacific, B. m. intermedia of the Southern Ocean and B. m. brevicauda ( also known as the pygmy blue व्हेल ) found in the Indian Ocean and South Pacific Ocean.
B. m. indica, found in the भारतीय Ocean, may be another subspecies.
As with other baleen whales, इसके diet consists लगभग exclusively of small crustaceans known as krill.
Blue whales were abundant in nearly all the oceans on Earth until the beginning of the बीसवीं century.
For over a century, they were hunted almost to extinction by whalers until protected by the international community in 1966.
A 2002 report estimated वहीँ were 5,000 to 12,000 blue whales worldwide, located in at least पाँच groups.
More recent research into the Pygmy subspecies suggests this may be an underestimate.
Before whaling, the largest population was in the Antarctic, numbering approximately 239,000 ( range 202,000 to 311,000 ).
There remain only much smaller ( around 2,000 ) एकाग्रता in each of the eastern North Pacific, Antarctic, and Indian Ocean groups.
There हैं two more समूह in the North Atlantic, and at least two in the Southern Hemisphere.
The globe artichoke ( Cynara cardunculus var. scolymus ) is a variety of a species of thistle cultivated as a food.
The खाद्य matter is buds that form within the flower heads before the flowers come into bloom.
The buds go away or change to a coarse, barely edible रूप when the flower blooms.
The uncultivated or wild variety of the species is called a cardoon.
It is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region.
The United States एक hundred-dollar bill ( $ 100 ) is a denomination of United States currency.
U.S. statesman, inventor, and diplomat Benjamin Franklin is currently featured on the obverse of the bill.
On the reverse of the banknote is an image of Independence Hall.
The $ 100 bill is the largest denomination that has been printed since July 13, 1969, when the denominations of $ 500, $ 1,000, $ 5,000, and $ 10,000 were retired.
The Bureau of Engraving and Printing says the average life of a $ 100 bill in circulation is 90 months ( 7.5 years ) before it is replaced due to wear and tear.
The bills हैं also commonly referred to as `` Benjamins '', in सन्दर्भ to the use of Benjamin Franklin 's portrait on the denomination, or `` C-Notes '', based on the Roman numeral for 100.
The विधेयक is one of two denominations printed आज that does not विशेषता a President of the United States ; the other is the $ 10 bill, featuring Alexander Hamilton.
The time on the clock of Independence Hall on the रिवर्स, according to the U.S. Bureau of नक्काशी and Printing, shows approximately 4:10.
One hundred hundred-dollar bills are delivered by संघीय Reserve Banks in mustard-colored straps ( $ 10,000 ).
the Series 2009 $ 100 bill redesign was unveiled on April 21, 2010, and was to be issued to the public on February 11, 2011, but production was shut down in December 2010 because as many as 30 % were unusable due to a manufacturing flaw.
A लंबवत क्रीज in the paper reveals a blank स्पेस on the bill when pulled out.
In their replacement, and continuing the ऊँची demand of this denomination, the Series 2006A was launched retaining the previous design ( 1996-generation ).
On April 24, 2013, the Federal Reserve announced the new $ 100 bill would enter circulation on October 8, 2013.
King David in robes of a Byzantine emperor.
Miniature from the Paris Psalter.
David ( ; ISO 259-3 Dawid ; ' ; Strong 's : Daveed ) according to the Hebrew Bible, was the second king of the United Kingdom of Israel, and according to the New Testament Gospels of Matthew और Luke, an ancestor of Jesus.
His life is conventionally dated to c. 1040–970 BCE, his reign over Judah c. 1010–1002 bce, and his reign over the संयुक्त Kingdom of Israel c. 1002–970 BCE.
The Books of Samuel, 1 Kings, and 1 Chronicles हैं the only sources of information on David, although the Tel डान stele ( dated c. 850–835 BCE ) contains the phrase ( bytdwd ), read as `` House of David '', जिससे most scholars take as confirmation of the existence in the mid-9th century BCE of a Judean royal राजवंश called the House of David.
He is depicted as a righteous king, although not without faults, as well as an acclaimed warrior, musician, and poet, traditionally credited for composing many of the ज़बूर contained in the Book of Psalms.
David is central to Jewish, Christian, और Islamic doctrine and culture.
Biblical tradition maintains that a direct descendant of David will be the Messiah.
In Islam he is considered to be a prophet and the king of a nation.
काठमांडू ( ; ) is the capital and largest urban agglomerate of Nepal.
The agglomerate consists of Kathmandu Metropolitan City at its core, and its sister cities Patan, Kirtipur, Thimi, and Bhaktapur.
It also includes the recently recognized urban क्षेत्रों of Shankhapur, Karyabinayak, and Champapur.
Banepa, dhulikhel, and Panauti are satellite urban areas of Kathmandu located just outside the Kathmandu valley.
Kathmandu is also known informally as `` KTM '' or the `` tri-city ''.
According to a जनसांख्यिकी conducted in 2011, Kathmandu metropolis alone has 975,453 inhabitants ; और the agglomerate has a population of more than 2.5 million inhabitants.
The metropolitan city area is and has a population density of 19,250 per km2.
The city stands at an elevation of approximately in the bowl-shaped Kathmandu Valley of सेंट्रल Nepal.
It is surrounded by four major mountains : Shivapuri, Phulchoki, Nagarjun, and Chandragiri.
Kathmandu घाटी is part of three districts ( Kathmandu, Lalitpur, और Bhaktapur ), has the highest population density in the country, and is घर to about a twelfth of Nepal 's population.
During Rana and Shah eras, the name `` Nepal '' referred only to the Kathmandu Valley ; it was what people who lived outside the valley called it.
During this period, अंग्रेजों historians called the घाटी itself `` Nepal Proper ''.
Today, Kathmandu is not only the पूंजी of the Federal Democratic Republic of Nepal, but also the headquarters of the Central Development Region of Nepal.
The Central Region comprises three zones : Bagmati, Narayani, and Janakpur.
Kathmandu is located in the Bagmati Zone.
Kathmandu is the gateway to tourism in Nepal.
It is also the nerve center of the country 's economy.
it has the सबसे advanced infrastructure of any urban area in नेपाल, and its economy is focused on tourism, which accounted for 3.8 % of Nepal 's GDP in 1995–96.
( Tourism in Kathmandu declined thereafter during a period of political unrest, लकिन since then has improved. )
The city has a rich history, spanning nearly 2000 years, as inferred from inscriptions found in the valley.
धार्मिक and cultural festivities form a major भाग of the lives of लोगों residing in Kathmandu.
Most of काठमांडू 's people follow Hinduism and many अन्य follow Buddhism.
वहीँ are people of other धार्मिक beliefs as well, giving Kathmandu a cosmopolitan संस्कृति.
Nepali is the most commonly spoken language in the city.
Nepal Bhasa is the indigenous language spoken by the Newar people.
Hindi is widely understood and English is understood by Kathmandu 's educated निवासियों.
The city 's literacy rate is 98 %.
Kathmandu 's sister cities ( ललितपुर Patan ) and भक्तपुर are integral to Kathmandu 's cultural heritage, tourism industry, and economy ; therefore UNESCO 's World Heritage Site lists all three cities ' monuments and attractions together under one heading, `` Kathmandu Valley- UNESCO World Heritage Site ``.
Field हॉकी, usually referred to simply as hockey, is a team sport of the hockey family which is played between two teams of eleven players with hockey sticks and a hard, ठोस plastic ball.
At the turn of the 21st सदी, the game is played globally, with particular popularity throughout Europe, Asia, Oceania, and South America – in addition to being the national sport of Pakistan and India.
The term `` फ़ील्ड hockey '' is used primarily in Canada, the United States, and other regions of the world where the sport of ice hockey is more popular.
During play, लक्ष्य keepers are the only players who are allowed to touch the ball with कोई part of their देह ( with the exception of a player 's hand माना 'part of the stick ' ), with this only applying within the shooting circle ( also known as the D, or shooting arc, or just the circle ), while field players play the ball with the flat side of their stick.
The team that scores the most लक्ष्य by the end of the match wins.
If the score is tied at the end of the खेल, either a draw is declared or the game goes into extra time and/or a penalty shootout, depending on the competition 's format.
The governing body of hockey is the International Hockey Federation ( FIH ), साथ men and women होने represented internationally in प्रतियोगिताओं including the Olympic games, राष्ट्रमंडल games, Hockey World Cup, Champions Trophy and Junior Hockey World Cup, with many countries running extensive junior, वरिष्ठ, and masters ' club competitions.
The FIH is also जिम्मेदार for organising the हॉकी नियम Board and developing the rules लिये the खेल.
A popular variant of field hockey is अंदर hockey, which differs in a number of respects while embodying the primary principles of hockey.
Indoor hockey is a 6-a-side variant, with a field which is reduced to लगभग 40m × 20m.
साथ many of the rules remaining the same, including obstruction and feet, there are several key variations - Players may not raise the ball unless शूटिंग on goal, players may not hit the ball ( instead utilising pushes to ट्रांसफ़र the ball ), and the sidelines are replaced with solid barriers which the ball will rebound off.
ethan `` Cane '' Ashby ( né एटकिन्सन ) is a fictional character इससे the American सीबीएस soap opera the Young and the Restless.
He is portrayed by Australian actor Daniel गोडार्ड, who originally auditioned for Brad Snyder on As the World Turns but was recommended for a role on the Young और the Restless instead.
The role was to be portrayed as an American, but Goddard 's Australian descent influenced the अक्षर 's background.
Former head writer lynn Marie Latham introduced him during the episode airing on January 12, 2007 as an Australian बारटेंडर in search of his family, a debut that प्राप्त a mixed response.
Latham created Cane as the बेटे of Phillip Chancellor II ( Donnelly Rhodes ) and Jill Foster Abbott ( Jess Walton ) but the character 's background was rewritten by Maria Arena Bell in 2009, reestablishing him as the son of Colin and Genevieve Atkinson ( Tristan Rogers and Genie Francis ).
Though characterized as `` mysterious '', Cane is `` loyal and dedicated '', जबकि Goddard described the character as a `` ठेठ Australian, working-class kind of guy ''.
He was the first member of the Atkinson family to appear on the श्रेणी, followed by his parents and identical जुड़वा brother.
Soon after his debut, he became a leading character, a decision praised by viewers and आलोचकों.
The character has महरूम involved with Amber Moore ( Adrienne Frantz ), Chloe मिशेल ( Elizabeth Hendrickson ) and most notably Lily Winters ( Christel Khalil ), a romance that garnered significant fan attention.
In 2009, Cane and Lily were married ; Global BC would बाद call Lily the love of Cane 's जीवन.
the जोड़ी had दो children, Charlie and Mattie Ashby.
In 2011, the actor was fired, and cane was shot to death onscreen.
however, Goddard was rehired soon after viewers campaigned for his return, revealing that Cane 's identical twin brother was in फैक्ट the man who died.
This sacrificed his marriage to Lily, but the couple were remarried on Valentine 's Day in 2012.
Goddard has been widely acclaimed for his portrayal ; Canyon News said that he portrays the character honestly, और is `` always dependable, on आग and exciting ''.
जॉन Christopher `` Johnny '' Depp II ( born June 9, 1963 ) is an American actor, film producer, and musician.
he has won the Golden Globe Award and Screen Actors Guild award for Best Actor.
Depp rose to prominence on the 1980s television series 21 Jump Street, becoming a teen idol.
असंतुष्ट with that status, Depp turned to फिल्मी for more challenging roles ; he played the title character of the acclaimed Edward Scissorhands ( 1990 ) and later found बक्सा office success in films such as Sleepy Hollow ( 1999 ), Charlie and the Chocolate Factory ( 2005 ), ऐलिस in Wonderland ( 2010 ), Rango ( 2011 ) and the Pirates of the Caribbean film series ( 2003–present ).
He रै collaborated with director और friend Tim Burton in eight films ; the most हाल being Dark Shadows ( 2012 ).
Depp has gained acclaim for his portrayals of such people as ed Wood in Ed Wood, Joseph D. Pistone in donnie Brasco, Hunter S. Thompson in Fear and Loathing in लास Vegas, George Jung in Blow, and the bank robber John Dillinger in Michael Mann 's Public Enemies.
Films featuring Depp have grossed over $ 3.1 billion at the United States box office and over $ 7.6 billion worldwide.
He has been nominated for top पुरस्कार many times, winning the Best कर्ता Awards from the Golden –_Motion_Picture_Musical_or_Comedy Globes –_Motion_Picture_Musical_or_Comedy for Sweeney Todd : The Demon Barber of Fleet Street and from the Screen Actors Guild for Pirates of the Caribbean : The Curse of the Black Pearl.
He also has garnered a sex symbol status in American cinema, being twice named as the `` Sexiest Man Alive `` by People magazine in 2003 and 2009.
He has been listed in the 2012 Guinness Book of World Records as the highest paid actor, with $ 75 लाख.
The World Wide Web ( abbreviated as WWW or W3, commonly ज्ञात as the web ), is a system of interlinked hypertext documents accessed via the Internet.
With a web browser, one can view web पृष्ठों that may contain text, images, videos, and other मल्टीमीडिया, and navigate between them via hyperlinks.
Using concepts from his earlier hypertext systems जैसे ENQUIRE, British engineer, computer scientist और at that time employee of the CERN, Sir Tim Berners-Lee, अभी Director of the World Wide Web Consortium ( W3C ), wrote a proposal in March 1989 for what would eventually become the World Wide Web.
At CERN, a European research संगठन निकट Geneva straddling the border between France and Switzerland, berners-lee and Belgian computer वैज्ञानिक Robert Cailliau proposed in 1990 to उपयोग hypertext `` to link and access information of various kinds as a web of nodes in which the user can browse at will '', and they publicly introduced the project in December of the same year.
चिह्नित Travis John सांचेज़ ( born November 11, 1986 ) is an American football quarterback for the New यॉर्क Jets of the National Football League ( NFL ).
He was drafted in the first round of the 2009 NFL Draft as the fifth overall चयन by the Jets and the second quarterback taken overall.
He played college football at the University of Southern कैलिफ़ोर्निया ( USC ).
Sanchez grew up in a well-disciplined and athletic family.
In the eighth grade, he began to play फ़ुटबॉल and learn the intricacies of the quarterback position, training with his father, Nick.
A well-regarded prospect, सांचेज़ committed to दक्षिणी California following उसके successful high school career in which he led his team to a championship title during उसके final season.
At USC, Sanchez was relegated as the बैकअप quarterback दौरान his first three years though he rose to prominence due to his brief appearances on the field in 2007 due to injuries suffered by starting क्वार्टरबैक John दाउद Booty.
Sanchez also became popular भीतर the community due to his Mexican-American heritage.
Named the starter in 2008, Sanchez led USC to a 12–1 record and won the Rose Bowl against Penn State लिये which Sanchez was awarded the Most Valuable Player award लिये his performance on offense.
Although अनेक considered him too inexperienced, सांचेज़ announced उसके intention to enter the 2009 NFL ड्राफ्ट.
He was selected by the Jets बाद they traded up with the Cleveland भूरा, and was named the starting quarterback prior to the start of the season.
Despite a subpar performance, Sanchez led the Jets to the AFC Championship Game, a losing effort to the Indianapolis Colts, becoming the fourth rookie quarterback in NFL history to win उसके first playoff game और the second to win two playoff games.
In his second season, Sanchez जारी to develop and led the Jets to the playoffs and the team 's second consecutive afc Championship Game where वे narrowly lost to the Pittsburgh Steelers, 24–19.
With the win over the New इंग्लैण्ड Patriots the week prior, Sanchez tied four other quarterbacks for the दूसरी most post-season road victories by a quarterback in NFL history.
In leading the Jets to two consecutive conference championships, Sanchez joined quarterback Ben Roethlisberger as the only two quarterbacks in NFL history to reach the सम्मेलन championship in their first two seasons in the league.
The next two seasons would be a regression for दोनो the team and Sanchez as they failed to reach the playoffs.
Fans and media critics called for a struggling Sanchez to be benched.
He eventually थी replaced towards the समाप्त of the 2012 season with Greg McElroy.
Paul Avery ( April 2, 1934December 10, 2000 ) थी an American police reporter, best known for his stories on the infamous serial killer known as the zodiac, और later for his work on the Patricia hearst kidnapping.
A small submersible AC sump pump साथ a garden hose कनेक्टर
A sump pump is a पंप used to remove water that has accumulated in a water collecting sump basin, commonly found in the basement of homes.
The water may डालें via the perimeter drains of a basement waterproofing system, funneling into the basin or because of rain or natural ground water, if the basement is below the water table level.
Sump pumps are used where basement flooding happens regularly and to remedy dampness where the water table is above the foundation of a home.
Sump pumps send water away from a house to any place जहाँ it is no longer problematic, such as a municipal storm drain or a dry well.
Pumps may discharge to the sanitary sewer in older installations.
Once considered acceptable, this practice may now violate the plumbing code or municipal bylaws, because it can overwhelm the municipal sewage treatment system.
Municipalities urge homeowners to disconnect और reroute sump pump discharge away from sanitary sewers.
जुर्माना may be imposed for noncompliance.
Many homeowners have inherited their sump pump configurations and do not realize कि the pump discharges to the sewer.
If the discharge is fed to a laundry sink in the basement, it 's likely going to the सीवर.
प्रायः hardwired into a home 's electrical system, sump pumps may have a battery बैकअप.
The home 's pressurized water सप्लाई powers some पंपों, eliminating the need for electricity at the expense of using potable जल, potentially making them more expensive to operate than electrical pumps and creating an additional water निपटान problem.
Since a sump basin may overflow if not constantly pumped, a backup system is important for cases when the main power is out for prolonged periods of time, as during a severe storm.
वहीँ are generally two types of sump pumps — pedestal और submersible.
The pedestal pump 's motor is mounted above the sump, where it is more easily serviced, but is also more conspicuous.
The pump impeller is driven by a long, vertical extension shaft and the impeller is in a scroll housing in the base of the pump.
The submersible pump is entirely mounted inside the sump, and is specially sealed to prevent electrical short circuits.
Sump pump systems are also utilized in industrial and commercial applications to control water table -related problems in surface soil.
an artesian aquifer or periodic high जल तालिका situation can कारण the ground to become unstable due to water saturation.
As long as the pump functions, the surface soil will remain stable.
These sumps are typically ten feet in depth or more ; lined with corrugated metal pipe that contains perforations or drain holes throughout.
They may शामिल electronic control systems with visual and audible alarms and are usually covered to prevent debris and animals from falling in.
Bleeding Kansas, Bloody कान्सास or the Border War, थी a series of violent राजनैतिक confrontations involving anti-slavery Free-Staters and pro-slavery `` Border Ruffian `` elements, that took place in the Kansas Territory and the neighboring कस्बों of Missouri between 1854 and 1861.
At the heart of the conflict was the question of whether Kansas would डालें the Union as a free state or slave state.
as such, Bleeding Kansas was a proxy war between Northerners and Southerners over the समस्या of slavery in the संयुक्त States.
the term `` Bleeding Kansas '' was coined by Horace Greeley of the New York Tribune ; the events it encompasses directly presaged the American Civil War.
Congress had long struggled to balance the interests of pro-slavery forces and anti-slavery forces.
The events later known as Bleeding Kansas were set into motion by the Kansas–Nebraska Act of 1854, which nullified the Missouri Compromise and instead implemented the concept of popular sovereignty.
An ostensibly democratic idea, popular sovereignty stated that the inhabitants of each territory or state should decide whether it would be a free or slave state ; however, this resulted in immigration en masse to Kansas by activists from both sides.
At one point, Kansas had two पृथक governments, each with its own constitution, although only one थी federally पहचाना.
On January 29, 1861, Kansas was admitted to the Union as a free state, less than three months before the Battle of Fort Sumter which began the Civil War.
बेंजीन is an organic chemical compound साथ the molecular formula C6 H|Hydrogen|H6.
Its molecule is रचित of 6 कार्बन atoms joined in a रिंग, with 1 hydrogen atom attached to each carbon atom.
Because its molecules contain only carbon and hydrogen atoms, benzene is classed as a hydrocarbon.
Benzene is a natural constituent of crude oil, and is one of the most basic petrochemicals.
Benzene is an aromatic hydrocarbon and the दूसरी [ n ] - annulene ( [ 6 ] -annulene ), a cyclic hydrocarbon with a निरन्तर pi bond.
It is sometimes abbreviated Ph –H. Benzene is a colorless and highly flammable liquid with a sweet smell.
It is mainly used as a precursor to heavy chemicals, such as ethylbenzene and cumene, which are produced on a billion kilogram scale.
Because it has a high octane number, it is an important component of gasoline, composing a few percent of its mass.
Most non-industrial applications have been limited by benzene 's carcinogenicity.
Giovanni Virginio Schiaparelli ( ; 14 March 1835 – 4 जुलाई 1910 ) was an Italian astronomer and science historian.
Wii homebrew refers to the reuse of Nintendo 's वी game console to run software that has नहीं been authorized by Nintendo.
It achieves this by defeating the वी 's copy protection and code signing measures.
In more general terms, Wii Homebrew refers to the use of the Wii 's hardware, accessories and तन्त्र for purposes outside those intended by the निर्माता.
असली efforts focused on using the Wii Remote as a pointing device on अन्य operating systems, or running web-based games in the built-in web browser.
Subsequent developments in खेल exploits, such as the `` Twilight hack ``, `` Bannerbomb '' and its later incarnation `` LetterBomb '', `` Smash स्टेक '', `` Indiana Pwns '', `` Yu-Gi-OWNED '', `` bathaxx '', and `` Return of the Jodi '', made installing the `` homebrew Channel `` possible.
Hadley ( right ) discussing the 2006 Israel-Lebanon crisis with Bush and Rice.
स्टीफन John Hadley ( born February 13, 1947 ) was the 21st U.S. Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs ( commonly referred as National Security Advisor ), serving under President George W. Bush.
Take identical growing plants और give fertilizer to half of them.
If there हैं differences between the fertilized plant group and the unfertilized `` control '' group, these differences may be due to the fertilizer.
A scientific control is an experiment or observation designed to minimize the effects of variables other than the single independent variable.
This increases the reliability of the results, often through a comparison between control measurements and the other measurements.
Scientific controls are a part of the scientific method.
For example, during drug testing, scientists will try to कंट्रोल two समूह to keep उन्हें as identical as possible, then allow एक group to try the drug.
Another example might be परीक्षण plant fertilizer by giving it to only half the plants in a garden : the plants that receive no fertilizer हैं the control group, because they establish the baseline level of growth that the fertilizer-treated plants will be compared against.
Without a control group, the experiment can not determine whether the fertilizer-treated plants grow more than they would have if untreated.
Ideally, all variables in an प्रयोग will be controlled ( accounted for by the control measurements ) and none will be uncontrolled.
In ऐसे an experiment, if all the controls work as expected, it is possible to conclude that the experiment is working as intended और that the results of the experiment are due to the effect of the variable being tested.
That is, वैज्ञानिक controls allow an investigator to make a claim जैसे `` Two situations were identical until factor x occurred.
Since factor X is the only difference between the two situations, the new outcome was caused by factor X. ''

John Adams ( October 30, 1735 ( O.S. October 19, 1735 ) – July 4, 1826 ) was the second president of the United States ( 1797–1801 ), having earlier served as the first vice president of the संयुक्त States.
An American Founding Father, he was a statesman, diplomat, and a leading advocate of American independence from ग्रेट Britain.
Well educated, he was an Enlightenment political theorist who प्रचारित republicanism and wrote prolifically about his often seminal ideas, both in published works and in letters to his wife and कुंजी adviser Abigail as well as to other founding Fathers.
Adams came to prominence in the early चरण of the American Revolution.
A वकील and public figure in Boston, as a delegate from Massachusetts to the Continental Congress, he निभाई a leading role in persuading Congress to declare independence.
He assisted Thomas Jefferson in drafting the Declaration of Independence in 1776, and was its primary advocate in the Congress.
Later, as a diplomat in यूरोपीय, he helped negotiate the eventual peace treaty with Great Britain, और was responsible for obtaining vital governmental loans from Amsterdam बैंकर्स.
A राजनैतिक theorist and historian, Adams largely wrote the Massachusetts Constitution in 1780, which together साथ his earlier Thoughts on Government, influenced American political thought.
One of his greatest roles was as a judge of character : in 1775, he nominated जार्ज Washington to be commander-in-chief, and 25 सालो later nominated John Marshall to be Chief Justice of the United राज्य.
Adams ' revolutionary credentials secured him two terms as George Washington 's vice president and his own election in 1796 as the second president.
During his one term, he encountered ferocious attacks by the Jeffersonian Republicans, as well as the प्रबल faction in his अपना Federalist पार्टी led by his bitter enemy Alexander Hamilton.
Adams signed the controversial Alien and Sedition Acts, and built up the फौज and navy especially in the face of an undeclared naval war ( called the `` Quasi-War `` ) with France, 1798–1800.
The major accomplishment of his presidency थी his peaceful resolution of the conflict in the face of Hamilton 's विपक्ष.
In 1800, Adams was defeated for re-election by Thomas जेफरसन and retired to Massachusetts.
He later resumed his friendship with Jefferson.
He and his wife, Abigail Adams, founded an accomplished family line of politicians, diplomats, and historians now referred to as the एडम्स political family.
Adams was the father of John Quincy Adams, the sixth President of the United States.
His achievements have received greater recognition in modern times, though his contributions यहूद not initially as मनाये as those of other Founders.
Adams was the first U.S. president to reside in the building that eventually became known as the श्वेत हाउस.
a Watt भाप engine.
The steam engine, fuelled primarily by coal, propelled the Industrial Revolution in Great Britain and the world.
The औद्योगिक Revolution थी the transition to new manufacturing processes that occurred in the काल from about 1760 to some time between 1820 और 1840.
This transition included going from hand production methods to machines, new chemical manufacturing and iron production processes, improved efficiency of water power, the increasing use of steam power and development of machine tools.
The transition also included the change from wood and other bio-fuels to coal.
The औद्योगिक क्रान्ति began in Britain और within a few decades spread to Western Europe and the United States.
The औद्योगिक Revolution marks a major turning point in history ; almost every पहलू of daily life was influenced in some way.
Most notably, average income and population began to exhibit unprecedented sustained growth.
In the words of Nobel Prize winner Robert E. Lucas, Jr., `` For the first time in history, the living standards of the masses of ordinary people have begun to undergo sustained growth... Nothing remotely like this economic behavior is mentioned by the classical economists, even as a सैद्धांतिक सम्भावना. ''
William Bell Scott Iron and Coal, 1855-60
The period of time covered by the Industrial Revolution varies with different historians.
Eric hobsbawm held that it 'broke आउट ' in Britain in the 1780s and was not fully felt जबतक the 1830s or 1840s, while T. S. Ashton held that it occurred roughly between 1760 and 1830.
कुछ 20th-century historians such as John Clapham और Nicholas crafts have argued that the process of economic और social change took place gradually and the term revolution is a misnomer.
This is still a subject of debate among historians.
GDP per capita was broadly stable before the Industrial Revolution और the emergence of the modern capitalist economy.
The औद्योगिक Revolution began an era of per-capita economic growth in capitalist economies.
Economic इतिहासकारों are in agreement कि the onset of the Industrial Revolution is the most important event in the history of humanity चूंकि the domestication of animals और पौधे.
The First Industrial Revolution evolved into the Second Industrial Revolution in the transition years between 1840 and 1870, जब technological and economic progress gained momentum with the increasing adoption of steam-powered boats, ships and रेल, the large scale manufacture of machine tools and the increasing use of steam powered factories.

This list ranks u.S. शहरों by land area ( not including bodies of water ).
Total areas ( including जल ) are also given, but note that, when क्रमित by total area, a number of coastal cities appear disproportionately `` larger ''.
San Francisco is an extreme example ; water makes up nearly 80 % of its total area of 232 square miles ( 601 km2 ).
Note also that in अनेक cases a नगर may be geographically large primarily because its municipal government has merged साथ the government of the surrounding county.
In some मामले the county no longer exists, while in others the व्यवस्था has formed a Consolidated city–county ( or city- borough in Alaska, or city- parish in Louisiana ).
These are shown in bold in the list below ( but not all examples may be indicated ).

The large intestine ( or bowel, colon ) is the last part of the digestive system in vertebrate animals.
इसके function is to absorb water from the बाकी indigestible food matter, and then to pass useless waste material from the body.
This article is primarily about the human gut, though the information परिचय its processes are directly applicable to most mammals.
the large intestine consists of the cecum, rectum and anal canal.
It starts in the right iliac region of the pelvis, just at or below the सही waist, where it is joined to the bottom end of the small intestine.
From here it continues up the abdomen, then आरपार the width of the abdominal cavity, and then it turns down, continuing to its endpoint at the anus.
The large intestine is about long, which is about one-fifth of the whole length of the intestinal canal.
In terminologia anatomica the large intestine includes the cecum, colon, rectum, and anal canal.
However, some sources exclude the anal canal.
the Green Bay Packers are an American football team based in ग्रीन Bay, Wisconsin.
They are members of the North Division of the National Football Conference ( NFC ) in the National Football League ( एनएफएल ).
Green Bay is the third-oldest मताधिकार in the NFL, having been organized and playing in 1919.
The Packers are the only non-profit, community-owned प्रमुख लीग professional sports team in the United States.
The Packers हैं the last vestige of `` small town teams '' that were once common in the NFL during the 1920s and 1930s.
Founded in 1919 by Earl `` Curly '' Lambeau ( hence the name Lambeau Field on जिससे the team plays ) and जार्ज Whitney Calhoun, the Green Bay Packers can trace their lineage to other semi-professional teams in Green Bay dating back to 1896.
In 1919 and 1920 the Packers competed as a semi-professional football team against clubs from around Wisconsin and the Midwest.
They joined the American Professional Football Association ( APFA ) in 1921, the forerunner to what is known today as the National Football लीग ( NFL ).
Although Green Bay is the last NFL `` छोटी कस्बा '' team, इसके local fan आधार और media extends into आसपास Milwaukee ; the team also played selected home खेल there between 1933 और 1994.
The Green Bay Packers have won 13 league championships ( more than any अन्य team in the NFL ), including nine NFL championships prior to the Super Bowl era and four Super Bowl victories —in 1967 ( Super Bowl I ), 1968 ( सुपर Bowl II ), 1997 ( Super Bowl XXXI ) and 2011 ( Super Bowl XLV ).
The Packers have long-standing, bitter rivalries with their NFC उत्तर ( formerly the NFC Central ) opponents, the Chicago Bears, Minnesota Vikings and the Detroit Lions.
The Bears-Packers rivalry is one of the oldest rivalries in NFL history, डेटिंग back to 1921.
The San Fernando Valley ( locally ज्ञात as `` the Valley '' ) is an urbanized valley located in the लॉस Angeles metropolitan area of southern California, United States, defined by the mountains of the Transverse Ranges circling it.
Home to 1.76 million people, it lies north of the larger and more populous Los Angeles Basin.
Nearly two thirds of the Valley 's land area is part of the City of Los Angeles.
The other incorporated cities in the valley are Glendale, Burbank, San फर्नांडो, Hidden Hills and Calabasas.
