Susan leigh vaughan Smith ( born September 26, 1971 ) is an American woman sentenced to life in prison for murdering उसके children.
born in Union, South Carolina, and a former student of the University of South Carolina Union, she was convicted on July 22, 1995 for murdering her two sons, 3-year-old Michael Daniel Smith, born October 10, 1991, and 14-month-old सिकंदर Tyler Smith, born August 5, 1993.
The case gained worldwide attention shortly after it विकसित, due to her claiming that a black man stole her car and kidnapped her sons.
She later claimed that she suffered from mental health issues कि impaired उसके judgment.
According to the South Carolina Department of Corrections, Smith will be योग्य for parole on November 4, 2024, बाद serving a minimum of thirty years.
She is incarcerated at South Carolina 's Leath Correctional Institution, near Greenwood.
Mount McKinley ( also ज्ञात as Denali taken from the Inuit Koyukon Athabaskan language meaning `` The Great One '' ) is the highest mountain peak in the United States and in North America with a summit elevation of above sea level.
at some, the base to peak rise is considered the largest of any mountain situated entirely above sea level.
measured by topographic prominence, it is the third most prominent शिखर after Mount Everest and Aconcagua.
Located in the अलास्का Range in the interior of US state of Alaska, it is the centerpiece of Denali National Park और Preserve.
The पहला European to document sighting the mountain was जार्ज Vancouver in 1794.
In 1903, James Wickersham recorded the first attempt at climbing McKinley which was unsuccessful.
In 1906, फ्रेडरिक Cook claimed the first ascent which was later proven to be false.
the first verifiable ascent to mckinley 's summit was achieved on June 7, 1913 by climbers Hudson Stuck, Harry Karstens, Walter Harper, and Robert Tatum.
In 1951, Bradford Washburn pioneered the West Buttress route considered to be the safest and easiest रूट and therefore the most popular currently in use.
The Honda S600 is an automobile manufactured by Honda.
It was launched in March 1964.
Available as a roadster – bearing strong resemblance to the Honda s500 – and as a fastback coupé – introduced in March 1965 – the S600 was the first Honda available in two trim levels.
During its production run up to 1966, the model styling would remain pretty much the same, with the most notable परिवर्तन coming to the front grille, बम्पर, और headlights.
Powered by a DOHC, water-cooled, four-cylinder inline engine with four carburetors, the engine capacity was increased to 606 cc from the S500 's 531 cc.
The engine produced at 8,500 rpm और had a top गति of.
With the convertible weighing in at mere, the extra sheet metal of the coupe तभी added to the overall वज़न.
Suspension was independent with sealed roller chain drive to each rear wheel.
The S600 was the first mass marketed Honda car.
First offered only in right-hand drive, it soon became available in left-hand drive to अपील to export markets.
There were a few pre-production S500s manufactured in left hand drive, two or तीन even being shown in some early sales brochures.
दोनो the S600 roadster and coupé यहूद available in standard trim and a special, upgraded package पुकारा the SM600 which included, among other items, special paint colors, exclusive badging, a मानक radio and speaker, a special antenna in the passenger side sun visor, standard reversing lights, a standard cigarette lighter, a standard हीटर, better cushioned seats, and a detachable seat track for जल्दी removal of the passenger seat.
Honda built 3,912 roadsters in 1964, with production climbing to 7,261 convertibles and 1,519 coupes in 1965.
Production dropped off in 1966 ( as they यहूद shifting to the S800 ) with only 111 roadsters और 281 coupes, giving tallies of 11,284 convertibles and 1,800 coupes for the 3 year span.
Everybody Hates Chris is an अमरीकी television period sitcom that depicts the teenage अनुभवों of comedian Chris Rock ( who is also the narrator ) while growing up in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighborhood of Brooklyn, नई York.
The show is set between 1983 and 1987 ; however, Rock himself was a teenager between 1978 and 1983.
Rock grew up with a boy named Kenny montero, whom he has often referred to as the inspiration लिये a lot of the episodes.
In many interviews, Rock has described Kenny as the reason he got into comedy in the पहला place.
The show 's title parodies the सीबीएस sitcom everybody Loves Raymond.
Rock stated : `` Everybody Loves Raymond but Everybody hates Chris ! ``.
The show 's lead actors are Tyler जेम्स Williams, टेरी Crews, Tichina अर्नाल्ड, tequan Richmond, imani Hakim, and विंसेंट Martella.
In Fall 2008, the The CW moved Everybody Hates Chris and The Game to the Friday night death slot.
the fourth season of the श्रेणी premiered Friday, October 3, 2008, at 8:00pm Eastern/7:00PM Central.
On May 21, 2009, The cw announced that it had cancelled Everybody Hates Chris.
Prior to this, executive producer Chris चट्टान announced that the समाप्त of season 4 matched up with उसके own past—dropping out of ऊँची school to become a comedian—and that it was time to end the show.
Pleural effusion is excess fluid that accumulates between the two pleural layers, the fluid-filled स्पेस that surrounds the lungs.
Excessive amounts of such fluid can impair breathing by limiting the expansion of the lungs during वेंटिलेशन.
Beowulf ( ; in Old English or ) is the conventional title of an Old English heroic epic कविता consisting of 3182 alliterative long lines, set in Scandinavia, commonly cited as one of the most important works of Anglo-Saxon literature.
It survives in a single manuscript known as the Nowell Codex.
Its composition by an anonymous Anglo-Saxon poet is dated between the 8th and the early 11th century.
In 1731, the manuscript was badly damaged by a fire that swept through a building housing a collection of Medieval manuscripts assembled by Sir रॉबर्ट Bruce Cotton.
The poem fell into obscurity for decades, and its existence did not become widely known again until it was printed in 1815 in an edition prepared by the Icelandic-Danish scholar Grímur jónsson Thorkelin.
In the poem, Beowulf, a नायिका of the Geats in Scandinavia, आता to the सहायता of Hroðgar, the king of the Danes, whose mead hall ( in Heorot ) has been under attack by a monster known as Grendel.
After Beowulf slays him, grendel 's mother attacks the hall और is then also पराजित.
Victorious, Beowulf goes home to Geatland in Sweden and later becomes king of the Geats.
After a period of fifty years रै passed, Beowulf defeats a ड्रैगन, but is fatally wounded in the battle.
After उसके death, his attendants bury उसे in a tumulus, a burial mound, in Geatland.
Shem Ham और Japheth by James Tissot 1904.
Shem ( ; Sēm ; Arabic : Sām ; Ge'ez : ሴም, Sēm ; `` renown ; prosperity ; name '' ) was one of the बेटे of Noah in the Hebrew Bible as well as in Islamic literature.
He is सबसे popularly regarded as the eldest son, हालांकि some traditions regard him as the second son.
Genesis 10:21 refers to relative ages of Shem और his bhai Japheth, but साथ sufficient ambiguity to have yielded different translations.
The verse is translated in the KJV as `` unto shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, even to him were children born. ``.
However, the New American Standard Bible gives, `` Also to Shem, the father of सब the children of eber, and the older brother of Japheth, children were born. ''
Genesis 11:10 records कि Shem was still 100 years old at the जनम of Arphaxad, ( but nearly 101 - देखिए Chronology note, ) two years after the flood, making him barely 99 at the time the flood began ; and that he lived for another 500 years after इस, making his age at death 600 years.
The children of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram, in addition to daughters.
Abraham, the patriarch of the Hebrews and Arabs, was एक of the descendants of Arphaxad.
Islamic literature describes Shem as one of the believing sons of Noah.
Some स्त्रोत भी identify Shem as a prophet in his अपना right and that he was the अगला prophet after his father.
in one Muslim legend, Shem थी one of the people कि God बना Jesus resurrect as a sign to the Children of Israel.
The 1st century historian Flavius Josephus, among many others, recounted the tradition that these five sons were the progenitors of the nations of Elam, Assyria, Chaldea, Lydia, and Syria, respectively.
Semitic is still a commonly used पद for the Semitic languages, as a subset of the Afro-Asiatic languages, denoting the common linguistic heritage of Arabic, Aramaic, Akkadian, Ethiopic, Hebrew and फ़ोनीशियाई languages.
According to कुछ यहूदी traditions ( e.g., B. Talmud Nedarim 32b ; Genesis Rabbah 46:7 ; Genesis Rabbah 56:10 ; Leviticus rabbah 25:6 ; Numbers Rabbah 4:8. ), Shem is believed to have been Melchizedek, King of Salem whom अब्राहम is recorded to have met after the battle of the four kings.
In a few of the many extra-biblical sources that describe him, Shem is also credited with killing Nimrod, son of Cush.
shem is mentioned in Genesis 5:32, 6:10 ; 7:13 ; 9:18,23,26-27 ; 10 ; 11:10 ; also in 1 Chronicles 1:4.
Geographic identifications of Flavius josephus, c. 100 AD ; Japheth 's sons shown in रेड, Ham 's sons in blue, Shem 's sons in green.
go Daddy or Go Daddy Group Inc. is a privately held कम्पनी that is primarily an अंतरजाल domain registrar और वेब hosting company.
Go Daddy Group Inc. filed for an IPO in 2006, but later canceled it, due to `` market uncertainties ''.
In addition to domain पंजीकरण और hosting Go Daddy also sells e-business सम्बन्धित software and services.
On June 24, 2011, the Wall Street Journal reported that private-equity firms KKR and Silver Lake साझेदार, along with a third investor, were nearing a deal to buy the company for between $ 2–2.5 अरब.
On July 1, 2011 go Daddy confirmed that KKR, Silver Lake Partners and Technology Crossover ventures had closed the deal.
Although the purchase दाम was not officially announced it was reported to be $ 2.25 billion, for 65 % of the company.
, Bob Parsons had ceded the सीईओ role of Go Daddy to Warren Adelman, who had been with the company for about 10 सालो.
The Andorran coat of arms at the Andorran parliament.
Andorra ( ;, ), officially the principality of Andorra ( ), also पुकारा the Principality of the घाटियों of Andorra, ( ), is a landlocked microstate in Southwestern Europe, located in the eastern Pyrenees mountains and bordered by Spain and France.
It is the sixth smallest nation in Europe, having an area of and an estimated population of 85,000 in 2012.
Its capital, Andorra la Vella, is the highest capital city in Europe, at an elevation of above sea level.
The official language is Catalan, although Spanish, Portuguese, and French are also commonly spoken.
Created under a charter in 988, the present Principality was formed in 1278.
It is known as a principality as it is a monarchy headed by two co-princes – the Bishop of Urgell और the President of फ़्रांस.
Andorra is a prosperous country mainly because of its tourism industry, which services an अनुमानित 10.2 million visitors annually, and also because of its औकात as a कर haven.
It is not a member of the European Union, but the euro is the de facto currency.
The people of Andorra have the 4th highest human life expectancy in the संसार — 82 years at birth.
The George वॉशिंगटन विश्वविद्यालयों ( GW, GWU, or George Washington ) is a comprehensive private, coeducational research university located in Washington, D.C..
It awards certificates, Bachelor degrees, Masters degrees, and PhDs across several dozen disciplines.
The university was chartered by an Act of Congress on February 9, 1821 as The Columbian College in the District of Columbia.

reality television series Keeping up with the Kardashians, and इसके subsequent spin-offs, including Kourtney and Kim Take New York and Kourtney and Kim Take Miami.

With sisters Kourtney and Khloé, Kardashian co-owns the fashion boutique chain D-A-S-H.
She has been involved in the production of several लाइनों of clothing and fragrances.
In August 2011, Kardashian married basketball player Kris Humphries in a widely publicized ceremony.
That October, Kardashian filed for divorce following 72 days of marriage.
The move garnered significant backlash from the media, who labeled it a `` publicity stunt ''.
After 536 days, Kardashian and Humphries reached an अघोषित settlement at the लॉस Angeles Superior Court, finalizing the divorce in April 2013.

Oahu ( ) or Oahu, known as `` The Gathering Place '', is the तीसरा largest of the Hawaiian Islands and the most populous of the islands in the U.S. state of Hawaii.
The state capital, Honolulu, is on Oahu 's southeast coast.
Including small close-in offshore islands such as Ford Island and the islands in Kaneohe Bay and off the eastern ( windward ) coast, it has a total land area of, making it the 20th largest island in the संयुक्त राज्य.
In the greatest dimension, this volcanic द्वीप is long and across.
The length of the shoreline is.
The island is the result of two पृथक shield volcanoes : waianae and Koolau, with a broad `` valley '' or saddle ( the central Oahu Plain ) between them.
The उच्चतम point is Mt. ka'ala in the Waianae Range, rising to above sea level.
The base currency of the United States is the U.S. dollar, and is printed on bills in denominations of $ 1, $ 2, $ 5, $ 10, $ 20, $ 50, and $ 100.
at one time, however, u.S. currency included five larger denominations.
टीप in the denominations of $ 500, $ 1,000, $ 5,000, and $ 10,000 were printed लिये general use, and a $ 100,000 note was printed for certain internal transactions.
British Honduras थी a British colony in Central America.
In 1981, the colony gained full स्वतंत्रता, and is now the independent स्वदेश of Belize.
First colonised by Spaniards in the 17th सदी, the territory on the east coast of Central America, south of Mexico, became a British क्राउन colony in 1862.
In 1964, it became a self-governing colony.
Belize became fully independent from the United Kingdom in 1981.
Belize was the last continental possession of the United Kingdom in the Americas.
Spelt, also known as dinkel wheat, or hulled wheat, is an ancient species of wheat from the fifth millennium BC.
Spelt was an important staple in parts of Europe इससे the Bronze आयु to medieval टाइम्स ; it now survives as a relict crop in Central Europe and northern Spain and has found a नई market as a health food.
Spelt is sometimes considered a subspecies of the closely related species आम wheat ( T. aestivum ), in which case its botanical name is considered to be Triticum aestivum subsp. spelta.
it is a hexaploid wheat, which means it रै six sets of chromosomes.
Sherlock Holmes ( or ) is a fictional detective created by author और physician Sir Arthur Conan Doyle.
a london-based `` consulting जासूस '' whose abilities border on the fantastic, Holmes is famous for his astute लॉजिकल तर्क, his ability to adopt almost any disguise, and his use of forensic science skills to solve difficult cases.
Holmes, who first appeared in publication in 1887, थी featured in four novels and 56 short stories.
the first अनोखा, A Study in Scarlet, appeared in Beeton 's Christmas Annual in 1887 and the second, The Sign of the Four, in Lippincott 's Monthly Magazine in 1890.
The अक्षर grew tremendously in popularity with the first series of short stories in The strand Magazine, beginning with A Scandal in Bohemia in 1891 ; further series of short कहानियां and two novels published in serial रूप appeared between then and 1927.
The stories cover a काल from around 1880 up to 1914.
All but four stories are narrated by Holmes 's dost and biographer, Dr. जॉन H. Watson ; two are narrated by Holmes himself ( `` the Blanched Soldier `` and `` The Lion 's Mane `` ) and two others are written in the third person ( `` The mazarin Stone `` and `` His Last Bow `` ).
In दो stories ( `` the Musgrave Ritual `` and `` The Gloria Scott `` ), Holmes tells Watson the main story from his memories, while Watson becomes the narrator of the frame story.
The first और fourth novels, A Study in Scarlet and The घाटी of Fear, प्रत्येक include a long interval of सर्वज्ञ narration recounting events unknown to either holmes or Watson.
The United States हाउस of Representatives is one of the two houses of the United States Congress ( a bicameral legislature ).
It is frequently referred to as the House.
The other house is the Senate.
The संयोजन and powers of the House are established in Article One of the United States Constitution.
The प्रमुख power of the House is to pass federal legislation that affects the entire country although its bills must also be passed by the Senate and further agreed to by the U.S. President before becoming law ( unless both the House and Senate re-pass the legislation with a two-thirds majority in each chamber ).
The House has several exclusive powers : the power to initiate revenue bills, to impeach officials, and to elect the U.S. President in case there is no majority in the Electoral College.
Each U.S. state is represented in the House in proportion to its population but is entitled to at least one representative.
The most populous state, California, फिलहाल has 53 representatives.
The total number of voting representatives is फिक्स्ड by law at 435.
Each representative serves for a two-year term.
The Speaker of the संयुक्त States House of Representatives, who presides over the chamber, is elected by the members of the House, and is therefore traditionally the leader of the House Democratic caucus or the House Republican Conference, whichever party has more voting members.
The House meets in the south wing of the United States Capitol.
jell-o is a brand name belonging to U.S.-based Kraft Foods for a number of gelatin desserts, including fruit gels, puddings and no-bake cream pies.
The ब्रांड 's popularity has led to it being used as a generic term for gelatin dessert across the U.S. and Canada.
Kennywood is an मनोरंजन park located in West Mifflin, Pennsylvania, a suburb of Pittsburgh.
The park पहला opened in 1898 as a `` trolley park '' attraction at the end of the Mellon family 's Monongahela Street Railway.
the park was purchased in 1906 by F. W. Henninger and Andrew McSwigan and thus began the Kennywood Entertainment company that has remained a closely held family business लिये over 100 years.
This traditional amusement park still रै structures और rides डेटिंग back to its opening और the early 1900s.
Along with Rye Playland Park, it is one of only two amusement पार्क listed in the National पंजीकरण of Historic Places.
Kennywood is owned by Kennywood Entertainment Company, which until December 2007 was a closely held family business owned by the Henninger and McSwigan families.
Kennywood Entertainment is now operated by California-based Palace Entertainment, a subsidiary of parques Reunidos, an international amusement park company based in Madrid, Spain.
parque Reunidos is in turn a subsidiary of Candover निवेश, an investment fund based in the uk.
A Social Security card जारी by the Railroad Retirement Board in 1943 to a now deceased person.
In the United States, a Social सुरक्षा number ( SSN ) is a nine-digit number issued to U.S. citizens, permanent निवासियों, and temporary ( working ) residents under section 205 ( c ) ( 2 ) of the Social Security Act, codified as.
The number is issued to an individual by the Social Security Administration, an independent agency of the United States government.
Its primary purpose is to track individuals for Social Security उद्देश्य.
A Social Security number may be obtained by applying on Form SS-5, `` Application for A Social Security Number Card ''.
Minimalism describes movements in various forms of art and design, especially visual art and music, where the work is set out to expose the essence or identity of a subject through eliminating all non-essential forms, features or concepts.
Minimalism is any design or style in जिससे the simplest and fewest elements are प्रयुक्त to create the maximum प्रभाव.
As a specific movement in the arts it is identified साथ developments in post–World युद्ध ii Western Art, most strongly with American visual arts in the 1960s and early 1970s.
Prominent artists associated with this movement include Donald Judd, John McCracken, Agnes Martin, Dan Flavin, Robert Morris, Anne Truitt, and Frank Stella.
It is rooted in the reductive aspects of Modernism, and is often interpreted as a reaction against Abstract expressionism and a bridge to postminimal art practices.
The terms have expanded to encompass a गति in music which features repetition and iteration, as in the compositions of La Monte यंग, टेरी Riley, Steve Reich, Philip कांच, and John Adams.
अल्पतम compositions are sometimes known as systems music.
The term `` minimalist '' is often applied colloquially to designate anything कि is spare or stripped to its essentials.
It has also महरूम used to describe the plays and novels of Samuel Beckett, the films of Robert Bresson, the stories of रेमंड Carver, और even the automobile designs of Colin Chapman.
The word was first used in English in the early 20th century to describe the Mensheviks.
In chemistry and physics, Dalton 's law ( also called Dalton 's law of partial pressures ) राज्य that the total pressure exerted by the मिश्रण of non-reactive gases is equal to the sum of the आंशिक pressures of individual gases.
This empirical विधि was observed by John Dalton in 1801 and is related to the ideal gas laws.
Mathematically, the pressure of a mixture of gases can be defined as the summation
or
where represent the partial दबाव of each component.
It is assumed that the गैसों do not react with each other
where is the mole fraction of the i-th component in the कुल mixture of n components.
The relationship below provides a way to determine the volume based concentration of any individual gaseous component
where is the concentration of the i-th component expressed in ppm.
Dalton 's law is not exactly followed by real gases.
Those deviations are considerably large at high pressures.
In such conditions, the volume occupied by the molecules can become significant compared to the free space between उन्हें.
In particular, the short औसत distances between molecules उठाता the intensity of intermolecular forces between गैस molecules enough to substantially change the pressure exerted by them.
Neither of those effects are considered by the ideal gas model.
इस is a list of the largest United States colleges and universities by enrollment for colleges and विश्वविद्यालयों in the United States.
What इस list includes:
Colleges and universities within the United States
University systems if the प्रणाली is run under a single प्रशासन
Enrollment is the sum of the headcount of undergraduate and graduate students
Enrollment is counted by the Integrated Post-secondary Education System within the U.S. Department of Education.
Enrollment is the 12-month unduplicated headcount, indicating the number of unique students who attended the university दौरान the year.
What this सूची does not include:
कोई indication of how many of the enrolled students are full or part time ( e.g., कुछ universities may have a high enrollment, लकिन have most students enrolled in only a single class )
For other lists that measure university enrollment, see the See Also खण्ड below.
`` Right Round '' is a song performed by American rapper Flo Rida, released as the lead single from his second studio एल्बम, R.O.O.T.S. ( 2009 ).
the song features guest vocals from Kesha.
It was released to radio on 27 January 2009 और was digitally released on 10 फ़रवरी by Poe Boy Entertainment and Atlantic Records.
The song lyrically speaks of Flo rida 's net ball referee enthusiasm, while adapting the chorus of the 1984 Dead or Alive song `` You Spin Me Round ( Like a Record ) `` in its hook.
According to one of the song 's writers, the chorus refers to oral sex.
Kesha contributed guest vocals to the song, but in the United States, during the चलाएं atop the chart, Kesha was uncredited.
the song received mostly negative reviews from आलोचकों, who claimed it was kitsch and misogynistic.
However, it was a commercial success, reaching the top ten of the charts in nineteen countries worldwide.
In the United States, it became Flo Rida 's second number-one single और broke the record लिये first-week बिक्री when it was released to digital retailers.
The single 's accompanying music video was निर्देशित by Malcolm Jones and nominated लिये an MTV Video Music Award.
The song has been used in several movies, such as The Hangover, The Ugly Truth and the Telugu movie Pilla Zamindar.
In the movie Pitch Perfect, the song is performed by the a cappella group the Treblemakers.
The Chief इंसाफ of the United States is the head of the United States संघीय court प्रणाली ( the judicial शाखा of the संघीय government of the United States ) and the chief न्यायधीश of the Supreme Court of the United राज्य.
The Chief इंसाफ is one of nine Supreme Court justices ; the other eight are the Associate Justices of the Supreme Court of the United States.
From 1789 until 1866, the office was known as the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court.
The Chief Justice is the highest judicial officer in the देश, and acts as a chief administrative अधिकारी for the federal courts and as head of the Judicial सम्मेलन of the United States appoints the director of the Administrative Office of the संयुक्त राज्य Courts.
The Chief Justice also serves as a spokesperson for the judicial branch.
The Chief Justice leads the business of the Supreme Court.
He presides over oral arguments before the court.
जब the court renders an opinion, the Chief Justice—when in the majority—decides who writes the court 's opinion.
The Chief Justice also has significant agenda-setting power over the court 's meetings.
In the case of an impeachment of a President of the United States, which has occurred twice, the मुख्य Justice presides over the trial in the Senate.
In modern tradition, the Chief Justice has the ceremonial duty of administering the oath of office of the President of the United States.
The first Chief Justice was John Jay.
The 17th and current Chief Justice is John G. रॉबर्ट्स, Jr.

Prudhoe Bay आयल Field is a large oil field on Alaska 's North ढलान.
It is the largest oil field in both the United States and in North America, covering and originally containing approximately of oil.
The amount of recoverable oil in the field is more than double that of the अगला largest field in the United राज्य, the East Texas oil फ़ील्ड.
The field is operated by BP ; साझेदार are ExxonMobil and ConocoPhillips Alaska.
Labor unions हैं legally recognized as representatives of workers in अनेक उद्योग in the United States.
Their activity today centers on collective bargaining over wages, benefits, and working conditions लिये their membership, and on representing their members in disputes with management over violations of contract provisions.
Larger unions भी typically engage in lobbying activities and electioneering at the state and federal level.
Most unions in America are aligned with one of two larger umbrella organizations : the AFL-CIO created in 1955, and the Change to Win Federation जिससे split from the AFL-CIO in 2005.
Both advocate policies and legislation on behalf of workers in the United राज्य and Canada, और take an active भूमिका in politics.
The AFL-CIO is especially concerned with global व्यापार issues.
In 2010, the percentage of workers belonging to a संघ in the United States ( or total labor union `` density '' ) was 11.4 %, compared to 18.4 % in Germany, 27.5 % in Canada, and 70 % in Finland.
Union membership in the private sector has fallen under 7 % — स्तर not seen चूंकि 1932.
Unions allege that employer-incited opposition has contributed to this decline in membership.
The most prominent unions are among public sector employees such as teachers and police.
Members of unions are disproportionately older, male and residents of the Northeast, the Midwest, and California.
Union workers average 10-30 % higher pay than non-union in America after controlling for individual, job, and labor market characteristics.
Although much smaller compared to उनके peak membership in the 1950s, American संघ remain a prominent political factor, both through mobilization of their own memberships and through coalitions with like-minded activist organizations around मुद्दे such as immigrant अधिकारों, trade policy, health care, and living wage campaigns.
To fight alleged employer anti-union programs, unions are currently advocating new `` card check `` संघीय legislation that would require employers to bargain with a union if more than 50 % of workers signed forms, or `` cards, '' stating वे wish to be represented by that union.
The current procedure involves waiting 45 to 90 days for a federally supervised secret-ballot कर्मचारी referendum on the subject.
The economist Joseph Stiglitz has asserted that, `` Strong unions have helped to reduce असमानता, whereas weaker unions have made it easier for CEOs, sometimes working with market forces कि they have helped shape, to increase it. ''
The decline in unionization since WWII in the United राज्य has been associated with a सुनाया rise in income and wealth inequality.
A Christian Lacroix fashion boutique
a boutique is a small shopping outlet, especially one that specializes in elite and fashionable items such as कपडे और jewelry.
the word is French for `` shop '', via Latin from Greek ἀποθήκη ( apothēkē ), `` storehouse ''.
The पद entered into रोज English use in the late 1960s when, लिये a brief period, लंदन was the केन्द्र of the fashion trade.
carnaby Street and the Kings Road were the focus of much media ध्यान as home to the सबसे fashionable boutiques of the era.
Now the East of London has महरूम regenerated and more Boutiques pop up in fashionable areas, such as मीनार Bridge Road.
It can also refer to a specialised firm such as a boutique investment bank or boutique law firm.
The word is often used to describe a property in the independent section of the hotel market ( such as The Rockwell in London ) in order to distinguish themselves from larger chains ( such as Hilton Hotels ).
In such cases the establishments aim to convey the idea that the operation is elite and highly specialised.
In the strictest sense of the word, boutiques would be one-of-a-kind but more generally speaking, some chains can be referred to as boutiques if they specialize in particular styles.
Recently, the पद `` boutique '' has started being लागू to normally-mass-market items that are either niche or produced in intentionally small numbers at very high prices.
This may be referred to as boutique manufacturing.
For example, before the release of the Wii, a Time Magazine आलेख suggested that निन्टेंडो could become a `` boutique video-game company '', producing games for niche audiences, rather than trying to compete directly with Microsoft and Sony.
In the traditional luxury- watch industry Scalfaro International is considered as the precursor in manufacturing and sale of bespoke watches.
The Swiss company uses a highly flexible boutique manufacturing site, which allows producing small series or even unique timepieces.
हालांकि some boutiques specialise in hand-made items and other truly one-of-a-kind items, others simply produce t-shirts, स्टिकर, and other फ़ैशन accessories in artificially small runs and बेचें them at unusually high prices.
In the early 1990s Selena started manufacturing her own line of women 's कपडे.
Opening two boutiques labeled as `` Selena Etc. Boutique & Salon '' One located in कॉर्पस Christi and one स्तिथ in San Antonio, Texas.
One was due to open in Monterrey, Mexico, in 1995 but due to her death it was नहीं opened.
Around 1999 the सैन Antonio location closed and the Corpus Christi location was closed in 2009.
In लेट 1990s some European retail traders developed the idea of tailoring a shop towards a lifestyle theme, in the form of `` concept stores '', जिससे specialised in cross-selling without using separate departments.
एक of the first अवधारणा stores was 10 Corso Como in Milan, Italy followed by Colette in Paris and Quartier 206 in Berlin.
Several well-known American chains such as Urban Outfitters, D-A-S-H, and The Gap, ऑस्ट्रेलियाई chain billabong और, हालांकि कम common, Lord & Taylor adapted to the concept store trend after 2000.
Navy Federal Credit Union ( or Navy Federal ) is a credit union headquartered in Vienna, Virginia, chartered and regulated under the authority of the नेशनल Credit संघ Administration ( NCUA ) of the U.S. federal government.
Navy Federal is the largest प्राकृतिक member ( or retail ) credit union in the world, both in asset size और in membership.
As of September 2012, नेवी Federal had over $ 50 billion USD in assets, और over 4 million members.
Stevland Hardaway Morris ( born May 13, 1950 as Stevland Hardaway Judkins ), known by his stage नाम Stevie Wonder, is an American singer, songwriter, और multi-instrumentalist, a child prodigy who developed into one of the सबसे creative musical figures of the late 20th century.
Blind since shortly after birth, Wonder signed with Motown 's Tamla label at the आयु of eleven, and continues to perform and record for Motown to इस day.
Among Wonder 's best known works are singles such as `` Superstition ``, `` Sir Duke ``, `` You Are the Sunshine of My Life `` and `` I Just Called to Say I Love You ``.
Well known albums also include Talking Book, Innervisions and Songs in the Key of Life.
He has recorded more than thirty u.S. top ten hits and received twenty-two Grammy Awards, the most ever awarded to a male solo artist.
Wonder is also noted for his कार्य as an activist for political causes, including his 1980 campaign to make Martin Luther King, Jr. 's birthday a holiday in the United States.
In 2009, Wonder was named a United राष्ट्र Messenger of Peace.
In 2008, Billboard magazine released a list of the Hot 100 All-Time Top Artists to celebrate the US singles chart 's fiftieth anniversary, with Wonder at number five.
By popular vote, Stevie was inducted into The SoulMusic Hall of Fame at SoulMusic.com in December 2012.
Psychosis ( from the Greek ψυχή `` psyche '', for mind/soul, and -ωσις `` -osis '', for abnormal condition or derangement ) refers to an abnormal condition of the mind, and is a generic psychiatric term for a mental state often described as involving a `` loss of contact with reality ``.
People कष्ट इससे psychosis are described as psychotic.
Psychosis is given to the more severe forms of मनोरोग disorder, during which मति and delusions, gross excitement or बेहोशी and impaired insight may occur.
The term `` psychosis '' is very broad and can mean anything from अपेक्षाकृत normal aberrant experiences through to the complex and catatonic expressions of schizophrenia and bipolar type 1 disorder.
Moreover a wide variety of central बेचैन system diseases, from both external substances और internal physiologic illness, can produce symptoms of psychosis.
This led अनेक professionals to कह that मनस्ताप is नहीं specific enough as a diagnostic term.
despite this, `` psychosis '' is generally given to noticeable deficits in normal behavior ( ऋणात्मक signs ) and more commonly to विविध प्रकार of hallucinations or delusional beliefs ( e.g. grandiosity, delusions of persecution ).
Someone exhibiting very obvious signs may be described as `` frankly psychotic '', whereas one exhibiting very subtle signs could be classified in the category of an `` attenuated psychotic risk syndrome ''.
An excess in dopaminergic signalling is traditionally linked to the positive symptoms of psychosis, especially those of schizophrenia.
This is विचार to occur through a mechanism of aberrant salience of environmental stimuli.
Many antipsychotic drugs accordingly निशाना the dopamine system ; meta-analyses of placebo-controlled trials of these दवाएँ, however, show either no significant difference between drug and placebo, or a very small प्रभाव size, suggesting that the pathophysiology of psychosis is much more complex than an overactive dopamine system.
People experiencing psychosis may exhibit some personality changes and thought disorder.
Depending on its severity, this may be accompanied by unusual or bizarre बर्ताव, as well as difficulty with सोशल interaction and impairment in carrying out daily life क्रियाएँ.
General Grievous is a fictional character in the Star Wars universe.
A recurring विपक्षी, he is the परम् Commander of the Confederacy of Independent प्रणालियों, a political faction of planetary systems waging war on the Galactic Republic.
Trained in all seven forms of lightsaber combat by Count Dooku, he is a ruthless and powerful योद्धा devoted to Jedi 's destruction during the Clone Wars.
His acts of wanton aggression and high जेडी body count होता prompt the galaxy to दे him the nickname the Knightslayer.
Though the notorious Jedi slayer was the being in the galaxy दौरान the Clone Wars who had killed the most Jedi in सिंगल combat, he did not hesitate to flee from battles he knew he would lose.
Statistics play an important role in summarizing बेसबॉल performance and evaluating players in the sport.
Since the flow of a baseball game has natural ब्रेक to it, and normally players act individually rather than performing in clusters, the खेल lends itself to easy record-keeping और statistics.
Statistics have been kept for professional baseball since the creation of the National League and American League, now part of Major League Baseball.
Many statistics are also available from outside of Major लीग Baseball, from leagues such as the National Association of Professional Base Ball Players and the Negro Leagues.
Dorothea Lange 's Migrant Mother depicts destitute pea pickers in California, centering on Florence Owens Thompson, age 32, a mother of seven children, in Nipomo, California, March 1936.
यूएसए annual real GDP from 1910–60, with the years of the Great Depression ( 1929–1939 ) highlighted.
The unemployment rate in the US 1910–1960, with the years of the Great Depression ( 1929–1939 ) highlighted.
The ग्रेट Depression was a कठोर worldwide economic depression in the decade preceding संसार War II.
The timing of the Great Depression varied across nations, but in most countries it started in 1930 and lasted until the late 1930s or मध्य 1940s.
It was the longest, most widespread, and deepest depression of the 20th century.
In the 21st century, the Great Depression is commonly used as an example of how far the world 's economy can decline.
The depression originated in the U.S., after the fall in stock कीमतें that began around September 4, 1929, and became worldwide news with the stock market crash of October 29, 1929 ( known as Black Tuesday ).
The Great अवसाद had विनाशकारी प्रभाव in countries rich and poor.
Personal income, कर revenue, profits and prices dropped, while international trade plunged by more than 50 %.
Unemployment in the U.S. rose to 25 %, और in some countries rose as high as 33 %.
Cities all around the world were hit hard, especially those निर्भर on heavy industry.
Construction was virtually halted in अनेक countries.
Farming and ग्रामीण areas suffered as crop prices fell by approximately 60 %.
Facing plummeting demand with few alternate sources of jobs, areas dependent on primary sector industries such as cash cropping, mining and logging suffered the most.
Some economies started to recover by the mid-1930s.
In many countries, the negative effects of the Great Depression lasted until the end of World युद्ध II.
A premature ventricular contraction ( PVC ), also known as a premature ventricular complex, ventricular premature contraction ( or complex or देवालय ) ( VPC ), ventricular premature ताल ( VPB ), or ventricular extrasystole ( VES ), is a relatively common event where the heartbeat is initiated by purkinje fibres in the ventricles बल्कि than by the sinoatrial node, the normal heartbeat initiator.
The electrical events of the heart detected by the electrocardiogram allow a PVC to be easily distinguished from a normal heart beat.
A PVC may be perceived as a `` skipped beat `` or felt as palpitations in the chest.
In a normal heartbeat, the ventricles contract after the atria have helped to fill them by contracting ; in this way the ventricles can pump a maximized amount of blood both to the lungs and to the rest of the body.
In a PVC, the ventricles contract first and before the atria have optimally filled the ventricles with blood, which means that circulation is inefficient.
However, single ताल PVC arrhythmias do not प्रायः pose a danger and can be asymptomatic in स्वस्थ individuals.
William Gary Busey ( born June 29, 1944 ), better known as Gary Busey, is an American film and stage actor, and artist.
He has appeared in a variety of films, including Lethal Weapon, Point Break, और Under Siege, as well as guest appearances on Gunsmoke, Walker, Texas Ranger, Law & Order, and Entourage.
He was nominated लिये an Academy Award for Best Actor in 1978 for his role in The Buddy होली Story.
The Anti-Counterfeiting Trade Agreement ( ACTA ), is a multinational treaty for the purpose of establishing international standards for intellectual property rights enforcement.
The agreement aims to establish an अंतरराष्ट्रीय legal framework लिये targeting counterfeit goods, generic medicines and copyright infringement on the अंतरजाल, and would बनाएँ a new governing देह outside मौजूदा forums, such as the World Trade संगठन, the World Intellectual Property Organization, or the United राष्ट्र.
The agreement was signed in अक्तूबर 2011 by Australia, Canada, Japan, Morocco, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea, and the United States.
In 2012, Mexico, the European Union and 22 countries which are सदस्य states of the European Union signed as well.
One signatory ( Japan ) has ratified ( formally approved ) the agreement, which would come into force in countries that ratified it after ratification by six countries.
Supporters have described the agreement as a response to `` the increase in global trade of counterfeit goods and pirated कापीराइट protected works ''.
ट्रेड Unions representing workers in the music, film and TV उद्योग and large intellectual property-based organizations such as the Motion Picture Association of America and Pharmaceutical Research और Manufacturers of America were active in the treaty 's development.
Opponents say the convention adversely affects fundamental rights including freedom of expression and privacy.
ACTA has also been criticised by Doctors Without Borders for endangering access to medicines in developing countries.
The secret nature of negotiations has excluded सिविल society groups, developing countries and the general public from the agreement 's negotiation process and it रै been described as policy laundering by critics सहित the Electronic Frontier Foundation and the Entertainment Consumers Association.
The signature of the EU and many of its member राज्य resulted in the resignation in protest of the European Parliament 's appointed chief अन्वेषक, rapporteur Kader Arif, as well as widespread protests across Europe.
in 2012 the newly-appointed rapporteur, अंग्रेजों MEP David Martin, recommended against the treaty, stating : `` The intended benefits of this international agreement are far outweighed by the potential threats to civil liberties ''.
On 4 July 2012, the European Parliament rejected the agreement in plenary session, with 478 voting against the सन्धि, 39 in favour and 165 MEPs abstaining.

A semi-trailer truck is an articulated vehicle that consists of a towing engine, known as a tractor in the United राज्य and truck in many other places, attached to one or more semi-trailers to carry freight.
It is also known as a हस्तांतरण in Canada, prime mover in Australia, semi, tractor-trailer, truck और trailer, ट्रांसफ़र truck, 18-wheeler, mack truck, big rig in the United States, or artic, short for articulated lorry, in Britain and आयरलैंड.
A semi-trailer करता not trail completely behind the towing vehicle, लकिन is attached at a point that is just forward of the rear-most axle of the towing unit.
This is done so that a fraction of the weight of the trailer is carried by the prime mover.
This arrangement means that both tractor and semi-trailer will have a distinctly different design than a rigid ट्रक and trailer.
The Pittsburgh Steelers are a professional फ़ुटबॉल team based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
The team currently belongs to the North Division of the American Football Conference ( afc ) in the National Football League ( NFL ).
Founded in, the Steelers are the oldest franchise in the AFC.
पिट्सबर्ग has won more Super कटोरी titles ( six ), won more AFC Championship Games ( eight ) and played in ( fifteen ) and hosted more ( ग्यारह ) conference championship games than any other AFC or NFC team.
The Steelers share the record लिये सबसे Super Bowl appearances with the Dallas Cowboys ( eight ).
The Steelers जीती their most recent championship, Super Bowl XLIII, on फ़रवरी 1, 2009.
The Steelers were founded as the Pittsburgh Pirates on July 8, 1933, by Art Rooney, taking its original name from the baseball team of the same name, as was common practice for NFL teams to do at the time.
The ownership of the Steelers has remained within the रूनी family चूंकि its founding.
The current owner is Art 's son, Dan Rooney, जो रै given much control of the मताधिकार to his son आर्ट Rooney II.
Long one of the NFL 's flagship teams, the Steelers enjoy a large, widespread fanbase nicknamed Steeler Nation.
The Steelers currently play their home games at Heinz Field on Pittsburgh 's North Side in the North shore neighborhood, which also hosts the University of Pittsburgh Panthers.
Built in 2001, the stadium replaced Three Rivers Stadium which hosted the Steelers for 31 सीज़न.
prior to Three Rivers, the Steelers had निभाई their games in Pitt Stadium and फोर्ब्स Field.
तीन different kinds of wheat and rye flour
Flour is a powder जिससे is made by grinding cereal grains, or other seeds or roots ( like Cassava ).
It is the main ingredient of bread, which is a staple food for many cultures, making the availability of adequate supplies of flour a major economic and राजनैतिक issue at विभिन्न times throughout history.
Wheat flour is one of the most important foods in European, North American, Middle Eastern, Indian और North African cultures, and is the defining ingredient in सबसे of their styles of breads and pastries.
While wheat is the सबसे common base for flour, corn flour has been important in Mesoamerican cuisine since प्राचीन times, and remains a staple throughout the Americas.
Rye flour is an important constituent of bread in much of central Europe, and राइस can also be used in flour, though this is relatively uncommon.
Heart rate is the number of heartbeats per unit of time, typically expressed as beats per minute ( bpm ).
Heart rate can vary as the body 's need to absorb oxygen and excrete carbon डाइऑक्साइड changes, such as during physical कसरत, sleep, illness, or as a परिणाम of ingesting drugs :
Central nervous system stimulants such as amphetamines increase heart rate.
सेंट्रल बेचैन system depressants or sedatives decreases the heart rate ( apart from कुछ particularly strange ones with equally strange effects, such as ketamine which can cause - amongst many other things - stimulant-like effects such as tachycardia ).
वहीँ are many ways in which the heart rate speeds up or slows down.
Most involve stimulant-like endorphins and hormones being released in the brain, many of which are those that are 'forced'/'enticed ' out by the ingestion and processing of drugs.
Due to individuals having a constant blood volume, one of the physiological ways to deliver more oxygen to an organ is to increase heart rate to permit blood to pass by the organ more often.
Normal resting heart rates range from 60-100 bpm.
Bradycardia is defined as a resting heart rate below 60 bpm.
However, heart rates from 50 to 60 bpm are common among healthy people and do not necessarily require special attention.
Tachycardia is defined as a resting heart रेट above 100 bpm, हालांकि persistent rest rates between 80-100 bpm, mainly if they are present during sleep, may be signs of hyperthyroidism or anemia ( see below ).
Catherine II 's carved, painted and gilded Coronation Coach ( Hermitage Museum )
A carriage is a wheeled vehicle for people, usually horse-drawn ; litters ( palanquins ) and sedan chairs हैं excluded, since they are wheelless vehicles.
The carriage is especially designed for private passenger use and for comfort or लालित्य, though some are also used to transport goods.
it may be light, smart and fast or heavy, large and comfortable.
Carriages normally have suspension using leaf springs, elliptical springs ( in the 19th century ) or leather strapping.
A public passenger vehicle would not usually be called a carriage – terms for such include stagecoach, charabanc and omnibus.
Working vehicles such as the ( four-wheeled ) wagon and ( two-wheeled ) cart share important parts of the history of the carriage, as is the fast ( two-wheeled ) chariot.
The 2004 Indian Ocean भूकंप was an undersea megathrust earthquake that occurred at 00:58:53 UTC on Sunday, 26 December 2004, with an epicentre off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia.
the quake itself is known by the scientific जातियाँ as the Sumatra–Andaman earthquake.
The resulting tsunami was given various names, including the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami, South Asian tsunami, Indonesian tsunami, and the Boxing Day tsunami.
The earthquake was caused by subduction and triggered a series of devastating tsunamis along the coasts of most landmasses bordering the Indian Ocean, killing over 230,000 people in fourteen countries, and inundating coastal communities with waves up to high.
It was एक of the deadliest natural disasters in recorded history.
Indonesia was the hardest-hit country, followed by Sri Lanka, India, and Thailand.
साथ a magnitude of Mw 9.1–9.3, it is the third largest earthquake ever recorded on a seismograph.
the earthquake था the longest duration of faulting ever observed, between 8.3 and 10 minutes.
It caused the entire planet to हिलना as much as and triggered other earthquakes as far away as Alaska.
Its epicentre was between Simeulue and mainland Indonesia.
The plight of the affected people and countries prompted a विश्वव्यापी humanitarian response.
in all, the worldwide community donated more than $ 14 billion ( 2004 US $ ) in humanitarian aid.
Steam rising from the Nesjavellir Geothermal Power Station in Iceland.
Geothermal energy is thermal energy generated और stored in the Earth.
थर्मल energy is the energy that determines the temperature of matter.
The Geothermal energy of the धरती 's crust originates from the original formation of the planet ( 20 % ) and from radioactive decay of minerals ( 80 % ).
The geothermal gradient, which is the difference in तापमान between the core of the ग्रह and its surface, drives a continuous conduction of थर्मल उर्जा in the form of heat from the core to the surface.
The adjective geothermal originates इससे the Greek roots γη ( ge ), meaning earth, and θερμος ( thermos ), meaning hot.
At the core of the धरती, थर्मल energy is created by radioactive decay and temperatures may reach over 5000 °C ( 9,000 °F ).
ऊष्मा conducts from the core to surrounding cooler rock.
The high temperature and pressure cause some rock to melt, creating magma convection upward since it is lighter than the solid rock.
The magma heats rock and water in the crust, sometimes up to 370 °C ( 700 °F ).
From hot springs, geothermal energy has been used for bathing since Paleolithic times and for space heating since प्राचीन Roman टाइम्स, but it is अभी better known for electricity generation.
Worldwide, about 10,715 megawatts ( MW ) of geothermal power is online in 24 countries.
an additional 28 gigawatts of direct geothermal heating capacity is installed for district heating, space heating, spas, industrial processes, desalination and agricultural applications.
Geothermal power is cost effective, reliable, sustainable, and environmentally friendly, but has historically been limited to areas near tectonic plate सीमाएँ.
हाल technological advances have dramatically expanded the range and size of viable संसाधन, especially for applications such as home heating, opening a potential for widespread exploitation.
Geothermal wells release greenhouse gases trapped deep within the धरती, but these emissions are much lower per energy unit than those of fossil fuels.
As a result, geothermal power has the potential to help mitigate global warming if widely deployed in place of fossil fuels.
the Earth 's geothermal resources are theoretically more than adequate to supply humanity 's energy needs, but only a very small fraction may be profitably exploited.
Drilling and exploration for गहन resources is very expensive.
Forecasts for the future of geothermal power depend on assumptions about technology, energy कीमतें, subsidies, and interest rates.
Pilot programs like EWEB 's customer opt in Green Power कार्यक्रम show that customers would be willing to pay a little अधिक लिये a renewable energy source like geothermal.
But as a result of government assisted research and industry experience, the cost of generating geothermal power has decreased by 25 % over the past two decades.
In 2001, geothermal energy cost between two and ten cents per kwh.
The term cubic foot is an Imperial and US customary ( non- metric ) ईकाई of volume, used in the संयुक्त States and the United Kingdom.
It is defined as the volume of a cube with sides of one foot ( 0.3048 m ) in length.
To calculate cubic feet गुणा length X width X height.
Hồ Chí Minh ( उत्तरी Vietnamese pronunciation :, Southern Vietnamese pronunciation : ) ; 19 May 1890 – 2 September 1969 ), born Nguyễn Sinh Cung and also known as Nguyễn Tất Thành and Nguyễn Ái Quốc, was a Vietnamese communist revolutionary leader who was prime minister ( 1945–1955 ) and president ( 1945–1969 ) of the Democratic Republic of Vietnam ( North Vietnam ).
He was a key figure in the foundation of the Democratic Republic of वियतनाम in 1945, as well as the People’s Army of Vietnam ( PAVN ) and the việt Cộng ( NLF or VC ) during the Vietnam War.
He led the Việt मिन्ह independence movement from 1941 onward, establishing the communist -ruled Democratic Republic of Vietnam in 1945 और defeating the फ्रेंच Union in 1954 at the battle of Điện Biên Phủ.
He officially stepped down from power in 1955 due to health problems, but remained a highly visible figurehead and inspiration for those वियतनामी लड़ for his cause—a united, कम्युनिस्ट Vietnam—until his death.
बाद the युद्ध, Saigon, capital of the Republic of Vietnam, थी renamed Hồ Chí Minh City.
All Roads Lead Home is a feature film released on September 26, 2008.
Directed by Dennis Fallon, it stars पीटर Boyle, Patton oswalt, Jason London, Vivien Cardone, Vanessa Branch, Peter Coyote, Stephen Milton, and Allan Kayser.
The movie was filmed in and around Kansas City, Missouri.
The movie made its World Premiere January 27 at the Santa Barbara International Film Festival.
The film has also recently been in several film festivals, and has received bad reviews.
Peter बॉयल died before the movie 's release.
It was the last movie he appeared in.
Sales taxes in the United States हैं taxes placed on the sale or पट्टे of goods and services in the United States.
While no national general sales tax exists, the federal government levies several national selective sales taxes on the sale or lease of particular goods and services.
Furthermore, forty-five states, the District of Columbia, and Guam impose general sales taxes that apply to the बिक्री or lease of सबसे goods and some services, and states also may levy selective sales taxes on the sale or lease of particular goods or services.
States may also delegate to local governments the authority to impose additional general or selective sales taxes.
Sales tax is calculated by multiplying the purchase price by the applicable कर rate.
Tax rates vary widely by jurisdiction and range from less than 1 % to over 10 %.
Sales tax is एकत्रित by the seller at the time of sale.
Use tax is self assessed by a buyer who has not paid sales tax on a taxable purchase.
Unlike the value added tax, a sales tax is imposed only once, at the retail level.
However, in cases where items are sold at retail more than once, such as प्रयुक्त गाड़ियाँ, the sales tax can be charged on the same item indefinitely.
the definition of retail sales and what goods and services are taxable vary among the states.
Nearly all jurisdictions provide numerous categories of goods और services that are exempt from sales कर, or taxed at reduced rates.
The purchase of goods for further manufacture or लिये पुनर्विक्रय is uniformly exempt from बिक्री tax.
Most jurisdictions exempt food sold in grocery स्टोर्स, prescription medications, और many agricultural supplies.
Sales taxes, including those imposed by local governments, are generally administered at the state level.
States imposing sales tax आवश्यकता retail sellers to collect tax इससे customers, file returns, and remit the कर to the state.
Procedural rules vary widely.
Sellers generally must collect tax from in-state purchasers unless the purchaser provides an exemption certificate.
Most राज्य allow or require electronic remittance.
A central processing ईकाई ( CPU ), also referred to as a central processor unit, is the hardware within a computer that carries out the instructions of a computer program by performing the basic arithmetical, लॉजिकल, and input/output operations of the system.
The term has been in use in the computer उद्योग at least since the early 1960s.
the form, design, and implementation of CPUs have changed over the course of their इतिहास, but उनके fundamental operation remains much the वही.
A computer can have अधिक than one CPU ; this is called multiprocessing.
Some integrated circuits ( ICs ) can contain multiple CPUs on a single chip ; those ICs are called multi-core processors.
Two ठेठ components of a CPU are the arithmetic logic unit ( ALU ), which performs arithmetic and logical operations, and the control ईकाई ( CU ), which extracts instructions from memory and decodes and executes them, calling on the alu when necessary.
Not all computational systems rely on a central processing unit.
An array processor or vector processor has multiple parallel computing elements, with no one unit considered the `` बीच ''.
in the distributed computing model, problems are solved by a distributed interconnected set of processors.
RFID chip अगला to a grain of rice.
This chip contains a radio-frequency electromagnetic field coil that modulates an बाह्य magnetic field to transfer a coded identification number when queried by a reader यंत्र.
This small type is incorporated in consumer products, और implanted in pets, for identification purposes.
Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) is the wireless non-contact use of radio-frequency electromagnetic फ़ील्ड to transfer data, for the purposes of automatically identifying और tracking tags attached to objects.
The tags contain electronically stored information.
Some tags हैं powered and read at short ranges ( a few meters ) via magnetic fields ( electromagnetic induction ).
Others use a local power source such as a बैटरी, or else have no battery but collect energy from the interrogating EM field, and then act as a passive transponder to emit microwaves or UHF radio waves ( i.e., electromagnetic radiation at high frequencies ).
Battery powered टैग may operate at hundreds of meters.
Unlike a bar code, the tag does not necessarily need to be within line of sight of the reader, and may be embedded in the tracked object.
RFID tags are प्रयुक्त in many industries.
An RFID tag attached to an automobile दौरान production can be used to track its progress through the assembly line.
Pharmaceuticals can be tracked through warehouses.
Livestock and pets may have tags injected, allowing धनात्मक identification of the animal.
Since RFID tags can be attached to clothing, possessions, or even implanted within लोगों, the possibility of reading personally-linked information without consent has raised privacy concerns.
Overtime is the amount of time someone works beyond normal working hours.
Normal hours may be determined in several ways:
by custom ( what is माना healthy or reasonable by समाज ),
by practices of a given trade or profession,
by legislation,
by agreement between employers and workers or their representatives.
Most nations have overtime labor laws designed to dissuade or prevent employers from forcing their employees to work excessively long hours.
These laws may take into account other considerations than the humanitarian, such as preserving the health of workers so that they may continue to be productive, or increasing the overall level of नियुक्ति in the economy.
One common approach to regulating overtime is to require employers to pay workers at a higher hourly rate for overtime work.
Companies may choose to pay workers higher overtime pay even if not obliged to do so by law, विशेषकर if they believe that they face a backward bending supply curve of श्रमिक.
Overtime pay rates can cause workers to work longer hours than they would at a flat hourly रेट.
Overtime laws, attitudes toward overtime and hours of work vary greatly from देश to country और between different economic sectors.
Visualization of links between pages on a wiki using a force-directed layout.
Force-directed graph drawing algorithms are a class of algorithms for drawing graphs in an aesthetically pleasing way.
Their purpose is to position the nodes of a आलेख in two-dimensional or three-dimensional स्पेस so that all the edges are of अधिक or less equal length and वहीँ are as few crossing edges as possible, by assigning forces among the set of edges and the set of nodes, based on their relative positions, and तब using these forces either to simulate the motion of the edges and nodes or to minimize their energy.
While graph drawing can be a difficult problem, force-directed algorithms, being physical simulations, usually require no special knowledge about graph theory such as planarity.
Purchasing power ( sometimes retroactively called adjusted for inflation ) is the राशि of goods or services that can be purchased with a unit of currency.
For example, if you had taken one dollar to a store in the 1950s, तुम होता have been able to buy a greater number of items than you होता आज, indicating that you would have had a greater purchasing power in the 1950s.
करेंसी can be either a commodity धन, like सुनहरा or silver, or fiat currency, or free-floating market-valued currency like US dollars.
As Adam Smith noted, having money देता one the ability to `` command '' others ' labor, so purchasing power to some extent is power over other people, to the extent that they are willing to व्यापार their labor or goods for money or currency.
If one 's monetary income stays the same, but the price स्तर increases, the purchasing power of कि income falls.
Inflation does not सदा imply falling purchasing power of one 's money income since it may rise faster than the price level.
A उच्चतर real income means a higher purchasing power since real income refers to the income adjusted लिये inflation.
For a price index, its value in the base year is usually normalized to a value of 100.
The purchasing power of a unit of currency, say a dollar, in a given year, expressed in डॉलर of the base year, is 100/P, where P is the price index in that year.
So, by definition the purchasing power of a dollar decreases as the price level उदय.
The purchasing power in today 's money of an amount C of धन, t years into the future, can be computed with the सूत्र for the present value :
where in this case i is an assumed future annual inflation rate.
Education in South Korea is viewed as being crucial for success और competition is consequently very heated and fierce.
A central administration oversees the प्रक्रम for the शिक्षा of children from kindergarten to the third and final year of high school.
गणित, science, कोरियाई, English, and social studies are generally considered to be the most important subjects.
Normally physical शिक्षा is नहीं considered महत्वपूर्ण as it is not recognised, by the generally academic elitist South Korean populace, as education और therefore many schools lack high-quality gymnasiums and varsity athletics.
South Korea was the first country in the संसार to provide high-speed internet अभिगम to all primary, junior, and high schools.
Although South Korean students often rank highly on international comparative assessments जब compared to students of most पश्चिमी education systems, the South Korean शिक्षा system is criticised for emphasising too much upon passive learning and memorisation.
The South Korean education system is rather notably सख्त and overly structured as compared to its counterparts in most पश्चिमी societies.
Also, the prevalence of non-school for-profit private institutes such as academies or cram-schools ( Hagwon [ 학원 ] ), which too emphasise on passive memorisation, as opposed to conceptual understanding, in students are criticised as a major social problem.
The My Lai Massacre (, ;,, or ) was the Vietnam War mass murder of between 347 and 504 unarmed civilians in South Vietnam on March 16, 1968, by United States Army soldiers of `` Charlie '' Company of 1st Battalion, 20th Infantry Regiment, 11th Brigade of the Americal Division.
Victims included women, मेन, children, and infants.
Some of the women यहूद gang-raped and their bodies were later found to be mutilated and many women were allegedly raped prior to the killings.
While 26 U.S. soldiers were initially charged with criminal offenses for their actions at mỹ Lai, only Second Lieutenant William Calley, a platoon leader in Charlie Company, was convicted.
Found अपराधी of killing 22 villagers, he थी originally given a जीवन sentence, but only served three and a half सालो under house arrest.
The massacre took place in the hamlets of My Lai and My Khe of Son My village.
The event is also ज्ञात as the Son My Massacre, especially in the Vietnamese state media.
The U.S. military codeword for the `` Viet Cong stronghold '' was `` Pinkville ''.
The incident prompted global outrage when it became public knowledge in 1969.
The नरसंहार भी increased घरेलू opposition to the u.S. भागीदारी in the Vietnam War.
Three U.S. servicemen who had tried to halt the massacre and protect the wounded were initially denounced by several U.S. Congressmen as traitors.
They received hate mail और death threats and found mutilated animals on their doorsteps.
The three were later widely praised and decorated by the Army for their heroic actions.
The hijackers in the September 11 attacks were 19 men affiliated with al-Qaeda, and 15 of the 19 यहूद citizens of Saudi Arabia.
Others were from Egypt, Lebanon, and the UAE.
The hijackers were organized into four teams, each led by a pilot-trained hijacker with four `` muscle hijackers '' who were trained to help subdue the pilots, passengers, and crew.
The first hijackers to arrive in the संयुक्त States were Khalid al-Mihdhar and Nawaf al-Hazmi, who settled in the San Diego क्षेत्रफल in January 2000.
They were followed by three hijacker-pilots, Mohamed Atta, Marwan al-Shehhi, and Ziad Jarrah early in the summer of 2000 to undertake flight training in south Florida.
The fourth hijacker-pilot, Hani Hanjour, arrived in San Diego in December 2000.
The rest of the `` muscle hijackers '' arrived in the spring and early summer of 2001, just months before the September 11 attacks.
Abū al-Qāsim Muḥammad ibn ʿAbd Allāh इब्न ʿAbd al-Muṭṭalib ibn Hāshim ( ) ( circa| 570 – circa| 8 June 632 ), also transliterated as Muhammad ( ), was a religious, political, and military leader from Mecca who unified Arabia into a single religious polity under Islam.
He is believed by Muslims and Bahá'ís to be a messenger और prophet of God.
Muhammad is almost universally considered by Muslims as the last prophet sent by God for mankind.
Non-Muslims regard Muhammad as the founder of islam.
Muslims consider him to be the restorer of an unaltered original monotheistic faith of Adam, Noah, Abraham, Moses, यीशु, and other prophets.
Born in about 570 CE in the Arabian नगर of Mecca, he was orphaned at an जल्दी age and brought up under the care of his uncle Abu Talib.
He later worked ज़्यादातर as a merchant, as well as a shepherd, and was first शादीशुदा by age 25.
Being in the habit of periodically retreating to a cave in the surrounding mountains for several nights of seclusion and prayer, he later reported that it was there, at age 40, that he received his first revelation from God.
Three years after this event Muhammad started preaching these revelations publicly, proclaiming that `` God is एक ``, that पूरा `` आत्मसमर्पण '' to Him ( lit.
islām ) is the only way ( dīn ) acceptable to God, and कि he himself थी a prophet and messenger of God, in the वही vein as other Islamic prophets.
Muhammad gained few followers early on, और was met with hostility from कुछ Meccan tribes ; he and his followers were treated harshly.
to एस्केप persecution, मुहम्मद भेजा some of उसके followers to अबीसीनिया पहले he and his followers in Mecca migrated to Medina ( then ज्ञात as Yathrib ) in the year 622.
This event, the हिज्र, marks the beginning of the Islamic पंचांग, which is also known as the Hijri Calendar.
In Medina, Muhammad united the tribes under the Constitution of Medina.
After eight years of fighting with the Meccan tribes, his followers, who by then had grown to 10,000, took control of Mecca in the largely peaceful conquest of Mecca.
He destroyed the pagan idols in the city and then sent his followers out to destroy सब of the remaining pagan temples in Eastern Arabia.
In 632, a few months after returning to Medina इससे The Farewell Pilgrimage, Muhammad fell ill and died.
By the time of his death, most of the Arabian Peninsula had converted to Islam, and he had united Arabia into a single मुस्लिम religious polity.
The revelations ( or Ayah, lit.
`` Signs [ of God ] '' ) — which Muhammad reported receiving until his death – form the verses of the Quran, regarded by Muslims as the `` Word of God '' और around which the religion is based.
besides the Quran, Muhammad 's life ( sira ) and traditions ( सुन्नत ) are भी upheld by Muslims as the sources of sharia law.
They discuss Muhammad and अन्य prophets of Islam with reverence, adding the phrase peace be upon him whenever their names are mentioned.
While conceptions of Muhammad in medieval Christendom and premodern times were largely negative, appraisals in modern history have been far less so.
This is a list of tables of the verified oldest people in the world in ordinal rank, such as oldest person or oldest man.
In these tables, a supercentenarian is considered 'verified ' if his or उसके claim has been validated by an international body that specifically deals in longevity research, such as the Gerontology Research Group ( grg ) or Guinness World Records.
the longest unambiguously documented human lifespan is that of Jeanne Calment of फ़्रांस ( 1875–1997 ), who died at age 122 years, 164 days.
She मिले Vincent van Gogh when she was 12 or 13.
This led to news media attention in 1985, after Calment turned 110.
Subsequent छानबीन found documentation for Calment 's age, परे any reasonable question, in the records of her native city, Arles, France.
More प्रमाण of Calment 's lifespan has been produced than for any other supercentenarian ; उसके case serves as an archetype in the methodology for verifying the ages of the world 's oldest people.
The longest undisputed lifespan लिये male supercentenarians is that of jiroemon Kimura, who currently lives in Japan and is age as of.
Since the death of 115-year old Dina Manfredini of the United States, on 17 December 2012, Kimura, born 19 April 1897, is the oldest living व्यक्ति in the world whose age can be documented.
He रै also been the oldest living man since the death of 114-year old Walter Breuning on 14 April 2011.
Since the death of 115-year old Koto okubo of Japan on 12 जनवरी 2013, the oldest living woman has महरूम -year-old Misao Okawa, also from Japan, born on 5 March 1898.
This is a timeline of the African-American सिविल Rights Movement.
The Civil Rights movement was a freedom struggle by African Americans in the 1950s and 1960s to gain equality.
The goals of the movement were freedom from discrimination, equal opportunity in employment, education and आवास, the right to vote and equal अभिगम to public facilities.
Heavy metal ( often referred to as metal ) is a genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s, largely in the United Kingdom and in the United States.
With roots in blues rock and psychedelic rock, the bands that created heavy metal developed a thick, massive sound, characterized by highly amplified distortion, extended guitar solos, emphatic beats, and overall loudness.
Heavy metal lyrics and performance styles are generally associated with masculinity and machismo.
The first heavy metal bands such as Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple and Black Sabbath attracted large audiences, though they were often derided by critics, a औकात common throughout the history of the genre.
in the mid-1970s Judas Priest helped spur the genre 's evolution by discarding much of its blues influence ; Motörhead introduced a punk rock sensibility and an increasing emphasis on speed.
Bands in the New Wave of British Heavy Metal ऐसे as Iron Maiden followed in a similar vein.
Before the end of the decade, heavy metal प्रशंसक became known as `` metalheads `` or `` headbangers ``.
During the 1980s, glam मेटल became a commercial force with groups like Mötley Crüe and ज़हर.
Underground scenes produced an array of अधिक extreme, aggressive styles : thrash metal broke into the mainstream with bands such as Metallica, Megadeth, Slayer, and Anthrax, while अन्य styles of the most extreme subgenres of metal like death metal and black metal remain subcultural phenomena.
Since the mid-1990s, popular styles such as nu metal, which often incorporates elements of grunge and hip hop ; and metalcore, which blends extreme metal साथ hardcore punk, have further expanded the definition of the genre.
The far-right ( also known as the extreme right ) refers to the highest degree of rightism in right-wing politics.
Far right politics involves support of strong or complete social पदानुक्रम in society, and supports supremacy of certain individuals or groups deemed to be innately superior or preferable who are to be अधिक valued than those deemed to be innately inferior or undesirable.
the far right 's advocacy of supremacism is based on what its adherents perceive as innate characteristics of people that can not be changed.
This stands as a point of difference साथ the centre-right 's attribution of behaviours, ऐसे as laziness or decadence, as the primary sources of social inequalities.
The centre right—unlike the far right—claims that people can end their behavioural inferiority through changing their habits and choices.
The original far right, which emerged in France बाद the फ्रेंच Revolution, refused to accept the French Republic and supported a counter-revolution to restore the French monarchy and aristocracy.
The far सही is commonly संबद्ध with persons or groups who थाम extreme nationalist, xenophobic, racist, religious fundamentalist or reactionary views.
The most extreme-right movements have pursued oppression and genocide against groups of people on the basis of their alleged हीनता.
Thomas Hobbes of Malmesbury ( 5 April 1588 – 4 December 1679 ), in some older texts Thomas Hobbs of Malmsbury, was an English philosopher, best ज्ञात today for his work on political philosophy.
His 1651 book Leviathan established the foundation लिये most of Western political philosophy from the परिप्रेक्ष्य of social contract theory.
Hobbes was a champion of absolutism for the sovereign, but he also developed some of the fundamentals of European liberal thought : the right of the individual ; the natural equality of all men ; the artificial अक्षर of the political order ( which led to the later distinction between civil society and the state ) ; the view कि all legitimate राजनैतिक power must be `` representative '' और based on the consent of the people ; and a liberal interpretation of law which leaves people free to do whatever the law does not explicitly forbid.
He was one of the founders of modern political philosophy.
उसके understanding of humans as होने matter और motion, obeying the same physical laws as other matter और motion, remains influential ; and his account of human nature as self-interested cooperation, and of political communities as being based upon a `` social contract `` remains one of the major topics of political philosophy.
In addition to राजनैतिक दर्शनशास्त्र, Hobbes also contributed to a diverse array of other fields, including history, geometry, the physics of gases, theology, ethics, and general philosophy.
Emotional intelligence ( EI ) is the क्षमता to पहचानो, assess, and control the emotions of oneself, of others, and of groups.
It can be divided into ability EI and trait EI.
Ability EI is usually measured using maximum performance tests and has stronger relationships with traditional intelligence, whereas trait EI is usually measured using self-report questionnaires and has stronger relationships with personality.
Criticisms have केन्द्रित on whether EI is a रियल intelligence and whether it has incremental validity over iq और the Big Five personality traits.
Heredity is the passing of traits to offspring from its parents or ancestor.
इस is the process by which an offspring cell or organism acquires or becomes predisposed to the characteristics of its parent cell or organism.
Through heredity, variations exhibited by individuals can accumulate और cause some species to evolve.
The study of heredity in biology is called genetics, which includes the field of epigenetics.
For United States individual income tax, adjusted gross income ( AGI ) is total gross income ऋण specific reductions.
Taxable income is adjusted gross income minus allowances for personal exemptions and itemized deductions.
For most individual tax purposes, AGI is more प्रासंगिक than सकल income.
Gross income is sales price of goods or प्रॉपर्टी, minus cost of the property sold, plus other income.
It includes wages, interest, dividends, कारोबार income, rental income, and all other प्रकार of income.
Adjusted gross income is gross income less deductions from a business or rental activity and 21 other specific items.
Several deductions ( e.g. medical expenses and miscellaneous itemized deductions ) are limited based on a percentage of AGI.
Certain phase outs, including those of निम्नतर tax rates and itemized deductions, are based on levels of AGI.
Many states base state income tax on AGI with certain deductions.
