Freedom Summer ( also ज्ञात as the मिसिसिपी Summer Project ) was a campaign in the संयुक्त States शुभारम्भ in June 1964 to attempt to register as many अफ़्रीकी American voters as possible in Mississippi, जिससे had historically excluded most blacks from मतदान.
The project also set up dozens of Freedom स्कूलों, Freedom Houses, and community centers in small towns throughout Mississippi to aid the local black population.
The project was organized by the Council of Federated Organizations ( COFO ), a coalition of the मिसिसिपी branches of the four major civil अधिकारों organizations ( SNCC, CORE, NAACP and SCLC ).
Most of the impetus, leadership, and financing for the Summer Project came from the SNCC.
Robert Parris Moses, SNCC field secretary and co-director of COFO, directed the summer project.
Blues is the name given to both a musical form and a music genre that originated in communities of primarily the `` Deep South `` of the United States around the end of the 19th century from spirituals, work songs, field hollers, shouts and chants, and rhymed simple narrative ballads.
The blues form, ubiquitous in jazz, rhythm and blues, and rock and roll is characterized by specific chord progressions, of which the twelve-bar blues chord progression is the most common.
The blue notes that, for expressive purposes are sung or played flattened or gradually bent ( minor 3rd to major 3rd ) in relation to the pitch of the major scale, are also an important part of the sound.
the blues genre is based on the blues रूप but possesses other characteristics such as specific lyrics, bass lines, और instruments.
Blues can be subdivided into several subgenres ranging इससे country to urban blues that were more or कम popular during अलग periods of the 20th century.
Best known are the Delta, Piedmont, Jump, and Chicago blues styles.
World War II marked the transition from ध्वनिक to electric blues and the progressive opening of blues music to a wider audience, especially white listeners.
In the 1960s and 1970s, a hybrid रूप called blues-rock evolved.
The पद `` the blues '' refers to the `` blue devils '', meaning melancholy and sadness ; an early use of the term in this sense is मिला in जार्ज Colman 's one-act farce Blue Devils ( 1798 ).
Though the use of the phrase in African-American music may be older, it has been attested to since 1912, जब Hart Wand 's `` Dallas Blues `` became the first copyrighted blues composition.
In lyrics the phrase is often used to describe a depressed mood.
A quarter डालर, commonly shortened to quarter, is a coin worth 1⁄4 of a United States dollar or 25 cents.
the quarter has been produced चूंकि 1796.
The choice of 25¢ as a denomination, as opposed to 20¢ which is more common in other parts of the world, originated with the practice of dividing Spanish Milled Dollars into eight wedge shaped खण्ड ( cf. `` pieces of eight `` ).
At एक time `` two बिट्स ``, i.e. दो wedges, each कील an eighth, thus a quarter of the Spanish real, was a common nickname for a quarter.
Day of the Dead ( ) is a Mexican holiday celebrated throughout Mexico and around the world in other cultures.
The holiday focuses on महफिलों of family and friends to pray for and remember मित्रों and family members who have died.
It is particularly celebrated in Mexico, where it is a national holiday, and all banks are closed.
The celebration takes place on November 1 and 2, in connection with the Catholic holidays of All Saints ' Day and सब Souls ' Day.
Traditions connected with the holiday include building private altars honoring the deceased using sugar skulls, marigolds, and the favorite भोजन and beverages of the रजि और visiting graves with these as gifts.
वे also leave possessions of the deceased.
Scholars trace the origins of the modern मैक्सिकन holiday to indigenous observances डेटिंग वापस सैंकड़ों of years and to an Aztec festival dedicated to the goddess Mictecacihuatl.
The holiday has spread throughout the world : In ब्राज़ील, Dia de Finados is a public holiday that many Brazilians celebrate by visiting कब्रिस्तान and churches.
in Spain, there are त्यौहार and parades, and, at the end of the day, people gather at cemeteries and pray for their dead loved ones.
Similar observances occur elsewhere in Europe, and similarly themed celebrations appear in many Asian and African cultures.
ANITA Mk viii.
The अनीता Mark VII and ANITA चिह्नित viii calculators were launched simultaneously in late 1961 as the world 's first all- इलेक्ट्रॉनिक desktop calculators.
Designed and built by the Bell Punch co.
in Britain, and marketed through इसके Sumlock Comptometer division, they used vacuum tubes and cold-cathode switching tubes in their logic circuits and nixie tubes for their numerical displays.
They were the first of a श्रेणी of desktop and hand-held electronic calculators that the company was to develop and sell under the ANITA name into the mid-1970s.
George Washington ( –, 1799 ) was the first President of the United States ( 1789–1797 ), the commander-in-chief of the Continental Army during the American Revolutionary War, और one of the Founding Fathers of the United States.
he presided over the convention that drafted the Constitution, which replaced the आलेख of Confederation and established the position of अध्यक्ष.
Washington was निर्वाचित President as the unanimous choice of the 69 electors in 1788, और he served two terms in office.
He oversaw the creation of a strong, well-financed national government that maintained neutrality in the wars raging in Europe, suppressed rebellion, and won acceptance among Americans of all types.
His leadership स्टाइल established many forms and rituals of government that have been used since, ऐसे as using a cabinet system and delivering an inaugural address.
Further, the peaceful transition from his presidency to the presidency of John Adams established a tradition that continues into the 21st century.
Washington was hailed as `` father of his country `` even during his lifetime.
Washington was born into the provincial gentry of Colonial Virginia ; his wealthy planter family owned tobacco plantations and slaves.
बाद both his father and older brother died when he was young, Washington became personally and professionally attached to the powerful William Fairfax, who promoted his career as a surveyor and soldier.
Washington quickly became a senior officer in the colonial forces during the first stages of the French and Indian War.
Chosen by the Second Continental Congress in 1775 to be commander-in-chief of the Continental Army in the American Revolution, Washington प्रबंधित to force the British out of Boston in 1776, but was defeated and लगभग captured later that year when he lost New York City.
After crossing the Delaware River in the dead of winter, he defeated the British in दो battles, retook नई Jersey and restored momentum to the Patriot cause.
Because of his strategy, Revolutionary forces captured two major British armies at Saratoga in 1777 and yorktown in 1781.
Historians laud Washington लिये his selection and supervision of उसके generals, encouragement of morale and ability to hold together the army, coordination with the state governors and राज्य militia units, relations with Congress and attention to supplies, logistics, and training.
In battle, however, Washington was repeatedly outmaneuvered by British generals with larger armies.
After victory had been finalized in 1783, Washington resigned as Commander-in-chief rather than seize शक्ति, proving his opposition to dictatorship and his प्रतिबद्धता to American republicanism.
Dissatisfied with the weaknesses of the Articles of Confederation, in 1787 Washington presided over the संवैधानिक सम्मेलन that drafted the United States Constitution.
Elected unanimously as the first President of the United राज्य in 1789, he attempted to लाओ rival factions together to unify the nation.
He supported Alexander Hamilton 's programs to pay बंद all state और नेशनल debt, to implement an effective tax system and to create a national bank ( despite opposition from Thomas Jefferson ).
Washington proclaimed the United States neutral in the wars raging in Europe after 1793.
He avoided war with Great Britain and guaranteed a decade of peace and profitable trade by securing the Jay Treaty in 1795, despite intense opposition from the Jeffersonians.
Although never officially joining the Federalist Party, he supported its programs.
Washington 's Farewell Address was an influential primer on republican virtue और a warning against partisanship, sectionalism, and involvement in foreign wars.
He रिटायर्ड from the presidency in 1797 and लौटे to his home, माउंट vernon, and his domestic life where he managed a variety of उद्यमों.
He freed all his slaves by his final will.
Washington had a vision of a great and powerful nation that would be built on republican lines using federal power.
He sought to use the national government to preserve liberty, improve infrastructure, open the western lands, promote commerce, found a permanent capital, reduce regional tensions and promote a spirit of American राष्ट्रवाद.
At his death, Washington was eulogized as `` first in war, पहला in peace, and पहला in the hearts of his countrymen '' by हेनरी Lee.
The Federalists made him the symbol of their party but for many years, the Jeffersonians continued to distrust his influence and delayed building the Washington Monument.
As the leader of the first successful revolution against a colonial empire in world history, Washington became an international icon for liberation and nationalism, especially in फ़्रांस and Latin अमेरिका.
Fiscal Year 2012 U.S. Federal Spending – नकदी or Budget Basis.
Fiscal साल 2012 U.S. Federal Receipts.
The Budget of the United States Government often begins as the President 's proposal to the U.S. Congress which अनुशंसा funding levels लिये the next fiscal साल, beginning October 1.
However, Congress is the body required by law to pass a budget annually and to submit the budget passed by both houses to the President for signature.
Congressional decisions are governed by rules और विधान regarding the federal budget प्रक्रम.
Budget committees set spending limits for the House and Senate समितियों और for Appropriations subcommittees, which then स्वीकृति individual appropriations bills to allocate funding to various संघीय programs.
If Congress fails to pass an annual budget ( as has been the मामला since 2009 ), a series of Appropriations bills must be passed as `` stop gap '' measures.
After Congress approves an appropriations विधेयक, it is sent to the President, who may चिह्न it into law, or may veto it ( as he would a budget when passed by the Congress ).
A vetoed bill is sent back to Congress, which can pass it into law with a two-thirds majority in each chamber.
Congress may also combine all or some appropriations bills into an omnibus reconciliation bill.
in addition, the president may request and the Congress may pass supplemental appropriations bills or emergency supplemental appropriations bills.
Several government agencies provide budget data and analysis.
ये include the Government जवाबदेही Office ( GAO ), Congressional Budget Office, the Office of Management और Budget ( OMB ) and the U.S. Treasury Department.
These agencies have reported that the federal government is facing a series of important financing challenges.
in the short-run, कर revenues have declined significantly due to a severe मंदी and कर policy choices, while expenditures have expanded for wars, unemployment insurance and other safety net spending.
In the long-run, expenditures related to healthcare programs such as Medicare and Medicaid are प्रक्षिप्त to grow faster than the economy overall as the population matures.
New Guinea ( also, Tok Pisin : Niugini, Dutch : Nieuw Guinea, and ; historically : Papua ) is the world 's second largest द्वीप, after Greenland, covering a land क्षेत्रफल of 786,000 km2.
Located in the southwest Pacific Ocean, it lies geographically to the east of the Malay Archipelago, with which it is sometimes included as भाग of a greater Indo-Australian Archipelago.
Geologically it is a भाग of the same tectonic plate as Australia.
When world sea levels were low, the दो shared shorelines ( which now lie 100 to 140 metres below sea स्तर ), combining with lands now inundated into the tectonic continent of Sahul, also known as Greater Australia.
The दो landmasses became separated when the area now ज्ञात as the Torres Strait flooded after the end of the last glacial period.
Anthropologically, New Guinea is considered part of मॅलानिशिया.
Politically, the western half of the island comprises two Indonesian provinces : Papua and West Papua.
The eastern हाफ forms the मेनलैंड of the country of Papua New Guinea.
The island रै a population of about 7.5 million, with a very low population घनत्व of only 8 inh/km2.
नई Guinea is differentiated from its drier, flatter, and less fertile southern बंटवारा, Australia, by its much उच्चतर rainfall and its active volcanic geology, with its highest point, puncak Jaya, reaching an elevation of 4,884 m ( 16,023 ft ).
Yet the दो land masses share a similar animal fauna, with marsupials, including wallabies and possums, and the egg-laying monotreme, the spiny anteater, or echidna.
Other than bats and some two dozen indigenous rodent genera, there are no pre-human indigenous placental स्तनधारियों.
Pigs, several additional species of rats, और the ancestor of the New Guinea Singing Dog यहूद introduced with इंसान colonization.
The human presence on the island dates back at least 40,000 years to the oldest human migrations out of Africa.
Research indicates that the highlands were an early and independent center of agriculture, with evidence of irrigation going back at least 10,000 years.
Because of the time depth of its inhabitation and its highly fractured landscape, an unusually high number of languages are spoken on the island, साथ some 1,000 languages ( a फिगर higher than that of most continents ) having been catalogued out of an estimated world-wide pre-Columbian total of 6,000 human dialects.
Most are classified as Papuan languages, a generally accepted geographical term which a minority of authors hold to be a genetic one.
A number of Austronesian languages are spoken on the coast and on offshore islands.
In the 16th century Spanish explorers discovered the island और called it Nueva गिनी.
In recent history western New Guinea was included in the Dutch East Indies colony.
the Germans annexed the northern coast of the eastern half of the island as German New Guinea in their pre–World War I effort to establish themselves as a colonial power, whilst the south eastern portion was अनिच्छा claimed by Britain.
Following the Treaty of Versailles, the German portion was awarded to Australia ( which was already शासी the British claim, named the Territory of Papua ) as a League of Nations mandate.
The eastern half of the island was granted independence from ऑस्ट्रेलिया as Papua New गिनी in 1975.
The western half gained independence from the Dutch in 1961, but became part of Indonesia soon afterwards in controversial circumstances.
`` The Van Buren Boys '' is the 148th episode of the sitcom Seinfeld, and name of a fictional New York street gang.
Their sign is crossing the hands, with one hand with all the fingers 'up ' and spread out.
The other hand has all लकिन the thumb and pointer finger up, for a total of eight ( 8 ).
The gang is named for the 8th अध्यक्ष of the United States, Martin Van Buren ( who was the पहला अध्यक्ष from New York ).
This was the 14th episode for the 8th season.
it aired on फ़रवरी 6, 1997.
Bevo sign
Bevo was a non-alcoholic malt beverage, or near beer, brewed in the United States by the Anheuser-Busch company beginning in the early 20th century.
Bevo enjoyed its greatest success during the time of prohibition, when beer, wine और आसुत liquors, were made illegal for thirteen years.
The Anheuser-Busch company started brewing Bevo when alcoholic beverages were prohibited in 1916 by the United States armed forces.
Production rose greatly with national prohibition in 1919, and Bevo was by far the most popular of the many `` cereal beverages '' or `` near beers '' of the time.
At the peak of इसके popularity in the early 1920s, अधिक than five million मामले of Bevo were sold annually.
Renard with a mug of Bevo, depicted in terra cotta on the interior walls of the Bevo building, St. Louis
Labels on the bottles billed it as `` Bevo the Beverage ''.
The नाम `` Bevo '' was coined from the word `` beverage '' and the Slavic language word for beer `` pivo '', and was pronounced `` Bee-vo ''.
Some Bevo advertising featured the character `` Renard the Fox `` ( आधारित on the protagonist of a medieval French folk-tale ), and promotional मग with this character were manufactured.
In 1930 Anheuser-Busch built a श्रेणी of boat-bodied cars in its St. Louis shops called the `` Bevo Boats '' जिससे were used for promotion.
सात are believed to have been built on Pierce-Arrow 8-cylinder chassis जबकि one surviving example was based upon 1930 Cadillac 353 V8.
Billboard विज्ञापन Bevo in trenton, New Jersey, 1917
a contemporary advertisement read `` Cooling और invigorating, Bevo the Beverage.
Order by the case इससे your grocer, druggist, or dealer. ''
The paper label on the back of the bottle पढ़ा `` The All-Year-Round Soft Drink.
Appetizing - Healthful - Nutritious - Refreshing.
Milk or water may contain bacteria.
BEVO never does. ''
Bevo became part of the popular culture of the time, and is mentioned in various popular songs and Vaudeville skits of the era.
This led to द्वितीयक slang uses of the word ; for example, in American military slang a young and inexperienced officer was called a `` Bevo ''.
The University of टेक्सास named इसके mascot `` Bevo '', a नाम which has stuck to this day.
Irving Berlin included a paean to the drink, `` You Ca n't Stay Up on Bevo '', in his 1917 army revue, Yip Yip Yaphank.
In the late 1920s smuggled bootleg beer and liquor as well as `` homebrew ``, cut into Bevo 's marketshare.
With sales flattening to 100,000 cases by 1929, Anheuser-Busch stopped production.
The Bevo Mill, St. Louis, in 2008
The bevo building, with the Renard character prominently displayed at the corners, still operates as a bottling facility at their main brewery in St. Louis, Missouri.
The landmark Bevo Mill, constructed by August anheuser Busch, Sr. in 1917.
it was closed in 2009, but it reopened in October 2009 under new owners.
Bevo is भी mentioned in the short story `` The Killers `` by Ernest हेमिंगवे ; as well as in Babbitt by Sinclair Lewis.
Mylanta is an over the counter medication used for the treatment of acid reflux, heartburn, and gastroesophageal reflux disease ( also ज्ञात as GERD ).

Milk is a white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
It is the primary source of पोषण for young mammals before they are समर्थ to digest अन्य types of food.
Early- lactation milk contains colostrum, which carries the mother 's antibodies to the baby and can reduce the risk of many diseases in the baby.
It also contains many other nutrients.
As an agricultural product, milk is extracted from mammals and used as food for humans.
Worldwide, dairy farms produced about 730 लाख tonnes of milk in 2011.
India is the world 's largest producer and उपभोक्ता of milk, yet neither exports nor imports milk.
New Zealand, the European Union 's 27 member states, Australia, and the United States are the world 's largest exporters of milk and मिल्क products.
China और Russia are the world 's largest importers of milk and milk products.
throughout the world, there are more than 6 billion उपभोक्ता of milk and milk products.
Over 750 million people live within dairy farming households.
Milk is a key contributor to improving nutrition and food security particularly in developing countries.
Improvements in livestock and dairy technology offer significant वादा in reducing गरीबी and malnutrition in the world.
Motorcycle speedway, usually referred to as speedway, is a motorcycle sport involving four and sometimes up to छह riders competing over four anti-clockwise laps of an oval circuit.
Speedway motorcycles use only one gear and have no brakes and racing takes place on a flat ओवल track usually consisting of dirt or loosely packed shale.
Competitors use this surface to slide their machines बगलों, powersliding or broadsiding into the bends.
On the straight sections of the track the motorcycles reach speeds of up.
The सटीक origins of the sport are अनजान but there is evidence of a type of speedway रेसिंग being practised in the USA before the First World War and in ऑस्ट्रेलिया in the late 1910s and early 1920s.
There are now both घरेलू and international competitions in a number of countries including the Speedway World Cup whilst the उच्चतम overall scoring individual in the Speedway ग्रैंड Prix events is सुनाया the world champion.
Speedway is popular in central and northern Europe and to a lesser extent in Australia और North America.
A variant of track racing, speedway is administered internationally by the Fédération Internationale de Motocyclisme ( FIM ).
Domestic speedway events are regulated by FIM affiliated national motor sport federations.
Vitamin D is a group of fat-soluble secosteroids responsible for intestinal absorption of calcium and phosphate.
In humans, the most महत्वपूर्ण related compounds of vitamin D are vitamin D2 and vitamin D3.
Cholecalciferol ( vitamin D3 ) and ergocalciferol ( vitamin D2 ) are unique as they constitute what we जान as vitamin D और can be ingested from the diet and/or supplements.
the body can also synthesize vitamin d ( from cholesterol ) when sun एक्सपोज़र is adequate ( hence इसके nickname, the `` sunshine vitamin '' ).
हालांकि vitamin D is commonly called a vitamin, it is not actually an essential dietary विटामिन in the strict sense, as it can be synthesized in adequate amounts by most mammals exposed to sunlight.
( Cats and dogs can not synthesize vitamin d efficiently and must receive it in their diet. )
An organic chemical compound ( or related set of compounds ) is only scientifically called a vitamin when it can not be synthesized in sufficient quantities by an organism, and must be प्राप्त from their diet.
However, as with other compounds commonly called vitamins, vitamin D was discovered in an effort to find the dietary substance that was lacking in a disease, namely, rickets, the childhood form of osteomalacia.
Additionally, like other compounds called vitamins, in the developed world vitamin D is added to staple foods, such as milk, to avoid disease due to कमियां.
Measures of serum levels reflect endogenous synthesis from exposure to sunlight as well as सेवन from the diet, and it is believed that synthesis may contribute generally to the मेंटेनेंस of adequate serum concentrations.
The evidence indicates that the संश्लेषण of vitamin D from सूर्य exposure works in a feedback loop that prevents toxicity but, because of uncertainty about the cancer risk इससे sunlight, no recommendations are issued by the Institute of Medicine, USA, for the amount of sun exposure required to meet vitamin d requirements.
तदनुसार, the Dietary Reference Intakes for vitamin d assume that no synthesis occurs and that all of a person 's vitamin D is from their diet, although that will rarely occur in practice.
in the liver विटामिन D is converted to calcidiol, which is also known as calcifediol ( INN ), 25-hydroxycholecalciferol, or 25-hydroxyvitamin D—abbreviated 25 ( OH ) D ; and which is the specific vitamin D metabolite that is measured in serum to determine a व्यक्ति 's vitamin D status.
Part of the calcidiol is परिवर्तित by the गुर्दे to calcitriol, the biologically active form of vitamin D. calcitriol circulates as a hormone in the blood, regulating the concentration of calcium and phosphate in the bloodstream and promoting the स्वस्थ growth and remodeling of bone.
Calcidiol is also परिवर्तित to calcitriol outside of the kidneys for other purposes, such as the proliferation, differentiation और apoptosis of cells ; calcitriol भी affects neuromuscular function and inflammation.
परे its use to prevent osteomalacia or rickets, the evidence for other health effects of vitamin D supplementation in the general population is inconsistent.
the best प्रमाण of benefit is for bone health and a decrease in mortality in elderly women.
The Duramax is a General Motors diesel engine family for light- and medium duty trucks, designed by Isuzu.
The 6.6-liter duramax is produced by DMAX, a joint venture between GM and Isuzu in moraine, Ohio.
This इंजन was initially संस्थापित in 2001 model year Chevy and GMC trucks and has been an option since then in pickups, वैन, and medium-duty trucks.
In 2006, production at Moraine was reportedly सीमित to approximately 200,000 engines per year.
On May 9, 2007, DMAX announced the production of the 1,000,000th Duramax V-8 diesel at its Moraine सुविधा.

Balto ( 1919 – March 14, 1933 ) was a siberian Husky sled dog जो led his team on the final leg of the 1925 serum चलाएं to Nome, in which diphtheria antitoxin थी transported from Anchorage, Alaska, to Nenana, Alaska, by train and then to Nome by dog sled to combat an outbreak of the disease.
The run is commemorated by the annual Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race.
Balto was named after the Sami एक्सप्लोरर Samuel Balto.
Balto died at the age of 14.

The Nissan Maxima is a mid-size / entry-level luxury car manufactured by Nissan, marketed as the `` four-door sports car ''.
the origins of the Maxima began in July 1976 as the Datsun 810, an upscale six-cylinder version of the Bluebird, and was spun into its own line in 1981, having been made continuously since then.
The `` Maxima '' name was applied gradually, beginning in 1981.
Most pre-2004 Maximas were built in Oppama, Japan, until the current North American maximas started being assembled in Smyrna, Tennessee.
the `` उच्चिष्ट '' has also been applied to Cefiros and Laurels in various markets.
Propolis as hive sealing
Propolis is a resinous मिश्रण कि honey bees collect from tree buds, sap flows, or अन्य botanical sources.
It is used as a sealant for unwanted open spaces in the hive.
Propolis is used for small गैप ( approximately or less ), while larger spaces are प्रायः भर with beeswax.
Its color varies depending on its botanical source, the सबसे common being dark brown.
Propolis is sticky at and above रूम temperature,.
At lower temperatures, it becomes hard और very brittle.
Steven Tyler ( born Steven Victor Tallarico ; March 26, 1948 ) is an American singer, songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist, best known as the frontman and सीसे singer of the Boston -based rock band Aerosmith, in which he also plays the harmonica, and occasional piano and percussion.
He is known as the `` Demon of Screamin ' '' due to his high screams और उसके wide vocal range.
He is भी known for his on-stage acrobatics.
During उसके high-energy performances, he usually dresses in bright, रंगीन outfits with his trademark scarves hanging from his microphone stand.
In the 1970s, Tyler rose to prominence as the frontman of Aerosmith, which released such milestone hard rock albums as Toys in the Attic and Rocks.
In the late 1970s and early 1980s, Tyler had a heavy drug and alcohol addiction, and the band 's लोकप्रियता waned.
He completed drug rehabilitation in 1986 and subsequently maintained sobriety for over 20 years, but had a relapse with prescription painkillers in the late 2000s, for which he successfully received treatment in 2009.
After Aerosmith शुभारम्भ a remarkable comeback in the late 1980s and early 1990s with the albums Permanent Vacation, Pump, and Get a Grip, Tyler became a household name and has remained a relevant rock icon.
As a result, he has since embarked on several solo endeavors including guest appearances on other artists ' music, film and tv roles ( including as a judge on American Idol ), authoring a bestselling किताब, और solo कार्य ( including a Top 40 hit single in 2011 ).
However, he रै continued to record music and perform साथ Aerosmith, after more than 43 years in the band.
The band 's latest album, Music from Another Dimension !
, was released on November 6, 2012.
Tyler is included among Rolling पत्थरों 100 Greatest Singers.
He was also ranked 3rd on Hit Parader 's Top 100 मेटल Vocalists of All Time.
In 2001 he was inducted into the Rock और Roll Hall of Fame with Aerosmith, and he was the presenter when AC/DC was inducted into the हॉल of Fame in 2003.
In 2013, Tyler and his songwriting partner Joe Perry will be recipients of the ASCAP Founders Award and will also be inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.
The जिगर produces urea in the urea cycle as a बर्बाद product of the digestion of protein.
Normal human adult blood should contain between 7 to 21 mg of urea nitrogen per 100 ml ( 7–21 mg/ dL ) of blood.
Individual laboratories may have different reference सीमाएँ, and this is because the procedure may vary.
Wayne Fontes ( born February 2, 1940 ) is a former American football coach and कॉलेज and professional football player who was the head coach of the NFL 's Detroit Lions from 1988 to 1996.
His 67 wins and 71 losses are प्रत्येक the most for a head कोच in team इतिहास.
The Jews ( ISO 259-3 Israeli pronunciation ), also known as the Jewish people, are a nation and an ethnoreligious group, originating in the Israelites or Hebrews of the Ancient Near East.
The Jewish ethnicity, nationality, and religion are strongly interrelated, as Judaism is the traditional faith of the Jewish nation.
Converts to Judaism, whose status as Jews within the Jewish ethnos is equal to those born into it, have महरूम absorbed into the Jewish people throughout the सहस्राब्दियों.
in Jewish tradition, Jewish ancestry is traced to the Biblical patriarchs Abraham, Isaac और Jacob in the second millennium BCE.
The modern State of Israel was established as a Jewish nation-state, और defines itself as such in its मौलिक कानून.
Its Law of Return grants the सही of citizenship to any Jew who requests it.
इसराईल is the only country where Jews are a majority of the population.
Jews also enjoyed political autonomy twice before in ancient history.
the first of these periods lasted from 1350 to 586 BCE, and encompassed the periods of the Judges, the United Monarchy, and the Divided Monarchy of the kingdoms of Israel and Judah, ending with the destruction of the पहला टेम्पल.
The दूसरी was the period of the Hasmonean किंगडम spanning from 140 to 37 BCE.
Since the destruction of the First Temple, most Jews have lived in diaspora.
A minority in every country in which they live ( except Israel ), वे have frequently experienced persecution throughout इतिहास, resulting in a population that has fluctuated both in numbers और वितरण over the centuries.
The world Jewish population reached a peak of 15 million prior to the Second World War, but six million Jews were killed in the Holocaust.
चूंकि then the population has risen again and, was estimated at 13.4 million by the उत्तर American Jewish Data Bank, or less than 0.2 % of the total world population ( roughly one in every 514 people ).
According to this report, about 42.5 % of सब Jews reside in Israel ( 5.7 million ), and 39.3 % in the United States ( 5.3 million ), with most of the remainder living in Europe ( 1.5 million ) and कनाडा ( 0.4 million ).
These numbers include all those who consider themselves Jews, whether or not they are affiliated with a Jewish organization.
The total world Jewish population, however, is difficult to measure.
In addition to issues with census methodology, there are halakhic disputes regarding who is a Jew and secular, political, and ancestral identification factors that may affect the figure considerably.
Corpus Christi बारात.
Oil on canvas by Carl Emil Doepler.
Corpus Domini redirects here.
For other uses see कॉर्पस Domini ( disambiguation )
The feast of Corpus christi ( Latin for Body of Christ ), also known as Corpus Domini, is a Latin Rite liturgical solemnity celebrating the tradition and belief in the देह and blood of Jesus Christ और his Real Presence in the Eucharist.
It emphasizes the joy of the institution of the Eucharist, which was observed on Holy Thursday in the somber atmosphere of the nearness of शुभ Friday.
In the present Roman Missal, the feast is designated the solemnity of The Most Holy Body and Blood of Christ.
It is also celebrated in some Anglican, Lutheran, and Old Catholic Churches that थाम similar मान्यताओं regarding the Real Presence.
The feast is liturgically celebrated on the Thursday after Trinity Sunday or, `` where the Solemnity of the Most Holy देह and Blood of Christ is not a Holy Day of Obligation, it is assigned to the संडे after the Most Holy Trinity as इसके proper दिन ''.
At the end of Holy Mass, there is often a procession of the Blessed Sacrament, generally displayed in a monstrance.
The procession is followed by Benediction of the Blessed Sacrament.
A notable Eucharistic procession is that presided over by the पोप each year in Rome, where it begins at the Archbasilica of St. John Lateran and makes its way to the Basilica of Saint Mary Major, where it concludes with Benediction.
c-reactive protein ( CRP ) is a protein found in the रक्त, the levels of which वृद्धि in response to inflammation ( i.e. C-reactive protein is an acute-phase protein ).
Its physiological role is to bind to phosphocholine expressed on the surface of dead or dying cells ( and some types of bacteria ) in order to activate the complement system via the C1Q complex.
CRP is synthesized by the जिगर in response to factors released by macrophages and मोटे cells ( adipocytes ).
It is a सदस्य of the pentraxin family of proteins.
It is not related to C-peptide or protein C.
C-reactive protein was the पहला pattern मान्यता receptor ( PRR ) to be identified.
The start of the systematic European colonization of the americas is typically dated to 1492, when a Spanish expedition headed by Christopher Columbus sailed for India to open trade but inadvertently discovered the Americas.
European conquest, large-scale exploration and colonization soon followed.
देखकर that यूरोपीय was preoccupied with many internal wars and was slowly recovering from the many deaths that the bubonic plague caused, the rapid expansion at जिससे it grew in माल and power was unforeseeable in the early 1400s.
The first expeditions occurred along the Caribbean coasts on the islands of Hispaniola, Puerto Rico and Cuba, and बाद 1500 विस्तारित into the interiors of both North and South America.
In 1497, sailing from the north on behalf of England, John Cabot landed on the North American coast, and a year later, कोलंबस 's third voyage reached the South American coast.
France founded colonies in much of eastern North America, on a number of Caribbean islands, and in South America.
Portugal colonized Brazil.
Eventually, the entire Western Hemisphere came under the control of European governments, leading to profound changes to its landscape, जनसांख्यिकी, and plant and animal life.
In the 19th century alone over 50 million people left Europe for the Americas.
The post-1492 era is known as the period of the Columbian Exchange.
Keith Richards ( born 18 December 1943 ) is an English musician, singer-songwriter and founder member of the English rock band the Rolling Stones.
Rolling Stone magazine said Richards had created `` rock 's greatest single body of riffs '', रैंकिंग him 4th on its list of 100 best guitarists.
Fourteen गीतों Richards wrote with the Rolling पत्थरों ' lead vocalist मिक Jagger are listed among Rolling Stone magazine 's `` 500 Greatest Songs of All Time ``.
Richards ' notoriety लिये illicit drug use stems in part इससे several drug busts दौरान the late 1960s and 1970s and his candour regarding his addiction to and eventual abstinence from heroin.
Testosterone is a स्टेरॉयड hormone from the androgen group और is मिला in mammals, reptiles, birds, and other vertebrates.
In mammals, testosterone is primarily secreted in the testicles of males and the ovaries of females, although small amounts are भी secreted by the adrenal glands.
It is the principal पुरूष sex hormone and an anabolic steroid.
In men, testosterone plays a key role in the विकास of male reproductive tissues such as the testis and prostate as well as promoting secondary sexual characteristics such as increased मांसपेशी, bone mass, and the growth of body hair.
In addition, testosterone is essential for health and well-being as well as the prevention of osteoporosis.
on average, in adult human males, the plasma concentration of testosterone is about 7–8 times as great as the concentration in adult human females ' plasma, but as the metabolic consumption of testosterone in males is greater, the daily production is about 20 times greater in men.
Females also are more sensitive to the hormone.
Testosterone is observed in most vertebrates.
Fish make a slightly different form called 11-ketotestosterone.
Its counterpart in insects is ecdysone.
These ubiquitous steroids suggest that sex hormones have an ancient evolutionary history.
Cluster sampling is a sampling technique used when `` natural '' लकिन relatively homogeneous groupings हैं evident in a statistical population.
It is often used in marketing research.
In this technique, the total population is divided into these groups ( or clusters ) and a simple random sample of the groups is selected.
Then the required information is collected from a simple random sample of the elements within प्रत्येक selected group.
This may be किया for every element in these groups or a subsample of elements may be selected within each of these groups.
a common motivation for cluster sampling is to reduce the total number of interviews and costs given the desired accuracy.
Assuming a fixed sample size, the technique gives more accurate results जब सबसे of the variation in the population is within the groups, not between them.
Jamestown is a town in Guilford County, North Carolina, United States, and is a suburb of the nearby शहरों of Greensboro और High Point.
The population was 3,382 at the 2010 census.
Natalie Portman ( born Natalie Hershlag ; ; June 9, 1981 ) is an actress and model साथ dual American and Israeli citizenship.
Her first role was as an orphan taken in by a hitman in the 1994 action film, but mainstream कामयाबी came when she was cast as Padmé Amidala in the Star Wars प्रीक्वेल trilogy ( released in 1999, 2002 and 2005 ).
In 1999, she enrolled at Harvard University to study psychology जबकि still working as an actress.
She completed उसके bachelor 's degree in 2003.
In 2001, Portman opened in New York City 's Public Theater production of Anton Chekhov 's The Seagull.
In 2005, Portman received a nomination for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress and won the Golden Globe Award for बेहतरीन Supporting Actress - Motion Picture for the drama Closer.
She won a Constellation पुरस्कार for बेहतरीन Female Performance and a Saturn Award लिये Best Actress for उसके अभिनीत role in v for Vendetta ( 2006 ).
She played leading roles in the historical dramas Goya 's Ghosts ( 2006 ) and the Other Boleyn Girl ( 2008 ).
In May 2008, she परोसा as the youngest member of the 61st सालाना Cannes Film पर्व jury.
Portman 's directorial debut, Eve, opened the 65th Venice International Film Festival 's shorts competition in 2008.
Portman directed a segment of the collective film New York, I Love You.
In 2011, Portman won the Academy पुरस्कार, the Golden Globe पुरस्कार, the BAFTA Award, the Screen Actors गिल्ड Award, and the Independent Spirit Award for her lead performance as Nina Sayers in Black Swan.
Copper is a chemical तत्व with the symbol Cu ( from ) and atomic number 29.
It is a ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity.
Pure copper is soft and malleable ; a freshly exposed surface रै a reddish-orange color.
It is प्रयुक्त as a conductor of ऊष्मा and electricity, a building material, and a constituent of various metal alloys.
The metal and its alloys have been used लिये thousands of years.
In the Roman era, copper was principally mined on Cyprus, hence the origin of the name of the metal as сyprium ( metal of Cyprus ), later shortened to сuprum.
Its compounds are commonly encountered as copper ( II ) salts, which often impart blue or green colors to minerals such as azurite and turquoise and have been widely used historically as pigments.
Architectural structures built with तांबे corrode to give green verdigris ( or patina ).
Decorative आर्ट prominently features copper, both by itself and as part of pigments.
Copper is essential to all living organisms as a trace dietary mineral because it is a key constituent of the respiratory enzyme complex cytochrome c oxidase.
In molluscs and crustacea copper is a constituent of the blood pigment hemocyanin, which is replaced by the iron-complexed हीमोग्लोबिन in fish and other vertebrates.
The main areas where copper is found in vertebrates are जिगर, muscle and bone.
in sufficient concentration, copper compounds are poisonous to higher जीवों and are used as bacteriostatic substances, fungicides, and wood preservatives.
The major professional sports लीग, or simply major leagues, in the United States और Canada are the highest professional competitions of team sports in the two countries.
Although individual sports such as golf, tennis, and auto racing are also very popular, the term is usually limited to team sports.
The term `` major league '' was first used in 1921 in reference to Major League Baseball ( MLB ), the top level of professional American baseball.
Today, the major northern North America professional team sports leagues are Major League Baseball ( MLB ), the National Basketball संघ ( NBA ), the National फ़ुटबॉल League ( NFL ), and the National हॉकी League ( NHL ).
Other notable leagues include Major League Soccer ( MLS ), the Canadian Football League ( CFL ), the Arena Football League, Major League Lacrosse, the National lacrosse League and the Women 's National Basketball Association.
The NFL, एमएलबी, NBA, and NHL are commonly referred to as the Big Four.
Each of these is the richest professional club competition in its खेल worldwide.
The best players can become cultural प्रतीक in both countries and elsewhere in the world, because the leagues enjoy a significant place in popular culture in the US and Canada.
The NFL has 32 teams, and the others have 30 each.
The vast majority of major लीग टीमों are concentrated in the most populous metropolitan areas of the United States.
Baseball, football, hockey, और soccer have had professional leagues for over 100 years ; जल्दी leagues ऐसे as the National Association, Ohio League, and National Hockey Association formed the basis of the modern MLB, NFL and NHL respectively.
Soccer was first professionalized in 1894, but leagues suffered greatly from lack of स्थिरता and seldom lasted more than a decade.
Soccer 's greatest successes were in the रूप of the American Soccer League ( 1921-1933 ), the original North American Soccer League ( 1968-1984 ), the नेशनल Professional Soccer League ( 1984-2001 ) और, currently, Major League Soccer ( 1996-present ).
Basketball is a relatively new development ; the NBA evolved इससे the National Basketball League and its splinter group the Basketball Association of America, taking on its current form in 1949.
Every major league averages 15,000 fans in attendance per game or higher as of 2011.
Meridian Altitude is an astronomical navigation method of calculating an observer 's latitude.
Earned value management ( EVM ), or Earned value project/performance management ( EVPM ) is a प्रोजेक्ट management technique for measuring प्रोजेक्ट performance and progress in an objective manner.
Because EVM has the ability to combine measurements of :
scope
अनुसूची
and cost,
in a single integrated system, Earned Value Management is able to provide accurate forecasts of project performance problems, which is an important contribution लिये प्रोजेक्ट management.
Early EVM research showed that the areas of planning and control are significantly impacted by इसके use ; and similarly, using the methodology improves both scope परिभाषा as well as the विश्लेषण of overall project performance.
More recent research अध्ययन have shown that the principles of EVM are positive predictors of project success.
Popularity of EVM has grown significantly in recent years beyond government contracting, in which sector its importance continues to rise ( e.g., हाल new DFAR rules ), in part because evm can also surface in और help substantiate contract disputes.

वसन्त is one of the four conventional temperate seasons, following winter and preceding summer.
There are various technical definitions of spring, लकिन local usage of the term varies according to local climate, cultures and customs.
When it is spring in the northern hemisphere, it will be autumn in the southern गोलार्ध.
at the spring equinox, days are close to 12 hours long with दिन length increasing as the season progresses.
Spring and `` springtime '' refer to the ऋतु, and also to ideas of rebirth, rejuvenation, renewal, क़यामत, and regrowth, with festivals such as Carnival, Easter and Holi being celebrated at this time.
Jamestown was a settlement in the उपनिवेश of Virginia, the first permanent English settlement in the Americas.
Established by the वर्जिनिया Company of London as `` James Fort '' on May 14, 1607 ( O.S., may 24, 1607 N.S. ), it followed several earlier failed attempts, including the Lost Colony of Roanoke.
Jamestown परोसा as the capital of the उपनिवेश for 83 years, from 1616 until 1699.
The settlement was located within the territory of a political entity known as Tsenacommacah, the state of the Powhatan Confederacy, with around 14,000 native inhabitants, and specifically was in part of the subdivision known as the Paspahegh tribe.
The natives initially welcomed the colonists with dancing, feasting and tobacco ceremonies, and they provided crucial provisions and support for the अस्तित्व of the colonists, who were not agriculturally inclined, although relations with the newcomers also soured fairly early on, अग्रणी to the total annihilation of the Paspahegh in warfare within 3 years.
Within a year of Jamestown 's founding, the Virginia Company brought Polish and Dutch colonists to help improve the settlement.
In 1619, the first documented Africans were brought to Jamestown, though the modern conception of slavery in the future United States did not begin in Virginia until 1660.
When the colony was subdivided into the original eight shires of Virginia in 1634, the town became located in the eponymous James City शायर.
The London Company 's second settlement, Bermuda, claims to be the site of the oldest town in the English New World, as St. George 's, Bermuda was officially established ( as नई London ) in 1612, whereas James Fort, in Virginia, थी not to be converted into James towne until 1619, and further did not survive into the present दिन.
In 1699, the capital was relocated from Jamestown to what is today Williamsburg, after which Jamestown ceased to exist as a settlement, मौजूदा today only as an archaeological site.
Today, Jamestown is one of three locations comprising the Historic Triangle of Colonial Virginia, साथ with Williamsburg and Yorktown, with दो primary heritage sites.
Historic Jamestowne, the archaeological site on Jamestown द्वीप, is a cooperative effort by jamestown नेशनल Historic Site ( part of Colonial National Historical Park ), and Preservation वर्जिनिया.
The Jamestown Settlement, a living history interpretive site, is operated by the Jamestown yorktown Foundation in conjunction साथ the Commonwealth of Virginia.
James क्रिस्टोफर Frey ( born September 12, 1969 ) is an American writer.
His किताबे A लाख Little Pieces ( 2003 ) and My dost Leonard ( 2005 ), as well as Bright Shiny Morning ( 2008 ), were bestsellers.
He was the subject of a scandal जब investigators discovered that prison time and the extent of certain चोटों were exaggerated in a Million Little Pieces, a purportedly autobiographical account of the author 's struggle with addiction.
Deere & Company, most commonly known by its name John Deere, is an American corporation based in Moline, Illinois, and one of the largest manufacturers of agricultural machinery in the world.
In 2012, it was listed as 97th in the Fortune 500 America 's ranking and 190th in the सौभाग्य 500 Global ranking.
Deere और Company agricultural products, sold under the John Deere name, include tractors, combine harvesters, cotton harvesters, balers, planters / seeders, sprayers, and UTVs.
The company is also a निर्माता of निर्माण equipment और forestry equipment, as well as a प्रदायक of diesel engines and drivetrains ( axles, transmissions, gearboxes ) used in heavy equipment.
Additionally, John Deere manufactures equipment used in lawn, grounds, and turf care, such as walk-behind lawn mowers, zero-turn lawn mowers, lawn tractors, and snowthrowers.
To support the कोर businesses, John Deere also provides financial services and other related activities.
The company 's slogan is `` Nothing रनों Like a Deere '' and has a चित्र of a leaping deer as a logo, a word play pun on `` nothing runs like a deer ''.
Carl Westby coined the phrase `` Nothing Runs Like a Deere '' for a marketing campaign to sell snowmobiles.
The company 's products are also identifiable by इसके distinctive shade of green paint, usually augmented by yellow trim.
The United States ten-dollar bill ( $ 10 ) is a denomination of United States currency.
The first U.S. Secretary of the Treasury ( 1789–95 ), सिकंदर Hamilton, is currently featured on the obverse of the bill, जबकि the U.S. Treasury Building is featured on the रिवर्स.
( हैमिल्टन is one of two non-presidents featured on currently issued U.S. bills.
The other is Benjamin Franklin, on the $ 100 bill.
Hamilton is one of only four people featured on u.S. paper currency ( 1861 to the present ) who was not born in the continental United States, as he थी from the West Indies.
The others are : Albert Gallatin, Switzerland ( $ 500 1862/63 Legal Tender ) ; George Meade, Spain ( $ 1,000 1890/91 Treasury Note ) ; और Robert Morris, England ( $ 1,000 1862/63 विधिक टेंडर ; $ 10 1878/80 Silver Certificate ).
In addition, Kamehameha I, appears on the 2008 Hawaii state quarter. )
All $ 10 bills issued today are Federal Reserve Notes.
The Bureau of नक्काशी and Printing says the average life of a $ 10 bill in circulation is 18 महीने before it is replaced due to wear.
Approximately 6 % of all US banknotes printed in 2009 were $ 10 bills.
Ten dollar bills are delivered by Federal Reserve Banks in yellow straps.
The source of the फेस on the $ 10 bill is John Trumbull ’s 1805 portrait of Hamilton that belongs to the portrait collection of New York City Hall.
The $ 10 bill is the only U.S. paper currency in circulation in which the portrait चेहरों to the बाएँ ( the $ 100,000 bill featured a portrait of Woodrow Wilson facing to the left, but was used तभी for intra-government transactions ).
Andy Samuel Griffith ( June 1, 1926 – जुलाई 3, 2012 ) was an American actor, television producer, Grammy Award -winning Southern-gospel singer, and writer.
He was a Tony Award nominee for two roles, and gained prominence in the starring role in director Elia Kazan 's film a Face in the Crowd ( 1957 ) before he became better known for his television roles, playing the lead characters in the 1960–1968 situation comedy The Andy Griffith Show and in the 1986–1995 legal drama Matlock.
Theresa Penelope `` Terri '' Irwin, ( née Raines ; born July 20, 1964 ) is an Australian -based, American -born naturalist, author, the widow of Australian naturalist Steve Irwin and owner of Australia Zoo at Beerwah, क्वींसलैंड, Australia.
She co-starred with her husband on The Crocodile Hunter, their unconventional television nature documentary series along with its spin-off series, क्रोक Files and the Crocodile Hunter Diaries.
She has जिया in Australia since 1992, when she married Steve Irwin.
Andreas Cellarius 's उदाहरण of the Copernican system, from the Harmonia Macrocosmica ( 1660 ).
Heliocentrism, or heliocentricism, is the astronomical model in which the Earth and planets revolve around a relatively stationary Sun at the center of the Solar System.
The word comes from the यूनानी ( helios `` sun '' और kentron `` बीच '' ).
Historically, heliocentrism was opposed to geocentrism, which लगाई the Earth at the center.
The notion that the Earth revolves around the Sun had been proposed as early as the 3rd century BC by Aristarchus of Samos, but Aristarchus 's heliocentrism attracted little attention until Copernicus revived and elaborated it.
Lucio Russo, however, argues that this is a misleading impression resulting from the loss of वैज्ञानिक works of the Hellenistic Era.
Using indirect evidence he argues that a heliocentric दृश्य was expounded in हिप्पारकस 's work on gravity.
It was not until the 16th century that a fully predictive mathematical model of a heliocentric प्रणाली was presented, by the Renaissance mathematician, astronomer, and Catholic cleric Nicolaus Copernicus of कैंडल, leading to the Copernican Revolution.
In the following century, योहानेस Kepler elaborated upon and expanded this model to include elliptical orbits, and supporting observations made using a telescope were presented by Galileo Galilei.
With the observations of विलियम Herschel, Friedrich Bessel, and others, खगोलशास्त्रियों realized that the sun was not the center of the universe and by the 1920s Edwin Hubble had shown कि it was part of a galaxy ( the Milky Way ) that थी only one of many billions.
नोराह Jones ( born geetali Norah जोन्स Shankar ; March 30, 1979 ) is an American singer-songwriter, pianist, and actress.
She is the बेटी of Indian sitar खिलाड़ी Ravi Shankar and Sue Jones.
She is also Anoushka Shankar 's half-sister.
In 2002, she launched her solo music career with the release of the commercially कामयाब and critically acclaimed album Come Away with Me, a fusion of country music and pop with तत्व of jazz which was certified diamond album, selling over 26 लाख copies.
The record earned Jones five Grammy पुरस्कार, including the Album of the Year, Record of the Year, and Best नई Artist.
Her subsequent studio albums, Feels Like Home, released in 2004, Not Too Late, released in 2007, the same year she made her फिल्मी debut in My ब्लूबेरी Nights, and her 2009 release the Fall all gained Platinum status, selling over a million copies and were generally well received by critics.
Jones ' fifth studio album, Little Broken Hearts, was released on अप्रैल 27, 2012.
Jones has won nine Grammy Awards and was 60th on Billboard पत्रिका 's artists of the 2000–2009 decade chart.
Throughout her करियर, Jones has won numerous awards and has sold more than 50 लाख albums worldwide.
Billboard named her the top jazz artist of the 2000–2009 decade.
Not to be उलझन साथ Dimension of a physical quantity.
For other uses, see Dimension ( disambiguation ).
From left to right, the square, the cube, and the tesseract.
the square is bounded by 1-dimensional लाइनों, the cube by 2-dimensional areas, and the tesseract by 3-dimensional आयतन.
A projection of the घन is given since it is viewed on a two-dimensional screen.
the same applies to the tesseract, which additionally can only be shown as a projection भी in three-dimensional space.
A diagram प्रर्दशित the first four spatial dimensions.
in physics and गणित, the dimension of a space or object is informally defined as the minimum number of coordinates needed to specify any point within it.
Thus a line has a dimension of एक because only one coordinate is needed to specify a point on it ( for example, the point at 5 on a number line ).
A सतह such as a plane or the surface of a cylinder or sphere रै a आयाम of two because दो coordinates are needed to specify a पाइंट on it ( for example, to locate a point on the surface of a sphere तुम need both its latitude and its longitude ).
The inside of a घन, a cylinder or a sphere is three-dimensional because three coordinates are needed to locate a point within these spaces.
In physical terms, dimension refers to the constituent structure of all space ( volume ) and its position in time ( perceived as a scalar dimension along the t-axis ), as well as the spatial constitution of objects within—structures कि correlate with दोनो particle and field conceptions, interact according to relative properties of mass —and हैं fundamentally mathematical in description.
These, or other axes, may be referenced to uniquely identify a point or structure in its attitude and relationship to other objects and occurrences.
Physical theories that incorporate time, such as general relativity, are said to work in 4-dimensional `` spacetime ``, ( defined as a Minkowski space ).
Modern theories tend to be `` higher-dimensional '' including quantum फ़ील्ड and string theories.
The state-space of quantum mechanics is an infinite-dimensional function स्पेस.
the concept of dimension is not restricted to physical objects.
High-dimensional spaces occur in mathematics and the sciences for many reasons, अक्सर as configuration spaces ऐसे as in लाग्रांजीय or Hamiltonian mechanics ; these are abstract spaces, independent of the physical space we live in.
Fontana ( ) is a city of 200,762 residents in San Bernardino County, California.
संस्थापित in 1913, it remained essentially rural until World War II, when entrepreneur Henry J. Kaiser built a large steel mill in the area.
It is now a regional hub of the trucking industry, with Interstate 10 and State Route 210 transecting the city इससे east to west, and Interstate 15 passing diagonally through its northwestern quadrant.
it is home to the largest of the San Bernardino County system libraries, a renovated historic थिएटर, a municipal park, and the स्वचालित Club Speedway on the site of the Kaiser Steel मिल.
Fontana भी hosts the Fontana Days Half Marathon and 5K run.
This race is the fastest half-marathon course in the world.
The U.S. 2012 Census reported that Fontana 's population was 200,762 in 2012, making it the second सबसे populous city in San Bernardino county county and 14th in the state.
Cowboys Stadium is a stadium with a retractable roof in Arlington, Texas.
It serves as the home of the National Football League 's Dallas Cowboys.
It replaced the partially covered Texas Stadium, which opened in 1971, and served as the Cowboys ' home through the 2008 season.
It was completed on May 27, 2009.
The स्टेडियम seats 85,000, making it the third largest stadium in the NFL by seating capacity.
The maximum capacity of the stadium, including standing room, is 105,000.
The Party Pass ( open areas ) sections are behind seats in प्रत्येक end zone and on a series of six elevated platforms connected by stairways.
It has the संसार 's largest column-free interior and the fourth largest high definition video screen, which hangs इससे 20 yard line to 20 यार्ड line.
The facility can भी be used for a variety of other activities outside of its main purpose ( पेशेवर football ) such as concerts, basketball games, मुक्केबाज़ी matches, college football and high school football contests, soccer matches, and motocross races.
Canadian इतिहासकारों until the 1980s tended to focus on economic history, including labour इतिहास.
in part this is because Canada has had far fewer political or military conflicts than other societies.
This was especially true in the first half of the बीसवीं century when आर्थिक history was overwhelmingly dominant.
Many of the most prominent English Canadian historians इससे this period were economic historians, such as Harold Innis, Donald Creighton and Arthur R. M. Lower
Scholars of Canadian history were heirs to the traditions that developed in Europe and the United States, but frameworks that worked well elsewhere often failed in Canada.
the heavily Marxist influenced economic history that dominates Europe has little relevance to most of Canadian history.
a फ़ोकस on class, शहरी areas, and industry fails to address कनाडा 's rural and resource based economy.
Similarly, the monetarist school that is dominant in the United States also has been difficult to transfer north of the border.
the study of economic history in Canada became highly focused on आर्थिक geography, and for many years the dominant school of thought has been the staples thesis.
This school of thought bases the study of the Canadian economy on the study of natural resources.
This approach रै since also become used बाहर of Canada in Australia and in many developing nations.
Before the आगमन of Europeans, the First Nations of what would become कनाडा had a large and vibrant trade network.
Furs, tools, decorative items, and other goods were often transported thousands of kilometres, mostly by कैनो throughout the many rivers and lakes of the region.
the early European history of the Canadian economy is usually studied through the staples thesis जिससे argues the कनाडाई economy developed through the exploitation of a series of staples कि would be exported to Europe.
Carbon-14, 14C, or radiocarbon, is a radioactive isotope of carbon with a nucleus containing 6 protons and 8 neutrons.
इसके presence in organic materials is the basis of the radiocarbon dating method pioneered by Willard Libby and colleagues ( 1949 ) to date archaeological, geological and hydrogeological samples.
Carbon-14 was discovered on 27 February 1940, by Martin Kamen and Sam रूबेन at the University of California Radiation Laboratory in Berkeley, although its existence had been suggested by Franz Kurie in 1934.
There are three naturally occurring isotopes of carbon on धरती : 99 % of the carbon is carbon-12, 1 % is carbon-13, and carbon-14 occurs in trace amounts, i.e., making up about 1 part per trillion ( 0.0000000001 % ) of the carbon in the atmosphere.
The half-life of carbon-14 is 5,730±40 years.
Carbon-14 decays into nitrogen-14 through बीटा decay.
The primary natural source of carbon-14 on Earth is cosmic ray action upon nitrogen in the atmosphere, और it is इसलिए a cosmogenic nuclide.
However, open-air नाभिकीय testing between 1955–1980 contributed to this pool.
The different isotopes of carbon do not differ appreciably in their chemical properties.
This is used in chemical and biological research, in a technique called carbon labeling : carbon-14 atoms can be used to replace nonradioactive carbon, in order to trace chemical and biochemical reactions involving कार्बन अणु from any given organic compound.
Lightning is a highly visible form of energy transfer
Lightning strikes हैं electrical discharges on a विशाल स्केल between the atmosphere and an earth-bound object.
वे mostly originate in thunderclouds and terminate on the ground, called Cloud to Ground ( CG ) lightning.
however, they may also be initiated from a very tall grounded object and reach into the clouds.
हालांकि `` a lightning strike '' is commonly used to describe all lightning, it is बल्कि erroneous and a misnomer, as only परिचय 25 % of all lightning events worldwide are CG, the large bulk of lightning कार्यक्रम हैं Intracloud ( IC ) or बादल to Cloud ( CC ), where discharge only occurs high in the atmosphere.
The scientific name for the पूरा process of a single lightning event is a and it is a very complex, multiple stepped interaction, which is not completely understood.
Most CG flashes only `` strike '' one physical location, referred to as a termination.
The primary conducting चैनल, the bright coursing light you may see and call a `` strike '', is only about 1 inch in diameter, हालांकि to our आँखें it looks much larger.
They are miles long, upwards of tens of miles.
And the entire flash, lasts only a few fractions of a second, सबसे of which is not visible to human eyes.
Thunder is सदा उत्पादित by lightning.
Just like बिजली, that deceives our eyes, usually looking larger or closer than it really is, the धरती 's atmosphere and our brain 's बोध of the outside world, ultimately determines whether it is `` heard '' or not.
Lightning can नहीं happen in a vacuum devoid of ions, nor can thunder occur without molecules to vibrate.
Thunder is a शारीरिक absolute for प्रत्येक single flash of lightning.
Contrary to popular belief, a lightning strike itself is usually not responsible for multiple deaths or injuries from a सिंगल event.
It would be impossible given the natural tendencies of a flash, unless people or animals were stacked on top of each अन्य, or they were somehow arranged vertically and भाग of the flash चैनल.
When lightning ignites an available fuel source और an explosion occurs, it is the shock wave or fire causing the injuries, नहीं the strike itself.
Ground Currents, also called step संभावित, of an earth termination is what truly causes सबसे injuries or death to humans and animals.
The near instantaneous फटाफट of सतह charges, induced by the overhead thundercloud itself, race to the strike point from hundreds to thousands of feet दूर during discharge.
इस current, caused during each stroke, takes the पाथ of least resistance, which may be ion rich human or एनिमल legs, over poorly conducting earth.
This is why it is best to crouch, with feet close together, if ever caught in the open during a thunderstorm.
Unfortunately, सबसे reports do not draw a distinction between the real cause of injury or death, be it the strike itself, a resulting explosion or fire, or usually responsible step संभावित.
Peter F. Kilmartin ( born 1962 ) is the current Attorney General of Rhode Island.
Kilmartin is also a retired पुलिस captain and a former सदस्य of the Rhode Island House of Representatives.
A couple following their marriage in the Manti Utah Temple.
Sealing is an अध्यादेश ( ritual ) performed in Latter Day Saints temples by a person holding the sealing authority.
The purpose of this ordinance is to seal familiar relationships, making possible the existence of family संबंध throughout eternity.
LDS teachings place ग्रेट importance on the specific authority required to perform these sealings.
Church doctrine teaches that this authority, called the Priesthood, corresponds to that given to Saint Peter in.
Sealings are typically performed as विवाह or as sealing of children to parents.
They were performed prior to the death of Joseph स्मिथ, Jr. ( the main founder of the Latter Day Saint movement ), and are currently performed in The Church of Jesus Christ of latter-day Saints.
Although some other denominations, ऐसे as the Community of Christ, view sealing as an artifact of Smith 's practice of plural marriage, some do still perform them.
The 2000s, pronounced `` two thousands '', was a दशक that began on January 1, 2000, and ended on December 31, 2009.
वैश्वीकरण, which had accelerated after the early 1990s fall of communism, जारी to be a फ़ोर्स in the 2000s.
The growth of the Internet was one of the prime योगदानकर्ता to globalization during the decade, making it possible for people to interact with other लोगों, express ideas, introduce others to different cultures and backgrounds, use goods and services, sell and buy online, research and learn परिचय बाते, along with experiencing the world without having to leave home.
the institutions, linkages and technologies that emerged or were redefined earlier would subsequently in this decade benefit many countries, in particular China and India.
However, in other parts of the world such progress failed to address जारी struggles with आधुनिकता, most notably characterized by the rise of al-Qaeda and other इस्लामवादी groups.
The September 11 attacks in 2001 led to the United States, United Kingdom, Spain, Canada and other nations आक्रमणकारी Afghanistan, as well as implementing various anti-terrorist उपायों at home and विदेश in what was known as the War on Terror.
the European Union saw further integration and expansion throughout much of Europe.
The economic growth of the 2000s had considerable environmental consequences, उठाया demand for diminishing energy resources, and was still shown to be vulnerable as demonstrated during the Global Financial Crisis of the late 2000s.
The Gunfight at the O.K. corral was a gunfight कि took place at about 3:00 p.m. on Wednesday, October 26, 1881, in tombstone, Arizona Territory, and is generally regarded as the most famous gunfight in the history of the American Old West.
The gunfight, believed to have lasted only about thirty seconds, was fought between the outlaw Cowboys Billy Claiborne, Ike and Billy Clanton, and Tom and Frank McLaury, and the opposing town Marshal Virgil Earp and his brothers Assistant Town Marshal Morgan and temporary lawman Wyatt, aided by Doc हॉलिडे designated as a temporary marshal by Virgil.
Ike Clanton and बिली Claiborne ran from the fight unharmed, but Ike 's brother Billy Clanton was killed, along with both McLaurys.
Lawmen Virgil and Morgan Earp and Doc Holliday were wounded.
Only Wyatt earp came through the fight unharmed.
The fight has come to represent a time in American history when the frontier थी open range for outlaws opposed by law enforcement that was spread thin over vast territories, leaving some areas unprotected.
The gunfight was नहीं well known to the American public until 1931 when author Stuart Lake published what has since been determined to be a largely fictionalized biography, Wyatt Earp : frontier Marshal, two सालो after Earp 's death.
Lake retold his story in a 1946 book कि director जॉन Ford developed into the movie My Darling Clementine.
After the movie Gunfight at the O.K. Corral was released in 1957, the shootout came to be known by that name.
Since then, the विरोध has been portrayed with varying degrees of accuracy in numerous Western films and books.
Despite its name, the gunfight दरअसल occurred in a narrow lot six doors west of the rear entrance to the O.K. Corral on Fremont Street, और also in the street.
The two opposing parties were initially only about apart.
About तीस shots were fired in thirty seconds.
Ike Clanton filed murder charges against the Earps and Doc Holliday but they were आखिरकार exonerated by a local judge बाद a 30-day preliminary hearing and then again by a local grand jury.
On December 28, 1881, Virgil Earp was maimed in an assassination attempt by the outlaw Cowboys, and on March 18, 1882, they assassinated Morgan Earp.
The suspects furnished solid alibis, and newly appointed डिप्टी U.S. Marshal Wyatt Earp took matters into his own hands during the Earp Vendetta Ride, ironically pursued by county Sheriff जॉनी Behan with warrants for the Earp 's arrest.
HDMI ( High-Definition Multimedia Interface ) is a compact audio/video interface लिये transferring uncompressed video data and compressed/uncompressed digital audio data from a HDMI-compliant device ( `` the सोर्स device '' ) to a compatible computer monitor, video projector, digital television, or digital audio device.
HDMI is a digital replacement for existing analog video standards.
There are a number of HDMI-standard cable connectors available, each of which can be used for any uncompressed TV or PC video स्वरूप, including standard, enhanced, high definition, and 3D video signals ; up to 8 channels of compressed or uncompressed digital audio ; a CEC ( Consumer Electronics Control ) connection ; and an Ethernet आंकड़ा connection.
HDMI implements the EIA/CEA-861 standards, which define वीडियो formats and waveforms, transport of compressed, uncompressed, and LPCM audio, auxiliary data, और implementations of the VESA EDID.
The cec allows hdmi devices to control each other when necessary and allows the उपयोक्ता to operate multiple devices with one remote कंट्रोल हैंडसेट.
Because HDMI is electrically compatible with the CEA-861 signals used by digital visual interface ( DVI ), no signal conversion is necessary, nor is वहीँ a loss of video quality when a DVI-to-HDMI adapter is used.
As an uncompressed CEA-861 connection, HDMI is independent of the various digital टेलीविज़न standards used by individual devices, such as ATSC and DVB, as these are encapsulations of compressed MPEG video स्ट्रीम ( which can be decoded and output as an uncompressed video stream on HDMI ).
Production of consumer HDMI उत्पाद started in late 2003.
In Europe either DVI-HDCP or HDMI is included in the HD ready in-store labeling specification for TV sets for HDTV, formulated by EICTA with SES Astra in 2005.
HDMI began to appear on consumer HDTV camcorders and डिजिटल still cameras in 2006.
as of January 8, 2013, which is ten years after the release of the first HDMI specification, over 3 billion hdmi devices have shipped since the launch of the HDMI standard.
Bree Van de Kamp ( née मेसन ; also ज्ञात in the series as Bree Hodge and Bree Weston ) is a fictional character and one of the four protagonists on the ABC टेलीविज़न series Desperate Housewives.
She is played by actress Marcia Cross, who has received multiple awards and nominations for her portrayal, including an Emmy Award nomination, तीन Golden Globe Award nominations, and two Screen Actors Guild Awards.
Cross 's portrayal of Bree has been widely praised by critics and fans.
Cross originally auditioned for the role of Mary Alice यंग, but series creator Marc Cherry विचार she थी better suited for the भूमिका of Bree.
Dana Delany, who eventually was cast as Katherine Mayfair, was originally chosen for the भूमिका but turned it down, saying it थी too similar to her role in Pasadena.
ब्री 's main struggle throughout the series has been her attempts to maintain a perfect life despite various obstacles such as widowhood, divorce, and alcoholism hindering her.
वो has been married तीन times ; to Rex Van de Kamp ( Steven Culp ), Orson Hodge ( Kyle MacLachlan ) and Trip Weston ( स्कॉट Bakula ).

Algoma is a city in Kewaunee County in the U.S. state of Wisconsin.
The population was 3,167 at the 2010 census.
Algoma is part of the Green Bay Metropolitan सांख्यिकीय Area.
The Hangover Part II is a 2011 अमरीकी कॉमेडी film produced by Legendary Pictures and distributed by Warner भाईs. Pictures.
it is the sequel to 2009 's The Hangover and the second film in The Hangover franchise.
टॉड Phillips निर्देशित the film in जोड to co-authoring the script with Craig Mazin, and Scot Armstrong.
The film stars Bradley Cooper, ed helms, Zach Galifianakis, Ken Jeong, जेफरी Tambor, Justin Bartha and Paul Giamatti.
the Hangover Part II tells the story of Phil, Stu, Alan, and Doug as they travel to Thailand for Stu 's wedding.
After the bachelor party in Las Vegas, Stu takes no chances and opts for a safe, subdued pre-wedding brunch.
However, things do not go as planned, resulting in another bad hangover with no memories of the पिछला रात्रि.
Development of The Hangover Part II began in April 2009, two months before The Hangover was released.
The principal actors were डाल in March 2010 to reprise their भूमिकाएँ from the first film.
Production began in October 2010, in Ontario, California, before moving on location in Thailand.
The film was released on May 26, 2011 and, despite receiving ज़्यादातर negative reviews from critics, it became the highest-grossing R-rated comedy during its theatrical run.
A third film is set for on May 24, 2013.

The English Renaissance थी a cultural and artistic movement in England dating from the late 15th और जल्दी 16th centuries to the जल्दी 17th century.
It is associated with the pan-European Renaissance that is usually regarded as beginning in Italy in the late 14th सदी.
Like most of उत्तरी Europe, England saw छोटी of these developments until more than a century later.
The beginning of the अंग्रेज़ी Renaissance is often taken, as a convenience, to be 1485, when the Battle of Bosworth Field ended the Wars of the Roses and inaugurated the Tudor Dynasty.
Renaissance style and ideas, however, were slow in penetrating England, and the Elizabethan era in the दूसरी half of the 16th century is usually regarded as the height of the English Renaissance.
Elizabeth Ann Bloomer Warren `` Betty '' Ford ( April 8, 1918 – July 8, 2011 ), was First Lady of the United States from 1974 to 1977 during the presidency of her husband Gerald Ford.
As First Lady, she was active in social नीति and created precedents as a नीतियां active presidential wife.
Throughout her husband 's term in office, she maintained high approval ratings despite opposition from some रूढ़िवादी Republicans जो objected to her more moderate and liberal स्थितियाँ on social issues.
Ford was noted for raising breast कर्कट awareness following her 1974 mastectomy and was a passionate supporter of, और activist for, the Equal Rights Amendment ( ERA ).
Pro-choice on गर्भपात and a leader in the Women 's Movement, she gained fame as one of the most candid first ladies in history, commenting on every hot-button issue of the time, including feminism, equal pay, the ERA, sex, drugs, abortion, and gun control.
She also raised awareness of व्यसन when she announced her long-running battle with alcoholism in the 1970s.
Following her White House years, she continued to lobby for the ERA and remained active in the feminist movement.
वो थी the founder, and served as the first chair of the board of directors, of the Betty Ford Center for substance abuse and addiction and is a recipient of the Congressional Gold Medal ( co-presentation with her husband, Gerald R. Ford, October 21, 1998 ) and the Presidential Medal of Freedom ( alone, presented 1991, by George H. W. Bush ).
Platelet endothelial cell adhesion molecule ( PECAM-1 ) also known as cluster of differentiation 31 ( CD31 ) is a protein that in human is encoded by the PECAM1 gene found on chromosome 17.
PECAM-1 plays a key role in removing aged neutrophils from the body.
