A wonton ( also spelled wantan, wanton, or wuntun in transcription from Cantonese ; Mandarin : húndùn ) is a type of dumpling commonly found in a number of Chinese cuisines.
Many people were involved in the invention of radio as we अभी know it.
Several possible methods of wireless communication were considered, including inductive and capacitive प्रेरण and transmission through the ground, however the method used for radio today exclusively involves the transmission and reception of electromagnetic waves.
After early speculation on the subject, experimental work on the connection between electricity and magnetism began around 1820 with the work of Hans Christian Ørsted and continued with the work of André-Marie Ampère, Joseph Henry, and Michael Faraday.
These investigations culminated in the पूरा theory of electromagnetism developed by James Clerk Maxwell.
This theory described the theoretical basis of the propagation of electromagnetic लहरें.
After Maxwell 's theory थी published many people experimented with बेतार communication, some intentionally using Maxwell 's theory some not.
It is considered likely that the first intentional transmission of a signal by means of electromagnetic waves was performed by David Edward Hughes around 1880, although this was considered to be induction at the time.
The पहला systematic and unequivocal transmission of em waves was performed by Heinrich Rudolf Hertz and described in papers published in 1887 and 1890.
हर्ट्ज़ famously considered these results as होने of छोटी practical value.
After Hertz 's work many लोगों were involved in the development of components and theory involved with the transmission और reception of इलेक्ट्रोमैग्नेटिक waves.
Others, notably guglielmo Marconi, were concerned with practical improvements and the commercial application of radio to wireless telegraphy.
Later on Reginald A. Fessenden became the first to send an ऑडियो signal by अर्थात् of electromagnetic waves.
Scurvy is a disease resulting from a deficiency of vitamin C, which is जरूरी for the synthesis of collagen in humans.
The chemical name for vitamin C, ascorbic acid, is निकला from the Latin name of scurvy, scorbutus, which भी provides the adjective scorbutic ( `` of, characterized by or having to do with scurvy '' ).
Scurvy often presents itself initially as symptoms of malaise and lethargy, followed by formation of spots on the skin, spongy gums, and bleeding from the mucous membranes.
Spots are most abundant on the thighs and legs, and a person with the ailment looks pale, feels depressed, and is partially immobilized.
As स्कर्वी advances, वहीँ can be खोलें, suppurating wounds, loss of teeth, jaundice, fever, neuropathy and death.
Scurvy थी at one time common among sailors, pirates और others aboard ships at sea longer than perishable fruits और vegetables could be stored ( subsisting instead only on cured and salted meats and dried grains ) and by soldiers similarly deprived of these foods for extended periods.
It was described by Hippocrates ( c. 460 BC–c. 380 BC ), and herbal cures for scurvy have been known in many native cultures since prehistory.
Scurvy was one of the limiting factors of marine travel, often killing large numbers of the passengers और crew on long-distance voyages.
This became a significant issue in Europe from the beginning of the modern era in the Age of Discovery in the 15th century, continuing to play a significant भूमिका through World War I in the 20th century.
While today scurvy is known to be caused by a nutritional deficiency, until the अलगाव of vitamin C and direct evidence of its कड़ी to scurvy in 1932, numerous theories and treatments were proposed, often on छोटी or no experimental data.
इस inconsistency is attributed to the कमी of विटामिन C as a distinct concept, an inability to reliably link different foods ( notably present in भैस citrus, watercress, and organ meat ) to स्कर्वी.
An additional अवधारणा required to understand scurvy थी the degradation of vitamin C by exposure to air and copper and other transition metal salts such as those of iron, thus changing the कड़ी of foods to स्कर्वी over time.
Treatment by fresh food, particularly citrus fruit, was periodically implemented, as it had been since antiquity.
However until the 1930s, treatment was inconsistent, साथ many अप्रभावी treatments प्रयुक्त into the 20th century.
It was a Scottish surgeon in the Royal Navy, James Lind who first proved it could be treated with citrus fruit in experiments he described in उसके 1753 book, A Treatise of the Scurvy, though his advice was not implemented by the Royal Navy for several decades.
In infants, scurvy is sometimes referred to as Barlow 's disease, named after Sir Thomas Barlow, a British physician who described it.
However, Barlow 's disease may भी refer to mitral valve prolapse.
Other eponyms for scurvy include Moeller 's disease and Cheadle 's disease.
Scurvy does not occur in सबसे animals because they can synthesize their अपना vitamin C.
However, इंसानो and other higher primates ( the simians - monkeys and apes - and tarsiers ), guinea सूअर, most or all bats, and some species of birds and मछली lack an enzyme ( L-gulonolactone oxidase ) necessary for such synthesis and must obtain vitamin C through their diet.
Vitamin C is widespread in संयंत्र tissues, with particularly ऊँची concentrations occurring in citrus fruits ( oranges, lemons, limes, grapefruits ), tomatoes, आलू, cabbages, and green peppers.
Iron is a chemical element with the symbol Fe ( from ) and atomic number 26.
It is a metal in the first transition series.
It is the most आम element ( by mass ) forming the planet Earth as a whole, forming much of Earth 's outer and inner core.
It is the fourth सबसे common element in the Earth 's crust.
Iron 's very common presence in rocky planets like Earth is due to its abundant production as a result of fusion in high-mass stars, where the production of nickel-56 ( जिससे decays to the most common isotope of iron ) is the last nuclear fusion reaction that is exothermic.
This causes radioactive nickel to become the पिछला element to be produced before collapse of a supernova leads to the explosive events that scatter this precursor radionuclide of iron abundantly into space.
Like other समूह 8 elements, iron exists in a wide range of oxidation राज्य, −2 to +6, although +2 and +3 are the most common.
elemental आयरन occurs in meteoroids and other low oxygen environments, but is reactive to oxygen and water.
Fresh iron surfaces appear lustrous silvery-gray, but oxidize in normal air to give hydrated आयरन oxides, commonly known as rust.
Unlike many अन्य metals which form passivating oxide layers, iron oxides occupy more volume than iron metal, and thus iron oxides flake off and expose fresh surfaces for corrosion.
Iron metal has been used since ancient times, though copper alloys, which have lower melting temperatures, were used first in history.
Pure आयरन is soft ( softer than aluminium ), but is unobtainable by smelting.
The सामग्री is significantly hardened and strengthened by impurities from the smelting process, such as carbon.
A certain proportion of carbon ( between 0.002 % और 2.1 % ) produces steel, which may be up to 1000 times harder than pure iron.
Crude iron metal is produced in blast furnaces, where ore is reduced by coke to pig iron, which has a ऊँची कार्बन content.
Further refinement साथ ऑक्सीजन reduces the carbon content to the correct proportion to make steel.
Steels and कम carbon iron alloys with other metals ( alloy steels ) are by far the सबसे common metals in industrial use, due to their great range of desirable properties and the abundance of iron.
Iron chemical compounds, which include ferrous and ferric compounds, have many uses.
Iron oxide मिश्रित with aluminium चूर्ण can be ignited to create a thermite प्रतिक्रिया, used in welding and purifying ores.
It forms binary compounds with the हैलोजन्स and the chalcogens.
Among its कार्बधातुक compounds is ferrocene, the first sandwich compound discovered.
Iron plays an important role in biology, forming complexes with molecular oxygen in hemoglobin and myoglobin ; these two compounds are common oxygen transport proteins in vertebrates.
Iron is also the metal used at the active site of many important redox enzymes dealing with cellular respiration and oxidation and reduction in plants and animals.
The Blue Cross Blue Shield Association ( BCBSA ) is a federation of 38 separate health insurance organizations and companies in the United States.
Combined, they directly or indirectly provide स्वास्थ्य बीमे to over 99 million Americans.
The history of ब्लू Cross dates back to 1929, while the history of Blue Shield dates to 1939.
The Blue Cross Association dates back to 1960, while its Blue शील्ड counterpart was created in 1948.
The two organizations merged in 1982, forming the current association.
A potato chip ( known as a chip in American, Australian, New Zealand, Canadian, Singaporean, Hong Kong, South African and Jamaican English ; as a crisp in British English and hiberno-english, and as either a chip or wafer in Indian English ) is a thin slice of potato that is deep fried or baked until crunchy.
Potato chips are commonly परोसा as an appetizer, side dish, or snack.
The basic chips are cooked and salted ; additional varieties are manufactured using various flavorings and ingredients including seasonings, herbs, spices, cheeses, and artificial additives.
`` crisps '', however, may also refer to many different types of savory snack products sold in the United Kingdom and Ireland, some made from potato, but may also be made from maize, tapioca or other cereals.
An example of these kinds of savory स्नैक्स is Monster Munch.
Potato chips are a predominant part of the snack food market in English-speaking countries and numerous अन्य Western nations.
The वैश्विक potato chip market उत्पन्न total revenues of US $ 16.4 billion in 2005.
This accounted for 35.5 % of the total savory snacks market in that year ( US $ 46.1 billion ).
Henry Clay, Sr. ( April 12, 1777 – June 29, 1852 ) was a lawyer, politician and skilled orator who represented Kentucky in both the Senate and in the House of Representatives.
He served three different terms as Speaker of the United States House of Representatives and was also Secretary of State from 1825 to 1829.
He lost his campaigns for president in 1824, 1832 and 1844.
Clay was a dominant फिगर in both the First and दूसरी Party systems.
as a leading war hawk in 1812, he favored war with Britain और played a significant भूमिका in leading the nation to war in the War of 1812.
In 1824 he ran for president and lost, but threw his electoral votes to John Quincy Adams, who made him secretary of state as the Jacksonians denounced what वे considered a `` corrupt bargain. ''
He भागा and lost again in 1832 and 1844 as the candidate of the Whig Party, which he founded and usually dominated.
Clay was the foremost proponent of the American System, लड़ for an increase in tariffs to foster industry in the United States, the उपयोग of संघीय funding to build and maintain infrastructure, and a strong national bank.
He opposed the annexation of Texas, fearing it would inject the slavery issue into politics.
Clay also opposed the Mexican-American War and the `` Manifest Destiny `` policy of Democrats, which cost him मत in the close 1844 election.
Dubbed the `` Great Pacificator, '' Clay brokered important compromises during the Nullification Crisis and on the slavery issue.
As part of the `` Great Triumvirate `` or `` Immortal Trio, '' साथ with his colleagues Daniel Webster and John C. Calhoun, he was instrumental in formulating the Missouri Compromise of 1820 and the Compromise of 1850.
He was viewed as the primary representative of Western interests in this group, and was given the names `` Henry of the West '' and `` the Western Star. ''
A plantation owner, Clay held slaves during उसके lifetime लकिन freed them in his Will.
Abraham Lincoln, the Whig leader in Illinois, was a great admirer of Clay, saying he was `` my ideal of a ग्रेट man. ''
Lincoln wholeheartedly supported Clay 's economic कार्यक्रम.
In 1957, a Senate Committee selected मिट्टी as one of the पाँच greatest U.S. Senators, along साथ Daniel Webster, John C. Calhoun, Robert La Follette, and Robert Taft.

The company is ranked # 232 on Fortune magazine 's 2010 listing of America 's 500 largest public corporations.
The Wizard of Oz, known during his reign as the Great and Powerful Oz, is the epithet of Oscar Zoroaster Phadrig Isaac Norman Henkel Emmannuel Ambroise diggs, a fictional अक्षर in the Land of Oz, created by American author L. Frank Baum.
The character was further popularized by the classic 1939 movie, wherein his full name is नहीं mentioned.

Marvin Gaye ( April 2, 1939April 1, 1984 ), born मारविन Pentz Gay, Jr., was an अमरीकी singer-songwriter and musician.
Gaye helped to shape the sound of Motown Records in the 1960s with a string of hits including `` How Sweet It Is ( to Be Loved By You ) `` और `` I Heard It Through the Grapevine `` and duet रिकार्डिंग with Mary Wells और Tammi Terrell, later earning the titles `` Prince of Motown '' and `` Prince of Soul ''.
During the 1970s, Gaye recorded the concept albums What 's Going On and Let 's Get It On and became among the first artists in Motown to ब्रेक away from the reins of its production company.
Gaye 's later recordings influenced अनेक R & B subgenres such as शांत storm and neo-soul.
Following a period in यूरोपीय under a tax निर्वासन in the early 1980s, Gaye released the 1982 Grammy Award-winning hit `` Sexual Healing `` and the मध्यरात्रि Love album.
Since his death in 1984, Gaye has been posthumously honored by अनेक institutions, including the Grammy आजीवन Achievement पुरस्कार and the Rock and Roll Hall of कीर्ति.

The Chernobyl disaster (, Chornobylska Katastrofa – Chornobyl Catastrophe ) was a catastrophic nuclear accident that occurred on 26 April 1986 at the chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant in Ukraine ( then officially the Ukrainian SSR ), जिससे थी अंतर्गत the direct jurisdiction of the central authorities of the Soviet Union.
An explosion and fire released large quantities of radioactive particles into the atmosphere, which spread over much of the western USSR and Europe.
The Chernobyl disaster is widely considered to have been the worst nuclear power plant accident in history, और is one of only two classified as a level 7 event on the International Nuclear Event स्केल ( the other being the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 ).
The battle to contain the contamination और avert a greater catastrophe ultimately involved over 500,000 workers and cost an अनुमानित 18 billion rubles.
The official Soviet casualty count of 31 deaths has been disputed, and long-term effects such as cancers and deformities are still being accounted for.

Mrs. Claus is the wife of सांता Claus, the क्रिसमस gift-bringer in North American and European Christmas tradition.
She is known for making cookies with the elves and preparing toys with her husband Santa Claus.
Her first नाम is a mystery, though she has been referred to as मरियम, Jessica, Layla, Annette, Heidi, or Martha.
HijackThis ( also HiJackThis or HJT ) is an open source enumerating औजार for Microsoft Windows originally created by Merijn Bellekom, and later sold to Trend Micro.
The program is notable for targeting browser-hijacking methods, rather than relying on a database of known spyware.
It scans a उपयोक्ता 's computer quickly, and displays browser hijacking locations, प्रर्दशित what entries हैं there.
hijackthis is used primarily for diagnosis of browser hijacking, as uninformed use of its removal facilities can कारण significant तन्त्र damage to a computer.
HijackThis does not remove or detect spyware ; it lists most common locations जहाँ browser hijacking activity can occur.
Browser hijacking can cause malware to be संस्थापित on a computer.
On February 16, 2012, Trend Micro released the hijackthis source code as open source and it is now available on the SourceForge site.
काठी क्रीक Records is an American record label आधारित in ओमाहा, Nebraska.
Started as a college क्लास project on entrepreneurship, the label was founded by Mike Mogis and Justin oberst in 1993 ( as Lumberjack Records ).
Mogis soon turned over his role in the company to Robb Nansel.
The लेबल is named after Saddle Creek Road, a street that cuts through the east पक्ष of midtown Omaha, and the beginnings of a scene whose members included Conor Oberst ( then a solo artist, currently of Bright Eyes, Conor Oberst and the Mystic Valley Band, Desaparecidos and Monsters of Folk ), Tim Kasher ( then of Slowdown Virginia, currently of Cursive and The Good Life ), and others.
Collectively, they were known unofficially as the `` Creekers ''.
Saddle Creek first appeared in print on a show flyer, offering to `` Spend an evening with Saddle क्रीक '' ( later to be the title of the label 's DVD. )
Saddle Creek became an incorporated entity as a result of a class project on entrepreneurship.
Distribution is handled by the Alternative Distribution Alliance, which is under the Warner Music Group छतरियाँ.
Saddle Creek Records continues to be the flagship label of a style of music called `` The Omaha Sound ``, characterized by a slight country twang.
This is increasingly inaccurate, though, with the rise of more electronic sounds such as those favored by The Faint and Broken Spindles.
the eclectic sounds of Saddle Creek 's disparate member bands is somewhat explained by उनके history ; a number of the original members of the label attended grade school together.
A `` sister label '', of sorts, to Saddle Creek is Team Love, started by conor Oberst in 2004.
The label opened arms to their first bands not based in Omaha in 2001 with releases by Now It 's Overhead and Sorry About Dresden.
Other non-Nebraskan artists followed, including Los Angeles 's Rilo Kiley, Eric Bachmann ( formerly leader of Archers of Loaf and कुटिल Fingers from North Carolina ), Georgie James ( Washington D.C. ), Two Gallants ( San Francisco ), and most recently Tokyo Police Club ( Toronto ).
In 2005, Spend an Evening with Saddle Creek, a documentary detailing the first ten years of the record label 's इतिहास, was released.
The dvd features extensive साक्षात्कार साथ the Saddle Creek bands, archival footage, और rare live performances.
On June 8, 2007, the label opened their own music स्थान नामित Slowdown ( after the group Slowdown Virginia ), located in downtown Omaha, Nebraska.
The following is a list of episodes लिये the television show Full House.
In total, there were 192 episodes filmed लिये the show over the course of its eight seasons, from 1987 to 1995.
Full House is a situation comedy which chronicles a widowed father 's struggles of raising his three young daughters and the lives that they have touched.
The patriarch of the family, Danny ( Bob Saget ), invites his brother-in-law Jesse ( जॉन Stamos ) and his best friend Joey ( Dave Coulier ), to help उठाएँ his children ( Candace Cameron, Jodie Sweetin, and Mary Kate/Ashley Olsen ), after his wife थी killed during an automobile accident involving a नशे driver.
After episodes 88 and 89, Jesse marries Becky ( Lori Loughlin ), और they move into the attic.
Then, after episodes 104 और 105, Becky and Jesse have twin boys named Nicky and एलेक्स ( Daniel and Kevin Renteria/Blake and डिलन Tuomy-Wilhoit ).
the series ends with एपीसोड 192, `` मिशेल Rides Again Part 2 '', when Michelle loses her memory and the family tries to restore it.
Notice of Stamp Act of 1765 in Newspaper
American अखबारों reacted to the Stamp Act with anger and predictions of the demise of journalism.
The Stamp Act 1765 ( छोटी title Duties in American Colonies Act 1765 ; 5 George III, c. 12 ) imposed a direct tax by the British Parliament specifically on the colonies of British अमेरिका, and it required that many printed materials in the colonies be produced on stamped paper produced in London, carrying an embossed revenue stamp.
ये printed materials were legal documents, magazines, newspapers and many other types of paper used throughout the colonies.
Like previous taxes, the stamp tax था to be paid in valid अंग्रेजों करेंसी, not in colonial paper money.
The purpose of the tax was to help pay for troops stationed in North America after the British victory in the सात Years ' War.
The British government felt that the colonies were the primary beneficiaries of this military presence, and should pay at least a portion of the expense.
The Stamp Act met great resistance in the colonies.
The colonies sent no representatives to Parliament, and therefore had no influence over what taxes were raised, how they were levied, or कैसा they would be spent.
Many colonists considered it a violation of their rights as अंग्रेजो to be taxed without उनके consent —consent that तभी the colonial legislatures could grant.
Colonial assemblies sent petitions and विरोध.
the Stamp Act Congress held in New York City, reflecting the first significant joint colonial response to कोई अंग्रेजों measure, also petitioned पार्लियामेंट and the King.
Local विरोध groups, led by colonial merchants and landowners, established connections through correspondence that created a ढीला coalition that extended from New England to Georgia.
Protests and demonstrations initiated by the Sons of Liberty often turned violent and destructive as the masses became involved.
Very soon all stamp tax वितरकों were intimidated into resigning their commissions, and the tax was never effectively collected.
Opposition to the Stamp Act थी not सीमित to the colonies.
British merchants and manufacturers, whose निर्यात to the colonies यहूद threatened by colonial economic problems exacerbated by the tax, also pressured पार्लियामेंट.
the Act was repealed on March 18, 1766 as a matter of expedience, but Parliament affirmed its शक्ति to legislate for the colonies “in all cases whatsoever” by also passing the Declaratory Act.
There followed a series of नई कर and regulations, likewise opposed by the colonists.
The episode played a major role in defining the grievances and enabling the organized colonial resistance that led to the American Revolution in 1775.
PT-105 underway.
PT नौकाएँ were a variety of torpedo-armed fast attack craft used by the संयुक्त States Navy in World War II to attack larger surface ships.
`` pt '' is the US hull classification symbol for `` Patrol Torpedo ''.
the PT boat squadrons were nicknamed `` the mosquito बेड़े ''.
The Japanese called them `` Devil Boats ''.
The असली pre– World War I torpedo boats were designed with `` displacement '' hulls.
They displaced up to 300 tons और the top गति was.
The PT boats used in World War II were built using the planing -type हल form developed for racing boats.
They यहूद much smaller ( 30–75 tons ) और faster ( 35–40 knots ).
Both types were designed to strike at larger warships with torpedoes, using relatively high speed to मिलेंगी close, and small size to avoid being spotted और hit by gunfire.
They were much less expensive than large warships.
PT boats were much faster, smaller, and cheaper than conventional ( displacement hull ) vessels.
During World War II, American pt boats सगाई enemy destroyers and numerous अन्य surface craft, ranging from small boats to विशाल सप्लाई ships.
PT boats also operated as gunboats against enemy छोटी craft, such as armored barges used by the Japanese शक्तियां for inter-island transport.
Good Friday is a religious holiday observed primarily by Christians commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his मौत at Calvary.
The holiday is observed during Holy Week as part of the Paschal Triduum on the Friday preceding Easter Sunday, and may coincide with the यहूदी observance of Passover.
It is also known as Holy Friday, Great Friday, Black Friday, or ईस्टर Friday, though the latter properly refers to the Friday in Easter week.
Based on the विवरण of the Canonical gospels, the Crucifixion of Jesus was most likely to have been on a Friday ( the day before the Sabbath ) ( ).
The estimated year of the Crucifixion is AD 33, by two different groups, and originally as AD 34 by Isaac Newton via the differences between the Biblical and Julian calendars and the crescent of the moon.
A तीसरा विधि, using a completely different astronomical approach based on a lunar Crucifixion darkness and eclipse मॉडल ( consistent with Apostle पीटर 's reference to a `` चंद्रमा of blood '' in Acts 2:20 ), points to Friday, 3 April AD 33.
the ग्रेट Basin is the largest area of endorheic watersheds in North America.
It is noted for both its arid conditions and its Basin and range topography that varies from the North American low point at Badwater Basin to the उच्चतम point of the contiguous United States, less than away at the summit of Mount Whitney.
The region spans several physiographic divisions, biomes / ecoregions, and deserts.
रास्टर may refer to:
Raster graphics, graphical techniques using arrays of pixel मान
Raster graphics editor, a computer कार्यक्रम
Raster scan, the pattern of image readout, transmission, storage, and reconstruction in television and computer images
rasterisation, or rasterization, conversion of a vector image to a raster image

Beowulf ( ; Old अंग्रेज़ी : ) is a legendary Geatish hero and later turned king in the epic poem named after him, one of the oldest surviving pieces of literature in the English language.
The आक्रमण on Pearl Harbor ( called Hawaii Operation or Operation AI by the Japanese Imperial General Headquarters ( Operation Z in planning ) and the Battle of Pearl Harbor ) was a surprise military strike conducted by the Imperial Japanese Navy against the United States naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii, on the morning of December 7, 1941 ( December 8 in जापानी ).
From the standpoint of the defenders, the attack commenced at 7:48 a.m. Hawaiian Time.
The attack was intended as a निवारक action in अनुक्रम to keep the u.S. प्रशांत Fleet from interfering with military actions the Empire of Japan was planning in Southeast एशिया against overseas territories of the United किंगडम, the Netherlands, and the United States.
The आधार थी attacked by 353 Japanese fighters, bombers and torpedo planes in two waves, launched from six aircraft carriers.
All eight U.S. Navy battleships were damaged, with four being sunk.
Two of these were later raised, and with the remaining four repaired, six battleships returned to service बाद in the war.
The Japanese also sank or damaged three cruisers, three destroyers, an anti-aircraft training ship, and one minelayer.
188 U.S. aircraft were destroyed ; 2,402 Americans were killed and 1,282 wounded.
Important आधार installations such as the power station, डॉकयार्ड, maintenance, and fuel and torpedo भंडार facilities, as well as the submarine piers and headquarters building ( also home of the intelligence section ) were not attacked.
Japanese losses were light : 29 वायुयान and पाँच midget submarines lost, and 65 servicemen killed or wounded.
One Japanese sailor was captured.
The attack came as a profound shock to the American people and led directly to the American entry into World War II in both the Pacific और European theaters.
The following day ( December 8 ), the United States declared war on Japan.
Domestic support for non-interventionism, which had महरूम strong, disappeared.
Clandestine support of Britain ( लिये example the Neutrality Patrol ) was replaced by क्रियाशील alliance.
subsequent परिचालन by the U.S. prompted Germany and Italy to declare war on the U.S. on December 11, which was reciprocated by the U.S. the वही day.
There were numerous historical precedents for unannounced military action by Japan.
However, the lack of any औपचारिक warning, particularly while negotiations were still apparently ongoing, led President Franklin D. Roosevelt to proclaim December 7, 1941, `` a date which will live in infamy ``.
U.S. रूट 85 ( US 85 ) is a north–south United States राजमार्ग that runs for in the Mountain - Northern Plains राज्य of the United States.
The southern terminus of the route is at the United States-Mexico border in El Paso, Texas, connecting with Mexican Federal Highway 45.
The उत्तरी टर्मिनस is at the United States-Canada border in Fortuna, उत्तर Dakota, where the route continues north as Saskatchewan Highway 35.
In दोनो the United States and Saskatchewan, Canada the route is known as the CanAm Highway.
Sections of US 85 are माना part of the Theodore Roosevelt Expressway.
The United राज्य presidential election of 1968 was the 46th quadrennial presidential चुनाव, held on Tuesday, November 5, 1968.
The Republican nominee, former Vice-President Richard Nixon, won the election over the Democratic nominee, incumbent Vice-President Hubert Humphrey.
निक्सन ran on a campaign that promised to restore विधि और order to the nation 's cities, torn by दंगे and crime.
Analysts have argued the election of 1968 is a realigning election as it permanently disrupted the New सौदे Coalition that had dominated presidential politics for 36 years.
Coming four years after Democrat Lyndon B. Johnson won in a historic landslide, the election saw the incumbent president forced out of the race और a Republican elected लिये the first time in twelve years.
It was a wrenching national experience, conducted during a year of violence that included the assassination of civil rights leader Martin Luther King, Jr., and subsequent race riots across the nation, the assasination of Democratic presidential candidate Robert F. Kennedy, widespread opposition to the Vietnam War across university campuses, and violent confrontations between police and anti-war protesters at the 1968 Democratic National Convention as the Democratic party विभाजित again and again.
The election featured the strongest third party effort since 1912 by former Alabama Governor George Wallace, a Democrat.
Because Wallace 's campaign opposed federal intervention in the South to end school segregation, he carried the Deep South and ran खूब in ethnic industrial districts in the North.
इस थी the last election in which New York had the most votes in the electoral college ( 43 votes ).
After the 1970 census, California gained the most electoral votes and has remained the most populous state since then.
This is the latest election where a presidential ticket won without carrying the vice presidential candidate 's home state.
Windows Task मैनेजर is a task manager or System monitor application included with the Microsoft Windows nt family of operating systems that provides limited information about computer performance and running applications, processes and CPU उपयोग, commit charge और memory सूचना, network activity and statistics, logged-in users, and system services ( and as often is the case with software tools provided by microsoft for Windows, 3rd party तन्त्र is available which fills the requirements more thoroughly, e.g, `` Process Explorer '', `` Extended Task Manager '', `` Anvir Task Manager '', `` Process Hacker '', and `` System Explorer '' ).
The Task Manager can also be used to set process priorities, processor affinity, forcibly terminate processes, and shut down, restart, hibernate or log off from Windows.
Windows Task Manager was introduced with Windows NT 4.0.
Previous versions of Windows NT शामिल the Task List application, which had far fewer features.
The task list was capable of listing currently running processes and killing them, or creating a new process.
In Windows XP only, a Shutdown menu is also उपस्थित that allows access to Standby, Hibernate, Turn off, Restart, Log Off and Switch User.
Earlier versions of Microsoft Windows ( Microsoft Windows 3.x, Windows 95, Windows 98 ) had a program ज्ञात as tasks to display the programs currently running.
This file थी executed by running the taskman.exe file इससे the C : \Windows directory.
Kanji ( ; ) are the adopted logographic चाइनीज characters ( hanzi ) that are used in the modern Japanese writing system along with hiragana ( ひらがな, ), katakana ( カタカナ, ), Hindu-Arabic numerals, and the occasional use of the Latin alphabet.
The Japanese term kanji ( ) for the Chinese characters literally means `` Han characters '' and is written using the same characters as the Chinese hanzi ( ).
John R Williams ( May 4, 1782 – October 20, 1854 ) was an American soldier, merchant, and politician who is सबसे well known for serving as the first mayor of Detroit, Michigan.
In total, he served as Detroit 's mayor for five other terms.
He also थी a brigadier general in the United States Army दौरान the ब्लैक Hawk War.

A smartphone that can be used as a कम्पास because of the magnetometer inside.
An iPhone that can be used as a geological compass because of the 3-axis teslameter and 3-axis accelerometer inside it
A military compass that was प्रयुक्त during World War I.
A compass is a navigational instrument that shows directions in a frame of reference that is stationary relative to the surface of the धरती.
The frame of reference defines the four कार्डिनल directions ( or points ) – north, south, east, and वेस्ट.
Intermediate directions are also defined.
प्रायः, a diagram called a compass rose, which shows the दिशानिर्देश ( with उनके names usually abbreviated to initials ), is marked on the compass.
जब the compass is in use, the rose is aligned with the real directions in the frame of सन्दर्भ, so, for example, the `` N '' चिह्नित on the रोज़ really points to the north.
अक्सर, in addition to the रोज़ or sometimes instead of it, angle markings in degrees are shown on the compass.
उत्तर corresponds to zero degrees, and the कोण increase clockwise, so ईस्ट is 90 degrees, south is 180, and west is 270.
These संख्याएँ allow the compass to show azimuths or bearings, which are commonly stated in this संकेतन.
The magnetic compass was first invented as a device for divination as early as the Chinese Han Dynasty ( Since about 206 BC ).
The कम्पास was used in सोंग Dynasty China by the military for navigational orienteering by 1040-1044, and was used for maritime नेविगेशन by 1111 to 1117.
The use of a compass is अंकित in Western Europe between 1187 and 1202, and in Persia in 1232.
the dry compass थी invented in Europe around 1300.
This was supplanted in the early 20th century by the liquid-filled magnetic compass.
The Inca Empire or Inka साम्राज्य ( Quechua : Tawantinsuyu ) was the largest empire in pre-Columbian America.
The administrative, political and military center of the साम्राज्य was located in Cusco in modern-day Peru.
The Inca civilization arose from the highlands of Peru sometime in the early 13th century.
From 1438 to 1533, the Incas used a variety of methods, from conquest to peaceful assimilation, to incorporate a large portion of western दक्षिण America, centered on the Andean mountain सीमाएँ, including, besides Peru, large parts of modern Ecuador, western and south central Bolivia, उत्तरपश्चिम Argentina, north and central Chile, and southern Colombia into a state comparable to the historical empires of Eurasia.
The official language of the empire was Quechua, although hundreds of local languages and dialects of Quechua were spoken.
The Inca referred to their empire as Tawantinsuyu which can be translated as The Four Regions or the Four United Provinces.
There were many local forms of worship, most of them concerning लोकल sacred `` Huacas ``, but the Inca leadership encouraged the worship of Inti —the sun god—and imposed its sovereignty above other cults such as that of Pachamama.
The Incas considered their किंग, the Sapa Inca, to be the `` child of the sun. ''
The kidneys are organs that serve several essential regulatory roles in most पशु, including vertebrates और some invertebrates.
They are essential in the urinary system and also serve homeostatic functions such as the regulation of electrolytes, maintenance of acid–base balance, and regulation of blood pressure ( via maintaining नमक and water balance ).
They serve the body as a natural filter of the blood, and हटाएँ wastes जिससे are diverted to the urinary bladder.
In producing urine, the kidneys excrete wastes such as यूरिया और अमोनियम, and they are also responsible for the reabsorption of water, glucose, and amino acids.
The kidneys भी उपज hormones सहित calcitriol, erythropoietin, and the enzyme renin.
Located at the पश्च of the abdominal cavity in the retroperitoneum, the kidneys receive blood from the paired renal धमनियों, and नाली into the paired renal veins.
Each kidney excretes urine into a ureter, itself a paired structure that empties into the urinary bladder.
Renal physiology is the study of kidney function, while nephrology is the चिकित्सा specialty concerned with kidney diseases.
Diseases of the kidney are diverse, but individuals with kidney disease frequently display characteristic clinical features.
Common clinical conditions involving the kidney include the nephritic and nephrotic syndromes, renal cysts, acute kidney injury, chronic kidney disease, urinary tract infection, nephrolithiasis, and urinary tract obstruction.
Various cancers of the kidney exist ; the most common adult renal cancer is renal cell carcinoma.
Cancers, cysts, and some other renal conditions can be managed with removal of the kidney, or nephrectomy.
When renal function, measured by glomerular filtration rate, is persistently poor, dialysis और kidney transplantation may be treatment options.
Although they are not severely नुकसानदेह, kidney stones can be painful and a nuisance.
The removal of kidney stones involves ultrasound treatment to break up the stones into smaller टुकड़े, which are then passed through the urinary tract.
One आम symptom of kidney stones is a sharp pain in the medial/lateral segments of the lower वापस.
Lockton Companies Inc. is the world 's largest privately held insurance brokerage firm, providing insurance, risk management and employee benefits solutions.
In addition to its Kansas City, Missouri headquarters, Lockton operates 60 locations in 17 countries.
Lockton is फिलहाल home to more than 4,450 Associates worldwide.
The company was founded by Jack Lockton in 1966 and रै since become the world’s 9th largest बीमे brokerage firm.
Lockton serves a wide array of industries with services that include risk management, casualty, surety, professional indemnity and more.
For 46 सालो, Lockton posted extraordinary organic growth, with वैश्विक revenues reaching $ 915 million in fiscal 2012.
Lockton Benefits Group : Lockton’s Employee Benefit’s team works closely with insurance carriers and administrators to create comprehensive and integrated benefits strategies for clients.
The Lockton Benefits Group provides services including अनुपालन, executive benefits, health और welfare, health risk solutions, retirement and more.
Lockton Affinity : Lockton Affinity, an affiliate of Lockton Companies, meets the insurance needs of affinity groups, franchises, professional organizations, and associations of all sizes.
Lockton Affinity offers a variety of insurance product विकल्प and programs.
Products include : सामान्य Liability, Professional Liability, Property, Workers Compensation, Directors & Officers Liability, Commercial Auto, Specialty Coverage, Excess, Health Plans and more.
lockton International : Lockton International operates offices in the UK and Ireland, as खूब as offices throughout Asia and Latin America.
In Europe, Lockton अंतरराष्ट्रीय is a संगी in EOS RISQ, Europe’s leading insurance broking and risk management consultancy.
EOS RISQ is an equity-based European partnership of major independent बीमे brokers with over 3,500 employees based in more than 30 countries in Europe.
lockton International provides specialized solutions for personal lines, SME’s and major multi-national clients.
White chocolate is a chocolate derivative.
It commonly consists of cocoa मक्खन, sugar, मिल्क solids and salt, and is characterized by a pale yellow or ivory appearance.
The melting point of cocoa butter, its primary cocoa bean component, is high enough to keep white chocolate solid at room temperature.
Donald Leon `` Don '' blankenship ( born कूच 14, 1950 ) was Chairman and CEO of Massey Energy Co., the sixth largest coal company ( by 2008 production ) in the United States.
he served in those roles from November 30, 2000, until December 31, 2010.
Blankenship is an active वित्तीय backer of the Republican party और participant in local and state politics, especially in his home state of West Virginia.
He has frequently बोला out publicly about politics, the environment, unions, and coal production.
U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission filings show Blankenship was paid $ 17.8 million in 2009, the highest in the कोयले industry.
His 2009 अदा represents a $ 6.8 million raise over 2008 and almost दोगुना his compensation package in 2007.
Blankenship also received a deferred compensation package valued at $ 27.2 million in 2009.
On December 3, 2010, Blankenship announced that he was retiring as CEO at the end of the year, and would be succeeded by Massey अध्यक्ष बैक्सटर F. Phillips Jr.

Negligence ( Lat. negligentia, from neglegere, to neglect, literally `` not to pick up something '' ) is a failure to exercise the care that a reasonably prudent person would कसरत in like circumstances.
The area of tort law ज्ञात as negligence involves harm caused by carelessness, not intentional harm.
According to Jay M. Feinman of the Rutgers University School of Law ;
`` The core विचार of negligence is that people should exercise reasonable care when they act by taking account of the संभावित harm that they might foreseeably cause harm to other people. ''
`` those who go personally or bring property where they जान that they or it may come into collision with the persons or property of others have by law a duty cast upon them to use reasonable care and skill to avoid such a collision. ''
Fletcher v rylands ( [ 1866 ] lr 1 Ex 265 )
Through civil वाद, if an injured person proves that another person acted negligently to cause उनके injury, they can recover damages to compensate लिये their harm.
Proving a case for negligence can potentially entitle the घायल अभियोक्ता to compensation for harm to उनके देह, प्रॉपर्टी, mental well-being, financial status, or intimate relationships.
However, because negligence cases are very fact-specific, this general definition does not fully बताइये the concept of जब the विधि will require one person to compensate another लिये losses caused by accidental injury.
Further, the विधि of negligence at common law is only one aspect of the विधि of liability.
Although resulting damages must be proven in order to recover compensation in a negligence action, the nature and extent of those damages are not the primary focus of negligence cases.
a melanocytic nevus ( भी known as `` Nevocytic nevus '' ) is a type of lesion that contains nevus cells ( a type of melanocyte ).
Some स्त्रोत equate the term mole with `` melanocytic nevus ''.
Other sources आरक्षित the term `` mole '' for अन्य purposes.
The majority of moles appear during the first two decades of a person’s life, while about one in every 100 शिशु is born साथ औज़ार.
Acquired moles are a form of benign neoplasm, while congenital moles, or congenital nevi, are considered a minor malformation or hamartoma and may be at a उच्चतर risk for melanoma.
A mole can be either subdermal ( अंतर्गत the skin ) or a pigmented growth on the skin, formed mostly of a type of cell known as a melanocyte.
the high concentration of the body’s pigmenting agent, मेलेनिन, is responsible लिये their dark color.
Moles are a member of the family of skin lesions known as nevi.
The comprehensive metabolic panel, or chemical screen, ( CMP ; cpt code 80053 ) is a panel of 14 blood tests which serves as an initial broad medical screening tool.
The CMP provides a rough जाँच of kidney function, liver function, and electrolyte and fluid balance, but it is far from perfect.
Abnormal values from a CBC may be a result of false positives and thus the CBC may need to be repeated for a रोगी ( or replaced साथ a more specific test ).
The CMP is an expanded version of the basic metabolic panel ( BMP ), जिससे does not include liver tests.
A CMP ( or BMP ) can be ordered as part of a routine physical examination, or may be प्रयुक्त to monitor a patient with a chronic disease, ऐसे as diabetes mellitus or hypertension.
Previous names लिये the panel of tests have been Chem 12, Chemistry panel, Chemistry screen, SMA 12, SMA 20 और SMAC ( Sequential Multiple Analysis - Computer ).
The tests are performed on machines based on the AutoAnalyzer invented in 1957.
Natural gas extraction by countries in cubic meters per year.
Natural gas is a naturally occurring hydrocarbon गैस mixture consisting primarily of methane, but commonly सहित varying amounts of अन्य hydrocarbons, कार्बन dioxide, nitrogen, and hydrogen sulfide.
Natural gas is an energy source often used for heating, cooking, and electricity generation.
It is also प्रयुक्त as fuel for vehicles and as a chemical feedstock in the manufacture of plastics and other commercially important organic chemicals.
Natural गैस is found in deep underground natural rock formations or associated with other hydrocarbon reservoirs in coal beds and as methane clathrates.
Petroleum is also another resource found in proximity to और with natural gas.
Most natural gas was created over time by two mechanisms : biogenic and thermogenic.
Biogenic gas is created by methanogenic organisms in marshes, bogs, landfills, and shallow sediments.
Deeper in the earth, at greater temperature and pressure, thermogenic gas is created from buried organic material.
Before प्राकृतिक gas can be प्रयुक्त as a fuel, it must undergo processing to remove impurities, including जल, to meet the specifications of marketable natural gas.
The by-products of processing include ethane, propane, butanes, pentanes, and उच्चतर molecular weight hydrocarbons, hydrogen sulfide ( which may be परिवर्तित into pure गंधक ), carbon dioxide, water vapor, and sometimes helium और nitrogen.
Natural gas is often informally referred to simply as gas, especially जब compared to other energy sources such as oil or coal.
This page is about the Imagination Movers band.
For सूचना about the TV show starring the बैंड, देखिए Imagination Movers ( TV series ).
Imagination Movers is a band formed in New Orleans, Louisiana, in 2003.
The lineup includes Rich Collins, Scott Durbin, Dave Poche, and Scott `` Smitty '' स्मिथ.
Members of the group were longtime friends and neighbors.
the group started as a television/music concept which was pitched to local PBS affiliates in New Orleans.
WLAE-TV was the first to लो an ब्याज in the group and later introduced them to Beth Courtney, the President & मुख्य कार्यपालिका Officer at louisiana Public Broadcasting.
जल्द after, lpb began airing one-minute videos produced by the Imagination Movers themselves.
The मूवर्स built a sizable regional following by setting educational songs for kids to melodies और rhythms that वयस्कों appreciate as well.
They बेची more than 100,000 copies of their self-produced CDs and dvds.
Their three indie CDs : `` Good Ideas, '' `` कॉलिंग All Movers, '' and `` Eight Feet '' along with their grass roots DVD `` Stir It Up '' have, combined, won fourteen national awards, from such groups as the National संघ of Parenting Publications ( NAPPA ) और अभिभावक ' Choice.
In early 2005, Disney took notice, and initiated negotiations to add the Movers to the company 's रोस्टर.
These were interrupted in August when the flood protection designed and built by the Army Corps of Engineers to protect नई Orleans failed.
The resulting floodwater claimed the band 's office, as well as the homes of Collins, Durbin and Poche – but the deal was signed in the spring of 2006.
In 2008, Walt Disney Records introduced the Imagination Movers ' music to the nation with the release of the Movers ' first nationally-released CD, `` रस Box Heroes. ''
In September 2008, a 30-minute show featuring the group began airing on the डिज़्नी Channel 's preschool programming block known as Playhouse Disney, and currently airs on Playhouse Disney 's replacement, Disney Junior.
The Movers write and perform all the गीतों on their show.
Moreover, the Imagination Movers have received नाजुक kudos for their live concert performances.
In अक्तूबर 2009, the Imagination Movers started the `` Live from the Idea गोदाम Concert Tour 2009 ''.
Traveling from mid-October to mid-December 2009 their live performances include lots of their favorite songs and dancing, as well as video appearances of गोदाम Mouse.
Beginning in early-February 2011 and wrapping up in late May 2011, the Imagination Movers presented their `` In a Big Warehouse Concert Tour, '' playing more than 100 shows in 50+ cities across North America.
From March to October 2012, the Imagination Movers toured North America on उनके post-Disney `` Rock-O-Matic '' tour.
The show maintained several elements of the original tv concept, such as an on-stage `` idea आपात '' and several sets from their older catalogue ; however, with the प्रस्थान of Wendy Calio back to her native Hawaii, the character `` Nina '', along with her musical numbers, is not present.
The tour promotes the Imagination मूवर्स ' new album/DVD release, `` rock-o-matic '', which features all new music from the band.
The album itself is produced independently of Disney and has a notably more mature, contemporary rock-and-roll sound, though still very appropriate for children.
Several performance dates were moved to later in 2012 to benefit from the increased exposure of the Imagination Movers TV show now playing daily on Disney Junior.
The platypus ( Ornithorhynchus anatinus ) is a semiaquatic mammal endemic to eastern Australia, including Tasmania.
Together with the four species of echidna, it is one of the five extant species of monotremes, the only mammals that lay eggs instead of giving birth.
It is the sole living representative of its family ( Ornithorhynchidae ) and genus ( ornithorhynchus ), though a number of related species have been found in the fossil record.
The unusual appearance of this egg-laying, बतख -billed, beaver -tailed, otter -footed mammal baffled European naturalists जब they first encountered it, with कुछ considering it an elaborate fraud.
It is one of the few venomous mammals, the male platypus having a spur on the hind foot that delivers a venom capable of causing severe pain to humans.
The unique features of the platypus make it an important subject in the study of विकासवादी biology and a recognisable and iconic symbol of Australia ; it has appeared as a mascot at national events and is featured on the reverse of its 20-cent सिक्का.
The platypus is the एनिमल emblem of the state of New South Wales.
Until the early 20th century, it was hunted for its fur, लकिन it is now protected throughout its दायरा.
Although captive breeding programmes have had only limited success and the platypus is vulnerable to the effects of pollution, it is not under कोई तात्कालिक threat.
The Chupacabra or Chupacabras (, from chupar `` to suck '' and cabra `` goat '', वस्तुतः `` बकरी sucker '' ) is a legendary cryptid rumored to inhabit parts of the Americas.
It is associated more recently with sightings of an allegedly unknown animal in Puerto Rico ( where these sightings were first reported ), Mexico, and the United States, विशेषकर in the latter 's Latin American communities.
The name comes from the animal 's reported habit of attacking and पीने the blood of livestock, especially goats.
Physical descriptions of the creature vary.
Eyewitness sightings have been claimed as जल्दी as 1995 in प्यूर्टो Rico, and have since been reported as far north as Maine, and as far south as Chile, and even being spotted outside the Americas in countries like Russia and The Philippines.
It is supposedly a heavy creature, the size of a small bear, with a row of spines reaching from the गर्दन to the base of the tail.
Sighting reports of the Chupacabra have been disregarded as uncorroborated or lacking evidence, while सबसे reports in northern Mexico और the दक्षिणी United States have been verified as canids afflicted by mange.
Biologists और वन्यजीव management officials view the chupacabra as a समकालीन legend.
The North American Free Trade Agreement ( NAFTA ) is an agreement signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, creating a trilateral trade bloc in North America.
the agreement आए into force on January 1, 1994.
It superseded the Canada–United States Free Trade Agreement between the U.S., Canada, and Mexico
NAFTA has two supplements : the North American अनुबंध on Environmental Cooperation ( NAAEC ) and the North American Agreement on Labor Cooperation ( NAALC ).
Thermal comfort is the condition of mind that expresses satisfaction with the thermal पर्यावरण and is assessed by subjective evaluation ( ANSI / ASHRAE Standard 55 ).
Maintaining this standard of thermal comfort for occupants of buildings or other enclosures is one of the important goals of HVAC ( heating, ventilation, and एयर conditioning ) design engineers.
the Predicted Mean Vote ( PMV ) model stands among the most recognized thermal comfort models.
It was developed using principles of heat balance and experimental data collected in a controlled climate chamber under steady राज्य conditions.
Because the PMV मॉडल was derived from data collected in a controlled climate, it is not suitable for applications in naturally ventilated spaces which प्रायः have high levels of air movement.
This shortcoming motivated the development of a family of empirical statistical models of thermal comfort in naturally ventilated स्पेसेस known as adaptive models.
Adaptive models of थर्मल comfort consider occupants as dynamically interacting with their पर्यावरण, and controlling their thermal comfort by means of clothing or window-opening and closing.
This is in contrast to thermal comfort in sealed buildings, in which occupants experience the पर्यावरण passively.
Thermal comfort is affected by heat conduction, संवहन, radiation, and evaporative heat loss.
Thermal सुकून is maintained when the heat उत्पन्न by human metabolism is allowed to dissipate, thus maintaining thermal equilibrium with the surroundings.
It has been long recognized that the sensation of feeling hot or cold is not just dependent on air temperature alone.
Thermal comfort calculations according to ANSI/ASHRAE Standard 55 can be freely performed with the CBE Thermal Comfort Tool for ashrae-55.
Durante degli Alighieri, simply referred to as Dante (, ; ; c. 1265–1321 ), was a major इतालवी poet of the Middle Ages.
His Divine Comedy, originally called ' and later called ' by Boccaccio, is widely considered the greatest literary work composed in the इतालवी language and a masterpiece of संसार literature.
In इटली he is known as ' ( `` the Supreme Poet '' ) or just '.
He, Petrarch and Boccaccio हैं also known as `` the three fountains '' or `` the three crowns ''.
Dante is also पुकारा the `` Father of the Italian language ''.
Headquarters ( कोबे, Japan )
( ) is a tire and रबर company आधारित in Japan.
It is भाग of the Sumitomo Group.
The company traces its origins to 1909, when the Sumitomo Group made an investment in Dunlop Japan, the newly formed जापानी subsidiary of the British company Dunlop Rubber.
Over the years Sumitomo और dunlop developed a close business relationship, and in 1963 the Sumitomo Group acquired control of Dunlop Japan and renamed it Sumitomo Rubber Industries Ltd.
In 1985, when dunlop Rubber was taken over by BTR plc, the company acquired the ऑटोमोबाइल tire assets of dunlop, including the right to use the Dunlop brand on automobile tires.
The acquisition did not शामिल the US and Australian businesses, which were separately स्वामित्व, but in 1986 Sumitomo also acquired the Dunlop Tire Corporation of the us इससे its management.
In 1997, Sumitomo formed a joint venture with Goodyear टायर and Rubber कम्पनी, by which Goodyear and Sumitomo agreed to manufacture tires for each other 's markets, including Dunlop branded tires.
As part of the agreement, Goodyear acquired 75 % interests in dunlop Tyres, the UK company which Sumitomo had formed, and in dunlop Tire Corporation.
Goodyear and Sumitomo also made investments in each other.
Today, the कम्पनी makes a wide दायरा of rubber based products, including ऑटोमोबाइल tires, golf balls and tennis balls.
Microsoft Visual Studio Express is a set of freeware integrated development environments ( IDE ) developed by microsoft that are lightweight versions of the Microsoft Visual Studio product line.
Express Editions were conceived शुरूआत with Visual Studio 2005.
The idea of Express editions is to provide streamlined, easy-to-use and easy-to-learn IDEs लिये users other than professional software developers, such as hobbyists and students.
The Alps are one of the great mountain range systems of Europe stretching approximately across eight Alpine countries from ऑस्ट्रिया and Slovenia in the east, Switzerland, Liechtenstein, Germany, France to the west and Italy and Monaco to the south.
The mountains were formed over hundreds of millions of years as the African and Eurasian tectonic plates collided.
Extreme shortening caused by the event resulted in समुद्री sedimentary rocks rising by thrusting और folding into high mountain peaks such as Mont Blanc और the Matterhorn.
Mont Blanc spans the French–Italian border, and at is the highest mountain in the Alps.
the Alpine region क्षेत्रफल contains many peaks higher than, known as the `` four-thousanders ``.
The altitude and size of the range affects the climate in Europe ; in the mountains precipitation levels vary greatly and climatic conditions consist of distinct zones.
वन्यजीव such as ibex live in the higher peaks to elevations of, and plants such as edelweiss grow in rocky areas in lower elevations as well as in higher elevations.
Evidence of human habitation in the Alps goes back to the Paleolithic era.
A mummified man, determined to be 5,000 years old, was discovered on a हिमानी at the Austrian–Italian border in 1991.
by the 6th century BC, the सेल्टिक La Tène culture was well established.
Hannibal may have crossed the ऐल्प्स with a herd of elephants, and the Romans had settlements in the प्रदेश.
In 1800 Napoleon crossed एक of the mountain passes with an army of 40,000.
The 18th and 19th centuries saw an influx of naturalists, writers, and artists, in particular the Romantics, followed by the golden age of alpinism as mountaineers began to ascend the peaks.
In World War II the Third Reich invaded the Alpine countries, with the exception of Switzerland and Liechtenstein ; Adolf Hitler kept a आधार of operation in the Bavarian Alps throughout the war.
The Alpine region has a strong cultural identity.
The परंपरागत culture of farming, cheesemaking, and woodworking still exists in Alpine villages, although the tourist industry began to grow early in the 20th century and expanded greatly after World War II to become the dominant industry by the end of the century.
The Winter Olympic Games have been hosted in the Swiss, French, इतालवी, Austrian and German Alps.
at present the region is home to 14 million people and रै 120 million annual visitors.
Lois patrice Griffin ( née Pewterschmidt ) is a character from the animated television series Family guy.
She is voiced by writer Alex Borstein और first appeared on television, along with the rest of the family in the 15-minute short on December 20, 1998.
Lois was created and designed by series creator Seth MacFarlane.
macfarlane was asked to pitch a पायलट to the Fox Broadcasting कम्पनी based on Larry and Steve, a short made by MacFarlane जिससे featured a middle-aged character named Larry and an intellectual dog, Steve.
After the pilot was given the green light, the Griffin family appeared on the episode `` Death Has a Shadow ``.
Lois is the mother of the Griffin family.
With her husband Peter, she रै had three children : मेग, Chris, and Stewie.
Lois is प्रायः portrayed as a stereotypical television mother, despite her admitting to being a drug user, a recovering meth addict kleptomaniac.
Lois has also had several affairs, one of which allegedly resulted in the conception of Meg.
She has appeared in other media relating to Family Guy—including a video game, commercials and books—and inspired an entire line of merchandise.
Lois 's distinctive New York accent originated इससे a character in a stage show that Alex Borstein had performed in, which was largely inspired by a relative who grew up on Long Island, New York.
Family transmission of Basque language ( Basque as initial language )
Percentage of students registered in Basque language schools ( 2000–2005 ).
Location of the Basque-language provinces within Spain and फ़्रांस
Basque ( endonym :, ) is the ancestral language of the Basque people, जो inhabit the Basque Country, a region spanning an area in northeastern स्पेन और southwestern France.
It is spoken by 27 % of Basques in all territories ( 714,136 आउट of 2,648,998 ).
Of ये, 663,035 live in the Spanish part of the Basque country और the remaining 51,100 live in the फ्रेंच part.
In academic discussions of the distribution of Basque in Spain and France, it is customary to refer to three ancient provinces in France और four Spanish provinces.
Native speakers are concentrated in a contiguous area including parts of the Spanish autonomous communities of the Basque Country and Navarre and in the western half of the French département of Pyrénées-Atlantiques.
The Basque Autonomous Community is an administrative entity within the binational ethnographic बास्क देश incorporating the traditional Spanish provinces of Biscay, Gipuzkoa, and álava, which retain their existence as politico-administrative divisions.
These provinces and many areas of Navarre are heavily populated by ethnic Basques, but Basque was, at least जबतक the 1990s, not spoken as a native भाषा in most of Álava, western parts of Biscay and central and southern areas of Navarre, either because it had been replaced by Spanish along the centuries, in some areas, or because it had never been बोला there, in other areas.
In southwestern France, the प्राचीन Basque-populated provinces were Labourd, Lower Navarre, and Soule.
They and other regions were consolidated into a single département in 1790 under the name Basses-Pyrénées, a name which persisted until 1970.
A standardized form of the Basque भाषा, called Euskara Batua, was developed by the Basque Language Academy in the लेट 1960s.
Euskara Batua was created so that Basque language could be used—and easily understood by सब Basque speakers—in formal situations ( education, mass मीडिया, literature ), and this is its main use today.
The role of this standard Basque language depends on the linguistic educational model of each region and each school.
In most areas of the Spanish Basque देश, the educational मॉडल D, where all subjects are taught in Basque, except `` Spanish language and literature '' ( which is taught in Spanish ) is now the predominant model.
In France, the Basque language school Seaska and the association for a दुभाषिया ( Basque and French ) schooling Ikasbi meet a wide range of Basque language educational needs up to the Sixth Form, while often struggling to surmount financial and administrative constraints.
अलावा इससे this standardized version, there are पाँच प्रमुख Basque dialects : Bizkaian, Gipuzkoan, and Upper Navarrese in Spain, and Navarrese–Lapurdian and Zuberoan ( in France ).
Although they take their names from the mentioned ऐतिहासिक provinces, the dialect boundaries are नहीं congruent with province सीमाएँ.
The President, Directors and Company, of the Bank of the United States, commonly known as the First Bank of the United States, was a central bank, chartered for a term of बीस years, by the United States Congress on February 25, 1791.
Establishment of the बैंको was included in a three-part expansion of federal fiscal and monetary power ( साथ with a federal mint and excise taxes ) championed by Alexander हैमिल्टन, first सचिव of the Treasury.
Hamilton believed a central bank was necessary to stabilize and improve the nation 's credit, and to improve handling of the financial business of the United राज्य government under the newly enacted संविधान.
Officially proposed to the first session of the First Congress in 1790, Hamilton 's Bank faced widespread resistance from opponents of increased federal power.
Secretary of State Thomas Jefferson और James Madison led the opposition, जिससे claimed that the bank was unconstitutional, और that it benefited merchants and investors at the expense of the majority of the जनसांख्यिकी.
The First Bank building is now a नेशनल Historic Landmark located in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania within स्वतंत्रता National Historical Park.
James Wesley Marsters ( born August 20, 1962 ) is an American actor and संगीतकार.
Marsters first came to the attention of the general public playing the लोकप्रिय character Spike, a platinum-blond yobbish English vampire in the television series Buffy the Vampire Slayer and इसके spin-off श्रेणी, Angel, from 1997 to 2004.
Since then, he रै gone on to play other science fiction roles, such as the alien supervillain Brainiac on the Superman -inspired series Smallville, the omnisexual time traveller Captain John Hart in British science-fiction दिखाएँ Torchwood and terrorist Barnabas greeley in sci fi 's Caprica.

In molecular biology, human chorionic gonadotropin ( hCG ) is a hormone produced by the fertilized egg after conception.
Later during pregnancy it is made by the developing placenta, and later by the placental component syncytiotrophoblast.
Some cancerous tumors produce this हार्मोन ; therefore, elevated levels measured when the patient is not pregnant can lead to a cancer diagnosis.
However, it is not known whether this production is a contributing cause or an प्रभाव of tumorigenesis.
The pituitary analogue of hCG, known as luteinizing hormone ( LH ), is produced in the pituitary ग्रंथि of males and females of all ages.
, the FDA has prohibited the बिक्री of `` homeopathic '' and over the counter hCG diet products और declared them बेईमान and illegal.
Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter, known by her stage name Beyoncé ( ; born September 4, 1981 ), is an American सिंगर, songwriter, dancer, and actress.
Born and raised in ह्यूस्टन, टेक्सास, she performed in singing और नाचना competitions as a child before forming in 1990 a समूह with Kelly Rowland and LaTavia Roberson that was eventually named Destiny 's Child.
Once signed to Columbia Records, the girls subsequently became one of the world 's best-selling girl groups of all time.
The group was plagued by आतंरिक conflict और legal turmoil and Knowles suffered from depression that lasted for a number of years.
During the group 's hiatus, Knowles released her डेब्यू सोलो album Dangerously in Love ( 2003 ), which earned her five Grammy Awards and has sold a total of 4.9 million copies in the US alone.
It spawned Billboard क्रमांक one singles `` Crazy in Love, '' considered by VH1 to be the `` Greatest Song Of the 00 's, '' and `` Baby Boy. ''
Following the disbandment of Destiny 's Child in 2005, Knowles 's second solo album B'Day ( 2006 ) contained the top five singles `` Déjà Vu ``, `` Irreplaceable ``, और `` खूबसूरत Liar ``.
Her performance in Dreamgirls ( 2006 ) अर्जित her two सुनहरी ग्लोब nominations.
Knowles ' work playing Etta जेम्स in that film प्रेरित her subsequent album I am...
Sasha Fierce ( 2008 ) which spawned hits `` If I Were a Boy ``, `` Single Ladies ( Put a Ring on It ) ``, `` Halo ``, and `` Sweet Dreams ``.
The एल्बम also helped Knowles earn six Grammys in 2010, breaking the record for सबसे Grammy Awards won by a female artist in one night.
Her fourth album 4 ( 2011 ) deviated towards traditional R & B and became उसके fourth consecutive number one album on the Billboard 200.
in January 2012, Knowles gave birth to daughter Blue Ivy Carter, her first child with husband Jay-Z.
Knowles has sold over 13 million albums in the US and 118 million records worldwide ( as well as a further 50 million records with Destiny 's Child ), and is one of the best-selling music artists of all time.
The Recording Industry Association of America ( RIAA ) recognized Knowles as the Top Certified Artist of the 2000s.
In 2009, Billboard named her the शीर्ष Radio Songs Artist of the decade and ranked her the शीर्ष Female Artist and the fourth Artist of the Decade.
Beyoncé Knowles is the most nominated woman in Grammy Award history, receiving 17 awards ; अन्य accolades include 12 MTV Video Music Awards, 7 Billboard Awards including a Millennium Award, and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame as part of Destiny 's Child.

The song पहुँचे क्रमांक One on the Billboard Hot Country Singles & Tracks ( now Hot Country Songs ) charts.

it is the fourth-largest city in the state and is the seat of.

The Sons of Liberty was a समूह consisting of American patriots that originated in the pre-independence North American British colonies.
The group was formed to protect the rights of the colonists और to take to the streets against the taxes by the British government.
They are best known for undertaking the Boston Tea Party in 1773, which led to the Intolerable Acts ( an intense crackdown by the British government ), and a counter-mobilization by the Patriots.
Osaka किला
is a city in the Kansai region of Japan 's main island of Honshu, a designated city under the Local Autonomy Law, the capital नगर of Osaka Prefecture and also the largest part of the Keihanshin metropolis, which comprises three major cities of Japan, Kyoto, Osaka and Kobe.
Located at the मुँह of the Yodo River on Osaka Bay, ओसाका is Japan 's third largest city by population after Tokyo ( special wards ) and Yokohama.
Keihanshin is the second largest महानगर area in Japan by population and one of the largest metropolitan क्षेत्रों highly ranked in the world, with nearly 19 million people, and by GDP the दूसरी largest area in Japan और the seventh largest area in the world.
Historically the commercial center of Japan, Osaka कृत्यों as one of the command centers लिये the Japanese economy.
The ratio between daytime and night time population is 141 %, the highest in Japan, highlighting its status as an economic center.
Its nighttime जनसांख्यिकी is 2.6 million, the third in the country, but in daytime the population surges to 3.7 million, second only after Tokyo ( combining the special wards of Tokyo, which is not a single incorporated city, for statistical purposes ; see the Tokyo article for more information on the definition and makeup of Tokyo ).
Osaka used to be referred to as the in feudal Edo period because it was the केन्द्र of trading for rice, creating the first modern futures exchange market in the world.
The छोटी Mermaid is a 1989 अमरीकी animated musical fantasy film produced by Walt डिज़्नी Feature एनिमेशन and वितरित by Walt Disney Pictures.
Based on the Danish fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen, The Little Mermaid tells the story of a beautiful mermaid who dreams of becoming human.
लिखा, directed, and produced by Ron Clements और John Musker, with music by Alan Menken and Howard Ashman, the film features the voices Jodi Benson, Christopher Daniel Barnes, पैट Carroll, Samuel E. Wright, Jason Marin, Kenneth Mars, Buddy Hacket, and Rene Auberjonois.
The 28th film in the Walt Disney Animated Classics series, The Little Mermaid was released to theaters on November 14, 1989 to largely positive reviews, garnering $ 84 million at the box office during its initial release, and $ 211 million in total lifetime gross.
After the success of the 1988 Disney / Amblin film Who Framed Roger Rabbit, The छोटी Mermaid is given credit for breathing life back into the art of Disney एनिमेटेड feature films after a string of critical or commercial failures produced by Disney that dated वापस to the early 1970s.
It also marked the start of the era known as the Disney Renaissance.
A stage adaptation of the film with a book by Doug Wright and additional songs by Alan Menken और new lyricist Glenn स्लेटर opened in Denver in July 2007 and began performances on Broadway January 10, 2008.

Purple पिया is a slang term for a recreational drug popular in the hip hop जातियाँ in the दक्षिणी United States, originating in Houston, Texas.
Its main ingredient is prescription -strength cough syrup containing codeine and promethazine.
Cough syrup is typically mixed with ingredients such as Sprite soft drink or Mountain Dew and pieces of प्रसन्न Rancher candy.
The purplish hue of purple drank comes from dyes in the cough syrup.
There are numerous slang terms for purple drank, including sizzurp, lean, syrup, drank, barre, purple jelly, Texas tea, and Tsikuni.
First/given, middle, and last/family/surname diagram with J. S. Bach as example.
J. S. Bach shared his given name with six immediate family members and many extended family members.
He साझा his परिवार name with most परिवार members.
A दिए name, in Western contexts often referred to as a first name, is a personal नाम that specifies और differentiates between members of a group of individuals, especially in a family, all of whose members usually share the same family name ( surname ).
A given name is purposefully given, usually by a child 's अभिभावक at or near birth, in contrast to an inherited one ऐसे as a family name.
A दिए name is sometimes legally changed through a name change.
Given names are often used in a familiar and दोस्ताना manner in informal situations.
In अधिक formal situations the उपनाम is प्रयुक्त instead, unless it is necessary to distinguish between people with the same surname.
The idiom `` on a first-name basis '' ( or `` on first-name terms '' ) alludes to the familiarity of addressing another by a given name.
The western स्टाइल of having both a family नाम ( surname ) and a given name is far from universal.
In many countries it is common लिये ordinary लोगों to have only one name ( a mononym ).
Hydrochloric acid is a साफ, colourless solution of hydrogen chloride ( H Cl ) in water.
It is a अत्यधिक corrosive, strong mineral acid साथ many industrial uses.
Hydrochloric acid is found naturally in gastric acid.
Historically called muriatic acid, and spirits of salt, hydrochloric acid was produced from vitriol ( sulfuric acid ) and common salt.
It first appeared during the Renaissance, and then it was used by chemists such as Glauber, Priestley and Davy in their scientific research.
With major production starting in the Industrial Revolution, हाइड्रोक्लोरिक acid is used in the chemical industry as a chemical reagent in the large-scale production of vinyl chloride for PVC plastic, and mdi / TDI for polyurethane.
It has numerous smaller-scale applications, including household सफ़ाई, production of gelatin and अन्य खाना additives, descaling, and leather processing.
परिचय 20 लाख tonnes of hydrochloric acid are produced annually.
Wheat ( Triticum spp. ) is a cereal grain, originally from the Levant region of the Near East और Ethiopian Highlands, but now cultivated worldwide.
In 2010, world उत्पादन of गेहूं was 651 million tons, making it the third most-produced cereal बाद maize ( 844 million tons ) and rice ( 672 million tons ).
Wheat was the दूसरी most-produced cereal in 2009 ; world production in that year was 682 लाख tons, after मक्का ( 817 million tons ), and with rice as a close third ( 679 million tons ).
This अनाज is grown on more land area than any other वाणिज्यिक food.
World व्यापार in wheat is greater than for all other crops combined.
Globally, wheat is the leading source of vegetable protein in human food, having a higher protein content than soybeans or the other major cereals, maize ( corn ) or rice.
In terms of total production tonnages प्रयुक्त for food, it is currently second to rice as the main human खाना crop and ahead of maize, after allowing for maize 's more extensive use in animal feeds.
Wheat was a key फ़ैक्टर enabling the emergence of city-based societies at the start of civilization because it was one of the पहला crops that could be easily cultivated on a large scale, and had the additional advantage of yielding a harvest that provides long-term storage of food.
Wheat contributed to the emergence of city-states in the Fertile Crescent, including the Babylonian and Assyrian empires.
Wheat अनाज is a staple food प्रयुक्त to make flour for leavened, flat and steamed breads, बिस्कुट, cookies, cakes, breakfast cereal, pasta, noodles, couscous and for fermentation to मेक beer, other alcoholic beverages, or biofuel.
Wheat is planted to a limited extent as a forage crop for पशुधन, and its straw can be used as a construction material for roofing thatch.
The whole grain can be milled to छोड़ just the endosperm for white flour.
The by-products of this are bran और germ.
The whole अनाज is a concentrated source of vitamins, minerals, and protein, while the परिष्कृत grain is mostly starch.
मुद्रण
to publish is to make content available to the general public.
While specific use of the term may vary among countries, it is usually applied to text, images, or other audio-visual content on any traditional medium, including paper ( newspapers, magazines, catalogs, etc. ).
The word publication means the act of publishing, and also refers to any मुद्रित copies.
